product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Love L'Eau Kenzo
review_content: Opens exactly like the original, which I love, but it lacks the depth, complexity and the longevity. Its lovely while it lasts. Perplexing as to why Kenzo even bothered "creating" this.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Love L'Eau Kenzo
review_content: The moment i smelled the lotus in it, i knew it,, had to be in my wardrobe for the summer mornings i feel romantic!!!! Only wish it would stay more than about half an hour, but still, satisfying!....

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Love L'Eau Kenzo
review_content: like all the fragrances by Kenzo: extremely personal, very tender and in some way exotic

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: Once upon a time by Kenzo,is one of my favorite perfume. A beautiful fresh rose, romantic and deep, that become woody and aromatic.She last long and the projection is pretty good as well. Unfortunately this fragrance was a limited edition, for the 40th anniversary of the brand.

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
This opens with a lot of smoky woods - especially sandalwood - on my skin. Like a wood fired sauna. It’s definitely unisex - leaning masculine - and it’s a lot heavier than I expected. The rose is smoky - not fresh, sweet or dewy. As it dries down it feels gentler and creamier, the smoky notes reside and the rose comes out more.
Smoke doesn’t work very well on me - it tends to dominate - and for that reason I think this will end up finding a new home. It’s not a bad scent but it doesn’t work for me. Not a safe blind buy I think.

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: Blossoming rose in musky cloud - rich, sweet, yet gentle. The rose is dominant but you can smell other flower notes too. When the scent develops, more sweet wood (and especially sandalwood) follows. Beautiful and original fragrance for spring.

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
opens with a blast of very natural rose otto, nutmeg, rosewood, then fades to a sweet floral (gardenia, magnolia) with the milky qualities of sandal. drydown somewhat reminicent of kenzo flower.
I like...

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
I am surprized, that it's from 2010. I thought it's something much more older.
In my opinion, it doesn't smell very good. It's overly woody and spicy.
I am not a fan of this chemical-woody composition, it's a little sharp.
It's not the worst scent, but I don't think it smells like a perfume.

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: This is the one of the nicest scents that Ive ever smelled. This rings true to woody and sweet to my nose. I really love this scent so much. Just a warm woody and sweet beautiful scent!!!!

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: Can barley smell it even after 2 sprays, very light!!

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: i tested this few times, i let two different friends of mine smell it. they both said it smells like coke. i can't say i disagree with them but i really liked it anyway :))

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: This is a rather warm and maybe spicy scent. Good for winter and autumn time. I found it yesterday in a clearance sale (has it been discontinued?) and bought it for 50% off for this winter's season. On me it stays on long and my bf likes it much too.

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
I found the opening fresh, floral, and a little zesty, with magnolia as the dominant note. The fragrance dried down quickly and became very spicy on me, like a very sheer note of cardamom, although I don't see cardamom listed. It must be something in the 'woodsy notes' interacting with my skin chemistry.

I would recommend it to those who like slightly spicy florals.

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
First off I'd just like to mention how beautiful this bottle is. The intense teal colour along with the fascinating, wallpaper designs are really eye-catching. I have a feeling this fragrance will sell well based on the bottle itself.

The fragrance is equally as fascinating to me as the bottle. It opens with a clean and powdery rose and magnolia blend, being rather refreshing and Summery.

Further through its development, Kenzo Once Upon A Time shows a slightly spicier side, making it a touch oriental. Despite the spices being present, please don't think that this fragrance is anything like YSL's Opium or CK's Obsession, they are in two different leagues. This is a pleasant, refreshing and subtle hint of spice only there to compliment the delicate floral accords.

After this initial flowery and spicy burst, the scent merges into a musky and ambery base, a little conventional, but still pleasant nonetheless. With the mass of Summer fragrances being released this time of year, it's nice to discover one, like Once Upon A Time that doesn't rely too heavily on citrus to make a refreshing statement.

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: At first it wasn't bad, but after some hours it becomes just too spicy. It almost make me want to sneeze.

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
I tried this new Kenzo a few days ago and also got a sample so that I could wear it for a few days. On initial spray from tester I was well impressed. It's a lively floral fresh scent, then it becomes warmer and a little spicy powder. Magnolia and peony are the notes that come out more individually but honestly this is a typical Kenzo's mishmash. It smells pleasant and attractive, joyful and easy but not cheap. It's quite soft but with a vanillic plasticky edge that nearly takes it into the cloying world of scent, in spite of being a light fragrance.
It was the vanillic edge that slowly took me to point out where I already smelled that typical vibe: Kenzo!
Amour and Indian Holi above all smell like this and for the ones who remember the long gone Kashaya. They are all beautiful scents that became impossible to wear for me because of that fake vanillic note that initially conforted me than brought me to nausea and headache.
Kenzo Flower is the worst in that sense, one of the most horrid fragrances I ever smelled and unfortunately a widespread one.
Once upon a time takes that vanillic note to a lower degree, not so suffocating and less plasticky.
I could wear this one for daytime, feeling conforted and soothed. It stays close to the skin with poor sillage and lasting power is not great.
The bottle is lovely, colourful and elegant in a modern sense.

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
A very flowery scent in the beginning, I realy can smell the peony and magnolia very good.In the drydown it gets a woodsy note that I like.

a nice and warm flower scent.

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: To be honest ... I don't think this smell like anything new, nor really pleasant. It's not bad, but I would not use it on somebody's skin. It is a mix-max of anything I could have smelled before in a wrongly-balanced concentration, all Kenzo's together (which are great separetely, but not here) + some toilett spray ... unfortunately, it leaves me with the impression of smelly product that "would have liked to be a special fragrance, ... but it's not". So much for the anniversary ... it deserved MUCH better.

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: This EDT has a floral aroma and sweet time, too loaded. I think it works well for women 30 and older. In teens only for an evening out.

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
Once Upon a Time smells more like a spicy oriental than a floral woody musk. It's very powdery, aromatic, dry but also deep and mysterious.

The scent is a hybrid of Flower and Jungle L'Elephant, with a touch of Amour - it's like the synthesis of the most popular Kenzo perfumes.

I personally find it quite likeable, and if you enjoy any of the three above mentioned fragrances, there are good chances that you'll also like this one.

the best, for 20 years now.

I had the chance to found a sealed 50ml in France , as one said lower, I can trade all my fresh perfumes with one of these ! Finally I've got my signature scent for warm days !

This is the freshest vetiver in my collection. It’s light, it’s airy and easy to wear. I get a peppery accord (probably the angelica) and I think I smell the anise :) Yet it’s mostly vetiver air on me. Ah, if the air where I am from smelt like this.

today i found the intense version sealed box.i love the way of smelling.nice liqourice vetiver frag.

Possibly the lightest fragrance I've ever tested. In the same vain as Gucci envy. Actually quite disappointed overall, but not a bad smell. I would caution those who have not smelled this before blind buying. Like I said - not bad - shockingly light (unable to smell). I did purchase mine from eBay, so I suppose it could have been altered.

5/10
Thk God i have 2 bottles of the intense version 1st formulation.

This was such a nice smelling juice; it's a real shame it's been discontinued. However, even this 'intense' version had little in the way of projection. That said, I remember it had a distinctive tendency to 'reappear' every so often for a few hours after it seemed to have vanished.

Anyway, the scent itself had a sweet, breezy, watery liquorice note which was frankly fantastic. Garnered plenty of compliments while it lasted. Could have been unisex but was nonetheless very comfortable as a masculine scent.

a great fragrance, airy but warm and soft vetiver surrouded by angelica and woods... it projects very good in summer... i can swear i smell ISo E super here... but nevermind...The best one from Kenzo!!!

Sorry to all the fans of this gem. It was now the second time that I had the chance to buy an bottle of this stuff and I didn´t. For me it´s just another ordinary fresh / sport toilet water. It smells like Kenzo Tokyo.
A master piece of Kenzo !! I miss it as it is no more sold since years...a compliment getter too !!

In 2003, Kenzo Air achieved the market, a scent that was very successful at the time, containing balanced notes of bergamot, vetiver, amber, fennel and licorice, basically. In 2005, the same perfumer – Maurice Roucel – released a more intense version, which was a limited edition and that still causes furor among the lovers of the original version.

This time, the licorice has not entered in the composition, which has notes of bergamot, anise and fennel, in the output; Angelica and Tahitian vetiver, in the heart; Amber, vetiver and Woods, in the base.

Definitely, is not one of my favorites, but I like it a lot. Why? Because is different from all the rest!
This is the kind of scent made for those who want to forget the worries, feel free of the heavy chains of everyday’s life, remember the freedom of being a child, etc.

Its scent is composed, basically, by nuances of anise and vetiver, with a touch of flowers and amber.
In this version, the aroma of anise is more poignant. Then, the vetiver predominates. Many people feel resemblance with the fragrance of Encre Noire, although I find the latter more dry.

Air Intense stays close to the skin, but lasts for hours and hours. And the bottle is a nice piece of cloud that fits in the palm of your hand.
A beautiful creation that was unfortunately discontinued and is rare to be found.
Remember ENCRE NOIR_Lalique, but Encre much so better.
Perfume maravilhoso,extraordinário. o melhor do vetiver está em Kenzo Air
want it
I finished 3 bottles of this. A good frag! Very unique. :)

This is IT! The buck stops here!
I'd trade all the other scents I have away and keep only this one if I had to!

And to clarify, this is an EDT, and to my nose, it's remarkably similar to KenzoAIR original. I've worn original on one arm and Intense on the other arm and I cannot tell a difference! I had other smell too, and they most would actually say that the original was the more "strong" smelling of the two.

SOOOOOoooooo... Yeah. Don't sweat the small stuff, and don't break the bank trying to find This INTENSE version, no one will ever be able to tell if you are wearing INTENSE or not, thats a promise! But if you do run across it, the bottle is really REALLY cool!


10/10 LOVE THIS ONE!!!

I think tha t was the best from kenzo ino don't understand way des cuntinio
That
I can't understand why Kenzo discontinued their best fragrances - unforgivable Air (regular and intense versions) and Time For Peace - and continue reissue such a crap like L'Eau par(((

An underrated gem.

It happened by accident that I layered two fragrances. I was testing Encre Noir to write my final review and instead of spraying it on an unscented smelling strip, I sprayed it on a piece of paper on which I previously tested Etro's Anice.
What a suprise to smell the anisic aspect of vetiver amphasized by the real anise note. Especially in the drydown when the two perfumes blended perfectly together.

Well, I found Kenzo Air Intense / Kenzo Air to have a very similar vibe to the above scenario and despites probably not being as praised as Encre Noir, it still has a great charme. Peppery, anisic, funny. Chemical? Yes, most definitely, but very well blended. Does great in warm weather.

If you're wondering about the differencies between the "intense" version and the original, well, I haven't found a substantial one. The "intense" is exactly like the original version but a little bit stronger, that's it.

Rating: 7.5/10
Beautiful scent! Love it! But as I know Kenzo has already ended producing it((( The same situation as with Kenzo Time For Peace, they were good fragrances!

It´s the same fragrance of the traditional Air, only in a intense version. I can´t fell it stronger than Air. Maybe it lasts a little more time in the skin, but still don´t fell this stronger.
A really good fragrance, but I preffer the traditional one.

Kenzo Air Intense is peaceful and delightful fragrance. It can take you to a far away environment, a place you have never been before. Amazing. Anise notes are really rich, which together to Vetiver note makes it special. It smells good even on a girl, I may say!

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Soie Kenzo
review_content: I don't use to like cherry blossom, but trust me, the replacement for this is Cerisier by Yves Rocher.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Soie Kenzo
review_content:
I agree with the previous reviewers, Eau de soie is a delicate and soft fragrance, feminine and light, very suitable for spring/summer or even now in February, when you get tired of winter bombs :)

I get clearly rose and violet from first spray which reminds me of Bvlgari Rose Essentielle, only lighter and greener and I get also a peppery note that reminds me of another beautiful underrated creation: Eau de Dupont.

Sillage and longevity are rather moderate...

The bottle is quite original but don't like the paper glued at the backside; I find the packaging very interesting though, opening with the flip on the side.
The more I wear Kenzo(s), the more I fall in love with the brand.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Soie Kenzo
review_content:
My great-grandmother had several silk flower trees, or "Mimosa" trees as southerners mistakenly call them, that I would climb and pick flowers from as a child. The opening of this perfume really does smell a bit like the pink fluffy sweetness from the trees, but sadly doesn't last long at all. The drydown scent is still realy nice and pretty. It sticks to clothes and hair fairly well, but on skin it doesn't last long.

I really love this perfume and I always reach for it if I'm in a hurry or am not sure what social situation I'm headed into because it's so inoffensive. I have it as a backup signature scent because it suits me so well - sweet and non-invasive!

EDIT: This smells so much like the "Wind Song" line from CVS. They layer really well, and they seem to make the Kenzo last a bit longer on me.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Soie Kenzo
review_content:
Rosellini-in-love
Rosellini-in-love
This is lovely.. Light floral and delicately sweet. Something to wear when you don't want to smell of perfume, just want to smell nice. For me it's comparable to l'occitane cherry blossom.

Clean, fresh, not overly sweet. Good for the very young, but not juvenile.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Soie Kenzo
review_content:
Very very gentle, timide opening as if the silkflower is asking "Can I come out and play" In the sun that is because this is a summerperfume.
Dries down to a and gets very powdery but at this stage cant say I smell any of the notes.
Wow this fume is high maintenance one. Dissapear so you need to have a special perfumebutler that spritzes you every 5 minutes.
A pitty - the smell is wonderful.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Soie Kenzo
review_content:
Just tried this as a sample and i love it. Why was it only a limited edition???!!! :(
It is so fresh and i love it.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Soie Kenzo
review_content: Trying this for the first time today. It is a pleasant enough scent, but it doesn't smell like silk tree flowers.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Soie Kenzo
review_content: It was a blind buy since it was on a great sale I could not resist, thanks for very positive reviews it really helped to make up my mind. Wonderful scent, yes very delicate roses and flowers, definitely for those who like flower scents and just a touch of powdery but not heavy. Do wish it lastes a bit longer, but still love it.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Soie Kenzo
review_content: This is lovely.. Light floral and delicately sweet. Something to wear when you don't want to smell of perfume, just want to smell nice. For me it's comparable to l'occitane cherry blossom.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Soie Kenzo
review_content: The best way to describe the opening of this scent is thinking of a clean blanket just stained with a super sweet red wine the alcoholic note in fragrance is very prominent. It's creamy, sweet-fruity, soft, flowery and ageless but nothing special I still need to try Camelia from this collection but so far the only one I find really attractive and energizing it's Eau de Yuzu all the rest are to my taste not worth the price.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Soie Kenzo
review_content: A soft floral, good for summer or spring.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Soie Kenzo
review_content:
I just received my parcel :) it was a blind buy but damn..... it was worth it .

So nice, delicate and flowery. Smells of spring blossoms and it brings back memories of me being a little girl and having fun on the meadow near my grandparents summer house...hmmmmmmm what more can I say ? i really like it and it makes a nice get away from all my other sweet and spicy fragrances.

Will be happily using it in spring and summer time.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Soie Kenzo
review_content: I have a sample and it brings Bvlgari Omnia Amethyste to my mind because there is a connection of violet colour and green plant juices between them two. Eau de Fleur... is fresher, it may be good for spring and summer. I've tried better scents by Kenzo, so I sniff the scent with no "wow"s but it's a a nice scent, lacking something that would make it brilliant. But I don't think it wasn't meant to be brilliant, it just has to show a nice done silk tree blossom.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Soie Kenzo
review_content:
WOW!! i can't beleive i had this perfume for a while just there on my bedroom desk between all my other perfumes & never tried it!! SOOOOOO! in LUV... right now i think it will be in my FAV!! ones i love the sensual scent of flowers in it i'm guess (since i'm new to reviewing perfumes) it smells like PARADISE TO ME :) a little fruity scent but just the perfect amount the Blossom scent is sooooo!! OMG! i cannot put my finger on the flowers itself but! it's just PERFECT MIX if you love sensual delicate lightly fruity & absolutely ROSE scent.. this is for you.. i'm wearing it right now & i want to smell this for ever... the staying power on me is really really good.. THANX GOD :)
i'd say its for all women who like to demark & smells fresh & sweet flower

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Soie Kenzo
review_content:
This is quite a pleasant flowers combination, Rose is prominent. I like the purity of rose in this perfume, which is exactly the same as Stella's floral part (just the floral part I mean).

Stella has an obvious undertone of amber, which doesn't comply with my imagination on a natural, relaxing flower scent.

Kenzo has successfully avoided all the heavy undertones and just focus on the beauty of rose itself.

I'm a rose lover. I wish I could meet this fragrance more earlier!!! Very nice, I want a bottle.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Soie Kenzo
review_content:
i love the powdery untertone from kenzo perfumes. this one is really nice creamy-powdery-sweet, lingers very close to the skin, the flower and fruit accents are very nice mellowed, wrapped in silk feeling, but you have to layer it twice or even three times, if you want to have a better staying power.
all in all it's a nicely done subtle comfy day scent, very feminine.
a shame the staying power is so weak.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Soie Kenzo
review_content: a very nice comforting floral smell. It has this recognizable smell which a lot of floral (fruity) scents don't have. It smells like a woman you would like to hug :) (i would like to smell like that!) though it fades away sóó quickly! too bad.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Soie Kenzo
review_content: I loved this perfume in store, but when I came home with it I didnt like it that much anymore. It smelled fresh and light in the store. But when I came home it had some powdery scent that I didnt like. Also to soft smelling for my taste.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Soie Kenzo
review_content: The Silk Tree, Albizia julibrissin, is also called "Acacia de Constantinopla". The smell of this Eau has something basic in common with the smell of mimosa, a true Acacia, but modified(damaged, in my opinion) by the fruity notes, which make it less dry and coarser. The smell of mimosa less bright, less yellow, more pink... and refreshened.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Soie Kenzo
review_content:
My friend has it and it very very fresh (too fresh for me) and floral.
It`s nice smell in general but I don`t like how it smells on the skin...
I think it`s a summer fragrance.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Soie Kenzo
review_content:
I have this one and Magnolia... very floral and light... summer frangce
Love it

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Soie Kenzo
review_content:
remember how pink velvet roses smell like?!they smell very soft,romantic and feminine without being tomboy,nor offensive for anybody.
this perfume exactly smells like pink roses and it's very nice.
the woman who chooses a fragrance like this is a perfect woman.it's not the perfume of tomboy,nor warlike.the weapon of the woman who wears it,is her feminity.
it's so light,perfect for a romantic date and that's the sole mission of the perfume I assume.
as the matter of fact it reminds me "Bright Crystal",but it's less fruity.it's a very goof floral fragrance for those who like light perfumes.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Soie Kenzo
review_content: It starts really flowery and fruity, but after some time it went pretty heavy and I didn't like it so much anymore. But overall a nice, fruity and floral perfume. And a beautiful bottle!

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Soie Kenzo
review_content: It's my favourite of the Eaux de Fleur Collection. It's so light, airy, fresh and flowery - just heavenly! I think you can compare this line to KenzoKi - it's just a bit more intense. But still very light and easy to wear.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Soie Kenzo
review_content: For those who like very light floral scents, this is for you! Think Stella in Two Peony. Smells very clean and light. If you like lily in the valley or peony scents this will appeal to you. Great for week ends, everyday or for tweens and young teens.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Soie Kenzo
review_content: Hello...I want to tell you that I'm wearing this perfume since I bought last week.It is soft, flowery,nice ...fresh...a litle alcoholic...

What a lovely smell. Reminds me of my childhood where lots of perfumes were flowery and uncomplicated. It also reminds me of Donna born in roma. It smells like a bouquet of flowers, smoothly creamy and tiny bit sweet-fresh. I rly rly like it- I might actually love it

I love this. I have a big collection and I have had this on my wish list for a while. I finally tracked it down and got the biggest bottle I could. There are some days when I just want to smell nice and not be challenged by a fragrance. There is a really nice balance of lightly floral, sweet, fresh, fruity with a delicate creamy base and a touch of powder. Nothing sticks out too much and it makes me feel calm and happy.

Tuberose? I must have gotten the one bottle that missed out on its dose of Tuberose - I happen to like it as a note in perfumery, and recognise it in its many forms, but Jeu d'Amour leaves me more than slightly disappointed. Don't get me wrong - she's pretty enough, but lacks substance. She starts with an alcohol-laced Citrus burst courtesy of the Mandarin Orange and ends with a thin trail of Freesia for the remainder of her stay - inoffensive, but unremarkable.

As mentioned by a few reviewers before me - I tried to enjoy this. Reminder why blind buys aren't always a good idea.

I just can’t truly enjoy this, and I’ve tried. With a 5ml mini, you can bet that I’ve tried. It’s just okay.

A little citrus at the top, and pomegranate (not my favourite note), and then pretty tuberose for the rest. I don’t detect even a hint of sandalwood here. It’s safe, inoffensive and lasts well enough, but there isn’t a wow factor for me.

Takes a while for the initial blast of alcohol to dissipate.
Sharp citrus followed quickly by tuberose which makes it a sweet and creamy heady floral, no fruit left.
Stays like this a while, I’ll try to catch the drydown on this another day.
Edit: didn’t like it enough to try.

a pretty spring/summer floral but nothing spectacular, a bit acquatic and full of tuberose with some sharp freesia and musk and maybe a hint of pomegranate if someone tells you and you stretch your nose; the tuberose is in the top but it is sharp, powdery freesia in the base with some musk. I actually like the top, tolerate the mediocre middle, and love the base.
Soapy, clean, slightly sterile due to the white florals used. Not unique enough to warrant a purchase.

Just received this today and the same day I received it, I gave it away to a friend lol, its not a terrible scent but its a very one dimensional, synthetic white floral fragrance without any presence or lasting power.

On my skin, pomegranate tames the tuberose completely. Usually tuberose strangles me, but in this scent it's polite and powdery. If I didn't know what the notes were, I'd say this smells like dried apricots - must be the sour juicy fruits on white florals that give that impression.
really strong freesia..and really sweet ..with long longevity

One of my favorites from Kenzo . I believe it’s limited addition and love it
Very elegant floral woody fragrance. Beautiful for summer days. Definitely can be noticed by many .

Basically, this is Pure Poison by Dior with added pomegranate note. I love Pure Poison, but it has that sad note, something nostalgic, whereas this one is cheerful, positive, uplifting, happy. I love it just as I love Pure Poison.

Clean fragrance, without too many frills, passe-partout, I could not place Jeu d'Amour properly in a specific or more suitable season than another.
My skin radiates a scent that reminds me a bit of Pure Poison Dior, but I can be misled by the mandarin I perceive as the dominant note, a note of sunlight and positivity.
It clearly falls between the fragrances I adore.

Lovely fragrance! Fresh, feminine, calm. A good choice for people looking for a sensual and minimalist spring scent. I am glad to have it in my collection. This perfume is a people pleaser with personality.
I imagine a young woman drinking tea in Japan in the early morning hours when i smell it. She is serene, joyful, grateful, self-loving and confident.
My nose detected tuberose (creamy and fresh), musk (gives the scent a subtle powdery touch) and pomegranate (soft fruity and a bit aquatic).
If you want a scent that smell like peace and freshly cuted flowers, try Jeu d‘Amour.
Final note: 8/10
Sillage: soft
Longevity: moderate

This was a surprise. I've had a sample vial of Jeu d'Amour for some time now, but haven't really been drawn to try it until today, which I only did because it was in my bag and I didn't like the other vial I tried on this morning (Marc Jacobs Honey).

The notes on the list on this page are not my usual thing. I'm not a big fan of florals, especially white florals, and I tend to be cautious with tuberose in particular. That said, I also am not very good at identifying individual floral notes (except rose, iris and violet, which it turns out I love in certain perfumes), so I couldn't imagine what this might smell like.

Well, as it turns out, I am enjoying this perfume very much. The opening is fresh and juicy, which must be the fruit and tea notes. While quite pleasant, it was the drydown that really hooked me in.

The early transition between opening and drydown was not particularly impressive, but the fragrance grew increasingly lovelier, until I later caught a lightly sweet and powdery, slightly musky scent that strongly reminded me of something. It took a while before I realized it reminded me of L'Occitane Iris Bleu & Iris Blanc, but even more beautiful. Comparing the notes, they only have musk in common, but reading up I learned that freesia is from the iris family, so I'm not sure if that is why they smell similar to me. Whatever it is, I am enjoying Jeu d'Amour even more than I do the L'Occitane fragrance, because while I like the latter's drydown, I get a waxy opening from it, which I could almost taste. The Kenzo fragrance only shares the delicately powdery drydown, except it is fuller and milkier, more delightful.

Since I already have Iris Bleu & Iris Blanc, I'm not sure if a full bottle of Jeu d'Amour is worth seeking for me, despite my liking it more. It's not normally the kind of scent I reach for (indeed, I don't use Iris Bleu & Iris Blanc much), but it's nice to have for when the mood strikes or just to smell occasionally. I will at least use up this vial if I couldn't get a small decant.
Tuberose and pomegranate. Not bad for sure. Catchy, but not too catchy to buy it for myself. But I like it.

It grows on you. I got it from my Mother who didn´t like it. I first thought it was the most generic "smelled it before" perfume out there but found myself wearing it everyday and enjoying it. I feel that I am wearing something pink and warm. A bubbly woman´s scent. Also a cover up your real emotions scent. Good for work.

Update: It grows on you so much you end up buying it again and love smelling it. Compliment getter. Reminds me often of my beloved Michael from Michael Kors. Ultra feminine, lipsticky and charming.

It is not like Tresor.
This is sweet but insipid. A hint if tuberose is at the beginning, overall this scent is really nice but this insipid factor does not letting me enjoying it. I dont like Jeu that much.
It's not fair such beauty to last so little.
This fragrance smells all the notes blending together, fresh and Very lovely in sunny days, i got many compliments with this perfume

In my opinion this stunning perfume doesn't get all the attention and recognition it deserves as a very particular composition that offers something new in a world of an ocean of scents. Jeu d'Amour is overshadowed by the popular line of Flower and its infinite flankers and isn't on the spotlight like the other Kenzos. However this perfume smells heavenly to me. I've been looking for a long time for a perfume that was fresh, woody, breezy, green and floral and this is the best example that suits the decription. It smells like springtime, like a wave of fresh, dewy flowers. The fragrance is very well balanced between the "bodiness" of tuberose, the freshness of freesia, the juicy pomegranate, and the sandalwood that contributes with the spicyness. Yes, it's a perfect scent for when you need to smell good but don't feel like wearing anything too heavy. Jeu d'Amour has an incontestable presence, is clean and is also a fragrance that makes you feel good and happy. Enjoy it.

I consider this fragrance very beautiful and feminine and not ordinary...it is sweet but not in a heavy way...my partner doesn´t like heavy fragrances on me, but this one he can stand...he even says it would fit me during spring or summer, even though I bought it as a winter/ fall fragrance...I am very curious about summer, I think it will change a bit its character.
If you like sweeter and romantic fragrances, this is a good choice...not too heavy...it´s romantic, princessy, warm...

Sillage is quite good, but not too owerwhelming...it lasts 5 - 6 hours on my skin...on my sweater even on the other day:)
p.s. EDT is loud and a bit soury, I don´t like at all...

Be careful! Eau de toilet is way diffrent than edp. My congradulations to the edp which has a milky silky close to skin wibe while using the white flowers. On the other hand edt stays scratchy and very loud.

This is nice but somewhat generic.
"I've smelled this before" was my first thought when I applied it.
Reminds me somewhat of Tresor in Love even though the notes don't match up. It's fruity but also woody, which I like.
Longevity and silage are moderate.

I have to agree with dissapointing drydown here.
After I sprayed it, it smelled wonderful - juicy, not too sweet, slightly powdery, very interesting and sensual.

After the drydown all I can get are white floral notes. I'm not saying it doesn't smell nice. It surely does, but somehow boring to me.

Dissapointing. At first application this is divine. Juicy, moreish, not too sweet, and elegant. I found it enchanting. However whatever it is that makes it interesting wears off within 20 mins and leaves a generic soapy white floral. Shame

I received a sample of this fragrance along with a couple of purchases and never really gave it much thought. At New Year however, I left the family party early and went to my college city to celebrate with my friends and boyfriend.
When I woke up the next morning I smelled of tobacco, spilled beer and had bags for days under my eyes, everything you don't want your family to see at family dinner. After a quick shower I realized I moved all my perfumes home for the holiday except this little one. it was light, flowery, sweet and velvety smooth and it seemed to go along perfect with the pancakes I made that morning before returning home to go to the family dinner. My boyfriend had a hangover and is very sensitive to smells but he even cuddled and I felt clean and elegant despite the serious lack of sleep. It's a great light fragrance and I will forever link it to me walking in flat boots and a black dress through the snow with a cold winter sun peeking through the clouds after a wonderful night.

This is my favorite perfume for the warmer months. I think it's ladylike and youthful at the same time and suitable for all occasions.
Very feminine with a hint of flirtyness.

The main note is tuberose, which is my favorite floral. It's a fresh and clean one with a hint of creaminess, supported by freesia. A hint of bubblegum-sweetness is there, but not too much. The pomegranate is also quite prominent and gives a sparkling fruity twist. I wouldn't have thought of a blood mandarin note (I never even saw a blood mandarin in my life), but now that I know it's there, I think I can smell a bit of a blood orange note, too.

I love that Jeu d'Amour stays fresh the whole time in a soft, non-screechy way. The base is musky and very soft, I find it perfect here. I usually like sweet and warm basenotes, but sometimes a cleaner, less sweet base is even better, and this is the case here. I'm glad they didn't use vanilla for this one.

Sillage and lasting power are average and that's fine with me.

I love it!

Very nice opening I mean wow.

Ince I get past that and let the other notes come through, it's a white floral.

Proud know the type, the Jasmine, gardenia ..... etc. well, these go bitter in me sadly, this one hasn't yet but we'll see.
It's very pretty, don't wear it with anything sweet or the sweetness will bring out the bitter, let it be, soft and floral.

Similar to
Michael by Michael kors
Glam Jasmine by m kors
Prada infusion de orange r but kenzo is prettier
Prob modern muse by e Lauder
There's a little handful I've had recently and they're all of this type and I sigh with annoyance even though I'd like to love them.

It's very pretty but, if these sort generally go funny on your skin don't blind buy.

Amo esse perfume! Para mim é o cheiro de um romance. Chega a ser quase indescritível de tanto que gosto. Certamente percebo as notas florais por bastante tempo e na abertura me chama a atenção o toque de chá e uma nota cítrica bem leve. De uma forma ou de outra, a fragrância consegue ser reconfortante e ao mesmo tempo sensual, mas de forma calma. Gostaria apenas que durasse mais pois 4 a 5 horas não é ruim, mas eu adoraria que durasse umas horinhas a mais.

I love this perfume! For me, it smells of romance. It's almost indescribable since I like it so much. I can certainly notice the floral notes for quite a while and in the opening the tea notes and blood orange do appear. One way or another, the fragrance manages to be both comforting and sensual, but in a calm way. I just wish it would last longer. Four or five hours isn't bad, but I would love it if it could last a couple of hours longer.

First when sprayed this perfume is quite sharp and strong, I feel mostly blood orange but I feel it mixed with some alcohol note, not the usual fresh citrus smell. I barely detect pomegranate and tea notes which is so disappointing because I really like them in a perfume. Freesia appears shortly after spraying and it stays till the end as well as the tuberose. Sandalwood appears in the base and it makes the scent a bit warmer and musk is barely noticeable too and it gives Jeu D'Amour kind of a soapy note. Freesia is the note I feel most intensely and if you're not into freesia skip this perfume. Jeu D'Amour is categorized as floral gourmet type of scent and I was curious to try it, but this is definitely not my type of scent. I would describe it as completely floral perfume that has a lot of freesia in, a bit tuberose and a tiny bit of sandalwood and blood orange, but it's not gourmet at all. I would definitely like this more if pomegranate and tea notes appear stronger but Jeu D'Amour for me is completely white floralish-floral type of scent. I don't like freesia and it irritates me in a perfume and here makes no exception – it's fresh but it's so sharp and it makes every perfume too retro smelling. I have to admit that Jeu D'Amour is nicely composed and creamy, fine and feminine scent but it's not for me. I think it would suit young women as well as mature women, basically every women that like white florals. As I said this perfume smells too retro for me. Longevity is high – it has strong sillage and projection and it stays on the hair & clothes. Pomegranate and tea notes are so rare to find in a perfume and I think it's a miss that instead of making them appear stronger Kenzo went for the boring combination of white florals and pretend this is a “floral-gourmet” which is funny because the only gourmet thing here is a tiny bit of blood orange right after spraying. If you're into freesia and white florals you'll probably like Jeu D'Amour.
Ahhhh... this should be called the smell of calm.
Hule idéntico a "mini liberty" es exquisito ! Floral dulce, juvenil, romántico me encanta!

I often like what Daphne Bugey creates. This one likeable too even if created by two people.
The fragrance reminds me about Amarige by Givenchy, in its heart notes mostly. It's something like an updated and changed Amarige, more modern. The base notes are sweet, almost caramel-like though, and Givenchy has definitely much better sillage on me. In fact, the fragrance has a good sillage in the first half an hour and then it decreases and decreases, to stay almost undetectable in the end.
I'd expect more sillage, it's KENZO! Actually my favourite brand, I guess.
The fragrance would suit a young woman, a woman in her middle age and elderly one too, not a very young teenager. It's sexy!

Quite a strong and harsh opening but thankfully it quickly settles into a light and inoffensive scent. I am able to detect all the beautiful top notes before the warm tuberose makes its entrance and steals center stage.

Feminine, a little playful, but in no way a silage monster. This perfume sits quite close to the skin. I don't see this as a fruity floral but rather a spicy (oriental) floral. I think its the tea note that adds the spicy feel. Overall a lovely scent for everyday wear and definitely office safe.

When I first tried Kenzo - Jeu d'Amour after receiving a sample, I really couldn't decide if I liked it or not - It almost seemed a little annoying. But as I used up the sample it grew on me and I bought a 30ml flacon feeling I would miss it once it was gone. Now just like onimoka, I think I should have bought a larger one!
It is a smell I feel I "have" as well as "have not" smelled before. Familiar but unfamiliar at the same time.
As it has grown on me I find it is predominantly a soft, warm and beautiful powdery tuberose scent which makes me feel beautiful, loved and desired, not blatantly sexy, rather a quiet sexual confidence. My husband likes it a lot which enhances my feelings towards Jeu d'Amour. To me it feels like "I love you - let's play" more than "game of love" It is not a statement perfume. In my opinion it seems appropriate for both the office and an intimate evening out. I wouldn't wear it to a rock concert or club though.
I find the silage is good. If I leave my office I can smell the fragrance as I walk back in (we have an open door policy so the fragrance isn't trapped inside, it seems to be absorbed by the air around you). I think closetlikeboots' comment of it having a faint waft that follows you is spot on as I have noticed it in the passageway outside my office if I have only been away for a short while. Longevity is good, I can still smell it around me after getting home from work 12+ hours later.
I haven't got any experience with Avon's perfumes so I can't compare the bottle design, to me it seems an elegant understated bottle, just like the perfume inside.

there is a new Version of this - L´Elixir in a dark purple bottle - I got this and love it more than this and the EDT because of the warmth of Rum and Vanila base - perfect for cold winter! I´m gonna svae this for the spring and the EDT for summer
This is the only Kenzo perfume that I like so much due to the tuberose in it. However, somehow, the tuberose disappears after 1 to 2 hours. Perhaps it is just my skin chemistry.
All I sensed on my skin was very strong lily. ;(
Very very strong and lovely perfume. This beats Alien in terms of silage for me. But for some reason, the tuberose turns into gardenia on my skin lol. It's still lovely. I wish it had incense o:

The bottle is...not the nicest, it's true. The scent does strike me as quite powdery, but it is quite long lasting and good sillage ... not overpowering. i've gotten compliments. it's not the most original smell ever, but i give it a 7/10

i would say the middle notes here are the strongest.. i don't smell too much pomegranate on me!

EDIT: wearing it now in the colder weather, I find that it's not very long lasting and the sillage is poor. The heat definitely seems to bring out the best in this summer perfume.

I had received many compliments wearing this. The sillage and longevity is good, you can walk into a room and a faint waft will follow you ( I've been told) as opposed to loud smack in the face. Generally it doesn't last long though after 2 hrs you won't be able to smell it on yourself, though others will. You can smell the pomegranate on first spritz then dries down to a warm, soft, hint of wood and lastly a fresh soapy smell. Though for me, Olympea has topped this.
I received a sample from my mother its ok nothing to write home about . its not very long lasting
Esto me recordó a Samsara con pur Decir de Gardenia de Yves Rocher.

maybe it's me, but I think there is something wrong with the composition of tuberose, pomegranate and tea! Even though the result hardly has anything to do with fruity notes, it is too sharp to my nose, almost like an expensive soap, but nothing like you might be expecting from a gorgeous bottle like this.
people who admire tuberose,may like it as well. still, there are better tuberose perfumes out there.

A true spring/summer scent. Fresh flowers with a hint of halfsweet fruits. Musk, Tea and Sandalwood in base. The tea-note fades out the sweetnes from the fruit in a good way. Fresh, flirty and chic. timeless - a scent for both the teenager and the elegant woman. On my skin it lasts about 5 hour.

En sann vår/sommardoft. Fräscha blommor med en aning om halvsöta frukter. Musk, Te och Sandelträ i basen. Te-noten dämpar sötman på ett bra sätt. Fräsch, flirtig och chic. Tidlös - passar både tonåringen och den eleganta kvinnan. På min hud doftar den i ca 5 timmar.

Jeu d'Amour Kenzo is very feminine and light fragrance. The note i can hear the most is freesia. Lasting power is 4 hours on skin and app. 8 on cloth. I can feel very aromatic waves from time to time when i walk. Very good for the office, but its romantic and memorable as well. I have only bought 30 ml now thinking to buy a bigger bottle.
It does reminds me of Laura by Laura Biagiotti, only this one i like better.
I got this perfume because of the use of pomegranate and it did not disappoint! The scent is there from beginning to end in my nose. I love this perfume, it's my current fave!!

An interesting fragrance, relying mostly on florals and musk to my nose. It opens with tuberose and musk, both coming on quite strong in the opening. Then the mandarin, pomegranate and freesia come in to lighten and brighten the scent. The tea note grounds it. The drydown is nice with a musky and powdery slightly sweet tuberose and fruity lasting scent with good sillage.

I do not understand why Kenzo linked this scent to its Amour line. There is no real similarity to my mind, except that they are both rather powdery in the drydown and a bit sweet. Jeu d'Amour is missing the lovely vanilla and rice notes that give the original Amour its distinctive scent.

Its a rather alluring smell to me! Im stuck between a wow and a not wow. Apparantly it doesnt smell good on me if i had not showered since morning and just spray it on my arm at night. Its got some kind of chemical plasticky scent mixed when smelled upclose. However after a nice shower and spraying this, the scent is so dreamy. The smell stays close to the skin, if the wind blew people around can totally smell it. And will wonder "wow what is this alluring smell?"
It's like Tresor EDT 2014, more powdery and more milky. What makes it more delicate. And seems to increase their age range.

Kenzo hasn't lost it's niche in this one. It has that typical Kenzo feeling to it. It's a little powdery, spicy and elegant white floral.
Warm, spicy and sexy.
Also, I must say that I asbolutely love the marketing, everything about it!
Definately one of the most interesting releases in 2014.

I wanted to try it since the notes sound really appealing, although to me this smells really syrupy actually the cough syrup sort. To be fair I only have tried it on a paper strip so it might get different on the skin. Anyway, I can understand why it is a popular fragrance I mean it is soft and uncommon I guess nothing that will put You off.

Georgeous.It smells much cleaner white flowers from the beginning. When dry seems to have a soft vanilla. And finally freesia gives a special, clean and modern feel, which is hardly found in perfumes of white flowers.

Reminiscent of one of J.Lo's perfumes at the opening and Pure DKNY at the base. Quite like it. Lasts well on my skin too. It's been on my wrist for about 6 hours and still going strong, which doesn't usually happen for me which is why I prefer spraying onto my clothes. It's nice and cosy, kind of like Pure by DKNY is cosy, if you know what I mean.

I've only tried it once. It's not terribly original and I could see why some would say it's synthetic. However, it has some presence and it is a very pleasant fragrance, very happy feel-good, but also feminine and flirty. The tuberose is the main note, but it is not heady, old-smelling tuberose, just a more soft white floral smell, made playful by the fruity notes (with the benefit of not being sticky or cloying). The sandalwood becomes more prominent in the drydown, but I think I prefer the opening.

Kenzo Jeu d'Amour opens with juicy pomegranate and a hint of mandarin. The pomegranate wears off into a vague fruity nuance after about 30 minutes, and the whole stage is left to the tuberose to shine.

The tuberose here has a slight buttery and milky texture. Along with a freshness lent from freesia, the tuberose feels relatively real, and doesn't get lost in a abstract fruity floral sweetness like some fragrances do. Granted, it smells mainstream, and far from being original or striking, but it's very nice and shows enough textures for me perceive it as a relatively true tuberose. The drydown after about 6 hours is a lily-vanilla base, with a slight suntan lotion vibe and a sort of powdered sugar mixed in, not uncommon to a few other fragrances in the same genre such as Lys Soleia and Baiser Volé Essence de Parfum, but it's just as lovely.

The sillage is moderate and the longevity is around 10 hours. Jeu d'Amour is a bright, relatively authentic tuberose, with a sensuous white floral and vanilla drydown. If you're interested in a big tuberose, but at the same time not too difficult to wear, Jeu d'Amour could be a lovely option.
too much sinthetyc White flowers and after five minutes one cheap floral woody base.
I'm not a fan of any fragrances by kenzo but I LOVE this! My only dislike is that (on me) it doesn't last very long, other than that it's perfect. Honestly you need to try this

I like this Jeu d'Amour. When I saw the bottle I thought: ok, here is yet another flanker, can't designers make anything new?
Anyway I tried it and didn't regret.
It's a lively floral with a zesty fruity opening and a long drydown in the vanillic musky modern way.
Nothing new, good news.
The opening is zesty but sweet, maybe because of the blood mandarine. It has an uplifting vibe and it reminds me of a very old fruity way: the '80s fruity scents. It's a slight different take compared to the endless fake fruit basket with only the berries variation of the last years.
This put me in a good disposition for the rest. Not that this scent is the epithome of creativity and originality, but in the messy sea of mainstream it stands quite bright.
The heart is floral or at least synthetical floral. I don't get the tuberose at all. Not in the way of the classic somptuous, carnal, warm and thick tuberose scents. It seems to me that many new perfumes features tuberose or gardenia, then they smell nothing like them and they are probably replacers. Like for strawberries, sandalwood and other materials. I guess few people get to smell real tuberose in a garden (and many would run away especially from some species!) so here it is the "new" tuberose. A fresher fake. Not too bad, at least it is nicely blended.
Then comes the inevitable sweet musky base of our days, nice enough for about 2 hours, then it falls flat with that edge of bath products and bodysprays.
This is a scent I could wear very easily and feel pretty, feminine, young and into the crowd, but with some distinction.
Strange scent, strong oriental and vibrating. I really can't define why I don't like it. Tuberose? Maybe. I have a problem with many tuberose scents and only very few of them have stolen my heart.

I tried this yesterday and sprayed it on a card. Today, the scent's still very strong on the card, so I'd say it has quite good lasting power. This is a nice, but very 'safe' and mainstream fragrance. It's interesting to see that several other reviewers have mentioned a similarity between this and Avon perfumes, because as soon as I smelled it, the first thought that poppied into my head was 'this smells exactly like an Avon perfume' (although I couldn't say which one as it's been years since I tried any). So, not a unique fragrance by any means, but pleasant. I like it, but wouldn't buy it.

This smells like Avon's 2000's fragrance Today - a strong jasmine / tuberouse on a woody base. In case of Jeu d'Amour the joyful and sour fruity note has been added in the composition. However, the scent is heavy and too mature enough.
Damn, why is this limited edition??!!
Lovely light slightly sweet perfume. Ideal for day wear if you don't want anything too heavy. Sadly it doesn't last very long
Tried this today and I have to say it's rather lovely, lots of tuberose with a hint of sweetness from the pomegranate and tea doesn't last too long but while it does it's really nice
Just tuberose. Wich unfortunately turns my stomac despite the fact that I can see why it is popular. So hey...if you like tuberose give it a try!

I didn't think much of the bottle, as Endymion says it's very reminiscent of an Avon one!

The immediate thing that struck me after spraying it was how much it smelled like bubblegum!

It's a fun, young scent, and I think I might treat myself to a bottle. :D

I tried a lab sample. What can I say?
It is incredible! It creates floral and a bit powdery gauze around you (thanks to freesia), I can't describe it really fresh, but it isn't heavy at all.
It also has fruity and juicy notes which make this fragrance really inviting!
I wore it to a meeting with my friends, and everyone made compliments to this fragrance, I was really surprised to get so much good feedback(i never get this much)!
The notes are very nice, but the bottle look as cheap as an Avon bottle :S
My bottle from about six years ago is almost empty. Just wore it for the first time in a long time. The scent is amazing. Forgot how good it is.

I do like this fragrance it's like a sweet coconut fragrance. When I smelled this for the first time It brought me back to middle school because it smells like a higher quality version of my main fragrance from that time, AXE Excite bodyspray. I even recently went out and bought AXE Excite showergel to see if I was right or not and I was right it's almost identical.

Kenzo Night is warm and peppery woods with some faint sweetness. As well versed in fragrances as I am, no particular note stands out. The mango doesn't stand out, nor does the tonka note. It is not as sweet that everyone else is making it out to be. It's rather a spicy, mature sweetness.

I definitely get a warm, mentholated vibe.

Unfortunately, I do not get any coconut or tanning lotion or candy/ice cream, and that was my sole reason for blind buying this fragrance. There is absolutely nothing fruity or tropical about this fragrance. Even if Kenzo Night gave off an "ice cream" accord, I would have at least been satisfied.

The overall feel of Kenzo Night is rather peppery and there is fleeting fruity-sweet note. It's actually on the mature side of things, I really can't see a teenager enjoying this or wearing it.
A nice opening and a scent I would not object to if I smelled it on someone, but overall not interesting enough to want to wear it. I did not finish my sample.

To those considering blind buying this one thinking it would feel similar to Creed VIW, Diptyque Philosykos, I'll stop you right here. It's not.
Think CK Obsession Night Men with a bit of Polo Black (this one lacks the spices), CK Eternity Now Men, Hugo Dark Blue, Diesel Only the Brave Wild (minus the citronella).

Definitely not for warm days in the tropics, it can get cloying, great performance.
Used to cost $30-$40 for 100ml 5 years ago..

To my nose this smells like a mix of the best attributes from Obsession Night for Men by Calvin Klein + Only The Brave Wild Diesel for men with a nice Tonka bean final note/dry down. I've only smelt Le Male Jean Paul Gaultier for men but I can see how it must share some similarities with Le Beau Jean Paul Gaultier for men which many compare it to. Kenzo Night has some very interesting middle notes, it's not dross.
I find the sillage becomes pretty close to the skin after an hour or so and likewise long lasting but just a skin scent. I wouldn't categorise this as the beast the ratings make it out to be, but that may just be olfactory fatigue on my nose's part.
It's definitely a very sexy fragrance but I'm still on the fence whether it's something I would wear too often, maybe I just need to get out more :D
This scent is so aptly named. It is a wonderful tropical concoction that to me is the gold standard for these types of scents. It is playful, yet mature. It is sweet, but it so wonderful.

It’s not going to be everyone’s cup of tea. I really like it though! It’s very much a ‘fun’ (or easygoing) fragrance - I’d say you either enjoy sweet tropical/holiday fragrances or you don’t, I guess. All I can really pick out from it is sweet coconut. It’s just really pleasant, not remotely ‘serious’ at all. It doesn’t smell in anyway the same but something about the linear sweet (and synthetic) scent made me think of Black XS Potion. Not a criticism. I had to check the box to see if Kenzo Night was an EDP, it isn’t, it’s just that it seems really long lasting but isn’t loud.

I’m having a blast with exploring Kenzo, after KPH eventually really grew on me after initial indifference and putting aside. Now I have discovered Tokyo, which is truly outstanding and a personal favourite now. Got Kenzo Aqua Kenzo on the way too.

I really hope I got a fake, because the fragrance that I got is just too sweet and generic. I get no coconut or tropical vibe at all. Also, it's too masculine in my opinion – I gravitate towards unisex frags.

Then again, I didn't particularly love JPG Le Beau either (even though I liked it better than this!), so maybe I'm just getting too old (or boring) for this kind of fragrance. It sounded so promising, though...

Kenzo Homme Night was quite a ninja challenge. I got a fresh bottle and the fragrance was incredibly tenacious, possessing headache inducing vapor pressure, and a heady linear gourmand body that's like some kind of synthetic mutation between tonka bean and mango constitutes. It shares a strong reminiscence with the base from Ferragamo Uomo.

I couldn't bear to wear it out—even once. That's how unenjoyable it was for me. After two years, I checked to see if the fragrance matured, and the tenacity mellowed out. Not this one though. Nothing changed about it at all. So I left a small amount in a dram to macerate, and see if I could level off the tenacity by more advanced methods and get some hidden qualities to open up.

It wasn't long, and from the sealed dram, the fragrance opened up and transformed into something much less ungodly. There were sweet hints off the tonka and fruit constitutes, a touch of enjoyable musk, and a bit of an ambery or resinoid accent providing a massaging stimulation.

It was enjoyable even. If you had a virgin nose—possibly amazing. But to me, it still comes off more than a bit adolescent. Something you'd be wearing through your teens. Not really worth all the trouble that went into it.

Sadly, this is probably just another shameless solicitation for a privateer formula, available only to the very wealthy Nihonjin.

Honestly I was a little disappointed with this one. I was expecting a fresh mango based fragrance with a creamy tonka dry down. But from the start I get a very creamy and pretty synthetic coconut smell. It’s a pleasant smell and it gets a little woodier and more floral as it dries down but I was honestly expecting a bit of a tropical fruit vibe. Still a great fragrance with good performance for the 38$ I paid

probably the worst performing fragrance I have ever bought and obviously, it's an instant dislike because of that. I have soaps that last longer and project more than this, seriously. the scent itself was good while I still was able to smell it, perfect for summer, but even then it was pure skin scent. after about 2 hours, it' was like I never sprayed anything at all. the batch is 6Y01, which reveals the bottle is 3 years old. 40$ wasted.

A mango and tonka bomb with a hint of spice.

I get a sort of coconut/tropical vibe from this and agree with others in the comments below that this is similar to Le Beau by JPG.

For me, projection is moderate to low and longevity is at the lower end of average at about 3 hours. This would be the only downfall to the fragrance.

Overall a nice smelling fragrance that could be made even better with improved performance and longevity.

Ratings
Sillage: 6.5/10
Longevity: 6/10
Scent: 7.6/10

bomb of a scent, this house deserves so much more love, original kenzo homme/pour homme is beast...but thats fresh salty green acquatic, this is mango coconut and tonka blast, its called night but can be used all year round day and night, beast mode performer.recently I sniffed Le Beau by Jean Paul Gaultier...almost identical at half the price...its an easy buy :)
9/10 if you like tropical sweet fragrances

Kenzo Night is warm and peppery woods with some faint sweetness. As well versed in fragrances as I am, no particular note stands out. The mango doesn't stand out, nor does the tonka note. It is not as sweet that everyone else is making it out to be. It's rather a spicy, mature sweetness.

★★★★

It definitely took me some time to appreciate Kenzo Homme Night. For me, it was always one spray on a paper strip without focusing on the scent, basically thinking about the original Kenzo Pour Homme as a far superior fragrance.

I have tried Virgin Island Water by Creed, Diptyque Philosykos, Heeley's Coccobello and South Water by Lili Bermuda while I was looking for a tropical fragrance. All of those fragrances smell wonderful (with a preference to Coccobello) but I always felt they are too unisex and suitable for daytime.

I decided to try Kenzo Homme Night in the end, but actually give it a full wearing, and I did the same with Davidoff Cool Water Night, only because I wanted to use a tropical fragrance only for night time and specifically for clubbing.

Kenzo Homme Night on my skin opens with a wonderful lush mango note that is uplifting and energetic, almost sporty I dare to say, but without making it a sport fragrance. I guess it feels sporty due to the coriander and grapefruit combo as top notes. After a few minutes, the magic happens. It turns really woody and even smoky, I can't smell the vetiver but I can definitely smell the guaiac wood and tonka bean that gives the composition the depth it needs for being a masculine night fragrance. What's fantastic about it is that the mango is always there, even when the base notes start to dominate and turn it slightly dirty and deep. Some people say it smells of coconut but don't be fooled, it's just when the tonka bean kicks in correlation with the mango.

The tropical character stays there for the fragrance's whole lifespan, which is a total of 9 hours or more with great projection for at least the first 4 hours. In my book, that's success in today's standards when everything fleets in the first hour (yes, I'm looking at you Creed)

Is it original? Well, tropical fragrances smell similar most of the time, but I have never encountered the depth of Kenzo Homme Night in any other tropical fragrance, and that is why I give it a gold medal as the ultimate masculine tropical fragrance.

The longevity, the projection and the good price beats it all, a fragrance that's aloof, lazy in a summer way but utterly seductive and masculine.

Wear it with sexy flip flops or total white trainers, your summer t-shirt and aloof shorts and you are that guy in the club that people sniff secretely, the guy that is hard to resist.

Thank you Kenzo, please wake up and go back to your creativity because -in the masculine spectrum- it has already been a while since Kenzo Pour Homme, Kenzo Air and Kenzo Homme Night.

I'm out, the summer night is calling...

Oily coconut smelling sunscreen. Definitely not for summer (at least where I live). Juvenile, sweet, tropical. Performance is good.

Kenzo Homme Night is an original take on coconut for men that is never too beachy or excessively summery.It smells fairly sweet though quite well-balanced as well, ends up being very long-lasting with satisfactory sillage, and remains quite unfairly off the radar.

At the same time it stays healthily distant from other Kenzo pour Homme offerings, and more than a flanker should be a perfume on its own merit. I am a bit biased here because I like Kenzo Homme Night quite a lot.

I wear it sometimes in the spring, at daytime, and fits many different occasions without being inappropriate. If you are looking for something "coconutty" that does not remind you of women's coconut perfumes, I believe this fits the bill. Apart from that, I can smell a little bit of pepper probably, and a fleeting undertone of mango,oh wait, or is it fig?

Be careful if you like your coconut to smell fresh, like with Virgin Island Water or "cocktail-smelling" like with Tommy Bahama Set Sail St Barts or Calvin Klein One Summer 2014. Those lean towards a fresher interpretation of notes, in my opinion. The Kenzo is more like raw coconut flesh, for better or worse.

In a way, KPH could be a distant, masculine cousin of Bronze Goddess (by Estée Lauder) maybe.

I would give it a 9/10, but you must like coconut (conspicuous by its absence in the notes description) to enjoy it.

The smell is stunning, I smell the coconut, although in my vision it's not sweet, but neutral as if coconut was just split. Apparently, the mango with something else gives such a perception. As for me, an unusual flavor, and I like so much that the sweetness is not very sugary.

Kenzo Night is a tropical candy, a mix of woody, fruity, spicy and sweet notes, playful, elegant and powerful. It is a superb choise and sexy 100% mens scent. It opens with an explosion of sweet coconut but after a while it becomes a little bit powdery, spicy an a note of sour mango appears.

The longevity is about 6 hours and the sillage is really heavy. The most distinguished notes are coconut, mango, grapefruit, cardamon, coriander and tonka bean.

It is a warm weather scent but I do not reccomend it for the very warm summer days. It is perfect for summer evenings, spring and warm autumn days.

Only tested at the counter, but a pleasant surprise. Aromatic mango mixed with coconut-like smooth benzoin, tonka and fresh spices... seemed to have decent longevity.. i like it:)

WEATHER / SEASON : all-year around (just go easy on the sprayer during warmer days)

TIME / : night and day

WHICH MAN ? : Mainly youngsters (teenagers + young adults). I'd develop that part below...

SCENT / FEEL : 16/20. I know many male 'fragranticians" are bored with the current trend of fruity scents. But if you want TROPICAL fruity scent, not the usual citrus/red fruits/apple, etc. this is a fair candidate. Not groundbreaking (I do get the sun tan lotion comparison) BUT well made.

I got mainly mango (top and middle) and tonka beans (drydown).. AND some coconut-y smell, all throughout, which is strange because it's not listed ! Must be the result of woods and spices being mix with mango? i don't know, but I know I love it.
It's not a linear scent at all, it does evolve. You go mango > coconut (?) > tonka and spices. It's quite well blended in my opinion, it evolves quite naturally, and the drydown is creamy with the tropical vibe remaining.

LONGEVITY : 8/10 - Very good longevity as usual with kenzo. I get a 8h+ from this one, and I love the fact that the top notes (mainly mango and that coconut-y smell) linger on for a fairly long time as main notes (~2h) and you still can detect them in the drydown. It even lasts longer on clothes.

PROJECTION / SILLAGE : 7/10 . Quite powerful for the first hour, then becomes a skin scent, but with fair projection (I'd say 1-foot projection for ~4h) and the sillage is rather weak. Which is weird, because, if oversprayed, it goes on the cloying side.

OVERALL : 15,50 /20

NOTES / ADD INFO :
Many were disappointed with this one because of the deja-vu "teenage" smell it has. I do understand the disappointment. It seems Kenzo tried to go mainstream with this one, they wanted their Le male or 1-Million it's quite a letdown compared to the other Kenzo offerings if you expect the Kenzo "originality" when it comes to their fragrances. I guess they need more money and wanted to launch something more accessible, likeable by the majority (I do like Kenzo pour Homme, but I detect a slight nail polish remover in it that kept me from buying it).
BUT this one wins as a candidate regarding TROPICAL scents available to men... When requesting a tropical scent for men its always the same 4/5 bottles : Virgin Island Water, l'Artisan Timbuktu, Tommy Bahama St Barts Sail, Jennifer Lopez Deseo... You know what? I prefer this ONE over those others. Looks like the only 'tropical' note available to men is coconut, this one at least has mango, which is a rather rare and interesting note. And It does the job very well as a tropical.
Nice to wear for all seasons as well, just make sure to use it sparingly during summer (though not sure a more mature man, says, in his 50 would pull it off. Maybe still too fruity to some)

Kenzo Night is not bad at all but differs greatly in quality and originality from Virgin Island Water.
It's playful and strong. Dry minty opening that evolves to a tropical mango aroma with a hint of coconut. Amazing woody dry down. Fruity, spicy and sweet. Sensual, unique ... a fantastic scent!

All Summer bottled by Kenzo
A fragrance I've been looking for ever since Obsession Night was discontinued.
Off course nothing could equal Obsession Night still Kenzo Night takes the upper hand for its longevity for Obsession Night disappears in 5 minutes.
I was asking myself why they shoved the "night" label for these two perfumes as they're typical day perfumes a day at the beach.
Back to the Fragrance it's fruity with coconut in the notes.It's a positive,sexy and fun fragrance.Great longevity and sillage though not cloying at all.
I was stopped many times to be asked about it and everybody around me loves it.

I really don't get the comments about it being synthetic: all fragrances are, that's how the manage to make them last long. A different thing is that smells like something you picture in your mind and you don't like the quality of it because you expected some other "smell image".

Anyway, I think this is fantastic: there is a coconut vibe as others have stated, and this note is above the mango to my nose. It's like smelling a refined tan lotion, a beachy smell if you will.

The name "night" suits it well, as I don't see it being used on the early day (cloying alert). It's meant for the cold to me, so I'll be using this a lot this winter. Nevertheless, this is NOTHING like original Kenzo Homme (which I love but haven't owned).

If you like sweet different fragrances, try this.

Kenzo Night almost surpasses Creed Virgin Island Water regarding the coconut note; however, longevity is only slightly better and the coconut is more artificial/synthetic.

Initial blast of Kenzo pour Homme Night features a strong alcohol vibe.

Then the top notes of Amber-Baby Powder-Suntan Lotion-Vanilla-and COCONUT quickly develop and take over. Very creamy and definitely unique! No one else has it.

The mild and fruity mango also develops. I think the description on Fragrantica is very accurate.

I have tried ALL the coconut scents out there. Trust me when I tell you that I am a COCONUT feind.

If you're like me and wish the coconut in Creed Virgin Island Water had a stronger coconut note, with more sillage and longevity, then you have almost found the right fragrance (although less quality and less well-defined notes).

Kenzo Night is very sweet and not masculine. It flirts with being unisex and is similar in sweetness to Paco Rabanne Black XS and Givenchy Pi, but it never crosses the gender line over to the feminine side.

Kenzo Night is certainly a linear fragrance and much more artificial/synthetic, especially when compared to Virgin Island Water. At times it feels blurry, as if all the notes were thrown together and they're bluntly not mixing well; however, it's the only other coconut scent on the market that I enjoy and find pleasant for my weird tastes. I purchased my 3.4 ounce bottle at Strawberrynet for 80 USD and free shipping. It might hit the online discount retailers for half-price in the future.

This is the only refreshing perfume I can't forget. I really wish I had it with me everywhere. I guess it's not very easy to find anymore. As far as I can remember, it was the only scent I ever smelled that felt like cucumber freshness. If you're looking for a scent that's safe, clean, and makes you feel like you're jumping into an icy pool in the scorching heat, this is definitely the one to have on hand. I haven't tried their other flankers, but the information I've provided is based on experience.

I have what I believe is the current formulation of this (purchased 2 years ago). It's obviously been reformulated as I don't pick up most of the notes that are listed or that others say they smell in vintage versions. Despite that, I do like it and feel that it's a wonderful clean scent for hot summer days. To my nose it's a water lily/bamboo fragrance that somehow manages to smell watery but not aquatic. Nothing ground-breaking but I also can't imagine it being offensive in any way--it smells like you just got out of the shower using a clean shower gel. Soft sillage, and not long-lasting, but it was inexpensive so I don't mind reapplying.

With all the Kenzo's I've sampled I've come to realize all women's fragrances of this brand have a very distinct DNA that I'd describe as oriental poise. Given how delicate they generally are, this DNA often stands out the most, and each new one I try instantly seems familiar. But regarding L'Eau: it is good. Olivier Cresp knows his craft, especially if we talk his earlier works. Kenzo (and perhaps only Kenzo) knows how to deliver this kind of scent, the meaningful minimalism. It smells like water; not the tap kind but the element itself and our mental image of it - the stillness of it, not the calamity. L'Eau feels like a beautiful blend of nature's breath and coolness of urban futurism, what with the impeccable humanly cleanness it emanates alongside the gentle herbal freshness. In the 90s people still dreamt of progress and nature coexisting in harmony, and that harmony manifests itself in this fragrance. It might be popular because it is simple, but it is in fact very special, being the perfect olfactory interpretation of water as a part of nature, the bridge between scent and vision. A delicate timeless fougere that is linear but not in the way that gives you a migraine with its monotone presence. Reed is appropriately sweet for a distinctively herbal note, mint and pepper aren't overdone, the base is soft and perfectly womanly. No fruits for me - maybe the newer formula has been tweaked - but frankly I prefer it that way, a strong fruity accord would only simplify it, not refine. As for performance, in my experience Kenzo fragrances get stronger with time.

Melody it reminds me of: Air - J'ai dormi sous l'eau.

Classic for a reason. My third bottle and an easy reach in summertime.
This was one of my first designer perfumes, and I still remember the awe I felt when I first smelled it in the early 2000s. It’s the perfect everyday fragrance for summer—not suffocating, not loud, not attention-seeking. Just effortlessly clean and aquatic, like a splash of cold water on a hot summer day.
If you find the equation “summer = citrus scent” a bit tiresome, you might enjoy this one. The mandarin orange note is incredibly subtle and supports the top notes rather than overpowering them.

Nose Note #467

We first had a flanker of this - Kenzo Ice Pour Femme (that review became my first on Fragrantica!). I must say, they are quite similar. Kenzo Ice is about watermelon, this one is about water lily and something like a bamboo note. I think it's really lacking something, because it's withering away as I write these words. It's almost not there even when you spray it. I mean it's there, but I'm finding it difficult to say WHAT is left there. It's immediately a skin scent. Feels like a perfume with no base.
It's very light, also reminds me of the famous mens version of this. Something citrusy and bamboo-like is the main show.

6.5/10, if only performance was at least average

I have vintage (oval shaped bottle) and rectangle shaped L'eau PAR-version of this. Vintage formula is softer. Opening is sweet herbal, like anise or fennel with hint of dry hay. After few hours it turns less sweet and waterlily comes out, dry hay note is still there, but less noticeable. After four hours I smell cedar and dry hay with hint of watery notes. This reminds me of Honore des Pres- Nu Green, very similar dry hay note. Longevity is better in vintage one, imo.
Newer L'eau Par Kenzo: Opening is sharp, very aquatic and herbal at the same time. Strong mint leaf note (sweet and minty) I think mint leaf scent was the strange note that bothered me always. It's very noticeable if you overspray this. After an hour this turns out very nice aquatic fresh, I smell waterlily, lilac and hint of peach. And then it's gone. Weak hay scent with musk. So sad.
I would like to try the newest L'eau Kenzo-version of this. I prefer vintage formula because it has good longevity and scent is close enough to newer formula.

I bought a new 30ml bottle of this fragrance for just $20, as I am on the hunt for the perfect fresh, watery, lotus fragrance and the notes list here was everything I wanted.

Unfortunately, this is another one where my sensitivity to calone renders the fragrance unwearable. It's kind of funny... if I squint and focus, I can sense how it would be perceived as a sweet, watery melon sort of note! But then it's right back to being stale sweat.

My search for the perfect fresh aquatic floral may be doomed!!

oooo I got a new fb gifted to me some days ago and It seems the juice got a rebranding because It does not smell like the perfume I remember? The Green is there, but it just smells off, like rotted lemons :( wished I never opened this one, it's like the floral portion of the scent got replaced by sharp fresh notes. Now I cannot even return It! damn

This fragrance is quite unique if we are talking abt the original one from the 90s.
I am lucky to own 3 bottles of this vintage fresh juice. Not really something I am using, so pm me if interested.
Synthetic and kinda sour. Much like a deodorant. Or a body wash.
Weakest perfume ever!!! Does not last A BIT. Only thing I like is the bottle.
