Wow this is breathtaking. I was not expecting that ... got a small bottle for 45$. I thought : I cannot be bad, must be nice. No, finally this is beautiful. I smell waxy grass, dirty mimosa, spring flowers and something "sunny" (maybe the citruses) on a delicate amber/almond base. It's actually quite potent for such a delicate scent. 2-3 sprays and I'm fine. It's actually the best mimosa I've ever smelled. I might go back and buy the remaining bottle at the store hihi. Another win with Kenzo vintage-issh fragrances.
All I can say is please bring it back I can't find it anywhere and I can't find a similar scent to this!

I registered here just to write my review on this particular perfume, as I myself am overjoyed that I got it and want to share this joy.
I received a sample size some 15 years ago and fell in love with it, asking my dad to bring it from the trip he was going to. He brought Kenzo Flower instead of Summer saying that this fragrance is no longer in stores and I tried hard to hide my dissapointment. Years and years I was desperately looking for something clean, soapy and chic at the same time and none of the bottles in my shelf made it to become my very favourite signature scent. Until not sure what made me remember about this perfume. I was determined to find it and I did. I ordered one and as soon I received it, I just fell into a time capsule of such a nostalgy and joy! The way the scent plays on my skin and clothes is just incredible and even though many reviewers do not like the soapiness it gives, I absolutelly love it in the combination of other notes of fresh flowers and powder. It is not just another fresh scent, it has a soul and I trully think that if you want to charm someone, this is it.
Another story is really the pain of it being discontinued… If you are able to find it, the price will be high. I bought 3 bottles and consider it as an investment in my overall image and my great mood when I wear it.

This is unique and I'm dying to get a bottle of it.
I only have a mini and I treasure it .
I didn't know I could love mimosa until I tried summer by kenzo.
The mimosa here is fluffy creamy sunshine
It's a chameleon that changes according to the season .
It's clean soapy fresh floral with hints of green in summer
It's a cloud of creamy lotiony powdery almondy mimosa in winter
It's perfect all year round.
It's natural ,smooth and feminine.
The notes blends together seemlessly the bright uplifting citrus and dewy green fresh white flowers with a hint of indole from jasmine softened by subtle musk and creamy milky almonds and there's a little sweetness and a subtle woodiness adorned by this beautiful powdery veil from violet and all of these notes supports the stunning fluffy sophisticated warm mimosa.
There's hints of baby powder or baby lotion and a buttery feel to it.
It's divine
You wear this and the world became peaceful,safe and calm and you feel relaxed ,adored and carefree in the embrace of your beloved one while sitting in a beautiful summer meadow.
It may seem simple but it's complex and well made .
It's light ,airy , delicate, uplifting,warm, clean,fresh,sophisticated and feminine .
Mimosa+ cream+ yellow flowers= SUMMER by Kenzo. I do not think it lasts very well on my skin, still I do not mind to reaply.

So I bought a 75 ml of this at a local thrift shop for next to nothing and thought the bottle looked really cute so I got it and I really love it! It's summer in a leaf shaped bottle, period. When you put on sunscreen and go outside on a hot day this is basically it. It's a little almondy and creamy and warm and delicious and it reminds me of how much I miss summer and I can't wait for it to get here!!! Until then...this baby will have to do!

Update: it's summer and this is pure magic in the sun. The hot weather does something amazing where it takes this and makes it soapy clean and sweet on my skin. Not really fresh tho, just clean. Like Dove soap. I can't get enough of this. It's the must underrated scent in my collection!

I just bought this, I opened it! I did one spray and I don’t like it!!! I was so looking forward to it that I feel like a fool having bought it without trying it first! It turns out that I hate mimosa smell. The mimosa never goes, and stays lingering. No long later then it gives you a real powdery clean/sunscreen smell that I thought I would really love but....I do not! If anybody is interested happy to resell! Please message me!!!

I found a bottle when it was already discountinued. It was my summer scent for that year. Absolutely adorable! It smells like mimosas and cream, with a touch of fresh citrus and subtle musk, which made it so easy to wear and sophisticated at the same time. Definetly a compliment grabber, my man loved it and all the ladies wanted to know what I was wearing.
Wish this gem were still around!

A1: (Stryax + mimosa + cituses) = Heated fresh mimosas
A2: (Almond milk + florals) = Suncreeny

A1 + A2 = Heated Fresh Mimosa Sunscreen

Uplifting. Energetic. Sultry. Heatness.
Wait, why do I smell mango?

Mimosa blooms bursting inside the belly of the Sun going on for miles until they rest on almond milk and Nivea sunblock cream. Could haul Summer, happiness and French Riviera pools through misty moors and peaty quagmires in Winter.

Since this masterpiece is discontinued, I spent so much money trying and trying other scents with the hope to find something to replace my Summer by Kenzo, but nothing smells like it. This is the most unique , summer, feminine, warm and fresh at the same time, clean and beautiful smelling fragrance I ever tried. I would describe it as the most expensive mimosa soap you ever smelled, with a hint of citruses in the opening, creamy almond and woody base. It makes people wanna come closer to you and smell you again and again. My best friend used to give me a hug and take a very deep breath every time I wore Summer by Kenzo. Almost everyone asked me what I was wearing.
I cant believe that someone came to the conclusion to `discontinue this and released something like Flower by Kenzo, which I absolutely cant stand.

Just tried the Kenzo Summer splash. I am getting a vibe of the yellow pump bottle of Vaseline lotion circa 1980s, which my mother kept stocked. Kenzo Summer smells powdery, floral and clean, with a splash of citrus.

Edit: Late summer day, the drydown reveals the “summer” aspect. It smells of a crisp ozonic floral you might get out of a nice sunscreen.

My absolute favorite for about 10 years now, I also found this one on ebay. Yay. The closest perfume I found to this one was shewood golden light from Dsquared, but omg the real thing is so much better. I keep falling into the trap of buying and trying so many other perfumes with mimosa in it. but I really don't smell that in any of them.Love this one, it needs to come back.

Thanks to Ebay I was able to repurchase this gem. As soon as this pandemic is gone I will purchase whatever bottles I can find. Why? Coz this is a masterpiece.
This is the creamiest yellow flower green perfume ever. All day it sits around you like a cloud of creamy goodness. It has a powerful body, character, longevity and siage.
There's nothing like it in the spring, on your scarf, maybe Poeme by Lancome, which is not as creamy. If it wasn't discontinued I would make it my signature. Why do all good things come to an end?
This should have never left the shelves. I guess people are not into green sexy florals anymore. They just want sugar bombs.
It's much more complex and beautiful then other niche fragrances I have smelled.
It's my greatest wish that Kenzo would bring it back.

I found myself another bottle of Summer by Kenzo, still a beauty and in perfect condition, 1 spray goes a long way and Summer dances around you for many, many hours. One of a kind. I tried other Mimosa- heavy scents- no one compares to Summer.

I know that sense of smell is most tightly linked to memory.
Kenzo Summer really brings that home for me.
My father, who I have always adored, smelled faintly of dial soap.
Every time I wear this, I get soapy notes that remind me of him and of my childhood.
It’s a surprisingly visceral connection.

Kenzo Summer is truely a mimosa perfume.I can pickup mimosa from the first minute,but there's also citrus freshness and light and clean florals.It's lovely,gentle and feminine.it reminds me Guerlain Champs Elysees

I don't know how I happened upon Kenzo Summer. Must've been through browsing the list of Kenzo fragrances and wondering why I'd never heard of this one. I read reviews, checked out the notes and found a brand new 2.7 oz bottle on Ebay, for which the seller accepted my lower (not low ball) offer because she said she needed to sell. A lucky day!

Summer is undoubtedly the most interesting, while not too much of anything, Kenzo fragrance I've ever smelled. Flower is twisted violets, baby powder and nausea in a bottle. Amour had potential, but I couldn't handle the thickness of that vanilla rice pudding. L'Elephant is everything spicy; a good fragrance I can appreciate from a distance. But Summer!? Finally a Kenzo I am utterly drawn to that I don't have to make special plans to wear!

Summer is the most warm, buttery yellow floral I've ever smelled. It starts off seemingly a mimosa overload, but within minutes the almond, violet, amber and woods take position. When I smell this, I think of talcum powder turned into a paste that's mixed into crushed almonds. I can't pick apart the other notes except the ones mentioned. The white flowers and citrus notes makes Summer feel bright and happy - they don't stand strong or alone. I'm impressed that there is no screechiness or harsh edges. It just smooooothes over itself. It smells like a luxurious body cream on the skin and has good-great longevity. Sillage is average. It doesn't wear me, which I like. It melds in with my skin and wafts gently, leaving soft trails of something soft, fluffy, and warm, but yes still manages to be bright and upbeat. I agree with other reviewers here.... It is totally unique while being easy to wear, which is not always an easy feat where fragrance is concerned.

I'm so very happy with this in the summer, but I see myself wearing it a lot in the fall too. It isn't an obvious summer scent imo. It's more of a year-rounder, happy but still somewhat mysterious. It's grown up, not the usual juicy, fruity, tart, sweet, tropical summer scent we see today.

As a lovely reviewer named Super Dacob said, it seems niche perfumes are the new mainstream and discontinued designers are the new niche. Summer by Kenzo blows Eau De Noho and Mimosa Pour Moi out of the water if that tells you anything.

I hope KENZO will make something very similar soon. This is very unique.
I keep about 30ml. in a bottle and just stare at it ... :))
Smells like expensive mimosa perfume and sunkissed skin ! Fresh and warm : citrus , mimosa, musk, woods +almonds. All you need. Very unique blend, not a simple one !

I echo the praise for Kenzo's Summer as I just found the best representation of mimosa in a perfume. This is a warm, natural scent starring mimosa and her well blended cast of citrus, creamy almond and sparkling violets. I pick up a little salt too, feels like a sunny day at the beach.

Easy to wear and unique don't often go together, and Summer accomplishes that task by avoiding the cliche warm weather labels: it's neither overtly citrus or aquatic.

I bought a new tester of the original formula off eBay and it's in perfect condition. I'm happy to add it to my summer scent collection. Better than average longevity with soft projection. The only thing I don't like is falling in love with a discontinued scent.
Just a very, very nice perfume =))

Suntan cream (mimosa, almond milk) + violets + soap + plastic + hint of indole. Very "yellow" sunny scent. Summer in a bottle. Love it. Why is it discontinued?
Similar : Daylight - Gabriela Sabbatini (more watery)

Oh, WOW, this perfume is beautiful. It is full of sunny, breezy mimosa blossoms, that are milky sweet and musky. They're fresh, fuzzy, but also warm and tickle your face. This lasts all day on me, and I get whiffs of it while I move around. I really wish this wasn't discontinued, perfect summer perfume.

So gentle, soft yet unique. WHY would they discontinue this one? every woman who smelled this one on me (some 10 years ago, when I had it) would ask, what this lovely perfume was called and then buy it for themselves. Basically all my friends and female familymembers bought it. Such a beautiful scent, that really smells of all the good things about summer-flowers, sunshine, suncreme, relaxed life, falling in love, dancing in your summerdress, warm, sunkissed skin.
SO sad!

lucky me found a vintage bottle in Norway. more then 10 years old, in perfect condition. I'm sooo happy. Kenzos best ever-made parfum in my opinion.

Lyckliga jag hittade en vintageflaska i Norge. Mer än 10 år gammal och i perfekt skick. Lycklig!! Kenzos bästa doft - alla kategorier, tycker jag.
Egy szép nyári virágoskert illata. Tartós, frissítő illat. Tartóssága is kiváló. Kis mintám van belőle, amit féltve őrizgetek.

Once it fully develops it's sensual.

To me this seems as mimosa throughout and throughout, BUT, on different minutes I sniff the other notes too. It's like they are dancing on my skin; other seconds I feel intense lily of the valley, on other I feel the cedar, sometimes the citruses are refreshing,so odd yet so beautiful! Unique indeed! Can be layered in my opinion, for i will layer some patchouli underneath it just to intensify sillage and projection. Mimosa is always present. Happy to have met such an interpretation of mimosa.
This is sunshine in a bottle!

Top notes of bergamot and lemon: well honestly the opening is like I'm entering a grocery store. Doesn't really feel as citrusy but it rather reminds me of green leaves and vegetables. But all the citrusy notes do emerge later.

Mimosa and violet: right after leaving the grocery store I enter the florist's fridge. I kid you not, for the next two or three minutes Summer feels exactly like the inside of a florist's fridge, where all flowers are kept, BUT, it quickly gets so so warm! Lily of the valley is prevalent and then mimosa really shows up and starts settling. Clean, it has white musk as well, white musk is clean. Violet is powdery, not always in the front.

it's a little tart.
Musk: undetectable to me for the most part
Amber: not an intense though, enough to give warmth,not smokey
Woods: also not intense at all. Yes I smell them here and there, but I just think the base in Summer Kenzo is only to provide longevity, not really stand out.

Overall a yes from me. Can be layered and worn on it's own. Longevity is up to six hours; a fair amount of time. Sillage is soft, it stays close to the skin
Suitable for all ages, especially the younger ones, teens. Casual clothing will pair nicely. Also summer dresses. Well obviously summer dresses...

I just found an original 2005 bottle of this one at a local store in my place which used to sell perfumes, and I'm in love, its unique.

I'm gonna treasure it for special beautiful sunny days, when you have no worries, time flies between mornings and warm lazy afternoons, you can indulge yourself with this powdery fresh floral.. it takes me to quiet summer days, countryside.. meadows of flowers and the sun is setting down..

I liked this immediately. Mainly it's mimosa. Its a soft sweet smell that could be your natural smell, like warm tanned skin that's been sun bathing. It's sexy at first, then becomes more like clean babies! I like to wear it in summer, it's such a summery smell, like sun tan lotion. I don't wear it in winter much, it feels unseasonal.
Thus summer I have slightly gone off it. I think it's a young persons smell and I'm growing older! It smelled too bright, yellow and unsubtle. Strange as I had always thought of it as sophisticated. Ones nose changes as one ages!?
So sad they discontinued it ! Please bring it back !

I've been on the hunt for a fragrance with lots of mimosa, and I definitely got it with this one! This is a lovely scent for spring and summer, with powdery florals and citruses to keep things fresh. At first the mimosa is the loudest note, with citruses playing a secondary role. In the drydown phase, they switch positions: as mimosa gets relegated to the background, citrus takes center stage. Summer by Kenzo is unlike most mainstream summer fragrances; it isn't aquatic or too sweet, and I love it for being a different kind of perfume for warmer weather. It sits close to the skin and isn't particularly long-lasting, but I still find it worth having because of its uniqueness.

The scent of skin warmed by a blazing summer Sun sums up this beauty for me. I love, LOVE anything mimosa and my Lancôme Poeme captures it elegantly in cooler weather. I wanted a lovely mimosa for summer and I have found it in this discontinued jewel.

It is rich yet somehow light; musky and salty on me, like I rubbed mimosa blossoms on myself after sunbathing. Just the natural smell of my skin enhanced by mimosa. I've not smelled anything like it. It at first comes off smelling hmmmm...not sure about it...no, not another boring aquatic! But 10 minutes in it reveals its true character: a gentle wind coming in from the coast and sweeping across a field of mimosas. No minor player on the fragrance stage, this.

It has been discontinued, yes, but I found some minis on ebay as well as full bottles. I bought one mini which I received in the mail yesterday and just ordered two more. It is a strong and long-lasting fragrance so I fully expect 3 minis to take me through the summer and into autumn as I think it will perform nicely in cooler weather as well.
If you can't find Kenzo Summer, look for Salvador Dali “Cadaques, ....” which is very beachy and summery.

I miss this, too. I used it a lot during summer, it smells like warm golden mellow summer nights. One of the very few perfumes I actually used several bottles of...

This summer I bought A Scent Soleil de Neroli by Issey Miyake, I get some of same feeling from this, even if the components are different.
The best yellow floral ever. Like standing in a ray of sunshine. I love this scent.

This was so good. Fresh but warm, like a summery meadow in a bottle. The citruses are powdery, the flowers combined with the almond milk make the perfume creamy, and the base notes are rich and pretty. It's a surprisingly full bodied summer perfume.

I loved it so much when I was younger. I remember getting a lot of compliments, and it always made me feel warm and fuzzy inside. Such a shame it was discontinued. I had a small drop left at my parents' house, but for some reason it had gone bad. Sigh. The tragedy.

I doubt there will ever be a fragrance quite like this. However, J Lo's Glowing is a very similar scent with the soft powdery note that could almost be the inside of your make up bag. It doesn't have the strength or creamy quality to such a degree, but it is close.

My email must be playing up I have just seen the suggestions and so funny, I have 50% of the recommended perfumes! Am thinking of maybe just having a private sample made up. It was and is my signature scent.

Wail.

Thanks guys :)
@badgerbruno - I think that Eau de Fleur de Yuzu by Kenzo could be a replacement - not 100% but the same character and some similar notes, especially the basenotes.

@badgerbruno, im afraid you wont be able to ever replace this unique scent from Kenzo...i have had this and its truly a masterpiece.
There are a few lovely ones you could try though, ive had them before and if you like powdery and yellow florals, along the lines of Summer, then give these a go:

-Bvlgari's famous Femme - magnificent,
-Lancome, Poême - one of my top 5.
-Versace femme - sultry, creamy, i have reviewed it previously,
-Armani Idole - super unique, rare and different, no one could guess what youre wearing with this one :)
-Issey Miyake A Drop on a Cloud, or was it A Drop on a Petal...it was a limited edition i had years ago, dont think its on Fragrantica. Was a beautiful, soft, flowery fragrance with something unique in it.
-Also i suggest maybe test Lolita Lempicka's Si, the one shaped like a clover...its gorgeously spicy and soft, one of the best 'yellow' frags out there.
-maybe also give Burberry Body a shot? (One of my top scents).

But yes, nothing quite like Kenzo...all their scents are very special, from Flower, Jungle, to Amour.
And Summer is the only frag i love with Mimosa in it, others that have used Mimosa, like Paris Hilton for instance, smell horrid to me, very dusty as if the juice has expired.

Ah yes, before i forget, Cacharel Eden is another winner. Flowers, powdery, velvety, intimate...very sensual, strong and powerful, and theres nothing like it out there.

So see, there are a few options i guess :) to take away the sad fact that sometimes one cant find a favorite frag anymore :( i also feel the same about a lot of scents that are impossible to find nowdays. Upsetting what designers can do to loyal followers, just to keep the perfume cycle going in the name of business :(
Ops, dont know why this got posted twice!? Sorry

This was my signature scent for years and I am desperate to find a suitable replacement now that my last bottles are running down. Nothing quite hits the mark like this. Dusty, milky, powdery, fresh, babylike, gentle, soft..... I loved it from the moment I used the sample. Rushed out to buy a bottle. Have never received so many compliments so it clearly works with my skin.

Any suggestions for similar scents most welcome.

This is an amazing scent of a meadow on a warm and sunny bot not too hot summer day, in mid June - not later. In July/August meadows smell differently. It's yellow floral and powdery but also slightly herbal - but not in the pharmaceutical meaning. It smells like grass and herbs growing wild in the field.
And this is one of really few mimosa-based scents that are not overwhelming.
If summer wind could be closed in a bottle and intensified by 1000%, it would probably smell like Summer by Kenzo.

Oh I LOVED this one from the very first time I smell it.
It was the only fragnance I bought over and over again and never got bored of it. I didn't know what to do with myself when they discontinued it, because it was years since I had searched for another fragnance. It was THIS good.

Citrus and powdery at the same time, you could smell the perfect mix of bergamot, mimosa, almond milk and the musk. It was bright, energizing and suprisingly sensual. I could be honestly turned on by this scent. Everyone were always telling me I smelled great.
Sadly, couldn't find anything somewhat similar.

Julie billi

I smelled the "she wood" already but i didn't think it smelled anything like the summer kenzo :((

michalshraiberit, try "dsquared she wood golden light"!

Update: michalshaiberit did you try the "golden light" version or the plain " she wood"?
can someone pls tell me where can i find this perfume or some perfume that smells realllly simillar to this????
It reminds me of those sun tan oils back to the 80s or early 90s, which were sensual in a chic way and very feminine. So summer-y...Really a must-have for those who like this sort of smells...

I believe that a certain flower in heaven smells like this.

Because in heaven everything is perfect ,right? As in everyone would love what they see,taste and smell,correct?

This.....this smells heavenly.

I never thought Mimosa can be used so brilliantly.
And what's so extraordinary about this is,that there is no middle stage or final drydown.

All that pyramid in one innocent flower!!!

From beginning till end,whenever that is,you can smell a creamy yellow flower that you picked from a meadow in paradise.

Summer by Kenzo is a bottle filled wiht JOY! So fresh and clean, lots of Mimosa, Musk, Styrax, Almond and Violet - in base there is tender woodsy notes.. And I totally LOVE Summer by Kenzo. Hard to find these days. Very longlasting on my skin and it works to wear year around. I have Tried Calypso Mimosa - its nothing like Summer by Kenzo - they are not alike at all.

Summer by Kenzo är en flaska fylld av LYCKA! Så himla fräsch och ren. Mängder av Mimosa, Musk, Styrax, Mandel och Viol - och i basnoten mjuka träiga noter. Jag bara älskar den. Tyvärr svår att hitta dessa dagar. Otroligt hållbar på huden och den funkar året om.
Jag har testat Calypso Mimosa - den är helt olik Summer by Kenzo - finns inga likheter alls mellan de två dofterna.

I used to put this perfume.. it is the only perfume that suited me. Whenever I put it, and wherever I went, people used to smell it and praise it. It is discontinued and since then I cannot find another perfume that suites me :( :(

It is light, perfect for any season, day or night.. :( :(
It smells clean and soapy on me...why is it discontinued?
Soapy sweet mimosa dream for very hot days!

As much as I dislike Kenzo Flower, I have to admit that I adore Kenzo Summer.
The leaf-shaped bottle is so pretty (although my husband says it is impossible to handle and very prone to be dropped), and the fragrance... oh, how delicious!
I do not think it suits summer very much; I think it is more a spring scent, redolent of soft mimosa, dewy lily of the valley and blossom, with soothing almond milk and lemon custard and woods in the background.
It does not smell sparkly and fizzy, it is quiet, sweet and cozy; it has a soothing effect on me, and it makes me think of looking out of the window on a rainy day, and seeing a beautiful mimosa tree in full bloom.
I really wish it were still widely available, it was a hard quest on ebay and so expensive, too. Why are the best fragrances discontinued?
Nice light scent . I liked it .

Ive had this, and would like to have it again. Lovely powdery frag, but not sweet, rather a floral, natural / nature, and botanical scent.
Different!! Unique!!
But - test before buying, definitely not everyone's cup of tea.
I have this. It doesn't suit me. It's 50% full. Does anyone want to trade?

Very nice yellow smell, ambered, comforting, sunny, whith a zest of almonds
I was my this summer parfume

I teach at a school near an important park, here, in Montevideo, Uruguay, South America. This is my favourite fragrance to enjoy in my long Spring Friday afternoon at school, particularly if it's not too hot, if temperature is around 20ºC. Nature, yellow flowers, comfort, calm... And my colleagues asking lots of questions about the fragrance I am wearing.

This fragrance came at my possession back on 2006 as a gift actually, without having the chance to try it before. It was really and apocalypses for me...
It is maybe the best "summer" fragrance I've ever wear. It happens almost every day people around to ask me "what is your perfume? you smell summer"!!!
I am start wearing it end of spring - early June once I am having my fist bathing at sea till early-mid September.
It is not a "common" odour actually, and for any negative comments I believe that has to do with the "chemistry" of the one who wears it.
I am so sad that this fragrance has been discontinued, and I bought two bottles from Amazon....I am gonna miss it and I already trying to find a similar one

i work with 100 people at my work and as soon as wore this perfume at least 40 of them(men & women),asked me about that!!!!!!!!!!!they told me that is fresh,clean,and smells like tan oil,soap and summer!!!after few weeks i could smell it EVERYWHERE...next time i'll keep my mouth shut... LOL!
Again, this was a gift...I do not like it much...But it is a good scent...reminds me of a sunny day out and about in the country side with warm florals all around you...

Beach,sand,yellow colour and sun tan oil!
These comes to my mind as a description of `Summer`!

So sad to discover that is no longer available BUT i found out that
Dsquared2 She Wood Golden Light is quite similar!

Hope that helps!

This perfume has the same effect all the kenzo perfumes have. For me it is smuthering. All I get is the powdery in it and I feel like my sinuses get blocked (but that is something that happens to me with all the powderies). That obscures whatever "floral sweetness" it might have underneath. It's a very soft and delicate fragrance though,if it weren't for the powder...

Subtle, summery and fun... it is a very good fragrance for day use... at night, it might not always match up! This one's a positive neutral, nothing that really stands out... but then we've had our share of overpowering perfumes which we don't like.

Its summer vacation, when i smelled it, on top notes i really like the orange (citrus) soft not too strong, natural its like you just walking around the beach and wear this kenzo.
Terrific!


i gave it 8/10

Having smelled this gorgeous summery floral-clean smell on a friend I decided to give it a try myself. Unfortunately it didn't work at all with my body chemistry, bringing out a very metallic floral unpleasant note. But for those of you who can wear it it's a lovely scent, kind of like having just showered with an old school shower cream like Camay.

This is so soft and cozy. Really a baby lotion like perfume, it´s stays very long on your skin. It reminds me of Zwitsal baby lotion but then with a spicy twist to it. I really love this one and think it´s a cute treasure Kenzo has made. I have finished my bottle and wouldn´t buy it again soon but maybe in a couple of years i will be missing this smell and buy another one.
discontinued??? oh no! I used to use this fragrance, and I wanted to go to get it again.. Are you sure that it's discontinued?

A lovely fragrance, but I would not call it an oriental floral - I think Kenzo Summer is a floral scent. Longlasting and wonderful. I love it. I don't like modern sweet parfum's but Kenzo Summer has an airy, fresh sweetnes , just so strong/sweet I can stand. The woodsy note in base softens down the sweetnes in a great way.

En underbar doft, men jag tycker inte att den är orientalisk blommig, utan Kenzo Summer är enbart blommig i mitt tycke. Hållbar på huden och superhärlig! Älskar den. Jag gillar inte moderna söta dofter men Kenzo Summer har en luftig fräsch sötma, precis så stark/söt som jag klarar av. Tränoten i basen dämpar sötman en aning på ett riktigt trevligt sätt.

I am doing this from memory and remembering this scent bought back memories of Avon topaze Kenzo is lighter and more floral and for me despite being lighter last on me for a very long time. Really lovely for anytime of year. I love the original kenzo but this one suits me so much more. Warm light and ahhh.

what a relaxing experience ! I would describe it as walking on a garden at the sun mixed with a hint of baby powder. when you first spray it smells like baby shampoo , but then the mimosa notes bloom and the other flowers mixed with musk I just love it ! It's soft, calm, great quality-sweet, flower-powdery. Even when the sillage and lasting power are not great Iam still buying a big bottle Iam gonna enjoy the magic softness of this fragrance until it last !

What a surprise I got this fragrance mini as a gift and really like it. Thanks RckChk. The initial notes are just stunning very soft almost like baby powder. Soft delicate, refreshing for the summer months. Smells like body lotion to me, clean out of the shower smell. The color of the bottle is just spot on. It a warm yellow fragrance the hugs you and holds you. As it dried down I could not help to see some similarities to BLV Notte. Sure enough they were created by the same nose Alberto Morillas only a year apart. Kenzo Summer is green in the opening, I really like the top notes on this one,much better than in BLV notte. So if you like Kenzo Summer you might want to give BLV Notte a try. They are not identical but share the same vibe.

I usually like heavier scents but this one got a hold on me. I've been familiar with it for quite some time, sniffing it whenever i got the chance but it wasn't until recently that finally got my hands on it. It's really soft,creamy and comfortable.It actually evokes memories of my childhood, playing at a sunny beach. At some point on my skin it almost smells a bit like plastic;not an artificial note of plastic rather a 'salty' smell of arm floats, sunscreen and swimsuit hungt out to dry. This scent is anything but boring or common.May be discreet but also playful,joyful and optimistic. It has personality but in a layback and quite relaxed way.It is memorable but not for those who want to make a statement. Sexy and appealing in it's own way the smell of sunny mimose will only make you feel better.

I used to adore this one and I'd finished a 40ml bottle in a very short time.
Tender, creamy and romantic, 'airy' and joyful.
I was searching it and intending to buy it again but I stopped searching after I got Champes Elysse.
Champes Elysee is on the same vain and bears strong similarities with Summer Kenzo (not the same perfume though), they both have a distinctive Mimosa note.
So, for those who want a little more affordable and easy to find alternative, Champes Elysee Guerlain would be fine (it's of outstanding quality anyway, maybe even better than Summer Kenzo).

If I could think of one emotion that this perfume evokes, it's undoubtedly HAPPINESS, with a capital H! This scent just makes you smile. I'm not sure if it's because of its simplicity or just thanks to its soapy/baby powdery goodness, either way, this is an endearing scent that makes you smell deliciously fresh, happy and content! Yep, this one is good all year round, for ALMOST every occasion [I personally wouldn't wear it on a very romantic date, only because it screams innocent, which doesn't always fit the mood ;-p]. Still, I love it and it's definitely a fave in my collection, that surprisingly doesn't smell like anything else I own, so in that sense, it's unique as well [which I love, 'cause who wants to double up on scents, right?].
I did want to add that on my skin this particular fragrance is much heavier than Clinique Happy and the staying power is a lot better, too! :-)

I initially bought this by mistake. I remembered my sister having a leaf-shaped Kenzo perfume and after asking her what colour it was, purchased ths one. I have now realised it was the green Kenzo Parfum d'Ete I should have got.

That aside, I thought I would like this anyway as I like Kenzo. However upon trying it, it smells very strongly of what I assume is the mimosa and possibly almond milk. It's also very powdery on my skin. I can't smell any citrus freshness at all or really any florals. After wearing it for an hour, I'm hoping it will die down later on. Not sure I could wear this for a full day!

I'm slightly disappointed after wanting the freshness of Parfum d'Ete.
Absolute disappointment...This smells awful on me. I was hoping it would smell like freesias. It doesn't.

So fresh and clean and so sensual at the same time - a real summertime Lolita. Fresh cut grass, sexy flowers and sugar all day long just from a couple of spritzes. Never thought a fresh fragrance could last so long and be so sexy at the same time...One of my favourites- Kenzo does it best!

I fell in love with this fragrance from the "first sniff". It is milky mimosa with violets, and with a very subtle tanginess.

Long lasting and quite strong, but, at the same time, sooo soft on the skin to the point of being a little powdery.
one of my favourite,love it

I fell in love with this scent at first smell... I tried it several times before buying it and had to have it. On my skin it is a very almondy mimosa and it lasts very very long. The drydown is creamy, which I like.I can't wear it in summer because it is too strong for me, but in winter it is a very comforting and warm fragrance...at work when the weather is cold or at home after work, when I need to feel cosy.It is supposed to be a summer fragrance though...
So not for everyday use for me, but delightful...

One of the best summer parfumes I've tried so far. I first tried it in middle of winter, yet it brought immediately comfortable memories of fresh summer sunrise. I would say it's floral fruity on my skin, not really oriental. It has long lasting power.

got a sample from mara_g, thank you so much and i really like it. the start is a bit skewiff to me...it's like a chameleon for the first 30 mins, the notes fighting for dominance between citrus, lily of the valley and jasmine. fortunately for me the jasmine didn't win on my skin :) it settled down first to lily of the valley, gorgeous and then the citrus, equally lovely. the overall feel to it though was grass...cut grass on a summers morning when there has been a really heavy dew. i don't get the freesia, almond milk or mimosa. fresh and lively but sadly quite short lived...about 4-5 hrs on me. and having looked around, it's impossible to get hold of. what a shame.

I had it some time ago and I love it!
It's not at all bitter or sour, it's rather feminine, mild and fresh.
one of my favourtite
I thought that this one was very close to the Yves Rocher Mimosa scent. I'm not the citrusy kind, so both were not my thing.
el perfume del verano lo amo es el mejor y fue el primer perfume que tuve un regalo de mis padres hace ya mas de 5 años lo amo

I get lots of daffodils and dandelions, which is unusual. The only other perfume I know about that features dandelions is CB I Hate Perfumes "I am a dandelion".
The citrus notes, shy flowers and the slight astringency (dandelion smell) that at least I get make this a perfect scent for spring. I like it a lot!
If you love this perfume, but would love it even more if it would be a bit stronger, go for Lalique Flora Bella! I love that one even more!
it's the best summer perfume!!!!! love it!!! i had a 50ml bottle last summer! i want it this summer again!! smells summer!! powdery and fresh in a special way!

This is a perfect clean just out of the shower feel scent, I love how it'ssolight but it stays on your skin for hours.I got so many compliment on this one.
just a lovely scent

I really love Kenzo summer. It is a perfume that gives you positive energy. Wearing this is a great way to start a day, especially before work. Makes you happy, feels like a garment of sunshine and mimosa on your skin and stays very long (more than a day for me) One advantage of this perfume is that it smells very clean and soapy so the result is fabulous if you spray it on your clothes. A minimal, clear-cut mimosa odor for people who prefer clean summer perfumes rather than heavy tones.

It was a gift!
The bottle has nice shape.
The scent is forgettable.
Mimosa I do not think so.
It is for shy little girls,
in my opinion,
not for grown ups.
this scent just makes me happy when I wear it. Lasts for many hours too..One of my top ten favourites.
This scent is wonderful, so light and different! It is balanced floral-scented bath. Glass is very exotic. I really need it!
i lOVE THIS!!!! this has to be an on going perchace its lovely clean fresh and girly Pretty summer scent One of my faveourites and i wish i could get another bottle :)
I love this...for me is mimose in a botlle and wearable in spring but in summer or winter too,very longlasting and I smell the same perfume for hours...not changes...beautifull!!!

This is incredibly soapy on me, although it's a mild fragrance. It reminds me of the pink, creamy liquid hand soap in our office restrooms. Strangely, I also detect a greenish lilac note, although it's not in the composition. Could this be the mimosa and violet?

Summer by Kenzo doesn't smell anything like any summer I have experienced. I WISH everyone smelt this good during a humid summer instead of like rancid sweat and soggy heat stroke.

This is incredibly soapy, I would even go so far as to say...bubble bath?? It is so beautiful and clean and fresh.

Personally it reminds me more of an early spring morning with pale sunlight, lounging on the lawn in jeans & a T-shirt, face bare of makeup, just being.

It is a grown up scent but youthful & comforting. I can see myself wearing it.

Soapy and light fragrance of mimosa and lemon. Between the perfumes with mimosa that I know, the mimosa note in this fragrance reminds me the real mimosa scent most of all. And the lemon note also smells nice.
I like this fragrance.

Summer reminds me the midday sun over my head, squeezing the plants that grow in all those rocky places near the beach and filling the air with their scents; only the wind or the night will calm this tension. I find Summer especially wonderful worn by a mature woman that retains her beauty naturally; I love when my mother wears it, it is touching and tender.

Entire story about Summer is contained in one word: mimose. Actually in two: mimose soap. I don`t know does this short description sound inviting or repulsive to your imagination. So I`ll add; Summer by Kenzo is Vivaldi`s Concerto in a minor, French Provence at the beginning of may, silk scarf around your neck and warmth of love in your heart. I advise wearing Summer for special occasions. I implore you give it a try.

For me testing Summer was accidental event. Falling in love with it was consequence.

Sour-ish citric notes at the start (especially if you smell straight from the bottle you might notice it), that quickly turn soft and soapy on skin, but also fresh, clean and summery.

Unobtrusive. Breezy. Unpretentious. Sunny.

hmm i had kenzo summer, well kenzo knows how to put a season in a bottle!
i wore it quite often during summer and the smell reminded me again of the great summer :-) a true gem, just like d'ete (original formula)!
very nice !!avey fresh clean scent, reminds me of soap , the mimosa note defines it, and makes it differ from alla others. perfect for summer !!!

I've tested quite a few Kenzo scents and found many of them to be just lovely. Some of them don't seem to suit my personality or my taste, but they always seem well-constructed and at least pleasant.

This one is an exception, in my opinion. I found its powdery florals to combine very oddly with something else - I don't know what exactly - that smells faintly of butter. Perhaps that is the almond milk, or the musk, or the combination. Whatever it is - and I am aware that the difficulty may be my own skin - it made Summer seem rancid and unpleasant.

I liked the green-and-fresh Kenzo Kenzo Parfum d'ete in the similar reclining green leaf bottle very much, and still more I liked the earlier 1993 Kenzo Parfum d'Ete in the upright frosted leaf bottle, with its lovely spring flowers. This one I'd be happy to forget.
I got this perfumn... long lasting which i love it... very powdery and soft...very unique... Good for summer

Natural scent, comforting and lovely.
The only thing I don't agree is its name. "Spring" suits better.

I like this perfume very much. It takes me away from my office to a sea side. I feel myself at a beach, drinking malibu and smelling the mimosa and jasmine flowers. It definitely reminds me summer but it is not a perfume for summer.
It is a fragrance to remind you summer in winter. Besides, it stays long.

i got this one for a gift.
its powdery n warm
overall its a good perfume

One of the best soapy & powdery scent. I feel no citrus in it though, mimosa, almond milk and musk is very dominant, but not sweet or overpowering, it is like a light breeze. Oriental-floral is the perfect cathegory for this smell but I don't understand why the name is "Summer" as I think it can be easily worn in winter because it has a kind of warm feeling like a cup of hot milk in the morning.
One of my favourite summer perfumes. It smells very clean and subtile on my skin. It reminds me of the smell of good quality soap, fact that I like and that makes me feel confortable all day long.

This is more floral than oriental on me. Since I am not into floral fragrances, I wasn't sure if I would like this one or not. But the drydown settles into a floral exotic scent on me. I don't think I will buy a bottle, but I can tell you that I will enjoy my mini until the last drop. Nice summer fragrance.

what a disappointment!I've tested kenzo parfum d'ete times and times on my skin and I should say this one has nothing in common with that lovely perfume.
it starts with really artificial,offensive notes that have nothing in common with "summer" or at least the later summer perfume.
after some minutes it smells like cream,something like Nivea or other hand and face cream.it's kinda warm and golden smelling.I mean if you don't know about the bottle you may think it's a gold perfume for cold weather.
at the base notes I get strongly cedar mixed with bitter almond and something sweet and spicy.
that's a pitty.that nice bottle deserved a better perfume which can be wore in summer.it's the worst perfume by kenzo.
I recived the pure perfume version as a gift when I was like 14. God I definatley loved it I can clearly remember it. It smells very light,delicate and fresh just like a field of flowers.
Smells like soap, I don't like it. It's too much mimose.

Soft and gentle, like a swan`s down.Among all the ingredients the violet definitely stands out.At first, it seemed like a lighter, more airy version of the Flower, but it does feel more clear, transparent - like a soul without secrets, wide-open and honest.If it is summer, it is the last that we see of it - end of August or even September, the sunsets are still fiery-red, but chilly, the air is starting to feel crispy, and the first yellow leaf is circling from a maple tree...Just the perfect time of the year to wrap your shoulders in this pale yellow pashmina.
The powdery note here is very prominent and the responsible one is mimosa - if you shake a cluster of flowers, the bright yellow dust falls, and that`s exactly how mimosa is weaved in this scent.
The drydown is fresh, a little soapy - very decent.
i tested in a boutique ...i like this perfume , is a little sweet and soft , warm , beautiful
It's full of joy and happiness! A very positive scent! Vy favourite mimosa;)

Floral scents are definitely not my cup of tea. And this smells of absolutely nothing but flowers -specially mimosa, which I normally like. I suffered a headache within minutes of trying it, it's way too heavy and overpowering.
Moreover, why did Kenzo called this fragrance "Summer"? There is nothing on it that could remind me of summer days (i.e., fruity or marine notes), but it does smell of spring flowers.

a powdery type perfume..

very nice to wearing after shower...huhu....

very non offensive fragrance.....

I like it but not fallin in love with this fragrance

A powdery type with soft musky feeling when I wear it....it's like after bath feeling.....

It's straight to musky notes nothing lemony on my skin
Such a fine and floral odor...!Soapy and fresh,tender and feminine.If you want to feel stylish,spontaneous and sexy in its innocent way,then Summer is your personality's bouquet!
For me it's not a summer fragrance. I wear it in the cold season.
The almond milk in this one is very prominent. It's a lovely warm smell and I wear it all year round. Very longlasting too!

I got it today and I am very uncertain if its a keeper. I decided to buy this only based on these reviews and and on the fact that I was attracted to the bottle. I also seems to enjoy Kenzo fragrances as they all seem to be unique and playful.
The fragrance really smelled as I would imagine. I expected (and wanted) a soapy/"lotiony" smell with a hint of sunshine and happy non-sharp sweet, yellow flowers. This one is for bedtime, summertime, miss summertime-in-wintertime moments.
The ONLY negative about this, is that late in the drydown I THINK I can smell something that reminds me of a house that I had to visit sometimes in my childhood that smelled really bad. Strange.

I got this from a friend and immediately liked it! Indeed it's soapy fresh but warm. When I smell this I picture myself on a beautiful beach: the feel of the sun on my face and warm sand under my feet, while I hear the sea in the distance... It's just only a little too sweet to be perfect, in my opinion.

i have receiced nothing but good impressions on this parfum.It relaxes me and it sends my mind miles away , in a greek island near the beach!I usually wear more spicy parfumes and this is a good break.
It is soapy, the smell of clean sheets having dried out in sunlight. It is one of my favourites for summer, but not for winter.
my good impression of Kenzo was ruined by this one, i have to say. the only drydown i got is about "soap" smell... awful!
It's very warm and perfect for the winter. It goes with a wool pullover.
A more muted version, reminiscent of the dust notes drifting through an old library. A more melancholic take on the original. Over time, a powdery base settles on the skin, lingering for many hours.

I can definitely appreciate this fragrance for what it is but if you expect something unique (like I did looking at the notes), you are setting yourself up for disappointment. Yet I also understand I'm not the target audience so that's on me.

It opens with really pretty, slightly cold and sharp iris. Sadly the ink note is too short-lived for me, quickly it turns into powdery flower scent and not much else. If you like inoffensive flower fragrances, you might enjoy this.

Ikebana Indigo has straight up shocked me, I really wasn't expecting to love it so much.
It starts off clean, reminding me of a boutique, just to turn into the most lipstick-y iris I've ever smelled lately. It's a bit overwhelming at first, but then a more acidic almost salty note of ink finds its way too, very simple and balanced.
Don't imagine a bright red lipstick, this is a dark, cold frosty purple made perfume.

This was so disappointing for me... I was very intrigued by the ink note and the simplicity but when I tested this in store it just smelled like the most common and boring cheap perfume marketed for teens. It doesn't smell bad it's just very boring and smells like a thousand other things I have smelled before. It's bright and has a bit of a punch, easy to wear in the morning and quite feminine. I was hoping for a cool, dark, emo scent reminiscent of a dark fairy in a rainy cold forrest - something like the vibe I get from Lolita Lempicka Le parfum but more modern and less sweet. So I'm quite sad I didn't find another treasure with that vibe.

Unlike the other reviewers the ink note is actually quite prominent to me. It's salty, slightly cold and smoky. I have never smelled an ink note before and like it! It gives an air of mystery and intrigue. I love Iris and thought that it would be more distinct but sadly I can only smell a blend of sweet florals not exactly just Iris. Considering how unique and interesting the ink note is I wish they had paired it with an equally as interesting floral accord. All in all I still like it :)
Very weak and smells like ink. Don’t like it

The best Iris perfume I have ever smelled so far. It is true it has similarities with Givenchy Irresistible Nude Velvet (which I also love) but it is much better because it has a mysterious smokiness surrounding it. Very feminine and mysterious. It's moderately strong and appropriate for any season but I love Iris, I could wear it anywhere, anytime and it will make me happy.
I fell in love with this perfume after I smelled my sample. I need this so so badly…the notes are intriguing, but I think they work very well together. I think I need to try more iris fragrances.

This made me think "if an android ballerina chose a perfume for herself, this would be it"—sheer and weightless, but also inky, mineral and cold. I smell printer ink (not squid ink), iris and vanilla. There is something high-tech and futuristic about it, yet I find it extremely wearable because it's so soft. I like it.
My mother dislikes it, she said is a bit sour and insipid (maybe that ink note), despite she cant stand vanilla scents, here was soft and not obstrusive, the only positive thing but... nothing more

My mom bought this for me in Greece. I am in love with it. It’s an inky mineral iris. The bottle is stunning. It’s simple and linear …but in not in a boring way. It also has some warmth to it (I am guessing from the vanilla which I don’t pick up specifically). It does have a tint of soft leathery sweetness. I am thrilled to have it in my collection…as an Iris lover this hits for me. Maybe because it was a gift I am biased, but this feels special to me.

The intial 15 seconds is alchol, pungent, powdery flowers (maybe the ink??). Within a few minutes, it grows into a sophisticated sweet, flowery perfume with a light salty note. Delicious and elegant 💙

i love the whole kenzo flower line so i was so excited to get this..........its nice but not what i was hoping for......and i dont mean that in a negative way......its just i was hoping for a stronger iris more powdery & a bit more vanilla..........i guess i was hoping for richer...........but instead its a nice light serene fragrance........and it blows me away how they can have "ink" as a note - cracks me up but they actually captured the "ink" essence in the beginning - u get an inky vibe - its actually nice - its not what my mind was thinking - i was thinking dark black smelly ink lol......its not that lol

u do get the iris but its subtle - nice & sweet...........and the vanilla dry down is very light - almost like theres no vanilla (almost) but the iris does shine here just in a shy way :)

overall nice easy scent.............still a flower fan !!!!

The smell similar to Givenchy Irresistible Nude Velvet, like my mom's old lipstick. Not a safe blind buy.

Rating: 0/10

Not the best, not the worst. The opening has nice iris, and I enjoy it very much. It smells like a burst of fruit and iris, which was a pleasant surprise. But as this dries down it becomes very musky, which I dislike. Maybe it's the interaction between the ink note and the vanilla, I'm not sure. This is not a bad scent, but it's not for me.

I'm so sad, that I don't like this one. It's not bad, but I really expected something much cooler and mineral from the way the bottle looks and how it's described. The ink and iris notes disappear almost instantly and you get left with a basic vanilla scent. Kind of boring. :/
This smells interesting. Fresh, cold, clean and nocturnal. I get a bit of powder but it is still clear. It’s also mature but in a good way. Really nice scent.

I really wanted to like this. As someone who’s neck-deep in perfumery and constantly chasing the weird, the daring, the unexpected—Kenzo Ikebana Indigo just didn’t cut it. It’s marketed with an intriguing promise: an ink note. But spoiler alert—it’s nowhere to be found. Not even a whisper. You could’ve told me this was just “floral,” and I wouldn’t question it.

The problem isn’t that it smells bad. It doesn’t. In fact, it’s perfectly pleasant. The performance is adequate—lasts a few hours, doesn’t offend, doesn’t cling too stubbornly either. But it’s so blended, so inoffensive, so safe, that it’s completely stripped of personality. Even the iris, which could’ve added depth or powder or coolness, is barely distinguishable. Just “floral,” with no character to pin it down.

Compared to Kenzo Homme Indigo—which, let’s be honest, is a showstopper with that sharp, inky marine punch and a mysterious abyssal drydown—this is a massive letdown. That scent feels like a journey through deep waters at night. This one feels like you sprayed on something from a duty-free shelf and forgot about it five minutes later.

To be fair, Ikebana Indigo might work for certain occasions. Running errands in spring? Office days when you don’t want your perfume to enter the room before you do? Sure. But if you’re someone who loves twisty, atmospheric, or unconventional scents, this will leave you cold.

Disappointing from a house that gave us something so bold and memorable with the men's version. This one just plays it way too safe.

The first kick is interesting. To me, it smells like a bouquet of dried flowers. And like a spilled ink. It quickly fades into a warm iris. A bit retro. The scent sits close and sadly disappears fast. A beautiful idea, shame it doesn’t quite hold.
@makinmagic1 it's available on Jomashop

As a lifelong Flower fan, and as a lover of iris, I simply had to try this. Does anybody know why it has such a limited availability? I had to resort to buying a tiny official sample on ebay. Is it simply because it's relatively new? I would love to have a small decant of this, as Indigo is quite beautiful. This ain't Iris Pallida or anything, but I do enjoy it. It opens with a mineral blast that quickly evolves into bitter iris mixed with sweet vanilla. And there is slightly sharp, curious inky note present from start deep into the drydown. For its entire lifetime it remains primarily iris, and only then vanilla. Longevity is so-so, which I'm ok with, silage is minimal, which makes it an acceptable work fragrance. Overall, quite an interesting creation.

This perfume is definitely not unique, but sure is charming and modest. It reminds me of a sunny spring or summer afternoon, a time for daydreaming and taking a nap. There is something truly peaceful, fresh, and comforting about it. The combination of iris and ink adds an expensive, classy feeling without being too heavy. This perfume is light, it feels as if you're not even wearing a fragrance; the scent simply floats around you.

This smells like an iris for the nighttime. It is inky for sure, it's a great combination.
There is a slight reminiscence of ELDO La Fin du Monde, but it is barely there - I would not put them in the Reminds me of category.
I'm wearing my sample and I really, really like it. It is FB-worthy for me.

Great iris interpretation, way different than the usual one.
If you struggle with iris scents, like myself, give this one a try, it feels very different than the norm.

I'd say that it feels clean, yet dark. More of a winter daytime scent for my standards. I also loved the mineral feel from the ink note.

Overall very pleasant.
Not for me. It smells stale to me.

The iris here is nothing like the powdery, creamy, or refined kind I love. It digs into the earth and releases a scent of… parsnip. A raw, rooty iris - exactly the kind I instinctively avoid. It speaks of torn-up roots, damp garden soil, when I prefer my iris dressed in silk, dusted with violet, or gently wrapped in musk.

In the background, a soft vanilla tries to sneak in, sweet, almost comforting. But it's too timid, too distant to balance out the aggressive vegetal note.

Such a pity, because the bottle deserved better. A composition as elegant as its case, that’s what I had hoped for.

For me, it’s a no.

To me the smell of this perfume is very mineral and soapy type. A clean girl perfume, after the shower. I don't know which notes give this clean athmosphere but I kinda like it!

It's a light scent to wear during the day or at home.

I only have a sample but would look forward to buy a 40ml one

Very comforting scent

The opening is EXACTLY like Dyptique's Fleur de Peu... It got me soooo excited because I'd love a more accesible version of FdP. It's magical!

That said, while still beautiful, the drydown of this one is kind of generic, not that different from other designer floral fragrances with a vanilla base, in my opinion. Compared to FdP, this is less musky / powdery and more fresh, like shampoo.

I like it but I hoped for something else.
Such a nostalgic and calming scent 😍 Little metalic at start, then vanilla join the party but its still very airy and light. Beautiful very natural iris. Perfect spring/summer scent

It gives me so much nostalgia!
Like I am in school classroom and smelling the ball pen ink which i accidentally broke...
How is it going to project in winter?

There is something in this that reminds me of my mom. Whenever we would go to the shopping mall on Friday she, and the atmosphere, smelled exactly like this perfume.
This is the wooden floor at Zara, the Sanrio store, sparkly purple lipgloss and whatever my mom was wearing in 1999. A bit of nostalgia and maternal love.

Just received a sample today. I want to love it - the notes looked promising and the text sounds intriguing. The "inky" smokiness lasts seconds in the opening and immediately fizzles out followed by an unremarkable sweetness that all sub par designer fragrances seem to have these days. The "iris" is again very thin and sweet smelling nothing buttery, nothing carroty, nothing powdery - nothing to indicate that it is iris, it could be any generic flower. Vanilla here is unremarkable - not even sure it is vanilla - more that it is just sweet. I get absolutely no sense of the color indigo from this. It's thin and has no backbone - nothing in the dry down that makes it unique - no leather, no smokiness no depth. Who wrote this drivel? The original Flower by Kenzo was such a delicate, yet intricately layered creation, this flanker is an insult to the original.
It smells like a furniture store. Interesting perfume.
I so want to try this but it is exclusive to The Perfume Shop in the UK and the one shop that has it had no tester ☹️
I’m in the US…. where can I buy this?

I love the entire Flower Ikebana line (Sakura and Mimosa were both so beautiful) and was highly intrigued by this latest flanker. Ink and iris? I’m not even usually a huge iris fan but I was intrigued.

This opens with a clean yet also earthy “orris root”-type iris that reminded me a lot of L’Iris by Santa Maria Novella. After a few seconds, the vanilla comes in to add a sweet background note but the iris does stay front and center. I can detect the slightest hint of that mineral “ink” note that gives this fragrance a warm, ambery quality, but it doesn’t play a huge role in the overall composition. To my nose, this is mainly an iris and vanilla fragrance.

It is definitely sweet, or at least sweeter than a “traditional” iris perfume due to the vanilla, but I wouldn’t consider this overly sweet as a previous reviewer indicated and it’s definitely nowhere near as sweet as Lancôme’s La Vie Est Belle to me. It’s interesting how we all interpret fragrances differently!

I smelled this perfume quickly.
If i can feel an interesting mineral aspect (représenting the ink) , it’s really too bad this « Iris Pallida » is very very sweet, almost sugary. It make me think at the iris in « la vie est belle », especially the « Iris absolu » one, even that i prefer this flanker over Ikebana a indigo.
I feel this perfume is a new try of the brand to touch an always larger audience, and it’s sad.
(Sorry for my English, thank you for your understanding)
How they extract parfum oil from ink?
CateCate, I saw that too and was wondering the same.

Ink….. that’s a first .

All so interesting 💙
CateCate I believe you are referring to Iris Pallida (Dalmatian or Sweet Iris). Iris Pallida is known for its silvery spathes in comparison to other Iris species.

What is “Iris Padilla”? Is “Padilla” correct!?

#Rubendiaz93 thanks for your kind explanation, though, to be honest, i know what iris paLLiDa is, that’s why I don’t understand why in both the ad pictures they wrote “padilla”🤷😉
This is summery without being lemony. I smell passion fruit, peony and grapefruit. Not a love, a like, but I have the feeling that this will grow in me.

People complain about not having a good office scent and then ignore this one. Wear this around people 1ho don't like big perfumes and you'll never whine about it again! It's nice and like a fresh garden rose.

I was browsing perfumes at the airport and had a whiff of this and was immediately struck by how much this smelt like the double delight roses growing in my mother's garden. It can't be a coincidence that the exact same rose features on the box. I eventually wondered back and bought it because the scent was so distinctive.
Same bottle than Jeu d'Amour !
Lasting power is poor on me but i think the scent is ok.
This is very floral fresh without being citrusy. it is soft, and not very last. nothing outstanding really. I dont feel anything while waering it. I bought as it is speacial edition at airport.

This is cute and nothing more...I find it quite generic. It's a true floral fruity composition. I see it more targeted to teenagers and girls in their early 20's, although older women can easily find it appealing as well.

There is a sharp acidic note that I can't exactly tell what it is, this note is present from the first blast and cling the whole time. It gave me a slight headache. My guess it's Lilac, as I'm not fan of this note. I had to run to wash it off...Not for me.

They have this at my local Ulta. It's cute. I get quite a bit of lilac from it at first but then in comes the cherry blossom, red currant & passion fruit. There's a definite romantic, rosy element in here too.
It's bright and floral-fruity. On me, passion fruit dominates in the drydown.
Unlisted rice note. Matcha & rice in the same vein as Arielle Shoshana's Sunday and Teo Cabanel's Je ne sais quoi. Light, cute, creamy, a bit soapy, part mochi, part tissues.
Smells fresh and earthy. Feels calm and balanced — like a peaceful moment in a cozy café.
ما اشم الماتشا او اي نوتة عشبية بس عطر مسك روزي عادي ونكرة
I really wanted to like this and to smell that creamy matcha and vanilla, but all I get is baby wipes, unfortunately.

I read the reviews of this and had such high expectations for a real matcha smell. Couldn’t find a tea smell at all, which is really sad because I regularly drink matcha. Top notes for me are baby powder and soap, maybe light coconut and rice. I can get the musk and vanilla. Maybe this is just what I smell on me, but I’m honestly disappointed because I like floral and fresh.
This collection never arrived in Brazil 😭

It smells very much like any aftershave, and the matcha underneath it. It's like powdered tea, coffee, cocoa, or something else that hasn't dissolved properly and is drowned at the bottom of the cup. so it is not heady or heavy powdery tea scent, a quite clean and fresh scent.

Tested this at the store and oh wow at first it really smells like matcha 😍 so yummy and lovely but not too gourmand but more to powdery and like a mochi. But after that it was okay, i wish the matcha smells last longer but the overall longevity is very weak. 2-3 hours. For the price it is quite expensive for the quality it offers. I would buy it if only they sell it in a small bottle bc i dont think its worth to buy a full bottle
if you're selling a bottle of this please hmu 😭

This is so good! I randomly sprayed it on test strip and at home I was keep smelling something really clean, slightly sweet (like a body lotion or luxury soap). It was this perfume. Next day I went again to test it on my skin. In the beginning it indeed smells bitter and powdery, like roasted matcha powder (or mate, I do not know how mate smells like). But in 10 minutes it slowly fades away and I can probably smell the rose, and musk. But they are very subtle. You can barely say it is rose or musk. Smells really clean! Usually me and my bf are very sensitive to perfumes, they are too strong for me most of the times, and it sickens me to keep smelling them all day on me. But this one, I could not stop smelling it, specially the dry down! I want a bottle :(

About longevity and sillage, not so great, around 3 hours on my skin, maybe more on clothing. Sillage is within arm length, inoffensive. But this is what I like in a perfume anyway.

I love this and feel fortunate I was able to get a bottle. What it smells like to me- powdery green tea that morphs into a white chocolate coated orange. I’m aware these notes aren’t listed but this is what I get from it every time and it’s delicious. It lasts on me about 8 hours but the sillage is very intimate.

This doesn’t smell like Replica Matcha, it’s more smell like you have a matcha rice cake at some Japanese Restaurant. More powdery on me normally I have vanilla base but this one is special.

Such a cute smell 8.5/10

Simply put, I love the smell but can't say the same about the performance.

It opens like delicate musky powdery matcha. After 10-15 mins rose and vanilla notes come through and it becomes more like green sweet and floral powder. This dream lasts about two hours and fades. Will say it again the smell is pretty but I do wish it was more long lasting.

In the Seoul airport and trying this on. The opening is pure rice, specifically the rice powder coating on the outside of a mochi….. as it develops the powdery rice settles down a bit and it becomes a lovely lightly sweet green tea mochi. It’s a kind of powdery that isn’t a baby powder or a vintage cosmetic powder— so interesting and unexpectedly nice. I just wish projection was just a little stronger; will have to wait to see irt longevity

So many surprises in this bottle! First of all, it's the first time I've tested a musky perfume that's NOT floral! I must admit I was pleasantly surprised... I thought I didn't appreciate musk, but it's when it's overdosed with white flowers that it becomes heady. This blend of musk - green tea - mate... It's the most beautiful musk I've ever smelled! Being a great lover of green tea, I didn't know what mate smelled like... now I do, and I've fallen for it. And that lovely vanilla sweetness combined with the musky green accord: a real treat. The whole thing is perfectly balanced, the result exceptional. I've never smelled anything like it! Hats off to Kenzo for this beautiful creation.

8.5/10

To me it smells not that much necessarily of matcha, but of green tea flavored mochi - a Japanese rice cake. There is that soft rice flour powdery feeling about it. I wouldn't compare it with other matcha perfumes, it seems a bit different. This line of Kenzo perfumes is lovely, very calming, relaxing, like a spa ritual, but I wish they were just a tad better on longevity and projection.

I so much wanted to like this - what can go wrong with a quality fragrance that smells of matcha-tea?

As I live in a small town with no opportunity to test fragrances that are not exactly "high-street", I took the plunge and bought the perfume blindly.

What can I say - all the listed notes are clearly discernible, but the very strong, very bitter powder note makes me sick to my stomach in an instant.
Pity!

This is quite a pretty fragrance. It has very low sillage, as stated by the users down below. However, I feel like if you're looking for a discreet floral tea fragrance that will feel refreshing in warmer weather, this will do.

I'm only at the 5-hour wear mark but Poudre Matcha is still easily perceptible. It's also going stronger than Hypnotic Poison EDT, which I had sprayed on my other wrist at the exact same time.

Green tea remains at the center of the fragrance during the majority of the wear, but as time goes by, it feels like it's getting more and more intertwined with the delicate, youthful rose. You can actually smell the roasted accord underneath it all, it's quite delicate.

As said earlier, I've been wearing this for 5 hours as of now--- I feel like the gentle & clean white musk is now peeping through, along with a reaaaally quiet yet naturally sweet vanilla. It's closer to the sweetness level of vanilla pods than of a gourmand vanilla (as in, vanilla extract for baking).

As pretty as this fragrance is, it's also quite simple and straight-forward. If you've tried & been wearing a myriad of green tea fragrances before, you may not be impressed by this. I love tea notes and as much as I love this fragrance, I would pick MM's Matcha Meditation anytime over Poudre Matcha. However, if I would be gifted PM, I would still enjoy it very much & appreciate the story it tells.

Edit: I'll backtrack a little bit... As much as I still prefer Matcha Meditation's more gourmand and uplifting approach, I feel like PM feels more and more special as the mate notes get quieter and leave room for the base notes to shine. They never completely disappear, the overall scent feels like more than a one-dimensional green tea fragrance. Still straight-forward, but not devoid of personality.

This one smelled really interesting from the cap, when I tried it on it was a nice scent, starting with a fresh opening that quickly mellowed into a creamy, soft herbal scent that on me smells like I had put on some expensive body lotion(with a hint of baby powder at times) . It doesn't seem to have a great sillage (will have to see about longevity since I'm writing this within the first 20 min or so after trying it on) it's a nice fragrance, I think it will make a great gift, inoffensive, not cloying, gives you that clean and well cared scent but I also think you can have the same effect with a scented body lotion or perhaps some other perfumes out there will smell similar for a more affordable price.

cosy yet artisinal perfume. opens with a lot more of the green/toasted facets before transitioning to a smooth vanilla-musk. this nutty green aspect lingers and prevents it from getting particularly sweet while the rose keeps things light & airy. does a great job at conjuring up the delicacy of japanese tea over a creamy base. performance is on the soft side so best to spray generously & use as more of a skin-scent. thanks to Mr Herault for another original yet wearable perfume!
matcha rice pudding that transforms into a clean skin scent……truly delightful !! I’m usually not into skin scents but this one is really good.

Nice fragrance. It’s fresh and soft. More feminine than masculine, in my opinion. More dusty than really powdery. Good for all seasons, inoffensive. A good choice if you want something clean and comforting. In a picture, it’s like a vintage soap bar.

This is currently on offer at Savers 12.99 for 50 ml.
Never heard of it before. Will pass due to lukewarm reviews.
Nothing wild in this scent. It's plain peony fragrance with a bit of fruits and woody notes. Later it becomes sharper so it is not my cup of tea.
Love it! So fresh and summery, without going overboard into the fruits departement. It has the loveliest Woody drydown that really lingers on skin. My summer and spring perfume this year!
This should have been called Kenzo Tame instead ;) Lots of not very well blended lemons, nothing exciting here....

I agree- it is a very safe fragrance. I would prefer wearing it at spring/summer times. At the very beginning it reminds me of Ferré Rose Princess Gianfranco Ferre, but then it is very much like Moschino Funny! Actually it smells like a fresh rose to me ( although there are no such notes). So it must be the peony note combine with the orange blossom. I bought it blind, as there was no tester and the price was good. It is a good one and i do not regret buying it. Will be using it now and during summer. I do not think it is a sharp one.
Got this one for Christmas. I'm not sure what to think. I like it but it's too strong (for me) somehow. It almost gives me a headache. I can smell the citrus..

I purchased this fragrance at Glasgow Int. Airport for £37, I've also seen it at Wrocław Airport (Poland).

It comes in a very nice box (tropical leaves print in fuchsia and indigo) but the bottle itself is a disappointment (plain and cheap-looking), so is the perfume itself. It opens with a fresh note that I identify as green tea and citruses (reminds me of The Vert by Yves Rocher that was released in the early 2000s) and dries down to a soft vanilla-musk combination. It has rather moderate staying power and minimal sillage.

Kenzo Wild will be a nice refreshing scent for hot summer days, however please bear in mind there is nothing 'wild' about it! Hence I believe you can find similar fragrances for a lower price or spend £37 on a better product.
A simple and elegant scent. One of my go to night perfume. Would put it in the same category as infusion d'iris, beautiful and calm perfume that makes you feel clean and put together.
I would love to date a man who smells like this. Kinda in love with this perfume. Simple yet comlicated and definetly lovely. Reminds me the freedom that born from the wisdom.

Wow... this is good. I got a sample long time ago, and today i sprayed it out curiosity. It was very dry, woody whiskey-like opening with a bit of fruity-flower sweetness in it. This got my attention. Over a time dry woodines dissapeared, and scent developed to beautiful sweet elegant scent. It reminds me a bit of Donna Born In Roma Intense and BARL 1. But in a soft version. I think I will purchase the whole bottle. It's simple and so memorable at the same time. Additionally there is no similarities with Crystal Noir as some people state. I ended up selling my bottle of Crystal Noir.

It smells like Magnolia and I like it even though I usually dislike orange blossom which becomes more detectable here after an hour or so. I bit powdery like the entire collection. Even Tonka is powdery at the drydown. I can't draw any parallels with BDK or Versace.


Dina_France (YouTube perfume reviews)

I love this perfume! I'm surprised, it's not at all the kind of perfume I'm usually attracted to. It is really unisex. From the first test it made me think of "Voile d'Ocre" by Yves Rocher and the evolution to "Crystal Noir"! If you like the latter, you will love this one! The longevity is weak though... I would say it's more of an EDT. But Oh my.. This scent is so intoxicating <3

8/10

This smells powdery, clean and woody. It is calm, but commands respect, if you know what i mean. It’s something i imagine a samurai wearing. It’s simple, but smells expensive and has personality. It’s a bit more masculine than unisex. It’s exotic and classic at the same time. It’s really worth trying.
Beautiful iris soliflora fragrance (though iris is not claimed).

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Ice pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: the smell is very pleasant actually, sweet yet piercing minty fresh, but the sillage and longevity are weak. 6/10.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Ice pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: a fresh touch of nature, mint in the country after a hot sauna mixed up with lime, a fresh scent but strong enough and very masculine

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Ice pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: I made a comments about romeo gigli man which to me although the notes are not similar but somehow the smell is quite like it! Since I'm wearing it in a tropical country, longevity tends to lose in about 2-3 hours then I have to repeat spraying it again. Yes it's simple, fresh yet so warm, it's something you really want to have it in your skin for a long time. I just wish this kind has an intense version, double the power. I could only get 50 ml bottle here, too bad.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Ice pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: it smells like freshly peeled tangerine with an icy edge to it!!! The scent is very refreshing and reinvigorating. Remember it's a LTD edition.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Ice pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: i live in argentina and i didnt heard about that fragance, i really wantto test t, because i love the le eau par kenzo frangances, i have l eau par kenzo indigo and l eau par kenzo.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Ice pour Homme Kenzo
review_content:
I don't know why it's called ICE. I don't feel it very refreshing. Actually, lime peel is the strongest note here and lasts throughout its development. Also, there's a peppermint hint that is pleasant. This combination is sweet and warm (not fresh to my senses) and makes this perfume work well as a unissex one. Think of a lime candy, not a mojito.

L'eau ICE isn't loud, though not as light as I would expect from something from Kenzo's l'eau line. I like to wear it on hot evenings, or cloudy hot days.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Ice pour Homme Kenzo
