review_content: Several minutes after put on my skin, I had that feeling about walking through an open yard, after the rain, with the sun just showing itself, birds singing and gentle winds bringing the smell of a specific flower which I can not remember the name right now ... so, I spray Rive Gauche pour Homme over it and fixed the problem :D. Well, it IS nice, but not on me. Yes, easily unisex, and in my opinion more to the feminine side.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Ice pour Homme Kenzo
review_content:
very refreshing, awakening; visionary astrogarden. Its snow vs. tropical breeze. I bout 9 bottles for goodluck before new year in Singapore.

its easily unisex

Green? No way. Very marginally at least. When ends a bit of.
This is very woody, white woods, medium spiced, sticky nectarine perfume.
Not far from J'ai Osé, Mystere, Vu de Lapidus. That era. A bit Femme also and Dalì. But the mentioned are full and fleshy, because of the flowers maybe. This has a carved out, a drilled smell.
Banana? yes a lot, but you notice this note only if you already know that is inside. You wont smell like a banana candy. Banana has many facet yellow flowery, fruity, rubbery.
Oakmoss? a lot wich make this perfume more chypre than oriental.
It is elegant. Sensual. African. Wierd. Fantasy. Magic.
Well, a bit vintage but... magnetic.
Yes make me think to a Princess mulatta of another planet into a Moebius comic.
I feel more carnation than clove. But can be, it has that pepper balsamic aura. And a bit leather/suede presence. It seems to have also a tiare ylang aldeydes shadow, and a patchouli tear, a pinch of metal powder..
King Kong is a deprecable name. But the scent can remind a remote jurassik island. A carnivorous flower. Bitter sweet.
an amazing fragrance, I've never smelled banana in it though. I wore it when it first came out and still have some unopened bottles which I want to sell. please message me if you're interested.

King Kong is a surprise in a sense of being much more conventional and classical-smelling than expected; instead of being pleasantly surprised with exotic elements (banana, cloves), for the first 10 minutes it is mostly showing its' powerful 80s chypre character to the point of becoming almost exactly bitter/green like marigold (if my sample wasn't labeled, I would have sworn I'm smelling vintage Montana Parfum de Peau). On the other hand, I did picked up some rubbery nuances in the background, even a delicate minty breeze... I suppose my sample came from an EdT splash bottle and some notes simply disappeared with time, or maybe King Kong and I are simply not a good match (I got more bananas of D&G Sicily, more exotics of Guy Laroche Clandestine). Still, this is a fine spicy-green chypre that won't disappoint fans of this genre.

I am very curious about this perfume, specially because of the banana note. I am not a big fan of bananas, but I love banana pie...

Maybe it will be better to wear this fragrance at Brazilian Carnival firstly.

Anyway, I think that it would be very funny to answer people in the streets who use to ask us a certain famous question: "What perfume are you wearing now?"...

I wonder if will they believe me when I say: "It´s King Kong!!"... lol...

Yes, I would buy a bottle.

Very good!
It make me think to Star Wars's Princess Leia into an alien oasis.

Certainly this is a perfume craziest I've ever felt. The word for it is "crazy."

It is vintage but very usable today, is shareable, men and women can use it.
Exotic, delicious!

I'll still remember with what perfume it looks and I come here to tell. At the exit we feel something like burnt rubber but this feature disappears quickly and then can feel cloves, roses and a pleasant tangle of spices. What perfume well done!

I have not read many bananas as I felt people referring to this note.

Well, anyway I'm very happy with this rarity!

Hi, I was (and I remain) a BiiiiiiiG fan of this perfume. However, haven't been able to find it for over 20 years. If someon knows wher to buy it nowadays, please let me know !
For those who wonder what it smells like, I would suggest to buy a home fragrance oil from "The Body Shop" named "sandalwood and ginger". The smell is pretty close to KK.

As soon as I sprayed it on, I was shocked; this is a very strong perfume! It was as if I'd ordered whiskey straight up. After a while it changed into a gentler scent. It's clear it's an old perfume; the scent is old-fashioned. I smelled the banana. The strong scent and the banana could be the reason why it's called King-Kong :-) It's not a wow-scent for me, but it's not bad either. It's different from anything I know, that's for sure.

Great! Thanks for adding my request! I also posted a thread on the forum before that asking people who are familiar with the fragrance how it smells like, so i will ask here once again: Is it good or bad and please share your reviews about this fragrance. Thanks!

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
"Indigo is connected with anxiety (tension and inner unrest) in psychology."

No. It's not. It's a healing phenomenon.

This is a very simple perfume. I think the name doesn't fit this perfume. Indigo as a phenomenon could have different components. Forest rainwater, green wheat, amber, soil scent, coal from burned wood, poppy and delicate fields flowers, aldehydes... Because indigo doesn't occur everywhere. It needs conditions.

No matter how much I love Kenzo Jungle, I love Indigo also but it's not a serious perfume. It's a simple, light, powdery scent suitable for daily wear, stays close to the skin and doesn't intrude. It's feminine and as I know hard to get. Which is a shame.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: I received the bottle of Indigo as a gift when a friend was moving to another country, she gave me what she had left. There was very little left in the bottle! I always kept it so it would never end. It's probably the cleanest, most ethereal scent, I almost feel the sound of whales when I smell it... mixed with elegant powders. Extremely inspiring, calming and to use all the time, both in summer and winter. It has some eternity in it. It is without a doubt, one of my favorite perfumes. It makes me feel elegant, clean, impeccable, infinite, and free. It inspires me to explore the unknown, and at the same time makes me feel enveloped in airs of delicacy and femininity.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: Well my heart is broken! I bought a full bottle of this about 6 years ago, insurance for when my small travel spray was gone. I knew the bottle had leaked a bit in transit but didn’t think much of it; I’d sprayed it a few times and it was fine. Today I opened the box to find the whole 3oz bottle had evaporated to empty! I only have a tiny bit in my travel and now see it’s listed as hard to find. I know none of us need to be encouraged to hoard our favorites, but…hold your loved ones tight! 😔

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: I blind bought that perfume (again) because it was cheap and I liked the color. Indigo ! I was not expecting much but it has grown on me. Indigo as a name really does fit that perfume. It's rather abstract. I can't really smell any of the notes listed above but really just a mix of everything. It has a powdery smell but not baby powder, not at all, more like expensive makeup powder. Dark and top quality natural makeup, if that makes sense. On first spray it has a reed smell just like the original L'eau Kenzo but that fades quickly. I don't really know how someone could dislike this on a woman. It's not invasive and rather soft. It's a really safe perfume and all year long worthy. I've worn it during under the burning sun and I'm sure it will be great during winter as well. It becomes a skin scent after 1-2 hour on me but the scent stayed on my clothes all day long. Overall another great perfume from years ago that feels different.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: This is like a sensual cashmere musk but enhanced with plum and tonka. It you absolutely hate musk, dont bother buying. If u like Narcisco Rodriguez more than likely this would be a safe blind buy. This is not a "musk" fragrance but closely resembles. More importantly, this is not a plum or tonka forward fragrance. But u def smell the notes. This will make u feel clean during a hot summer day, this will make u feel sexy naturally, this is a ur skin but better type fragrance.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: I don't agree with the main accords listened above. I smell a non sweet fragrance, floral and sort of acquatic. Very femenine.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
Hm.. I have a mixed feeling..

On my skin, it opened up with mostly bergamot splash

Two minutes later, powdery ylang ylang scent emerged, almost like baby lotion and spa scent having a hybrid baby.. but the baby kinda feel like an old lady, a clean freshly showered classy old grandma

Two hours later, still powdery... But sweeter with a hint of fruit waaaaay back, like in the tiniest corner of space.. hmm... I don't know how to explain it... The base notes kinda bring the whole hybrid experiment into something 'decent'

I think I like the dry down.. but, hmm..

Maybe I'll update my review after some trials

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
On me this smells like pure hand soap but in a soft and expensive way.
If you want to smell like you just stepped out of a long shower and applied an unscented body lotion - this is it!
It lasts all day and sits close to the skin.
I think most people would like this as it is quite inoffensive.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: On me, Indigo is a powdery ylang-ylang and tonka concoction. It's not all that sweet, instead it's a bit bitter and has a strong incensey quality to it. After a few hours, I start to get an aquatic note that breaks up the powderiness a little. It's a soft but dark scent, absolutely deserving of its name. Good sillage and lasting power as well. The opening has an off-putting sharp rubbery note, but thankfully it disappears as the scent settles.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: I loved this Kenzo L`Eau flanker. The scent was very fresh but not like all those soapy perfumes. I mainly smelled Tonka Beans and plum. Very good for the day. Unfortunately, I cannot find it any more, as that was the only `watery` fragrance that I liked.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: This smells so much like deoderant, Secret? It reminds me of Project Know, the little puberty class thing we had in middle school. I think that’s what it was called, I can’t remember, but we got little bags with our first deoderant in them and this smell brings that to mind. :) Not bad if you like the smell of the powder scented kind of deoderant, but not for me.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: I usually love fragrances with plum, especially in violet bottles. But this one is not catchy at all.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
I call this one plums in a powder. And I mean it in the nicest way.

Have been using original L'Eau Par for years in summer but this one has nothing in common with the original one - or yes, maybe one thing: both fragrances smell great.

Indigo is rather warm, comforting and quite sensual perfume for fall/winter. It's like covering yourselt with your favourite and coziest sweater that also looks good on you.

Not cloyingly sweet, gentle scent. Really well blended perfume.

I still have some juice left in my bottle and I'm glad I do as it was discontinued.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: Very unique. Indigo colour rafined into liquid and filled in bottle. I can smell mostly tonka and bergamot. Should be calming the mind but the efect of this scent - pleasant one, is exactly opposite, makes me restless.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: Sensual and mysterious , powdery in a niche, loukhoum way, enveloping, ambergris tone reminds me strongly of Ambergris Balmain ' s one, it is like a tender, but persistent veil of warm pastel colors of evening, so very attractive fragrance. I think it was underrated and not very well known for some reasons in times when was easily available, and not everyone will go for blind buy for money ppl ask for it, which is sad, this perfume deserves more love from public.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
The first L'Eau Par Kenzo appeared in 1996 for the female audience. The male version only came on the market in 1999. Currently, twenty years later, the line already has more than 20 different versions on the same theme. Eau Indigo versions hit the market in 2009.
The inspiration came from psychology, since Indigo was linked to anxiety and the intention was to create fragrances that could help in the process of relaxation, bringing peace and balance.

L'Eau Par Kenzo Eau Indigo Pour Femme usually deceives anyone who thinks that just because it has the name L'Eau, it will be another "boring water". Jokes aside, this perfume has nothing to do with a simple L’Eau. It is an exotic floral, which could have been launched as Noir, Nuit or any other type of nomenclature that reinforces nocturnal aspects.
Its composition includes notes of bergamot, mandarin and a touch of magnolia, in the head. In the body of the fragrance, a rich floral accord of Sambac jasmine, ylang-ylang essence and orange blossom (Azahar flower), on an almondy base with notes of tonka bean, ambergris and plum.

On the skin, the output is strong and weird, since the citrus nuances do not merge to the floral nuances in a perfect fit. It seems they made a layering of different perfumes and something went out of harmony. This initial phase makes the fragrance behave as unisex and, in a way, often scare many women.
On the other hand, this distinctive scent encourages us to find out what comes next. And the magic happens when the fragrance begins to gain a sweet and creamy side, rich in jasmine and, especially, in ylang-ylang, with small facets that are powdery and indolic, causing a contradictory feeling of repugnance and comfort.

With the passing of the hours, the projection diminishes a little and the perfume appears more comfortable and soft, thanks to the tonka bean. In this final phase, the plum note is divine and reminded me of the same nuance of plum that exists in a masculine scent of which I like very much: Lacoste Pour Homme.
L'Eau Par Kenzo Eau Indigo Pour Femme plays with the limits of gender and differs of the male version, which is much more refreshing. In fact, I do not think it is the ideal fragrance for hot days and I still risk saying that, perhaps, it has been little publicized in its concept, precisely for not delivering what it promises.

As I have never read reviews or comments on it, as I see about more powerful and sensual fragrances, it seems to me that there is a lack of knowledge and, especially, of interest from the female audience, maybe for thinking that it is another fresh fragrance from the house. But make no mistake! It is a fragrance with quality and behavior worthy of an Eau de Parfum, which fits well with autumn afternoons or cooler nights.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: I love it, its just the right fragrance for me.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: I do not feel any floral or citrus notes. I do feel notes of blue ink, plastic and Xerox. Very synthetic. Complete disappointment after Flower, Flower parfume and Kenzo by Kenzo, that i loved.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
Oh wow. I generous swap partner snuck this into the box she mailed me; I'd never heard of it before, but looking at the notes made me joyfully anticipate wearing. I like plum and tonka, and ylang ylang is growing on me as it seems to be a common note in some of my favorites.

Actually wearing this has been extremely enjoyable. But, I feel like what I smell is *not* what is listed! If I had to guess the notes without reading them, I'd say I smelled cumin--lightly sweaty and earthy--for the first 2 minutes and then this became a powdery heliotrope fragrance, quite comparable to White Soul or even to Kenzo's own Amour (which I adore).

This is definitely lightly powdery, and I find that ylang ylang can often bring the powder. If the plum is there, it is not what I normally smell as plum (eg, Rogue or Natori). As I write, it occurs to me that this is somewhat like Natori, but brighter. It also seems to have a light, powdery amber note.

I think my nose is reading the ambergris as cumin, as ambergris is an organic note that comes across like warm skin. I think the plum + ylang ylang must be crossing my wires and giving me the heliotrope I swear I smell. I also think it's possible I'm anosmic to some of this fragrance, as it really seems to ebb and flow on my skin; the initial application--after the cumin--seemed to disapear, until I smelled heliotrope, so it's entirely possible I'm smelling this in a single dimension vs the multi dimensions it was meant to convey.

All that said, it's lovely. It's sweet and soft, powdery and feminine, gentle and calming. I enjoy smelling it, and am so pleased to have been given it. Longevity (my quirky nose aside) seems to be about 3 hours, which is sadly short. Sillage was modest; no compliments, but I felt it was radiating nicely. I have a tiny, purse sized spray bottle, so I cannot comment on the bottle. I recommend this for fans of .... well, I'd say, for fans of Amour, White Soul, Natori and other powdery sweet fragrances.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
I get plummy tonka ambergris heaven with this one. It's richly evocative and can't quite put my finger on what it reminds me of. Powder accord is soft and not all that dominant on me but I have always believed powder smells can be a individuals own skin chemistry reaction
I love this unique beauty and am so thankful to a fantastic swapper that shared it with me

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: Indigo is a soft, modern, powdery, vanilla-musky type of scent in the same family as (but not identical to) Jaipur Saphir and Armani Lei. I've seen a few reviews comparing it to DK Cashmere Mist and although I can see why people make that comparison, that wouldn't be the first thing I'd compare it to. Indigo starts off with sort of a spicy citrus blast that seems like it might be veering into "masculine" territory, but after a few minutes it settles, and as it dries down it turns into a comforting powdery (but not baby-powdery), smooth, musky, vaguely vanillic (but not foody) skin scent. It's hard to detect individual notes, but I would swear this fragrance contains heliotrope, because there's almost a "fluffy" feeling to it. It's the fragrance equivalent of wearing your favorite silky underwear. It's easy to wear and it does not have strong sillage, so it would be suitable for situations where you can't wear a fragrance that makes a strong statement or projects. This would be perfect for wearing to the office, out to dinner, to the theater, etc. It's kind of a background noise sort of fragrance. It's not boring by any means, but it doesn't shout or demand attention.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: Love it!!! Very unique and sexy. Subtle, but long lasting. Zen in a bottle.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: This is my first Kenzo. I blind bought it online and was super excited to try it. The notes looked delectable, however, I was completely underwhelmed when I tried it. It's very pleasant..don't get me wrong..but what's most dissapointing is it's lack of projection. Not an exaggeration, I have to put my nose about an inch from my skin to smell it..and that's within ten mintues of spraying it. I've had it since last fall, so I've tried in two different seasons. I'm hoping the hot, summer air will do some kind of wonder for me so I'll hang onto it a bit longer. The other dissapointment for me is that I smell absolutely NO PLUM.Nada. I mostly smell ambergris ( which I LOVE) NOT AMBER......and Johnson's baby powder and something slightly almondy (like heliotrope which is not listed). NO fruit and maybe the tiniest hint of Jasmine and Ylang Ylang. The way this smells on me, I don't associate it with the color Indigo in any way,shape or form. If I had to rename it a different color, I'd go with: Perrywinkle.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: I'm puzzled. The listed notes outline a warm, balsamic, soft spicy perfume, yet my nose smells it completely different. Soft spicy yes, but I'd say this is a heavy musk fragrance, musk being the main note. I don't know what gives that unmistakably musky feeling to me as it's not listed here at all. I get zero sweetness from Indigo> no amber, no jasmine, and definitely no tonka. What I do get is bergamot, and the spiciness of plum and ylang-ylang. It's a nice fresh scent, but not outstanding unfortunately, even though it looks so promising going by the description. It's nice enough to wear.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: It is a sharp fragrance, at least on me. Not in a bad way, thou. I think, the mood and impression it leaves would suit someone energetic, sharp and minimalist. Not my kind, but very interesting one.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
Comforting elegance with a strong personality, I'd say. Not boastful, nor imposing. A distinctive perfume with a kind and warm heart, elegant and mysterious at the same time - which is rare.

A jewel among perfumes. They captured so well the essence of the indigo colour itself - can't think of a better name.

Keywords: midnight violets and fantasies, amber, musk, cashmere.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
This is delicious, tempting and aromatic. A little soapy but in a good way.
I find it mature, sophisticated and elegant, also kind of mysterious. It is an art in the perfume world, but it might not be suitable for everyday life. An extraordinary fragrance for sure.
Very strong, with huge sillage, I think one spray is perfectly enough.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
The first time when I saw the pyramid of L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo, I too thought that it was a heavy composition and was skeptical how it would fit as a flanker of L'Eau par Kenzo. However, after wearing it a few times, all the previous reviews make perfect sense.

Eau Indigo is powdery tonka bean all the way through, yet it has a crisp freshness keeping it transparent and clean. This particular texture reminds me of Kenzo Flower and Bvlgari Blv Notte, as all three seem to rely on a similar trick to bring out a discreet dynamisme.

The opening notes of bergamot gradually transitions into ylang-ylang, which adds a sensual feminine sweetness to the powdery tonka. Amber brings more warmth with time, but the whole scent always keeps its clean powdery nature.

I don't find it 'indigo' per se, probably because I don't detect much plum on me. But the dusky aura that Eau Indigo exudes, makes perfect match with the twilight. Eau Indigo, being primarily powdery, also smells quite different from the aquatic original L'Eau par Kenzo. However, both share a contemplative and calm quality, which makes them spiritually in the same family.

The sillage is moderate to soft, the longevity is at least 9 hours. Eau Indigo is introspective, yet its clean powderiness feels very cozy as well. I think it worths a sniff, especially to those who enjoy powdery fragrances.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
Thanks to 2746cstreet for my lovely decant. Also, amen on the "ambergris, as opposed to amber" sentiment. Ain't no amber up in here!

Indigo opens with the brisk saltiness of Eau des Merveilles on the front edge, quickly followed by the billowy, yet musky-powdery finish of tonka. What a sexy, yet understated combination of accords! I really don't find it sweet at all. Indigo is a true skin scent in every sense. It wears close to the skin, and it smells like clean skin that has been exposed to the open ocean and to the sand and dust of the dunes, and then to the clean white linens of a quaint beach house on the coast.

It's amazing how evocative Indigo is. It doesn't smell natural as in, "occurring in nature", but it does smell natural as in, after awhile I couldn't tell whether I was detecting Indigo, or just the natural scent of my own arm. I think I am going to have to buy this at some point. It's very comforting and pure. Longevity is average, wears as a skin scent.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
First let me say that this is an ambergris and not amber fragrance. Big difference, Fragrantica. Psh.
Because of this, I was afraid to try Indigo for a long time. I saw amber + plum and thought: SYRUP.
However, because I'm just crazy like that I went ahead and blind bought it when I came across an irresistible price on eBay.. and I'm glad I did.
This is powdery as hell. I love it. The opening has a strong, bitter bergamot that I rather like. It's assertive as bergamot should be. However, the dry down is a musky, dusky tonka scent with just a bit of plum and jasmine.
Definitely a "skin scent" in the sense that it's not uh, "perfumey" as they say. However, sillage is moderate and Indigo is quite long lasting.
I'm a big fan of musky/powdery/creamy scents and this is a major "like". Not quite a love yet.. it hasn't necessarily grabbed me, but I can see myself wearing this often.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
I reviewed this a year ago and I still adore it!!!! However today I was wearing Donna Karan's Cashmere Mist which I love but I find I get headaches from it. Anyhow I showered tonight before bed and sprayed with Kenzo instead and I find it reminds me of Cashmere Mist! A lot softer and woodier but similar and best of all NO HEADACHE!!!
I think I know which perfume I will choose tomorrow!!!

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: I love how light and fresh this fragrance is .. it's calming. I mostly use it at home .

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: I had hopes for this one, it sounded so lovely just from the name and there are many reviews about how grand it is. Unfortunately, not for me. I wish I smelled all the lovely things others speak of. The only thing I can say is that this scent does have a melancholy "blue' mood to my mind. It started off smelling very much like vintage fountain pen ink. Not a bad smell, but not anything I would want to wear. Then it developed into a generic grocery store 'clean' soap scent. I think there is also a clothes washing liquid that smells similar to this. This fragrance and my skin did not like one another. Since I got only ink and soap scents from it, this one is not for me.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: I bought Indigo at the Narita airport on New Year's Day, 2010. I believe I was in search of Balenciaga's Paris, but I tried this and immediately loved it. It forever reminds me of winter because it's soft and cozy; it smells like an ivory cashmere sweater against that cool blue-glow twilight of winter evenings. Powdery, musky, a little floral, but not overwhelming.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
Third bottle. Love L'eau par Indigo.. Love the Tonka, Plum and Amber mix. Its grown-up, deep, dark and sexy. No sugarsweet notes in this one and thats great! And Indigo stays all day/night, very longlasting on my skin.

Tredje flaskan. Älskar L'eau par Indigo. Älskar mixen av Tonka, Plommon och Amber. Den är vuxen, djup, mörk och sexig. Inga sockersöta doftnoter och det är bra! Indigo sitter hela dagen/kvällen, otroligt hållbar på min hud.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
I made yet another boo boo, bought it without testing it first. It smells just like Shalimar, to my nose!
NO more buying blind for me, I've learned my lesson.

I can understand how many women would love this scent, it's just not for me. I adore the clean, fresh fragrances and this one is just too sweet for me.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
Such an interesting scent, woodsy, but a clear woodsy, a bit in its own vibe, calm, almost an intellectual scent if I dare say!? hard to define almost, it is a bit similar to Ultraviolet by Paco rabanne although not as smooth, my only issue is at times it is more woodsy/smokey than I would like..depends
it makes me think of cloudy skies..
I do like its appeal, warm scent,a bit spicy, fresh, I agree in winter it will be a scent I wear a lot!!

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: This is for the unconventional, cool, calm, no-frills woman with a bit of mystery and who does things her own way. It’s a lovely, luminous scent. Fresh, floral, and slightly powdery but it’s the clean, lighter kind of powder, not the rich, heavy, exotic kind of powder. This was an impulse buy for me; one of the store assistants sprayed the perfume on my wrist, and I was pleasantly surprised by how good it smelled and so ended up buying a bottle. But precisely because it isn’t a heavy scent, it lasts only about 5-6 hours (morning to early afternoon), so you’ll have to bring a small refresher amount if you plan to stay out until evening or night.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: This to me is the ultimate fresh out of the shower scent. Its clean and soapy and reminds me a lot of an old-school Nivea cream from my childhood. Even though this is pour femme and they also have a pour homme in the same line, I feel men could easily get away with wearing this one also. This scent reminds me so much of my late grandfather who used to use a shaving cream from Nivea and the smell of it is very fresh in my memory still. Also, now that I think of it, reminds me of my Dove deodorant in the scent "powder". So to sum up Kenzo indigo is indeed first and foremost powdery but also clean and fresh. I can't really detect any plum or any of the individual notes for that matter and the sweetness of the scent also seems to escape me somehow. Despite that I find Kenzo indigo to be an overall pleasant scent that lingers and gives you a my skin but better feeling...or should I say my skin but cleaner :) For me personally though, will probably not be renewed once finished.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
This is fresh, smooth and powdery perfection! I know, I know - there is the sense that powdery means "old lady" which is really a condescending way to refer to grown-up and classic scents that are not fruity!
I get compliments galore when I wear this. Kenzo at its best!

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: I usually wear "jungle/elephant" but chanced on Eau Indigo and decided to buy it without ever having tested it (that's how much I trust Kenzo perfumes!). Excellent decision. This is a fantastic perfume, very feminine and sophisticated, heavy but not excessively so, with a touch of oriental mystery. Always reminds me of a very chic Frenchwoman when I wear it. Lasts very well on me (Kenzo always does). Beautiful. A new favourite.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
I love this perfume.
I started to sniff it at stores after buying Kenzo Amour which just may be my all time favourite perfume. This is a tricky perfume, does not smell very feminine in the bottle, nor at the first spray on skin. As it evolves it grows just sweet enough!!!<

I spend a fair amount of time at work pondering just how nice I smell when I have this on. This also reminds me a lot of Prada l`eau Ambree though this is a more feminine sweeter scent!

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: That's weard... The perfume is described like sweet and balmy, but on my skin it is very powdery, similar to Kenzo Flower but a bit more floral...

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
I love this one on paper or on someone elses wrist.
Not my own, because then it smells like cat piss.. too bad... :(

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: I love this scent. It smells very light but not to say you won't get any scent out of it. It smells like powder after a few minutes of spraying it. People often stop to ask me what perfume I'm using. Try it I promise you will be happy. It's fresh and almost makes you smell like a baby.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
Past 2 years I have become a plum-fan, amber-fan and Tonkabean-fan..And this Kenzo have it in a very nice mix and package. L'eau Par Indigo is warm, sexy and a bit "dark" on my skin. Just wonderful. works both day and night, a great scent. This is my second bottle and I love it.

Under de senaste 2 åren så har jag börjat älska Plommon-not, amber och tonkaböna i parfymer och Kenzo L'eau Par Indigo har en härlig mix av dessa, och snygg flaska. En varm, sexig och lite "mörk" doft på min hud, helt enkelt underbar. Funkar både dag och natt - suverän. Min andra flaska och jag älskar den.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: it's an okay scent, but nothing spectacular to write about.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: To me it smells like Nivea Creme with a hint of vanilla.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
wow..monster silage!
The juice is very complex. It starts out as a floral, then develops into a spicy-herby smell, and finally settles down into a powdery-soapy smell( i think that bergamot is responsible for musky soapiness I felt..) with a hint of both spice and flowers(think shower gel with spicy accords and florals)..
It's spicy and clean smelling at the same time. I personally wouldn't wear it, not being a fan of musk or bergamot, but I find it fascinating and unusual.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: it reminds me the body shop white musk. it's not something special. I cant smell any flowers,just amber and tonka bean but it is so long lasting

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: Picture on the box amazingly describes what you should await from this perfume. It feels like when the evening comes and the dark overcomes you. I really love this perfume, it´s something new, different and mysterious for me. I am so lucky that I´ve found Kenzo Indigo!

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: This is dreamy, soft and beautiful. I feel very relaxed when I wear this. I can smell tonka bean, amber and plum, but also soft musk and vanilla even thought they are not listed. Can be worn year round day and night but I might prefer this on summer and warm fall.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: in my indigo is exactly as I imagine that color in a sunset or a sunrise. It unfolds in a smooth, dusty, comfortable, especially this last and so creamy and balmy . A really lasting musk with soft and bright tangerine aroma (very subtle) while deep plum and flowers. Ilike it any season only you need be in the mood for Indigo :)

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
I love Flower by Kenzo and was wandering in a perfumery shop to discover something "similar" (which cannot be as Flower is unique for me). Well, L'Eau Indigo is a balmy, light amber scent. I think that the plum makes it lighter. After some minutes, you can feel the discreet jasmine. I would not compare it to Flower at all, but this Indigo caught my attention. I find it to be very discreet but noticeable perfume. The kind of scent that "stays in the air". For spring and summer, night or day... I think this will be one of my next purchase ;)

(FYI: Eau 2 from Kenzo is just great, but cannot find it on this site. Can be purchased in Europe, though. I recommend it to everyone who likes Kenzo.)

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: Perfect for warm spring. Not either day or night, it suits the best "afternoon".

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: I must start by saying that this perfume lasts FOREVER. It lasts and lasts ands last.. After all day at work, after a shower and in the morning next day - Its still there! Its actually pretty amazing. The perfume however, is very Kenzo, as someone mentioned. I only get a lot of tonkabean here, a powdery tonka combined with ylang ylang and a little bit plum. Put violets in this one and you'v got LouLou in your hands. I dont see any complexity in this scent, its just extreamly powdery, or powdery might not be the right word actually. Strong soap would fit better. Not in a bad way, I must say that I do like this perfume, but its not something very speciall to me since I just get A LOT of strong soap. A very long lasting soap I should add...

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: I bought this for my wife and we love it! You get very fleeting, almost insignificant citrusy top notes on first spray that last no more than 30 seconds, before they are overpowered by the most powdery smelling heart and basenotes I've ever smelt in a perfume. The powdery notes are very clean, flowery and mildly sweet - and also surprisingly potent and long lasting (it's an EDP), smelling almost exactly like Johnson's Baby Powder! I reckon the colour 'baby pink' matches the smell of the perfume far better than 'indigo'. Anyway, its overall character is indeed very soft, tranquil and ultra-feminine, and probably exclusively for daytime use. Great-looking bottle too, especially as I have the matching Indigo male fragrance:) Delightfully charming!!

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: I've never tried such a mystical fragance. Very, very nice :-)

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
Love this fragrance. On my skin, it starts of fresh with a strong burst of mandarines and bergamot, then for a while, the tonka beans are almost overpowering and then it settles into a gorgeous mix of smoke, vanilla and amber. I imagine a beach after sunset, with the sky colored purple and the sea a blueish tone, mixing into one at the horizon, creating a burst of indigo. I can see a bonfire, a couple with their toes in the sand, appearing as an interwined shadow from a distance.
It's worth a try, especially layered with a vanilla body spray. Just so delicious.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: it's like incense, night & sea.. and very very Kenzo.. it's bottle design like a sculpture.. gorgeous.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
As I have found with other Kenzo fragrances there is something artificial about Indigo, but I like it anyway.
I cannot detect any citrus here at all, just the amber and plum, followed short time later by the floral and tonka bean, which should be the other way around, but no matter, its lovely the way it is.
Its early autumn here, still sunny but getting chilly and Indigo really suits this climate, or spring, but it would be overpowering in summer heat I think.
I'm not sure it has the power, or projection to be a sexy night time scent, I'll keep it for daytime.
All in all I'm pleasantly surprised by Indigo.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: No offense to those who love this perfume so much, but on me it smells exactly like mosquito repellents!!

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
i choose a blind perfume. i'm looking for something new the other than floral or fruit.
first i smell i smell the bergamot, a little and just the tonka bean... (like a cigarette).. smell so different, that why the name is indigo.

unfort,it just 4/5 hours in my skin.. smell its gone.


7/10

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
An extremely comforting, soothing fragrance, I put it in one line with Lacoste Femme and Bulgari Petits et Mamans - I guess baby powder calms me down the best, because this is what I smell mostly and love in 3 fumes.
But I would by no means compare it to Blv Notte, which smells like wet diaper for me and is anything but comforting... although I agree that there are SOME aspects in common (powder and cleanness, mostly), the overall result and atmosphere they induce are different.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: only had this on for about half an hour but loving it so far. i can and can't see what others meant with their comparison to blv notte. it's blv notte daytime *lol. it's baby powder all the way and fortunately i bloody love that in a fragrance. blv notte is the sensual side of this; this is innocent feminity at it's best. no fruit, just clean. love it.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
I have it and I have to say I'm torn ;)
On the one hand, I like it: it's light, delicately powdery, feminine. On the other hand, there are times when I feel something masculine in Indigo and maybe it's the time plum comes out. I prefer Elephant when I need a masterpiece, and I prefer Indigo when I don't want to feel too tired of Kenzo Jungle Elephant - that sometimes happens.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: Me gusta esta fragancia,la siento suave,algo dulce,buena duración,deja en mi piel un aroma delicado y agradable. Creo que es mejor para épocas frías,pero en realidad puede usarse en cualquier estación del año...

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
I agree with Sherapop, it is very similar to Blv Notte by Bulgari...

The same sweet, dry, powdery trail, except it's spicy, somehow even bitter.
At times, I could smell something that reminded me of L'Eau pour Homme - a sharp, sour, almost aquatic note.

I am doubtful about this fragrance. I want to like it, but its sharpness is too striking against the soft tonka bean and plum. It's a bit bipolar!

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: Today I've bought this beautiful fragrance with a good discount. It is pleasant to me from beginning to end and I think this fragrance becomes my favourite because it is really beautiful, gentle, comfortable and unostentatious.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: I would recommended for day wear at work . It is nice and clean smell so that for sure won't annoying anybody. That's way i love this purfume !!

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
L'EAU PAR KENZO INDIGO POUR FEMME is a sultry oriental to my nose, especially in the early stages, when I'd swear there was incense or something along those lines here. I agree that the general atmosphere is indigo: the sky at midnight.

Upon initial application I was wondering why this was called "L'eau", and it didn't seem very Kenzoid to me either. However, INDIGO becomes more and more powdery as it dries down, eventually leaving behind a layer not unlike the famous FLOWER powder. I also find some overlaps here to BLV NOTTE.

I like INDIGO, and if I didn't already own BLV NOTTE, which covers some of the same olfactory territory, I might acquire a bottle. Definitely worth sniffing for those who appreciate oriental perfumes.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: at the first spray, I sniffed frehness, a bit thicker than original l'eau par, but then it smells powdery...just powdery. But kinda like it :)

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: This one is soo delicate, feminine, tender and innocent. It's a bit powdery, smells almost like a baby. It's good for any season. It's a very soft scent BUT I can still smell it after 34 hours on my hand.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
To me, the first the aroma I encounter is like refreshing zingy lemonade, then Indigo develops into a warm , sultry fragrance of slight tantalizing spices, violets (even though they are not in there)and hints of mild, sweet jasmine.
I love and adore Kenzo Jungle,(an aquired scent) but I am not a fan of the original L'Eau Par Kenzo (which is far too flowery for my loving) as I enjoy mystery, exotic and sensual aromas for day and evening.
Indigo is like a little slice of delicious sublime heaven to me. I had it arrive today,and I am in love with it. I will buy many more bottles, so I not run out of it... xox :)

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: I was expecting and hoping for something mysterious, and sensual when I saw this bottle on the shelf. What I found on my skin was not pleasant. I personally can't pick out any of the listed notes. At first spray it smelled like a powdery rose, and then it turned and I was left with a sort of menthol foot powder smell. Not my cup of tea.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: Testing this one today... nice siliage, not too little, not too much. Haven't figured out if I like the frag yet. Its drydown is very powdery,very violety (although that's not listed as a note) which I usually associate with an "old lady scent"-- like a drawer sachet. As others have said, nothing like the L' Eau par Kenzo. I think that this could be worn day or night.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
Indigo is silent, sleeping beauty. And indeed, reminiscent on indigo color. There might be several reasons for that; the plum, the ink texture of the notes, the cozy state this brings me to. Purple and soothing like lavender. Only not smelling like lavender. I couldn’t guess the notes, and from those listed here, I can assure you no bergamot came to my nose.

Indigo is, as someone mentioned, abstract perfume. It includes smooth white linen, dusty facial powder, silky body oil, resins of peace and comfort. To me it is much alike Givenchy Ange ou Demon Tendre. Find it perfect for spring, has nice quality and lasts for several hours. Recommend it!

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
It reminds "Kenzo", but I much prefer this one, although I don't like any of them. However, it is very femenine, that is, it expresses some very intimate aspects usually found in women, even mature ones, and not in men. I associate it with women's taste for little things; it is difficult to express, nothing specially atractive to men or related with them, but with most women's hability of being touching. The blend also reminds me the smell of some flowers produced by very primitive plants, like magnolia or paeonia; and makes me think of internal fluids, deep water beings...
I don't like this perfume because it is too mysterious and disturbing to me. "Kenzo" in my skin makes me feel dizzy.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
I quite liked it at first. I got plum mixed with something "beachy" (sand, sun lotion...).
It was light and airy and a little sweet.
20 minutes later, it started to smell rubbery on my skin. It reminded me of my old dolls, with a hint of jasmin.
I would have liked it without the rubber note.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: It has nothing common with the original leau par kenzo. Interesting, didn't decided yet if i love it

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
Tried this today and find it very extraordinary. When I smelled directly at the spot where I sprayed it on I didn't like it that much - very bitter and artificial. But the overall impression was very agreable, powdery and floral at the same time.
Will have to try some more times to decide whether to buy this or not.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
strange because is hard to identify the notes, minimal and abstract, floral to the femenine angle, spicy-powdery with the contrast to the soft-semi creamy line. sexy but very intimate.. shy but deep.

lovely, lovely, i want to smell this in that girl..

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: i tried this fragrance because it is new in my country, eventhough i'm not a fan of Kenzo perfumes and i have to say that this is a very unusual and strange perfume. somehow, i can't detect any note. it seems 100% synthetic to me. i agree with the reviews that claim that this is in the Kenzo style. it's not at all a feminine fragrance but it's not a masculine one either... it's just...strange.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
It is always exciting when a random fragrance catches my eye, because immediately I believe that it is fate, something beyond my control, that draws me in and urges me to love a new and unique scent.

Perhaps it was the beautiful purple coloured bottle that attracted me or the name of this fragrance that made me anxious to test this.

What hit me was a deep, sensual and unique scent which had been composed beautifully. The fruity top notes were subtle yet rich and sweet, with the slight presence of the plum note lingering underneath the fruits and the flowers. This scent is odd, but in a way that it makes you love this fragrance even more.

Eau Indigo transports me to some far off land, a tropical and fertile rainforest filled with luscious and rare fruits with clear, luminous starry skies.

When the tropical fruitiness passes, Eau Indigo softens into a powdery ylang ylang and jasmine blend. Strangely enough, as a child I owned a doll called 'Baby Born' which smelt exactly like this fragrance's drydown.

When I smell this fragrance, I can imagine wearing this at night and during colder months because it is so warm and mysterious. I dare to admit that I find this fragrance incredibly sexy.

Like Vertigo mentioned earlier, the colour indigo certainly matches this fragrance with its depth, mystery and darkness. I am eager to add this fragrance to my growing collection as it would add a different aspect and variety to what I already wear.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
I definitely like this one. Actually, it has all chances to become my favourite from Kenzo.

I find it difficult to detect the notes except for the base ones – amber and tonka bean, they give some certain depth. So, the perfume doesn’t resemble L'eau par Kenzo, neither cold nor so refreshing. In metaphorical sense I can compare it with “Green tea” ice-cream in the Japanese restaurant, it is not the most yummy but still an unusual and very attractive one (at least for me).

Besides, the main thing I bought into is its sensuality. Eau Indigo seems sensual to the extent Japanese perfumes could reach. (Let’s specify that Agent Provocateur and Narciso Rodriguez are from another planet).

To sum up my general definition for the perfume would be: Still waters run deep. It obviously leaves space to imagination: a flash of hidden sensuality during a day and elusive mystery at night. An air of detachment is getting along with a desire of giving vent to one's feelings. And the drydown whispers, whispers… Actually, I would not be surprised to find a new “Intense” version released soon. The volume of sound here seems to me like in Mark Jacobs Daisy or Armani Diamonds.

P.S. By the way, Indigo for men on my skin makes me think more of inner peace than the sensual aspect.

P.P.S. Today I tried it again in hot windless weather. Seems like it is loosing half of its charm under megapolis heat and revives only in the cool wind.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
This one was surprise, surprise! (In a bad way).
Smells on my skin just like Avon's Pur Blanca Blush! Only there's no lilac here.
The similarity is very disappointing me :D
At first it starts nice citrusy (only difference between those in Avon's I get lilac too) then jasmine with ylang-ylang that is creamy and reminds me of heart notes of Pur Blanca Blush. Dry-down is softer a bit sweet and close to skin. I find this fragrance very suitable for everyday and it has great lasting power. Only I think that I would be bored with this one. What a disappointment!

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
Yes.
The fragrance is deep, rich, smooth and a bit dusty. Still, very like Kenzo.

It really has an indygo colour to my nose, maybe because of the plum :)

I couldn't tell the specific notes, and the fragrance was too sultry for me, but it is interesting and unusual.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Eau Indigo pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
I just tried this one - I find it nice, deep, the fruity sweetness being dominant and it's not a citrus scent at all. It's the Tonka bean and Amber in the base notes which give the scent certain profoundity and mystery, I suppose.

What is more important - it has nothing to do with the original L'eau par Kenzo which I can't stand! Actually, eau Indigo consists of entirely different notes from the former.

However, objectively, I would recommend L'eau par Kenzo for day wear (if it is YOUR fragrance), and this one might be complementary to it by being used at night. :-)

product_name: Flower by Kenzo La Cologne Kenzo
review_content: This was a "suggested fragrance if you like...." when I was searching for fragrances that smell like my favorite scent Dolce & Gabbana Light Blue. This couldn't be further from that. To me, this has a musty powder odor that reminds me of the cheap drugstore scents or maybe the dollar store knock-off. My husband bought it for me from my wishlist, I tried it once and now it's sadly sitting on the dresser never to be worn. The bottle is lovely.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo La Cologne Kenzo
review_content: I avoided smelling this as thought it would just be a lighter version of Flower... how does it compare to Armani White, if anyone has compared the two?

product_name: Flower by Kenzo La Cologne Kenzo
review_content: PERFUME FRESCO E DELICIOSO, PENA QUE SAIU DE LINHA.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo La Cologne Kenzo
review_content: It's a perfect "mom's scent". So comfortable and light floral. Slight old-fashioned like the powedery florals from the past, but this version gives an fresh update for nowadays. When you first apply, the sillage is honest for a cologne, and after an hour it turns into a skin scent like you just got out of a cold shower and used a floral soap. Very refreshing if u wanna be slightly perfumed.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo La Cologne Kenzo
review_content: Realy reminds me of Light Blue by Dolce & Gabbana. Totally summer! Fresh and clean. Lemon/rose/musk.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo La Cologne Kenzo
review_content:
Opens green, fresh like cutting grass, trust me iam a rose hater but in this fragrance it really blends green incredibly, forget about the annoying plastic you get in the original
" Flower " this one is creamy, green, half cologne half parfum. I just love it ! I bought it blind and don't regret. For green scents lovers this is worth to give a try !

product_name: Flower by Kenzo La Cologne Kenzo
review_content: Got this tester from Nordstrom and what really stands out to me is the vanilla and white musk from the start. Add to that the peppering of citrus made for a very pleasant day wearing this at the office. I live in Arizona and still can smell it on me after a 8 hour day. It's very pretty, light, and feminine. I would buy it if I liked the base notes more.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo La Cologne Kenzo
review_content: Green, fresh and bitter sweet. Love it!!!

product_name: Flower by Kenzo La Cologne Kenzo
review_content:
Finally a Kenzo Flower that I can wear.
I cant bear the powdery smell that ALL Flower versions have. But this one is so subtle, so delicate.
The powdery here is something I can tolerate. Of course, you can smell and say that this is Flower by Kenzo, but in a much better way.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo La Cologne Kenzo
review_content:
As a Flower big fan, I couldn't resist to get the cologne version. But I was very surprised, because this and the original one are quite different.

First, I got an explosion of bergamot. Then, it turns into a green scent few seconds after. VERY green, and I feel like I'm smelling grass and plants in somewhere rural. I really didn't expected this, and I'm not a fan of green notes, but in the drydown, this cologne finally turns into something that remids of Flower.

If you dislike Flower, you don't need to worry. There are nothing powdery, no baby powder and no plastic feeling. In the drydown of La Cologne, I still getting a little bit of green notes, but there is a light sweetness of Flower, which is represented by vanilla.

So light, so refreshing, perfect for hot days, for sure. This is a cologne, so obviously it doesn't last long and the sillage is poor, but it is a good option to refresh you.

This is for those who like green and fresh scents. If you dislike the original Flower, you can also give it a try. La Cologne can make a surprise for you.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo La Cologne Kenzo
review_content: It's very creamy. I don't like regular Flower, this is better. I can't say I love it, but it's not bad. The bergamot and petitgrain makes it a bit fresher, but not citrus. I can hardly smell pepper. The predominant note is a (a little) bitter orange flower. It's not powdery. When the vanilla appears it becomes a looot better, a bit sweeter, nice, what a surprise. It's creamy all the way, but it has the same melancholic heart than Flower.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo La Cologne Kenzo
review_content:
I gave this a try pushed by a SA and didn't regret it.
Let me say I'm a total hater for regular Kenzo Flower. I just can't stand (plastic) Flower.
When SA approached me with this cologne I searched around with eyes for a way out. She caught me. She sprayed me and I didn't felt poisoned. Actually, after a few minutes La Cologne set nicely on my skin, immensely less harsh and intense than bigger sister. Nice scent indeed, very wearable even in warm weather, lightweight, sweet, only a hint of powder. I'm not crazy about, but I like it.

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: I do not like this at all. It smells bad to me, like algae and trash.

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
The old Kenzo edt issue was a very good fragrance that I will always have nostalgic moments associated with. When I tried the old stump for the first time, I experienced a wow effect. This bright coniferous-sea freshness was simply exciting. As for me, this new version is not very similar to the old release. Still , there are only echoes . There are fewer notes, and the components are more modern, such as calypson and synthetic sandalwood. The fragrance has become an absolute unisex, even more feminine.
Nevertheless, I still give him the highest grade. At least for curtsying towards the great classics. The fragrance is distinctive and stands out from the galaxy of similar modern care scents.

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
Kenzo EDT

The OG. What can I say? I've had the opportunity to smell the original OG, as opposed to this one. Quick plug that one is way better than this version.

While I must give this OG its props it is my least favorite in the line. It took a while for my nose to open up to it. It has its place among its peers but not as unique as its flankers.

KH EDT opens up with this slightly sweet sea breeze that almost comes across like baby wipes, and unfortunately, that smell lingers quite a while. Though salt and calypsone are mentioned it's not the notes that are detected. This smells in my opinion like Johnson’s Baby Lotion (Pink Bottle)

Price Point 10/10
Performance 8/10
Projection 7/10 (1-3 hrs of solid projection on skin)
Longevity 10/10 (8-9hrs)

Enjoy

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: I luckily recieved a legit bottle from Jomoshop; so I smell no cat piss whatsoever. It's unique, a little weird, fresh, and pleasant. It makes you stand out from all the other Ambroxide-heavy summer scents, with a mature, fresh, woody aroma that may or may not get you compliments, but it will make you feel classy.

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: I join the crowd. The cat piss is there somewhere, beware. This perfume is only good to attract old cat loving ladies. Even if you can like the lady, it would still be difficult to like the perfume.

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: regular fresh fragrance but with the notes of piss and old cucumber. who in their right mind would release this

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Smells like an old lady from the middle east.

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Oh man, this is indeed pretty awful! I have a couple of fragrances that give of hints of urine on an urinal cake, like the classics Boss No.1 and Giorgio for Men. With both fragrances it is the honey that is responsible for this association and with Boss No.1 that realisation is enough to mute the urinal cake association for the biggest part. With the Giorgio it is not enough (my bottle have had its final purpose as a toilet freshener). This Kenzo is worse than the Giorgio. The smell is very different, but the association with bodily fluid and urinal blocks is even stronger. No, I cannot recommend this fragrance. A pretty bottle though.

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
This smells like straight up urine. Freshly peed urine on a urinal cake. It’s like Oscar de la Renta Pour Luí and Cool Water had a baby and then peed all over it

What a rip off

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
I really wanted to say that Id enjoy Kenzo EDT as much as I had loved Quinton Bisches Masterpiece in Kenzo EDP but after 2 months of owning the EDT I can confidently say this is a solid "No" for me

Unfortunately the Floralzone musk used here has been used in dozens of cleaning and bathroom products, and on my very first spray I wasn't pleased over the fact that I smelt like a straight up urinal cake

I understand that this is the remake of the original but I'm willing to guess that most cleaning projects didn't smell like Kenzo homme when it first released.

After about 3 hours of drydown the bathroom Cleaning spray scent subsides and leaves a nice clean laundry smell behind

Uniqueness/memorability 4/10
Longevity 6/10
Silliage 5/10
Overall 5/10

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Has the Kenzo hairspray opening. Interesting clean scent after. Very similar if not identical to the original.

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: I didn’t get this fragrance at first and I was just going to sum it up to a bad purchase but guess what it smells better in the air than up close. It’s nothing really other than a clean watery perfume but as others have mentioned this thing is going to take on a different feeling in hot humid weather. I believe weather will make the smell more intense and interesting.

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
If you grew up in the 90’s you probably remember that scent , it used to be very popular back then.
This one, is an excellent upgrade to the smell and the bottle, the ‘sea water’ element in this been emphasized , and it’s got a very unique ocean like smell , it’s not something usual and not for every nose, but for those who can rock it, you’ll draw a lot of attention and compliments. Good performance for an EDT especially when sprayed on the clothes . Wear it on a summer evening to bring the ocean breeze with you

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Worst scent i’ve ever smelt , literally a rotten fish

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: I am utterly confused by this fragrance. If there’s one thing I smell the most with it, it’s flowers, specifically frangipani or plumeria, and I’m not sure if that specifically is what’s getting people hooked on this frag. It smells so much like a walk through a resort to me. The wood is a lovely backdrop to the brightness of the fragrance, and I can’t help but feel… relaxed with it on. It dries down much more ostensibly masculine and a little bit old fashioned, and the longevity is better than I expected. Quite nice!

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Is this one made by Bisch?

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
While I generally like this one as a complex green aquatic fragrance, that Calypsone note makes it kind of weird. That might be causing all the hate in the comments. If only this didn't have that, and instead had something else more uplifting like a ginger note or even a note of gin. I'm guessing the EDT Intense and Marine versions are superior to this, but haven't tried them yet. The EDP is in another category, as it's a leathery aquatic.

Update: Came back to this after a few months, and now feel that this does harken back to an earlier time. It does feel more vintage to my nose and memory than the initial testing I did. However, it's nowhere near as complex and masterful as the original from 1991. This is an attempt to do that, but falls short.

I don't understand the comments here saying this smells like urine? Like Kenzo, or any designer, would approve and release something that smells like piss? That's just the notes which Bisch is trying to get this to smell like the 1991 original, with a modern twist. People who know the original can see that. People who are comparing this to Invictus cannot. Unless your piss smells like pine-scented calypsone.

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
I think this fragrance is truly underrated. It offers a well-blended mix of woody, green, aquatic, and floral notes (but not in a feminine way). There are plenty of "blue" and "green" fragrances on the market, but the combination of woody, green, and sea-like scents is very unique. While some might call it "old," I prefer the term "vintage." Its performance is impressive, especially compared to many summer fragrances, which often lack sillage and longevity. It has a cool vibe, making it perfect for high heat. My girlfriend even commented, saying, "You smell so clean, like you just took a shower!"
perpect 10/10 frag

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
Try wearing it on the day following a rainy day. As others have said it really shines in certain atmospheric air conditions.
I learned from PDM Kalan that it's best to wear challenging fragrances when you have a busy day that keeps you occupied. At the end of the day you will have a better perspective between initial mid and dry down profile.

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
Sorry to say but.. this is like detergent for floor cleaner ✌🏻
Rate 5/10 ✨

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
Picked this up after hearing about it on the YouTubes and it’s ok so far.

My first impression during the opening was Rave Super Hold hair spray. My mom used this when I was a child and the opening really brought memories back. The dry down is better and I haven’t decided yet how I feel about it yet.

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
Smells like baby powder with marine notes, very soft and pleasant but not for me.

5/10

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
I'm not a hater but this is one of the very few that gets a hard no! To girlfriend and I both found it to smell like acetone.
(Think nail salon nail polish remover)

Returned it

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: it does smell classic and kinda between modern and vintage. right amount of saltiness and good longevity tho.

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
Floral, "Oriental," and aquatic.

Opens with aldehydes, very floral and green.
Airy, slightly marine like and earthy.
Quite musty from the off.
Waxy, soapy with a faint honeyed note.
Maybe some grassy notes, faint tobacco?
Then becomes "papery," possibly some iris?
Gets more soapy.
Has a note in the drydown that off my skin smells a bit like smoky bacon? (I don't mind it though.)
Smells a lot better in the air than directly off the skin.
Overall smells very natural and like a cross between a green house in a botanical garden and beach pebbles at low tide.

I feel this is unisex. Would work all year but more of a day scent.
Maybe slightly mature, ages 25+.

Performance is great; very powerful projection which lasts for hours. As a soapy, floral skin scent, it lasts 8hrs+

Would definitely try before you purchase, it's unique and has a throwback feel. It's also a little dour at times. Overall I like it though, smells like a Japanese spa, or Onsen.

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
Nostalgia in a bottle.

Kenzo Homme, the re-issue of the classic fragrance, immediately transports me back to the 1990s – a nostalgic journey for those who, like myself, experienced the original. It's a scent that invokes a strong sense of déjà vu, capturing the essence of its predecessor while introducing subtle yet noticeable differences.

Upon first encounter with the re-issued Kenzo Homme, I was pleasantly reminded of the original fragrance I cherished back in the day. There's a familiarity in its composition that echoes the past, yet it's not entirely the same. The current iteration seems to diverge slightly from the original's signature freshness and lightness. This newer version feels a bit softer, which could be a nod to modern fragrance trends or simply a reinterpretation of the classic scent.

Comparing scents separated by a span of 30 years is challenging, as memories of aromas tend to evolve over time. However, the re-issued Kenzo Homme still manages to evoke good feelings and memories. Stripping away the layers of nostalgia, the fragrance stands on its own merits. It skillfully blends marine notes with woody undertones, adding a hint of freshness that makes it particularly well-suited for warmer weather.

The scent is delicate and subtle, but has a noticeable presence, making it a fitting choice for someone who appreciates a balance between subtlety and character. It's especially appealing to those who enjoy a hint of retro vibes in their fragrance, as it skillfully bridges the past and present.

In summary, the re-issued Kenzo Homme is more than a mere replica of the original; it's a thoughtful reinterpretation that pays homage to its roots while adapting to contemporary sensibilities. It offers a delightful olfactory experience that appeals to both longtime fans of the original and newcomers seeking a scent with a blend of marine freshness, woody depth, and a touch of nostalgia. Furthermore, as Kenzo Homme won't be my daily go-to fragrance, it holds a special place in my collection. Its nostalgic charm and unique blend of scents make it a delightful addition for occasional wear. Therefore availability of a smaller 40 ml bottle is a thoughtful touch and just right for me.

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: ocean in a bottle. The difference between it and Kenzo pour homme is that it is a little sweeter. A unique scent.

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: smells like suncreen lotion and i almost gagged

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
This is very much like the OG 90s KENZO Pour Homme. I’d say like 90-95% the same….?!

I was hoping a more interesting version of that 90s KENZO Pour Homme with the Calypsone note, especially because I bought the ‘22 KENZO Homme EDT Intense first that I love. Kind of let me down because I don’t get the calypsone or any sweet fruity nuance that is listed.

So this is just almost 100% the same with that 90s KENZO Pour Homme. To make it sure, I even ordered a decant sample of 90s KENZO Pour Homme, and yes they smell identical.

That can be good for you guys who love that DNA, but for me, I’m not a big fan of that 90s KENZO Pour Homme. I tried and tried many times to like it but I just can’t.

So still, the EDT Intense is way better. Blue aquatic without being generic. Pleasant, without being boring.
Or, get the EDP version if you want a similar nuance with EDT Intense but much deeper, stronger, and denser to wear in the night.

Been keeping my eyes on the Marine version, but it’s still unavailable yet in where I live. Hopefully it won’t let me down like the EDT version did.

EDT 7/10
EDT Intense 9/10
EDP 9/10

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
I will forever love this one soooo much. This smells exactly like my dad (whom I lost 10 years ago), but it surely couldn’t be the one he wore. Then Kenzo Pour Homme crossed my mind, but I unfortunately couldn’t find it anywhere in store to smell. Later I found out, that this is in fact the original version, in a new bottle.

Since I'm fairly new to the perfume game, i can't really pinpoint notes and such, but i would describe it as a fresh, clean, and maybe aquatic scent, but with a unique twist towards the drydown. The twist being a sort of sour/citrus ish note, that i can't quite put my finger on.

Of course my review is biased, since it holds such a massive sentimental value for me, but i tried to keep my votes reasonable.

Longevity is okay, but i did wear it in the winter months with very cold weather, and now (8 hours in) it's a VERY subtle skinscent.

Sillage is also okay. You will not get noticed from across the room, but you'll get a compliment when hugged.

It's a more masculine than feminine fragrance.

FOR ME the price value is great! I got the 40Ml for like 45 EUR / 50 USD. If you can find it discounted, I'd def recommend but I can't promise that it fits everybody’s taste.

For me a 10/10
Objectively a 7-8/10

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: This version is quite lame compared to the first launched. No more Kenzo character found in this new version, just like another mass perfume

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
Thank you Lord my experience was on paper and not on my skin..I smelled raw eggs in the dry down !.. is there someone else like me ?.. of course not for me !..
3/10..

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: New version still has the same DNA as previous versions, but maybe a little bit modernized? I remember when few years ago I have been testing this fragrance and I remember that it was much more woody. Of course this new version is still very salty, marine, oceanic scent to the point it leaves a taste of salt in my mouth when I smell it. Deep blue waves are sill in my imagination, cold breeze is blowing on my face. I want to also mention three others from the series by Quentin Bisch. I think they are great, beautiful perfumes, but akigalawood is making me sick. I can’t stand personally DNA of his perfumes: Bois Imperial, new Kenzo Homme EDP, Intense, Marine, Ganymede etc. I don’t know how he created this accord, but for me it’s waaay too peppery and harsh. Nonetheless I think it’s a good thing that Kenzo is much more brave in launching original and good quality perfumes.

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Whoa! this is one laundry fresh clean scent ! If I never saw the notes and genre of this fragrance prior to blind buying this and somebody asked me to describe it I would say that's gotta be Floral (Aldehyde) dead set ! And its pretty obvious they've added synthtic floral and aldehyde notes in here. So to those considering blind buying this I wouldn't go by what the notes and genre are here, I definetely don't get Woody (Aquatic) or the notes listed for the matter, perhaps that was the intention or could even be the case the notes simply got lost and drowned out by all the other synthetics added in. Try before you buy with this one. It's a bit of a unisex frag too, so if your girlfriend is a bit of a clean freak she'll love it.

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: For 95% the same as I remember the original was some 30 years ago. Maybe just a bit sweeter and fresher. That having said, it’s still a very pleasant fresh option for spring and summerdays. Great sillage and longevity, just as the original, and very recognizable. Great new bottle also, but it resembles bamboo, while that’s not listed or recognizable.

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Smells like something I'm familiar with I just can't pinpoint it. I will say it's a big disappointment for me. Smells too feminine. Performance is meh. Can't recommend to even waste your time sampling it

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
So, I have not smelled the original.

But it's very interesting symphony of notes. Unfortunately, my grandma that is now long gone, had almost exactly the same smell as toilette freshner, so that is what came to my mind.

I have not read the notes before smelling, I just expected something oceanic. After 20 minutes of smelling I could start identifying notes. None of these are obvious or sticking out, but I first noticed that Ylang-Ylang is quite prominent after you identify it and faint Calypsone gives the perfume a hint of melon bubble-gum smell. After reading the notes, Yes the nutmeg is noticable in the notes and also woody notes that combine with the ylang ylang into very creamy woods.

The drydown is different. Fruity warm and inviting, featuring cozy and comforting peach-mango combination.

Now... I don't think I would actually wear it since it reminds me of what toilette freshner in the middle. However if you are interested in the notes I mentioned, definitely check this out, it's very interesting and unique among today's sea of blue fragrances.

Review context: Spring 19:00, 19°C, 86% humidity. (Amber Oud Bleu Edition on my other hand, might affect the character of the smell, but I didn't percieve it)

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
This one was very confusing. The ‘original’ and this one should be combined on Fragrantica, as I got in an argument with an EBay seller insisting they had sold me the wrong fragrance.
