For those wondering, It IS the original frag, but in a new bottle. This is according to Kenzo’s website. I had to do research to figure things out and BOY OH BOY did I eat crow with that EBay seller.
On to the fragrance.
It’s gorgeous! Fits in with Cool Water and Preferred Stock and Drakkar. Not that it smells like any of those, it smells like its own thing. But it has that 90’s aromatic/fougere vibe to it. I didn’t care for it at first spray, but that’s normal for me with older frags. It also doesn’t smell great when you smell directly from the skin. Smells best in wafts. Up close it VERY aftershave, which I still love. But in wafts, all of the harsh aftershave scent disappears and you just get a beautiful, fairly simple aquatic. I’m actually fascinated how it can smell like an entirely different fragrance when smelled at a distance. This, along with L’Eau Super Majeur D’Issey, is going to be one of my evening fragrances this summer! Concerts, bars, water parks, this is what I’ll be wearing! Already got a couple of compliments and I’ve only worn it twice! Not a safe blind buy, unless you like aftershave/barbershop styles! But I love it! And despite what many have said, I LOVE the new bottle design. I’m going to get the flankers in different sizes so I can have the art piece SET!

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: This is the original in a new bottle - and it still smells amazing!

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: This new bottle design is just ugly and very cheap. However, the fragrance itself is my absolute favorite fragrance and has been for over 20 years!

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: A bad imitation of the original. This one is harsh and even can be called powdery. Original was to take you to the sea shore.

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
Yummy. So fresh and thirst quenching if a fragrance could be that.

Watermelon, the sea, pine tree, ocean breeze etc.

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: I'm enjoying this one. It smells similar to Kenzo Pour Homme in the older bottle but this smells MUCH better. It's unique, a little weird, fresh, and pleasant. I am glad Kenzo decided to reimagine this one. It still holds its own in the plethora and diversity of fragrences today.

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
Kenzo's nomenclature has been extremely confusing lately, so: This is the original Kenzo pour Homme from 1991 in a new bottle. It probably has been reformulated a few times since its original release but it's still essentially the same fragrance.

Kenzo Homme Eau de Parfum (2016), Kenzo Homme Eau de Parfum (2022), and Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Intense (2021) are all very different and barely related.

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: The lightened version of Kenzo Homme INTENSE reduced by 30%, suitable for summer use, refreshing.

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Great! 5/5

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: I think this might be the original Kenzo Pour Homme in a new bottle? It really smells similar and has that green watery artsy vibe.

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: I have tried it three times, spraying it on my neck, wrist and paper stripe. I think this is only some joke... Actually there is no any character, it is like water only. Some strange tart-like scent can be felt very weakly at the first three minutes. Then everything disappears. My nose is not perfect, maybe a litle blunt, I can confess it. But neither my 11 year old daughters felt anything. And in the meantime the original Kenzo Homme EDT version is almost totally unavailable here in Hungary. I do not know what happens. I wonder what the other Kenzo fans will say about this fragrance.

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
done 100x before and better
4/10

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
This one is a regular version, but smooth and less woody. It has the same DNA as the regular Kenzo Homme.
It has nothing common with last year's edt intense.

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Tried it and didn t like... Reminds me of the original one... Not tested on a skin, so hard to tell anything about the longevity....

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
I wonder if this will be a less spicy and pickle-centric version of the recent 'intense'?
If it is I think I'd like it....a lot.....'Intense' was nice but was way too spicy and eventually gave a pickles vibe, which I hated.

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
This is just the original rebottled.

In their website: "KENZO HOMME Eau de Toilette, the original Eau de Toilette for men in a new design inspired by the freshness of sea sprays mingling with the green and woody scent of pine and sandalwood."

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: To the one who reviewed it as long lasting with strong sillage, where the hell have you even sampled it ?

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Michau, good question. I guess it wil not be discontinued because its a classic and probably their best seller till this day but this has the same name, indeed. And the piramid note is different so, i dont know what Kenzo are thinking with this release...

product_name: Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Does it mean original Kenzo pour homme is discontinued? I doubt LVMH will keep both "Kenzo pour homme EDT" and "Kenzo Homme EDT".

I wanted to like this one too but sadly I don't! Yes, you can make out the rose and the saffron, but mix it all in with the powdery old school kenzo vibes. That sounds good on paper but in reality the rose and the saffron notes aren't the plush notes you find in niche or arabic perfumery - the saffron is medicinal, the rose vegetal. It creates a medicinal, powdery, watery mess, not the arabic rose gourmand you might be used to based on seeing these notes. Probably not fair to compare the two but I can't help but feel dissapointed - there are simply too many amazing vanilla rose saffron perfumes out there at pretty much every price point. This smells rushed and dated.
This was the only perfume I packed for a trip to the UK in late summer/early autumn. I can't stress how lovely this was in the humid and sometimes warm, sometimes cool weather.

Comprei onde 50ml numa promoção por 150 reais, tem um toque da flor de laranja misturado com a rosa de kenzo, doce sinto a baunilha mas não exagerada, um forte toque ácido de especiaria provável o açafrão oq e bom! feminino e elegante, fixação e muito boa sim! Projeção também e boa.

Still as pungent and disgusting as I remember. Classic Flower DNA ruined by a sharp metallic odor somewhat similar to what they add to frags like Erba Pura. Very screechy and sinister. Powdery but not sweet. Not well-blended either. Old-fashioned but in a way that makes you want to forget, not reminisce.

این نسخه کوچکترین شباهتی به کنزو فلاور اولیه نداره.اگه همچون من به عشق اون سراغش میرین به شدت مایوستون میکنه.از این سبک عطرهای شیرین و تکراری و خسته کننده تو مایه های بلک اوپیوم ، لیبغ و....جیوانچی ل اینتردیت 🫤

Why do I get this clean soap vibe from this? Yes it’s floral, a little bit sweet but not overly sweet, but I get a soap, spicy rose scent. I don’t know where people smell the vanilla? Maybe a bit in the base just to soften but it’s certainly not a vanilla forward fragrance to me! The orange blossom gives that soap vibe I believe but it’s makes me confused why people voted vanilla as top accord. As I’d say floral is top accord followed by spicy then vanilla.
Such a gorgeous vanilla and definitely my favourite of the "flowers". My nose catches similarity with Poison Girl that I have, but I'd say this one is a lot more summer friendly.
It's nice and delicate. Not ground breaking... A clean floral scent.

There is something very intimate about this scent. To me, it feels like the more sensual, outgoing sister of the original Flower

In close contact, it's a true compliment magnet. The clean, almost clinical DNA of the original softens into something warmer, with a pillowy, natural skin scent and a subtle metallic tang that makes it enticing

Perfect for date nights!

In between Miss Dior Le Parfum and Frederic Malle Lipstick Rose 🌹
Powdered creamy sweet rose, a bit of Mancera Roses Vanille too. This isn't a floral perfume, this is definitely a vanilla, cosy type of scent. Very cuddly, I'd say perfect for autumn and cold weather.
A pretty, saffron flower scent. You can honestly get a better version of this at many Arab perfumeries. But this is still nice for what it is.

WITH MACERATED TESTER

Disappointed.
How is it possible to happen that beautiful scent can be saffron bomb?
When i tried with the brand new sample, rose and orange blossom were prominent and harmonized well. ( my Avis is in a below )
But with macération it became only saffron, then flower scent is seriously hard to detect.
It smells like grandma’s bedroom.

Very nostalgic scent, late 90s and early 00s… Fresh and spicy, yet powdery snd almost lipstick-y. Floral notes with a beautiful clean and soapy finish. It’s quite powerful but also sheer at the same time.
That's ok. It's extremely sweet and potent. I do much prefer the original Flower, this is worse imo. Performance is very good. This is very feminine.

If anyone is missing the beautiful Miss Dior 2017 you must try a sample of this. After the initial warm saffron opening (thankfully short lived) it has the same orange and rose combo going on as MD2017.
For me its suitable for any season, daytime wear. Its mature (not old fashioned) slightly sweet fruity floral. It has decent longevity and a soft projection.

WITH BRAND NEW SAMPLE NOT MACERATED

Rose is fresh and kinda metallic but harmonizing well with Orange blossom surprisingly.
It’s very beautiful, mature and inoffensive scent.

It's a very, very good perfume! If I wanted to buy a gift for a friend, this would be the one! It's absolutely a safe blind buy! It doesn't seem like something very complicated but it really smells gorgeous and rich!

I get the lighter version of Libre. It’s not new, Libre is better.
It’s nothing beyond a lot of fruity florals but it’s nicely done, well composed.
Safe for everything. To me it’s a little boring but pleasant.
Nice scent bubble. It’s very respectable if you want a work perfume and you want it traditionally feminine. It lasts a good 6 hrs on skin so longevity is very sound.
There are zillions of these types of fragrances because they are popular. It’s a decent one of those.
If you want more sultry just get Libre Le Parfum. If you want cheaper get Golden Decade summer by Zara.

Came across a tester in a shop that I normally do not visit. It's fruity, rosy with much vanilla there. Not fresh, it's on the heavy side. It's like Angel Nova but AN is a lot more woody as the oud is discernable there. Flower by Kenzo absolu is, however, just sweet and cheerful. It may relate to My Way or Sublime Epoque a bit more. Overall lovely but I may not go down this path for now. Definitely recommend if you are a floral or fruity person.

This is such an underrated scent. I personally did not realize how gorgeous it was until I started to use my bottle. It is a clean, mature scent with depth to it, as well as great sillage. It is not clean in an aldehydic sense, but still smells so clean to me.

This is THE love of my life :) I absolutely adore it and I am surprised to see such low reviews.
L´Absolue starts with slightly spicy opening, I guess that´s the shaffron talking. I can´t smell any roses nor flowers. Immediately after the opening I get clean, soft musk, which I keep smelling for the rest of the day from my skin and my clothes.
For me it is a comforting and romantic smell. I often use it when I am going to be in a stressful situation because for me it represents a calming blanket and I feel safe thanks to it.
Aquatic roses, smoky saffron, sweet incense. So unique.
Nice and very sweet rose.

Oof. On paper this is everything I should love, but it smells super funky :(
I wish I could pinpoint what exactly it reminds me of, I just know it smells unpleasant. Weirdly coppery, musty and synthetic.

I got this as a free sample when I ordered other samples and based on the notes I thought I might enjoy it. When I first sprayed it on, I actually really like the scent. It was sort of tropical and fruity almost? I couldn’t really discern any specific note but it definitely didn’t read very floral to me. My hopes were high at this point, and I wasn’t worried about a powdery dry down bc as a general rule I tend to enjoy powdery scents as long as they aren’t straight up baby powder. But within five minutes this had turned into an absolutely nauseating almost medicinal powdery scent. I tried to give it a chance but it was truly making me feel sick so I had to scrub it off. Based on what I smelled, the notes for the original Flower make more sense, but I double checked and I definitely had this version. Not too disappointed since I didn’t pick this out myself, but it is pretty rare that I scrub a scent off me or feel ill from it, and I think this will make me much more wary of scents labelled as powdery from now on.

From a male point of view :
Very nice floral, musky, slightly sweet fragrance. Opens up floral and dries down to a rosy, musky, slighly powdery vanilla fragrance. Elegant scent with a character. To my nose, this is a floral and lighter version of YSL Libre Intense.

Your type of perfume if you like the rosey ones, I love the vanilla-musk dry down too, favourite combo. The smell is not heavy but yet long lasting! Delicate, someone told me that I smell delicious 😂 suitable also in the summer ending.

Skin test, hot day.

This one 'comes and goes' on me.
Everything I've be picking up seems to be names amber floral in category lately...

Well, l'absolu fits into the warm, sweet, floral category for sure.
Its nothing to do with the original dry floral Flower.

Rounded, warm, spiced - but not like in food - light florals, though no literal flowery feel.
No fruit like in Kenzo amore .. there's a couple of tall bottles, black one and maybe a red one, they're something like Elixir etc...

So lately there's alien goddess, v&r fortune Elixir, Prada intense - though that's far more aromatic - anyway.. warm feeling.

parfum que je trouve assez générique, fruité, fleuri, un peu sucré, convient bien à tout âge, je ne le trouve pas vieux jeu, au contraire plutôt mass appeling, peut être acheté sans être forcément essayé avant

I received a sample of this with another purchase. I double checked now to make sure it's not the original Flower by Kenzo because it smells very old fashioned, most teachers in my school went for this scent profile in mid-late 2000s. My aunt also had a fragrance so similar to this that it takes me all the way back.
I have this thing with Alberto Morillas' works where I am repelled slash puzzled by the opening and as it settles I find the scent to be nice but they never really wow me. Flower L'Absolue doesn't evolve much on my skin, time passes but it stays the same as it was upon the initial spray, just a tad less spicy and citrusy, but still very sharp and screechy. In my opinion Morillas does more classic/mainstream types of frags like Daisy or Bright Crystal very well but something feels off with his bolder creations.
I'd move leather and metallic higher up in the accords since they stand out the most, making the scent really bitter and unpleasant. I suppose if it evolved more then those accords would degrade and be balanced out by the sweetness of vanilla but whatever it is that causes it to smell this way (saffron + musk?) is so abrasive from the beginning til the end that other notes don't get to shine at all. It has the same heaviness I pick up in L'Interdit but unlike that one, this scent doesn't come off as vulgar.

Very mature fragrance for a mature lady (although a mature lady that is my mom said it's awful and that I better wash it off, sigh) but a man could pull it off too, it's so very leather-y and leaves a cologne-like aroma in the trail.

I'm trying it out of a sample.
Love love love
Long lasting and sexy, feels more like a winter/fall type of fragance

Just another flankers every year, utilizing the success of the first Flower by Kenzo. This brand need to rejuvenate and do something daring like Kenzo Takada did in the past. The current team is just playing too safe re-launching new flankers, not sure they are really working. People are getting bored with your flankers
First sniff love, bought it right away, its so beautiful. I love it. Beautiful blend of al mentioned notes in a Kenzo specific style.

I looooooveeee this parfume. When I first try it at the store, I knew that I must take this home. For me and with Indonesia weather, this parfume makes me feel warms like a bouqet of flower hugging me... And the crazy part is, the smell of the parfume it remains still even after 2 weeks on my sweater.. It's a long lasting parfume and I love to wear it especially to an event... This is a mature woman parfume...

A very pleasant and delicate floral fragrance with saffron accents but I don't feel like I absolutely need this. I really liked the Elixir version for the gourmand route it took, and this one piqued my interest more than L'Absolue.

I’m currently exploring saffron perfumes as I’ve recently noticed how hooked they get me (YSL’s Libre Le Parfum) so I decided to revisit the new Absolue flanker.

Once again, it smells really pretty but I’m not thinking about it day and night. I don’t know why, but I feel like it lacks a little bit more contrast. Its evolution feels expected, there is no surprise--- it remains almost linear on my skin.

Also, I feel like it may smell a bit mature for some people so if you expect it to be on a fresher and more youthful side, you might be disappointed.

Shocking surprise, so good for the price and the bottle is stunning. Definitely fruity, I'd say an expensive take on Britney Spears' Fantasy but with grapefruit and actually good ingredients. Pretty good longevity and a refreshing must for summer.

Flower by Kenzo L'absolue is completely different than the Original Flower Kenzo. I love the Original, but I'm in love with this. This is a warm, sweet fruity/floral fragrance....... Some perfumes feel either too old or too young, but this can be enjoy by all age groups.

I have heard from many that Kenzo fragrances are very popular in France so I would avoid wear this while traveling there. Just don't want to smell like everyone else.

It tested the longevity & it lasted a few days on fabric.

I would group this with the same sweet Floral category of Giorgio Armani My Way (Floral, Intense), Si Passione (Intense), Givenchy Irresistible EDP......

It's absolutely Not the in the same citrus/detergent scent category like YSL Libre or Valentino Voce Viva.

I love it... I'm Indonesian and this parfume smells soooo good with our humidity. I can smell the safron and the rose. It felt warm and elegant. I don't feel like it has similarity with My Way, Libre, etc.... Maybe the humidity also affecting how this perfume smells...

Generic perfume, really similar if not identical to Voce Viva. In the same group of vanilla/fruity/white florals perfumes that are everywhere at the moment (Voce Viva, My Way etc.) To me it has no character, just boring okayish smelling scent.

I love the original. What happened with this flanker? I want a DNA-test! They don't even smell like they are related! This isn't a bad perfume, but you can't compare it with the timeless masterpiece I'm in love with. This modern scent needs its own name and its own bottle.

I'm confused with this one. This smells nothing like the original Flower by Kenzo. Unlike the original Flower, I don't find any personality or uniqueness in this EDP, To me, it smells like 90% of the generic floral/fruity sweet fragrances that are so popular right now. Although I have to admit that this one is somewhat pleasant, the rose and orange flower notes are well combined, and the vanilla notes are not candy-like (fortunately).The musky vanilla drydown reminds me of Dior's Hypnotic Poison. Decent sillage, but poor longevity. Overall, I'm not impressed.

I find this more beautiful and elegant than the mentioned L'Interdit, Voce Viva, Libre, My Way. This is much easier to wear. Those contain the orange blossom, but they smell screechy sometimes. Flower L'Absolu still has a bit of that original Flower DNA and it makes the composition more interesting, not summery, bright and flashy. It's quite a universal all year round perfume. Saffron is an excellent touch. I still think the original Flower is a much more unique creation, this doesn't have that at all, but it is pleasant to wear.

It's pretty but just another heavy white floral fragrance from the many in the market, it has nothing from the original Flower by Kenzo, but it's soooo similar (to don't say identical) to L'interdit, Voce Viva, Si Passione, Libre, My Way etc etc etc.
Nothing new, exciting or original, if you have any white floral scent in your collection already, you don't miss anything with this one.

Really loving that one ! It packs a punch at first, it s warm, with an underlying sweetness, and warm florals..usually Morillas creations tend to be pretty, but soft and a bit generic…not this one..it isn’t at all like the original Flower, this is less floral, less powdery, less dated, more sensuous too!
I am wearing it in summer, but I think winter is the best season for it…beautiful !!

I love Jeu d'Amour as a fresh floral daytime scent, I like Kenzo in general so I was very curious for the Jeu d'Amour flankers.

Félin is not what I expected. I don't think this belongs in a black bottle. It's not too similar to the original, but not a dark and sexy version either in my opinion.
I don't smell strawberry, more blueberry or maybe blackberry. There is the typical "dark fruity" accord mixed with some shampoo scent. In the beginning I can also sense the tuberose note from the original Jeu.
The base reveals a light, warm, nice patchouli and a clean musk component.
It's okay but to me the most boring of the Jeu d'Amour line.

I have Kenzo jeu d'amour elixir and like it a lot so I couldn't wait to try new member of the family
When first sprayed,I was immediately reminded of jeu d'amour elixir.similarity was so much that first I thought I'm trying that one instead of new felin flanker but it's black bottle ensured me
Their scents are as different as their bottles to my nose,same shape but different colors(not too different,both bottles have dark colors)
Kenzo jeu d'amour felin opens with caramelized berries,fruits aren't fresh or bright and seemed more like blackberry not strawberry.it even has the same creamy white floral heart but instead of vanilla,there's amber and patchouli here to give it heavier,warmer,more serious,deeper,darker and more grown up facets.a fall,winter/night scent.sexy and mature at the same time has a modern gourmand vibe.the first phase is almost syrupy sweet and heavy fruitchouli.nothing new but this type of perfumes are the trendy sexy scents of these days and I have to confess that I like it sometimes however I know that If I wear it on regular basis,I'm going to find it cloying.
As it dries down,syrupy sweetness of blackberry jam mellows and clean musk shows up.it's drydown reminds me the drydown of miss dior 2012, the same clean musk, tamed patchouli and gentle amber blend with different types of flowers here which still have a hint of berryish undertone. finally in drydown I can sense a hint of strawberry instead of sweet dark berries of the opening
It was my first test and I will edit as soon as I can give it a better try but even right now,I know that I like it
I sprayed it once on my hand five hours ago and I can't smell it anymore but it's not a weak and faint scent and projects well while it lasts
I can live without it but I may buy it as it's reasonably priced here

Unfortunately I don't like it very well.
There's definitely strawberry and pathcouli, I don't think they go together well.
Also, a weird tuberose note. And amber.
It's quite sweet and strong, nothing fresh about it.
Kind of heavy, it could be a winter scent in my opinion.

I got asked to test this fragrance, sadly I am a bit disappointed, for me it only smells citrusy/fresh, no sweetness to it. On me it also doesn't last long, I don't get that sexy mysterious feeling wit this one but more of a subtle and generic vibe. Defenately meant for young- mature adults but if you're into that stuff I'd go for this one!

Going Through International Airport, I tried this New Kenzo Fragrance, The first thing that entered my mind was WOW!!...Settling delicately on my skin, I could smell the sweetness of the fruit, lingering on, I could smell the rest of the delicious notes. As I was passed by other passengers, they too, could smell the delicious notes up in the air...Also commenting Wow...what is that scent..turning back and discovering the new scent...To me, the Fragrance is amazing, it warms up so beautiful onto my skin...lingering on, leaving a soft trail. Love it, very feminine...KENZO JEU d'AMOUR FELIN....YOU HAVE WON ME...
I cannot distinguish this from cheap air freshener. To me it is absolutely disgusting and sooo lame and generic.

Yet again, people have voted on the notes of a perfume before it's been released.

I understand that some lucky few may have the opportunity to test a fragrance before its official release date - but why vote on the notes, longevity or sillage without leaving a review?

Please - if you have tested a fragrance in this manner - leave a review and explain your opinion!

product_name: Flower by Kenzo L'Eau Originelle Kenzo
review_content:
Very delicious this perfume! It immediately sends the powerful Flower by Kenzo and that's good, because until today its predecessor has held the shuttlecock up there among countless launches that break through the market! Alberto Morilas is behind, that's enough! [laughs]...

Citric and very aquatic opening that shows luminosity, it also has a very calm Ginger water that joins with an aroma of new Pepper, freshly manipulated! I love its freshness with each movement, as it begins to announce a perfume from later on.

The perfume grows in such a way that it becomes the center of attention around! Here, in the drying process, there is a semi-cold Rose water, and more tropical fruits, highlighting the Green Apple with its reverberant bittersweet tone and another peony of Peony (I love this flower, this note so much), which denotes a rosy appearance, ventilated, punctuated in the fine and decided floral. There's a smell of flowers on the stalk here, too delicious all of it!

In the end, the bomb explodes, with a lot of Violet that gives a general powdery feel, but with the support of a bed of Musk that sensualizes and makes the fragrance hyper feminine! It fixes a lot and projects about 3 strokes perfectly; in small environments he dominates and does very well. Small and short sprays are the secret of its power!

product_name: Flower by Kenzo L'Eau Originelle Kenzo
review_content: Reminds me a lot of original Flower by Kenzo, but a little bit easier to wear. A little bit more airy, and not as heavy as original Flower. 1 spray goes a long way and I think its easy to overspray this one - and then it becomes heavy, thick and awful. Best in colder weather. Very nice to layer with musky or leather'y scents.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo L'Eau Originelle Kenzo
review_content:
Disclaimer: Aquatic and watery perfumes are not my cup of tea, so, please keep that in mind while reading this review.
I have tested this perfume from a sample in the form of a sachet.
The first thing that hit my nose was this unpleasant watery note, which is very prominent mixed with some spice and citrus. I hoped it might settle down to powdery florals and musk but that didn't happen the watery notes were strong even after 3 hours of wearing
I had to scrub it down with a vanilla soap to neutralize the sour notes.
I guess it's quite strong because I can still smell it on my arm, but after washing my arm it's mostly sharp musk with some flowers.
In general, it smells quite harsh and chemical that's why its a pass for me.
but if you are a fan of aquatic perfumes give it a try, you might like it.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo L'Eau Originelle Kenzo
review_content:
A good everyday, aquatic/floral scent for ASIAN ladies, because Kenzo was originally made for the Asian audience due to it's roots. Some people might blend well with it, but should be the types who actually traveled through Asia and love the scents of it's food and flowers.

Because of this, and if you're not Asian, then it may not be for you. If fact, most fragrances are not made for everyone out there.

You have to test a fragrance if it blends well with your natural body odor, which explains why some people don't like this one (maybe they have bad skin odors and try hard to cover it up with sweet scents?). If you're a girl who's always into sweet scents, then it might NOT be for you.

This Kenzo is a floral scent with a hint of ginger in the background, which is typical for Kenzo frags. If you like floral scents, it can be you're signature scent.

This doesn't scream at others or demands attention, but it's subtle as a young lady walks by others not trying so hard. In other words, it's NOT masculine in any way.


Age group: 21+
3-4 sprays max

Climate: Summer nights, Spring, Fall days
Sillage: 4 stars
Longevity: 4 stars
Versatility: 4.5 stars
Scent: 4 stars
Overall: 4.25 stars

product_name: Flower by Kenzo L'Eau Originelle Kenzo
review_content: I have no idea why people are saying it smells masculine because for me this opens with aquatic and sweet notes. What's interesting about this perfume is how much it changes on your skin and how long it stays. The original flower by kenzo smells more powdery whereas this one smells more juicy which smells stronger in humid weather. I love wearing it on a chilly windy fall day, maybe just one or two spritzs and it smells warm amazing throughout the day. It smells very floral with the hint of the original smell with a whiff of aquatic scents if that makes sense. Again, I have no idea why it smells so masculine to others but for me I feel pretty feminine when I wear this perfume.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo L'Eau Originelle Kenzo
review_content:
12. March 2016

I do not know if its me or the fragrance, but i have found it in shop on sale huge 100ml bottle for less than 40eur and almost did by, since i thought "originelle" should mean "back to its roots" and was hoping for the original formula (i still have some left from first release, so i thought i could use this one now). Boy am i glad that i have not only tested it on paper blot, on which it smelled ok, but also on my skin. It smells horrible on my skin and very few fragrances do so. It smells of a scent of metal in the very cold weather, you know, that tadte on metal, when you lick it in the cold. I guess its a combination of watery notes, musk and a lot of ginger flower. Do not be fooled by "originelle" it smells nothing like the original formula!!!! Horrendeous for tje first 30-40 min, it then becomes more flowery, but until that time all i smell is a metal. Not my type of smell at all, i better buy some other versions.

good lasting power though!

Please do not remove this comment, since others might find it useful. Not every review should be positive, so people like me wanted to make a blind buy might find it very informative. Thanks.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo L'Eau Originelle Kenzo
review_content:
Starts of like a watery version of the original Flower. Then not long after I was getting strong wafts of an aquatic floral. I couldn't believe how much this changed on my skin.

It kind of reminded me of cool water wave but not as sporty fresh. Another fragrance this reminds of, but I can't think of it's name. Not sure if it's the pink bottle one by Issey Mikaye.

Long lasting but not me.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo L'Eau Originelle Kenzo
review_content: Update. 24hrs later, I now really like the dry down scent that's left on my sample card - that always seems to happen :/ - but anyway the dry down has a fresh milkyness to it that more like the original red poppy version than the opening. It also reminds me a bit of Demeter Musk #7

product_name: Flower by Kenzo L'Eau Originelle Kenzo
review_content: It's so generic and blank. It's just a musky water and that's it. All be it, an oriental musk.. ...but the more I think about the white poppy that it's supposed to represent the more it grows on me. It's definitely a white, fragile and understated scent and I think it really suits the model/face of their ad..

product_name: Flower by Kenzo L'Eau Originelle Kenzo
review_content: Sampled this recently. Agree with others on its masculinity. I pictured a urinal cake instantly! Not for me!

product_name: Flower by Kenzo L'Eau Originelle Kenzo
review_content: Beautiful but masculine! would be an aamazing scent but for a guy...

product_name: Flower by Kenzo L'Eau Originelle Kenzo
review_content:
OK This is the one a originally smelled when "Flower" was first released.
I knew I remembered Aquatic & Sweet notes which must of been the peony. The new scent doesn't even come close to having one whiff of sweetness, to be it's Nauseatingly masculine. I've smelled many men's colognes that I would love wearing. The new flower is bland, neutral and Herbal Medicinal, like the stinkiest kind of herbs not the fragrat ones like Basil & Rosemarry

product_name: Flower by Kenzo L'Eau Originelle Kenzo
review_content: Wowza

La primera vez que lo olí me llamó la atención, no soy muy fan de los perfumes de Kenzo porque odio los aromas florales, sin embargo, este perfume es todo lo que llevaba buscando hace tiempo.
Lo compré a finales de agosto, con una temperatura de 35ºC en una zona húmeda. Es un olor dulce pero no empalagoso, es suave y delicado, pero no atalcado. Tiene una dulzura más frutal que floral, pero esa nota tan potente de mimosa es la que rebaja la posible pesadez que lleve este perfume. Es una fragancia fresca, ideal para el verano si no quieres renunciar o oler siempre dulce, e incluso adaptativa en los días más fríos. Es versátil, pero no milagrosa, no lo recomiendo en climas helados, no encaja con un ambiente gélido. En primera aún no lo he probado pero ya doy por sentado que será ideal. Al echarlo en mí puedo percibir notas frescas, casi rozando lo acuático sin recaer en lo salado y cítrico, es estar tumbada un día cálido de sol en un lecho de hierba y flores, con un vestido largo y holgado, que acompaña bien el calor con la brisa fresca. 100% lo volvería a comprar, es un olor del que no me canso.

The opening smells like fresh persimmon fruit/kaki fruit--it's earthy, fresh, slightly nutty, and slightly sweet. I have never smelled kaki fruit notes in any perfumes, so this one is really unique.

Sadly, it becomes more average after the opening. It develops into yellow flowers, and ends up aquatic and white floral--you know, the type of scent you smell in products labeled as "lotus" or "bluebell". This type of scent gives me a headache so it's a "no" for me. However, I don't mind smelling this perfume on others because it's so unique and elegant.
It’s very aquatic upon spray, but over time, I get Dewey mimosa. I thought I got plant stem in it, but maybe it’s kumquat and hinoki. It’s inoffensive and safe.

Based on the list of notes, I should have enjoyed this fragrance. Alas, nope. It’s too sweet and synthetic for my liking. As others have observed, the list of notes is certainly incomplete, because this scent contains loads of vanilla, and the sesame note gives it a gourmandish, rather than floral vibe. The mimosa note is not done too well, and it never manages to assert itself properly.

Light, happy, floral. I don't love yellow florals (or florals in general), but this is quite accessible. Kind of like Poeme-lite. The drydown is really quite nice. I'm shocked there is no vanilla in here. This simply smells like mimosa and vanilla to me. I can imagine there's tangelo in there as this smells quite fruity out of the cap, but the wood and sesame I don't detect. This is just a simple light, creamy mimosa scent. I'm enjoying it.

The powderiness in this perfume is not from mimosa, but from the sesame note which is stronger to my nose. The mimosa here is smooth and clean and not too fluffy/pollinated. I think I would get this more for the nutty note than the floral one, if I didn’t already have L’occcitane’s Melilot which has a similar scent profile.
Smells very fresh, I like it. I would put this on after a gym session and a shower and I needed to feel refreshed.

Such a unique and elegant scent--I've never smelled anything quite like her! I was a little apprehensive when I first bought her, as I hadn't had much experience with mimosa fragrances and didn't know what to expect, but she left an amazing first impression on me! I was so pleasantly surprised by how well her notes worked together and the overall complexity of the fragrance, I fell in love immediately! She had good longevity, around 6-7 hours for me (it depends per person, but I don't really need much more than that...if I need anything more I'll just apply it again!) with intimate to moderate silage. She's SO perfect and I really REALLY recommend her! I can't wait to be able to get my hands on her again!!!

This is an interesting perfume. At first I felt discrete sesame seeds notes, but then it evolved into something complex; the hidden mimosa comes out and becomes the star of the fragrance.
It's fresh, with no sweetness in it, more green, and... elegant.

Instant love! The mimosa took me back instantly to my childhood holidays in the south of France. Such a lovely, radiant, sunny mimosa scent, ideal for warm summer holidays or if you want to invoke the feeling of such a beautiful day. It's a definite yes from me!

The first in this line, Flower Ikebana Sakura, was an instant “love” for me and is completely unique in my fragrance collection, whereas this Mimosa flanker is just a “like.” (It was also, oddly, difficult to find here in the US despite being a new release…I ended up purchasing it on Fragrancebuy.) I feel like it is a bit less unique than Sakura.

That being said, Mimosa is still lovely. It’s floral like Sakura, but without the woodiness. Because of this, Mimosa comes off as a tad lighter, airier, and strictly a spring/summer fragrance. I get a bit of citrus at the top, which might be the kumquat? (I’m not sure what a kumquat smells like!) There’s some aquatic notes and a touch of powder in there too. It’s overall light, clean, elegant, and inoffensive. It’s perfectly office appropriate, and also good for casual daytime wear.

Beautiful, light mimosa with a powdery dry down. I get a hint of sesame, but not very much. I’d like more, as that savory aspect is really enjoyable to me. I imagine this would go well for someone, someone who doesn’t want to make a statement but to just smell nice.

First I was in love with it. Feminine and clean mimosa, very elegant and a bit powdery. I was a 100% sure that I'd buy the bottle. After a couple of hours, I noticed the powdery notes getting stronger and after 4h I was done with it. HEAVY powder, almost as heavy as Narciso Poudree. Had to scrub it because I started feeling nauseated and it was hard to breathe. I was left with fresh and somewhat sweet cucumber water after managing to get most of it out (a bit stuck to my hair which I didn't wash). I think you have to absolutely love powder for it to work for you, for me it was way too much.
This is easily the most beautiful mimoza rendition I have ever tried! It carries the DNA of the Kenzo's Flower line while being an elegant mimoza at the same time. BIG WIN for a blind purchase!

A luminous, warm, clean, and enveloping composition. Elegant and discreet. Floral-powdery, with powdery notes that are less pronounced than in the classic Flower. A fragrance that subtly wraps around, bringing comfort and soothing. A safe purchase for a classically elegant woman.

This is nice. It’s fresh, sweet and floral. It smells clean and a bit creamy. It’s a soft, peaceful fragrance. There is something a bit earthy too that gives it a nice touch. I think it’s pretty inoffensive. A good choice if you want something clean and safe and not citrusy for summer.

I normally don't like Mimosa in scents, and this seems to be the first exception. I really like this greenish, powdery Mimosa here, I can smell the other notes very clearly too, a zesty fresh, lighty sour kumquat and slighty roasted sesame...somehow the scent gets a very soft aquatic vibe in the drydown which gives it an airy, quality and makes the mimosa softer and lighter. This will be the first mimosa scent in my collectinon, bottle is beautiful too.

Winter skin test.
This one sits alot like the other Ikebana, quietly musky floral woody.
Wood isn't woody, and the must is very soft, it gives a slight powdery edge to this. The mimosa is wet floral.
This scent feels soft, rounded, slight powdery dry edge but remains .. creamy, it doesn't go wet wet floral.
Extra buttery mimosa, sweet and heavy. Pass.
I love mimosa fragrances, but not this one. It has that slightly powdery mimosa in the opening, but as it dries down some kind of aquatic cucumber note takes over (which I don’t like).
The worse out of the Flower line - than again, I don't like mimosa. This is fresh and blatant, not complex or original at all...for hard core mimosa lovers only..

This starts very much in the Flower family, and shortly after completely changes into A Drop d'Issey. I mean completely. I can't tell the difference between the two perfumes. No idea how, as the notes listed have nothing in common.
It has the OG DNA of Kenzo Flower, for my liking a bit too much, i wanted the yellow flower to shine more, they are there but in the background. Overall though it's fresh and pretty
when and where is this being sold?

Beautiful floral perfume, just like the previous Kenzo Ikebana. It is too floral for my taste but I still enjoy the sweet, well-blended, beautiful smell of the mimosa. Kenzo Ikebana Mimosa develops very nicely and the dry-down is even more enjoyable, leaving a pretty and long-lasting trail.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Summer Fragrance 2014 Kenzo
review_content: Lovely, soft and powdery yet great for summer. Makes me feel comfortable. Very similar to Flower Lumiere, though lumiere has top notes not drowning as much in powdery cloud. This summer version is very good, they immortalized it in the Flower Lumiere version it seems. I cannot truly name what I feel in this scent, only that it is creamy, powdery, good body balm like and very pleasant.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Summer Fragrance 2014 Kenzo
review_content: I got a very strong note of freesia and the musk with a bit of sweetness from the violet. Overall a very soft, dreamy perfume with a lovely tall bottle. It's not my favorite but it's a lovely floral perfume nonetheless.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Summer Fragrance 2014 Kenzo
review_content:
it opens with a hint of beautiful freesia and citrus. now and then the litchi and ginger pop out and the soft violet from middle note provides a feminine vibe but gosh this fragrance is all about musk! the white musk goes very strong on my skin. soapy, powdery, a bit aquatic, smells careless and dangerous at the same time! actually the dry down is somewhat salted which reminds me of the breeze on my face at the seaside.

sillage is moderate and lasting power is absurd for a summer scent(9 hours)! this is a very interesting fragrance, laid-back in an elegant way. it's perfect to wear it on a sultry summer night.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Aquadisiac pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: This came out a year after Artisan Blu and kind of gives the same impression, only as a LKPM flanker. An aquatic green floral giving the impression of “blue” (but not like your typical blue). Airy, light, and smooth as Cresp always does.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Aquadisiac pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: I am a woman and got sent this one by mistake instead of the female version. I tried it and ended up loving it. This perfume has a fresh, citrusy scent without being overly sweet - perfect for summer. Very unisex, leaning masculine. It lasts well above the average female perfume (about 4 hours) but if I compare it to my boyfriend's perfumes, it's a weak contender in the endurance game. It projects softly, no more than an arm around me, but people noticed it and complimented me. I will happily finish the bottle.

My favorite flanker of original Flower. Even went an extra mile and bought a back up bottle when I realized that it is disappearing from the shelves. The original Flower was too much, this one is non-offensive yet has the recognizable Kenzo Flower signature.
It was sticky!

I just don't care for this stuff at all. It was sent to me by accident instead of another one that I ordered, thankfully they took it back! Im sure it smells good on anyone but me. I always have that happen, I always smell something that I hate on myself and smell it on someone else and just love it. Its all in the chemistry! Perfume is a science indeed.
I love Kenzo's other smell,with that flower bottle shape.Than I tried this one,sutch a disapoining smell,realy not nice at all!

One of the worsts scents ever... sour sweat with a disgusting something. Where have those notes hidden? I really can't 'see' them. Summer.. ? Flower? Maybe 'dizzi nightmares' should be the name of this fragance if we can still call it so.

A funny thing is happening......against all odds I started finding myself LIKING a Kenzo Flower! No love, just a like...

The original Flower gave me a horrid headache - sweet, powdery violets on hyper-drive. This put me off wearing this Summer fragrance, until now....curiousity got the better of me.

This version is much less intense, it is soft & velvety, powdery & sweet but toned down in comparison.

At first I smell there is a strange sour-grassy smell which I often find with summer fragrances. Luckily this disappears after a while & the lychee & there is a scent-impression of a fuzzy peach & a glass of ginger beer - sweet, & juicy with a sour bite. The powdery violets are noticable, but not heady or cloying...there is still a wet, delicate fruitiness in this version.

This is a summer scent, so my hopes of finding some dark, daring incense were dashed....but there is a good depth in this mid-weight fragrance which stops it from turning into a flighty fruity-floral. As it mellows it warms, deepens & opens into a rich, velvety rosey-red flower smoothed by musk.

As soft as cat's paws, feminine, cute & sunny whilst managing to steer clear of being too girly-girly or twee. Good staying power & reasonable sillage. Dare I say it....this perfume is growing on me!

A warm scents, light version of kenzo flower a summer fragrance without alcohol in ingredients make this one is fresh, long lasting and not a dizzy type fragrance, if i have to choose, i love this than original one.

i think i love the scents from first spray until last note, a fresh fruit notes but has flowery characteristic too make this fragrance is very feminine but not overpowering, there no need to wait, from ist second till hours all layers are lovable :))

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Love L'Eau pour Homme Kenzo
review_content:
It's similar to the original but it has less mint note in its heart together with (more) lotus flower and green pepper.
The top note is surely yuzu with marine notes.
Base contains (I think) a little rose and lily water with a hint of musk (I haven't smelt any wood in it).
On the whole it's really romantic and projects better than the original.
I like very much this crystal clear harmony closed in a scent and I keep in my wardrobe always a bottle of this limited version :)

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Love L'Eau pour Homme Kenzo
review_content:
Last longer than the original! Smell still almost the same, stronger at the beginning!
This line is unique and one of my favourites of all time!

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Love L'Eau pour Homme Kenzo
review_content:
its unique,fresh,
no need much word, try it,,
hehe

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Mirror Edition pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: Starts off with little sweet melon with hint of mint then dries down to green notes. Not groundbreaking, but perfect for very hot weather. The mint is quite soft as compared to other mint infused fragrances in the market.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Mirror Edition pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: I tried this & all I smell is melon so I didn't wait for the drydown cause the melon smell make me sick.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Mirror Edition pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: Well I guess I'll be the first to review it. I got it in the mail last night. First thoughts upuon spraying - it smells EXACTLY like the John Frieda Frizz-Ease line. I got mostly raspberry and mint, and a hint of lily. It is nothing mind-blowing or unique, but a great scent for those hot summer days when you just want to throw on something refreshing and simple. It smells like a shampoo/body wash, like you just out of the shower. Fresh: and watery - perfect for hot, humid summer days.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Mirror Edition pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
I have a strong feeling this will smell like my all time guilty pleasure favourite that is Ralph Lauren Cool which I think bears some resemblance to the original L'Eau par Kenzo but is more youthful and fruitier like this flanker is supposed to be. Now all I have to do is wish and hope that this flanker will arrive in my country so I can try it out ASAP. I am really anticipating a substitute for RL Cool!
Edit: I am still waiting for the release in shops. I hope this is not a very limited release!

Edit: This has been released in Brazil, Russia, Germany and USA but why not the UK?!?! I am waiting!

From a floral lover
this rose fragrance has that kenzo dna but the scent itself is sweet rose with something airy in the drydown like freesia or maybe the magnolia although the musk isn’t noticeable to me its there i can see it but not too much
the opening is synthetic creamy raspberry and rose how does the raspberry snell creamy ? Idk when the fragrance settles a little it turns into rose and freesia with something creamy but not the gardenia creaminess another creaminess but fades right away when the base show off the fragrance turns into just rose and white musk

This is a fresh, bright red and deep pink fragrance. Juicy- and fruity- are words that come to mind. The scent profile is unique but simple- and when I first smelled this one around 2014, I had to have it. Kenzo's aesthetic is all about elegant simplicity, and this one feels like a youthful rendition of that- and an easy crowdpleaser.

Top notes are Raspberry and Pink Pepper. The raspberry & rose combination had me sold- and may be underneath that red, red, juicy topnote. It's strong and immediately recognizable as Flower in the Air. I definitely get the airy effect because of its fresh aesthetic. This effect fades after about an hour.

Pink pepper, to me, is not something I immediately smell as a stand-out feature- but after reading the notes- it's definitely there, but likely synthesizing with the other notes to create a musky base that throws the prominent features forward. Another way to put this: I owned about 4 pink pepper scents in my late teen years (before I knew anything about fragrance notes)- and was attracted to it as something that smelled a little complex, modern, and wild- like other basenotes- but still youthful and non-animalic. It was right up there with patchouli & amber for me for this effect. All of these scents had a peppery bite to them that was immediately noticeable. Flower in the Air (by comparison) has no bite- no wildness- and the pink pepper, to me, fades into the background and is muted by the rosy, raspberry juice.

Middle notes are Rose, Magnolia and Gardenia. I smell all of these on the 1-2 hour mark, and the sharp raspberry fades. Because of the synthesis of notes, magnolia & gardenia aren't stand-outs to me. I'm smelling all of them at once- and it's airy, fresh, floral, and red. This is a red garden rose, rather than a powdery, english rose. Flower in the air is spot-on. The effect I think of is shopping in the organic grocery on a Saturday morning. It's refined, feminine, and sophisticated- at once. Silleage is moderate- and this is one you can sense from arm's length- but won't leave a trail. When my body heats up, I can smell this one emanating from my chest for 2-3 hours.

Base note is White Musk. This one is a clean musk, and I can barely sense that it's there. It's shower fresh.

Overall: Flower in the Air is about a 3 hour wear for me- with arm's length silleage- and an incredible fragrance. It is a floral, fruity scent that works best during daytime in warm or hot months. I spray this one heavily after a shower on weekend mornings- and it's modern, inoffensive- unique. If you're looking for something striking or signature- you'll need a respray after 2-3 hours. A 7/10 for me.

it’s giving me rose, fresh fruits, followed with a little spicy from the pepper. this isn’t something i would choose if i have to pick one from the counter but i got this as a gift. i’m not a flower person but this is pretty tolerable hence the fruity notes. the longevity is insane on me, so this is a good fragrance i would apply on weddings and more formal garden-outdoor occasions.
A rosy and sweet scent dressed in one of the most beautiful bottles. Fruity opening but I smell the rose magnolia and gardenia too. A good buy, especially for the bottle.

This is a delicious fruity floral: red fruits, blooming flowers, a sprinkle of pungent pepper that gives an edge without overpowering the other notes.
The rose is modern, fresh and sweet. The powdery / soapy scent of the rose is subtle and perfectly balanced with an overall juicy / fruity vibe.

On my skin, I don't pick up a drastic evolution in this fragrance, as it actually comes across as really smooth.
The pepper transforms into the lemony notes of magnolia, the fruitiness lingers into the floral part.

Flower in the air is a feminine fragrance that brings joy, it's perfect for spring and autumn, office and school friendly.
A safe blind buy if you love juicy red fruity florals with an hint of spiciness.
Very aromatic kind of scent, but fresh and sirupy. Rose is really dominant, but raspberries give that sweet fruity vibe into the scent. There is also the strong musk undertone in the scent.

So far I have not found a fragrance from the house of Kenzo that I dislike, although not all of them are for me, all the ones I have tried feel attractive in their own way, in this one Alberto Morillas played with his beautiful Flower creation from the year 2000 and he brought us more than a flanker an oxygenated and crystalline version or "vision" of it, which although he remembers it does not have much resemblance to the besteller of the house.
"Flower in the air" as its name suggests is a more ethereal interpretation of the classic poppy (the house's insignia) that opens with juicy red rose petals, garnished with pink pepper and bathed in raspberry water (here the fruit does not feel red or very sweet, but rather with a pinkish tone, tangy with natural sweetness but at the same time a little synthetic)
Although this fragrance is delicate, its opening is powerful and the rose is felt from beginning to end, in the beginning playing with the raspberry notes and feeling a little soapy (very little) perhaps due to the pink pepper, and later with more floral tones due to the magnolia and gardenias present at the heart of this composition, the fragrance remains fairly linear throughout its life, only allowing glimpses of white flowers to be seen in the drydown with a background of white musk that adds layers and weight to the composition.
This fragrance is very happy and dynamic, perfect for daytime use and despite its fresh smell it performs quite well, projecting very well the first hour and a half lasting about 4 to 5 hours, I highly recommend it and apparently it is discontinued, so if you find a bottle do not miss the opportunity because I feel that even with several more sprays it will work perfectly also on slightly colder days.

Oh yes! This is a nice fragrance! Subtle, sophisticated, flowery mild elegant spicy. It reminds me of Guerlain complexity.
Love it. Light, clean, fresh, classy but young.

This is what Flower would be without its musky powdery violet and with fresh fruity top notes. Fresh, easygoing and quite youthful. It's a sweet floral, but not sweet in a gourmand way at all. More like a typical pink floral fruity. Strangely the raspberry and gardenia notes strongly remind me of the sweet pea and freesia accord used in My Burberry. I even get more freesia than raspberry, actually. So I totally can see why Flower In The Air is also compared to Miracle. It's not quite as sophisticated and classy as My Burberry, but it's a very pretty fresh rose nevertheless, and a great Spring-Summer fragrance.

A nice, inoffensive fragrance.
I personally think it's a bit of a stretch to claim "FITA" and the original "Flower" as similar. They are similar in the sense that they are both perfumes, and come from the same fragrance house, and are predominantly florals.
I adore "Flower". No question. It's bold. It's powerful. It's straight-up gorgeous. It just brings me so much joy.
"FITA" would be amazing if it was stronger - which I gather would be counterproductive to its name. It's meant to be airy and light, and it succeeds.
Very slight raspberry beginning with gentle peppery, rosy overtones.
It's the fragrance equivalent of meeting your idol, and realising they're actually human.

PERFUME HACK: I can't detect it on my skin, but I'm loving it on my clothes!

***

Kitty rating: 5/10.

EDIT: 04-10-2020: Okay, I have to admit; this is actually starting to grow on me a little. A LITTLE! There have been some mornings (always fairly early mornings, strangely) where I have felt *this* is the only perfume I want to spray in that moment. I like it. I do like it. It's still not a true (in my opinion) flanker of "Flower", but...it's kinda nice.

AMENDED Kitty rating: 6.5/10.

This is delicious rose syrup in a pretty bottle. I love it so much. It's floral, but unlike the typical floral scent- this is so delicious and creamy almost like it's edible, so yummy! I love it. It's not Britney Spears' fragrances kind of sweet, it's the sweet with depth, with delicate musk layered underneath. It's rich and yummy, honestly I can't stop sniffing my wrist after I spray this perfume on me lol

P.S. oh also can we just appreciate how BEAUTIFUL this bottle is, like darn it I'll admit I blind bought it just for the bottle before discovering the beauty within.

On first spray I get melon and rose even though melon is not a note after the melon dries down I get rose and a hint of a white floral but mainly rose, this smells nothing like the OG Flower but it's still a beautiful scent that I will try to keep in my collection

a nice quiet perfume.........soft & sweet...........i would call this a shy rose scent :) its not in your face bold & its not sharp like some rose scents can be........its rather soft & delicate with a touch of sweetness :) i dont get musk on me but that could just be me lol

very easy to wear.........not super original but if ur looking for a delicate feminine rose scent thats easy to wear check this out :) and the bottle is super cute !!!!

I saw this perfume on my mum’s dresser and used it this morning. The smell changed and I loved the dry down. It was nothing like when I first sprayed it. The smelI was amazing, light, soft and long lasting on my skin!

I really liked this one at first spray however the raspberry scent was a bit sharp and I think it doesn't blend well with rose. I am not a fan of fruity fragrance in general. It smelled cloying and too sweet and sadly, smelled cheap too (but I bought it at full price!) The bottle has been sitting on my desk for quite some time now. Longevity and sillage is moderate.

A very simple and sweet floral - perfect for an everyday type fragrance - office wear etc. I don't get much musk, there's no fruit, and it's fairly weak. It would make a safe gift for a floral fragrance lover, but it's not outstanding. Just pretty. It's really not that different from Kenzo flower, so if that's already in your collection, this is probably redundant. I like Kenzo flower by the way - as a nice, safe, pretty floral. I think this is probably an either/or situation. If you're after a pretty fragrance, get one or the other. Both is just a waste in my opinion. Lasts 2-3 hours on me.

A very pretty rose fragrance that almost reads like peony on the skin with some musk and pepper supporting it. The raspberry just sweetens the scent but does not make it a fruity floral in the least. Glad I blind bought this and love the bottle cap.

I figured it out, its taken me a while but I don't think I can handle musk. Its very strong in this for me and doesn't suit my skin or chemistry. Such a shame because it is very beautiful. I adore rose, gardenia and raspberry, gorgeous...

This one is really nice. It is a soft, clean fragrance, but it has a "body", if you know what i mean. It is delicate, elegant and feminine. Not overly flowery, not overly sweet. Office and date appropriate.
The only con, is that it is not really unique.
I imagine a young, intelligent and serene woman wearing it.
Try this if you like musk and sweet florals.

This is very nice. It is very linear as others have mentioned. I don't really get the top notes at all- it goes straight to the rose and that is where it remains. The rose is tempered though by the other flowers so even a non-rose lover like me can enjoy this. The rose is not overwhelming. It's sweet but not sickly sweet.
I don't get much of the original Flower in this, which IMO is a good thing
Silage isn't great on this although longevity isn't bad. I wish it would project more.

For lovers of fresh but sweet roses without powdery notes. A youthful fragnance but not for young people only - I've been testing it from my mom's bottle. She is sixty and she likes it.

On my skin the sillage was soft to moderate and it lasted about nine hours.

Kenzo is quite an underrated fragrance house. Their scents are something I've come to appreciate the older I've become. Flower by Kenzo, (their most well-known scent), was something I detested as a young woman, but have come to love with maturity. I was keen to see how this flanker, Flower In The Air compared to the original.

The first thing I noticed was that Flower In The Air was lacking the powdery-ness found in Flower by Kenzo. This fragrance is instead very fresh and clean smelling with notes of raspberry, rose, magnolia and gardenia on a bed of clean white musk.

Some reviewers have complained that this composition is quite linear. I would have to agree that this scent is not all that spectacular, however when it all boils down to how it wears on the skin, I am very impressed.

I tested Flower In The Air alongside many other scents when last at the department store. From all the tester strips I sprayed, Flower In The Air stood out the most to me. What captivated me the most was its easy-going, carefree aroma. It's comforting in a clean, crisp and shower-fresh kind of a way. I would happily wear Flower In The Air as an office and/or running errands scent. It's essentially a staple for anyone's wardrobe, the scent you reach for when nothing else suits.

Love the smell of this but quite an uncomplex perfume compared to other kenzo perfumes. The main smell of it is a very sweet rose. It is quite a linear perfume which is most people think it doesnt last as long. I think it lasts just as long as others but because there is not much evolution of the scent, your nose gets use to it and then you cant smell it one yourself.

A lovely feminine scent! The perfect combination of rose and raspberry makes it a classy and soft fragrance with a spicy touch. It radiates beautifully through out the day, with a good longevity, about 8 hours. It reminds me the original Flower without the remarkable powdery notes. It's fresh and delicate, just like flowers dancing in the air!
The first moment of this smells like Jeanne Arthes Love Never Dies (pink.)Then it turns into sweet deliciousness. If anyone wants to trade for the LNDs, PM me.

I've worn this both in summer and colder months and I must say that the sweetness is more suitable around fall and early winter or spring. The fruity blast in the high heat is obviously tamer and lends to brighten up the otherwise strong rose and gardenia. After 3 hours on me, the musk is noticeable and blends everything in a warm embrace. Longevity is excellent on me (about 6 hours) and please be mindful when spraying this, as with any Kenzo fragrance (in my experience) it is potent. I think 2 sprays are good enough in the summer heat (because the rose is more pronounced, unless you are a rose lover) and 4 in colder seasons. All in all, a very good perfume with excellent performance and if you are lucky you could get it at a very good price.
Typical fruity floral fragrance based on raspberry and rose. Girly, happy scent. Too sweet for my liking.

This was a gift that my husband personally picked out for me for Mothers day. It is sweet and i like it. The more i wear it the more it grows on me. If you ever smelled rose scented luxury bath soap from the 70's, this is that type of rose smothered in rasperry. The raspberry smells like bath and body works sun rippened raspberry body spray. There is a sprinkle of pink pepper. As the perfume dries it becomes more musky keeping the sweet rasperry and vintage rose. My husband loves this perfume and i receive alot of compliments wearing it. The best part about this perfume is smelling it wisp around me and through the air. It's 60 degrees outside with a slight breeze. I walk outside and in the wind the smell of roses and rasperry leave a lingering trail behind me and around me. It's quit beautiful. Sillage is soft but it continues to radiate softly all day. Longevity is about 6 hours. When you first spray Kenzo flower in the air wait a few minutes before smelling it, it takes time to settle and develop. If you smell it immediatly it's all sugary, after a few minutes it turns into something beautiful.

سلام
این عطر را برای همسرم خریدم
بوی بسیار خوب و لطیفی دارد، نه خیلی گرم است و نه خیلی شیرین احساس خوبی به آدم می دهد
کمتر آقا یا خانمی پیدا می شه که از این عطر خوشش نیاد
اگر سلیقه طرف مقابل را نمی دانید و یا می خواهید بدون تست خرید کنید انتخاب خیلی خوبیه و پشیمان نمی شوید
ماندگاری خوبی دارد حدود ۳ ساعت بوی اولیه را نگه می داره و بعد از شش ساعت با کمی دقت می شود هنوز حسش کرد

Loved it when I bought it, cause the smell was fruity/floral but not nauseatingly sweet- and also a bit fresh. But after a while I started noticing harsh/plastic notes in it. I'm not sure what happened...

I really love the packaging though the cap is a little bit loose.
right after spraying smell a light fresh flower, floral and light.
after a long time it's mainly sweet rasberry scent
but the longevity is short, it lasts like 3 hours on me

Diabetes in the air.
Lol this smells amazing but doesn't last at all.
Raspberries plus pink pepper in the beginning equals heaven.
Out comes a amazing trio burst of Rose, Gardena and magnolia.
The white musk base is perfect and would make me think it would last on me.
Sadly it only last a max of four hours on me. In my country I live, they sell this at department stores way over prices almost double. So it's highly unlikely I will buy. It's also maybe too teenagers, Abercrombie or Hollister etc. Lol type smell for me to spend that kind of money.

Flower in the air? More like cotton candy exploded in the air. LOL

But it's still lovely. It's a rosy, sweet, sugary scent. If they made a rose flavored cotton candy, this would be the smell.

The name of the fragrance suits it very well! It leaves some very nice floral scent in the air. The sillage is moderate, longevity also moderate. I think it perfectly avoids the nausea that strong flowery fragrances sometimes can cause (at least for me); this one is fresh and sweet without being overpowering. Very feminine, and I prefer this one to the Flower In The Air Eau de Toilette. And keep in mind that I do not usually fall for floral scents since I love aquatic, citrusy ones. Well done Kenzo! And I could even imagine wearing this in the winter.

Its like having a rose absolue candy for the beginning, very sweet roses and gently intense. Gently intense? Ironic phrase but that is how it feels. The rose doesn't come on sharp or very flowery. Like the air its gentle yet massive with just one spray. This candy scent lasts probably nearly 2 hours and turns into a very strong musk. This musk is not gentle like the famous Narciso. It may sting a little (still tolerable for me), but this will turn into a much softer musk in an hour with the hint of rose.

Tresor Midnight Rose is much more like the raspberry i would imagine. For Flower in the Air EDP it does not feel like raspberry. I agree with others on the cotton candy. No pickups of notes like lily or gardenia either.

Overall a very likeable scent for sweet rose and musk lovers, a little romantic, a little dreamy, a little sexy. I just don't really like the bottle's design...

Well this one just crept up on me I would never choose Kenzo usually as I think that most of theres are revolting like the flower one in the tall bottle smells likes earl grey tea rather disgusting. However this one has surprised me in a good way it is just lovely right through the notes and my husband really likes it so that is good enough for me and it has a lovely bottle I give it a 9 out of 10 it's just sweet and light and very pleasant I really love it

I bought this on a whim and I'm not happy. It's very rough on my senses. If you like soapy flowery scents, you may like this. I find it too strong and sweet, and slightly powdery. I'm so sad, the bottle is gorgeous.
Interesting, the rose in this has a cottony note to it.. But because it's in the air it doesn't last that long.

I've got vial spray for this. Spray it on my wrist, last about 6 hours until it fades.

The scent is more airy that Flower. Long lasting and fresh.

Thin feminine scent lingers. Love it. Much wearable than the Flower version.

Flower in the Air is an oxygenated version of Flower, if that makes any sense. It smells fresher, cleaner, slightly synthetic (like nearly all perfumes do these days), brighter and younger. The intoxicating (or nauseating) effect of the original Flower is considerably muted, but the relationship to it is there. Perhaps one could say Flower in the Air is the bright-eyed, freer (yet still composed) child of the more earthbound and serene Flower...

Very prominent raspberry note. It reminds me of Amethyst by Lalique without the "soapiness". The longevity is not that great, but not terrible, about 4 hours on my skin. All things considered, great fragrance for spring or summer.

I'm writing this review as I'm smelling the perfume on my arm. I know it might sound odd but this perfume just boosted my ego, I feel very feminine, sophisticated and amazing. I usually wear light, flowery, fruity scents but this one is a great alternate. The opening is fantastic with rich and luxurious rose, plus the sweet berry helps the rose not to be overwhelming and old. But I think it's the gardenia that grows on you, the more I smell this perfume on me, the more I'm loving it. It's the clean yet luxurious smell that I've been looking for and really wanted Bulgari Omnia Crystalline to work but it smelled a bit heavy on me. I will definitely add it to my collection.

I love the rose-raspberry-pink pepper trio in the opening. It's sweet and fresh and romantic, possessing the "airiness" that the name suggests. But after a while it slips into a rather generic fruity floral. There's nothing wrong with it and I wouldn't say nay to a bottle, I just wish it had a little more character. But I think this flanker is designed to be an unassuming, unobtrusive version of its predecessor and in that Kenzo has succeeded.

I'm a firm fan of the original and don't see much resemblance outside of the rose note. This is light, slightly soapy and a skin scent vs. Flower's potent powder bomb. Don't assume love or hate based on one or the other.

First of all- yes, I bought this because of the bottle. I adore everything with poppies, and when I saw this on the "sale" shelf... The bottle is like a design object in my room - irregular shape, simple,transparent lines and that red, bright poppy on the top. Beautiful!
Now about the scent...
I smell a dangerous rose in this perfume, and it reminds me that song by Kylie Minogue & Nick Cave "Where the wild roses grow".
The opening is fresh, sweet, dewy, wild rose and juicy raspberry mixture with some lightweight very mild powder. I smell some sparkling pink pepper which gives French vibe to this potion.
Then all this becomes more green, it must be gardenia. And then comes the "evil" in this wild summer garden -the musk. It adds a sensual, even a sin edge to the perfume. Modern, light, but still classic and quite unique daytime scent.
" They call me The Wild Rose, but my name is Elisa Day..."

I had low expectation for this perfume due to the negative comments, but surprisingly, I like it enough for it to be my primary go-to perfume for a few months. It's very flowery and powdery--if you're into woody scents you may not like it. Sweet with a lot of rose and berries in it.

Longevity and sillage are excellent to me. Just a few spritzes on the right places and you're good. It's light enough to be worn in the day, but on a hot day it may turn overwhelming if you spray it even just a little bit too much.

Overall, it's quite versatile and it's likeable enough for me to wear it quite often, but I can see why this doesn't sit well with some people.

Rating: 7.5/10

This edp smells like gasoline mixed with melting plastic.
Many new releases do just that, strangely enough.

In 2013, Kenzo released this fragrance (not to be confused with the EDT version, announced in 2014), to integrate the Flower by Kenzo line, which is a sales success worldwide, taking the poppy as its central theme. The idea behind this creation was of a lighter poppy, as if the flower, which was planted on the floor, could achieve and bloom the sky.

With a simpler composition, without resins or incense, this floral won lightness, getting less powdery, but still keeping the DNA of the traditional version. Flower in The Air EDP contains notes of raspberry and pink pepper, in the output; Magnolia, gardenia and rose in the heart; white musk at the base.

Normally, the first impression you have of a fragrance that takes raspberry in its structure is that it will be sweet, with red berries aspect. A huge mistake! Here, the raspberry provides a slight bittersweet nuance, but what dictates the rules is still the bouquet of flowers. The scent of roses is perfect, as well as the presence of Magnolia, with its unique scent. The musk serves to terminate the evolution with its cleansing nuances, which transmit even more lightness to this fragrance. Although possessing Eau de Parfum concentration, Flower in The Air EDP does not exude for a long time but lasts fairly.

For the fans of Flower by Kenzo, here is a great floral option for torrid days of summer or for those who need to wear perfumes in a more contained manner.

This isn't bad but it's nothing like the original Flower or my personal favourite - Flower Essentielle.

More fruity, no powder, kinda like a synthetically constructed rose out of geraniol, dihydromercinol... sadly a no for me. It veers precariously close to smelling like one of those mainstream-nothing fragrances...

It doesn't smell bad... it just doesn't wow me - I don't feel alive in it. But for someone else this may be the exact thing they were looking for. I recommend trying it on the wrist, the opposite inner elbow... and on some fabric... I guess, see if its love for you...
what I love from this perfumme is... how it brings a fresh feeling and confidence for me to start my day. Not so rosy but more "air" like more space to breath
It's currently my favorite fragrance. I love it madly. A greedy, fresh, sweet and sensual embrace at the same time. Literally in love. The sillage is soft but it's adorable.

Tried today. It almost brought tears to my eyes... no, I'm joking! well, that would be an exageration, yet Flower in the Air really came to my sense as a Kenzo-relief.
Kenzo (if he cares about or rather leaves all the work to Others) launched some of the most beautiful and original perfumes of last decades. His original was a real floral dream. Real flowers.
Jungle L'Elephant was an unforgettable daring powerful oriental. The longtime lost Kashaya, that smells like nothing else I ever smelled.

Then Kenzo lost himself into the mists of fake plastic vanilla and burned nauseous powder... Kenzo Amour, nice enough but soooo headache cold vanilla, the same kind as HP.
And then Flower. One of the nightmare scents of last 10 years. Something I cannot smell without feeling my throat clenching and wanting to...
A long list of more or less meaningless works. Some good with Once upon...
Now Flower in the Air.
As I took the pretty enough but also a little tacky cheapie bottle in my hand, I thought: "Ok, let's go. We need to do it for perfume reference, but try it on paper first!"
Oohhh! So nice and such a relief! Kenzo you came out of the burned plastic toxic mists, eventually!
Flower in the Air comes as a relief! It's highly breathable and that's already a lot!
And for the first time after years a Kenzo's perfume that state flowers in its name actually smells like something that can be called a flower. Name=thing, flower=flower, rose=rose. Not so difficult, an easy concept after all.

Flowers in the Air starts with a good vaguely sparkling rose as a statement: I'm rose.
I'm happy that the raspberry is done so gently and doesn't kill everything. This way it becomes a brilliant complimentary note to rose.
The mentioned White flowers are present and playful, but quite subdue compared to rose.
When the rose calms down it comes a sweet powdery musk. I should not like it at this stage but I actually do, maybe because it's vaguely reminiscent of Guerlain Idylle. Anyway a soft musky drydown with a gentle powdery edge, nothing screaming.
This is a scent I could wear very easily in spring when the weather is only warmer but still chilly. It's pretty, good, uncomplicated, modern and girlish without being boring.
Still chemical at certain degree, but gentle.

As the silliage is soft, I would like to have this to wear in the house, I can definitely detect the rose and gardenia. It's a very soft and pretty perfume, but for me, it's not my usual power fragrance like Poison or Poeme so it's one for the house.
