I tried this at Ulta yesterday and I really don't like it. I was expecting something with much more character to it. It actually smells like Flower by Kenzo and it's just so common,unfortunately.

OK. Actually I am not a kenzo lover. I even wasn't curious about this perfume because any of kenzo's creations didn't excite me. So being polite I tested it at the local drug store...... I was so surprised! It was exactly what I was looking for: optimistic energizing and very feminine perfume. It lasts a lot! I can really can smell the notes of magnolia with the delicate touch of roses. I am not afraid to call it exclusive for the day time. Lovle it! A lot of compliments!!!!!

I won a 50ml version and was excited to try it, despite disliking the other Kenzo perfumes.

Despite the classy bottle, the scent itself is very plain and sugary to me. All I get is raspberry candy floss with roses, which is quite a sickly sweet smell. The lasting effect is poor.

The fact that it is extremely expensive would put me off it, but since I got it free, I gave it to my mother, who also said she thought it was unexciting.

1.5/5, the 1.5 for the bottle.

This was a disillusion!!! Nothing similar to the Original Kenzo. Is this water in a bottle?! You can barely smell it. Very light, doesn't worth the money.
At least, the bottle is very pretty.

This fragrance develops so strangely on my skin that I even can't believe it. After 10 minutes, it was like some chemical smell, something between deodorant and washing powder. Never got such effect before with any perfume, so I am deeply surprised. And, the smell is quite alright, not the way I want to rub it off. Just, it is very unusual on my skin.

Impressed me how the first sniff remember me a brazilian fruit named "jambo", a fruit that smells like flower (not the pink jambo, the yellow ones).
Now I see the raspberry and pink pepper top notes in the site but still guess kenzo is using jambo on this.
I loved the first 10 minutes of this fragrance by this, then it fades away and becames less fruity and less interesting.
I adore this, i tried it yesterday, it's magical

I have a sample of this but it's such an awkward one (a little bag filled with fragrance so when you open it the juice goes all over the place. Who invents something like this?!) Fortunately the fragrance itself is really pretty even though I don't like the original one. It's a bit powdery and smells very clean. I got rose petals, gardenia and only a hint of citrus. Really classy and well done Kenzo!

This was love at first sniff! This one's lighter than the original Flower, which I have. Rose and magnolia are the dominant notes here, with undertones of raspberry and musk. I love that this is less powdery than the original too. It's fresh, elegant, floral and sweet. Longevity and projection on me is good, just like the original. As soon as I tested it, I knew that I desperately had to buy it! ♥

Totally different from original Flower, what is a good thing. The other side of the coin is that it is weak, you barely smell it. Longevity is poor and it is very soft, you have to put your arm very close to your nose to smell it. A pity because, if stronger, would be very nice.

(Now I´m thinking.... since this "extreme", "intense" wave is in vogue, is Kenzo thinking about releasing a stronger version in six months, just to have something more to sell? If it happens, it will be a shame, to sell us poorly fragrant water and then sell the real stuff..)
In few words smells the same than the original but 2013 version. I like it.

Flower in the Air is a clean and tranparent floral fragrance. I get mostly magnolia and some rose adorned with sweet sour raspberry, fresh, young and feminine. Unlike the original Flower, FITA doesn't have that powdery texture. Towards the end, the musk becomes more prominent.

The sillage is relatively close and the longevity is around 8 hours. I find it less edgy than the original Flower, but easier to appreciate and wear. Not a surprising release, but a well structured one nonetheless.
Looks like water do not smell anything!

I really enjoy this fragrance, but it is really a shame that the base note only contains musk in it. It could be much more interesting and better developing fragrance if it had more notes combined in the base. Other than that, it is a nice, clean, soapy fruity floral fragrance. Much better than Kenzo's last few creations, but it lacks the WOW effect after all.
I really like this its feminine and a lovely daytime perfume. Love it after its been on a few hours, yummy.Lasted on me 5 hours.
This is very sweet but I like it! The fruity raspberry makes this rose scent more modern and young. I could wear it out at night as well as during the daytime.
Nice. Very sweet rose, light, delicate. But nothing special. I prefer the original.

I tried it today... Omg!! It's sooo different from other Kenzo perfumes.. It's not similar to Flower at all..!
This is all about roses, it's delicate, light and super feminine.. On my skin it doesn't last a lot but it's a beautiful (spring-summer) rose scent..
I LOVE this perfume. Unfortunatelly it lasts very very little :(

Pretty floral, it goes on bright, but with a certain sweetness that keeps it from being overly floral, it smells nice, modern, uplifting, a bit of the original Flower in it, although this is more rounded, longevity is ok..it isn't outstanding but overall nice.
Easy to wear, easy to enjoy, nice creation!!

Beautiful bottle!!!
The juice is not groundbreaking. You can detect the "original" fragrance without the suffocating powdery effect. Fruity but not fresh because the rose tames down the whole composition.

Debenhams had this out already in July. It's less sweeter than the original Flower and less powdery. I can smell the raspberry and rose notes which stayed most prominant on my skin. It's still sweet but lighter, I can still smell it around 4 hours after spraying. Not something I would rush to buy but an ok pleasent day time scent in a nice shaped bottle!
What a fresh, uplifting scent!

A largely forgotten 2012 release by Francois Demachy, Kenzo Homme Sport is a ho-hum summer flanker that leans more "blue" than "fresh."

2.5/5

I blind bought this. Been wearing for several days. Love it.

Right, it's not mind blowing, but I think it still has its own uniqueness. Very pleasant from start to end.

Doesn't project like crazy for sure, yet it is what it is. It does the work nicely. Very uplifting every second getting a whiff of it.

Really interesting juicy a bit sweet citrucy in the beginning. Plus a just right dose of mint blending with that fruity fresh juicy sweet citrucy.

The start getting that interesting ginger and bit of spicyness in the middle. The sweet refreshing citrucy is still there though.

Then ends in smooth vetiver and woody cedar.

I get a consistent 5-6 hours of longevity. Spraying on clothes however, really help to 7-8 hours. It even stays for days on my jacket.

In short, this is a great option for daily wear. It suits nicely both in hot weather and cooler times like night summer or rainy tropical climate.

Very happy everytime getting a whiff of this scent after 3 or 5 hours from the first spray.

So underrated. Joy Amin gave it 9/10 if I'm not mistaken. I agree with him, though for me it's a solid 8.5/10.

Bleu de Chanel meets Terre d'Hermes in assists of Guerlain Homme touch.
Quite odd notes combination. Kenzo Sport smells weird and intriguing at the same time. I don't know if I like it or not therefore i still have a bottle from 2013 and use it occasionally.
Wife likes it thou
7/10

I tried it on myself yesterday. It smelled like Vic Vaporub! Could by my skin chemistry but I mostly smelled mint and ginger, no lemon, which resulted in a “eucalyptus cream for sore muscles” sort of smell. Very unappealing at least on me.

This was a dissapointment. Did a blindbuy on this in hope it was something similiar to Armani Code sport after reading review and it was not close at all.
To me (a not so experienced nose as you others) it just smelled to strong mint and wood.
I did not like it very much.

Kenzo Sport goes on slightly sweet and minty, with a heavy oxide-like aroma carrying it. Brazen—you get a hint of the cedar from the start. It is a very monotone cedar essence. It strives to create a sense of masculinity with the warmth and abrasiveness that it adds.

There is a synthetic constitute that doesn't exactly sit well with me. Possibly a virgin nose would find it more enjoyable, but my nose is very seasoned and it muddles the mint essence for me. It's almost like a gingery balsam, with the sharpness of an oxide.

The fragrance dries down to a strong dominance of the monotone cedar, with the sharp oxide behind it, attempting to lift the warm abrasive qualities. They are a bit too heavy for it though, and I believe this is a boot technique, because I've experienced this exact same 'cedar' in Legendary Fragrances Treasure Island Lady.

The style of this fragrance is very adolescent, and seems to be geared more towards people in their high school years. However, I don't find that the basey use of cedar here would appeal to younger individuals like that—but is force-projecting—and would moreso be the kind of thing that makes them feel uncomfortable.

I do subtly enjoy the fragrance, but it's a bad sport, in the sense that it doesn't make me feel like I'm wearing anything sporty, attractive, or energetic.

Mmmm this is a nice scent! It reminds me of something I smelled in my youth, even as a child perhaps. I wonder if it was a soap, something containing mint.

This was my first sniff of Kenzo Sport and I'm interested to try it again sometime, properly (on skin) as I like the fact it's a bit different from what I was expecting.

It doesn't seem all that strong but I find it such nice scent (and very masculine in my opinion), all the more surprising as so far at least I haven't found many minty scents that do it for me!

An instant, perfect hit, made by no other than Francois Demachy. The grapefruit and mint simply erupt giving way to an oven-baked cookie feel. Yes, this is my own take and it sure as hell tackles this accord. Extraordinarily well blended, I had a vague idea what this would smell like but I gotta say I was completely blown away by this formula. Lasts more than 5 hours so I can't see what the fuss is about, for this kind of frag it is the tops. Awesome!!

Unfortunately longevity is poor. I think it's very similar to Armani Code Sport (in my want list 'cause my Kenzo Sport is almost finished and I consider both them unisex).
Does anyone else smell this similarity?

★Really nice scent ,fresh and refreshing EDT ,very unique and amazing combination of mint and ginger beside citrus and spices that is masterly balanced makes it a great fragrance for hot days, I wish it has more silage and longevity but being pleasant even just for myself when I wear it seems satisfying***********★

Great, underrated, scent. Smells really nice, fresh and original. The only problem is that is doesn't last very long.

Longevity: 6/10
Sillage: 7/10
Scent: 10/10

Nice fragnrace for the price,citrusy opening and later turn into something i don't know what..But it is nice scent,last about 5 hours on my shirt even after taht i can smell it but not strong...Sillage is not bad,some people can notice scent about 1-2m around and asking what is that smell...

Longevity 7/10
Sillage 6/10
Scent 10/10

A longevity-cutted version of Kenzo Homme Boisee and always reminds me of Terre d'Hermes. Too heavy to be a sport perfume.

This does NOT last. Apply 1x will only get 3 hours on my skin at best, and won't last much longer even you increasing dosage to 2x or 3x.

DO NOT BUY, no matter how cheap it is!

Rating: 5.0/10.

Something about the drydown or latter end of this scent just really intrigues me. Towards the end ginger, mint, lemon and maybe grapefruit combine to make an odd scent that I like to smell.

It has an odd beginning, maybe synthetic or lemon furniture polish-like of an aroma. This weird beginning to it goes away and moves on to a slightly spicey end life.

Dior's Homme Sport is just a tick or notch above this Kenzo sport scent, the ginger is sweeter and stands out more in that Dior fragrance.

This is lite and lasts well into the 5-6 hour range and radiates well off of my skin.
A joyful perfume
Bleu de Chanel Sport

The opening it's fresh grapefruit juice with ice cubes, ginger slices and mint. Very refreshing and yummy!

The dry down remind me of VPH and Allure Sport plus the ginger note. It's pretty linear and safe, great fragrance for summer outdoor activities.

Can be find quite cheep, so for the money the fragrance have very good value. Decent longevity and very good projection in the first hour.

Much better that Sport Extreme in my opinion.

Two thumbs up!

In 1991, Kenzo brought Kenzo Pour Homme, which became a sales success and maintains numerous faithful fans, until nowadays. And as happened with other famous brands, the market has evolved and opened space for versions of the biggest hits in the world perfumery. Obviously, Kenzo Pour Homme has also won several versions, such as Kenzo Homme Fresh, Kenzo Homme Boisee (also called Kenzo Woody) and, in 2012, this sport version, which already owns even an intense version called Kenzo Homme Sport Extreme, released in 2013.

Kenzo Homme Sport follows the visual line of men's fragrances, with bamboo-inspired bottle, this time in a gray-blue tone and with the letters in red. It seems, too, that some bottles were sold with the "sport" word in the same white and smoky style as in the box, but that they do not continue being marketed currently.

Another important aspect is that the perfumer of this fragrance was François Demachy, who created fragrances for Acqua di Parma, in addition to numerous successes of Dior, Fendi and Givenchy.

This is not a replacement version of Kenzo Homme Fresh, as some believe. The latter was a great alternative of freshness to the original version. Here, I see another attempt to create a new version, focused on establishing its place within the family Kenzo Homme. And if we're going to talk about dna, this one kept something from the Boisee (Woody) version, with the notes of mint in the output and cedar in the base.

Kenzo Homme Sport is an aromatic spicy fragrance, with tonic notes of Mint and ginger, combined with the grapefruit, which merge into a heart of geranium and a base of cedar and vetiver.
The output is almost an energizing shock, rich in citrus and refreshing aromas, ideal for the sportsman. The heart is more voluminous and the Ginger takes time to appear, but is a full prize for those who enjoy fragrances with this note. Finally, the base is woody and light with the typical aroma of cedar, representing the soil in which the athlete steps.

The sillage is great and the lasting is not bad, as many others within the standards of sporting fragrances.

For the man who doesn't make a point of showing off, who is free and sexy in a natural way and doesn't take life too seriously, Kenzo has brought Kenzo Homme Sport. I must confess that I'm curious about the Extreme Sport version.

I like the minty opening,very refreshing.
the drydown is somehow like BO.
Very short longevity.maximum 2 hours.
Stick to Kenzo classic.Do NOT get this.
It starts very nice. Fresh, cold-mint like perfume, but... The drydown is awful. Smells like cheap feet deodorant. Nothing to do with this crap, sorry guys.

I have a sample from this, I feel very sharp, fresh, mint/citrus and rude, real sport man scent, similar to an after shave or a mint foot spray smell, not bad but not something significant. After 2 hours becomes more sweet (lime) and woody.

This is nice for summer time, on a beach day, or just for hotter weathers. I would take sport fragrances and just play sports in them, that's just how I see them now. This one is a well done citrusy, spicy, green, fresh fragrance. Try it.
why all these comments? this is unusual special and amazing summerfrag .

Completely agree with the last review, opening notes are original and fresh but the drydown is way too spicy and heavy IMHO. I bought it very excited last summer but got bored very fast and don't use it anymore.

The opening notes are a mix of Armani Code Sport & Issey Sport... Limey, Minty, with a hint of ginger

After 30min, Kenzo Sport turns too gingery (mixed with mint).

30min later, the mint notes fade away, leaving only the ginger. I like ginger on Dior Sport (vintage and 2012) or Kenzo Tokyo, but Kenzo Sport has nothing but ginger and spices on the base.

Don't buy this judging the initial notes.
Exactly like almost every single other sport frag. ever released. Smells identical to Guerlain Homme
I'm really feeling this Kenzo Sport sample. The Japanese fragrances are unlike many of the mainstream stuff out here. This is a definite holiday buy for me.

I also think this is more like a flanker of Kenzo Boisee than Kenzo pour Homme. First I thought this to be a more weak Kenzo Boisee with a hint of citrus (the last main accord of the five listed above) among the top notes, but Sport is a stronger scent, is very long lasting and usually tires my nose quickly, although I receive more compliments with it than with Boisée. Also, is not herbal orientated as Boisée is. Anyway, my feeling with this Kenzo is that they aren't trying to create something really new, even as a sport scent, but just going with the wave of the majority. Some are better than others, but most of them still very average or unoriginal. Here they took Kenzo Boisee, recycled it to look like a sport scent, and voilà. P.S.: it could be worst, and they made it worst: Sport is still a better scent then Sport Extreme.

Been waiting to try this fragrance since it was first announced. Finally found it at a duty-free shop at JFK in New York last week. It's definitely Kenzo. I mean... it's almost like Kenzo Wood with the citrus turned way up. I like it... it just doesn't last very long.

First impression; this one reminds me of Givenchy Play Sport with citrusy sweet mint. It just lacks the floral accord that is in the Givenchy. Spices create something a bit vulgar and animalic like a body odor. It's not a good thing but luckily it is subtle (phew!).

So far, I find this edition of Kenzo to be pretty good. It's nicely woody, average staying power, but it's not as chilly and cool as other sport frags. It's not even spicy either. It's just somewhat mellow. I am not totally in love with it tho because Givenchy Play Sport is still on the top of my list for 2012 sporty fragrance.

This one has no DNA of the regular Kenzo Homme and smells more lika a sporty version of Kenzo Homme Boisee. It starts like a lighter variation of Armani Code Sport: minty notes on a gingery lemony foundation. But soon the scent becomes more herbal reminding a bit of Burberry The Beat and especially the dry down of Bleu de Chanel (not the fruity opening, but the earthy dry down of Bleu!).

The good point of the fragrance is the high quality of ingridients. The bad ones are average projection and worse longevity than Armani Code Sport, Dior Homme Sport and Bleu de Chanel have. Nevertheless it's a decent stuff in the range of sport fragrances.

Well, I went to visit the homepage of Kenzo, and I noticed that the perfume Kenzo Homme Fresh is no longer mentioned. So, I presume that the Kenzo Homme Fresh was discontinued and in Its place will be put the Kenzo Homme Sport. There is a logic in this supposition, because both fragrances are for the summer. Besides, we are living in the "Age of Sports". More sports will arise. I have nothing against sports fragrances, and I hope that the KHS will be a pleasant surprise. Peace and Light to All!!!
Thanks mannyb! Strange how people rush to judge. And besides what's wrong with sports.fragrances ? ? I love Dior homme sport and allure homme sport to name a couple.....
Wait and try...Demachy made amazing fragrances, and KHS can't be a bad scent
hmmmm wait and try.....

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Poppy Bouquet Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: The combination of mandarin and jasmine makes this very reminiscent of YSL Libre for me, so if you like that scent but wish you had a more summer appropriate version, you would love this. I don't get a lot of the almond or tea notes on my skin chemistry.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Poppy Bouquet Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
Rating: 😳🫥
Do I like it: Yeah, for about 30 seconds
Who it is: someone who likes Flower by Kenzo but is afraid to offend the sourroundings by wearing perfume
Smells I get: realistic non-descript florals, musk
Meyer's Briggs type: shy INFP, INFJ

Oh, how nice! Aaaaaaand it's gone.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Poppy Bouquet Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Un parfumel drăguțel dar foarte intim. Îl folosesc când sunt pe lângă casa îmi dă așa un vibe pozitiv

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Poppy Bouquet Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
Its similar to the original poppy bouquet, the gardenia ads this subtle soft sweetness, I liked that in the original as well. Tea, musk, jasmine and green almond are nice blended. Pretty, unique and delicate...This perfume is vegan as well, big like !
In winter time its hard noticeable and the tea note comes out more...

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Poppy Bouquet Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
Got a sample of this from a kind person who sold me clothes online and i probably wouldn’t have discovered this particular fragrance otherwise, the kenzo flower range hasn’t been interesting to me except for the beautiful bottles.
Well this scent instantly impressed me despite being one of those safe, crowd-pleasing florals that are found everywhere. This one stands out because it smells like real flowers with citrus added. It’s also a bit powdery. I like it so much I am planning to purchase a full bottle. If you like feminine, innofensive but elegant scents, this one is that and more.

I smell spring when I sniff it. A relaxing airy comforting floral that I need in my heavy floriental collection for the days I need to fly like a colorful butterfly.
Performance is satisfying for me, I don’t want all my perfumes to act perfectly I need perfumes that fades slowly and unnoticeably like a shy little girl. I need this perfume to perform intimately between me and my very own skin.
Yes, I know you don’t expect such a review from an Arab perfumista ! ;)

It's one of the few perfumes from Kenzo that I can say I like, I could say it's really, that is surprisingly coming from Kenzo, a feminist fragrance, no, it's not for office or meeting or when you want to express like a powerful leader, woman, individual, it's a free spirit vacation day. I can see it worn at a colorful business suit maybe a sky blue one with a white blouse in a spring day while you are in a city break vacation in a location like Vienna or Verona or Copenhagen. It is very suitable for an elegant woman in a suit but in a relaxing environment. It's a floral, woody scent, it practically smells like an apple tree that bloomed in May.

I absolutely loved it!

The apple blossom here is a delight, as much as the pear blossom.
Peony just perceptible, which is a plus if one is looking for a fragrance more prominent on the apple blossom note, as it was in my case. It's a triumph of spring, tender petals drenched in juicy pear.

Pity that the fragrance does not work with my PH :(

Really not keen on this one before - which is a surprise as I have enjoyed (even loved) every other Kenzo I have tried.

On me this is a really dull, fruity scent. Almost sour and oddly sort of sharp at the same time. Aside from the occasional hint of Rose, the flowers never really develop on me.

L: Moderate
S: Moderate

Just not my cup of tea.

I like this perfume. In fact, I have a soft spot for Kenzo's fragrances. I like many of them. Floralista is great to wear in the summer, I was wearing it a lot when I was going to the beach. It's quite weak on me, and has a sour note, but it's like flowers and fruit in bloom together, very pleasant. And somehow mature. No rose here but it brings it to my mind too. Maybe it isn't the biggest masterpiece by Kenzo, yet it has charm and it's optimistic.

I was expecting this to be more flowery. It's quite nice, but too fruity for its purpose.
I know it's not on the notelist, but on my skin became so fruity... maybe because of this tropical extreme heat in my country, IDK....
I was hoping that maybe would dry down more floral on my skin, but nope nope. Opens very juicy and gets softer quickly, which is nice... The blend between peony and the fruitness is good! Bad longevity though.

Anyway, good scent but wrong advertising.
I would say it fits more summer than spring

Floralista is a very nice fresh spring floral. The fruit blossoms are gentle but by no means shy. To my nose this is very much like walking through an apple or pear orchard in full bloom on a sunny breezy day. Not heady or too sweet. Very carefree and easy going. Although I'm looking for an easy floral for spring, florals and fresh are always a crap-shoot on my skin and while this is not bad at all, Floralista is a bit "too fresh" for my tastes. It's still quite chilly out so I will try it again when the weather warms to make my final verdict. I'll update then. But for floral lovers looking for something really pleasant and gently sweet, lady-like this is worth a try.

Floralista was a very nice surprise! Kenzo last releases having been less than impressive to me,I was wondering, but no it smells very pretty, creamy, real nice floral, it is soft yet it lingers well.the apple blossom smells pretty, with the peony trailing behind it..after a few hours I can still smell it around me..good job on that one! it has some similarities with EL Pleasure in Bloom, although I like Floralista better, it is brighter, overall better. it is a bit sweet in the drydown, and easy to reach for. I will add the bottle is real nice too.

24. March 2014

Today i have tested it for the first time in tax free shop and i must say that it is a very very good floral fragrance. The notes didn't sound promising, but the actual scent is a great one and now i will get certainly several bottles of this beauty. It makes you feel like you're standing in a garden in full bloom on a warm sunny late spring day. Delicious i must say.
At first it opens with a bit sour combination of apple blossom and peony, and i had fears that it might stay that way through the whole composition until the very end, but after 15-20 minutes it becomes much more softer, thanks to the peach blossom, which i didn't detect a first at all. It turns into more creamy oeachy delicate yet strong scent, which i haven' t smelled in countless other releases. Very good indeed, i enjoy it very much and surprised to see such a good fragrance made for a tax free retail. Normally these kind of fragrances are bland and generic but Kenzo positively surprised me this time.
I don't smell any pear gladly, or if there IS one, it is not domnanting at all but accompanies other notes.
Kenzo has made few good scents for tax free retail in the past and this is another great example. I feel like it will become one of my favorites for spring, but it is also good for autumn. Somehow i feel like it would be too strong for summer, at least for me.
Longevity could be better, it lasted around 4 hours on my skin.

P.S. on paper it doesn't smell at all that good as on my skin. Peach blossom note does not develope or projects much on paper, as much it doeson my skin.
This is clearly targeted for the airports duty free shops!!!
Doesnt sounds very new with the notes, but might be good for the spring though :)
I love the contrast of sour grapefruit with sweet creamy vanilla here! It's a charming calm fragrance, perfect for work because there is barely any projection. Delicate, light and airy.

I bought this out of curiosity, as I'm an expat in this part of the world and fly to Bali quite a lot on my weekends. The name "7:15 am in Bali" really intrigued me, and I had high hopes.

Has Daphné Bugey ever set foot out of Europe?

Nothing about this fragrance invokes anything remotely related to the smells or feelings of being in Bali let alone anywhere in Asia. Knowing Bali well, I was at least expecting some Southeast Asian florals like kamboja (frangipani), champak, lemon grass or kenanga (ylang ylang). Even some sandalwood to replicate the incense they burn in Bali would have been appreciated.

This just smells like generic women's perfume...

Tender and powdery white floral scent with a refined sun lotion finish (coconut and tropical flowers) and a touch of citruses. It smells nice and sweet, but slightly old-fashioned due to huge amount of jasmine.

Follow me on IG: scent.guide

14. december 2020

It seems like most of Kenzo fragrances are not really my best matches and to me most of them are quite boring. This Bali fragrance is also the case, it is very nice done vanilla scent with sprakling grapefruit and the ingredients are of a high quality, but still it lacks that extra "oomph" for me. And judging by the price of it i can tell you that it is overhyped. You can get similar fragrances for less. Call me crazy, but i get a very close dupe of L´instant by Guerlain after the opening fades away. It is quite linear without development, it basically stays the same the whole time and this is not much exciting for me either. It does remind me a lot of Madagascar, but this one is lighter. I also get quite a similar vibe with Boucheron´s "Trouble" but Bali is less powdery and less strong. Overall it is nice but as i said before it is not something i would brag about or spend a fortune on. Moderate sillage and average lasting power. I have sold my bottle, since for me i like my "L´instant" much more and they are quite close to me, when i tested them side by side, so since i have enough of "L´instant" i decided to let go of less exciting "Bali"

Do not remove this comment, i strongly believe not every single comment should be positive and negative ones are actually quite useful for people who buy blindly

I love everything Kenzo and I want to like this one too but the minute I spray it on, it just disappears. I never had a perfume like this. I assume it must be my body chemistry but this literally vanishes in thin air. I can smell it in the spray nozzle but not on me:(

That's an interesting one. I got a sample of it and as I tried for the first time I didn't believe this was unisex as it seems to me that this is really female scent. But why not, after a while I could imagine a man wearing this one too.

I feel like bathing in vanilla rice puding wearing this one - which makes me feel so comfortable and somehow I find it attractive too. Nice, cozy, warm (prefer this one for winter or fall would do either I guess).

Mm. Sweet and sour, airy, very Kenzo. On me it's barely more acidic than vanillic. I can't believe there isn't any frangipani note in it, it has that kind of a vibe. Don't lynch me over this but there is something in it that reminds me of Midnight Fantasy as well, though certainly very restrained.

The name seems about right, it has a morning kind of vibe, but I almost feel like it evokes a cityscape rather than Bali. I don't know why this is, I haven't even been outside of Europe, so I wouldn't know what Indonesia/Bali is like to begin with. This fragrance makes me think of living in the heart of a major Asian metropolis and getting ready to dive into the morning bustle on a day where you feel well-rested and excited for what the day will bring, maybe knowing you have a date lined up after work or something like that.

a molti questo episodio di viaggio non piace, abituati a considerare kenzo una garanzia di originalità (sarà poi vero, a parte qualche felicissima eccezione) nella ideazione di profumi. io, al contrario, sono intrigata da questo accordo che si ispira ad una mattina o ad una colazione, fate voi, balinese, e che riporta semplicemente note esotiche di vaniglia, orchidea e frutto della passione su una bella base di pompelmo. Nulla di originale, nulla di spettacolare, soltanto la sintesi, nel senso chimico del termine, delle 7,15 a Bali. Esotico senza essere fastidiosamente carico di tiarè e simili, fruttato senza essere sciropposo, discreto quanto basta per immaginarsi lontani senza strillare. bello e fuori produzione.

Well, for me not the Grail. This is far too sweet a "fruity" vanilla to me. The vanilla, orchid, and passion fruit just dominate in a very synthetic way. The light airiness is typical Kenzo and there are certainly Kenzo scents I adore (Elephant has my heart). But this one just smells very drugstore, mall-frag to me, nothing distinctive.
However, it is "true" to its notes, so, if you are a vanilla lover but want to try something different with an aquatic grapefruit-passionfruit vibe, instant powder from the orchid, then go for it. I think it is "office friendly" and more appropriate for spring and summer days in the heat. Perhaps it might even be better then, as I'm wearing it in the winter now.

Instantly recognizable as a Kenzo fragrance Almost like it says "I am Kenzo, be prepared. You know who I am, let me welcome you to the experience."

It is sweet like candy, but not the kind of candy you find usually in fragrances. It's not like cotton candy, gummy bears. Not like a celebrity scent appealing to teens who want to smell like a sugar bomb. It's more of a sweet, soft, slightly creamy sweet made for adult taste. Imagine planning your dream trip to Bali, expecting what it would be like. Things are rarely what you imagine them to be, but your trip to Bali is exactly what you expected and wanted. That feeling of satisfaction and accomplishment mixed with pure joy and relaxation is what is evoked in me when I smell this - my expectations are reality.

So first of all, when I see grapefruit in a fragrance, I avoid it. The fact that 7:15am in Bali also has passion fruit only further pushes me away. The scents I have tried with this combination always, ALWAYS result in an acidic, pungent, sour quality that I just do not like and it does not work on me. However, 7:15 leaves only the most sweet, creamy, and friendly aspects of these fruits, though their signature qualities are still there. They are perfectly balanced with florals of jasmine and orchid which soften it even further. Lastly we have this delicious, warm, creamy vanilla that wraps everything up and slowly sinks in through the notes, blending beautifully as our journey of 7:15am in Bali continues.

As we come to the end, like a memorable vacation, the sweetness I initially experienced returns quietly as a reminder, until this scent slowly disappears and sinks slowly into warm vanilla, until you're left with nothing but a lovely memory of 7:15am in Bali.

Joy ,lightness ,vacation in a bottle.
On me it is v similar to my other darling , Casmir.
Love it ,gives me a good feeling ,a feeling of lightness.
It's a sort of aromatherapy scent ,it lifts one up.
Casmir is definitly a brother scent that might be combined with a citrussy scent for a lighter version.
Happy perfuming.

Long ago, I sold my Kenzo 7:15 am in Bali on EBay. I thought it was too strong with crazy longevity on me and "flat" vanilla. At that time, I was wearing Chopard Casmir, so you can see why the poor Kenzo didn't stand a chance.
I recently swapped for it, and I got it back into my collection. At the same time, I swapped for a 5ml decant of L'Elephant. I thought I really would learn more by wearing these two Kenzo vanillas side by side, so the left wrist has the L'Elephant and the right wrist has the 7:15 in Bali.
Both are creamy, but not sweet vanillas. I use mexican vanilla when I cook because it's much better quality and has almost no alcohol. Kenzo vanilla is like that. It's rich and creamy pure vanilla pared down. So, what the house of Kenzo does, is add other elements to that vanilla base to change it up. The L'Elephant has a dry leaves and hot dirt in the sun feeling. Because I also have Dzing!, which has the horse note, this Kenzo does have a dry elephant skin note at the very opening! I really don't know how they managed that, but I love it. This fragrance DID remind me of my safari in Kenya. It had the wide open skies, the airy vast feel, the dry hot earth in the sunshine (not wet damp dirt like Demeter), and sunshine all on top of that cozy vanilla. The citrus notes with the vanilla actually smell like sunshine! I feel like this really would be the perfect fragrance to wear on safari when you're in the hot sun in those open air jeeps watching all the beautiful elephants walk by. It's making me feel so happy I could cry.

The 7:15am in Bali has that same vanilla base, but with soft palm fronds layered over it. I also got a very very light orchid smell, which I would like to amplify. This one also reminded me of Bali. Bali is probably the lushest, greenest, most floral place I've ever been. One of my favorite things to do in Bali is to go to the spas. There are so many spas in town where you can get a massage, bath, and scrub. One place I feel in love with had little cabanas in a circle around a carved teakwood garden setting. You'd go into your little cabana and get into a warm bath with a ton of floating orchids, then you'd get a sugar scrub and a massage. After the massage, you go sit on a teakwood recliner in the flower garden to relax. Kenzo has managed to bottle all that!! The only note that I didn't get much of was the orchid flowers, but I can layer it in. The 7:15 in Bali has the green palm fronds from the garden, with the vanilla smell that I love, with a hint of the warm woods. I can't believe I couldn't smell this when I first owned it, and now, I am completely head over heels in love!
I do love Amour and I think 7:15 is like his cousin. More creamy, soft and more wearable all year. I bought it in a store in Bahamas. Love at first. Sad it's discontinued. Why is that??????.

7:15am in Bali is all about creamy vanilla, candied passionfruit and sparkling grapefruit. Not necessarily a scent that I'd associate with a tropical country like Bali, but delicious and fun nonetheless.

This fragrance is more than likely going to appeal to younger consumers due to its sweet and fruity nature. I found myself quite drawn to it at first, however I must admit that I was later disappointed because it smelt similar to other mainstream vanilla fragrances.

So far I have only been able to find this limited edition in duty free stores. My guess is that it is intended for travellers.

If you already enjoy Kenzo Amour, you'd probably like 7:15am in Bali. Kenzo does vanilla well. I can wear this fragrance without getting too much of a headache. It's quite a shame that this fragrance isn't more readily available.

The orchid note in the heart causes this fragrance to smell a tiny bit like Britney Spears' Fantasy, however this similarity is fairly short-lived. I would say that 7:15am in Bali is quite an easy fragrance to like.

The lasting strength is average and the sillage is fairly soft. It's a hard fragrance to track down, but I would recommend searching for it online if you're serious about buying it.

Love from the first split. Actually it's not that feminine to me. The sweetness of this fragrance come from vanilla and no heady floral. It's simple(I admit) but still very good. Sweet and creamy. Very comforting like a dawn and morning breeze at beautiful resort. a romantic one.

For the unisex fragrance it may a bit on feminine side but not too feminine for a guy either. I found it soft vanilla and not candy or floral sweet. New fav for me and I'll take it everywhere.

Another great find by the House of Kenzo. And as usual, I always fall hard for LE's fragrances and this is now very hard to find. I don't know "notes" too well, but this is an exotic blend of familiar smells. This is a lovey tropical with orange vanilla and some coconut cream yet it's not foody. I love orange in the warmer months and usually find vanilla better in cooler months. But this is done in such a way I'd prefer it warmer months, but will wear it year round. The orange is the perfect citrus fruit that's not bitter like grapefruit or tart like lemon. The vanilla is not a warm vanilla but more like vanilla ice cream. And the coconut gives it the creaminess and exoticisim that tropical quality. I will wear this when i go on vacation . . . whether it is for real or just in my imagination. Simply lovely.

An incredibly feminine sexy gourmand which is powdery vanilla with sweetness and warmth..

I applied 6 heavy sprays

0- 2 mins. Fills the room. This bottle is EDT, Initial smell is synthetic and a little bit off

2 mins -1 hour - 1 foot projection. Okay, here we go, the true scent reveals itself and I am confused, this is listed as unisex...???? "you've got to be kidding me".. John Mcenroe.. This is so femine sexy, it is amazing, it leaves me stunned, this is tanned cougar, vanilla-powdery-sweety gourmand with a hint of what smells like leather (not listed). Ages 34- 56. Wowie!

1 hour - 4 hours - 8 inch projection. Quite linear, so sexy, can't get enough of it...

4 hours - 6 hours - 3 inch projection with some trails

6 hours - 8 hours. 2 inch projection, drydown not as nice as start and some sourness comes in

Long lasting

I have been to Bali and there was no smell to recall. What there was though close to Bali was the single most incredible smell that I have ever come across, which I recommend lovers of aromas experience once in your life- you will be astonished. Get a slow boat from Bali to Lombok to arrive in Lombok for approx just before dusk... You will experience 30 mins away from Lombok the most incredible enthralling burst of spice aromas which will encaspsulate your love of fragrance forever..

(Then take an overland bus journey through the Spice Islands to Flores, seeing Komodo, Mt Keli Mutu's dawn, and all that the Indonsesian reefs have to offer.. enjoy the sun and diverse ethnic cultures of multiple islands and most important, take it easy for once!)

Very good

I obtained a small bottle of Kenzo 7:15am IN BALI out of curiosity from a discounter (hence, scent unsniffed), and after several wearings, I have to say that I'm not really smitten with it. I say this because it seems as though I am alone, given all of the glowing reviews.

To my nose, BALI seems a bit off somehow. It may be that the orchid and fruit are imparting a slightly sour cast to the vanilla, and that may very well have been intended by the perfumer as an olfactory effect, but unfortunately it reminds me somewhat of the endless catalogue of bad synthetic sandalwood vanilla frags.

I should say that, on a good day, I find this perfume rather pleasant to wear, albeit not that exciting, and I do always perceive its synthetic cast--it's just that on a good day I don't mind that so much. I suppose that since this is a limited edition travel issue to be sold at duty-free shops at airports to tourists on their way to vacations in far away exotic places, BALI is supposed to convey the calmness one feels while lying on a beach having left all one's worries behind back home. So it's not really supposed to be a high-energy, revolutionary scent.

Rather oddly, every time I see the image on the bottle, before having focused, it looks like a bodybag to me. On closer examination, it proves to be some pillows on a bed. And maybe that's a good metaphor for the contents of the bottle as well.

Very nice, warm perfume for a special evening. It smells a bit sweet, like vanilla, with something light warm woody and a little jasmine...

Very sexy, feminine, attractive and chique perfume. I love it very much! It's a pity this was a special edition only on sale at the airport.

This smells like the morning sun on your skin, the kind that lets you know as it caresses you through the cool that the day will be scorching later on

And also there are creamsicles. But in a good way.

Lighter than 5:40 pm in Madagascar, but still warm and enveloping. Easy going. Vacation in a bottle. Another comfort scent of mine.
I cannot to smell anything :S

Oh... I don't think it's boring! It's a cuddly warming fragrance, as a matter of fact, one of my favorites! I sense mostly vanilla, than orchid and maracuja. It's great but doesn't last very long on me. 'Ts great!!
Scent: 10/10
Lasting power: 3/10
Oh and what is sillage? :0)
Another boring citrus/vanilla blend. The grapefruit in this is exceptional, very realistic and fresh, but in the end, it's just another citrus vanilla scent.

I like it, but I prefer 5.40 P. M. in Madagascar, it lasts longer and it's more memorable.

Kenzo in Bali is a pleasant smell with strong vanilla and flowery notes, also nice grapefruit. All in all stays rather close to skin but more than 12 hours on me, that's good. It's darker than Kenzo in Madagascar, actually it brings flowers and fruit covered in chocolate to my mind, or a room in semi-darkness, spring or summer, morning is near, air blooms. Comforting and subtle, a bit similar to Madagascar in climate but different ( it's thicker, Madagascar is more as if a cloud was flowing around you).
I'd say it's a fragrance good for days you just want to feel comfortable, nice, you're tired of too sophisticated fragrances and as if you went to hot countries. I've never been to Bali, so hard to say if it shows the real atmosfere in the place, but I really admire these fragrances - stops to show atmosphere of nature and places I've never been to.

The bottle looks nice. What the fragrance lacks is I wish there were better quality ingredients here.

In my opinion it's oriental-vanilla or even oriental gourmand (but not imitating food!)

Lasting power: 3,50/5
Fragrance: 3,7/5
Sillage: 3/5
Bottle: 4,80/5

A pleasant smell, but the common good. There hidartantes lotions you buy at pharmacies and suermercados smells very similar. Despite being mildly sweet, can be frec, something like a passion fruit popsicles ... The fund vanilla is very cozy, is not dense, but that evaporates and leaves a touch of purity to the skin as well ... Think of a leaf with a green and fresh passion fruit mousse on top. That's how I feel when using this perfume! But there's a catch, it's a scent that is not noticed, have to get up close to see, lasts up to 4 hours on my skin

To be in Bali right now and wake up to fresh fruit, followed by warm, milky, jasmine infused rice pudding for breakfast...

Really, it's that simple, but good. I'm reminded very much of Lavanila Laboratories Grapefruit Vanilla--lush but sparkling at the same time with a good quality base.

one of my friens used this, since i smelled i triedto find it but unfortunately i couldnt find it where i live.
she says that the salesman told her that really in bali in 7:15 am flowers makes the air smell like paradise and this parfume has been created to smell like that!

Delicate yet sensual, discreet and lovely, this perfume is a true beauty covered in a veil of modesty.
I love it, the flowers, vanilla and passion fruit are so superbly blended, it smells very "niche" if I can say that.
This perfumes is indeed sweet and humid, smells like rays of sunshine on wet flowery gardens or jungle. It has a salty undertone, almost like skin covered in ocean water warming in the sun.
Silage is minimal, lasting power less then average too. The bottle, quite hideous. What were they thinking?
I don't understand why Kenzo would create this little beauty, and give it so little power....
Recommended because it's truly a beautiful skin scent, but it should definitely be stronger.

I was very excited to try this scent for a few reasons. First of all, "7:15 am in Bali"? I mean, come on! That sounds wonderful! If a perfume can transport me to a morning in Bali, it's definitely worth a try. And second of all, the reviews on here were very good, people seem to love it.

I loved it too when I finally got my hands on a small decant. It's deliciously sweet and summery, like the smell of sunscreen and dry oil on sundrenched skin. The jasmine and vanilla envelop you in a comforting blanket of scent. It is easy to wear, not offensive to people around you, and works really well as a summer scent.

However, the love affair didn't last long. I'm not sure why, but shortly after smelling it for the first few times, I started picking up on a sharp note. And every time I smelled it after that, my nose went straight for that sharpness. Maybe it's the grapefruit or passionfruit, but it's like coming across a slice of lemon inside a rich chocolate cake. It takes away from the rich mellow sweetness, and ruins it for me a little bit.

I'll still wear the rest of my decant and maybe even venture into buying a full bottle if I see one, because it is quite a nice scent. But the short staying power and sharpness make it difficult to really love.
I use it to go to college, it's not a strong fragrance, but it's delicious! Everytime I use it I feel good. The fixation is very good in my skin, above 5 hours.
well,it is nice fragrance but nothing special. For me it is light,really light version of Amour. Lasting power minimal.

bali smells more gourmand than floral fruity on me. got a hint of fresh fruits on top, later it settles to soft rounded sweet vanilla.

i am not a huge fan of vanilla dominated base notes, but this one was just perfect on my skin. it is light, yet sweet without sticky cloying artificial sweetness that i usually get from gourmand smelling perfumes.

this one is not that easy to get though... kinda regretted i didnt get this one the moment i saw it...

7:15 am in Bali is a creamy wonder. It starts, and finishes, the same on me which makes me very happy. It's a creamsicle reformed into a high end, low lit, romantic restaurant, fine dessert. This would be a custard delicately, a lightly browned top, surrounded by creamy orange and vanilla sauces lightly drizzled on the plate. The creamsicle effect is most likely the passion fruit blended with the vanilla but it's very soft and unassuming and I love it.

It stays close to the skin after the opening but it's well worth the effort to re-apply if needed. For me it conjures up a humid steamy summer evening out. It isn't necessarily sexy, more warm and slightly sultry. I just picked up a full bottle after burning through my sample vial. I agree with nathalieZ, this is definitely more feminine.

this is delightful, without being neither lifealtering nor a masterpiece - but I find myself returning to this fragrance, everytime I get the chance and am sad of not owning a bottle!
it's a comfy, not too fruity-floral with one the best measured natural vanilla notes I've smelled so far. The passionfruit stars in this fragrance, along with a silky touch of vanilla-ed flowers.
Only critic: Why only selling at AP and as limited ed?

The opening was a delight! I couldn't tell it was grapefruit--just something citrus. It almost began as a light orange creamsicle on me. The passionfruit kept the grapefruit from being to bittersweet & citric. But the middle notes turned into something not so pleasing to my senses--almost the same way that Moschino Funny dried down on me. This wasn't as bad though. It turns almost into a powdery vanilla with a hint of citrus/fruity flavor after the middle notes go away. I'm on the edge over this one. Sillage isn't great (but I only have a sample). Might be different in spray form. It's been on me for 3 hours so far, and still seems to remain noticeable if you're in close proximity of me. Will update when it begins to fade completely.

Something about it reminds me of Oscar de La Renta Fresh Vanilla.

I was flirting for several month with this perfume, in each airport i passed.
Finally decided to buy but then the next one appeared (madagascar) creating a big dilemma :) finally i went for Bali, mostly for the passionfruit-orchid combination.

7:15 AM in Bali captures a calm, romantic mood. Jasmine meets a green orchid note, floating in a sea of vanilla.

It is rich, intense and heavy, but does not float too far from the skin. It is intimate and holds a secret in its slow and languid composition.

A man can wear this for evening or romantic occasions, because it does have a slightly woody undertone, as long as it is not overdone.
I like it again and again, it's perfect for hot weather. It's not disturbing very sweet and soft.

7.15 in bali
the box, the bottle, the name that picked, instantly takes my mind away off of my body and sharply taken to bali

sunset at tanahlot, dinner at jimbaran, sunrise at sanur, and other magical moment at magical place there

7.15am in bali must be the alternative for those who need a vacation but have no time
this is awesome

Hi!
I absolutely loved the smell of this perfume when I first found it at an airport duty free.
However the fragrance really does disappear quickly from my (male) skin - I applied some at the departing and arriving airport and when I got home an hour later it was only slightly perceptible ...
I might buy it if I find it on sale somewhere, but at about EUR 50 per 50ml EdT I would hope for a little more "bang for the buck" ...
Regards, Markus

I got a small sample from this wonderful fragrance and when I tested, I knew: I will buy a whole bottle.
The fragrance is soft, not too strong, but fit to my skin very well. When dries down, I feel vanilla and orchid, and - it’s interesting - feel some coconut notes (although not contains coconut). It’s not similar, but the character of this fragrance on my skin reminds me to JLO Miami Glow. When I wear, my feeling is the same: hot summer nights at the sea. I'd rather name it 7:15 PM in Bali.
I enjoy this fragrance very much though I have to agree it doesn't last long. This perfume I find sweet and soft as a morning with beloved one.

I'm not sure what's going on for me with this perfume, but I can't smell it very well. It appears to me to be so faint and fast-fading on my skin that I am beginning to wonder if I am anosmic to it. What I can smell is a faint floral that smells like a pleasant fabric softener. I've never had a perfume fade so quickly on my skin, which made it very disappointing. Might be a nice match for someone who is looking for a very soft floral.
bought it and instantly it became this period's favourite! very feminine, not too bold, gentle, might be a bit stronger.. but no probs, still it's adorable!
I only can smell orchid and vanilla... but also liked it, for a man it´s diferent. I use to work and to sleep coz it makes me feel confortable.

i think it is really special because you feel like you want to bath in the scent the instant you smell it. i tried it at the airport first and couldn't forget it so i got it on the flight back. i wear it nearly everyday because it makes me feel extremely comfortable.
I love the sweet and sour openning, but later it becomes soapy on my skin and just fades away very quickly:(

A nice, light, "low-pressure" perfume. Could be a bit more twisted, i like it and use it on an everyday basis, but it's not special or exciting. May be it's for those days when you don't really know what mood you are in? :)

I bought it from the airport without waiting for the test results.Normally I adore Kenzo and I was very impressed about the name and the package. But for the scent I would say that jasmine and passion fruit is so weak (or maybe just on me) I can slightly smell orchid and vanilla but not so warm as usual, mostly in a masculine way. It obviously didn't fit to my skin very well, I have to renew it 2-3 times a day.It is definetely a light fragrance without any significance. I am curious about the way it smells on men, I guess it would be better.

it´s not!!!
I expected sth really special and unique, but it´s just a flat fruity, undefined floral.bad.....

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Magnolia Kenzo
review_content: I still remember when this limited "Eau de Fleur" line was launched. I tried all five at a local Sephora (the camellia was not available then). And this one! So elegant and airy...Like when it's still warm but you feel a transient sense of cool air in early fall. You look up and see the high, endless clear-blue sky.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Magnolia Kenzo
review_content: Acquatic but also creamy magnolia, soooo femenine. Love it.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Magnolia Kenzo
review_content:
I've been neglecting my bottle of this for years, I'm ashamed to say. After I bought it I went through a niche perfume phase which led me away from the simple beauty of fragrances like this. I discovered Eau de Fleur de Magnolia the other day during a clean out and have been wearing it constantly. I've looped my way back to this, and to a better appreciation of simplicity done well.

Eau de Fleur de Magnolia is a tender, creamy floral with a pronounced citrusy topnote. Despite its delicacy it has some tenacity, about 5-6 hours on me. It's spring here and soon the magnolias will be in bloom and I'll be able to compare them to the perfume. Still, Eau de Fleur de Magnolia is beautiful regardless of how close to nature it is. This is the only magnolia soliflore I've ever smelled so I don't know how it compares to others, Frederic Malle's for instance, or Acqua di Parma's. Again, it doesn't matter.

It was only ever a limited edition which is a terrible pity because it deserved better. It could be the summer signature for an elegant woman of any age. Good taste has no age.

Sorry tantalise with a review of long-gone fragrance, but if you do happen to come across a bottle, grab it.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Magnolia Kenzo
review_content: Oh my Lord! This is so divine!! Creamy magnolia with a little citrus in the background. I used to be addicted to Magnolia by Yves Rocher, but, this is just as good, if not, a little better. If you are afraid of florals, you should try this one , because it's very light.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Magnolia Kenzo
review_content: how can you detect gardenia when there is no gardenia in it? :/

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Magnolia Kenzo
review_content: Creamy warm lemony gardenia . beautiful but no sillage whatsoever :(

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Magnolia Kenzo
review_content: Realistic and creamy magnolia blossom, its not overwhelmed by citrus at all, but give this little touch of zest to flower. Very easy to wear and enjoy for every day or for spring clean feel, going for ladies lunch or for tea-room. It doesn't remind me of Magnolia Yves Rocher, more like Orchidee Yves Rocher, slightly spicy and gentle fragrance.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Magnolia Kenzo
review_content:
Having never sniffed a magnolia blossom, I can't vouch for the precision of the accord in this fragrance. However, going only by Eau de Fleur de Magnolia, I'd guess they're lemony-creamy florals.

This is light, linear, genial and utterly inoffensive. I often reach for it when nothing else seems to appeal, particularly on hot days.

It layers well with other light citrus scents or scents with a coniferous note. On this warm July day, I'm wearing it layered with Jo Malone's Verbenas of Provence and am very pleased by its blend with the lemon and cypress notes in the Jo Malone.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Magnolia Kenzo
review_content:
I would love to love this perfume. I bought it blindly and I like it, not love. The citrus is overpowering and the magnolia note seems to be lost among the citrus. I have find memories of l'occitane eau de Val and was hoping it would smell a bit similar. This one is great for hot summer days as it is a clean scent

Edit: after a month of wearing this, I have grown to love this perfume. Granted the citrus is still screechy, I can now detect the magnolia note which is creamy and lovely

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Magnolia Kenzo
review_content: Lovely light scent that starts with a citrus note and devolves into the magnolia scent. Its VERY light, nice for summer, but not too much longevity.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Magnolia Kenzo
review_content:
This is a very beautiful, creamy magnolia fragrance with a delightful citrusy opening. Unfortunately Eau de Fleur de Magnolia was limited edition, but if you do happen to stumble on some going cheap, grab it. It was composed by Francis Kurkdjian before he set up his own house and started charging big bucks for his perfumes.

Eau de Fleur de Magnolia is not especially long-lasting. To me it is rather unsexy and overall is a little too polite and discreet for me. I agree with the very first reviewer, at the bottom of the screen, that this is an introverted scent. I'm an introvert myself so, paradoxically perhaps, I prefer my fragrances bolder than this. It makes me think of a person who strives so much to demonstrate her elegance and good taste that she fears making any sort of statement at all.

But I have found a use for my full bottle of Eau de Fleur de Magnolia: I spray it in the bath as the water is running. (You can do this with any perfume.) It makes the bath and the bathroom smell delicious. Add a little unscented bath oil, and bath time feels like slipping into a warm silk negligee.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Magnolia Kenzo
review_content:
I stumbled upon this fragrance while searching for perfumes with Magnolia notes. Bath and Body Works' Magnolia Blossom was one of my favorite fragrances of all time and since chances of them bringing it back are VERY slim I decided to try to find something to take its place.

I bought Eau de Fleur de Magnolia because of the good reviews, and one that even mentions BBW's fragrance. I am not disappointed - Eau de Fleur de Magnolia is GORGEOUS. It is the only soliflore that I have bought thus far. It is a good, clean, sunny floral that takes on a wonderful creaminess as it dries down. I have to say, it doesn't smell like I remember Magnolia Blossom smelling - but, to be fair, I haven't actually owned/smelled Magnolia Blossom personally for a few years at least. There is something about Eau de Fleur de Magnolia that is both invigorating and elegant. I have never smelled true magnolia, but if this is any indication of what they smell like I can guarantee I would love them, too!

I am sad that there is such limited availability of this fragrance. This gorgeous, feminine number ranks among my favorite fragrances of all time.

EDIT: Holy staying power!! I STILL smelled this on my wrist this morning and on my sweatshirt. It smells so heavenly!

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Magnolia Kenzo
review_content:
I have been searching a long time in reality and my dreams to find a magnolia fragrance that actually features the magnolia blossoms from the southern U.S. Let me tell you, THIS IS IT. I hardly get much of the citrus, as this fragrance is not like a Guerlinade which often starts with a big citrusy bite, and then calms to the rest of the story. This fragrance is simply, beautifully, a magnolia sole flore. As time renders the fragrance, it feels more acquatic and ethereal. This could be seen as a negative but since I am not a big floral fragrance lover, this is a positive for me.

When I spray this, I am immediately taken back to my grandfather's farm. My grandmother had many very large magnolias in her yard along with about 100 diffferent varieties of Irises. They lived not far from the Chesapeake Bay a little north of Norfolk, so the summers are very hot and humid. The smell of these lovely magnolia blossoms carried and hung in the air like the heaviest velvet.

This fragrance brings forth the magnolia in all it's dark green glossy leaves, white flowers with yellow/orange stamen and interior. If eating a magnolia blossom burst all it's flavor into your nose and mouth, you'd have this fragrance!

Thank you Kenzo for making a fragrance that makes a southern gal smile.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Magnolia Kenzo
review_content:
This fragrance smells much more orange citruses to my nose rather than magnolia. As a huge magnolia scent lover, I don't like that fact. Besides, it's not a magnolia scent that I like.

Not bad, but not my cup of tea.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Magnolia Kenzo
review_content: Although I love this perfume, magnolia is not very detectable here. Magnolia is not a strong smelling flower of course so maybe that is why . The lasting power is not good , no one ever smelled it on me or noticed the scent . Not even me!! there are perfumes that you can smell for ever and ever and even if no one complimented you , you would be happy coz you can enjoy how you smell and how the perfume makes you feel . But this one you can neither smell it be uplifted by it coz you do , nor any body else can too! so for me this is one of the best smelling perfume for 1 hour or so then gone baby gone...

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Magnolia Kenzo
review_content: This is so pretty - but so delicate! A beautiful pure magnolia, which I have been searching for. But magnolia is not I think a very heavy flower by any means, which is a part of its value I think, it's dainty feminine fragrance. To me this is a floral fragrance for people who don't really like perfume. This is such a lovely light scent. Shame it's a limited edition.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Magnolia Kenzo
review_content: It captures well the smell of magnolia I know from my childhood. It is a clean, light and somehow stoic scent. Not warm. It is also rather discreet. I would not buy it for myself but would not object if I were given this perfume.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Magnolia Kenzo
review_content:
I love the scent of magnolia blossom and was actually looking for a soliflore when I came across this one online. Hmm, magnolia blossom and citrus together?

WOW! This is an amazing combination. Pure sunshine in a bottle. Fleur de Magnolia starts off with a generous blast of lemony citrus, which burns off quite quickly.

The end result? A delicate, natural and beautiful magnolia blossom scent with an ever so slight citric twist. Bright, uplifting, cheerful and warm.

I do believe I have found my new favorite summer scent!
FYI,
For anyone who misses BBW magnolia blossom, IMO, This one is all that and more!!

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Magnolia Kenzo
review_content: God, I was so disappointed with this one :( Magnolia is my favorite spring tree and I was looking forward to smell it...But I sprayed it on my wrist and about five minutes ago...NOTHING, ABSOLUTELY NOTHING...I did not understood...I don't know if it has something to do with my skin Ph or what...

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Magnolia Kenzo
review_content: very nice perfume, but too ephemeral...

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Magnolia Kenzo
review_content: It is a nice refreshing perfume, a real magnolia with citruses. I liked it but I always sneezed when I sprayed myself with it, it had too much alcohol, I think.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Magnolia Kenzo
review_content: It evokes well Magnolia grandiflora flowers, the most commonly grown here in southern Europe: their lemon, creamy, spicy scent; their thick, ivory petals... A primitive and beautiful plant; the smell of its flowers has something in common with the smell of Paeonia, another antique: a peculiar softness, nothing romantic, very joyful, sensuous, fragile, even hurting... but true.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Magnolia Kenzo
review_content: This one is definitely the best out of the range. A gentle, even innocent, fresh and light fragrance that has nothing redundant in it. I've never been much into 'over-simple' scents but there's something very special and intriguing in this particular fragrance. The only thing that bothers me is its weak staying power as it vanishes quite quickly, unfortunately.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Magnolia Kenzo
review_content: I think it's one of the best in the collection. I have this and Silk.. first it smell like lemon and later it turn to floral scent... Love it

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Magnolia Kenzo
review_content:
between magnolia and citruses I smell citruses more clearly.
yeah,it's all about citruses and it's very fresh.I think it's better to call it a floral-fruity rather than a pure floral.
this is one of the most simple perfumes.there isn't anything sophisticated here.but it's lovely.
I like "fleur de soie" more.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Magnolia Kenzo
review_content: Once I wore it to date with a man in November last year. It was a fabulous night indeed. From then on, I will think of him as long as I spray the perfume into the air. I close my eyes and take a deep breathe, yes here he comes.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Magnolia Kenzo
review_content:
I won this fragrance in a drawing (Thanks, Now Smell This!) and haven't smelled the other two in the series.

I do get a burst of fresh, light citrus in the top notes - I think perhaps mandarin, not bergamot - but it does not last more than five minutes. Very quickly I smell freesia, and lemony-creamy magnolia. As the fragrance wears on, I begin to get lily of the valley along with the freesia. After a few hours, the scent plays out (normal for an edt strength), with just the remnant of the light florals on the skin, rather than the basenotes one might expect (white musk? woody notes).

Clean, fresh, pretty, and ladylike. This fragrance is one of those pleasant background scents every woman needs, for when you want to smell nice but unmemorable.

The bottle is generally rectangular, with a wavy shape not obvious in the photos, and has a nice substantial feel in the hand.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Magnolia Kenzo
review_content:
I agree with the others.
I think this one is the best in this collection.
I don't get any citruses, just pure, gentle, silky flowers.
Nice and discreet, but doesn't 'strike' me.
Definitely a spring fragrance :)

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Magnolia Kenzo
review_content: I LOVE the Eaux de Fleur Collection. This one is so creamy and light at the same time - perfect spring fragrance.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Magnolia Kenzo
review_content: i agree with black bacarra, this is the best of the three.. the magnolia-citrusy scent is so fresh and light.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Magnolia Kenzo
review_content: Among the Kenzo eau de fleur range this is my favorite. Very similar to Acca Kappa's Calycanthus but the magnolia in this has a creamy floral quality like expensive scented European soaps. A variation of a clean scent.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Magnolia Kenzo
review_content: ｎａｔｕｒａｌ，　ｐｕｒｅ，　ｓｉｍｐｌｅ　ａｎｄ　ｉｎｔｒｏｖｅｒｔ．

***Update about one year in***
Well DAAAANG! So, I e owned my bottle of the latest formulation of Kemzo Jungle Homme for about a year now and while initially I was NOT at all impressed with the performance, its just gotten better and better over-time! Id noticed slight improvements the first vouple.months in, but NOE after not having used it in about 5 nonths I pulled it out, did a couple spritzes on my arm and its REALLY projecting and is lasting much longer that it did (Especially in the begining.) Lemme tell ya'll those 2 little spritzes on my forearm are continuously reaching my nose and seems much more rich, deeper and the top notes arent leaving my skin fast like it used to.

My advice (IF you own a lot of frags) is try to not use it too much so as to NOT waste it trying to over-spray so you can get decent longevity. I mean Im NOT exaggerating, the different is pretty drastic and although this is considered sort of "A cheapy" , it is SOOO worth the wait! So just wear it a few times to let air in your bottle, then put him back in his box and put him away for a few months! A STELLAR unique, Fresh/Spicey fragrance! The Cardamom and Mate with lime and the Sanflewood base... AMAZE-BALLZ! I NOW give this little "Hidden Gem an 8.5 outta 10.. Plus this has been discontinued guys! But its still available and affordable so order yourself a bottle! I'M So glad I did and that I waited so it "Maturated" properly! Thanks for taking time to read my thoughts on Kenzo Jungle Homme!

This scent is amazing when smelled right after skin application, however the great oriental warm amber/woody/balsamic smell is gone after 3 minutes.

Actually all the perfumes are doing it more or less, but especially this one is doing it a lot. I like the initial smell, but the after-smell is not so great in comparison to other parfumes.

The guy from below is right. he gave out the base. Perfumes are no longer the same. All those charming scents that were great 5-19-15 years ago, smelled, tasted, played. Now, in the new version, there is only a pale shadow of them. It's a piece of shit. Yaano's perfumery took a wrong turn and became obsessed with 2 notes - sickly sweet fragrances and akigalawoOd. perfumery is no longer about olfactory art, but about the conveyor belt. It's the buzzers that are to blame. They don't give a fuck, they treat everything like an endless social media feed with 15-second clips.

I’m reviewing a 50ml bottle with the older style packaging, ie, “Kenzo Jungle Pour Homme” written inside the green box in the centre.

Make no mistake, this comes from a time when fragrances were intentionally designed as works of olfactory art to be sprayed, truly taken in, and savored. Things have sadly gone downhill since, with the current climate of churning out as many bubblegum, sugary elixir flankers as possible each financial quarter to feed the drooling social media algorithm-addicted basics who buy whatever influencers tell them to buy.

This? Fragrances with this much pre-conceived thought, focus, and vision feel completely alien in 2025. Like they were created on an entirely different planet. Designer houses took creative risks back then. Putting trends aside, there is absolutely no way this fragrance would ever make it past the focus panel/product/marketing approval stages in the current landscape we find ourselves in. Because no one has the balls to take creative risks anymore.

The slight animalic funk coming from the mate note that hovers in the background gives this a “carnality”. Really earthy and human.

Smells like making love to a woman on the packed, dry earth of the Serengeti savanna under a clear, moonlit sky next to a guaiac wood (palo santo) crate filled with limes and jars of spices. This is citrusy, earthy, woody, sweet, sour, and spicy all at once with a slight “sweat” type of accord humming in the background but I mean that in a very good way. Maybe there's also some dried Zebra dung funking away in the distance for added measured haha.

Longevity/performance, even on my older bottle, is not the greatest. But overspray this bad boy, enjoy the ride, then smile once it’s over. Knowing you’re always only ever one spray away from returning to that far-flung African trading post on the savanna.

I bless the rains down in Africa.

8/10

Kenzo Jungle for men:
Just received this in the mail and applied it post shower. The middle notes are similar to those found in Versace Blue jeans, another 90’s scent. Jungle for sure has some similarities to others released in 1998. Armani Emporio comes to mind. Jungle has a good sweetness to it to offset the woody notes. It is an Eau De Toilette so apply it liberally. Perfect evening cologne for the summer, depending on the temp you could get away with it being a summer daytime as well.

When I first smelled Kenzo Jungle Homme, I recognized the DNA of AESOP Marrakech Intense. It is spicy with cardamom and sandalwood with an earthy dry down with patchouli. I like it but it does not stay long enough.

Kind of wet/humid and dry/dusty at the same time, untamed, slightly erotic and primitive. It's also like a savory-spicy-sweet gourmand, oriental food. I think it will be nice in warm weather and a little bit of sweat, rain or sun. It's challenging for sure though

Very unique woody fragrance. Clean, confident scent. I received it as a gift many years ago, I didn't wear it much at first, but gradually grew on me.

In my experience, the longevity is around 6-7 hours. Overall, the scent is a 6/10. It may be polarizing for some people. I recommend trying a sample before purchasing.

Unlike anything else a truly unique and creative scent profile... I was walking near the beach the other night and smelled it on someone passing by... Wow...the sillage took me back in time, MANY years!

Nose Note #274

Great. There's this interesting but somewhat funny sweet aspect about it. I wondered at first what this accord might be. I guess it's the citruses mixed with the typically spicy notes of cinnamon, nutmeg and cardamom. There's also something bubble-gummy about it. And I also get the Byredo Gypsy Water comparison. Jungle is more about citruses, Gypsy Water is more about spices. To me Gypsy Water smells like indian workers in Dubai, or just like some indian incense.

Really very interesting.

Lately I find myself liking the 90s and 00s perfumes much better than the modern stuff.
This is great.

Ive already reviewed Kenzo Jungle Homme, but I want to offer up my experience thus far as a word of advice to whomever is planning on purchasing this (possibly discontinued) GEM of a masculine, woody/spicey/fresh, unique scent.

So when Id first purchased my very first bottle of Jungle homme a few months ago, I was pretty dissapointed with the performance over all. It did NOT seem to last over 2 hours, and the sillage was a bit too intimate for my liking. So, what I would do is I would definately over-spray this scent liberally so I could get atleast moderate performance out of Kenzo Jungle Homme. Loved the scent, but yeah after watching review after review stating that it had "Solid Performance", I felt completely let down. Now OF-COURSE its bc of reformulations as this scent has been around since "1998", so I was sorta expecting the poor performance all be it with fingers crossed in hoped that it hadn'tbeen completely neutered!.

Well, Id try wearing it again here and there while over-spraying with minimal performance improvement over-time which caused a pretty good dent in my bottle, but still, no drastic improvements. Well after 2 or 3 months of not wearing Kenzo Jungle, I picked him up again and was pleasantly surprised at how much the performance had improved! Its now WAY MORE PRESENT, Lasts quite a bit longer on skin and ESPECIALLY on clothes where I can clearly smell it even into the following day, and it lasts a good 5 to 6 hours on skin. Plus Im not even having to over-spray too much for it to give me decent sillage/projection and longevity.

So my advice is, if you really wanna grab a bottle of this 90's gem of a fragrance. Wear it a couple times spraying a decent amount out, but then put it away for at-least 2 1/2 to 3 months so as NOT to waste as much as I have. Trust me, your patience will certainly pay off, plus again, I do believe this is or will be discontinued soon so it wont be as easy to come by sooner rather than later! Thanks for reading my thoughts on this great scent! Blessings! And remember... BEEE PATIENT!🫠😉

I first reviewed this 11 years ago and I remember it being really strong and more complex. It used to be able to fill up a room with its aroma. The bottle I have from 2018 is more mellow and more citrus forward with some spices and woody elements later in the dry-down. The older formulation was more of a cooler weather scent because of how strong it used to be with the spices and cedar notes but the newer formulation can be worn during the warmer months. It's still a good scent and unique either way but I wish it was closer to how I remembered it.
This one’s good, got a lil funk in it but a good funk. You want this funk. Jungelous.
