It amazing how fragrance can giving us various senses of feeling. While others mentioned Kenzo Tokyo as modern city, spice shop and nightlife in Asia. I feels like Tokyo captured an image of Tokyo city but not modern world Tokyo like in the ad. Its more an old time Tokyo like in 20-30's. Sepia and monochrome. Like picture of old wooden japanese houses and brown paper.(But not melancholic and artistic as Mitsouko).

About the scent everybody here said it all. Its a combination of fresh herb spicy, dry citrus and green tea fragrance. Very Kenzo in character.

I don't dislike this fragrance for the overall smell, but for what it delivers. A 2-3 hr of presence, if you are lucky to get even that, is not my idea of spending on a perfume which does have a good opening. Spicy, citrus and exciting in the start it end up in its dry-down (if you can call it that) within a few minutes. If someone tells me i smell good after 4-5 hours of spraying, i might be intrigued and might come to a conclusion that its olfactory saturation that renders the perception of this fragrance to a complete non existing. It would still not change the fact that if i don't get a whiff of this once in a while, it just wont do it for me. My most disappointing fragrance purchase. I got it at, what i thought was a great bargain. I still feel mugged. Shame.

Scent 6/10
Longevity 2/10
Silage: none from what i perceive.

Update: Think I may be completely anosmic to this blend! I can only smell it when i bury my nose in my wrist. Sorry K Tokyo, its not you, its me.

Very spicy and it last for hours.
I wore it this morning, came home this evening, showered and i can still smell it. So you are warned, it last!

I "blind" bought this for hubby based on your comments, our positive experience with Kenzo scents and the ginger opening. Thanks for the tips. It is a new favorite of mine and great for fall.

This smells like a contrast of light and dark. At first a bright blast of citrus, ginger and zing tickles the nose. Then, the top notes zip away quickly, and a wonderful five-spice aromatic woods aroma plays for a few hours. Longevity is a bit modest yet the arm's-length sillage is nice for those who want to smell it. It won't overpower.

I like that it is not sweet but is zesty. Also I'm thinking that this will not smell good on some people. It does work in our case. After buying the original m7 about 10 years ago, this is the best scent for cooler weather I've smelled that we both like.
Opens really well. Dries down like Visit but has a Tea scent too.
It took me three years to find it. Thanks Fetiche :)
horrible for me! to heavy

Gorgeous scent. I find it very very similar to Omnia Crystalline, which is one of my favourite fragrances. I rarely come across a masculine fragrance which I like this much. Pink pepper, which I love, is very noticeable, and so is ginger, which is also one of my favourite notes, and the mixture of notes is really well achieved and balanced. This is really my taste. Love it. I only wish it were a bit stronger. It seems that they are at last making more creative and nicer scents for men and getting rid of those horrible prejudices, commercial and of other natures. Stayng power is not great, though.

There is no longevity or "drydown" to talk of in the first place. Hard to believe, but this scent simply vanishes in ten minutes. It should be used as an indoor perfume only where one can spray themselves every half an hour or so. Very disappointing, the more so because it smells great and is somewhat pricy.
I used an FM brand inspired by this... and wow people in the office noticed and I got a lot of compliments.. Could not forget athough people said I smelled like tea. woohoo! made my day!

Baked potato black pepper, grapefruit, cedarwood blast!

Dies down in no time at all. I wish it lasted longer
My father have this perfume.i don't know why i hate this perfume.for me it's to pungent and sharp..the scent makes me dizzy.maybe this scent not my kind of fragrance at all..

I wanted to like this so much - the concept was cool, as was the bottle, and I am also a big fan of woodsy scents.

But what you get is something that smells like a wet, mossy forest after the rain - very pungent. Which isn't bad in itself, but in this case it resembles some cheap Axe (Lynx) you buy at the supermarket...and that's really not a good thing.

Longevity is also a huge problem - non-existent.

Nice scent, very masculine, stays close to the skin. I really like peppery woody scents, this reminds me of Bang. This scent will fade out quick but its still worth adding to your collection because it's just that good! Go heavy on the trigger it will not over power. A comfort scent for me. I will test other Kenzno frags.

Being a big fan of this House, I had great expectations of this. The ad was so "flashy" and energetic, the bottle was gorgeous and the notes sounded SO intriguing to me. I was overjoyed to see a sample spray in a recent package from a fellow member, and waited to try it (as I usually do for smaller samples) for my review. I sprayed it one time on my hand; it was good, but kind of fizzled. I did a full wearing yesterday, and here are my thoughts...

Oooh a woody spicy from Kenzo!! *gets all excited*

*sprays on both arms, both elbows, both sides of neck and down the shirt* I should really smell awesome now!

Enter a cloud of clean clear citruses and warm, wet ginger; with LOTS of sharp dry pepper. OKAY...this is kinda "spicy/sporty", but we shall just wait and see where this goes! Cue a cool breeze (almost metallic in nature) of bitter (and I mean BITTER) orange and green tea. The tea is fresh (almost iced) and does create an interesting contrast to the sour opening and warm pepper. I love the drydown of guaiac and cedar; but where are the nutmeg and cloves I so wanted layered over the woods?!? *sniffs wrists and elbows again, puts head INSIDE shirt and sniffs DEEPLY* What gives...where did it go?!? Okay, others said I smelled great, but I could not (and I mean with my nose pressed against my skin) really smell much of anything but skin, hints of metal...and cool leaves and a faint wisp of pepper. Color me: DISAPPOINTED! I adore L'Eau (and it's considered "weak") and the Indigo flanker especially, AIR and Power; and even kind of dig most of the women's AMOURs and FLOWERs too. THIS? I can't help but feel like someone held something great under my nose (for 15 minutes) and said "You like that? Too bad...you can't have it! Nyah!! Nyah!!!"...I wanted the scents of fast paced life in the Ginza, cool green guaiac aromas of sap & leaves in the wind, shiso incense on the air, flashes of bright lights and ENERGY everywhere! *sighs* All I got was some sporty body spray with a fleeting longevity, and minimal sillage! Maybe, it is just my skin, but overall I can say everyone else liked it on me...and I may have liked it too, but something somewhere in my brain/olfactory system must have just "blocked it out". I hoped I would be like the guy in the ad: in jeans and plain white shirt, dancing with free abandon while those in power suits filed past me, and breathing in the night life of the largest city in the world. Instead, all I got was a feeling I had missed the last bullet train home.

Sillage: weak
Longevity: fleeting
Overall: 3/5

My first sniff of this was a single spray from a manufacturer's sample, the "full wearing" (for this review) was 7 sprays from that sample, now all but gone! Maybe...I need to find a tester SOMEWHERE and really do a REAL spritzfest of this and see if THAT makes any difference at all! This is the opposite effect or reading notes and going "Yeah-been there, done that!" and getting wowwed!! I wanted to try this for ages, perhaps I set my expectations too high...or maybe, just maybe, something in this does NOT agree with my chemistry at all.

I want to like this...
Everyone else likes it on me...
I just don't get it...

*sighs*

if you are like me and want to smell something different from the usuals then this what you go for.bought blind and cheap as well and will say it was money well spent for what am getting out of this bottle.
Am not going to bullshit anyone with notes and all here but this is a good spicy fragrance.the dry down is like a drug to me.i mean i just cant enough of it.It's simply awakening my senses and i dont usually say that about most fragrances,honest.

If I had relied on reviews from basenotes then I wouldnt have gone ahead to get it but to every nose his own and to me this is bliss.

recomend you try it.

I don't really like the top of this one because it' very spicy peppery and strong. However, the scent settles into something nice and less intense. Spiced tea with orangey lemon and herb. It's fresher and sweeter too. Everything just calm down to the point I can enjoy it. It's masculine, fun, and energetic. Perfect for a modern day/night lifestyle.

As a woman, I love wearing rich, woodsy and masculine scents, especially if they're infused with pepper or ginger. Most of the scents I wear that are of this calibre are very strong and at times, offensive. Kenzo Tokyo has a subtlety that doesn't bother me in the slightest. Its softness provides a clean and refreshing quality that I would have never expected.

The fragrance opens with light, watered-down citrus, pepper and tea. This blend is quite pleasant and refreshing. Its sensuality tends to immerge more on warmer skin or during the warmer months. With that thought in mind, Kenzo Tokyo has the versatility to be worn all year round.

I'd describe this fragrance as being sometimes sharp and sometimes smooth. The citruses, pepper and ginger keep the scent lively, yet the base of soothing woods and a hint of non-smokey incense keeps the scent grounded.

Sometimes I feel a little strange because Kenzo Tokyo does have some very masculine moments, but for the majority of the scent's development it keeps me entertained and I still feel like a woman wearing it.

I took a huge chance with Kenzo Tokyo, having decided to buy it blind based on reviews calling it a woodsy and gingery incense delight. Well, I am disappointed that there's not a whole lot of incense, but I am impressed with its subtle, gingery woods. I recommend.

ON the first try, I got astringent green notes, woody alcohol, almost sharp pine needles and booze, and definitely wood notes. Second try, it was orange juice with vetiver first on . It's definitely the trip it's supposed to suggest: a Westerner's jet-lagged first impressions of Tokyo and all her chaotic, deafening life. Fascinating and unisex. It does end very woody and peppery, so if that's a note you don't care for, forget it. But as far as edgy and neon-spangled, this is the ticket.

Tokyo goes Ginger, pink pepper, guaiac wood in that exact order and all other notes are complimentary. This is the only scent ive come across, in as long as I can remember, that has achieved the intended accords that are expressed on the tester bottles.
Starts with a sharp, almost repulsive Ginger accord that could well have done without the citrus harshness, then develops with a smoky, extreme-pepper accord (similar to that found in Marc Jacobs Bang) then finishes with the addition of guaiac wood.
One well worth trying, much more wearable that Bang, but the initial spray may be a bit much for some mainstreamists. I found the initial spray a bit weird.

This is a very unique frag and It's one of my favourites. It begins very spicy until the tea note begins to dominate then the spicyness goes and it mellows into a zen like sort of state. It sticks to the skin within 1-2hrs so if you're trying to impress someone you'd prob have to invade their personal space.

Tokyo should be worn on rainy days. It complements the smell and I think the rain might actually help with the projection. If you're familiar with the frag, just imagine what it would smell like after the rain has fallen, the place is still damp and smell of the rain still lingers. My theory is that the warm moist atmosphere might actually prolong the life and quality of the smell.

with a little help from mother nature this smell will surpass amazing

8/10

Yet another recent purchase and addition to my beginner's collection. The only reason I would stop short of "loving" this cologne is the relatively poor staying power and sillage.

Tokyo definitely stays close to the (my) skin, but it is an amazingly unique blend of clean spice that I just couldn't resist. Many have commented that this a young fragrance, but I think just about anyone could safely get away with this one.

It's a shame that Kenzo fragrances smell so great but disappear so quickly on my skin.

This scent is the complete opposite of Wonderwood (Comme des Garcons) : it´s fresh, loud and spicy.
Whereas Wonderwood transports a feeling of quietness and contemplation Tokyo is the face of a metropole : buzzing with people, shrieking with noise, bursting with flavour.
Tokyo starts off with a citrus flash, tinging with firy spices, then the ginger comes into effect.
You will be fully awake by then :-)
Later on the pepper shows and is just as relentless but warm and embracing.
After a few hours Tokyo presents warm woods.

An uplifting and refreshing scent which I will reserve for warmer days. Tokyo is a nice new approach to a fresh perfume. By the way : I think it´s unisex.

I love this scent! My father used this one for a while, and maybe because of that I think that this smells like a real man! Both sillage and longevety is more than average on my skin! 6-8 hours. I have fairly dry skin, so 6-8 hours is actually very good! It is fresh, I get some citrus, and some delicious spices! Go for this one guys! It is very affordable! I paid about $40 US for a 3.4oz/100ml bottle, and that was included shipping to Norway.. Sometimes I even spray a couple of sprays before I go to bed! Thats how much I like it! :-) In my eyes, this is by far Kenzo's best offering! You just cant go wrong with this one!

I got this one at a sale from a store and it was a BOGO. Unbelievable type of deal for a great scent. This is an extremely modern fragrance, it is young but edgy at the same time. I think this is a pretty versatile scent and it can definitely be pulled out in the colder months. If you are looking for an oriental spicy that is easy on the nose, you should try this one out.

I LOVE THIS ONE. I bought it blind, thinking it would be something sharp and strong like Armani Attitude (based on a bare sniff of the cap) but I got something so much better!! The scent is subtle but in a good way. Imagine green tea with a dash of masculinity.

one of my fav kenzo frag.
very fresh scent.
not very lasting on my skin.
didn't like the bottle tho, looks like an axe to me IMHO.

7/10
Kenzo Tokyo fue lanzado hace ya 3 o 4 años, en todo caso el que no resulta original es el perfume de Natura el cual no tendrà mas de 1 año en el mercado.

Un perfume de caracter fuerte, diria que original si no hubiera olido el Homme de Natura, pero el especiado ,directamente la pimienta, se muestran con un cracter dominante... pobre fijacion, pero agradable rastro..

Imagine an extreme powerful black and white pepper punch at the few minutes, then comes the sweet patchouli warm scent for hours, dry down is mild patchouli. Lasting power very good, easily past 5 hours and silliage is good, people with blocked nose will be able to detect the strong peppery smell.

It is created with younger (20's) crowd at mind and it is funky, youthful and playful!

Finally tried this!
The first impress is very Kenzo way! :)
After a minute, it turns to very harsh pepper and ginger, that I dont like at all (althought pepper and ginger are my favourite motes).
But about 20' later, it turn to something totally diffirent, very soft tea and woody notes. The harshness is totally gone!

So there's a big separator in this perfume, that cut it to 2 diffirent parts. I've never see anything like this before!
Kenzo is always unique.

This sounds very interesting! Kenzo always has something different, spicy and oriental!
The signature bottle is catchy, it reminds me of nightlife of Asian cities, the energy of night parties! As I always remember and love that feeling.
And the commercial just double it!

Can't wait to try!

One of the most (if not the most) peculiar fragrances i've ever tried!
The opening is not a huge citrus blast, turning down quickly to the screaming green tea leaf.
Awesome unique smell. Love it for cold days and cold nights.
Sillage could be better.

Notes of lemon, ginger root, blood orange, shiso leaves, mate, clove, nutmeg, green tea, pink pepper, guaiac, cedar.






It has been created for the young crowd.
The aroma has been inspired by images and the cool vibe of a busy colourful night in the Japanese metropolis.
The result is kind of electric I must say, fruity and slightly peppery.

The ginger root is here the main key, the center of the attention, while the rest of the notes stays in the background, as the juice develops.

Tokyo starts gorgeous and zesty; There’s a explosion of citrus while the ginger reveals itself fiery and dewy accompanied with the sisho leaves.
This is my favourite part of the whole perfume.
The rest for me, loose credibility and interest.
After a little while the fragrance loses power and it gets close to skin scent, the projection turns minimal and "Tokyo" remains in your skin a delicate nice halo of ginger, herbal peppery and powdery tea with strokes of guaiac wood.

Not bad.
Tokyo is an interesting fragrance, but if it would keep the original fireworks from the top notes I would love it infinitely.

It’s a fact that Japanese community enjoy subtle perfumes.
I do like the perfume but, also, I do prefer shout out fragrances. It’s part of the mistery and the seduction.
The long lasting is acceptable.
I enjoy wearing the perfume but it is becoming one of those ones that I keep sniffing trying to recall the initial explode. Then nothing.

This one made me fell (sadly), neutral.

my man used probably all Kenzo editions, to the point that I'm not even sure which ones I prefered. However, this one was my pick for him so I remember it well because I loved its ginger note and found this parfume very sexy. I guess sexy for me does not equal his idea of man-ly parfume ;)anyways we compromised on power cologne which is sexy enough for me and not too femminine for him.

I just love the design on the bottle. It's the most beautiful thing I've seen in ages, for a perfume bottle.

It has the motion of the city caught visually. Like a train is zooming by you, or you're making time down a street and the lights are streaks.

True art.

I heard it`s been discontinued - what a pity.It is a perfect scent for a sexy urbanite, and even a girl can easily pull it off.It opens up vibrant, with juicy citrus and ginger, but it is not in-your-face juiciness, but a soft, purry one, like a lemon riccola! and the woodsy part comiing on strong and fast, like the night falls on the big city. I love the second part of Tokyo - the beautiful nutty/spicy mist...It is not romantic, I am afraid you can`t expect loyalty from this type of scent, it`s not going to give you any false hope!but it will go partying with you after a day of cold calculating in the office!

This fragrance is perfect for men who like to be relaxing and enjoying at evening with girlfriend or going out.
From the beginning is sharp citrus with exotic notes but the best part is when it is dry down. I love the dry down because it smells so romantic, elegant, sexy and I cant stop with smell myself all the time. I can somehow smell bamboo although it does not contain it. Bamboo with ginger, green tea and fresh notes make this fragrance a hit from my part.

I actually wanted to buy Jungle but following an impulse I bought Tokyo instead and that day I didn't regret it. It was suitable to many occasions and more wearable as a day fragrance.
I liked the smoky ginger-lemony opening very much and after 1 hour I enjoyed the fruity/green-tea/pepper/nutmeg combination which gives a nice oriental aura.
Some reviews said it's 'like Azzaro Visit if it was made by Kenzo' and I partially agree, but I like Visit much more.
Edit: After several days it had average sillage (close to skin) and longevity even for a modern citrusy-oriental fragrance. In the end I got sick of it and gifted to a good friend. My rank 6/10. ☣☣

I received it as a gift from my brother. A dream scent indeed. A very lovely oriental scent, though it's supposed to be a woody spicy. Longevity is not too great (like all Kenzo products), but yet it is satisfactory.

Ginger and grapefruits in the top note are fabulous. Only the pink pepper part is not much compatible to my skin, which is ignorable. When it dries down, the woody notes are so remarkable.

A good smell for everyday purpose, specially in fall and spring days.
modern, nice masculine scent in the kenzo way. we have here good mix of many spices (f.e. pepper and ginger)

What an awesome bottle! Very fitting with the name... or another cosmopolitan asian city...

Anyhow... I was expecting a burst of energy. Something fresh and citrusy.

I got the citrusy... but no burst. If there was one it vanished real quickly. This is actually a very subtle fragrance. This one stays very close to the skin boys.

But there's still an appeal to this fragrance. It's complex. It's not very virile but it's still masculine. It's for the elegant man. Not for Mr. Lumberjack or Mr Business Kingpin. It's urbanite, young yet organic and dewy/foggy. I understand where the name comes from. Japan is a fitting image.

The highlight here is the Tea note. It makes it interesting. It quite dominant in the dry down.

It's subtle and longevity is only ok. I like it but I won't buy it. Longevity is not worth it. It might be fitting for me but it's not the type of fragrance I am looking for. Still... a very interesting fragrance.

I like it but its not my favorite.I really wasted money on this scent because i really don't wear it that much.

smell a little bit like an eggnog ...

I realize that Kenzo calls my attention, even though I´m not a fan of most of its scents. Must be because the unusual character, the simple and creative bottles... As for Tokyo, it has ginger, its proeminent note, and I don't like ginger in a fragrance that much, but here works well. During its drydown the ginger becomes light, though this note follows the evolution until the end, which, by the way, is not that long. Could replace a lot of citric scents, by its difference ... a fresh ginger scent, or, like "jeca" said, "spicy fresh". But is a warm freshness, if you know what I mean. Slightly unusual, slightly pleasant, very hard to overdose.

Slowly it became one of my favourites scents.

I like this one so much. Reminds me the spice shops at eastern lands.
Very spicy especially with strong ginger accord.
For me it starts with spice blast and continues till end.
Good projection and lasting.

¡¡Decepcionante!! Una verdadera lástima porque el principio es buenisimo. Por eso me la compré.
Me puse de un probador del Corte Inglés, y me encantó. Claro, me puse en la mano y no me dí cuenta de lo poco que iba a durar. Eso es lo que le ocurre a este perfume, que dura muy poco. Tiene mucha fuerza al principio, es muy bueno, pero dura unos minutos.

A very nice clove fragrance that is also young. It is oriental, yet modern, with no excess on musky notes. It is really energizing without being too generic or exaggerated on the citrus notes that you find in a lot of fragrances. Original, yes.

Kenzo Tokyo reminded me of Fahrenheit at first but then after awhile it gives you that ginger fruity scent...it's either you hate it or love it. For Asian countries, this perfect for night out clubbing. Definitely not an everyday or a day fragrance. this scent evokes energy, fun and party...If you have experienced night life in Asian countries such as Singapore, Bangkok, Hongkong, Manila and Tokyo then this scent will remind you of it.

In some parts i can find a similar moment to azzaro vist in the woody point, but tokyo share other kind of aroma. The initial angle is very energetic, impulsive and expansive... then the calm is in the skin, a soft mix of aromatic lines mixed with a balanced line in notes. Luminous, comfortable and exotic.
The bottle is beautiful and the scent reminded me of nightlife and glamour in a very sophisticated way. Always thumbs up when it comes to party all night long.
In the start I found it very spice but then lasts a smell I don´t know how to explain to you, it remindes me a tipical brasilian dessert made with corn, milk, sugar and cinnamon lol ;-)

I find it absolutely irresistable. It's breezy, modern and urban with a perfect balance of citrus to open, along with woods, spices and greens to carry the body and drydown. Makes the wearer smell cool, confident and intriguing.
I find it really boring, nothing special. Along with Vintage, Tokyo should be the worst scennt of Kenzo.

I've read so many bad reviews about Tokyo by Kenzo, but I can't really understand the reason why.

For me, Tokyo is a delicious combination of orange, green tea and ginger. The strongest note in it is the ginger, and it lingers for around 5 hours on my skin.

It may not be groundbreaking, but it's nice, safe and suitable for any event.

I try to like it but...

Tokyo starts nice, fresh, green and humid, kind of exotic. it's like you are walking along the tokyo street in a rainy night. It's such a good mood!
But when you expect sth more romantic happened, it ends suddenly without a sign and leaves u in an emptiness of citrus notes.

That really makes me annoyed, I don't understand it at all!
This perfume is very elegant, spicy fresh in the Kenzo way.

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: For the 40th anniversary of the brand, Kenzo launched this collection of two fragrances in 2010, one for women and one for men called "Once upon a time". In the case of men, it is a fragrance not suitable for all audiences, which could perfectly belong to a niche house because of how challenging and different this composition is, which is a nutmeg bomb from start to finish, accompanied by ginger and coriander that They provide a certain heat but not so warm as at the same time it is refreshing thanks to the vetiver base that gives it a freshness and classifies it as an intense oriental woody, very ethnic and with a certain dirty and earthy vibe. For those who did not have the opportunity to find it in their year of the launch, I recommend that they try it now as a fragrance worthy of admiration and to have in your collection, that is, very sober and mature, not suitable for those under 30 years old.

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Homme Kenzo
review_content:
Ohhhh I forgot about this one...Is it still in production ? I doubt...This was a very spontaneous buy for me during a travel, and I was so satisfied - i remember it being very warm and spicy, just like mentioned in a previous review, pencil shavings vibe. I loved it a lot. Too bad that I didn't know its worth, now thinking it was such a treasure. It's the woody fragrance that is not dry but spiced up.

UPDATE: FOUND A BOTTLE UNEXPECTEDLY IN A LOCAL PERFUME STORE! Such a lucky incident, and it smells exactly like I remember, it's a nutmeg spice masterpiece. I shall give an updated review after catching up for a few days.

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: I got intrigued about this one so I found it in a good deal. It lingers around very nicely, and as first time wearing it, I can totally say I am pleased, I need to try in a warmer day to see how it performs.

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Homme Kenzo
review_content:
Nutmeg? Vetyver? Ginger? Yes, you can identify traces of them if you are told to do so. However, the mix of all of them seems to result in an unusual smell of coloured pencils. I don't know what to do with that. It reminds me of my childhood.

**

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: Very strong, almost medicinal scent of squeaky clean nutmeg soap. Soapy but not like in lavender/barbershop soapy. Linear and does not evolve very much. Somehow reminds me of scents from around the year 2000. More than vetiver, I also get a slightly sweet fig leaf-like scent. If you like "fresh out of the shower" smells this one could be for you.

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: I read that this was also marketed as "Kenzo Signature". Can anyone confirm? Kenzo Signature does not appear in the Fragrantica database. I tried a sample of Signature and it seems to match the notes listed above - nutmeg, vetiver, and ginger. Opens strong and if I based my rating only on that I would have given it a thumbs down. Once it mellows, it's nice but there's no 'wow' factor. Inoffensive and good for year round wear at the office. I'm a bigger fan of the original Kenzo Pour Homme.

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Homme Kenzo
review_content:
I hated it alot. It very loud and sharp perfume.

I would buy NOT it again.

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: Delicious. For me the best Kenzo. It is not as smooth as others.

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: A light woody spicy frag, the dry down is smooth and low key, just he way it should be,a classy juice.

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: good for 'winter and autumn days and nights', 'summer and spring nights'. its not heavy but strong, so no need to sprey it too much.

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: Tried this today and really enjoyed it. It has Kenzo DNA running through it. It has has a soft woody vetiver feel to it.To my mind it is Kenzo's version of Bvlgari's Man.

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Homme Kenzo
review_content:
Does anyone remeber "Good Life" from Davidoff? Sniff this Kenzo and there you go..
All in all is a nice and warm scent that puts smile on your face making you feel cosy.

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: it's not heavy. first spray nothing special. 15 min later, smells like ck free basenotes. I think similar of ck free. Very good woody scent. but ck free top note little different from kenzo. I prefer kenzo. But they are very ligt too.

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Homme Kenzo
review_content:
Smells like I'm in a strange, dense forest the likes of which I've never been to, and it has just finished heavily raining. But it's not a soft, fresh woody smell, I think
I've fallen face down into a plant I'm a bit scared of.
It's not a fresh scent, it's thick, but not heavy, a kid of pungent greenness to it that's still pretty nice. Definitely an autumn smell. Avoid this one in summer. I really don't know if I like this one.

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: Vetiver + nutmeg + ginger make a mix to the point of that none of these notes are prevalent alone. I get a scent a bit herbal and tart in the feeling.

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Homme Kenzo
review_content:
A EDT cool, and manly. Entry notes very opaque and strong, too forest middle notes of wet wood, a little spicy with hints of ginger, green wooden base notes.

I think you may be best classified as a woody aromatic or acuatic woody, with average, leaving a trail peaceful, nice. It has no power to use romantic or serious presence to an office, maybe casual outings with friends, working better day. It has a light touch as a cream or powder makeup at the end. If you like scents evoking a bit quiet and natural environment, the EDT is very good choice.

product_name: Once Upon a Time pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: i need to try it again, at first experience its very creamy, the nutmeg tune is very loud that make the rest of notes a shy light smell, in combination of notes i could tell that is something like almond and cream with a little green touch. Soon i have to write an update.

This is awesome but not a blind buy, it opens with floral (mid) and santal (strong) and it remains for like 2 hours then the santal (sandal) notes goes down and remains a beautiful floral-wood frangance with a very clean smell.
It last a lot, I sprayed 2 times on my arm and 15 hours later already I can still smell it on my skin.

I tried so hard to like the Kenzo Homme series and tried all the flankers, but in the end I realized that I don't like the salty scent. The only product I found usable was "Marine," but it felt too young. I think those who like salt and sea notes will love this series. It's very different and beautifully blended, but it makes me nauseous.

A smoky/floral take on the classic Kenzo Homme dark aquatic style.
To those who have tried this line before, you probably know what to expect, but I don't think it's redundant.
Lighter and more versatile than the EDP.
If you like the Kenzo Homme line then snap it up because it's supposedly a limited edition.
I perfer edt intense version much better

110ml versiyonunu 2500tl gibi güzel bir fiyata edindim marine temasını sevdiğim için kör alış yaptım fazlasıyla güzel bir koku bence homme edpye benzerliği var o kokuyu seviyorsanız bunu da fazlasıyla seversiniz gelelim kokuya odunsu kremsi ama marine temasını kaybetmemiş bir koku başlangıçta odunsuluğu ön planda ama zaman geçtikce daha kremsi bir hal alıyor ve tüm gün teninize kıyafetinize kene gibi yapışıyor tende kalıcılığı 12+ saat kıyafette günlerce kalır edt olmasına rağmen performans konusunda beast diyebilirim performansı dolayısıyla 4 mevsim de kullanılabilir ama çok sıcak yaz günlerinde bir tık boğabilir 3 4 fıs sıkmak yeterli olacaktır onun haricinde asla boğmaz sonuç olarak her anlamda kullanılabilir bir koku tavsiye ederim
somewhere between intense and marine, i think it may be the best one for the ones like me who think ,marine is too floral or intense is too "niche" like

I just got a sample of this and while I'm still testing it out, I'll say that IMO Fragrantica should separate the recent "Kenzo Homme" releases in the plastic bamboo bottles from the original "Kenzo Pour Homme" line. These new fragrances are all pretty similar (with the exception of the Eau de Toilette, which is a re-imagining of the original KPH) while everything in the old bottle style has been discontinued. I think doing this would cause less confusion.

Literally this scent has a nuclear performance, more than 12 hours of longevity the only matters is the whole line end up to the same DNA, anyway if anyone likes this line then go for Santal Marine, the most versatile of the whole line in my opinion.

Unfortunately, it smells similar to this whole Homme line, and I don't like that too much - except the EdT with a different DNA, very similar to the original 1991 pour Homme version, which I love.

Edit: Maybe it takes time... I already grew to like (and bought) Indigo.

I have a big dislike for woody ambers, but Quentin's creativity with these materials always intrigues me. The marine notes stay present well into the drydown, paired with synthetic woods that are surprisingly pleasant. It's a very powerful fragrance, so go easy on the sprays—less is more. If you stop smelling it, you might have gone noseblind.
kokunun dengesi çok iyi bütün hayatım boyunca böyle kokmak istiyorum hissi uyandırıyor. kalıcılığı 7 saat kadar açılışı oldukça güçlü.
This is the version of the perfume series is a mix between EDT intense and EDP, with the addition of a leather smoke note

Finally the DNA perfected. I have to say now that this is the best one of the 4, closely followed by Intense and the EDP. This anchors the DNA very well, smoothes out the edges and makes it very versatile.

I get a lot of sandalwood aroma chemicals with salicylates supporting lactones I think its methyl laitone to give that cramy sweet extended deep touch, with an fougerish aquatic spicy calone cascalone patchouli amberwoody vibe its a brilliant perfume stays for ever!

8/10

I was able to snap up a tester bottle of this here in the states, for a great price. I don't have the EDT Intense, but this very similar to the Kenzo Homme EDP, has smoky woods instead of the leather. While being lighter of course do to the concentration, but pretty weak even by EDT standards might be down to the 97% ingredients of natural origin. I'm a fan of the Kezno Homme DNA, so this was a easy buy for me. Although if this your first Kenzo Homme purchase I would probably stick with the EDP (2022) or Marine.
Smells very very similar to the EDT Intense, completely redundant and pointless release.

Fragrance Review:

First thoughts, this is an oud dominated scent mixed with Kenzo Homme DNA.

- Kenzo Santal Marin starts with a strong dose of oud and woody/earthy scent. It has very little sea notes or lavender in the opening, if not none at all.

- I sprayed a total of 5 times. Twice behind each ear, twice on the front of neck, and once in front of my chest. The longevity is okay, it lasts approximately 8 hours on my skin, projects for about an arms length for 2 hour before turning into a skin scent. It does however lasts a few days on my clothes.
(Depends on skin types)

Overall Rating (8,5/10)

I don't hate nor like this fragrance, it's not something I would wear as oud/woody fragrances isn't a combination I enjoy smelling. But if you're a fan of Oud/Woody notes, and you're a fan of Kenzo, then this might be the perfect combination for you.

First impression after three royal sprays on the back of my hand at 32 degrees Celsius: Santal Marin is what I expected, a mix of Kenzo Intense EDT (blue bottle) and the EDP (black bottle), but more of the latter. I’m one hour in and I hardly smell it anymore. I have the same experience w the EDP which I’m not so fond of. I love the EDT Intense. I might try it again some other time, but for now a bit underwhelming :(

An intriguing, modern aquatic-woody fragrance.
Kenzo Homme Santal Marin opens up with a gentle, salty marine accord.
Once the first fresh burst subsides, a creamy sandalwood note emerges, which grounds the fragrance quite nicely. Simultaneously guaiac wood creates a smoky, slightly bitter edge around the sandalwood note. Lavender is listed as a note, but can only be perceived as a distant whisper in my opinion.
The interplay of aquatic freshness and smoky, bitter milky-creamy woods is quite stunning, but might not appeal to everyone.
At first sniff it could come off smelling odd, which I personally appreciate.
Giving the fragrance time and multiple wears is kindly recommended. ;)
Once Kenzo Homme Santal Marin dries down it can easily be appreciated by everyone, all notes come together harmoniously and smell very pleasant with the distinct Kenzo Homme DNA humming in the background.
Do test it out! :)
I hate kenzo edt intense edt marine I'm looking forward for this one I'm wishing for atleast a different smell from homme line

Wow another one, can’t wait to try this! I just purchased Marine flanker this week thinking it was the new one and now another! I want it. Own and loved the first three. So didn’t mind blind buying and will for this one too
@letmeregister IKR they attempt to ruin & tarnish EVERYTHING. It's sickening
I really hate clowns on this site that vote on fragrances that are not out yet. It happens all the time.
Looking forward to this one, especially with that smoky aspect to it. Let's hope the hype doesn't get to this one & the prices go up dramatically like they did with the EDP & Marine.
Spraying is not enough I need this perfume up my ass.

Buying a bottle of this was a triumph of hope over experience. My Mum wears it, and it smells gorgeous on her; likewise one of my colleagues, who used to leave a beautiful violet trail around the office. On me, nothing. It just disappears. *sulk* I have gifted it to someone who will enjoy it.

i mainly get baby powder / baby wipes and very faint violets, but in the best way possible. this was my signature scent for quite a while, and i have very fond emotions towards it as i got it for christmas from my beloved. it is a very gentle and soft scent, perfect for bedtime or when you simply want to smell clean and powdery, elegant and slightly floral. i also adore the bottle, it reminds me of a glass skyscraper with a lovely bright poppy growing through it. i think this is a fragrance which i will repurchase once i finish it, although i do have other favorites now as well - it's just too tender and nostalgic for me. the only downside is that the longevity isn't too great, i can't really smell this anymore after 2 or so hours. that's very unfortunate, but i do think there's something sweet in its fleeting nature. it's a short lived treat, but a very comforting scent to me. i associate it with baby yellow. :)

I have the alcohol free version of this, but couldn’t find it here on fragrantica. I smelled the original years ago in duty free in Stockholm and thought it was absolutely beautiful. It’s a bit out of character for me because I typically don’t like a powdery scent and this is definitely that!! Yet there’s something about it that makes it really beautiful. It’s something I would only wear in the daytime perhaps for Sunday Mass, it’s clean, calm and innocent. The dry down is really unique. It’s a fragrance you’d recognize as soon as you smell it. It’s not my typical preference but I can definitely see the appeal.

Flower by Kenzo really surprised me. I was expecting another dull and lifeless white floral as so many designer houses love to expel into the world without a care, but I was wrong. This is actually quite gorgeous, and considering the price it can be bought at, fantastic value for money too.

It’s a very soft and delicate scent, a smell very intimate which is left to be discovered, not announced. The rose has a strong bearing, with a pronounced sharp and salty facet which is just mouthwatering, yet made dry and flattened by that soft powdery violet. Married by soapy white flowers and clean musks, the resulting harmony is lovely.

I’m actually considering whether to pick this up. I do really enjoy it and the price is fantastic, but do I love it enough to warrant adding to my 150 bottle collection? I’m not so sure. But what I can say is don’t look past this if you haven’t tried it!

I love florals, and a floral named Flower with a poppy built into the bottle is really up my alley.

But this is SO POWDERY. Like, baby powder teenage girl deodorant. And I'm talking Teen Spirit deodorant.

I'm glad I bought a vial of this because the bottle design almost sold me by itself. Honestly, most of Kenzo's bottle designs are incredibly cute and appealing to me.

This would've been a waste of money for me, though. Definitely not for me to be quite honest.

I will never stop loving this fragrance. I was 22yrs old when this first came out and I bought it duty free on one of my first trip to Australia. It was my signature scent for years. I now have about 200 bottles of fragrance and still absolutely love this. It's a classic that's still relevant today and not old fashioned at all. So pretty and comforting.

I got this bottle in 2025 from Spain, batch number 5A01.
It’s noticeably different from the original Flower I used to wear years ago. This reformulated version leans heavily on a synthetic powder note - it almost feels like wearing a fabric softener. There are faint floral undertones, but they get completely buried under the cosmetic-like powderiness. Longevity is strong, but the scent is linear. After a while, it becomes tiring to my nose - more of a monotonous powder cloud than the emotional fragrance I remember.

There’s that Algerian woman who said this perfume is for every time summer or winter day or night and said it’s the best perfume that makes you feel special.. and guess what? I ordered it, and Yes. It’s powdery soft and musky soooo feminine the longevity is insane for a powdery perfume like that.
And I’m really thankful that I believed in what that algerian woman said cause this perfume is 10/10.

It's weird how I smell no rose at all for the first few seconds. Just a creamy musky jasmine, that's all I can detect. The Bulgarian rose comes out later and overpowers everything else. I could never make peace with the strange bitterness in this note, even though I like rose notes in general.

It does settle down to a random powdery floral later on, like everyone else said. Kinda boring.

Not for me.

Complexity: 2
Longevity: 4
Radiance: 1
Occasion: 4
Season: 4

Overall: 3

The opening is a CLEAN sweet flower, and after a few minutes it settle to a lovely powdery floral sweetness, definitely a violet hidden in there, maybe even the tiniest licorice? It's very gentle, soft, innocent, but not so much that it becomes annoying, do you get what I mean? It's a very kind and clean fragrance, someone you cannot get angry with. I love how the powder feels here. Despite being so soft, it lasts for a decent amount of time too!

this is such a teacher scent to me, reminds me of 2010s))

you would smell this from her when you couldn't solve a problem and she would come for help, or when you would hug her... i miss being in elementary school

This Is the fragrance I picture Lady Galadriel would use for daily meetings and long walks amidst Lothlorien. An airy yet humid kind of dignified powder. There Is something nostalgic about Kenzo Flower, something that's regal yet evanescent. Like sitting near a quiet lake or pond on a hazy down watching the light through a filter of mist.

Back in the 2000s when this perfume was launched, everyone around me was wearing this perfume and it was a major turn off for me. Growing up in the 80s, my fragrance tastes were leaning towards chypre florals like Paloma Picasso and Givenchy Ysatis, as well as spicy orientals like YSL Opium and Kenzo Jungle l'Elephant. I had since sticked to these 2 olfactive families. Now, 25 years later, and after having tested over 1000 fragrances, I waq gifted a small 30 ml bottle of Flower by Kenzo dated back from the 2000s and waouh!!! This is a very soft unique feminine scent, safe for the office, and definitely one everyone should own. A classic as far as I am concerned!
Not for me. Way too powdery and floral with a strong incense note. I find it suffocating.
Powdery and veeerrryyy sweet. Too sweet for me. If you like a violet note you should give this a try.

Just got this and do not smell any fruits at all...this is very flat and powdery.
It's not terrible but not what I expected. Maybe only good for the office or church where you want something light.

I only got this because a bunch of people said it reminds them of D&G Feminine - IT DOES NOT AT ALL!!!
D&G had more depth and probably because it had the yellow floral like mimosa and Ylang Ylang.

The search continues...

I expected a forgettable floral at first, but the middle notes surprised me. The mix of opoponax and violet is beautiful, and I really love how it comes through. It gives the fragrance personality and makes it stand out. It leans a little vintage, in a good way, like powdery late-90s style. Comfortable and very much of its time.

The only drawback for me is the bottle. It looks striking, but it’s tall, bulky, and honestly a bit impractical. I’ve even heard perfume sellers complain it doesn’t fit on their shelves properly, and I get that. Still, the scent itself makes up for it, much more interesting than I expected.

I love Opoponax, hopefully this is a big winner for me. My other hawthorne perfumes, Rance Josephine and Miss Vanderbilt, are much loved, so I'm thinking positively.

Update: yes, reminds me of both aforementioned perfumes! More powdery. More violet. Hawthorne is INTENSE. 10/10

I've always wanted to like this fragrance. I got it as a gift when I was younger and it still gives me a headache. It comes off as too powdery on my skin, and bitter floral like old rose - not the fresh kind, the kind that has wilted and is rotting in a vase kind.

I never thought I liked Kenzo Flower. I’ve had this bottle tucked away for over 10 years because I could never get past the opening—old-fashioned powder mixed with something weird and a bit stringent. Not my vibe back then.
But this summer, in the middle of the stifling heat, I couldn’t bring myself to wear yet another gourmand (which makes up most of my collection). So, I dug this forgotten bottle out of the back of my cabinet, fully expecting it to be ruined after a decade of maceration.
To my surprise—I LOVE it. The notes feel softer, more luminous, and unexpectedly refreshing in the heat. What I once dismissed as “powdery and strange” now feels comforting and elegant.
So, take that, younger me—you were wrong.
چقدر این عطر خوش ساخت و یونیکه.ملیح و ملایم و شیک و متعادل و آرام بخش❤️❤️❤️
I can’t understand why anyone have bothered to make a clean floral musk when this already exist. This is so much better than anything in this genre (le cri is an exception).
Islak mendil kokusu.

Something has happened to me. This summer I’ve shed my former powder-hating-self. I’m reformed. I can’t get enough of fragrances like this. It is so fluffy, foggy, feminine, not-too-sweet but sweet, clean with a twinge of incense keeping it interesting. What you might wear to enter into a fairytale, or maybe even Heaven.

My signature scent.

A soft, rosy and powdery fragrance perfect for all occasions. It’s one of the few perfumes I get complimented on and works really well with my skin chemistry. Love the bottle design too.

Only downside is it can start to smell “sweaty” (?) after a few hours. But other than that I absolutely love it.

aesthetics and marketing seem subordinate to the fragrance in itself, which has way more of an etat libre d'orange or serge lutens energy to it than expected. i could totally see it marketed in a scifi context and gaining more of a niche reputation for it. reminds me a little of dent de lait even; the incense, violet and jasmine mimic the dna and evoke the same clean, lotionlike, but also cold and metallic air. very unexpected, going to have to do a side by side comparison, but i feel like longevity would be better with dent de lait. flower may be a tad more powdery. intrigued

This fragrance smells so much like parma violet sweets. It's powdery, sweet and slightly soapy (but in a non generic way). The perfect fragrance to wear after having a bubble bath

I'm also getting some faint hints of Johnson's baby powder mixed with Malibu sun cream (which isn't bad!)

Lovely and inoffensive

I do enjoy this perfume, as someone that's usually more interested in gourmands. It's quite powder forward.. I get hints of rose and musk, but it's mainly powder to my nose, which I don't particularly mind, It reminds me of when I'd baste myself with talc powder as a child when left unsupervised in the bathroom (very nostalgic!)
I do suggest not over-spraying this perfume though, It's sillage & longevity is amazing and as somebody that tends to overspray a-lot, I paid the price.

Happy I didn't blind buy this. Terrible experience, beginning (burnt plastic?) to end (just nauseating).Tried washing it off when I got home, but hours later I can still vaguely smell it. I thought I would really like it, but really just... hated it. Boyfriend thought it was "ok". Definitely not for everyone, not a very friendly fragrance.
I love love love this perfume. It’s a your skin but better smell. Very clean and the right amount of sweetness. I also love sprayint this on my pillow before going to bed.

Flower by Kenzo is truly a masterpiece of powderiness, resins and balsams, blended effortlessly with vanilla, violet, rose, jasmine and hawthorn. To my nose, the blackcurrants and the hawthorn are the most easily notes detectable in the opening of this scent.

It’s so satisfying to find a unique scent nowadays and I know that Flower by Kenzo was launched literally a quarter of century ago, but I haven’t tried it until today (potentially I am living under a rock) and I instantly feel in love with it. It’s something else than what’s currently trending on the fragrance market and I find that very refreshing.

Might be slightly controversial, but I don’t find the scent dated or smelling old fashioned. I find it super intriguing, alluring and captivating. This can be found incredibly cheap nowadays and I recommend to all ladies which haven’t tried it yet to give it a shot. I have hundreds of perfumes in my collection, but nothing similar to Flower by Kenzo…

No clue if it’s still popular with older generations but at least on social media isn’t. I didn’t heard anything about it. Deserves so much more love and attention at least online.

Will be adding a bottle of this gorgeousness to my collection as fall season approaches. It’s not the summeriest out of all fragrances, even though it’s called Flower. For me it’s something new, different that totally worth the money. And needs more hype so that the newer generations of perfume enthusiasts will catch up with the greatness of the older designers releases!!!

if kenzo flower has 0 fans then i have died. the perfume that no one will make me hate and the pefume i will always wear and doubt i will ever change. i like the ikebana variant a bit more because that scent is truly how japan in my mind smells like but the og flower is so darling and loveable and whoever says it smells like a grandma has nooooo idea.

i got it as a bday present from my mom because i kept talking about it for half a year (it reminded me of the band lamp which i love sm) and ever since then i can't let go of it. it's v nice and powdery and just a lovely and comforting scent. my friend who gets migraines from almost every perfume told me this one is very nice and that says a lot. in summer this perfume is more flowery and fresh, like coming from a bath but in winter it's simply angelic and comforting. my mom bought one for herself too bc she got to love the smell to. such a darling perfume i love it so so much!!

This is easily EASILY the most powdery perfume I have ever tried. It does have a little bit of floral going on there, and it's not a particularly offensive smell, but you have to really like that powdery smell.

Scent Description: Powdery Floral
Sillage: Medium
Longevity: Medium 3-5 hours
powdery-rose (almost like johnson&johnson's baby powder) at first, which diverges into a powdery-vanilla-lychee-musk on my skin. great projection and longevity, but not for me! an icon nonetheless.
Very powdery, very sunscreeny. A bit of rose, a lot of musk. Unobjectionable, but feels very basic and lacking personality. Not for me.

Smells like flowers after the rain.
Soft and delicate yet loud and memorable .

It will whisper that softness all day to you and those around you ...
Where she is Fragile , there lies her strength, I would call this one not your baby ... Or when the rain stops 😊
smells like fennel

My childhood scent. Growing up my mom lost the cap so I would just see a long bottle on top of our small closet. Smells exactly like her and early 2000s nostalgia.
Beautiful sophisticated clean floral, (which I don't typically reach over for) however everything is blended so nicely, with no note taking over the other with a powdery dry down. This will be my wedding scent. Reformulation hasn't changed much, the originals longevity was insane. I don't wear this scent often because it is so sacred to me.

I had a terrible day today. Lot of negative thoughts, tears, bad emotions. I feel hopeless and tired, so I’m just going to sleep now. Why am I sharing it here? Well, I just sprayed myself and my pillow with Kenzo Flower, because it feels like a warm, caring hug. It’s not the first time when I intuitively reach for this particular fragrance in such moment. It creates a safe barrier. Peaceful aura. Incredibly comforting scent. And I think it’s a true art if perfume can really work that way. In all that mess, it’s indeed a small thing, but let’s learn to appreciate them and be grateful. Thank you Alberto Morillas!
almost musky and animalic, but in the end just a powdery kleenex smell with a hint of flowers. Reminds me of that Britney Spears MV where she dances in high school. Has a foggy, misty feel to it.

One of those fragrances that is starting to smell dated. It leans a bit hairspray for my tastes. It is a nice, smooth and powdery floral. I do get the incense base which makes this have some depth. However, there's something that hangs around, mostly in the sillage, that smells of hairspray.

A very, VERY late review for what had been one of my most anticipated fragrances. My papa gifted me this perfume for Christmas of 2024 and I have loved it ever since I first sampled it in the perfume store we used to frequent on shopping trips. The packaging is absolutely darling and, unlike some, I am very fond of the powdery scent- especially considering another favorite fragrance of mine is Chanel No. 5. Is it for everyone? No, but I think its absolutely wonderful. The bottle is beautiful and I love how it looks next to my other fragrances. In terms of price, I can't really say considering this was purchased during the holidays at an outlet, but I am sure a decently priced bottle is out there awaiting for a loving home!

I think this may smell "vintage" to some people because it's exactly the same smell as Nivea chapstick in the early 2000's. The white, basic one, with a blue lid. It's not a bad smell, just kinda... funny to smell like Nivea chapstick :P

I think I must be having a stroke because I'm getting a savory red sauce note buried deep in rose and violet. Aside from craving garlic bread, its fine. It's mass appealing and decent but I wouldn't get a full bottle
This surprised me. Very nice and flowery / powdery without getting too sweet. The rose and violet is really nicely done. Refreshing. Great bang for your buck.

I used to dislike this fragrance. I found it too “clean”, too delicate, too innocent.

But lately, clean and delicate fragrances have started to make an impression on me. And today, I find this one utterly charming.

It’s a powdery floral scent - almost creamy - deeply romantic. Though completely modern, it takes me back to the end of the 19th century. Innocence, romanticism, and elegance, all blended into a single fragrance. Flower is nostalgia for a time we never lived.

Funny how tastes can change. Now, I find it perfect for those moments when I just want to wrap myself in a cocoon of softness.
This is very nostalgic to me its simple florals with a Sweet powdery scents I would love spray this on my fresh blanket and just sleep in It

It begins as a beautiful rose and violet, powdery and soft and delicate. Over time it moves to include subtle jasmine and becomes a more moist and dewy scent. This feeling of cool flowers seamlessly transitions to musk.

It's an incredibly smooth evolution over the course of the drydown. I think of this as angelic, soft fluffy heavenly scented clouds, and soft colors of diffused pink and purple. It is perfect for all seasons, day or night.

It is a true masterpiece! I rarely comment on bottles, but this is perfect, elegant, minimalist and suits the fragrance inside. It's not my usual type of perfume, but I LOVE THIS!
powdered violets and childhood innocence
Baby powder and something nostalgic. Like pulling a childhood blanket out from the closet and taking a deep whiff.

One could say that the powdery fragrance profile of Flower by Kenzo has reached cult status because it is instantly recognizable. To me, none of the notes dominate and everything comes together as a harmonious powdery and musky fragrance. The musk is soft, without sharpness. Interestingly, once dried down, I get wafts that remind me of hard candies, along with a ever so slight hint of sweetness. This is a versatile and classic, but not old-fashioned, fragrance.

this scent is deeply nostalgic to me, because it used to be my mom's signature scent when I was a little kid. now, I bought myself a bottle of my own and even though I'm in my twenties I find it to be perfectly suitable for myself. I dont find this to be vintage or old at all. to me, it feels modern, on par with skin scents like Fleur de peau or l'eau papier by diptyque.

Rose potpourri and talc powder 🥀

This gorgeoussss bottle consists of a linear concoction of roses and talcum powder,, it smells like a vintage luxury beauty product line.. My aunt owns this since forever and uses this mostly in our hot Indian summers and we've spent many summer vacation days together that it's scent is so familiar & nostalgic to me

Performance is not that intense, it's quite versatile so can be worn in all seasons if you enjoy powdery scents, lasts all day on outfits

People who like powdery soft rose scents would love it which is quite contrasting to the modern tastes,, it is reminiscent of vintage perfumes in the sense of like old Hollywood light glamouresque vibes 🎥

If you go into a home goods there's always some sort of bizarre collection of toiletries, one of them often being a body powder. As it has been used for centuries, for relatively cheap you get a powder puff covering a well of floral (my favorite was rose and violet) scented talc. While many reviews claim Flower by Kenzo reeks of baby powder, which I've smelled on many scents and is honestly evocative of an infant or a very elderly person, this distinctly smells like body powder. Very Marie Antoinette; porcelain perfect, delicate, beautiful and desireable, but very very out of touch with the common (wo)man. This isn't a frag I'd recommend to, well, almost anyone I know, but it smells lovely on me and will do the same for anyone whose skin works well with powdery scents.
This was my "grown up" scent in high school for when I was attending events where the syrupy scent of Lady Gaga's Fame would be unwelcome, but now as an adult it feels more appropriate to use in casual settings, a pleasant but fairly intimate hint of femininity. Pairs well with Myhrr for something a little more sensual and unisex.

Oh wow, I adore this. I was not expecting much due to it's reputation, but yes, this is absolutely one I will soon be buying a full bottle of. It smells clean, pure, cute, and very nostalgic. The baby powder is definitely noticeable, though for me this is a positive thing as I really enjoy such scents. Seems to dry up sweeter than it starts, which is not a problem for me.
I think I'm in the minority here in that I absolutely hate this. I can't stand baby powder and anything "white musk" so that's probably the reason.

I absolutely love it. Fresh, powdery, light floral. It smells so clean and light. Like super fresh floral washing powder (in the best possible way). It's amazing to wear on a everyday-day. To just smell clean, fresh and presentable.
I adore it.

Flower by Kenzo is currently one of my favorite scents. A soft, powdery, floral, almost baby powder-like scent that can be used anytime and anywhere. Not sweet, not heavy, not musty, but perfectly balanced. The rose, violet, opoponax, musk and vanilla are the notes that are most prominent for me. A scent that does not bore, not too pushy but is present, a classic but still only 25 years old.

i need to write a love letter for this fragrance. Soft, very powdery and sweet. Smells like, buried flowers in baby powder, for a funeral maybe. submerging them in soft powder, burning incense for your loved ones, and the soft musk that come along with warm clothes. I absolutely love this scent. soft, mysterious, and a unique powdery floral which cannot be matched

This fragrance smells very floral, yet powdery (Some might even say it smells like baby powder, which I kinda agree), and u can definitely smell incense when it wears down. It's beautiful and very comforting.

So, if u like powdery scents, this one is for u.

Kenzo Flower has always been in my collection. It’s my most comforting scent and the only one that has a true power of boosting my mood. Whenever I feel nervous or sad, one spray is enough to calm my senses. I feel secure when I wear it. It’s really great feeling :)

It’s a very original and magical fragrance, I think it’s really hard to find something that’s close to Flower. It’s powdery, but I disagree with baby wipes suggestions. For me, except for the comforting effect I’ve mentioned above, it’s more of a make up, old school powder puff smell. And since I’m into vintage vibe, I really love it.

Notes in Flower are blended in a masterful way, resulting in feminine, powdery floral composition.

Longevity is very good on me, hard to describe sillage bacause im so used to the smell, but I received compliments so I believe others can smell it as well.

It’s my secret weapon against my fears, sadness and bad mood.

Kenzo flower - for a beautiful world! :) (btw I also love advertisement campaign)

If I could paint a picture of this fragrance it would go something like this:

You’re standing in a field of violets and roses, like something out of that vampire movie. It’s going to be a scorcher of a day but at this very moment it’s early in the morning and a little crisp.
You’ve come straight from a bath in a crystal clear pond and are wearing some sweet talcum powder that was gifted to you by a kind, little forest fairy. Your clothes are warm and snug, and are scented by the surrounding flowers.
You feel in your heart and soul that everything is at peace.

So, you’re heading home, but is it bed time or has the day just begun? The choice is yours because there’s no right or wrong answer.

This perfume could suit any age or gender, but I guarantee the person wearing this is more beautiful than they know.

May peace be with you all
Grandma Snugs

This perfume was born from an inspiration to materialise the scent of an imaginary sweet-smelling flower, and this is how it behaves.
Thus, it seems created from a mix of rosey violets (!) and some almondy, powdery heliotropes. It is slightly dewy but ambery… sun-dappled, with a touch of shaded vegetation. Although the floral cloud that forms is mildly talc-like, it is possible to find a [slightly bitter] dust present in it, probably from the [unburnt] opoponax and incense, which would provide some weight to the subtle (slightly sweet and woody) floralcy.
This perfume is clean, in a tender way. It maintains a discreet balance and delicacy, until the softly musky finish.

I hate rose but I love it in this perfume.I have the tester and it is hard to apply it on the skin so I use it on my wet hair before blow drying and it lasts a solid 2-3 days.It is sexy but cute.Not overpowering and I get an headache from anything heavy.My mom used to wear it when she had me.She is a fan of it to.In my opinion the best version out of every Kenzo Flowers.Also the bottle is super cut so it is a plus. 7/10.
A very pretty red lipstick kind of perfume…opening is a bit harsh for me but once settles its stunning and classy..i would wear it in cold weather too heavy for summer
it's a very pretty rose scent... it's like a beautiful rose body powder. Not for me but great for a fan of roses.

will always love flower by kenzo. this perfume makes me feel like i am in the scene from american beauty where she is surrounded by roses, but instead of roses, it's glittery powder.

not necessarily a fan of the bottle, but it's not the worst. i love the scent too much just to give it minus points for the bottle.

I visited my aunt recently and she gave me her 10+ year old 50ml bottle with around 10 to 15ml remaining.
I sprayed it 4 times today in the morning and it lasts all day and projects a ton to the point I feel uncomfortable bc I feel like I annoy others.
It's not bad just very intense.Powdery sweet smoky with a hint of flowers not necessarily rose.It reminds me of Easter vanilla cookies.
The drydown is so interesting.It's super woody and it reminds me a bit of Santal 33?
I dont think its for me but it is top quality.Impressive.
I got a sample pf this and it's a beautiful feminine scent, but definitely way too powdery for me to handle. My migraines would go insane.

As a floral lover, this is beautiful. I also love powdery notes. For now, it’s a like because when I sniff up close on my wrist, there is a slight bitterness to it, as if plant stem was ground up.

I will try spraying on clothes and see if I no longer get the bitterness.

Update: 03/23/2025. I wore this a few more times but on my clothes and hair. And I no longer get the bitter note. It’s very powdery and pretty. I really like it.

I have tested it in a perfume store, This fragrance is strong Powdery Incense flory with a musk cames from the background. Powdery scent here like powder of compact powder, or makeup scent. One of the most beautiful powdery of makeup fragrance. Also, flowers here are very pure fragrance.

Powdery Incense flory musk fragrance give you feeling of feminine, If you didn't smell this perfume before, I advise you can blind buy if you prefer strong clear powdery perfumes like powder comes from makeup.

This fragrance suitable to wear it at night, in winter or Autumn seasons,, It lasts 8 hours on the leather and one day on clothes.

لقد جربته في متجر للعطور، هذا العطر عبارة عن رائحة قوية بودرية مع البخور والمسك الموجودان في الخلفية، نوتة البودرية هنا مثل مساحيق التجميل أو رائحة المكياج. من أجمل عطورالمساحيق البودرية، وأيضًا الزهور هنا رائحتها نقية جدًا.

رائحة البودرية و البخور مع الزهور والمسك يعطيان شعورًا بالأنوثة، إذا لم تشمِ هذا العطر من قبل، أنصحك بإمكانك شراؤه شراء أعمى إذا كنتِ تفضلين العطور البودرية القوية الواضحة مثل البودرية التي تأتي من المساحيق التجميلية.

هذا العطر مناسب لارتدائه ليلاً أو في فصلي الشتاء أو الخريف، ويدوم 8 ساعات على الجلد ويوم واحد على الملابس.
to me it smells near identical to parma violet sweets, it feels like ive just rolled out of a swizzels party mix but honestly i'm not mad about it

It's a pleasant scent but there's a note that ruins it for me. I can't pinpoint it but it's there and I can't agree with it. The drydown is beautiful, but the first two hours are a struggle. Low projection as well.
this bottle deserves standing ovations.
Somehow Kenzo might have changed the inci. All I can smell is a musky coumarin type of scent. It was a fresher scent once when I got it in Harrods in London 2000.

Lovely everyday fragrance! So beautiful with her musk, roses and violets. A walk in a beautiful garden in spring. I don’t find this cloying. It’s powdery, but I also get something fresh and light from this, no vanilla or incense.

Hate the bottle though 😔
One spray is all you need. Anything more is headache inducing. It’s a lovely evening scent during the equinox seasons, imo. Really lovely as long as you stick to ONE spray.

I like it, nice and powdery floral, but i guess the violet note is a bit strong for me.

Good everyday perfume, but wouldn’t buy it for myself. I would give it a 7/10.
This is the only fragrance I have ever tried that made me feel nauseated. Just sick to my stomach. I'm guessing that the hawthorn is the culprit. Went right in the can.

I love this perfume I love this parfum so very much this is my romantic night kind of perfume. it is so soft and feminin and powdery but not make me dizzy is Like you swimming in atmosfer of rose petals.

This is my signature scent I've worn it since 2001 at one time I was gifted the Just a drop oil which was incredible but sadly was discontinued. I find the parma violet and rose notes along with the musk are the scents that linger on my skin. I do find since the reformulation that it is not as long lasting as it once was but still my favourite.
beautiful soft floral scent, I love the design of the bottle and the fragrance is so comforting to me

the bottle is so dumb and impractical but i’ve always had some version of this perfume so it’s very nostalgic to me. smells like my childhood and france. you really get the powder and rose with this one but the rose isn’t too heavy to me.

This fragrance has almost a sterile, clinical quality to it that paradoxically enhances its beauty

The sharpness of the incense, animalic and faint tangy notes pull on the airiness of the musk, vanilla and violet, all perfectly accompanying the rose to create a stunning, timeless powdery scent

Gorgeous!

Sento molto violetta e rosa.
Lo trovo molto artificiale, non mi trasmette la sensazione di trovarmi in un campo di fiori.
Profumo estremamente intimo.

nice floral baby powder scent. toilette actually has really good projection and longevity. nice and clean, definitely on the mature side. i like it though, one of the better floral scents as someone who doesn’t like floral too much.
only good floral perfume i know

My profile: F, tropical climate, dry but acidic skin
- From the bottle: Nice, sweet
- On paper: Okay
- On skin: Battle between white musk and incense (the latter overpowers), no other notes to identify and I never overthink the smell.
- Could’ve fooled me for an Arabic fragrance if it weren’t for the incredibly weak projection and longevity.
Yes, it is sweet-smelling.
My sister thought it was powdery, but agreed with me when I clarified it as incense-y.
Mall tester was much better than what I have, I can’t believe it.
In my opinion, only ladies that are MUCH older wear this fragrance and pull it off easily. I would only like smelling this on my grandmothers.
Not worth a blind buy, I would gift this to a young person I dislike or do not care for.

Personally, do not buy.

I love this. I got it on a whim during a day trip to Sydney and was enamoured by the bottle. I'd seen it online, but had no idea about what it smelt like, but it was more than a pleasant surprise. It's the ultimate powdery floral. The florals are beautiful, especially the rose, and the resinous musky dry down makes it amazingly sexy and almost fresh. The vanilla keeps it sweet, but has an earthy quality that keeps the sweetness grounded, at least on my skin. Maybe not safe for blind buy if you're not taken by powdery fragrances. It is definitely very powdery the more I've come to wear it (especially during the opening). A little goes a long way too, it can become overbearing if you're sensitive to smell! Overall such a beautiful, comforting scent. I love wearing it to laze around the house or when I work outside, working a little sweat into it sort of freshens it a little bit, but that may just be me.
I feel like a walking "Gourmandises" by Alizée. Real-life sex kitten

This perfume reminds me old ladies' dressing tables. It's another one with some vintage vibe and for some reason it also reminds me of old models from the 20's. It's super powdery and I can't use it but I like to smell it on other people.

smells so so pretty and professional, dabbing it on always makes me feeling like THAT bitch in a soft sweater/corporate superstar kind of way. very inoffensive, i mostly get powder and violets. love the bottle design too but i wish that i had it as a spray.

Such a beautiful powdery floral scent with a nice amount of musk. Smelled it at store and honestly it smells so much better on my skin. Loves it so far reminds me of those spanish rose tear free baby washes from Sedano’s iykyk.
There is too much coumarin in it for me. Otherwise it emits a deep talc feeling. I loved it once, for its sensual and put together smell.
This is my coziest cashmere sweater and I feel like I'm getting a hug all day when I wear this. That's all. Cozy hug.

I was so excited to wear this as it smelt amazing in store. I put it on and absolutely no one can smell it on me! I absolutely drowned myself in it, and still after 1 hour the smell had completely gone. I'd be ok with this, if the perfume was cheap - but the perfume is VERY expensive, and for the price I expected better. I've had perfumes that have cost less than £10 that lasted longer - very disappointed with this one :(

There are levels of powderiness, ranging from a powder BOMB, mild makeup powder like and softly powdery. Like a baby's scent when they are near you but you're not the one holding them. Kenzo flower falls in the baby in their mother's arms category. This is super soft and so feminine! If you love scents that are girly, soft and ultra pretty, you will love this. The florals are not in your face and gives the powder a sweetness. This is a classic for a reason! I have the eau de parfum. Some may look at this as a grandma scent, but I happen to love scents that are similar to this.

When I think of floral fragrances I think of beautiful and feminine scents. This is neither of the two. It just smells too synthetic for me and it doesn't have that feminine appeal that I expect from floral fragrances.
Paras tuoksu ikinä ❤️ Sellainen puuterinen juuri josta nenä tykkää. Ties kuinka mones pullo menossa jo, mutta ikinä en kyllästyä voi 🥰

Smells exactly like babypowder in the 80s plus rose, and I cannot stand rose in perfumes so it's a hard no from me.
Rating: 1/10

I really appreciate Kenzo character, because all fragrances differ between them and from others in the market. Flower by Kenzo, a classic one, retro and powdery, reminds me of Bvlgari Petits et Mamans. A unique combination of violet and rose perfectly blended with musk. A timeless perfume, which I personally wear in the office. Kenzo also offers the body/hair mist version at a friendly price ;)

inspiration in words: "You enjoy your comforts and don't give in easily. You are hard-working, always well-groomed and serious, like a rock that remains unmoved no matter how hard the wind blows. Consistency and trustworthiness are the words in everything you do. You've your own hidden but gentle charm".

I love this perfume so much as a fresh day to day fragrance when you don’t want to wear anything too overstimulating. This is powdery in a rice/starch way which I love as I always loved the smell of mum’s spray starch. It’s dry, with only a touch of sweetness and has a very tactile quality to it like cornstarch, it’s so versatile and I can wear it to bed, during the day, out the shower. It definitely grew on me where I feel like I would need to get a back up of this or a close equivalent of some kind.

This is my anytime, anywhere fragrance & it will always have a place in my collection

Based on my personal experiences, people who love teint de neige, soavissima but looking for cheaper alternatives can enjoy kenzo flower. I’m not saying it’s a dupe, it has major differences, but overall scent profile shares huge similarities. Clean, elegant powderbombs. I adore teint de neige and soavissima also i enjoy using this as well. Beautiful scent for a very reasonable price. Ps: soavissima is nuclear so sometimes i feel shy to use that in public attending occasions, this one gets the job done and much less aggresive.

Not my type of perfume. Very powdery kind of baby powder with a green note, I don't smell any rose, vanilla, jasmine nor the fruits declared on the notes. Just green leaves and baby powder. I'm guessing the prominent note is that violet, which is not bad but definitely not my liking. After a few minutes it doesn't develop much more than that, but ended up smelling pure baby powder.

This flower is beautiful. She can put a smile on your face. Flower by Kenzo can be easily mistaken for Guerlain. Infact in the opening I am reminded of l'instant by Guerlain. But then it sweetens further and further. For a moment you can see a semblance of L'Heure bleue.
Oh how I used to wonder if that heavy fragrance from certain hair oils could be separately sold as perfumes. Today I guess my wish came true. In India perfumed hair oils have been in vogue since ages. And so has been the art of using Sambrani/Dhuno which is a resin and very balsamic to perfume and dry the hair using its fumes. That's what makes Flower by Kenzo so special.
