There's no going back from this perfume. I feel the juice may have become watery and diluted but its still good. Anyone can wear it all year round.

This is a powderbomb! Not super sweet but very floral. I smell dried rose petals and baby powder. I can also smell a lot of musk in this. Super feminine with a retro vibe. It feels like a perfume that would’ve been popular in the ‘70s or ‘80s (but it came out in 2000). I’ve had a bottle of this for years, and I really like breaking it out in the springtime. I’m pretty happy with the projection and longevity. I also love the tall, thin bottle!

Flower by Kenzo is a throwback scent with a heavy powdery and lipsticky vibe, like rummaging through your grandma’s old makeup drawer. It’s nostalgic and vintage but also clean, elegant, feminine and timeless. If you’re not a fan of powdery fragrances, this might not be for you, but it’s definitely got a unique charm. For a pro tip: try wearing it to bed. The cozy, comforting scent makes for a great nighttime companion. It’s a fragrance that brings a touch of the past into the present in a really soothing way.

smells like something from my childhood i couldnt quite put my finger on. my childhood was something i yearned to go back to, thus making this scent something very comforting. indeed very talcum like but elegant. signature perfume worthy? add 40 years to my age then yes.

Got my hands on an older bottle because I read the reformulation changed it a lot. I was able to ID it by the flower on the lid, the old version is bright red whereas the new one is muted in color. Anyways, it smells very feminine and lady-like. It's powdery but not in a talcum kind of way, but more oily and warmer. It smells floral, musky and creamy although, to me, violet is the most prominent note. It reminded me fo PMB baby violet cologne that I used to wear as a kid. I like to wear this to sleep.
I got a new bottle. Is it just me or this was reformulated? I prefer the OG bottle I had in mid 2000s..
Smells like baby powder in the best way possible.

another grandma-style perfume. Too outdated.
I mean, its an ok fragrance but i think they put an overdose of artificial powdery notes and it didn't result in anything that good.

Very floral and powdery which I really like. I definitely smell the roses and violets, vanilla and musk and a little bit of incense. I really like it, lasted on me a good amount of time. I can see being worn all year round but it's not my personal favorite for winter.

Rose makeup powdery or lipstick scent. Very feminine and classic, I love it. If you love pollen scents, you should try it soon.

Rating: 8/10, It has an addictive smell and gives off retro Vibes
on my skin it smells like rose water. good for when you want to go for a delicate fresh vibe.

Nice floral powdery fragrance. For years this was my signature scent. I don't understand why some reviews deem this unpleasant. Perhaps they don't like powdery scents. When wearing this, I receive compliments. If you like fresh Powdery scents, try it.
The quintessential powdery fragrance. What hasn't been said about this masterpiece? I will always love it.
100% pure 80s lipstick scent, love it or hate it.

I decided to sample this and on the first spray it was pure talcum powder. It's got a vintage feel to it, although I do remember a girl in my class wearing this and letting me spray some and I liked it. Kenzo Flower starts to smell more fruity and floral on the drydown, I can't smell any incense yet. So far it's a "like"

I know powdery perfumes aren’t popular in the fragrance community and I am one of the few who do enjoy them. I know they are viewed as old lady-ish, dated, or too baby powder-esque, however, I like them for the vintage, makeup smell they can evoke.
Kenzo Flower is a very powdery, almost, and I mean almost bordering baby powder, floral fragrance. I do get the violet and a mild tartness of the black current, but the rose and jasmine are very faint and overpowered. The vanilla and the musk are present, in the dry down, but the powdery note is the most dominate.
I prefer scents like this (Narciso Poudree, Putain Des Palaces) to wear straight out the shower and to bed. If you’re into powdery perfumes, try this, otherwise be cautious because this isn’t for everyone.

Well, I tried a sample at the airport. It certainly smells like an 80s mother in her nursery wearing a floral vest as she feeds her child in her rocking chair. Not really something I would want to smell like. But pleasant.
Does this smell similar to NR Fluer Musc to any of you guys?
The love of my life...nothing is as beautiful as you.
Beautiful, elegant, clean, powdery scent. Very close to the skin, moderately long-lasting. A classic and a beautiful gift for a lady.

Kenzo Flower holds a very special place in my heart. A few years ago, I had a miniature bottle and loved it so much that I would steal a whiff every now and then, but never committed to a full-sized bottle. Recently, I realized how much I missed it and finally gave in. While the bottle's shape isn't the most convenient, it earns a pass. The scent is pure luxury; a powdery violet with subtle notes of roses and incense wafting through the air. It carries a slightly gloomy undertone, reminiscent of the charged atmosphere before a rainstorm. It's both comforting and sophisticated, with a hint of baby powder but make it utterly enchanting. I will always have a bottle of this in my collection.

I've had her on repeat for years, she's always replaced once she's empty. She is powdery, fresh and clean. She is signature worthy and for a while she was. If I could only wear one perfume forever she would be a contender. She's classy and she gets noticed, strangers like her. There is an innocent attractiveness, an aura. If pretty had a smell she would be it.
It has a clean and powdery scent that's timeless... like a sophisticated version of Love's Baby Soft. If you enjoy baby powder or cotton scents, I definitely recommend giving it a try.
Knowing nothing about this, the first time I smelled it - it reminded me of Tesco's baby wipes.

I have a FLOWERBYKENZO 2023/2024 version, Eau de Parfum.
Official description: Pink Pepper, Damascena Rose, White Musks, Vanilla.

90% of it is synthetic powder, reminiscent to Baby powder, Johnson & Johnson baby oil and Nivea cream). The rest 10% is left for your imagination. I get something generic floral (Rose, Jasmin, Freesia, Iris combination) with shampoo-like Musk. Shiro Masaki is very similar style, but so much better than Flower by Kenzo.

Dina_France (YouTube perfume reviews)
Beautiful and timeless perfume, it's a classic but not too old-fashioned. One of the two only floral fragrances that I own as I'm more into gourmands but I still keep reaching for it
It's a balanced and feminine powdery scent. After wearing it for some time I realised that on my skin it does smell like baby wipes. However, it's a classic and a clean option for every day use.

Mild and creamy scent, with lasting aroma of a rose. Sweet, feminine combination with violets and jasmine is not overcharging: it is delicately enriched by vanilla and musk. Without juicy, honeyed mandarine it would be plain fragrance but here, everything is well-balanced. This perfume is well thought out, made for sympathy.

I really enjoyed wearing it, definitely it is not for the last time.
Unoffensive choice, suitable for spring-summer season.

This smells exactly like something I’ve smelled before.. maybe it’s an aftersun, a diaper cream, a cleaning cloth or something like that. It has that pampering powdery vibe, exactly like some fragrant rejuvenating lotion.

I love lipsticky powdery fragrances, and this has a complety different vibe. It’s clean, soft and pampering. The perfect scent for a natural no-makeup look. It’s floral, but the flowers are not distinct. It’s so well blended that no note stands out as the star of the show. They’re mixed and create a rejuvenating type of fragrance. Pampering is the best word to describe this.

Batch is 8D11. This was my grandmother’s signature perfume. For as long as I can remember. She always smelled like this. It’s got a lot of rose and jasmine with a tinge of powdery feel from the vanilla, opoponax and hawthorn. It’s got really good projection and longevity although my grandma was a heavy sprayer so can’t say it’s gonna be the same for all. It’s an elegant and classic floral perfume.

Cherishing the last few drops of this, as it was a gift from my late father. For some reason, this smells more like a white floral to me. A very clean, powdery, floral scent. Almost baby powder like dry down.

Edit: tried a fresh one in the store today and there's something so dreamy about this. like a cloud.

I was looking for a perfume for my wedding night and some random site suggested flower by Kenzo, I went ahead and smelled it. I was shocked and wondering how did I go this long without having it in my collection. I m seriously in love it, represents everything I love, powdery, fruity, feminin. it smells like a girl you would marry can't wait to wear this at my wedding.

A great baby powder scent, while not being old-fashioned. It is very clean and sweet and feminine. My boyfriend has sensory issues and dislikes fragrances but, for the first time ever, asked me to spray him with it. He asked me if he could borrow it sometimes! He says it smells like clean linen, I think due to the powdery notes. I bought Flower in tandem with Clean Rain for a spring fragrance duo. They layer well together, it is almost like I can smell the stem with Rain and the petals with Flower.

As for all perfumes and fragrances: be sure that you have a fresh bottle before you review it, and not one that has gone bad. Sometimes I wonder over some negative reviews…
My last few drops in my Kenzo Flower bottle had actually turned a bit harsh and strange, so I opened my new 100 ml instead. Quite another experience! So now I use the rest of the old bottle in the water I use for my ironing - it is not all that bad.
And Kenzo Flower remains one of my dearest favourites - ever since it came out. Timeless, ageless and effortlessly feminine. Even though now comes soon the time when I don’t use it so much - summer! I think it is best in the colder seasons, since it is warm and very powdery. So for now, I put it in the box, and in my dark, cool closet, for safe keeping!! 🥰
Very beautiful, soft rose with a gorgeous parma violets and vanilla dry down. Can’t help but love this one.

Powdery sweet rose
I like it
Al Rehab rose but less musky
It is way too sweet
On skin I do get musk and dustiness
I like this a lot
But I don't know if I can handle how sweet and dusty it is

Agree w below comment by anaesthesiaangel, "Powdery, feminine, almost vintage smelling. Light and floral, but dusty and will most definitely age the wearer. Delicate and powdery"
I don't want to smell like *just* baby powder. It's a no for me.

I love love love this fragrance! Yes it does give baby wipes, but I kind of like that about it! It's a powdery, delicate and welcoming scent. I think the main reason I love it so much is the nostalgia from smelling it throughout my childhood. Just proves how timeless it is lol! If you're worried about it ageing you, or that it has old lady vibes then I would suggest testing beofre buying. I personally get more baby powder/baby wipes than old lady.
Back when I was a paralegal, I smelt this on one of the very attractive older defence lawyers. I nearly got myself into trouble LOL.
Powdery, feminine, almost vintage smelling. Light and floral, but dusty and will most definitely age the wearer. Delicate and powdery

Oh what a lovely, feminine fragrance! It reminds me of the 90s and 2000s where people would go out of their way to purposely smell like baby powder. This perfume quite literally smells like baby powder. Unless you're into powdery perfumes, this fragrance may completely turn you off. It is strong. People will be able to smell it on you if you walk by or are in close proximity. It may be a nice smell for those that like the scent of baby powder or baby cologne, so beware that this smell will be noticed by those around you! After a while, it turns more into a floral, lipstick powdery kind of smell. The smell transforms from baby powder ---> powdery floral lipstick. I spray it when I know that nobody is going to be around my persona, so I can solely be the one to enjoy this cute, powdery fragrance. It smells comforting, clean, and powdery. Like you just took a hot shower and are wrapped up in a warm towel.

Love love love this scent💕 I own 4 clean scent; 3 of them including this one are a clean florals: Chanel chance eau tendre and Victoria secret first love. They have the musk note and smell like baby powder but with different formulas.

VS first love is the fresh clean floral scent that you would expect from Marc Jacob’s Daisy.

Chanel chance eau tendre is more sophisticated, but soft.

Flower by Kenzo is deeper and I think it’s because of the rose and the little bit of pink pepper. Now on the website, it say in the little paragraph the Vanilla, musk, Rose and pink pepper are the notes. Idk where the perfumers are getting all those other notes from.

Absolutely smells like baby powder/dreft baby detergent. If you do not like that smell, avoid this! Personally it doesn’t bother me and I find some comfort in that powdery sweet and fresh smell, so this fragrance is cute and relaxing. Maybe having a baby does that to you lol I miss the smell of the dreft detergent from washing baby clothes. Lasts decently long.

Fabulous.
I'm going off memory for this one as its been at least 17 years since l had a bottle.
It's very Johnsons baby oil smelling, it has that kind of oily thick baby powder floral smell that is divine, its got the vanilla and powder and sweetness to just the right level. It's a light creamy, not heavy thick vanilla creamy, its feminine and very pretty and simplistic in its notes. Its not overloaded with notes l adore the subtle parma violet notes in it as l love the parma violet flavoured powdered sweets. This perfume is superb if you love the smell of Johnson's baby oil this will appeal to you. I recently bought my friend a bottle for her birthday and remember feeling ever so tempted to keep it and get her something else. My aunt always said when you will know when youve got someone a great gift because you really want to keep it for yourself. It's a lovely perfume it lasts a good amount of time on the skin and is of average designer perfume pricing. I give this perfume a 7.5 out of 10.
Got it as a gift...musky sweet with strange combo scent. Terrible

I got this as a present for Christmas last year and at first I wasn't a big fan of it because it didn't stick out as much compared to my other fragrances(also I noticed it smelled like those old colognes my grandma used to wear when I was younger). Only recently I have started using it more and I've grown to love it, especially since it reminds me of my childhood.
It's a very lightweight, timeless perfume and I think it can easily become a signature scent, if you enjoy powdery, floral notes. I can especially feel the musk and rose, sometimes the vanilla aswell, but I don't really pay attention to notes as I just enjoy the overall vibe it gives off.
I would recommend wearing this in the winter and spring, and mostly during the day. :D
Adore this smell, powdery monster in some way, but so lovingly! Gives feeling of comfort and home.
i got a sample and i was stunned , i will never wear this not because its bad , but because it smells like an old cheap perfume (nostalgic) childhood type shi , not for this generation

I tried the Poppy bouquet flanker first and I thought it was super boring and OMG am I glad I gave this a chance! She's fresh, she's clean, she's a sweetheart! She's Infusion d'Iris' granddaughter, a lovely fragrance for fans of powdery notes that don't age you. I'm not a fan of fruity perfumes or white florals, I adore roses and musks on the other hand, so it's probably no surprise it's love at first sight. Still, liking the notes when you read them is no guarantee you will like the perfume. This one is perfect for me both on theory and in practice. It's linear and I get vanilla way more than musk for now, but I love it the way it is, even though I prefer musk to vanilla every day. I love the creative concept, the bottle, everything. It's long-lasting too, which is not a must for me, but it's definitely a plus. I am pretty sure I will be adding this to my modest collection. (✿◠‿◠)

Exactly the scent I was looking for and an amazing option for everyday wear for me. While I see many people say this scent is “old” I personally think on me it becomes quite youthful. It’s addictive and I’m having the urge to buy those mini travel perfume bottles to keep this around at all times. It’s a sweet floral scent, but because of the powdery aspect and the more shy, intimate projection, it’s not enough to overwhelm people during the summer, just must be used with caution.
I see the “baby wipe” aspect but I do not mind at all, I love the scent of baby products. Lovely!

My family are all fans of Morillas freshies, and this is his best work.

It's not a new perfume, but it doesn't feel dated. This is all that Mojave Ghost by Byredo tries and fails to be. It's floral, woody, powdery, nurturing, and not quite like baby wipes - though I get the violet+powder association.

People around me find it lovely, not annoying, acceptable, bright, open and i even got an "optimistic".
Personally, it evokes the smell of soap my mother used to use when I was younger.

It's a homogeneous blend of soap accord, florals, woods and powder, buf you never quite know what you're smelling. Calming. Does the job. Absolutely stunning.
Smell like a baby wipe. I do not want to smell as if I have just been changing diapers.

Vintage Sweet'n'Dirty Musk (but not too dirty) with Rose, Violet & Vanilla...

This is a powdery sweet musk, but not a white musk or a clean musk. There's a contrast where it's more powdery sweet than sun-bronzed skin, but it has some animalic salty skin facets, and smells to me like good grooming sweetened by the days events, or good grooming at the end of the night. Alongside all the notes there's a vintage sweet'n'dirty musk vibe, and although this isn't a dupe I catch reminders of scents like Ombre Rose L'Original Jean Charles Brosseau 1981 and Ange ou Démon Givenchy 2006, which both have that same contrast.

Opens with sweet, baby-powdery rose & hawthorn with violet swelling through. Hawthorn here has its strong honeyed floral tones with dirty animalic nuances which to my nose lean more rooty-green than dirty at first. As it transitions to the heart, the violet & rose tones expand the velvety plushness and opoponax lends a faintly seasoned amber glow, while Jasmine is there with it's salty skin & baby wipes facets. The musky vanilla base keeps the effect going for well beyond average performance, and incense sustains the seasoned facet of opoponax.

Performance is a well beyond average for year round wear. I just have a sample of this, but fans of powdery. sweet'n'dirty musk scents might like this. For what it is, it's well done. Enjoy!

A full on nostalgic experience.
My mom used to wear Flower by Kenzo and many of its flankers, and I recently got a small bottle of it.

To me this is a very delicate and elegant powdery floral with a hint of sweetness. It’s smells really clean !

To me the Florals aren’t overpowering the rest of the scent, but complimenting AND complimented by the other notes. You get a clean and smooth base, with this White Musk and sweet and subtle vanilla. And those aspects are highlighted by the intensity and depth of the Incense and Opoponax.

The fruits are more discreet, I don’t detect any of the Mandarin, and the Black Current slightly shows up on the opening.

It’s an easy perfume for spring and summer, really effortless yet elegant, sophisticated and delicate. Lasts for a long time, pretty good in terms of sillage and longevity.

Not what I usually gravitate towards but it is a great perfume.

Just for the fact of this scent being a huge part of my childhood in the early 2000’s, and smelling so iconic, I give this a 8/10 🌹

I'm not ashamed to admit my love for classic powdery florals with notes of iris or violet - but this is not your average powdery perfume. It doesn't smell like baby powder to me like a lot of other reviewers have mentioned, but I can see why it isn't a universal crowd-pleaser. The opening is very aquatic and fresh, and it dries down into what I can only compare to a vintage rose-scented blush compact or maybe a silk flower that has been scented with an old fashioned potpourri. I love to wear it alone with more elegant outfits and on a casual day, I spray it in my hair towards the nape of my neck and choose something spicier for my wrists to offset some of the heavy powder notes as it sits. It's not an everyday type of scent for me, but I really do think it's a gem of a fragrance.

It smells way too much of baby powder than anything else. It reminds me of changing baby diapers. I don't really want to be reminded of diapers when I'm not actively changing them. This is a no for me.
whenever i sprayed this on me i feel like i’m in 2000s and a child again and even though it’s a female perfume i would love to smell that on a man

Is there a question I would like to ask especially to my Far Eastern friends? katana shaped bottle and poppy flower. As you know, poppy is a flower and symbol used in memory of those who died in the Second World War. So, does having a picture of a poppy on the bottle of a perfume that does not have a poppy scent help it be perceived as a reference or symbol? Is this an elegant reference? It wouldn't surprise me if such a subtle reference was made by the Japanese, who suffered the most in World War II.
Rosey luxury soap

<3
A fragrance transcending many moons and decades, a beauty preserved and nurtured by its presence and timelessness.
More words to come.
On me this smells like baby powder and barbasol shaving cream. I feel pretty neutral about it. If you’re into powdery scents that aren’t very sweet this would probably be something you would enjoy.

Sometimes I feel that no words could describe how beautiful this fragrance is to me. Almost 10 years ago I received a small 30 ml bottle from my aunt, unfortunately back then it didn’t appeal to me, however I started wearing it as I realised that it was a good choice for the harsh winter.

And then the magic happened, the more I wore it, the more I liked it. It was clear and unusual exactly as advertised, a velvety freshness which came from black currant and mandarin orange accompanied then by thick powdery rose, hawthorn and violet notes. It is a strange and mystical fragrance, incense and opoponax giving it an almost oriental accord, not oriental as in Middle East, but oriental as in Far East.

The scent is very calm and almost reflective as Japanese people tend to be. In this fragrance the sensuality is not obvious or in your face as the Western world perceives it, instead is serene, mysterious and never asking for attention.

I read here that many people wear it during warmer months, but to me there is no better season to wear Flower than in winter as I tend to associate it with the purity of snow. In my opinion this fragrance is one of the classiest fragrances out there and a true masterpiece, they just don’t dare to make this kind of perfumes anymore.
This was a scrubber for me. Very heavy floral, baby powder smell that was just way too headchey and mature for my taste. Was racing to get it off. Hard pass.

The year was 2002 and I was young. Flower by Kenzo became my signature scent without me even noticing or knowing there was such thing called "signature scent". Up to this day, if you ask an ex-lover or my mom what was the perfume associate with me in my twenties back in Caracas, Venezuela, will be Flower by Kenzo. I don't remember well when was the last time I smell it but up to this day I close my eyes and when I remember Kenzo, I remember those pasionate and intense nights in the tropics. It has been twenty years since Kenzo and I loved using it. I empitied at least three bottles of it before moving on to other perfumes.

Really disliked this on me - not sure why, though. I knew it wouldn't be a love: powder is a hit or miss for me (I adore Maison Margiela Replica Lipstick On but baby powder scent is not generally what I want in a fragrance) and I'm more gourmand than floral...but I was racing to wash Flower by Kenzo off before it even dried down sufficiently! So my conscious nose was like okay, baby powder and flowery poo pourri, but my unconscious nose was like - noooo, run, poison fumes!!! I do have that reaction sometimes to fragrances but this one was unexpected based on the profile. Maybe the violet is what was coming through? I'm not sure I have a fragrance that features that. So - I can't say the scent was objectively problematic. It's a nice enough scent. And I suspect some wear this beautifully. I'll just have to do some more comparing to see what it might be what is throwing me off and why I reacted so strongly to it.
like a drugstore lily-of-the-valley mixed with choward's violet mints
The lamp perfume, i love this perfume so much im so sad it runs out pretty fast

Lovely bottle, convenient to hold. Wanted this for quite some time, reminds me a lot of Love by Chloe, same powdery sensation, same aura and definitely for grown women. I need to be in a certain mood to wear those kind of smells, but i think i enjoy it for the moment.

I've been wearing this on and off for about 15 years. I'm not a fan of the "soapy" opening, but I love the beautiful, powdery dry-down. It's unlike any other perfume I've tried before, and this lasts forever!! It's in my top 10.

1. The skin factor never played a trick on me like with this one. On my wrist, Flower is a. Incense b. More incense and c. Old and withered flowers, crushed to death. Where is this powdery sensation everyone complains so much about? 😭 Don't get me wrong, I love incense but I wanted powder...
2. THE BOTTLE! This bottle (and all the flankers) plus Guerlain's bee bottles are IMO the most beautiful work of art in the world of perfumery.
3. Strangely, is not BAD. It's weird. But I usually like weird so I will give her some time to grow on me or to get out of my life lol

EDIT: Hours later it didn't evolve to anything besides more incense. Even on clothes! No powdery flowers for me, I guess. Still, I don't dislike her. She's just, hmm, meh?
EDIT 2: Second day, don't know if it's the weather but now I can feel the powder and I'm officially starting to love Flower. Such a weird experience, never had a fragrance conquer my heart with time, I usually like or dislike them at the spot. Still confused how she went from incense to a floral powder from one day to another, but I guess that's what makes names like Morillas so great.

this the perfume i keep in my arsenal for "serious" occasions, important meetings, funerals, anything i want to be less "girly" and more "womanly". not really sweet enough for me to consider wearing regularly, but it's clean and sophisticated, and i like the powdery notes.

I didn't think this suited me at the time it came out, but now 23 years later, it suits me now. It is a powdery floral but never too sweet, pleasant and comforting, refined and clean. It doesn't stay long on me. Disappears completely within 12 hours with no trace.

I like this scent. It's clean, powdery, floral, definitely a bit vintage smelling. Reminds me of coty airspun powder with a hint a baby powder. I find that it does give me a headache if I spray too much so I stick to 2-3 sprays and it last a long time.
first spray is like nostalgic, floral, and powdery. develops kind of green(?) kind of like sitting in grass. dries down into a soft vanilla scent

I bought this years ago when it was first launched. It was bang on trend: a powdery floral with heavy duty sillage and longevity. Looks so delicate but boy is it powerful. I loved it for all these reasons but the reality is what originally drew me to it was the bottle. It looks like a beautiful poppy. Made me think of beautiful flowers in a field although in reality the scent was more urban as opposed to countryside. I loved it.
so elegant, so feminine. Love it.

Hate it! I received a sample of this perfume. Immediately upon spraying it, I hated it. It smells like Dove Original deodorant (which I also can't stand) mixed with a soap. Just awful. Overpriced, too.

Strong scent with a strong projection. Smells very powdery, soapy and "old school" / mature. The notes blend well together.

Doesn't suit my personal taste.
unfortunately too green on me! smells amazing in bottle, powdery wood and violet

my favorite perfume of all time. I had a bottle in high school, the first perfume I ever purchased. Its so unique. Very strong, great silage, lasts around 6 hours for me. I get powder and wood notes out of this with a musky background. It's amazing.

I like the soft and powdery bulgarian rose and the honeyed hawthorn in the opening, but I'm not too keen on the ammoniac smell from the black currant and the astringent and citrusy quality from the mandarin orange. It's a bit harsh and cheap smelling to me.

I feel pretty much the same way about the heart notes too, loving the powdery parma violet, soft and lush rose and sweet and fragrant jasmine, but the opoponax is again too much and makes this fragrance too heavy for me, what with its warm spicy and balsamic quality and all.

The base notes of musk and vanilla are lovely and lend themselves well to this fragrance, but the incense ruins things for me somewhat and makes Flower by Kenzo too smoky a fragrance for me. I like my fragrances to smell a bit lighter and more floral and this is not it.

I'd recommend this perfume for the spring and thw fall and for during the day, but not during other times of the year. I'd say that it leans feminine as a fragrance, but the smokiness and the spiciness skews it towards being more unisex in parts and so it could be worn by a certain type of man. Maybe a more androgynous and/or feminine type of man.

This perfume ended up lasting 9 and a half hours on me and its sillage was I'd say about moderate on my skin.

All in all, I'd give Flower by Kenzo a 6/10. It's slightly above average but still average as a fragrance to me.

This morning I dug out my sample and sprayed some on my wrist. Well, I tried to, but it wouldn’t spray out and dribbled down the tube onto my fingers and so I smeared it onto my wrist instead. That was mildly annoying. No sooner had I “sprayed” than the baby woke up, scuppering my plan to get up before 5am to have a few minutes to myself. That was also kind of annoying. Yet now I find myself with a warm baby nestled into me and this soft, cakey make-up powder (slightly rose, slightly violet, slightly vanilla/opoponax sweet) wafting around me with a touch of incense as well, and I can’t say that I’m annoyed at all.

Edit next day: I’m wearing Flower again because I like it, and suddenly I realize that this is Trussardi My Name but with more depth and oomph and lasting power. I’ve had My Name for years and often sniff at the bottle but never wear it anymore. Not sure what that means for Flower; I guess time will tell!

i only have a dupe (compared to the original in store and didn't sense much of a difference); to me this smells so much like banana candy in a really creamy way. it's so round and powdery, nothing tart or astringent about it whatsoever. i struggle to pick up any particular flower, it's just velvety like petals. the drydown leans more vanilla, still very powdery.
i've never smelled anything like this before! i more associate strong white and soapy florals with old lady perfumes, so i don't really think this smells dated.

According to the pyramid, there's a violet note in Flower. I've tested this scent several time and can't find the elusive violet. Nor can I find the rose, the hawthorne ... IMHO, F. is a generic flower scent, faintly sweet and more than a little artificial.
Performance is decent, sillage is modest. Kenzo scents don't seem to agree with me, and I have no idea why. Jungle Elephant was horrid and F. just isn't all that good.

It took everything in me not to blind buy Flower for the bottle alone, which is adorable and reminiscent of growing up in the early aughts, so I mustered up some self control and got a sample instead. While I don’t think this would be a safe blind buy for everyone, it definitely would have been for me as someone who appreciates powdery florals and musks.

First impression: A puffy cloud of violet baby powder. After a few minutes the green element of the violet puts the baby powder in a corner and reveals bright black currant and rose. The jasmine is quite green and not lusty or dirty. I will say, although it’s quite floral, I’m not getting an overpowering sweetness from those notes which I actually appreciate. It’s like I’m picking up more of the green flower stem than the bloom itself. On the dry down, a slightly sweet and silky vanilla incense comes forward as the powder fades into the background, an unexpected note for this scent profile but very very pleasant as it adds some nuance to an otherwise linear scent.

Longevity wise, it fades to a skin scent pretty quickly but i will have to wear for a few days to come to a conclusion about its performance.

I appreciate the youthfulness that this scent embodies. Many reviewers have said it’s mature but i disagree. I like the way that the notes surrounding such a prominent violet give way to a very delicate, airy and fresh powder rather than a dank soapy aldehydic powder associated with a more mature scent profile.

There is also a nice comforting and cozy quality to this scent. A perfect bedtime scent and neutral enough to wear to an office setting. Maybe there is a maternal association with the baby powder profile but it’s also just very soft and rounded out. It has a floaty cloud-like vibe. I think Flower could work in any season, but especially in spring and summer. It seems light, fresh, and green enough to stand up to heat. In fact, I’m curious as to how the notes will develop on warm skin.

Overall, I’m pleasantly surprised by how nuanced and dynamic Flower feels. A very pretty and fresh fragrance that I could see myself working into my collection for casual warm weather wear. Could be used for layering as well. If you like powder and purple florals, this could be signature worthy, I think it’s extremely wearable for any season and daytime occasion.

Very pleased with this blind buy--it's a tester of the Kenzo Flower EDP and sadly missing the adorable top that puts the iconic red blossom at the top of the green stem on the bottle--but it's 3.3 ounce, which will last me a long time, assuming this delicate little vase-bottle doesn't shatter. Yes, it smells like powder. Yes, it smells like roses and violets. Yes, it has a bit of an Alice Blue Gown, Gibson Girl parlor vibe to it--completely at odds with the modern, minimalist bottle--and I was expecting it to read more 21st century (or even late 20th century). But as it happens, this is the kind of fragrance I love (and not unlike another great recent bargain find, Jaipur Bracelet by Boucheron, although that is more of a dusky violet whereas this reads to me as more of a deep velvety pink, like the deepest pink in the inside of a conch shell, or a kitten's mouth. I also pick up some citrus sparkle from the blackcurrant and mandarin orange. The jasmine and musk are exquisite, but I can't really discern much incense. It's certainly not as incensey as, say, L'Heure Bleue. Anyway, this smells just like what I was hoping Miss Guerlain Rose nRoses would smell like, only with more longevity (by far). Obviously, if you don't like rose and violet accords and powder, you should probably avoid, but if you do love those Grande Dame cosmetic scents of yore, pick this up; you can usually find a bargain on the online discount sites.

I'm upgrading this longevity and expanding this to day and night. Because who doesn't want to smell like silky rosy sandalwood powder as she drifts off to sleep or rouses herself for another trying day? I do think I would need to scrub this scent off if I were feeling migrainous, but honestly I do that with most fragrances, simply because I would never want to create that association and ruin an otherwise great perfume.
Straight powder. Not baby powder but like a puff powder. Smells nice.
Beautiful and feminine, gentle and green. Smells like realistic poppy flowers. Could be great for the office or any occasion where neutral scent is being asked for. I like it so much.

Pure powder in the opening, with the florals peaking out on the drydown. This is a pretty fragrance for sure, and while definitely of its time, I think it still holds up today. I wish I liked Flower more than I do, though. When it comes to powdery fragrances, I lean more toward Putain des Palaces or Valentina Poudre. Flower smells more like a fresh, even sterile powder than the others do.

EDIT: Maybe it's because I'm now testing Flower in cold weather, but I've been enjoying it much more lately than I originally did. I'm even thinking of buying a bottle once my sample is gone!
flowery and very pretty. If you're hyper-sensitive about not wanting "old lady scents", don't buy. Personally i love it.

my mother received this as a gift from some relatives but she's a "fresh" fragrance kind of person, thus, it was handed down to me. i do like this scent, I don't see it as bad but it is sometimes very overpowering and makes my head ache. i don't normally go for *mainly* floral scents as i'm more of a gourmand person, but i like how this dries down and smells a bit like sugar and vanilla. Nice powdery notes, just don't wear during summer or you'll suffocate yourself and everyone around you lol. i dont layer this with other perfumes on my skin/ clothes but i like layering it with a hair refresher mist that's vanilla flavored to really bring out those vanilla notes. people say i smell like cake :)
lilting curtains, haze at dusk, the Lisbon sisters & tiffany lamps....and stuffy stuffy powder. i wouldn't purchase this, but will reserve the remainder of my sample for bedtime cozy:)

I don't like it. Too flowery, powdery and vintage for my taste. I love floral fragrances, but this is too old-fashioned. It's the kind of perfume that chic ladies wear to church... or to gather for a cup of tea! Pretty, but I couldn't see myself wearing it...

6/10

I grew to love the very strong powderyness that made this perfume bothersome to me at the beginning. It's very different from Amour but you can sense some kinship in the vanilla and incense notes, I'd say Flower has a more melancholy touch to it, which is now very very attractive to me in a perfume, this ghostly feel, and not just because it is vintage, something feels otherworldly.
This feels like a fellow suffering spirit gently bringing you comfort from the other realm. Very beautiful scent and definitely not for everyone like the best people aren't!!

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: tropical fruity vibe that really smells like pear and grapefruit, tart with some white musk; I liked it but didn't love it until the base that I did not like; the cedar kind of ruins the whole thing not deepens it with an odd off chemical smell, mixed about this one; not my typical Kenzo love; it's really just okay, average, like other things out there

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: I wanted it.I bought it.l love it.

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
Got myself a 10ml vial of this nostalgic scent.
I was gifted a set when I was 18 by my then boyfriend, who we no longer together with but still are friends. I loved how unique and sharp it was compared to most of sugary, syrupy, vanilla scents advertised to young women. I anticipated the momentof smelling it again... Well... I'm glad I didn't order a bigger volume yet I still love it, and it's still a fragrance of its own. As I I know it's been discontinued a few years ago, I don't know if it's because this, that it starts go bad, but at the start I get quite a bit of vinegar. It dries out quickly though, becoming the lovely scent I remember

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: A very lovely perfume for every day wear! I love it!

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
madly kenzo edt

summer test two sprays inner arm

i got a bad tester - had gone off so the notes smelled like tea and other things. i wiped it off with alcohol wipes.

i could still smell this - very zingy - tart.
rigght off the bat it reminded me of:
dolce nd gabanna light blue
anna sui fairy wish
sort of.. oscar dl renta flor

the zing factor is quite good. i have dg l blue, and a n secret wish, this has other notes balancing it out and it smelled nice with my other tests that day - lovely by SJP, babydoll by YSL.

the dry down was very different - cheese cakey warm.

excellent for an edt strength

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
(review from a man, teste on my girlfriend9

Very very simple, but amazing, soft, smooth and versatile sweet-fruity pear scent. The opening is really fine pear with a hint of litchi, the mid is a solid combination of heliotrope and jasmine, but the base isn’t good, the strong cedar doesn’t fit in the composition. Nevertheless this is a very pleasent scent, and yes, sometimes less is more.

- Spring/summmer daytime scent, very versatile

- Sillage ang longevity is totally moderate, longevity is around 5 hours

- Safe blind buy

Scent (open, top-mid): 8.5/10 (x2)
Scent (drydown, base): 6.5/10 (x2)
Sillage: 5/10
Longevity: 5/10
Uniqueness: 7.5/10
Versatility: 8/10

Total: 6.938/10

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: I mostly get cedar wood from this one. It dominates the fragrance, which is a pity because I counted more on pear and litchi which I adore. A somewhat masculine scent.

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Now I completely understand the differing reviews. I had the same experince - Kenzo Madly EDT is a chameleon. I recieved a decant of this and when first smelling the nozzle I thought "what a delicious pear scent". That was around the end of spring. Unfortunately it didn't play out very well on my skin around that time. Overripe pear and really just weird. Tried it again around summer - nope. Now I grabbed the decant again because I need a purse spray for one of my bigger bottles and thought I'd just empty it (sorry). However - being the never-give-up type I sprayed it again and wow! There are no spices listed in the notes (technically) but this is now a wonderful scent of spiced fruits with a little jasmine, woody notes and musk. It could be the cedar working its magic. Absolutely wonderful and very different. I will gladly use up my decant in autumn. At least for my body chemistry this seems to be the perfect time!

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Powdery , balmy. I dont smell pear, maybe cedar mutate that note. This is not the watery pear, normally used, it is rather a jam.

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Smells nice in the shop so I bought it, but when I use it, it's just completely different, such a disappointment!

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
I dont really like it. start out with Tangy pear litchi scent. Its kinda offensive. But the dry down quite good actually. It stays on my skin making statement "I'm totally here, sniff me often".

I like to sprays a lot so this wont do.
Luckily i just bought the mini version.

No floral detected to my nose.

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: This is a strange little thing.... The first time I wore this was a cold winterday in northern Europe and all I could smell was pear: sweet, ripe pear. The second time I tried it was a hot and humid summerday in Southern Europe and all I could smell was musk: strong, fresh musk. Third time: now it is autumn and this scent really show me the best: ripe pear, sweet litchi, fresh aquatic musk all blend toghether to a Beautiful spice. Maybe it was my skin the two other times I tried it but for me this is a autumn scent, can work in spring too I guess.

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
I think this is a great fragrance.

It starts out indeed quite fruity, with the pear and litchi really at the fore, and the sensuous jasmine lingering. But as it fades, it seems to fade into this beautiful, rosy musk that does have something of a tropical note to it - not overdone. It's really lovely, that dry down, and I keep catching it again this morning on my clothes.

I think this is better than the parfum.

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Very generic, sweet, nothing special.

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
Unique and enchanting fragrance with delicious juicy pear and litchi notes and delicate florals that work perfectly together.
Pretty crystal and fuschia pear shaped twisted glass bottle to echo the pear note.
As with all Kenzo scents,it's well crafted and worth every penny.
Beautiful work of art packaging as usual,this time with vibrantly colourful butterflies. <3
If you love pear notes as I do this is highly recommended.

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
I like this one. Madly Kenzo! is bright, fresh and young.
It's very musky, so if you don't like musky perfumes, you may not like this one. It smells like jasmine and litchi on my skin.

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
I think I'd like to own a little bottle!

I REALLY like this on myself, but this scent -- even if applied with a light touch -- might be something that gives other people a headache. So, I'd want to be cautious wearing it to, say, work, a restaurant, the gym.

As per other reviews, it has a VERY strong fruity opening. I also detect musk and cedar at this stage, too. The "floral" is there, without a doubt, but I don't sense it as keenly as other members. To me, this is a clean, lovely-smelling "shampoo" scent!

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: This is very peppery to my nose and after a while very sweet. Although I don´t dislike it it´s not a scent I want to own. The balance between the sweet pear and the sharp cedar is´t the best and it´s a rather odd combination to my nose. I think I will use up my sample though :)

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: smells like sweet syrupy medicine! don't like it at all :(

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
AS somebody said just before me, I got it in promotion same day bought chanel coco noir as the special evening fragrance. And I loved it mainly because it was light compare to chanel and cheaper, much cheaper. Then I loved it for another 2 weeks and I stopped I was like: ehh it's ok.

Then it was another month I was using it from time to time when suddenly one day I sniffed my jumper which I had the day before (with Kenzo Madly) and I liked it again, very special smell.

I don't like sweet smells, or very vanilla smells but this one even it is a bit sweet (kind of) doesn't really bother me.

So yes, give it a strong 6.5/10 like it but not sure if buy again.

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Too heavy for me, even if it's only eau de toilette. Later I feel overpowering oriental wood, just like one dominating note. In most of cases, I like warm, oriental, woody fragrances, but only if it keeps some balance between flowers and wood. Madly by Kenzo doesn't.

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: This has recently SO surprised me! Got it cheaply on a trip to London and felt "meh" about it- just one to wear on those days when I don´t really care I thought, since it is nice enough with the litche and jasmine. One night I put it on before bed and I woke up to the MOST amazing, clean, fresh, fruity and musky smell ever! LOVELY! I feel that one shouldn´t be fooled by the strongly fruity opening since that one smoothly carries over to the really nice jasmine and it all together falls into clean woody notes and this so clean and surprising musk. A few here don´t like the musk and yes, it is strong- i. however, love it! There is just something about this Madly i cannot put my finger on and I would really suggest people to give it more than one try in the store! I am really glad I did and I am planning on buying a large bottle since I am sure this is one of those scents that the company just discontinues or maybe they´ll add some flanker with the notes changed... Another thing that surprises me is that I do like the aquatic note in it- I thought I was completely over anything aquatic, but in this it just makes sense- the fragrance is also stronger than frags with an aquatic note usually is! I will now research heliotrope since there is heliotrope in it and I am not familiar with that note!

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
The campaign for this really confuses me. This is such a heavy, musk scent and the ad makes you think of a fresh, young fragrance.

I can hardly detect any other single note, when I give this a whiff all I see in my head is this cheap bottle of musk my mother bought me when I was like 12, that I couldn't stand.

I'm not going to say this is a stinker, but I am not a big fan of musk to begin with, so I would say this is really just for musk enthusiasts.

Seriously.

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
Madly Kenzo EDT is a tad better than its predecessor, Madly Kenzo, but I still wouldn't buy it. The musk note is quite overwhelming in both fragrances.

Madly Kenzo EDT opened with a lot of potential, featuring a fresh pear note and a juicy hint of litchi. It thankfully wasn't too fruity, just soft enough to allow the delicate, feminine heart of jasmine and heliotrope to shine through.

Unfortunately the synthetic musk that I had an issue with in the original made a somewhat abrupt entrance, smothering those beautiful fruits and powdery florals. Don't get me wrong, I adore musk, but in this fragrance the musk note smells like a disastrous mix of chemicals.

Kenzo is usually a brand that works for me, producing a countless number of scents that I have loved enough to add to my collection. This Madly series has unfortunately been a bit of a let-down.

A dear friend sent me a sample of Kenzo Madly EDT, and I thank her because I wouldn't have tried it otherwise. If you bitterly disliked the original like I did, you might find yourself enjoying Kenzo Madly EDT, as it is quite a different composition, and is not as heavy.

I do hope that Madly Kiss 'n Fly and the new and upcoming Madly Oud Collection are improvements on this fragrance. Refine that musk note and then maybe they'll have a winner.

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
I smell honey from the start to the end... at least on my skin.

The honey isnt listed in the notes, that show that i dont know anything about scents ; )

Has a good lasting, but isnt for me.

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: It's really fresh and happy... but there is waaaayyyy too much musk... like most of other kenzos; i'm moving on easily.

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: I get a significant litchi note from the beginning to the end. Though it's very detectable, it's soft and tender, not in an aggressive way. It's fruity, sweet and sour, but incredibly clean. It doesn't smell too girly but absolutely cute and I think it works well in spring, even in hot summer as it's fresh. However, it's probably more suitable for young ladies IMO due to the image of litchi. I tested EDP too and they're very different, as EDP has somehow a masculine vibe. The longevity is about 5h and the sillage rather close.

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
My dad bought me this without me asking for it and i'm glad he did, the more i wear it, the more i like it
The opening is mostly pear, litchi and lovely jasmine, the drydown is more about the jasmine and cedar aaand a lot of musk, very fresh, kind of aquatic but still different, not your typical fruity floral at all, it has some edge. The first time i wore it i wasnt super happy about it but now i'm completely hooked so give it a chance! also the pear and litchi are more about the juice, not sweetness, i think they smell pretty natural. i love this scent for spring and summer.

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
Quite normal, I encounter many scents with fruity-floral-acquatic, nothing special for me.
I expect better ones from Kenzo.

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
The beginning, pear, rasberry.. i love the top notes very smooth, not so strong..
But the base with cedar.. umm not.. its too strong.
i agreed with gennie17.
Not the best from Kenzo.


6/10

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: This is my actual signature fragrance. There is something very fresh and happy about this scent. I am not an expert when it comes to fragrances by the way. It has this very light citrus scent to it.

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: This is a bit better than the EDP in my views, still I am not sure I truly like it, the cedar is pretty strong in the top notes, like a wood chips effect. . It is almost like smelling incense in a way, not sure I find the effect of cedar mixed with the other notes very attractive I still get that wet ashtray smell I get in the EDP. I agree there is a dissonance in the notes, in the end there is a sour effect, and I am not too fond of it. Not the best Kenzo.

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
I have to admit, i might have been a bit crazy regarding the campaign. I kind of loved the original madly bottle, the bright colours, the butterflies, ... However, i was taken aback when i smelled that one and could hardly breathe for the incense smell. So when this edt came out i wanted one right away, thinking it would be softer.

So, my grandma bought me the smallest bottle (claims she's to old for perfume so her only choice is to buy them for me - gotta love her :) ). I'm still in love with the shape but after an hour i smelled... Uhm... Nothing :( sprayed on my hair, my neck, my clothes... But to no avail! Will keep the bottle as decoration though :D

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: I like this one, it is lovely and sweet. Surprized to see that much unliked votes.

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
I'm surprised to know that this perfume contains pear. I did not notice it. I think that Madly EDT is another Light Blue copycat but with less citrus in the opening.
Lots of cedar too.
I find Madly EDP much more complex and enjoyable.

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
I like this smell. It is simultaniously sweet, dry, cool, spicy and warm at the same time. The dryness and coolness prevents it from being too sweet, and the sweetness seems almost fleeting at times.

It reminds me of Givenchy Organza, but for young women.

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: I was gifted with this one, although I am grateful and I have to keep it, I am not enjoying this smell. Flowery, kind of sweet. It smells cheap. I wear it to bed, and even that I am not really crazy. This probably would suit younger ladies.

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: I`ve got the tester, tried it twice but it doesn`t say anything to me. Besides, the bottle is horrible.

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
When I first put this on my skin it smelled gorgeous. Fruity, yes. but also a little spicy. Something different. I couldn't really decide if I really liked it because it felt maybe even a little too spicy and woody for my type. Sadly, when I came home (after like half an hour) it turned really really sweet on my skin which I don't like a all. Too bad. If it had stayed the way it started on my skin, I would have bought it immediately... It might just be my body chemistry not working great with this one, though.
Oh, and it lasts surprisingly long. Even after taking a shower, the next day my wrist still smelled like it.

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Maybe I'm just not a litchi fan, so for a couple of hours this fruity juice is a bit annoying for me. Very prominent litchi and pear, but no heliotrope for me (beware, heliotrope lovers, this needs testing). Then - quiet soft musk (but litchi is still there). Despite of fruits and jasmine, this fragrance stays very close to skin. Suitable for having tea with your friend. Or just sitting home.

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: How Gorgeous is this Fragrance!!!...Very Different to the EDP. Soft, Feminine and Elegant, it lingers nicely onto my skin....This Fragrance has certainly won me!!!..Another Beautiful Kenzo Fragrance on the Market!!!

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
20. august 2012

I totally agree with user Antonpan. This has almost (may i even say at all) nothing to do with EDP "Madly". While i like "Madly" EDP very much for it´s character and being not another floral-fruity, i just don´t get this EDT "Madly". Bland, lightly sweet scent with litchi and pear accompanied with a way too much of a jasmine. Oh, yes, there is a heliotrope as well, but somehow these notes don´t combine each other, they mess with each other and if the fragrance would be a chior, this one would not be a good choir at all. More of a music band with one leading singer (Jasmine) and two back vocals (pear and litchi, the opening act). Oh, wait, there is a disturbing fan, that got bakstage and now tries to get on the stage - heliotrope. This concert was a mess, sorry. I´ve seen (smelled) it once and won´t be returning for more.

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: This one has nothing common with woody peppery Madly Eau de Parfum. Madly Eau de Toilette is a typical "pink" fruity floral scent. Nevertheless it is very well done and, yes, it's joyful! The combo of pear and litch here are evident, and these components smell quite natural. Despite the fruitiness the fragrance stays will stay close to skin to my mind. Madly Edt is absolutely another story than Madly Edp, but still lovely and attractive.

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
This scent is very joyful. There reminds me of Annick Goutal petit cherie. Full of pear and lichi. Then scent runs into the musk and the vanilla. Very delicate, cosy. I like it :)
I wait for smelling EDP :)

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
How comes I feel lemonade and bubble champagne, not any fruits?
It's a lovely scent, but I expected more from Kenzo.

product_name: Madly Kenzo! Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Very Kenzo - litchi is lovely much less 'flowery' than kenzo flower more sophisticated and musky. Very very nice - not mind blowingly amazing but you wouldn't complain or be disappointed if you bought it without smelling first.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Ice pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
Nose Note #1

For some reason all I smell is watermelon. The watermelon is kind of solid, but the overall feel is aquatic, watery. Refreshing and has a 1 metre sillage for like 15 minutes, then disappears quickly.

Upd. after a year: We use it as air freshener occasionally and it actually performs really well. I enter the bathroom after 3-4 hours and the beautiful aroma is still vivid.
In the deep drydown it reminds me of the OG L'eau par Kenzo pour Homme.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Ice pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: Really refreshing. Perfect for summer. It almost smells like it would quench your thirst.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Ice pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: I'm not very keen on mint. Reminds me too much of toothpaste. But I 'm willing to give this a try since I am sick to death, fed to the back teeth with the tired and tiresome syrupy fruit salad concoctions that pass for perfume these sad says.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Ice pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: mint and lemon..fresh.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Ice pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: This might be the most refreshingly light scents I have smelled. Beautiful for spring summer but also the light mint livens up a cold winter day. Opens fresh ice mint, lemon, slight ginger tea, becoming a soft pretty floral drydown and lasts for more than 6 hours before you might consider a reapplication. I don't like water lily used in other Kenzos so this was excellent for me. It is a shame this stunner was discontinued, it is the best imo.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Ice pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: It is very aquatic and fresh on me.I like the bottle although it's not really standing out of the crowd.However,some reason is telling me I should not wear this too often.So,maybe I'll wear it whenever I hang out with my friends?

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Ice pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: Very fresh but still, long-lasting, which is a combination hard to find. Not a girly and supersweet fragrance but yet feminine. Perfect for daytime, spring and summer. Vanilla from base notes is noticeable within a few hours and gives it an elegant touch. I love this EDT, such a pity it can't be found anymore...

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Ice pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
I have this from Debenham's clearout shelf and I do not regret buying it.
The scent is crisp, fresh and clean and a bit like snow so I intend to wear it in winter.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Ice pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: There is a note in the original L'eau par Kenzo which I absolutely cannot stand (water lilly). It's also in another Japanese brand fragrance L'Eau D'Issey, just a mere whiff of it on my skin makes me feel ill! I saw this and decided to try it as I didn't even know they had an Ice version! I find this much better than the original one, minty and lemony, which I love and ideal for hot weather. Unfortunately the lasting power on me is a few hours, but in the currant hot temps this and AG eau d'hadrien is just about all I can tolerate. Great summer fragrance.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Ice pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
Very very very minty! And even thought I can't smell it on my skin after a few minutes, other people can apparently so that's ok :-)

One of the mintiest ladies frags I've smelt, really fresh. Nice bottle too!

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Ice pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
I love Kenzo. I think I have not tried any single fragrance of their that I did not like.

I tried L'Eau par Kenzo Ice a long time ago and only remembered it was nice. I retested it yesterday, and looked up the notes to find out with quite a shock that there is no watermelon here, while on my it seemed more like a watermelon water with a huge dose of freesia. I am not sure if I would classify it as woody aromatic on my skin, since I did not really get most of the notes, except maybe for lemon and some vanilla. Sadly I didnt get any mint nor ginger.

Nevertheless, I blame my skin for it, and I still think it is quite an interesting fragrance, specially for summer.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Ice pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
after the first scary sniff it becomes delicious orange peel.. totally agree with amanda.
I don't like l'eau par kenzo, and it has nothing to do with it

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Ice pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
I had the sample of the original, but there is some tone that badgers me a lot. But the ICE I love. It is fresh and it stays like this. It's perfect everyday scent, as I can't wear something that's too notable. It gives a cloud of freshness around the user and that makes it perfect for me.

Update: I've used this for a while now and like it everyday more and more. The top mint lasts long and is my favorite. I'm really happy that I found it. It's really a surprise as I don't like the original.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Ice pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: well this one is stronger a bit more masculine. it could be the mint that is very strong but yet so refreshing. it's like a lemon-mint ice tea. and the base notes give it just the right touch to soften it up a bit. very appropriate for young girls but also for adults. very good choice for summer fun time.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Ice pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: i love leau par kenzo, but i wanna ask if this one, leau par kenzo love or the original leau par kenzo is more suitable for a teenage girl uses it during summer? thanks

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Ice pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: its fresher but stronger than l'eau par kenzo, actually currently i prefer this to the original, its really refrshing and after the drydown to me it smelled like recently peeled mandarin,

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo pour Femme Sunlight Edition Limitée Kenzo
review_content:
Who forgot fruit peels and banana peels in the heat?

A charge of vivacity and energy - watermelon crust with lemon, at times as if a green unripe apple. In the base a little bit of wood, sounds noble, not in the style of summer watering cans.
In general, it behaved decently on the blotter. But the beginning is strange, it may scare you off.
If you like fresh lemons with a slight bitterness throughout, not just in the top notes - it is for you. I would take it for myself, but where to put the previous fifty bottles).
Upd. Winter test on the skin showed bedbugs. Not for nothing I wrote in summer that the start can scare away 😂

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo pour Femme Sunlight Edition Limitée Kenzo
review_content: Flowers, fruits, aquatics, lactone - I'll take it without looking, oh-so-tempting combination. The bottle (system first corrected to "flag" 😂) looks gorgeous. This is summer at it's very best! The time in the afternoon when the bright yellow sun turns to set, and the deep blue and cloudless sky above.....

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo pour Femme Sunlight Edition Limitée Kenzo
review_content:
osim memori kolekcije koja je izdana prošle godine i koja mi je fantastična, evo još jedan novi kenzo kojem se nie bih bunila u kolekcija;)
it is very comfortable and pleasant, it is more scented, it looks as if you have come out from under the shower, it has a penetrating look.
on my skin it lasts a couple of sati, light, but solid, ideal for a lot of application for a hot summer...at +35 I still don't need anything more, I just want something uniform and affordable.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo pour Femme Sunlight Edition Limitée Kenzo
review_content: Wooster, 50 bottles of L'eau line is almost like 50 shades of gray :) since 2015 I have been approaching these L'eau flankers, and no matter how you twist it, at least in one direction, but all different (to my nose, so to speak). Kenzo no worse than G. Schoen manages to lead people around the nose (in the literal sense of the word) with a small number of ingredients, replacing them or changing places to get different flavors and find admirers for each bottle. Moreover, in TV concentration the fragrances hold up no worse than SP, and in some cases even better.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo pour Femme Sunlight Edition Limitée Kenzo
review_content: Wooster, for every bottle of Kenzo, and other companies that produce flankers, there will be haters of those very "offshoots" of classics. So maybe for the 51st bottle we should stop being disappointed and hope for a radical reformulation of the L'eau line? :) I mean, it's kind of strange to evaluate a fragrance you haven't listened to just by reading the pyramid and thinking "same old thing again".

Very powdery yet floral at the same time. Powdery yet lively. Soft. Verging on gourmand with its vanilla. I can feel hawthorn, jasmin and rose. I think I like it more than Flower but they are very similar. It feels warm and I love it for winter.
this perfume reminds me of my childhood.
This reminds me of my mother’s Crepe de Chine of the 1950’s

Spicy lightly vanillic rose lipstick; very powdery with beautiful shades of smoky roses. Works best in warm weather to me, all the notes get a chance to shine.
Lasts around 6 hrs on me, major projection beast. Rather shocking considering the scent isn't an 'aggressive' one, quite the opposite in fact.
Classic Alberto Morillas powder. Reminds me of the Blv series by Bvlgari.

I just got this today and it smelled exactly how I thought it would. Original flower with pepper. I was worried about the lack of the notes in the original and the added pepper. But here's the thing ladies, spices are at the top of the pyramid. The pepper dries down. It becones even more like the original. And as for the lack of orange, violet, and opponax; you really dont notice its absence. Its somehow still very powdery in a high quality way. Successful blind buy!

Spicey baby oil scent, thats why i detect it. Baby body oil scent mixed with something gently spieced up.
Not my type, somehow i connect it with Asian style.

I was disappointed when I had to swap away my Kenzo Flower bottle because I did like the scent but I couldn't cope with its nuclear strength that literally took my breath away. Fortunately in another swap I was surprised with a sample of Kenzo Flower Essentielle and it is what I wished the original to be. KFE is in no way as strong as KF - at least to me - and it is also less sweet. I can actually smell the flowers in here whereas KF was more sweet powder with just a hint of flowers to my nose. KFE is rather lovely; yes, it still packs a punch in the opening but that calms down relatively quickly and leaves me with a wonderful powdery/flowery trail with just a hint of sweetness that rescues it from becoming cold and unapproachable. Like this, however, it has a lovely comforting freshness and a nice nostalgic feel about (probably the rose in here) that makes it a joy to wear.
Balsamic, floral, musky scent, nice, but too overwhelming for me. It's rather for cold season.

I was searching for a small bottle of perfume for travelling time I had tested FLOWER by Kenzo before and I liked it (no love ofcourse) so when I saw a 25 ml of flower in a perfume shop I did not notice the word "essential" on the box and I thought it was the same perfume. After unboxing I just realized they are different :) At first I got disappointed I got lots of rose, jasmine, powder and a little of smoke:)
I wore it at work and I got complements from 3 people so I decided to change my attitude, it is also a high quality perfume. It does not smell artificial and stays for hours. It is very feminine, powdery,unique,complex,quiet,longlasting,it has its own charm and young men seem to like it.

Well, I tried this one a year ago and it was all about Hawthorn all over me.. not nice at all. Now I have tried it again. Lovely Rose, Insence, Pepper, pink pepper, Jasmin, Musk and Vanilla mix. And its lovely! Less is more and 1 spray goes a long way. Very longlasting on me - 15+ hours.

Day 2: I woke up this morning and Essentielle was still around. Soft, warm pepper/Insence/rose-mix was dancing on my skin. Impressed!

Pepper on my skin is great. Pepper is fresh, warm and calms down the sweet flowernotes. I can't wear strong Citrusnotes - the almost always turn maleish on me, so I love pepper/pink pepper-notes they work perfectly on me =)

Tja, jag provade denna för ett år sen och då skrek den Havtorn, inte alls trevlig. Nu testar jag den igen och den är ljuvlig. Ros, Rökelse, Peppar, rosa peppar, Jasmin, Musk och Vanilj i härlig mix. Helt underbar ju! Lite är lagom, 1 sprejning räcker länge, otroligt hållbar på mig, mer än 15 timmar.

Dag 2: Vaknade i morse och Essentielle är fortfarande kvar. Mjuk, varm peppar/rökelse/ros-mix som fortfarande ångar från huden. Imponerad!

Peppar på min hud är magiskt. Peppar blir fräsch, varm och dämpar de söta noterna från blomnoterna. Jag kan inte bära starka citrusnoter i parfymer - de blir nästan alltid manliga på mig, men peppar/rosa peppar älskar jag och de funkar utmärkt på mig utan att bli stickiga eller skarpa.

When I'm wearing this perfume, I feel like I'm in a world drawn on a white sheet of paper with thick black ink. It's a tricolour world where everything, every last thing is either white, pink like a rose, or sky blue. Clean and calm and quiet, very comfortable. I'm especially happy to wear Essentielle when I'm uneasy or feeling awkward in a situation as it provides to the piece I need in those times.

It's a very clean scent, soapy even. Rose, jasmine, hawthorn, and vanilla dominate mostly on my skin. The incense is very soft like a breeze or gentle wind, and very well blended with the vanilla. I can hardly detect the peppers at all; I don't mind it actually, as I guess it would give a sharper edge to the perfume that would ruin the dreamy image I've got wearing it. A real comfort perfume if you're into floral ones.

Tried this yesterday and i thought this is very similar to Al Rehabs Rose perfume oil!

This flower essentielle version is smoother and sweeter than the original. Also very long lasting - i prefer this one.

I tried this long ago but never got around to own it. I remember thinking that the dryDown was similar to Cristobal. Now I got an impulse to just buy it, and no regrets here! It is a classic 3 stage perfume, with a wonderful Rose Jasmin and a bit peppery top note, followed by a short lasting middle that is powdery and pleasant, and with a wonderful long lasting sweet powdery and a bit incensy vanilla dryDown. Really such a pleasant trip, it never ceases being super feminine, elegant yet cozy at the same time! Great lasting power too, with moderate to strong sillage. Love it!

This smells very similar to the regular "Flower", but with more pronunced rose.
And it`s a nice rose, not an "air freshener" type of rose. It`s not a "floral" scent at all though!

Warm, cozy, easy to love. The bottle looks very cute too.

Thank you for the sample Denise! :-)

I liked this perfume a lot while I had it. It starts with this oily, pencil like note, quickly developing into peppery goodness. It's similar to the original Flower, but so different at the same time. The pepper gives the scent the playfulness, and sharpness. The incense it's so briliant here, just the right amount to make it smokey and misterious, something so very femme-fatale like. I love the development of this perfume, starting with oily woodiness, "cooking" into earthy jasmine with hint of incense and blast of pepper. This does not smell soapy on me, it's quite balmy, which I do not understand looking into the notes. I'd say try before you buy.
I do not detect vanilla, I think it just blends into the other ingredients and makes them darker and richer, without adding sweetness. Kenzo knows how to deal with vanilla, so I think what they did here is excelent. Great projection, great development, overall I'd say it's absolutely 100% oriental perfume, on me at least.
Bravo Kenzo, you did fantastic with Essentielle!

This smells quite similar to the original Flower but with an extra zesty kick in the opening and a bit less powder in the drydown. It is sweet but in no way smells like something edible. Flower Essentielle is sophisticated and comforting, and if the original flower didn't quite do it for you, try this one. Also, the bottle is gorgeous and surprisingly tall. My 0.84oz bottle stands at 10 inches or so and towers above the rest of my collection! Doesn't hide in the crowd, that's for sure.

I really do regret that I sold this scent 3-4 years ago - it was too sweet and vanilla for me. It's one of the scents you had to be grown up for wearing them. Now it's different, I fell incense and rose mostly <3 and I know that it'll be my signature for a/w 2013.

Very good scent. Much better than original Flower, less powdery. The pepper and incense notes sooths the fragrance and turns it into a much more interesting perfume. Very good sillage, pretty good longevity, it's a uplifting perfume, makes me feel comfortable, calm and comfy at the same time. Too good to my coworkers when I wear this, I get a much better person to work with!
Jasmine shows up in a non-indolic smooth way. The rose in this frag is not the overwhelming rose of Agent Provocateur (and I do love Agent Provcateur) nor the superfresh rose of Eau de Quatre Reines by L'Occitane. It's a soft but intensive rose. I feel like the rose on this is the one Very Irresistible was aiming to, but got somewhere else instead - they reached a lovely rose, but not a irresistible one.
Nice powdery clean musk, not too powdery, and a good use of hawthorn, too.
As usual, the Kenzo Vanilla Signature (I like it very very much) wanders throughout.

Almost as lovely spiced as Kenzo Flower Le Parfum. If you couldn't reach Le Parfum, try this one. It's indeed a different smell, but them both share some character.

This is absolutely one of the most gorgeous perfumes I have ever smelled! Thanks again Anna for the sample!
You've got wonderful taste in fragrances! :)
This is a gorgeous floral fragrance on me.
It's not too much about Incense & Vanilla on me as it is about Rose & Jasmine.
A lovely, beautiful bouquet of these flowers, more powdery than it is smoky and just a soft hint of Vanilla which adds a very delicate sweetness to the composition. Or it is the hawthorn... I just read the odor profile for this note and this could be definitely the sweetness!
Very elegant! I love it!!
Longevity & sillage are excellent!!
♥♥♥♥♥

It was my favorite perfume for a really long time. Before it went out, it was also my mother's favorite. When I first smelled it, it felt like soap. After try it for servel times, I really loved it. It was rosey, soft clean. The bottle was interesting, just like a flower~

This is a very nice perfume and reminds me a lot of CK Eternity plus the rose note. I was very happy to include same in my perfume collection. Sillage and longevity are very good and it is perfect for Spring season. As I tried after some time I found out that the incense note is very well blended with the flower and gives to the perfume a deep but yet gothic style. I like it a lot.

I like the initial peppery florsl scent but that quickly turns to powdery vanilla, powdery vanilla and that is all. Not special or unique. Not worth the price in my opinion. I have owned and loved three other Kenzo perfumes, including Kenzo Flower. This new Kenzo Flower Essentiell is nothing next to the original Flower.

Love jasmine!! Is my "signature" note and never fails me. Although, is a very dangerous ingredient that mixed with something stronger can be really a tragedy. Pepper has this effect in Kenzo, it has happened to me that people asks me if I don't get dizzy with it because they do! Others have told me it's beautiful and they love it. It's strong and I recommend to put it once and never retouch. Is for any occasion and suits every season of the year.
