the very first thought that will pop in when you smell it is "agh what an annoying flowery smell" but i have to say the base note of this perfume is so warm and nice so my advice is to wear it before going out with at least 1 hour so you get the satisfying result that you search for . it was a gift so i have no idea if its too expensive or not and never searched for it online

On my skin this one starts very dark and with a great punch of insence. Middlenote gives a licoriseheavy note blended with dark rose and pepper. I usually loves pepper, but I don't like licorise. This one is not for me. Looking at notes in this scent, maybe its the Hawthorn that makes me think of heavy, dark licorise. Hawthorn smells very heavy if you crush the berries, and Hawthorn is a smell I really dont like.

After 3 hours when Hawthorn finally dissapeared the basenote is gorgeous, soft incense, rose and musk. Very classy and elegant mix.

På min hud startar denna väldigt mörk och med en rejäl dos rökelse. Hjärtnoten ger en kraftig lakrits not blandad med djup, mörk ros och peppar. Jag älskar peppar i mina dofter, men jag tycker inte om lakrits. Denna är inte för mig. Dock en doft för karriärskvinnan i mitt tycke. När jag tittar på doftnoterna så ser jag Havtorn, kanske är det den som gör att jag känner lakrits. Havtorn har en tung och kraftig doft när man mosar bären och Havtorn är en doft jag verkligen inte gillar.

Efter 3 timmar när äntligen Havtorn-noten försvann så blev basnoten helt underbar. Mjuk rökelse, ros och musk i en elegant och klassisk mix.
I don't like rose at all but this one is very unique, powdery and vanilla floral fragrance. It smells very comforting on me. Its so nice and I love it .

I get aldehydes within the floral notes, similar to Chanel No 5's soapy aldehydic notes. Then the obvious Jasmine and Rose notes. I prefer this to the original, personally. But that is just me. It's incredibly similar but I just like it more.

Edit: I have TOTALLY changed my stance on this one and own a bottle of it. It is gorgeous. Still, they are quite similar to one another - I think both are great, both come down to preferences...
I luv this but it's not for everyone. It smells like baby powder and bananas. But I love it!

This is unexpected perfume for me.
I got it as gift, and i didn't really notice the 'Essentielle' word because my eyes set to Kenzo Flower: the notorious floral perfume.My first encounter with Kenzo FLower was years ago, and it was dreadful. It was horrible, overwhelming flower bouquet that turned my intestines upside down. Having read 'essentielle', i don't hope that much either. Not a fan of floral perfume,never was.But i take my chance and give it a whiff.

First impression : it is rose. a very delicate rose, light and intriguing because there is this comforting & powdery scent. but then again, there's incense [oh good lord i hate this ingredient]but on this one, it smells heavenly.I love the dry down part. It lingers for quite some time with this subtle neutral and jasmine-ish scent. It is absolutely beautiful.
About the incense, it is deep but curiously 'buried' under the rose-jasmine duet, a bit soapy like Chanel Coco Mademoiselle, but Kenzo Flower Essentielle is more subtle, not as glamorous as Coco Mademoiselle, but still, a very beautiful fragrance.
i love it so much!
So unique that you cannot possibly mistake it for something else. However, its very powdery, so if you are not in to it, the dry-down will disappoint you sorely.
wearing this perfume makes me feel my day more optimistic... good for everyday use...
i agree that kenzo flower was not so good but this essentiele is brilliant , but u have to wear it in small volume and it mellows with ur skin beautifully, and it lasts for ages on skin.
Is very light and comun fragance,not for me.
A very unique smell and very soft. Love this fragrance alot. !! =)

Comprei este perfume sem conhecê-lo e foi uma decepção. Primeiro é muito gostoso e suave. Depois fica muito ruim, só cheiro de incenso e nada de flores. Por fim surge o cheiro de jasmim, mas então o cheiro acaba, pois a fixação dele é péssima.
Gostaria que alguém me informasse como faço para adicionar os perfumes que possuo, amo, gosto, etc, no meu profile do site fragrantica. Só consigo incluir o perfume de assinatura e os preferidos.

It's so floral , hot , generous, cheerful <3
I don't know in what extend it's connected with the 2000 "Flower by Kenzo" because i have never smelled it , or if i did , i don't remember it.
the rose is so strong and floral I just can't handle it.

I never was attracted tho the 'Flower' perfumes. I received a sample of Essentielle (the only way to be sure if you really like a smell) and tested it. It's a real flowery scent, I can smell the incense immediately, normally you'd have to wait until drydown to smell this.

On the other hand, the rose and jamsine stay present to, which is a good thing. Lots of other perfumes do differ from the opening scent after a while.
Not this one.

But I do think I know now why I'm not very fund of Flower, there's just too much vanilla. I like it on someone else but for myself, I don't want to be surrounded by this bakery smell.

Must have for vanilla lovers!

I love this fragrance. The weird part is that it's drydown reminds me a little the drydown of Infusion d'Iris on me - probably this is the incense that makes it's appearance. Very nicely blended and feminine... I was gifted a 25 ml bottle and I can already see that it's not going to last long :)
I think it smells like a mix of Flower by Kenzo and Kenzo Amour. It smells good and fresh,but nothing i would wear longer than a few minutes.

MUSKY ROSY FLORAL FRAGRANCE, An
eau de parfum essentielle, a creation
crafted with a new density… where
emblematic ingredients of FlowerbyKenzo
are magnified by components of
uncompromising quality.
Do not like this one which when I tried La Tigra by Kenzo, I love it! Two opposite poles of scent to my nose. I cannot sand this scent at all but do love Tigra!

The rose and insence and the vanilla and musk i clearly feel ,but not the jasmin . Its a lovely ,slightly oriental in a light way,flowery smell. The oriental light toutch and the vanilla with the classic flowers is an interesting combo! I like it ,its NOT ordinary

While I did not at all like Kenzo Flower I like Esentielle much more. The opening is rather powdery,abit wishy washy and slightly soapy. But then later the scent becomes much more sweet and floral and it allmost smells like jasmine and cucumber that has been rolled in vanilla sugar (don't ask me where the cucumber came from). The incence is not that prominent at all but it sits nicley in the background and lingers with the rest of the notes. The type of woman that I would imagene could be caught wearing this. Would be someone who was sweet and rather quirky not conventionaly beautiful but rather strange and intriguing. Because this scent is rather strange and at times sharp and no way near the conventional mold for what is considered a good perfume.

the opening is quite fresh with the rose...after a while turns flowery and then u can feel the incense...lacks the powderness of the original ..it is kinda of lighter...very crisp with a touch of exotics from the incense....quite interesting
The rose and jasmine are more prominent in this one. It lacks a bit of the powderyness of the original Flower and turns rather floral on the skin.

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Когда я только его купила, он мне совершенно не понравился, был резким и очень одеколонистым. В итоге я его так и не полтзовала, пролежал в комоде. И сейчас я его достала, и боже, это совершенно другой аромат. Нежный, пудровый, цветочный, не слишком приторный, и он мне нравится. Думаю духи после транспортировки зимой следует выдержать и дать им отдохнуть

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: the notes are fantastic unbelievable ultra gorgeous… the smell? Supernova Synthetic generic weapon

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Beautiful gentle floral perfect for Spring and Summer. First spray is a bit scratchy, as if a distant puff of salty sand tickles your nose, but then the pretty flowers open like a breath of fresh scented air. The blend of peony and rose is soft, pretty, with a lingering ultra feminine touch. It's more creamy in the heat, more powdery in cool weather. Overall this perfume is light but persistent, leaving a beautiful trail . It stays on skin for 6 hours, and clings to hair and fabrics until you wash it off. Projection is moderate for the first 4 hours, then it stays closer to skin, still leaving a soft trail as you walk by. The vanilla darkens over time, changing to a deep amber color, becoming richer, adding better longevity to the perfume. This EDT is different from the original EDP. I own and love them both.

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: If you like rose soap, that typical lotion scent and sweet powder, all without being juvenile or over the top, this one's for you! This is so softly floral, lotion-y and cute, kind of innocent. The pear is the same as in Irresistible. They have some of the same vibe, but I actually prefer this one. This lasts longer and is more like a "real" perfume. This is perfect for everyday wear or work, I would wear this any season too. But I think it's perfect for spring and summer. I think this would be more suited for people 25+. It doesn't smell amazing close-up after spraying, but very lovely if you let it come to your nose instead. Impressive longevity, especially for an EDT!

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Nothing special but very pretty nonetheless, a sweet, light and wholly inoffensive scent! Could see this as a safe gift for a younger female relative if she enjoys the colour pink, could also see a office lady with a cute manicure wearing this to work.

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
Much less intense than its version in the emerald green bottle, but at the same level of quality and finish, that's for sure! Although I'm not sure I'd like to have one for myself, for now!

A rather frightening opening, due to the odd combination of citrus touches, pear juice and another oily almond content, with zero flowers and one note trying to overlap the other; It was messy, I must say, but if I can get through his exit, it'll be pure joy!

A garden of living Roses and another bouquet of dewy Peonies stand out in the heart, bringing a sensation of neatness, freshness, absolute cleanliness and, at the same time, admirable joviality; cool this tender feeling of young age that he refers here!

Finally, it becomes a fragrance that is very close to the skin, with a vanilla background, and hints of sensual musk, and a few more pinches of wet woods and a very shy, very exquisite lily and for those people who admire more intimate perfumes, who seek to perfume themselves only for themselves!

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: I was disappointed. It smells like the soap of Marseille :( I didn't like it at all. I could have bought Allure or Coco Mademoiselle 🤦🏼♀️🤦🏼♀️

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Very synthetic, was disappointed. Strong scent though.

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: The notes look just divine, I imagined something lovely and softer. It doesn't smell like Nivea at all. Very interesting composition, I find it hard to make my mind up about it. I smell something slightly sharp, it's not creamy and too soft (like Nivea), I think, I would really love it without the pear as something stands out too much and destroys that beautiful soft, flowery, milky undertone, which is felt throughout. It is slightly powdery, I'd probably love it if it was less on that sweetness. It's not cloying by all means, nothing close to LVEB sweetness, but I can't love it as it still annoys me.

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: My mom owned this one a long ago. Not the best versatile female fragrance, but I still recommend it for you to wear during warm weather. I'm not basically a Kenzo perfumes fan, but I recognize this one as the best pick. It has a wonderful rose smell, gotta love how the base notes provide your girlfriend, wife or best friend with that blameless smell of a musk, violet, vanilla and sandalwood. You also really gonna love the freshness of the perfume. I recommend this one.

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
Something in this fragrance is off putting to my nose and I really think it’s the rose. To me, this does smell like Nivea body cream/lotion but less pleasant because of that rose. I get the peony here but it’s overshadowed by sharp rose. I’m hoping I can find a way to tone that note down as I’m in love with the bottle and otherwise find the fragrance pleasant.

I think this could be worn as a casual everyday scent. It has decent lasting power and forms a light and airy scent bubble. I could also see this being worn to bed

Update: I couldn’t make it work, gave it away

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
I was not the biggest fan of Kenzo World EDP, I didn't hate it but found it rather mediocre and kind of messy. Because some reviewers described the EDT as not similar to the original and as a Nivea cream type of scent, I still wanted to try it.

Well, I do think it's similar to the EDP, but less fruity and more floral, and more harmonious all in all. Both have the same lush, humid, syrupy texture that is also found in the My Burberry line, which is no surprise as they're all by the same perfumer, Francis Kurkdjian.
World EDT starts out fruity, I'm not sure if I would have identified it as pear though. It's sweet and juicy, but the floral notes of dewy rose and peony already peek through. I'm glad they left out the red berries that clashed with the peony in the EDP. After I while the scent becomes creamier and a little powdery with the almond blossom, musk and orris, which is quite pleasant. It's clearly almond blossom, not almond, so this is not gourmand at all, but it's much sweeter than Nivea and similar body cream scents. I wouldn't put it into the "clean and freshly showered" category, it's a sweet fruity floral to me. When I once tried it in an overheated mall with a heavy winter jacket on I noticed it turned sickly on my skin, so I'd say this is better suited to mild weather and lighter clothes.
After 6 hours I can barely smell it today, so the performance is nothing to write home about. The whole scent is nothing extraordinary, but it's nice and likeable.

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
i imagine a flirty, mature lady wearing this - the same lady on the bus that sprayed on too much perfume and is suffocating you.

would recommend getting a tester before making a purchase.
too strong for my liking, nauseating.

bright side: packaging is cute though

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
I love this perfume so very much, it's calming and clean, smelling very soapy, and, I love the soapy smell in it, it reminds me of my Black Mexx and my beloved Escada Especially perfumes.

10/10 points, fits everybody in the universe, and I also think this perfume will smell very good on men :))

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
How bright, uplifting and feminine! This is one of those scents if you want to feel fresh, clean and pretty: then splash this on and you're good to go!

Kenzo 'World' EDT smells NOTHING like the EDP and falls into the same category as Ferragamo 'Signorina' EDT (Except I love Signorina more).
First spray I get that crisp, soapy pear. It's definitely citrusy on me and not sweet (if you're looking for sweet pear go for Katy Perry's 'Meow' EDP). Within 5 minutes the florals come in, they are tart! My skin projects the rose most. As it dries down it's quite linear: Powdery, crisp pears on a bed of tart, soapy roses. I get way more peony in 'World' EDP.

Is it a complex, unique scent? No definitely not. Do I think it's an easy reach for all daytime occasions in warm weather? Heck yes!
P.S. If you're looking for a more mature version of this scent 100% go for Lancôme's Idole range.

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
I dont Think this is similar to Nivea which I’m familiar with.
But I do Think its similar to Dove soap/lotion.

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
Nivea skin cream--powdery florals and waxy fruit, with that unmistakable odd sweet musk.

It's nice, but the flashback to all my mid-eighties high school angst hit me like a slap, and I swear my face broke out in sympathetic second puberty.

Peony and pear on top, orris root and Duran Duran on the bottom.

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: This is very sweet on me, almost in a sickly way. It must be the pear notes. A shame because so like a lot of Kenzo perfume. I really like the bottle and it convinced em to give it a try.

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: This perfume is very light. Perfect office scent; no one would be offended by this scent. Use it for a tranquil afternoon or to go to sleep at night. Such a delicate scent could even suit a child. I love eyes....so I love the bottle. However, the contents of the kitschy bottle are quite inoffensive.

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
I would describe this as a clean, fresh floral. Perfect for spring time. Not offensive in any way. Lots of comparisons to Nivea cream fragrance (and body lotion) which I cannot attest to as I have not smelled that one. This is very feminine and pretty. I don't know how much I will reach for this as I have a lot of other fragrances that I like and enjoy a lot more than this one but I am not mad that I own it. It is not very loud - sillage and projection I would say are moderate at best - which for Kenzo is unusual. Usually their fragrances project and last a long time on me.

UPDATE: 12hrs later on my scarf - I can still smell it !! Longevity is awesome !

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: It is very pleasant❤️Clean, powdery a little bit skin-like sweet. I’m not smelling nivea cream here at all. Opening is very fresh, after some time it’s more powdery but not in bad way. It’s safe blind-buy I guess if you like clean-fresh scents 😊

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
An eccentric bottle with a special scent inside it! (There should never be lame/generic fume inside a bottle that has this much character.)

I like how the powdery note is combined with the fresh florals. A very pleasant, easy to approach perfume, that is not generic. Pleasant but not boring. I could wear this anytime and I like the eye.

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
The other day I got a tester of this and I wholeheartedly agree with Albiretu, this smells SO much like Nivea cream!

There's definitely a little bit added fruitiness going on, but the Nivea vibe is super strong.

Longevity in cooler European weather (15-20 Celsius, 59-68 Fahrenheit) is rather weak on me. I can smell it for about 2-3 hours. Sillage is also rather quiet. I guess people will mostly smell it when you move by them, as in getting into /out of the same elevator, moving by their desk closely etc.

It's inoffensive, clean, fresh, feminine, the perfect office fragrance. Might also fit well with a white dress meeting your friends for a spring or summer brunch. Weirdly also I could picture 1980s Steffi Graf (or insert any other 80s or early 90s tennis player) to be promoting it.

I don't think I would go out of my way to buy this, but I wouldn't be mad if I got it as a gift randomly. It's a no brainer pick for the daytime and for settings when you're not sure people will appreciate stronger fragrances or not. I'd definitely use it up.

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: I remember leaving a rather underwhelming review for Kenzo World EDP some years ago. This one, however, is a whole different story. Very powdery, but in a good way, almond milk-like scent with barely there vanilla and very delicate heart notes. I'd compare it to the smell of skin (not leather, but clean, soft human skin, if you know what I mean).

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
In love with this, smells to me like Nivea Cream, literally identical to it. Such a calming and soothing scent, appropriate for all occasions, from a work lunch to a family brunch, to even a wedding, really really anything... It makes me feel like I just stepped out of the shower and put cream on, feeling fresh, clean, sexy, and in a good mood.
It has a hint of creamy floral soapiness, it makes me think of thick dense Nivea cream when you lather your hands with it. Great sillage, projection, longevity. I sprayed a couple sprays in the store around 6-7 hours ago and it's still very very noticeable. I will be doing my research to find this for cheap and I will most definitely buy myself a full size bottle. Gorgeous scent, better than the EDP (which is completely completely different), although I like that one too.
Thank you to the Sephora SA for giving me a sample of the EDP, I was not aware of these beauties by the house of Kenzo. Can't wait to get this.

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
Oh what a beautiful clean fresh and feminine fragrance. Its gentle yet string and smells of pure femininity.
It is not like a bar of soap but it does have a soapy characteristic to it.
I love it .... It's definitely a fragrance that leaves you wanting more

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Rose, orris & musk

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
You said it: Nivea in a perfume bottle!

This is a nice, safe and inoffensive scent, different to the EdP - much safer and much more tamed.

Pleasant enough and something I might wear should I not have anything else to wear. Just like I would use my Nivea lotion should I not have any more fancier lotions around.

Normally I love peony and pear notes, but those notes are far too muted in this scent for them to really shine, unfortunately.

For those expecting a pretty pink every day scent this is great. If you are expecting much more, like I was based on the notes and Kenzo's own description of the scent, this may be a slight disappointement.

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Kenzo recycled the bottles after La Perla discontinued Eclix.

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: It's an ok fragrance, not bad but not groundbreaking either. I like it better than the edp, but still smell pretty average. It's not worth buying for me, since there are so many similar scents for a much lower price.

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
Like many already said it smells pretty much exactly like Nivea cream. Since I love Nivea I love this quite a bit. Finally a smell like the actual cream. I think I need this ! Just smells clean , baby like,Nivea lotion and baby powder. Complete compfort to me :)
Ended up buying this. Love it as a daily out of the shower perfume. It just smelles clean , freshly bathed and like a baby’s but lol. Pure Nivea smell !

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Maybe this fragrance is more nice from the line for this moment, imho. Almond powder, peony and pear. Not bad. But not catchy enough.

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
I don't deny that the shape of the bottle intrigued me a lot.
A bit juicy at first, this scent quickly becomes soft, soapy and powdery. To my nose the main notes are peony and bergamot, along with violet.
Surprisingly I like this fragrance that reminds me of the smell of blossoming trees in spring.

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: I ended up buying this off of QVC blindly. This is the first time I've ever done that when the reviews have not been so great. The reason I went ahead and did it it's because the notes listed are all things that I love. I am so happy that I bought it. I can really smell the peony but it's kind of muted with what smells like a somewhat soapy Rose. It does not smell like Chloe but it reminds me of Chloe. I really really like it. So much that I'm considering getting the EDP

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Floral gourmand dense hand cream with hint of soapiness. Soft, feminine, cozy. In a way powdery and clean scent. Not too serious, potentially can fit most situations.

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Why do I smell Nivea lotion?

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: The packaging promises "a surprising complicity between fizzy pear, glowing peony, almond blossom, and the feminine orris". And it delivers. It's quite potent to begin with - predominantly sweet almond and fruit. The fizz they describe reminds me of sherbert, and the delicate floral notes come out as it mingles with your skin. It's a sweet floral, with a shot of almond and sugar on top. And it's beautifully done.

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Unremarkable, pink fruity-floral. Does not have any personality I barely remember it and I was wearing it a couple of days ago. It lasts rather well on me, and I could feel the wafts of its unremarkable smell good 6 hours. There's also a chemical note peaking out here and there, reminds me of dust a bit. Such a shame - these eye bottles and commercial have such potential - if only they would launch something memorable like Flower or Jungle pillars, but no - they went with the easiest possible fruity-floral ...

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Weird powdery sweet a synthetic scent... Let's not make this one a huge hit, please.. It gives me headaches on top of all.

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
I didn't like the EDP and this one is far better, but still not anything I would like.
I definitely sense sweet almond in it. There's also synthetic pear mixed with a floral note that does not smell like peony to me. At least not a natural peony.
Very strong for EDT, powdery and weirdly sweet.

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Just ordered it. Can't wait to try it !

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: This is likeable but nothing new. Fresh, pinkish, crisp, breezy etc. Same vibe as Versace Bright Crystal.

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
Just tried it, it is very nice. Soft fresh and a bit powdery...if you like soft scents, this is lovely..it is pink like the bottle! Would be perfect if you want to wear something light, non intrusive..to smell pretty on a spring day..
I enjoy trying it, but not one I need to have...but I wouldn't mind wearing it !!

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Very mild, perfect office fragrance. Everyone would think that you have just a nice deodorant or you used a scented shampoo in the morning. Wear it if you have a misfortune of working in a fragrance free space.

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
This is nice, but unimpressive. It is inoffensive, light and quite mainstream. It smells cheaper than it really is. Longevity is disappointing,3 hours and you can not smell anything anymore.
I also don't get any powder.

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
Powdery, soft-gentle, feminine and nice..
A little bit baby kinda powder.

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: This is brilliant. I prefer this to the edp. It's a beautiful design in person. Smells lovely. A good mood lifting fragrance.

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: I prefer this version to Eau de perfume, which I don't like due to the smell of rotten berries I can feel in the dry down. Eau de toilette is much quieter, delicate flowery with a touch of fruit. Nothing extraordinary, but quite pleasant.

product_name: Kenzo World Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: OMG, I must have this at some point, I so can't wait, I have the other two Kenzo World perfumes, and the notes to this sound just as amazing!!! I love this line, and could see them doing all colors of eyes!

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Colors pour Homme Kenzo
review_content:
Unlike L’eau Pour Homme, Kenzo Colors is harsh, bitting you from the get go with a potent ginger, loud and unapologetically synthetic, when the sage and cardamom joins it feels like a mess of cooking ingredients with no direction.
If L’eau pour homme gives a sense of calmness and peacefulness, L’eau Colors is the opposite, like going from a balanced state of mind to a total nervous breakdown.
The drydown is much better, probably thanks to the musk and some light woods but at this point is barely perceptible.
I’m not enjoying this fragrance. I’m going to leave it here and let it be.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Colors pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: I picked this up in T.K. Maxx in the U.K. for a very good price. It's...okay. It's fine. It opens with a warm lemon and ginger and does not develop much. for the longest time I could not think what it reminded me of but then it hit me: Starwalker by Mont Blanc. It has that same relaxing, warm, almost solar accord. But compared to other Kenzo releases this flanker was a disappointment and the original L'Eau Par Kenzo remains hard to beat.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Colors pour Homme Kenzo
review_content:
L'Eau Par Kenzo is a citrus+mint+ginger combo skin scent. There's not much difference compared to the other L'Eau Par versions. It stays close to the skin.

Sillage: Soft (skin scent)

Longevity: Weak (due to soft sillage factor)

Will I buy this? Not really.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Colors pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: A very casual but not ordinary fragrance. It's surprising for who wants for a day-by-day or day job fragrance, refreshing something citrus (it's not lemon), light spicy and woody. A safe path to success, hardly somebody will be disapointed, it's very kind and good taste. But soft sillage and longevity, 1 or 2 hour in my skin, I have retouch it ever... it's different of the traditional. I really love it (much more than CK One Summer editions). You better try the Mirror Edition....

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Colors pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: Reminds me of Nautica Oceans, watery and little salty. Both are made to sunny days. A good blind buy. Projection 7/10. Sillage 7/10. Longevity 8/10.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Colors pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: Boy, some flankers seen to be turning in circles. The ginger main note (acording to fragrantica users votes) brought me to that, but it just remember me of Kenzo Wild Man everytime I smell it. What a let down...

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Colors pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: Great smelly, fresh, watery, unisex and lime fragrance for summer:) On my skin after 1 hour is similar to Armani code sport, the sillage is low and the longevity is 2 hours

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Colors pour Homme Kenzo
review_content:
Stumbled across this in a small chain fragrance store, which was a surprise given that getting Kenzo scents in the UK is sometimes a thankless task.

So, the scent itself. It's definitely got citrus there, a lot more so that the original L'eau Par. Though the citrus is more aquatic than say compared to Chanel Allure Homme Blance edition, it's definitely tempered and gives way to a herbal note, as the mint and sage notes suggest. The spiel says this is woody but compared to Kenzo Woody this is a copse rather than a forest.

Sillage, not overly strong. Bearing in mind how close the original can sit to the skin. (Out of the L'eau Par flankers I'd say this is the weakest I've smelt, compared to Indigo and the Wild editions.

Longevity, four hours later and I can smell it close to my skin and perhaps half a foot away. It's not overpowering.

However, I can see its place as a summer scent. Heat would definitely make this react differently in my view and on the drydown it's even nearing some of the Miyake summer scents, but in a slightly more mellow sense. I also think heat would make it project more, it has that feel to it.

Overall, a different direction for the L'eau Par series and one that's in my view a touch more nuanced. Definitely going to be worn in the summer to see what it's really capable of!

Totem Blue by Kenzo is a unique blend that leans towards the sweet side, with coumarin and pineapple taking center stage. It has a playful, modern freshness that reminds me of Kenzo Aqua, but instead of its signature aquatic vibe, this one swaps it for a melon-like undertone that adds a soft, fruity twist.

It’s easygoing and versatile, making it a solid casual scent. If you enjoy fresh-sweet combinations with a bit of a tropical edge, Totem Blue is worth trying.

I´ve got a sample from my boyfriend today. The sample was probably 0,5ml in little plastic bag with marketing pic. Very unpractical though so when I´ve had opened the bag, the liquid poured on me.. so i put the whole 0,5ml ( quite a lot) on my whole arm. First thing I have to say...the longevity is waaaaay too poor. Maybe an hour on me idk but I doubt even that which is ridiculous when I consider the price of fragrance. Scent itself is meh, nothing special but nothing bad too. It´s nice, soft, citrusy, not-very-loud scent. I thought of this being unisex even before I read the info so that´s pretty obvious. Anyways it´s nothing I would be craving for. So for me this is a Like category - becouse the scent is quite fine - but the longevity and ununiqueness keeps me from buying this.

Second try

This doesn’t have the weird note that the first test had. The weird note might have been due to environment or others I had on.

Totem blue

Tried yellow and blue today, haven’t found the orange.

Blue: it dies nice things in the beginnning, it’s a bit off in the middle, that cedar mixed with other notes is not bad, not good, very different, I will say I was feeling like crap today and the tests I had on were making me a bit queasy.

I had this, the yellow one, Dior jadore l’or, and Dior jadore Touche last ine was a scrubber so got removed, and it might have been the lively L’or whafting up and mixing with the blue totem doing weird things??

The note I got reminded me of roberto cavalli with the oval bottle and Fancy lid edp. Like a (nice) rubber eraser note??

I got the pineapple at the dry down after several hours, it was cooler and more unisex than the yellow one, but warmed up in the dry down.

I think both could be easily unisex. Great sillage and longevity. 6hours or so

Totem blue is a pretty good scent; let's not forget it's supposed to be easy, likable and is quite affordable, i'll take this any day over a 400$ pretentious niche scent that cost 10 bucks to make.
Totem blue is straightforward citrusy juicy pineapple, laid over a semi-sweet woody base, with occasional spicy and coconut-y accents. Good for cooler summer nights and laid back occasions. Unpretentious and quite fun, the bottle is nice too.

scent: 7+/10
longevity: 6/10
sillage: 5/10

I think it's the best from Totem line. Also one really great pineapple scent. I don't get how it's supposed to be unisex, smells too feminine for that. Fresh and nice pineapple scent with a hint of wood.
In my opinion it is the most yummy one of the three Totems. Girly, dolly-like, I feel a strawberry candy but not pine-apple. Yes, it is yummy and simple.
Syrupy pineapple juice and car fresheners. Smells like a less complex version of "Animale" (if it's possible to get less complex than that).

This blue totem opens with a bunch of sweet pineapple notes. There is also something ozonic or aquatic in the mix, that gets a bit stronger as the scent progresses. Still lots of pineapple but also darker notes that give this scent a certain bite and make the base more sturdy. The drydown is cedar-ish, tiny bits of ozonic aquatic notes, a bit of iso-e-super and pineapple on top.

Sillage is moderate, longevity moderate.

I can't really define the cardamom in here, it's part of a dark accord but not as cardamommy as I'd like it to be. The pineapple, on the other hand, is quite out there and enjoyable. I can see myself wearing this in summertime when I feel like something simple and fruity.

This is an easygoing pineapple cedar combination that does not impress very much.

It's light and easy wearable but lacks in character and sophistication.

For me Kenzo has better offerings than this one.

Pass.

its weird nobody mentions Jungle le Tigre in the similars. id say they are practically identical, only here Kenzo replaced spices with lotus flower to make it watery and ozonic... but the key note - vanilla - is done in the same fresh, almost lemony, a bit sour style.
although launched in 2009, it still carries that particular 2000s vibe, like shiseido zen, avon pur blanca etc (in terms of style I mean)

I know this is extremely difficult to find, but I don't think it's worth its current eBay prices. Maison del'Asie has a fragrance called Mother x love which smells practically identical (despite different notes), and performs much better

Ah Kenzo ... Such an underrated house. This is a shame. Kenzo produced some amazing and wearable fashion ... and beautiful perfumes :) Somehow they have been mostly forgotten despite the originality and the talent. Now back to this perfume. This is the best vanilla-heavy perfume I own because it stands out in the crowd of overly plain gourmand vanilla that are smelling like a cake. You definitely smell the lotus and some freshness for the first hour or so. It's woody as well. The dry down is some sort of vintage woody vanilla that is quite pleasant and not cloying. It's stays on my skin for a couple of hours. It is true that it is beautiful even during hot humid Summer days. And the bottle is beautiful with its sunset background.

I genuinely miss this perfume. I used to always bring it from the trips in 2009-2011 and I haven’t smelt nothing like it since. Very airy, ozonic, but also woody, sweet woody, lactonic, very unique. Still looking for anything close to it or a dupe. That’s the only vanilla I ever liked, it’s raw woody vanilla that you don’t find in modern fragrances. Wish Kenzo brings it back at least as limited edition one day again.

I am so upset, I bought this a couple of years ago while traveling and I loved it. I didn't wear it every day but when I did wear it I had a lot of very happy memories associated with it.
This past year we had to move into a condo when our house sold faster than expected and we waited for our new home to be finished. So we started moving into our new home and still had things in the condo, not much but a few things including about half of my perfume collection. Well someone broke into the condo and while they didn't take much they did take my box of perfume that I didn't get moved. And now I am just sick about it.

Lovely scent. I picked this up 7 years ago at an airport in Europe, and it still smells the same. I don't know what lotus flower actually smells like - isn't it usually in the middle of a pond so how do we peasants know? I thought it was a combination of bamboo, vanilla, and cedar. Very unique - nothing else like it, fits the title completely. I've only smelled this on one girl I know - most don't have this in US. It is NOT just vanilla for sure...that's what makes this stands out.

Following a trend of olfactory travels, which was widespread among several companies, the house of Kenzo also released a collection of fragrances inspired by places and their exotic aromas. The first of these was 7:15 AM in Bali, in 2008, followed by this one here, in 2009. There is also a third creation, which was released in 2011, taking Sicily as inspiration.

For those who don't know, some places are very specific to the perfumery universe, because of a certain ingredient that is produced and/or cultivated and that makes it unique as, for example, the Tahitian Tiare flower, the sandalwood from Sri Lanka, the bergamot from Calabria, the rose from Turkey or the lemon from Sicily.

In 5:40 PM in Madagascar, Kenzo has decided to explore nuances of the most famous vanilla of this market, which is obtained through a specific genre of Orchid, and very used in perfumes in the world: the vanilla of Madagascar.
In the composition were mixed notes of Lotus Flower, in the head, followed by notes of Freesia and cedar, in the body of the fragrance, over a rich and creamy vanilla base. But what is little spread is the existence of vanilla also at the top of the olfactory pyramid. No wonder it is easily noticed (and lingers), from the moment that the scent hits the skin.

Overall, this is an oriental scent with some floral nuances. I've read reports of users citing more the Lotus Flower and others who claim to have noticed a lot of Freesia. On my skin, this scent had an extremely linear development, with a floral touch of synthetic aspect, which is clearly a result of the freesia's note. But the star of the fragrance is, obviously, the vanilla. Here, it is not too liqueur or too sweet. It is creamy and sweet in the right measure, giving a unique feeling of comfort. For this reason, the image of the sunset, which is depicted on the bottle, combines very well with the feeling of a cappuccino being drunk on a waterfront balcony while admiring the sunset with a blanket over the shoulders.

Although this collection has been released as a limited edition and was initially marketed only in the airports stores, 5:40 PM in Madagascar is the kind of semi-gourmand scent that can be worn easily in my country (Brazil). As I said before, it's not too sweet. In addition, has subtle projection, making it comfortable, intimate and cosy. And there's more: some say that it is a female perfume, but it is clearly unisex. And it works very well if worn at the same time by a couple in love, no matter of what genre or composition.
It's the kind of perfume that you can wear in a movie night, for example, and ensures proximity all the time. And the lasting is very good!

Finally, the bottles are the same throughout the collection, with pictures of each specific place and in single size of 50 ml.
If you like slightly sweetened scents, are vanilla fan and like Kenzo’s style, this is another perfume you should test.

This is a really strange one and NOTHING like I expected.

The opening of this smells very bizarre. It smells like a very sharp slightly scorched grass, or hay. There are reeds blowing in the wind on the box and bottle and that's what I get. I wasn't expecting that at all. It's actually very arid smelling and I'm going to say..not the MOST pleasant thing I've encountered.

The vanilla hides behind this for a while but starts to emerge when it's dry. It's the most non gourmand vanilla I have ever smelled! It stays crisp..light and almost airy.

I really don't get any of the things the other reviewers have said and I'm really not sure what to make of it.

It's a head scratcher!

:)

Rich vanilla with a floral twist. There is something in this thank I can't put my finger on. Love it. I picked it up in Duty Free because it was love at first sniff. Very unique and different than any other vanilla I have tried. I used it up fast. It became my signature.

I was always curious about this one, and I have to admit this was an on line blind buy on black Friday, but now it's arrived and I'm in love! Totaly seduced by Kenzo! Great vanila combination in a creamy way. I found very similar to Dior J'adore. both have the same vibration on my skin.
I am surprised to see so few notes. I must be sensitive to one of them, because I thought it smelled cacophonous, random notes clashing together in the worst possible way.

One of my most special, beautiful fragrances ever.
Extremely rare, got is as gift from overseas, never saw it being sold in SA. I miss it so freaking much.
This fragrance is stunning, Kenzo always get it right.

i just purchased mine, can´t wait to sniff it!!


God! totally me! love at first siff! raw vanilla, green feeling... very close to skin.

there´s a very noticeble acquatic note in it... i´d classified it as acquatic vanilla..very much day wear vanilla
i love to wear it at the office, very safe and close to skin, despite the airy feeling to it, very close I can smell the vanilla...it´s not a provocative or seducing vanilla, it is very natural and clean... I just purchased one more duo kit to stock it up :p

A nice vanilla done in the Kenzo way, I recognise the same character as in Amour only less sweet. Madagascar is a refreshing and sweet little fragrance, purely feminine and appropriate for summer wear. Not too distinctive, hence it has fallen into the back of my perfume wardrobe. I do not sense the aquatic element or the woods at all, I would just say that is a vanilla blended in a light, summery ethereal way. Uncomplicated and very easy going, it reminds me of a young beautiful girl on holidays, wearing a bikini and concentrating admiring glances from everyone without trying or realizing it. Innocent and sweet!

ALMOST DISCLAIMER EDIT: layered this one over Kiehl's Original Musk. This layering is pure comfy cozy bliss! Kiel's musk gave depth and heat too this too aquatic vanilla. The flowery part of the frag, otherwise too sharp, got a hint of creaminess and some sweet character (but not on a sugary or gourmand way). As a counterpart, this Kenzo toned down the soapy feature of KOM, which I don't appreciate that much. Strongly recommended layering experience
Powdered wood and citrus in a very 1970s feeling. Quite lovely warm fragrance with a tart candy note that is divine.

Somewhat disappointed with this one. Settled down too citrusy, airy and aquatic on my skin.

But it's definitively a vanilla frag. Not a complex one, in fact, a very simple but although nicely done. Guess it'll suit men really good.
Who is the nose?

É delicioso, suave, doce e floral. Tem uma fixação muito boa, é elegante e fresco na medida certa (moro no Brasil). Mas se a pessoa quiser que o aroma fique mais intenso, pode aumentar a dose no corpo e, mesmo assim, continua sendo um perfume elegante. Achei o vidro maravilhoso, muito criativo, quase cinematográfico. Ou literário. Digo isso porque os nomes dos perfumes dessa série de Kenzo parecem nomes de filmes ou nomes de livros. A imagem nos vidros e a forma deles combina com essa ideia. Parabéns, Kenzo!! Obra de arte contemporânea!! ^_^

Was interested to try this given that it's labelled as unisex and I've worn other women's scents by Kenzo before.

My impressions are it's a very warm vanilla scent with a trace of a floral note with the lotus. It's soft and veering towards the feminine for sure.

It does last though. I've had applications lasting from morning to night and it seems to thrive in the warmer weather.

As for the scent, once the initial floral notes temper, the vanilla dominates and in a sweet sense. The lasting note is definitely pleasant and one that I'd be comfortable to wear.

Overall, this is a pleasant calming scent that would definitely be of use when travelling and you need to freshen up or give yourself some grounding amid the chaos.

Yes, it smells just like the Yves Rocher Vanille Noire - an 'acquatic vanilla'. YR VN with a very very subtle floral edge to it. I'm more of a fan of the essential oily coconutty vanilla, so I'll pass this sample on sometime.

Powdered wood, citrus, vanilla. Reminds me of something from the 70s, but I can't pin it down. I think I'd be loving this if only it was stronger. On my skin, it's almost invisible, just a bare waft of scent when it's wet then nothing at all after. I will try layering it with unscented lotion to extend longevity, but it's disappointing so far for not lasting. Still, seems lovely for the bits I can detect.

Begins with a smell of wet grass and then gets a sweeter smell the vanilla.
Very comfortable and alluring to women and men.
For me one of the best scents of vanilla.
I love this perfume, it has a powerful and longlasting un sillage huge.
Perfect for use on all occasions.
I recommend.

A wonderful tropical vanilla scent. Bought this on a whim in the Duty Free before heading off to Bangkok. So it was inaugurated in the late afternoon heat at about 40 degrees and lots of humidity. You might think that it is too much but somehow it is well suited to a hot summer night. The lotus and woody notes keep it floral enough to stop guys from eating your neck (although they will try - I had some experience of this stuff being a man magnet!). It is a shame that it is discontinued. I managed to bag a back up bottle so I am safe for the next few years if I use it now and then. If you want some, please PM me.
A delight! It begins with a half green smell to me, wet grass, but with the passage of time is left with a background of vanilla very comfortable.
a wonderfull vanilla fragnance, -which in my opinion- is perfect in really hot and humid weather. I will take it with me on my Brazil trip:-)

Kenzo 5:40pm in Madagascar is a unique perfume featuring lotus and vanilla. It smells very different from other vanilla perfumes in that it is not at all sweet. I picked up a bottle of this blind out of curiosity and initially I did not like it very much because it seemed somehow off. I have to say, however, that it has grown on me over time. Now that I am used to its strange personality, I rather like it and no longer find it sour or confused.

MADAGASCAR is a true unisex fragrance, with a somewhat masculine bent, but some wearers may find the watery lotus overly synthetic, as I initially did. As my own case demonstrates, this perfume is an acquired taste!

Probably one of the best vanilla scents I have ever come across. It's not a overly sweet winter vanilla, but a fresher summer one. Could seem a bit ordinary at first, but it grows on you in a big way. Love it!

I just receive my bottle and first impression was delicious not to sweet, comfort.
warm like sunset but a little soft you need spray a lot ...
For people want some light vannila scent is great!!
I like something more strong....
It is nice anyway!!!

I got this last summer and didn't care for it a lot, it was very very green to me, like the scent of a wet weed pulled from the marsh. It was a nice scent in the woods, but not so good to wear. It might be that very note that smells like pecans to DresdenDoll. I get no flowers or sweetness from this during the summer at ALL. It's mine and I had to at least like this! Well, it might be that sometimes the first few sprays are rather unpleasant in perfumes and they have to be sprayed a few times before you can detect the most pleasant notes. Perhaps it's from the air in the sprayer, I'm not sure, but, I like this scent quite a LOT now. It still comes out green, but a fresh green, not mossy and damp. Within 30 minutes, this turns into a lovely vanilla. I dislike very much vanilla in a perfume but this is one of the exceptions for me. This is the dry, natural, vanilla that one would smell on a very hot, late afternoon, in Madagascar! Of course I can only imagine as I've never been there. I love to grab my sweater and smell this on it from the evening before. It's most lovely when you can smell this the same way someone smells this ON you. This could become a favorite of mine in no time. I wonder what this summer again will bring to my nose. I hope this isn't just a winter scent for me. Heavy damp air makes me dislike most perfumes and with luck, that's all that made me not cozy up to this at first. Wish me luck! My only advice for this lovely scent is, buy with an open mind!

So warm. The vanilla is strong, but it's of the best sort- rich, honeyed, smooth, clean. Very natural fragrance, as in it does remind you of the photo on the bottle, of the heady, lush air of a warm tropical evening. My sister thinks it smells like she wants to eat it.

But it smells almost exactly like this:

A vanilla bean red (rooibus) tea I used to have.

So rich and flavorful, sweet and fragrant, that it didn't really need the honey I always added.

In the same way as savoring a cup of that tea, this is personal pleasure of mine, my madagascar scent.

I really don't understand why the opening of this is like a blast of pecans to me! I really like it but I wasn't expecting it. I don't get flowers but the woody pecan-like scent blends smoothly into a warm woody vanilla, very natural. Such a nice woody vanilla scent. This does draw up an image of a bright orange sun setting in Madagascar, where vanilla orchids bloom and the wood for a fire is being prepared. Nice sillage and good staying power too, I like this one a lot.
I like the fact that it is uncomplicated, yet interesting. Yummy like Baileys ;)

I love it!!in my skin is very sensuall.
I give it 10,sillage and long lasting very good :-)

What I get the most out of 5:40 Madagascar - is lotus and vanilla. It also has this woody undertone, similar to the scent of furniture.
I did not expect to find it so overpowering, but it is, to the point where it becomes headache-inducing. It has all the attributes to become a cozy fragrance, but unfortunately it verges on being annoying. I think it simply lacks the necessary balance in its composition. Too bad, I expected to really like it.

Maravillosa fragancia de Kenzo, uso hace un par de años 7,15 am in Bali, pero definitivamente me aburrió. Hay un "algo" que nosé definir que me ah terminado por cansar , en otra review leí lo mismo que ahora afirmo. Así que ahora es mi nuevo perfume de gimnasio. En cambio esta versión que se le parece mucho es bastante más delicada, menos intrusiva aún si es que cabe, femenina y misteriosa, limpia y cálida, empolvada y fresca sin caer en el talco que tanto gusta a Kenzo. Sencillamente deliciosa , mejor para verano y primavera con trenzas en el cabello y ropa suelta y vaporosa, gracias Kenzo una vez más.Vainilla suave, sin llegar a dulce y el loto tampoco cae en las típicas notas acuáticas, la armonía es perfecta y se complementan excelentemente. Un 10.

I have it and absolutely love it.
It's a simple fragrance, but it's beautiful in its simplicity.
There's a beautiful vanilla - airy, fresh, absolutely adorable, probably the prettiest vanilla in perfumes I've ever smelt.
There's also lotus noticeable, pretty one.
The fragrance is very optimistic, it calms down but doesn't make you sleep, you last and last in admiration. My first time with Madagascar wasn't that great though, because I thought it was too simple. No way! The second time and love was born :D
It lasts longer on me than Kenzo in Bali, the sillage is good :)

i got mine in a dutyfree shop on airport as well, attracted by the nice bottle, it was love at first sniff.
i don't think it's a only vanilla scent at all. it's a very airy complex but almost linear scent from top to bottom.
the cedar is very delightful and round, the flowers light and sweet, the vanilla lingers smoothly in the background. the scent is very powdery, earthy, woody, warm, with a hint of lovely vanilla.
it stays close to skin and will let you catch some wiffs the whole day long. when hugging people they always compliment how good i smell when i wear this! this would certainly not offend anyone... i even think it will attract people to come closer to you :)
maybe it's not sexy but confidential. can't stop to sniff my wrist and let me feel immediately cosy and safe. it stays for days on clothes as well.
this scent is very wearable for work as for a night out in summer. i would wwear it also in winter for a comfy feeling after having a shower or sitting around with your beloved at home.
I've tried so hard to love it, but for me it has simply no personality, it's a very soft woody scent with a hint of lotus. I wouldn't define it as an oriental vanilla at all.
Very much of a non-offensive vanilla. Not cloying. Airy... I see it at every airport, though it is hard to find in the average shops.

Oh, how lovely scent is this. Gorgeous vanilla, different to Wish vanilla. I wish I could eat myself, I love it very much.
A great surprise from dear friend Nathalie.

I am using it for the first time today and I sprayed it about 8 hours ago and is lasting till now. It's a pleasant sweet (but not to much) scent, very vanilla (this is all I get after 8 hours).

I felt, at first, a odd smell, that I figured later it is oakmoss. Truly, I never smelled oakmoss, but after I read here that theres is some in this parfumes's composition, I reallize that it must be it. I found it a strange smell, I could feel it after 3, 4 hours. Than, I smell only vanilla and some flower that I can't name.

It is a sweet and nice fragrance, good enough to every day use, better in colder days.

I feel vanilla and smooth silky spices, but no waterlily and no oakmoss at all.Feels like a humid morning in tropics, the name is very becoming.Sweet enough but not too much, and vanilla is not a confectionary one - it`s raw and spicy (if you ever tried to eat a vanilla pod, you know!
I've tested it last week at Ljubljana airport in duty free shop and because I like white flowers, it was a great experience to tested it. I like it very much and it is already on my wish list.

I was very excited when I found it in duty free store at Gatwick airport. I love vanilla so I sprayed it on my wrist and after I smelled it, it brought my early teen memories back. I found that really odd and couldnt figure out why this happened. I was thinking about it all day and then I realised that it smells very much like Spice Girls Impulse deodorant, the one with the orange cap on it (I know, thats really weird) - it was discountinued years ago but I swear it smells very similar.
Overall, it is a pleasant 'fresh vanilla', but I find it a bit too simplistic - I wish at least one more note would be added to create deepness. Its longevity on my skin was quite good -I could smell it on my wrist for about 5 hours

At the beginning it smells like morning dew, wet grass, pure herbs, I couldn’t smell any flower, but after a while vanilla with freesia and lotus, and it seems you are walking in a forest, maybe they shouldn’t have classified it as oriental/vanilla, because it’s more green than anything.

I tried this one on in the cosmetics section of a shop aboard a cruise ship. I did at first not understand that it was a unisex scent beacuse it's very sweet and vanillia esque. But unfortunatley this perfume does after ca 7 mins on my skin. Turn into something that smells like washing up liquid mixed with vodka. It gave me and the pepole that I where traveling with a severe headache! Yuck.

This sent is so relaxing
It immediately whisks you away from all your worries and day to day life.
It reminds me of the sweet breeze after a hot summer day. It is really gorgeous it is not super, overly done, sweet. It is naturally sweet.

First I didn't konw the smell, and I just take appreciate the bottle, the picture, and the mirage it would like to express. And when I got it in DFS, I really love this perfume, especially the smell of Freesia & Vanilla. I had long for Kenzo perfume for a long time but this time I believe this one the best of Kenzo.

Very nice edition, only found in airports. Just like the picture here on the site it evokes precious woods in a warm afternoon. I like it as it is not too sweet. Will definitely test with more occasions.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: I quite like this Kenzo Flower EDT version compared to the EDP version, I dislike the EDP because it's too powdery & intense, but this EDT version is alot less powdery and less intense and more floral, it's actually a lovely floral fragrance that's a bit more softer, it reminds me abit of CK Beauty.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: I don't know why but EDT is more heavier than the Original. It is more citrus, wood, musk, vanilla, while the original is more violet and muguet all over. EDT smells like Nivea lotions or those kinds.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
This starts out differently than the eau de parfum, very mandarin citrusy, but dries down to exactly the same scent. After smelling this, I can understand why Kenzo felt the need to create a new eau de toilette in 2021. Maybe someone there realized this was essentially the same scent as the eau de parfum. The note profile for the new 2021 eau de toilette, created by Alberto Morillas (which is a big bonus in my book 😊), is completely different. I now want to try that too.
While I like this, I'm still not sure this edt would wear any lighter in warmer weather, which is why I wanted it. The only time I can wear the edp is during the cold months because of the heavy powder. I see no difference in the level of powder here. It's still a powder bomb on me.
I was considering getting a backup for the edp but now no longer feel the need, but I am disappointed that they didn't make this a true edt, sans the powder for warm weather wear. Despite that, I love this too and am glad I now have what I consider a backup bottle of the original scent.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
At least three ways to do a flanker:

One. The original composition in diluted concentration.
Two. Something else entirely — while trying to use the name of the original to promote the flanker.
Three. A satellite of the mothership—bears the family resemblance but missing some parts, and/or with parts unique unto itself.

This is a number three situation — it’s a summer-weight Flower with a green, powdery, musky violet note. Not as rich or as cloying as Flower edp which for me reads mostly as heady, stridently sugared opopanax musk coating roses and violets. No, no — Flower edt is tender green violets from the earth meeting violet pastilles from the candy apothecary meeting a young woman’s first powder compact…all held together in a matrix of clean white musk. Uncomplicated and pretty. Has one of those superfine sprayers that makes each pump like a tiny aerosol spray — I wish more brands used those. Worth the $16 I paid for it at Marshall’s. Weirdly, on paper, the drydown reminds me a fair bit of Baiser Vole.

(As an aside, in my quest for the prettiest violet ever, I couldn’t believe how laundry-ish Guerlain Insolence edp became in the drydown — what started as an over-the-top, maudlin, high-drama violet/berry duet eventually turned into a dryer sheet. The prettiest violet I’ve found so far is the discontinued layering fragrance Soft Violet from Arcana. Happily got that in a trade!)

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Bought this at TJMaxx for a fairly good price. Cozy, sweet, powdery, with a tiny bit of insense. The violet is very noticeable. Inoffensive, easy to wear.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Found this at TJ Maxx recently. I don't smell any of the mandarin orange listed. I'm mostly getting light but very powdery rose and violet, with just a hint of sweetness. It reminds me of dryer sheets, but in a good way. It's definitely something I'd feel comfortable wearing to work.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: This is sweet, pleasant but fleeting and I wish it lasted longer and was more potent. No this smells nothing like Invictus. Not every modern scent in the last ten years smells like Invictus.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: One girl 2y ago said that i smelt amazing when i were wearing this masterpiece, not me and that girl have been dating for 2y. Do your math or sum

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: Smells fresh, blue, and aquatic. The opening has a dark, heavy, concentrated ocean scent, if that makes sense. Solid performance on my skin, lasting a full workday without problems. The scent is very linear, so it gets boring after a while. Good for everyday summer wear.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: Its ok! But i find it weak, even in the opening(!)

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Homme Kenzo
review_content:
I would say it is similar to Invictus (same family) but it is not a clone or even trying to be a clone.

I really love the scent profile but this is really weak. I can put on 10 sprays and it's gone within 2 hours.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Homme Kenzo
review_content:
more rounded, less sharp than original
has a sweeter note with the lime
still smells similar, but less fresh soapy clean
more relaxing dark watery clean

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Homme Kenzo
review_content:
Initially refreshing perfume, which carries some sweet footprints, but without falling into the routine of contemporary masculine gourmand perfumes that break every week in world launches. That perfume to be used without much commitment, for the day at the Club it looks great!

Light and creative opening, referring to the seaside, only well flavored, kind of a subtle immersion bath of fresh herbs, along with a lemonade heated by the sun and another light Yuzu tea, very aromatic, relaxing!

In drying it becomes a handmade vegetable garden, emanates an amalgamated aroma of riches of herbs that reminds us of gathering people with indigenous roots, or family cultivation, this is beautiful, I like to feel it, the citrus aroma of the beginning remains and the aromatic issue of herbs increases with each movement, referring to the aroma of male.

In drying it becomes dense and more serious, the Vetiver in it does not shine so much, but attributes to it a special "what" of remote anthropological ritual, because who stands out here is the Cedar, in raw chips of fresh, half moist, half spicy and highly aromatic; very well there in the fundão, after a few hours, L'Eau Kenzo Intense

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Homme Kenzo
review_content:
Invictus Legend on a budget. Of course comes with a compromised performance.

It’s really good tho. Smells salty, citrusy and ever so slightly fruity, very refreshing. The longevity isn’t bad either, especially considering the price.

Definitely would buy this if I was in need of a budget-friendly, spray-away summer fragrance.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Homme Kenzo
review_content:
Smells good it was my first fragrance so I like this.This have own smell I think this is unique enough but only downside is performance it becomes skin scent after 40 minutes you have to reapply it
If you want fragrance for warm weather you can try it I'm sure a lot of person gonna like it.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: I see the similarity with Invictus, I would say it is a darker version of Invictus, for summer night occasions ( not a clone, but the similarity is there ). Longevity is not bad, projection is very good for the first hour, but then disappear completely. The problem with this one is that you need to spray a lot of it to get a good amount of projection and sillage, but being a sweet scent, if you overspray it, you will literally choke anyone around you for the first hour. So when I know I will wear it, I heavily apply it at least 30 minutes before to meet someone else. If you like the Invictus bubblegummy vibe and you find it a 20-25 dollars, give a try, but I paid it 56 $ when it was released and with that kind of longevity and projection it doesn't really value that much.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Homme Kenzo
review_content:
This is a good fragrance for the price.

Sour citrusy and strong opening with smooth ambroxan base. Maybe because of the ambroxan / salty accords people are saying it is invictus clone while in fact it is a defferent scent. The powerfull sharp lime and bitter yuzu balance the ambrox bubblegummy sweet effect in a good way.

It is pleasant, modern, fresh, complements getter and affordable at discounters.

Acceptable performance and longevity.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Homme Kenzo
review_content:
Uhm, I'm a big fan of original L'Eau Par, but this lacks depth for me. It's fresh, yeah, slightly sweet undertone with some woodiness to it. Easily unisex spring/summer fragrance. But it smells so flat and non Kenzo to me.

To me 4/10.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: We need to have an option to keep a record of people who leave misleading opinions. If you think this smells like Invictus or is a 99% copy then I can't take your reviews seriously

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: It has zero similarity to L'eau par Kenzo pour homme. Zero! Nada! So I can't understand why it's called L'eau Kenzo Intense.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Homme Kenzo
review_content:
Yes!

I must admit that it makes the impression of being a new and likable summer scent. It is not weak regarding longevity so that's a plus as well compared to other options from this house.

To my nose this is not comparable to PR Invictus. Yes, it is a sweet scent as well but the depth is different.

Nonetheless I'd rather pass on this because I'm not a fan of too much sweetness going on.

If you can ignore or get past its syrupy kool-aid notes then it really is a nice minty, cedar, yuzu combination.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: Nice begining, excellent top notes. However, after 40 min becomes a simple generic scent - fresh wood. Good longevity, limited sillage.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: Yeah this smells nothing like Invictus...

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: it is new 2015......a great fragrance, airy but soft vetiver surrouded by angelica and woods... it projects very good ... i can swear i smell ISo E super here... but nevermind...The best one from Kenzo!!!

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Homme Kenzo
review_content:
Released this year (march of 2015), this version was introduced in the market as a fascinating and refreshing fragrance.

L'Eau Kenzo Intense is a limited edition of the L'Eau Par Kenzo collection, which was launched almost 2 decades ago. I don't know why they changed the name. However, if we translate, L'Eau Par Kenzo means "water by Kenzo", while L'Eau Kenzo is closer to "Kenzo water", which means that, what was once an interpretation, now became an affirmation. Either way, it's the kind of change that I think is unnecessary.

The official composition brings marine accord, lime and yuzu, in the head. Then, notes of black basil and Lotus flower are blended in the heart. Finally, cedar and vetiver at the base.
The result is an aromatic and floral fragrance (in my opinion), that reaches the skin in a sour and slightly minty manner. It is very easy to notice the nuances of yuzu and lime at this stage. After a while, a drastic change occurs and the scent shows itself more floral, with great presence of the Lotus flower. When it reaches this stage, does not change anymore. I haven't met the female version yet, but this one can be easily worn by women.

With respect to the projection, is very good at the start, but then, almost disappears without a trace (literally). But I can't complain about the longevity, since the scent got stuck on the skin for many hours, albeit very close.

The bottle kept the pattern, with a dark blue color, becoming very beautiful. Unfortunately, is another one of those fragrances that are coming to market with the promise of more intensity, but do not match expectations. Works very well as an Eau de Toilette, but the term "Intense" only serves to draw attention.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: Sadly i agree, this is so close to Rabanne Invictus, maybe some notes are in diference, a sweet overdose in invictus, and maybe an stronger floral vibe in kenzo, .. strange coincidence.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: Recently purchased this, and it is a solid and inoffensive spring/summer fragrance that starts off with a burst of yuzu before settling down pretty quickly (at least on my skin) to a moderate vetiver and cedar in the base. Longevity and sillage are both weak to moderate. Smells really pleasant and is perfect for casual wear in the heat. 7/10

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: A 99% copy of Paco Rabanne Invictus. The differences are almost non-existent. An overdose of modern salty aquatic molecules. This is absolutely not the style of Kenzo!

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: I was stearing at the boxes of this perfume on a store shelf for few months. somehow Kenzo distributed them a way before it was supposed to be presented, that is why testers were not supplied. for me, as a l'eau par kenzo fan, it was truly hard to visit the stores every week to check the availability of testers, because I gave myself a word not to make a blind purchases so many times. finally this week testers have arrived. disappoinment. complete. probably it was my mistake to expect a intense version of the first l'eau par Kenzo. this one has nothing in common with the original. however, if someone will be seraching for a new perfume, it will be ok. I couldn't understand the idea. why Intense if it's a first among L'Eau Kenzo (without "par"), and why it's completely different if it's a Intense of L'eau par Kenzo. well anyway, don't make a blind buy.

product_name: Kenzo Jungle Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Why?

product_name: Kenzo Jungle Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content:
I’m reviewing a 50ml bottle with the older style packaging, ie, “Kenzo Jungle Pour Homme” written inside the green box in the centre.

Make no mistake, this comes from a time when fragrances were intentionally designed as works of olfactory art to be sprayed, truly taken in, and savored. Things have sadly gone downhill since, with the current climate of churning out as many bubblegum, sugary elixir flankers as possible each financial quarter to feed the drooling social media algorithm-addicted basics who buy whatever influencers tell them to buy.

This? Fragrances with this much pre-conceived thought, focus, and vision feel completely alien in 2025. Like they were created on an entirely different planet. Designer houses took creative risks back then. Putting trends aside, there is absolutely no way this fragrance would ever make it past the focus panel/product/marketing approval stages in the current landscape we find ourselves in. Because no one has the balls to take creative risks anymore.

The slight animalic funk coming from the mate note that hovers in the background gives this a “carnality”. Really earthy and human.

Smells like making love to a woman on the packed, dry earth of the Serengeti savanna under a clear, moonlit sky next to a guaiac wood (palo santo) crate filled with limes and jars of spices. This is citrusy, earthy, woody, sweet, sour, and spicy all at once with a slight “sweat” type of accord humming in the background but I mean that in a very good way. Maybe there's also some dried Zebra dung funking away in the distance for added measured haha.

Longevity/performance, even on my older bottle, is not the greatest. But overspray this bad boy, enjoy the ride, then smile once it’s over. Knowing you’re always only ever one spray away from returning to that far-flung African trading post on the savanna.

I bless the rains down in Africa.

8/10

product_name: Kenzo Jungle Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Crossing my fingers for PowerCOLOGNE next! <3 <3 <3

product_name: Kenzo Jungle Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Finally! I very much love the stunning fragrance but always disliked the sturdy, difficult to handle bottle. Now this new 75ml version is perfect, same juice in a handy, elegant bottle! Bravo!

product_name: Kenzo Jungle Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Crossing my fingers for elephant next! <3 <3 <3

product_name: Kenzo Jungle Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: @vaportrail power is already available in this bottle shape too.

product_name: Kenzo Jungle Homme Eau de Toilette Kenzo
review_content: Now this is a pleasant surprise! Maybe they'll bring back Air or Power next?

Very pleasant, citrusy, fresh with mineral notes. I find it wearable year-round, but it must be magnificent in the summer. It reminds me of the smell of laundry detergent... when clothes are drying in the machine and a soft fragrance is released. On my skin, however, it doesn't last very long, which is the only slight drawback.

My experience with fresh aquatics is limited, so I thought this may be a good place to start. L’Eau Pure is refreshing without evoking shower gel or laundry. Soft-focus mandarin balances a nose-tickling mineral core. Without the astringency of CK One or floralcy of L’Eau D’Issey Pour Homme, this fragrance has a satisfying plasticky cohesion. Like a geodesic dome filled with rare flora and recirculated mist, there’s a hopeful (anachronistic) futurism to L’Eau Pure. Unassuming yet sort of moving.
It just smells clean and fresh.

Es todo lo que espero de un perfume que se llame "L'eau pure". Una sensación de frescura, limpieza, agua, mar, aire. Amo su salida cítrica y esa lavanda que se asoma rápidamente. En mi piel tiene menos duración de la que me gustaría, porque es un olor al que quisiera oler siempre!!
It's really close to the long discontinued CK2 , but better overall. Ozonic, Calone, touch of musk and woods to round everything and give it a sensual vibe. Nice one

Aquatic citrus and cheap, sweet lavender, maybe a bit of neroli.
Heavy handed, loud and clunky, especially for something called "L'eau Pure".

It has good performance but I seriously wouldn't want to smell like this in the first place.

The bottle is stunning. The scent is very good. The type of aquatic I like, not too woody. It smells like water. I don’t think of water as even having a smell, until I sampled this. The goal is achieved. I've never been to Japanese Onsen but I can imagine it when I smell L'eau Pure. It's watery but warm.
Beautiful clean scent. You really smell clean and fresh, it also has a sofisticated touch to it.

Really beautiful fragrance, mineral and fresh, like a sunny day by a clear rockpool that is regularly refreshed by the incoming tide. I know this fragrance profile (ozonic aquatic) is out of fashion but I could care less - this is a lovely thing, best new designer perfume I have come across in a long while. I have already ordered a second bottle as I am powering through the first (a small one, only a 30ml) and my husband is eyeing it jealously.

EDIT: I have been layering this with Etat Libre d'Orange 'You or Someone Like You' and the mint blends beautifully with the water notes. It smells like springtime in my house!

I was expecting more from the ginger opening, but it leaned towards a yuzu citrus scent with ozonic notes. I tried to find the lavender, but it’s a very lowkey scent. It dries a but flat for me even though it’s fresh and clean. Projection is a little underwhelming, but it’s definitely long-lasting.
