Divine opening! Fresh, clean, realistic water, slightly citrusy & woody (completely unisex). In the mid, that clean aquozone tones down to reveal more of the lavender & woods (starting to lean feminine). Then the dry down is musk & wood forward, lavender still present but citrus way in the back (at this time tho, the fragrance swings def more fem). Projection is very good but longevity is really super impressive.
Depite leaning slightly too fem for me, I really enjoy this one thanks to its very unique clean water note in the beginning. It also has a very calming effect.

This is a light and refreshing fragrance with a clean, aquatic character that makes it very easy to wear. It opens with a crisp watery freshness and remains subtle throughout, never becoming overpowering. The scent stays close to the skin with moderate longevity and projection, making it a good choice for everyday use. Overall, it’s a pleasant and simple fragrance that appeals to those who enjoy soft, airy scents.
the lavender did it in for me. a no. BUT the one thing it DOES have going is longevity. i damn near had to use steel wool to get this shizz off of me.

This is decent, but it's nothing to go out of your way to try in my opinion. It's fresh and oznic but it's kind of flat and doesn't really change much. This is unisex but I would say that this reads as somewhat feminine, but only because of the other fragrances that it's reminiscent of. This reminds me of those late nineties and early 2000's female perfumes with the super fresh melon and ozonic notes...I can't remember any of the names off the top of my head. Like those scents, though, it's ever so slightly headache inducing and nauseating, just barely, but if you're sensitive to that then you may not like this.

I like that Kenzo is going for an unabashed freshie but I think they've missed the mark with this one. I just can't imagine who this is for in 2025. Again, it's not a bad scent, it's just unexciting and I'd rather be wearing something else.

I'd give it 5 out of 10.

Nothing Special. The notes left to be desired, citrics, musk and a boring lavender. And i am fan of lavender scents. Unisex or Youngies scents are my type, but i think it has very few notes diluted in musk.

****** I slid through Jc Pennys to pick up the new eternity Amber essence and they had this kezo on display , threw about 5-6 good sprays on my forearm about an hour ago, & I’ll just say the first 30 minutes was divisive and kinda difficult to navigate what exactly I was dealing with, but now that it’s been about an hour on my skin, I’mma bout ready to run back and get a bottle. Very clean fresh and 100% a solid summer frag if you can get past the first 30 minutes or so. Well done kenzo. At first it reminded me of este lauder pleasures for men, I still feel the same way in that regard, however this is a much more modern take on that scent profile without the oak moss Happy sniffi’N
THE END.

Pure freshness, a bright aquatic citrus splash. It’s in the same family as D&G Light Blue, Moschino I Love Love, or Divine Paradise, the drops by Issey Miyake: easy, refreshing scents made for summer heat. A little sweetness comes through, then it settles into a musky dry down.

I really enjoy the aquazone note here. I like when synthetics are used well, as is in this case. The fragrance itself is simple, but that’s kind of the point - it does the job of cooling and refreshing you. The bottle is beautiful too: baby blue, crystalline, soft and rounded, it matches the scent perfectly.

That's an interesting twist. Kenzo normally focuses a big chunk of its perfumes around the idea of "aquatics". L'eau Pure per nomenclature is an aquatic perfume as well. Without a single marine accord or note. The perfumer directed it to the aldehydic freshness. It's an ode to crispy laundry sundried on the chill day. Now, I am even more curious to try Ms. Bugey L'Artisan Perfumer's awarded perfume because it seems "aqua fresh" area is her expertise.

The fragrances itself opens with loads of bright citruses and as many noted - some kind of detergent. It's not too pungent and does not develop much rather than gets softer over the time. The overall longevity - 3-4 hours, which is not bad for this perfume genre. I did not focus on silage much.

The best thing in this perfume for me is the feeling of prolonged "hug-you" laundry freshness and the pyramid component trick. One of the best designer releases this year even though I am not a big appreciator of "aquatic fragrance family".
Smells like a scotch egg mixed with chlorine

Roberto Werino Aqua very much reminded.
CK2 is better.
A one -time perfume
Sunscreen kinda vibe. It performed well on my skin but Idk if I'll buy tbh

This is a great aquatic summer fragrance. Kenzo know what they are doing with their warm weather fragrances.
Aquozone, lemon, mandarin & sandalwood is the most prominent notes for me. A lovely blend!
Also a great performer on my skin 👍

Almost a carbon copy of "CK2" from Calvin Klein. There are a few very minor differenses though. "CK2" has more blue watery freshness whereas "L,eau Pure" is a bit greener turning cucumbery later. The minerality (wet stone) of "CK2" lingers longer, whereas "L,eau Pure" turns softer and soapy clean but in a funny way. I kept looking for fresh coconut to be a note but no, it is not. Nonetheless, there is a tender soft coconut scent (maybe white musk and sandelwood). I find that note as well in the Body shops now discontinued "Italian summer fig". I am wearing both scents right now, and there is not much to tell them apart. However "CK2" dries out to a dry mineral note, "L,eau Pure" turns soft coconut.
It has a few family traits with "Noa" from Cacherel, It is in the same vein of soft, clean and non sugary.
Smells like a good toilet spray. Would not put on my body
Frutiger Aero bottle and scent? Yeah I'm copping this as soon as it's available idc.
I feel like I really like it but the lasting power/projection isn't a lot
This is available at JC Penney here in the states.. really JC Penney…random place but ok.
Super pleasant, but it disappears so quickly - I tested it today and it was completely gone within 1.5 hours. It’s a lovely freshie, subtle and intimate.
Fresh and aquatic, very safe. The sweetness is almost undetectable. This is a good scent for people who don’t like perfume. It’s soft and calm, like kids’ soap.

I find this to be quite strong for a "l'eau" fragrance. Definitely more feminine than masculine, with a strong lavender-lotus-peony presence, like the review below rightfully acknowledged. Sadly not for me

I just got my Kenzo L’Eau Kenzo Pure, and I have to say—it instantly reminded me of A Drop d’Issey Eau Fraîche. They share a similar vibe: clean, fresh, and watery, with that calming, almost zen-like softness you’d expect from both brands. But Kenzo has its own unique presence too.
Kenzo L’Eau Pure opens with a refreshing wave of watery citrus and light floral notes. It feels incredibly airy—like mist over a still lake on a summer morning. You’ll notice soft florals like lotus and peony, mingled with hints of green tea or mint, depending on your nose. The drydown settles into a very light musky base, keeping it clean and skin-like.

It’s very much in the same family as A Drop d’Issey Eau Fraîche, but while Issey has a slightly sweeter, creamy almond twist, Kenzo keeps it crisper and more minimalist.

Kenzo is great at creating "harmless" fragrances for the smarter population that does not want to stand out in a vulgar way. L'eau Pure is fresh and clean - it leaves a delicate trail and it's pleasant to wear. To me it smells of some Guerlain Aqua Allegoria or Hermes Jardins. I love it!

This is fresh. Purchased a bottle at El Corte Inglés in Barcelona and have to say this is definitely different from anything Kenzo has put out.

It’s a fresh aquatic that smells very similar to scent like Hugo Now. The aquozone molecule is very distinctive in that it runs through the life of the fragrance. As it dries you can smell the lavender and sandalwood but the whole composition is very shampoo, brisk and summery. I like it . It’s not unique but it definitely is great for the warm weather. Some will say it’s too pedestrian considering the Bisch creations for the brand.. but I think it’s perfect for the summer and will definitely be a super seller. Especially abroad. The sandalwood in this is not pickle centric or even that noticeable. This is a keeper. Leans a little feminine.
Hope this is something really new from Kenzo
Honestly this sounds amazing fresh-out-of-shower!
This smells similar to their flower tag, very nice

I just received this today and it smells very nice it's very warm and perfect for this time of year. But I have smelled it before and I'm racking my brain to try and recall what it reminds me of. I want to say it's very similar to cinema yet somewhere in there I'm getting a Nutty smell like Sensi Armani. So if you like both of those fragrances this is on the same lines.

I purchased this online by accident. I thought I was buying the regular Kenzo Amour.

At first spray I was so disappointed. The opening is horrible, stale, sharp and acrid. I don't think the tea and bitter orange go well together. Luckily that stage only lasts about 15 minutes and you are left with a lovely creamy, soft, floral vanilla.

On me it has moderate lasting power and light sillage. I like it but it's not a love. The bottle is stunning.

Definitely shares some DNA with Kenzo Amour EDP....but is lighter and fresher (thank you Peony!!) and just a bit more floral, which is fine for this time of year. I get a lot of tea/vanilla/bergamot with a musky vanilla drydown. The peony shines in there throughout, fresh and clean and bright, but never overpowering or sharp. All in all, a very beautiful composition. The bottle is gorgeous as well, of course. Different enough from the original EDP to own both, in my opinion.

The top notes are awful on me. It's unpleasantly sharp with obtrusive floral. It drys down a little softer but the bitterness is still there. I'm starting to think I really don't like peony. I agree it's similar to Cinema which I also thought was awful. Both are much too sharp and floral for me.

This flanker of amour is extremely lovely!
Not that much similar to it's procedure,it's cozy and a lovely vanilla,tea combo but much brighter and wearable all around year
It opens with uplifting citrus and tea notes,it has the lovely freshness of these notes but not the expected sharpness.vanilla and musk hug this citrus tea and make the overall combination rounder,warmer and deeper..there are also pretty floral notes,dominant bright frangipani,ylang-ylang and some peony blended perfectly with other notes
Kenzo l'eau amour has all features I love in a fragrance,it's fresh,feminine,smooth and cozy.it's versatile and smells pretty.it's very balanced and bottle is adorable .vanilla is used artistically here,it makes all this sharp notes soft and smooth and prevents the combination to become a very light summery scent.indeed both longevity and sillage are good and acceptable
Although it's wearable year round,IMO it's perfect for late summer,early fall.because of it's sunny fresh fluffy feeling,very relaxing
Kenzo has some great fragrances and this is One of them
P.s:Trussardi a way for her+ Kenzo Amour's soft almost milky vanilla =Kenzo L'eau amour

This is very nice sweet vanilla-frangipani composition. Truly pleasant, I can't imagine anyone disliking it. Amour florale is my favorite from this line so far, but this one is also pretty good.
Comforting, subtle and not over-whelming at all. The only downside is that it might be too ordinary.
Still nice enough and worth a try.

I love the bottle for this fragrance it is so pretty and so is the juice inside it! Kenzo Amour L’eau opens up with a smooth bright citruses and gently fades into one of the best tea notes I have ever smelled in a fragrance! It is fresh but still a little heavy because of the musk and a tiny bit of vanilla. I think I also pick up on peony and tiny bit of ylang ylang which blend perfectly with the tea. On my skin the tea note manages to linger on my skin until it reaches the drydown which took about 4-5 hours. The drydown is simple but still lovely a blend of vanilla and musk light and still fresh. This has great lasting power, I got 8+ hours out of it and considering that it is an EDT I thought that was impressive, but it was never too heavy in the heat. It might as well be summer already where I live it been pretty hot this last couple of weeks.

Somehow Kenzo fragrances allow for notes that I usually can not stand to become wearable such as tea which usually gives me an instant headache and violets. They are almost like miracles for me haha. I’m glad to have the perfume in my collection I find that it’s a great scent for summer, but I am sure I can wear it all year long without a problem.

I also have to thank Vie Café for introducing me to this lovely fragrance I would have never found it if she had never mentioned that I would most likely enjoy it. She was right I totally love it! <3

LOVE this on colder days, the tea leafs smell sooo addictive. LOVE the bottle, so cute on display! Kenzo should have made this an EDP as it does not last longer than i wish. Overall, a fantastic job with the cute long neck bottle and the juice inside :)
Update: 5 sprays in a late spring morning, after 6 hours the smell still lingered on, so this definitely lasts longer in summer months (whereas it seemed to lasts for only 2-3 hours in winter).

It smells like the original one,Only lighter. But i like it:-) just a pity it is a limited edition,because it is great if you think the original can be to strong,like it is för me sometimes. On Me the musk and vanilla are the most prominent notes.

A very fresch scent with teanote in top. Great for warmer days. Nice but not a favourite.

En väldigt fräsch doft med te-not i toppen. Perfekt för varmare dagar. Trevlig men blir aldrig en favorit hos mig.

Love the fragrance. Love the bottle. Love every fragrance from the Amour line.

But unfortunately l'eau has absolutely no staying power. Sprayed 2 times at my wrist 2 hours ago - and theres noting left :(

I know this is intended to be a summer scent, but after testing it in both cold weather and in hot weather, I actually prefer it in cold weather, where the base notes seem to be more prominent!

In the heat, there is something about this scent that is very green and sharp. I think it is a combination of the green tea, bitter orange and ylang ylang. The peony is also clearly detectable, but the base notes feel completely overshadowed.

In winter, it's a bit creamier. The peony is still detectable, but the composition feels more balanced on my skin.

Overall, though, it's a very sheer skin-scent, and maybe a tad too floral for me in the end.

Maybe Kenzo should start a jeweller's or glass factory?:) These bottles are gettin more and more breathtaking! In reality this one makes an impression, and the same goes to this year's Flower Tag - splendid, both of them!
The scent for me is an equivalent of Hypnotic Poison Eau Sensuelle for the original Amour - a bit lighter, a bit smoother, less woody, but definitely the same scent. Pity it's summer and this kind of frag don't appeal to me at all - maybe I should have bought it for winter? The bottle alone is worth it!
If you were a fun of Chacharel's Gloria, you will love this one! Unfortunately not longlasting on me.
It smells like a Comodoro Rivadavia's bar, notwithstanding I will buy it 4 my girlf.
It is very similar to Yves Saint Laurent's Cinema, but with the Amour base. I would say if you have the YSL, you probably don't need this one. It is quite pretty, though :)

This is for those who like the original Amour but think it is a bit too heavy and headache inducing, like me. The Eau is fresher, more floral and delicate, but still keeps the whole Amour vanillic concept.

i just got this today and i really like it i normally do not go for these kinds of scents i dont think it foral to me its deeper but still fresh..i like true fruity florals mainly tangy sour fresh fruity smells but this is a nice change for the evening in the spring summer and fall winter..im glad i got it and it has a very beautiful bottle


UPDATE:::I adore this scent it is so beautiful its now on the top of my 5 favorite perfumes of all time...i have never had the pleasure of smelling the original amour but i have got to get it now since this one smells so good..Thanks for the best swap ever Anna_gr
I smelt this today at the department stores in Bilbao-Spain.Very clean and soft, a little bit sweet. I liked it more than the regular kenzo amour. The bottle, as somebody commented here is gorgeous.

Just got it in the mail today. The bottle is stunning, the picture does not makes it justice!

I like the fragrance, in my opinion it is Amour that is more suitable for the spring/summer - like Amour in love :)

It's more lightheaded than Amour but still you can definitely feel the original fragrance in the background – as if you layered Amour with something citrusy. On me the staying power is not bad and so is the sillage.

Not sure it is full bottle worthy if you already own Amour, but I'm crazy for Kenzo fragrances, so now I'm a proud owner!

Update: swapped it. Always prefered to wear the original over it...

Why does this bottle has to be so big, but so pretty!?

Because for the juice inside, I would not háve to have it. Still, it's a nice fragrance:
the original amour sure comes trough, with it's ricey smooth -not too sweet- vanilla. The big difference is that this l'eau has a orange in the opening added, and a frangipani/peony heart, which make it appeal more fruity. It is less dreamy and cosy than the original, l'eau is a bit more uplifting and awake. Like a breeze of sunlight (if sunlight would be like air). But still, there is that creaminess like in the original which makes l'eau a comfortable fragrance too. The silleage is good, but the staying power is worse than the original's. All in all, I wouldn't say l'eau -as the name would assume- is more acquatic, watery or light. It's just more bright! And probably more suitable for summer then it's mother.

PS: Personally, I prefer 'the mother'.
because it's from the future! This looks exciting, i love amour, hopefully this one turns out to be awesome too

This fragrance centers around a powdery iris, but what truly stands out is the strong presence of ginseng.

There’s indeed a distinct sunscreen-like impression here, likely from the soft, powdery iris combined with the clean, comforting white musk and the warm ginseng - or perhaps from some unannounced ylang-ylang.

However, the overpowering ginseng cuts through this softness with its sharp, almost spicy edge.

In the end, it’s an ok scent, but the imbalance keeps it from being truly memorable.
The note is very deceptive - as many have said, it smells like a very sweet “sunscreen” scent. It's not powdery, but rather a coconut+frangipani+watery+balsamic scent composition.

It smells like s sophisticated day in beach. It has that "sunny" or "solar cream" smell, bit in a very faint or delicate way. The tea note is not as strong as it is on other tea perfumes. It blends so well with the iris.
There is no frangipani listed, but that is the vive of this perfume. Definetively "Soleil" is a good name for it. So bright in a peaceful way.
Projection and sillage are quite weak, still, it is very unique and beautiful.

A lovely iris powdery fragrance. It has a slight make-upy feel (as is often the case with iris fragrances), but it's not too vintage; it's the green tea that gives it a lovely Asian twist. I didn't understand the choice of its name ("Soleil The" which means Sun-Tea) until I realized that it leaves behind a pleasant solar trail - which is surprising without the presence of tiare/coconut/monoi/ylang/jasmine!

8.5/10

I love Kenzo Memori Collection, stole my heart with these beautiful relaxing and soothing fragrances🤍 Nuit Tatami is my instant crush and Soleil Thé comes afterwards. Soleil Thé means Sun Tea and i find it really happy and sunny as its name☀️ Though the notes don’t include any yellow or sweet fragrant flowers i do clearly get mimosa and maybe some honeysuckle flavours🌼 It has iris which leads the fragrance from the beginning until the end, ginseng, tea and white musk are the remaining notes. This yellow flowery, let’s call it mimosa feeling gives a bright vibe like a warming effect of the rising sun. Pulls the fragrance to the breezy side. Here you may find iris powdery and creamy instead of reflecting cold and distant energy of its own. Soleil Thé is soft, airy but bright and a happy member of this collection✨

The beginning is promising: Magnolia and sunny powdery cloud. But then things do not go the way I expected :( Baby powder, johnson & johnson baby oil, Nivea cream + rice powder and Matcha tea. Not the kind of powderiness you'd normally get from Iris. A bit itchy Musk that dominates a bigger part of the fragrance.
My review of this KENZO collection is available on my YouTube.

Dina_France

I had half an hour to sample the whole line represented and though several new Kenzo Memori started promising, the best drydown on blotter belonged to this one. Hence - the bottle.
Definetely soleil - whatever we usually mean by it - light, airy, slightly mineral, but not salty. Soft and ligtly creamy it feels suitable for a skin care line.
Reminiscent of Sunflowers by E. Arden and Memories by Gucci. I found longevity and sillage not very prominent yet and pair it with Eau de Soleil Blanc by TF, now the combo is longlasting and nice.

Cold skin, cold weather test
Smells way less interesting than I expected from seeing the notes.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: Sweet but fresh, and a little fruity. This is what I imagine the color pink to smell like.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: Gross typical fruitchouli. Yes, it's got a distinct apple note and the florals are a bit fresher than some others, but it's still a fruitchouli, so when I wear it I smell like a perfume store that only carries the very most basic and crowd pleasing scents and sprays them all every hour on the hour in an attempt to showcase their wares. If I wanted to smell like Angel, La Vie Est Belle, and Coco Mademoiselle somehow all had a baby with an apple, I would...well I wouldn't.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
Review is for my own reference - I am pleasantly surprised by this scent! The other Kenzo scents I've tried are too floral for me, but this smell like fresh sweet (fruit vs. candy sweet) and peppery to me (not as good as PR Black XS though), and maybe a bit aquatic. The package says this is a Gourmand Floral, which I would agree with, Fragrantica has it as a fruity floral. I think this might be too cloying in the humid summer months, but great for daytime the rest of the year. I think this is a unisex crowd pleaser, a wide range of ages could wear this. Someone mentioned that it smells a bit like walking past a BBW, but in a non- cloying way and I would have to a agree. This would make a nice candle scent too. It is a stronger scent with a decent silage. straight from the sachet its fruity sweet. left on the skin for a bit it smells a bit more floral pepper.
Unfortunately, the sample that I got was not in a mini spray bottle, but in a sachet like a moisturizer sample. I wish I could have a bottle to try multiple times. I'm assuming if you sprayed too much you would get a headache. The red apple smells nice in this scent, I wonder if there is a DKNY similar scent?

I strongly disagree that this smells like La Vie Est Belle by Lancome. This is less intense and more fresh sweet, where as LVEB is richer and less fresh. It also does not smell Missoni Missoni EDT!

I really like it, almost love. but there are other fragrances I want to buy. I would keep if gifted. The price is okay too at about $55 for 100ml on discount sites. I think this would have to be one of my favorite fresh fruity floral smells.

Edit: as it's dried down for about an hour it smells a bit smoky and meaty. Maybe that's the earthiness? Not super gross, but not really pleasant for a femme perfume. I don't think I've had a perfume that changed that much on my skin before. Usually, complex scents will go from sickly sweet to a warm caramel sweet. but this went from sweet to smoked wood. Again this makes it lean more unisex. A bit disappointed by the end scent, I wish it stayed sweeter, but it does piqué my interest as a scent.

A few more hours have gone by and it smells a bit sweeter and smokey.

The smokiness of this scent reminds me of Dior Poison Girl.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: I can say one word this; ordinary! l do not like it:(

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: For me, this is for people that want Chanel Coco Mademoiselle or Dior Miss Dior to work for them, but can't get pass that sharp strong floral note. This has everything beautiful from the before mentioned, but the sometimes headache inducing sharp floral note is removed. Love it! This seems too heavy for me personally for Summer, but otherwise a year 'round beautiful scent. You really do have to love a designer take on patchouli with this one like Elie Saab La Parfum. And I do!

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: Wearing a sample of this as I type this review and I have to say I do like the scent but it's a bit too feminine for me. Not something I'd wear because frankly it screams preppy bubbly woman in a sundress on a warm afternoon or high school girl who oversprayed her bodyspray. Anyone else remember that era around 96-2000 when every girl left an absurb trail of cheap bodyspray throughout the hallways? Not the aura I'd want to give off as a 6' dude who's into spooky stuff and metal, but hey it still smells fresh and nice. Very sweet, fruity and floral, reminds me of fancy lotion or bodywash you'd find at a place like Sephora or Lush. Okay maybe there's a slight "walking passed a Bath and Body Works in a mall circa 2000" smell too but it's not that cloying. I could see this one being offensive to people though as it IS strong and projects hard. Up close it's almost too much.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
This is not just another flirty fruitchouli of the decade, but way more than that. Sharing almost no similarities and/or common DNA with the original L'Eau, this fragrance could be a strong player on its own (and perhaps that way would be less overlooked).

It opens with ripe yet fresh and sharp, almost metallic and cold apple notes, which never gets tart, juicy or overly sweet. Instantly patchouli comes into play - soil like, but not dirty and very cold. Like loose soil holding some frozen water droplets in the shape of small ice crystals. Some peony and lotus gives soft fresh floral nuances making L'Eau Kenzo Intense more wearable. After some three hours the scent turns more woody. Also some resinous warmth is detectable (like ambra or benzoin), but it is still very patchouli heavy.

This perfume lasts up to ten hours with moderate sillage; however with heavy spraying heavy sillage could be achieved. Cooler and colder weather, day and night appropriate, unisex.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
red apple, lily , lotus patchuli..all 3-strong and feminine .like a 90 s perfume. but in a good way.
strong and womanly, maybe better for winter because of the type of versace crystal noir .. vibe.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: Veryyy nice fragrance very unique doesnt remind me of any other fragrance its unique on its way very chic sweet perfume i always find sweet perfumes nice but they smell somehow cheep this perfume smells sweet and also very luxurious in a wayyy ...it smells great on my skin i loveee it..

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: It smells pleasant and fruity-generic (aka boring) for the first half hour or so, but then it blooms, and smells so irresistibly pretty!! I couldn't stop sniffing myself after, and the scent stayed all day. The 'vibe' I get from this is a cross between Miss Dior Cherie 2005 and original L'eau Par Kenzo. It's sweet, warm and optimistic, but also clean, chic and very feminine. Definitely 'spring-y'! But I would wear it all year round. The patchouli here is clean, and it's not too sweet, so it could work in summer too (maybe not when it's really hot out). I personally didn't get apples right off the bat, just a rich, happiness-inducing fruity-floral with refreshing watery nuances to tame the sweetness...that L'eau Par Kenzo DNA in this scent stops it from veering towards sticky-syrupy territory. A youthful aroma, but not juvenile...for those over 25, yes, it's grown-up enough for the office or general everyday wear for sure. It doesn't really smell like any other fragrance out there, though it might remind you of a few. Sillage is alluring, and longevity is 7 hours +.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
I agree with people here saying this has something from original L'Eau Par, deep deep down, but it's there.

Opens with a burst of very sweet apples. That's pretty much all I can smell at first. Unfortunately I find these apples quite generic to be honest.
I expected something else after the drydown but the apples still stay the most prominent. I get a bit of lotus and quite nice patchouli undertone.

The scent itself is overwhelming for me and way too sweet. On the other hand its quite unique fruity fragrance I have to admit.

Spring suitable.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: I love apple and patchouli notes, so I sort of expected it to be another great sparkling fruitchouli, but no. The perfume is flat. The sweetness is very plain, bubble gum type, it really lacks depth. I'm glad, I didn't blind buy it. It gave me similar impression as Live Irresistible by Givenchy.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: This fragrance is kind of underrated in my opinion. It might not be the most refined and grown-up scent, but it's very fun and a bit unusual. I smell mainly patchouli and a sweet, juicy candy apple that makes it different from most other fruitchoulis. It's the kind of perfume I like to wear to fun events like a fair.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
WoW... That's... Interesting....
When I smelled this on my girlfriend I swear she smelled like candied apples, juicy berries and earthy vanilla, absolutely astonishingly beautiful scent on her, but looking at the notes I am quite shocked.
I guess body chemistry can do crazy things, now I HAVE to try it too.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: love love love! definitely a better update modern sexier versionh of Leau Par which u can still smell in it. the patchpuli gives it the deepness and sensuality. hot!

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: Horrible smell and horrible bottle. When will Kenzo re launch the original L'eau Par?

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Femme Kenzo
review_content:
Lightly floral, strongly fruity and juicy scent. Good!
I like it rather well. The other l'eau versions were not bad either, but this is the best for my taste.
Interesting composition of lily, apple and patchouli.
I recommend to try it! :)

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: It's intense floral scent, I can't smell much of an apple. I agree that it does not resemble any of the previous L'eau line. Simply, it is not light! It is rather overpowering. I find it quite strange that this scent was launched in spring. I think that fall would be a lot better time.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: I ususally don't like fragrances with apple notes but this one reminds me an apple cake... it's so yummy! I swear I can smell some cinnamon here. Very delicous.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Intense pour Femme Kenzo
review_content: There's a strong linden blossom note in the top - it's juicy, sweet and deep - though it's probably a combination of lily and apple. I like the fragrance so far, but it's completely different from other Kenzo L'Eau incarnations.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Thé Kenzo
review_content: Felt like a prayer and blessing on the skin, like a very intimate caress. Very sad about it being discontinued, it was the first tea fragrance I loved

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Thé Kenzo
review_content:
One of the first fragrances in my collection. Til this day, I will never understand why Kenzo discontinued this fragrance. It smells like citrus green tea. I would consider this a unisex fragrance. However, it leans feminine, because of the drydown, where the powder engulfs the entire fragrance. Hence, the reason it's marketed for women. I like the scent, but I wouldn't buy it again because of the dry down.

If Kenzo brings the scent back, hopefully it's reformulated for a more masculine scent, because I like the citrus, floral, tea opening and middle, but that drydown is not for me, lol. It smells like a woman's powder.

BUT DO NOT let my review influence your buy. Assess it yourself and have your own thoughts, rather than strictly going off someone else's thoughts and opinions. If you can, I suggest getting a sample first…or looking up the notes to ensure you will like it. Read reviews before buying a fragrance, but take them with a grain of salt. Everyone has their own opinion regarding smells. IF you do buy it, enjoy it :-)

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Thé Kenzo
review_content: A very light scent, too light, but nice when you get your nose right up to it.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Thé Kenzo
review_content: This is a very nice fragrance, powdery tea scent that makes me relax and refresh...got many compliments. Projection is moderate, but the longevity is quite good on my body (8-9 hours). This one would be my new fave for fresh fragrances.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Thé Kenzo
review_content:
This is a scent that comes from a really interesting line- very low key, clean, crisps scents that are very appropriate for every day wear, office, school, hospital, you name it.

Eau de Fleur de Thé is perhaps the most unisex out of them all. It would work on both men and women; I do not find it particularly 'tea-ish', it is citrusy and musky above all and not sweet. I am drinking tea as I write this little review and definitely I can detect tea in my glass, but not in the perfume bottle or on my wrist.

It is not a scent you can write paragraphs about, as it is simple and straight forward, so I can just end with a recommendation to try it if you like brisk, energizing scents that are not too loud or sweet.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Thé Kenzo
review_content:
It says tea on the label and green tea is what you get. The musk note is pretty subdued and instead it's a very linear green tea scent with moderate projection.

And it works as unisex fragrance. I've worn this in contrast to Kenzo Tokyo, which takes the green tea and adds red peppercorn and ginger, but the tea notes are suprisingly similar. Out of the two, I'd prefer this for its longivety and the fact that it is so linear.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Thé Kenzo
review_content: a little bit of citrus in the opening and then just plain tea, not green or white but more like regular tea bags. It's very masculine, it doesn't have a single dash of sweetness or flower note. This scent is more dry-bold than clean and refreshing.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Thé Kenzo
review_content: I think this is CK One in Kenzo way with more Longevity :)

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Thé Kenzo
review_content: How did you guys get the smell of tea? It only smelled white flower on me, damn. It smelled pretty green though. If you are looking for the smell of green tea, try Hermessence Osmanthe Yunnan, it smelled much like tea.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Thé Kenzo
review_content: Like this scent for summer. It is a fresh fragrance, rather unusual, and makes a chnage from my favourite florals and orientals.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Thé Kenzo
review_content:
This smells soooo nice! I would describe this scent as unisex as the green tea leaves with limes and musk is as masculine as it is sweet.
Sorry to say it does not last at all, after an hour or two I can't even detect it.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Thé Kenzo
review_content: I feel is so strong, so citric, almost masculine; but I love tea and I wear this when don't care show me little feminine. Is not for girly girls. Is for independent girls. Perfect for Summer. Starts with a very strong citric and ends floral; if you can handle the first part, you'll be happy. I think that Thé Vert for Bulgari is more feminine, more ethereal.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Thé Kenzo
review_content: There are alot of tea smells out there but none smell as fresh & clean as this one. It smells much more complex than the two notes listed to me. A great summer fragrance.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Thé Kenzo
review_content: I got it last summer, I liked it but it lasts for about half an hour

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Thé Kenzo
review_content: I love all "light" perfumes by Kenzo and can't stand those that have "personality". All of them, however, seem to be a tribute to the natural world in some way or another. Les Eaux de Fleur that I have tested are uncomplicated and perfect at the same time.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Thé Kenzo
review_content:
I'd describe it as a very cheerful& refreshing perfume. Very lovely & It smells so "natural" & balanced, nothing artificial about it. I'd be wearing it next Summer :)
** Thanks so much NathalieZ for the lovely perfume <3

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Thé Kenzo
review_content: It's the best green tea fragrance I've ever sniffed!

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Thé Kenzo
review_content: It smell good on the testing paper... The funny part is it turn to another smell on my skin which i dont like it!

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Thé Kenzo
review_content: It does not only smell like pure green tea (as you can find it in Elizabeth Arden or L'Occitane's fragrances). Its more subtle, light and a bit flowery and even has a citrusy note. Very well balanced.

product_name: Eau De Fleur de Thé Kenzo
review_content: It smells like a combination of Bulgari's White Tea and Green Tea fragrances. I can actually recommend this as unisex. The tea is not the green apple variety green tea that floods the market but smells like actual green tea leaves with limes and musk.

In one word-retro.I dont mean it in a bad way,just saying the obvious.I like vintages ,i adore them actually,but i just spray them at home on my wrist to enjoy them by myslef.I blind bought it today hoping it will be from these wearable 90's scents ,but this is not a good one for me to spray it on and go in public.I will try it in the warmer weather,i think it will be sweeter then and the retro carnation will be mellow and not so spicy .By the way on me it smell extremely close to Sun moon stars.The dry down is like a vintage lipstick smell .Nice ...

I had never heard of Kashaya before - even though I have always loved Kenzo’s fragrances. But then I stumbled upon it, when I was looking for another fragrance from Kenzo. Apparently, it seems like it is actually discontinued. And so I fell for another blind buy. Again.
I was a little bit nervous about that - I don’t want to waste my money on something really odd.
But I am really pleased! To me, this is a quite unusual fragrance. It is fruity, but not very tart, nor childish. Not sharp or too strong. The fruitiness combined with the creamy and powdery softness is really special. I could have survived without this new purchase - but I am glad to have it!

Kashâya... its name means emotion and desire...

The first note offers us a fresh side with a beautiful citrus scent. But very quickly the juice transforms into something much more sensual, woody and amber. Jasmine - heady - and peach - powerful and enveloping - take hold. The vanilla is not far away and takes place, discreetly.

The end result is a carnal, torrid, oriental and at the same time airy, fresh, light fragrance. Incomprehensible? But nevertheless true.

Perfumes like this have become difficult to find in classic perfumeries and perhaps they're not even unanimous among those who know them. But I eagerly ask for more!

I remember Kashaya from '90ties as a happy, joyos, bold scent.One year I gave my mother a giftbox of this consisting also the bodylotion and it suited her so perfectly. So, one day I was browsing the internet and googled Kashaya and bling! found a page and ordered it immediately, big bottle 75ml for 68euros. And yes, this is still a beauty, I recall the precious moments with mama and I'm so touched by the memories. My hubby likes this one very much, very feminine scent so I'm happy that I bought this. Oh boy I feel so nostalgic...
Sophia Grojsman to a T. Love it. Wouldn’t expect anything other than greatness from the queen of perfumery.

Fragrance that is pleasant, bright, joyful, and highly energetic It always makes me feel good. I'm captivated by the intriguing fruity opening, exquisite floral centre, and benzoin-sandalwood oriental base. Longevity and silage are both superb. It's the oddest combination of creamy richness and dazzling airiness. Unique. It's very magical. It's gentle and sweet. It smells iridescent, nacreous, and wonderful to me. enthralling, with a lovely fragrance When I wore this to work, I always had praises and compliments.

Weird on my skin. First impression was like I smell acrylic paint that in 15 minutes changed into an apricot body creme. After 2 days of tests and attempts to understand this perfume it started to sound more sweet (kinda like Dior Dolce Vita sweetness). Comfortable scent,but nothing special. Longetivity 1 hour max.
Update: after spraying on the cloth it lasts all day long. Sounds like opaque oily waxy apricots. Weird, but still comfortable. Finished my 5ml tester. Will not buy again.

The full bottle of this honeyed beauty found me through blind swap, and it was absolutely delicious surprise! I've kept it since last November to wear now - in mid-August heat - just wow! All jammy, slightly honeyed and syrupy apricots and peaches are in the forefront. Its quite complex, like 80s and 90s such scents are, with supporting variety of florals, yet completely unique imo as fruits are jammy and strong, really edible. And its not actually old-fashioned or classic the slightest, but instead joyful, playful and opulent.

Bold, but friendly, warm with benzoin giving boozy sweetness to the base. I actually wore it a bit in winter for lifting my moods, but it opens up much better right now - comes out more rounded. I smell spring florals (narcissus) and y-y in it, that add freshness and a touch of fresh dampness to balance the honeyed sweetness. And pineapple adds a touch of acid...

I'm not very familiar with lots of Sophia Grojsman creations, but I can see some similarity with what I know: Eternity, Vanderbilt, Sun Moon Stars, Tresor and now also with famous Champagne later named Yvresse that a very kind perfumista sent over to sample blindly. Its a lot about vibe- there is undoubtedly smth like Grojsman vibe in these... Kashaya does not have super sillage or super longevity but whilst its there for a few hours, its incredibly voluptuous and delicious. And who could also resist this beautiful crazy sunny bottle fitting for forest elves? :)
It paved the road for plastik fantastisch Gucci Rush, and I love it for that.

Finally I got my hands on Kashaya!!! I have been sniffing it and sniffing it again and again in the shops, when I was young woman, but than I never could afford to buy it, but now, the children are adults, the dogs are in heaven, and, I quitted smoking 11 years ago,

so, it was time for me and Kashaya, and of cause I love Kenzo, and the japanese komposer Kitaro (I have a LOT of cd's!!!) Kashaya is for me the spirit of Japan, it's clean, tidy, just right amount, I want to travel to Japan, and visit it's gardens, smelling their flowers, eating their food, walking on old roads, drinking tea, se mt. Fidji, visit Tokyos most famous zebra cross-road,

with Kashaya, I first smell the apricot, which is why I love it so very much, than there is the flowers, and all the spices, this juice is intoxicating, and I am waiting for the mothership to come and get me .....

12/10 points. Fits enyone, everywhere. Happy Easter to all of you :))

I blind-bought this based on the exciting reviews here. But I'm disappointed. There's a bold synthetic note in Kashaya that evokes the sweet-plastic scent of a latex birthday balloon; it's overpowering and unpleasant. Once it dried down on my skin, however, what's left is very pleasant, soft, creamy floral that's very close to the skin. 6/10

This is delightful. At first sniff I immediately started comparing it to other fruity florals of the 90s. It has less spice than Dolce Vita, less cedar than Chanel Allure, is not as syrupy and heavy as Tresor, and not as loud and overbearing as Amarige. Yvresse is another one but it's too long since I've smelled it for me to comment.

For me it's much more wearable than any of those. Where Kashaya makes a contribution is firstly that it includes a deliberately artificial accord that is so characteristic of Kenzo fragrances. And secondly, its sillage and longevity are surprisingly moderate. It's as if Grojsman was asked to apply some Japanese restraint to her normally florid style.

With all those heavy hitters on the market I can see why Kashaya struggled a bit and, as a reviewer on Basenotes expressed it, 'drifted into obscurity'. It can still be found in a few places online.

The bottle is fabulous, pictures don't do it justice. It reminds me of amber-coloured Depression glass. Love it.

this reminds me of revlon charlie gold but a little more caramel, a little sweeter and a little more fruit
in my opinion this is similar to revlon charlie gold old formula.

I really like this because I love peach/apricot but unfortunately it lasts rather poorly on me and I have to keep respraying throughout the day. I won't be repurchasing. I much prefer Ted Lapidus Fantasme which has the peachy apricot fruity sweetness that I'm craving with much better sillage and lasting power for a better price.

It smells like very high quality body cream to me and that's awesome if you like creamy frags. It's very suitable for office wear and I'm sure everyone will compliment how femininely beautiful you smell. It has a lot of notes but it's very hard to tell them distinctively as a amateur fraghead. Overall very pretty scent that will make everyone happy.
a vintage wonder!!!! full of peach, apricot, (in the vintage treatment not modern fruity), vanilla, sandalwood, ylang, orchid, narcissus, hyacinth, musk; the drydown is all peach and vanilla

I was looking for a talisman, or rather a fragrance to wear as a lucky charm on tough days.
I happened to come across Kashaya in an old stamp shop, and bought it straightaway without the chance to try it, with the feeling that I had almost certainly read something positive about it just a short time before.

I consider it a privilege to have in my hands such a good luck charm, this (masterly) blend of hiacynth, pineapple, carnation and apricot-in-syrup_like.
Kashaya has a delicious, contemporary spirit that kidnapped me and always will, I think.
Let me suggest you try it.

(Note: maybe my bottle was not completely well preserved, just sprinkled it is a little bit alcoholic but while it starts evaporating it develops, wonderfully!)

A successful blind buy, K. is the first Kenzo perfume for me. An early 90's vintage, K. opens with sweet fruity notes, later florals, amber and sweet spices appear. The skillful combination is soft and warm, and make for a charming, feminine perfume. Sillage and lasting power are average.
The bottle has an unusual shape, like so many Kenzo frags. Even the box is decorative with leaves on the inner flaps.

Kashaya is a first class Floriental and another hit for perfumer/creative nose Sophia Grojsman hands down the best in the business. In '93, this was a luxurious and well made fruity floral. I remember smelling this on some of my teachers in school. My 5th grade teacher wore this all the time and also alternated this scent with Sun Moon and Stars. Fruits in this fragrance include apricot, peach, bergamot and pineapple. The peach and apricot combo is very intense, but I love peachy scents in fragrances so this was a good thing. Flowers in this fragrance include orchid, rose, narcissus, orange blossom, jasmine and ylang-ylang. There is no way you can overlook these flowers. The Oriental touch of sandalwood is strong here as well. There is a vanillic base and amber. This is strong stuff. I remember smelling it on my teacher even after she had left the classroom. I have enjoyed wearing this in summer time when the fragrance really stands out. Beautiful.
This is a deep warm scent, rich in vanilla. On my skin it is exactly Aqua Allegoria Ylang & Vanille!

I got this today in a blind swap. Beautiful box, beautiful bottle. I put it on my wrist, one spray. In the beginning it smelled like urine. I am not kidding, I was sniffing it and thinking "what have you done?". this lasted maybe five minutes. Then it turned into an old school perfume, something like maybe Ungaro Diva. I thought to myself "ok, I can deal with that even though I am not much into such thing lately". this lasted about 30 minutes.
And then it developed into a soft, creamy vanilla-like gentle cloud that you just want to sniff and sniff and sniff some more. It's been 10 hours since I sprayed it, I can still sniff a little on my wrist where I put this one spray.
I think it's perfect for the fall-winter, very happy, I think it will be great with real wear, like my usual three sprays on sides of my neck and chest. Should last the whole day and it is probably easy to get over this weird urine opening if you know what lies ahead.
If I would look for a comparison, the only one I can come up with is Ted Lapidus Silk Way which I also love.

I just love this fragrance. It is sweet without being overbearing and floral without any single note taking control. Add to that this amazing bottle, which is in and of itself a work of are with the iridescence that can only be seen in daylight, and the wonderfully detailed glass work on the bottle itself. If anyone doesn't like it and wants to remove it from their home, I'll happily take it from you...

This has Sophia Grosman written all over it, and to me that's wonderful. Like Paris and Champagne (Yvresse) it's happy, bright, joyous. I couldn't wear this and not feel at least a little uplifted. I don't think it "smells like Tresor" but it shares the same DNA, with the interesting fruity opening, lovely floral heart and benzoin-sandalwood oriental base. The moment I smelled it I recognized it as a child of Grosman, and there's no doubt it's a sibling to Tresor, Paris, Yvresse - but I wouldn't confuse it with any of those or any other fragrance for a second now that I've sniffed it.

Longevity is excellent and sillage it great. The first word that comes to my mind with Kashaya though is "radiant". It's one of those perfumes that will continue all day to periodically waft up to you if you have it on a test strip on your desk. Spray it in a room, walk out, close the door then return a bit later (or a good deal later even) and it's there, not in a huge heavy fog cloud but brightly and surely.

Generic is the last thing I would call Kenzo Kashaya.

Blind buy.....Everyone is correct....it's an odd perfume, not bad and not awesome but interesting. I have it, will keep it and wear it here and there before I decide any more how much I like it. Does not smell like Tresor at all on me. Will update you soon on this one.

Ιt surprises me to read that Kashaya smells generic. To me it is very original. And very unique. I cannot think of any other perfume that smells similar. It is a very nice perfume for autumn or light winter. Creamy and powdery and sweet. I always got compliments when I was wearing this at my work. Once my roomate borrowed it, and her then boyfriend went crazy for it.

It is the strangest mix of creamy opulence and shimmering airiness. There's no other perfume I can think of that occupies its spectrum in such a way. Unique. I can't account for the fact I love this so much, given its sweetness. I guess there are these little windows of opportunity for new things to wriggle in and become part of us, heart and soul. I think Kashaya got in just after Kenzo and around the same time as Casmir. Kind of a perfume ddos attack, a gang assault. Anyway I am very glad. It's magical. It's tender and kind. The bottle shape and colour are hugely influential in my experience of the fragrance. To me it smells iridescent, nacreous, in a lovely way. This also is unaccountable ['carnival glass?', part of me is declaiming; 'PEACH-toned carnival glass???']. but I completely cherish it. I think for me the whole experience transcends or evades questions of 'taste' and just penetrates to the vital 'soul' [I'm a heathen] within.
PS the comparisons to Tresor are puzzling. I do not like Tresor. Sometime, I must see what they have in common and what distinguishes them. Such a fascinating area of study.
Smells like a cheap drugstore perfume.Very generic, heavy powdery oriental scent. Not sure about lasting power as I sprayed some other scent over it (found the smell a bit head ache inducing)
Kashaya é delicioso! A orquídea em Kashaya é o que mais me encanta! Um perfume especial, difícil de achar aqui no Brasil. Maravilhoso!

I remember of 90's.

I like.

On me it soudns as Arabie Lutens :)
So intense ,with smoky apricot and peach,with a lot of woody's notes and intense white flowers.Adorabile sunny perfume!

too strong, too sweet, too spicy, no wonder it last so long. It's not listed but I smell lots of cinnamon. I agree with other review it doesn't leave much oxygen the breath I gave away the bottle i had.

I would like to thank malia for the sample as I didn't know about this scent. It's very rich and interesting...First is rather strong, but wait... it dries beautiful and it does lasts for a long time.

Very feminine, very special!! Warm fruity floral perfume with a touch of vanilla and oriental hints. It's kind of sweet fragance, but on an elegant way. Not too strong and overpowering, it's rather discreet and very elegant.

It opens strong fruity-hyacinth, than after while it becomes more oriental and vanilla sweet with a bit of orange blossom, some roses maybe, carnation for shure,............ I don't know exactly.
It's difficult to describe all the notes that make up Kashaya, they are simply so well balanced that they produce gorgeous perfume. That's why we call some perfume a masterpiece , is it?
Loev love love this beauty so much!

I wanted to, I should have liked Kashaya but it was just too strong, sweet candy and rich amber, just occasional woods and bergamot: as if I was wrapped in it and there was no oxygen and freshnes, no air to breath - I see how it could be lovely but if the power was 1/4 of what it was on me

Upon first sniffing Kashaya, it immediately reminded me of something, but I couldn't put my finger on it. Then finally it came to me . . . White Shoulders! It feels like a modern, woodier and softer interpretation of White Shoulders.

Oh, so many memories about Kashaya! It was signature for a friend at college and it suited her very well.
For me I couldn't wear it easily because I found it very chaotic and too plastic sweet.
I think that this burned plastic vibe for Kenzo started there. After Kashaya all Kenzo's fragrances have that cloying disgusting edge taken to an extreme revolting with Kenzo Flower.
In spite of the burned plastic vanilla Kashaya was a very lovely, romantic, seducing and longlasting.
It was very original, too at that time. Nothing smelled like Kashaya! I owned several samples and I wore them till their end, but it was never signature fragrance for me.
Now it is discontinued and Kenzo keeps throwing fragrances on market as if they did nothing else in life.
It would be better to have Kashaya back instead of many new launches.
I think that something of Kashaya survived in Kenzo Amour, a lovely scent with same headache inducing plastic vanilla.

Kashaya is a very typical Sophia Grojsman creation. You can tell that immediately. But unlike the majority of other treasures created by Sophia Grojsman I do jot only respect but like and wear it. My own scent classification is very different from Fragrantica's ;) I usually classify them by my perception or by best use. My perception of Kashaya is what it is supposed to be: relaxing, comforting and mind and body wrapping perfume. I can use it whenever I need or want to be totally tranquil. Sillage is decent too. Kashaya is a very long lasting scent because it is sold in big bottles ;)

Kashaya is a mix of gorgeous flowers with, to my nose, exotic honey. I know it is not honey, but the smell very much reminds me of it. It is rich, deep, warm, long lasting.

One of my absolutely favourites. Gorgeous and very seductive.
Wonderful oriental! I think you can easily pull it off in warmer weather, because it doesn't have that hard core sweetness and very transparent.

Mmmm, a wonderful scent. Like a bashful wallflower waiting to be discovered, freed from the shell and be appreciated and admired for all what he/she has to give.
On my skin it is all about the drydown, which comes rather quickly.

It opens with notes very similar to Elnette hairspray, at least how that smelled in the 80's (maybe the carnations and hiacynths shining through or that the bottle is turning?. I also get that smell and association with the opening of Youth Dew Amber Nude, but way longer time).

However, this fades quickly within half an hour and what is left is rich, soft, peachy, sweet, warm and creamy. I also smell banana and sometimes a little woodiness.
I'm not sure how to write but I experience it like a very moist ripe fruit but at the same time it is dry. It is quite linear on my skin during the day but I still find it interesting.
The sandalwood seems to be a surprise ingredient, some days I smell it clearly and some days not, anyway it just morphs the perfume into another version, still as beautiful as its sibling. It could well be in the background counting for that slight driness I experience, but it is just a guess. The woodiness yes.
Also, I find it well balanced, according to my preferences when I'm in the mood for something a little sweeter.
It holds for almost 8 hours, after that there are hints of vanilla left. The sillage is quite good but not offensive, if I were to smell it on someone else I would really like to know what it is.

Remind me to thank my father for his christmas gift to my mother many years ago, otherwise I would not have known that such a gem exists. I didn't appreciate it back then, but have done for some time now.
Maybe this one should be kept as a secret?
Kashaya is so incredibly interesting and beautiful at the same time. No boring stuff. No agressive ingredients. Pure feminine bliss!
I find this fragrance rather unbalanced, with very heavy peachy notes and nothing to balance them or add interest. This means that on my skin it's unbearably sweet and cloying.

Hi,

this have been one of my fawourites now about 16 years. And still this is so Unique, Beautifull and sweet oriental scent. I have no bad word for this Perfume. I used to be known by this scent. This is one of my Firsts. And still Loving it. For me this Scent is truly eternal Love- Kashaya.

For some reason the opening of Kenzo KASHAYA smells simultaneously animalic and plast-icky to me. Very thick and impenetrable, this composition makes me feel slightly uncomfortable to wear but without quite attaining the status of scrubber.

As it dries down, KASHAYA becomes somewhat more bearable, but it takes some time to get there, and it's never really a joy for me to wear. The bottle is totally unique, but the perfume seems to me a sort of hodge-podge of any number of other Sophia Grojsman creations, although I should say that I myself do not smell anything even vaguely approaching TRESOR here. Not for me.

Kashaya is more of an oriental gourmand with the sweet fruit ( apricot, peach ) overriding the flowers. Very nicely done and does bear a similarity to Tresor as others have noticed! It is an old school gourmand, different from the usual, so I would advise a skin test to see if it's up your alley..Kashaya is borderline too sweet but is softened by a rice note and dries down close to the skin. I can detect some jasmine and rose but no tuberose- the flowers are pretty muted here anyway. A very comforting scent which dries down clean and soft.

It was a long time ago I had this perfume. When looking at it a lot of good memories come back. This was my partyperfum in the -90. I had two favourites then Kashaya by Kenzo and Vanderbildt by Gloria Vanderbildt. Both of them strong and loud, but very nice scents to wear. Longlasting too..If I find a bottle I will buy it again.
Yes Harlequin they have certainly some notes in common!! Indeed Kashaya being a bit more creamy and Sira des Indes a bit more fruity oriental to my nose!

You wouldn't guess it from the notes, but Kashaya is almost identical to Sira des Indes on me - and I literally mean barely distinguishable (even after a week of testing). And yet Kashaya is so well-loved by the members, while Sira des Indes is so not.... weird. (I guess the qualifier "on me" must play the major role here.)

Well yeah, Kashaya is a bit more complex + balanced, a touch creamier + subdued, but only when I tell myself it must be so by staring at the notes long enough. Or it could just be the difference between the EdT (Kashaya) and the EdP (Sira). Otherwise, both smell like fruity-creamy ylang-ylang domination - and since I'm hopelessly addicted to the ylang, I could get olfactorily drunk on either one of these, equally happily.

AMAZING perfume!!! I couldn't agree more with the opening review of Zoka and couldn't have said it better!:

'I love this perfume. It is really rich scent, very interesting opening with fruits and fantastic floral heart and long lasting oriental base. It is really masterpiece compared to banal fragrances that are more and more common every day'

I had Kashaya delivered to my doorstop today.
Very excited, as not sniffed it before,knowing that Kenzo is one of my loves for most fumes they have , except for the flowery ones, and then I sprayed it on.....and I thought Oh no, what on earth have I bought.....!!!!
Giving that I am a very fair person, I cried a little...lol...then 10 minutes later I was in awe....... Yay for Kashaya...I am in Love....
Kashaya is really warm, soft squashed fruity aroma, sensual flowery, touches of vanilla, musky and bits of woods thrown in.
Is actually quite rightly a heavenly scent... Love it...xx

I agree totally with Nyoka, I just cannot understand why people do not love this. It is so smooth and comfy, it actually is a gourmand, without the typical gourmand notes. The mixture of sweet fruit and soft flowers has been done so well, that is feels like a gourmand shawl to me. I love it!

Thanks to anorton,I am the owner of this beautiful scent.IT is more about what it isnt than what it is.IT isnt loud,sickly sweet,knock u down in ur face.Instead its Not heavy,but lasts,Very comfortable to wear,and fruity enough to b fresh,light and exciting.THese r exotic fruits that take u to far away lands.It takes u on a journey through,jasmine wrapped tuberose orchid beds of almost magical flowers.as u enjoy all these pleasures u become aware of a slight touch of amber and musk with some vanilla added to give it the spice.Beautiful scent.beautiful bottle.
I have tried to like this, but I don't think it goes with my body chemistry. I hate the way it smells on me. Bummer too, I really love Kenzo Amour.
I believe this perfume is similar to Sun Moon Stars by Lagerfeld.....only that one is a tad sweeater.... Nice, cute, not a masterpiece though but stilll nothing wrong about it....
i like this but,its unremarkleable.grocery shopping yes,but not a high nite on the townii wish it had a more woody smell.
I don't understand the rating on this one! It is such an elegant perfume!! For all you gourmand lovers and Orchid addicts, a real must have in my opinion!!!

This is a rich floriental that I would happily wear if I received a bottle for free-the ylang ylang, tuberose, jasmine and orange blossom all have such sweet heavy nectar alone, that I could feel like a queen with a fantastic garden cultivated just for me wearing these nectars-but with Kashaya peach and apricot and mandarins are being held right under my nose, and the garden is heady in the heat of this fragrance...
The anise creates a nice effect before reaching the royal dry down-and all the while, with the flowers, the fruit, the spice, I smell toasted rice with vanilla and amber. This is peculiar and definitely pleasant if you love sweet scents with a hint of resin with your vanilla-If you like heady flowers, you might like this one....I have a love/hate relationship with sweet scents-and no floriental will ever replace my Accenti-but this is not bad at all.
The bottle is almost gorgeous, and kind of ugly...Quite surreal. But it is a heart, and it fits the "eternal love" theme perfectly. Although I am not in love with this fragrance, I might want it someday, certainly for the unique (or disturbing) flacon.
Gentle oriental. Oldfashioned and gracefull. Soft and quiet. Similarities with Tresor.

I was searching for something to put on at night, just before bed. I wanted something mild, not overly stimulating.
This is perfect for late evenings, after a shower. While complex, this perfume is not pungent, it speaks volumes with just it's whispers, and it is perfect for a relaxing, gentle scent. It's very mild and so light that it's barely there, but when you do catch breaths of the scent, it's articulate as a long poem or great novel, and creative and colorful like a Monet..with all the little strokes colors and notes blending and seeping around the edges, but each still visible, recognizeable, as individual droplets of paint and scent, yet all forming a beatuiful scene. I particularly enjoyed the bergamot, anise, ylang ylang, and strong benzoin and amber. It doesn't last long on the skin, you must catch it before it fades, appreciate the few moments of pleasure it bestows.

I love Kashaya. It reminds me of a golden autumn - the smell of dry leafs under your feet on a sunny September day, the smell of dried summer fruits (pears, apples and berries) and dried flowers.
I would call this fragrance nostalgic, warm, very calm, somehow relaxing and with a presentiment of a sunny autumn in the bottle. Try it, there's a chance you might love it too!

This could have been a great scent, really. Instead it's a concoction of notes without any care, it's so messy (same applies to the bottle) and it becomes nauseating. I remember this as the first turn to artificial cloyin smell in Kenzo scents. Why??? The idea behind is just so lovely! I'm not sure but I think it has been discontinued (at least in Italy).
yes, the best fragrance of Kenzo. To my skin, after while, kashâya smell like a wonder candy of flowers :) Enchanting...

The most feminine Kenzo ever.I feel for it`s soft dry down - and in a way it almost reminds me of Tresor of Lancome with it`s slightly powdered flower petals.But this one is more evasive, more subtle, more becoming.The other reason I crave Kashaya is the bottle - feeling the "vines" on the glass is almost like trying to decipher a coded message from your beloved.

I love this perfume. It is really rich scent, very interesting opening with fruits and fantastic floral heart and long lasting oriental base. It is really masterpiece compared to banal fragrances that are more and more common every day.

Alberto Morillas has done a lot in this one unfortunately it was discontinued from the brand I was able to keep just the rest of 30ml bottle to save this in my nose memory I like every detail in it the sweetness the silage and the long lasting and how it cools down such a pity not to find it again anymore

I couldn't appreciate this because of its metallic acetone-like smell that never went away. But I fixed this by layering with Bianco latte and now I've created the perfect creamy white chocolate raspberry fragrance. In love!

O melhor perfume que já tive! Sensual, viciante, fiquei triste quando saiu de linha, nunca mais encontrei uma fragrância igual! O melhor perfume! A framboesa é forte dominante, tenho ele ainda porém uso com parcimônia para não acabar.
Do they come with 2 bottles? I want to use this for something maybe

A delicious, warm, sweet, powdery, and enveloping fragrance.
How come it's no longer in production?
What a shame!

For me, Flower Elixir represents one of the best Kenzo perfumes and one of the best powdery perfumes ever produced! It’s such a shame that it has been discontinued because it was loved by many, so I think it must have sold well.

Scent profile is very beautiful and feminine, delicate, warm and super smooth. A sweet raspberry dipped in soft powder, mixed with sweet praline, creamy vanilla, mandarin oranges, luscious rose and orange blossoms! An excellent powdery, fruity, warm floral with strong, gourmand facets.

I personally loved Flower by Kenzo L’Elixir because it’s one of the few powdery dominant perfumes that it didn’t have iris or violet in composition, back in the days I really didn’t liked iris or violet in perfumes.

Flower by Krnzo L’Elixir was a delicious scent that was quite unique to mainstream designer launches for the time it was available but smelled so alluring and beautiful that made so many of us ladies, absolutely adore it!!

I will be forever grateful for my 50 ml back up bottle because on days like today’s, during slow morning weekends, I can enjoy the magic of this and reminisce of good times!

Kenzo, please start producing Flower L’Elixir again! Please, we need it, ten years later and there’s nothing like it!!
I will never believe they discontinued this amazing fragrance 😞
This was absolutely gorgeous. The best perfumes always get discontinued.

This is a gorgeous scent where the raspberry note identical to raspberry hydrolate dominates the composition. It is candied with praline and vanilla, reminiscent of a lollipop. Very pleasant to wear and joyous at that. Good longevity and projection even in winter but the scent does not overwhelm. I think it is even richer in different weather. I loved it initially but then I bought a raspberry hydrolate and it smells just as long and just as divine but for pennies. Now I like it still but I feel like wearing a simple byproduct not a parfume.

This has to be one of my favourite fragrances and like everybody else really disappointed that it was discontinued :(

It opens very much like a raspberry cola, it’s got that deep dark fruity vibe to it. And it’s just the right amount of sweet. One of those fragrances for me you gotta wear it on its own to really enjoy it and I truly believe it doesn’t have to be layered because it is the moment.

Gives off evening vibes, date night. Wore it on a first date with a guy, got cold and he gave me his jacket to me wear. As we parted ways and I gave him his jacket back, he messaged me the next morning saying he couldn’t stop smelling his jacket and I smelt “heavenly”. Beautiful, well blended scent. Top 2 and not number 2.

Yummy raspberry and vanilla. Praline note is cherry on top. I do not detect anything common with Prada-Candy even though some notes are similiar. L’elixir is fruity, powdery but not dry, playful and chic.

This is a wow vanilla! Unfortunately it has been discounted but definitely get your hands on this if you can find at reasonable price!

This is a powdery vanilla, that is candied with floral notes. The longevity is not the best on me and sillage is close to skin. I can see how this is compared to Prada Candy but this is much more defined candy. I layer this with florals sometimes. This can be a great sweater weather scent! Recommended 8/10 only because the longevity isn’t the greatest unless layered with something else.

WHY
WHY
WHY
WHY
Did they discontinued this precious frag?
I have a brand new SEALED 50ml bottle of this for swap or sale. Pm me. Canada only.

@CarolinaM007
I love this too and am running out of my last, precious bottle.
Shobi perfumery in Greece makes a top dupe and ships worldwide.
Since I am based in Europe, I look for dupes of discontinued fragrances mainly here (Spain, Greece, Italy, France, Germany and Ireland): hope this helps.
This is the best Kenzo in my opinion. It is very powdery with whiffs of raspberry. Unfortunately it falls flat and does not transform past the powdery profile. I wish there was more sweetness.

This smells EXACTLY like boume vanilla and it is sooo much cheaper. Performance is actually disappointing for a kenzo perfume. I would not recommend spending your coins on this. Get the cheaper dupe trust me. Boume vanilla is it if u like this scent profile. Boume is a tad bit sweeter probably due to the more vanilla in the base

I would recommend checking out Mizensir ‘For your love’.

It’s not a dupe but it has a similar feel. It has the raspberry and the same nose created it.
Hi! Does anyone have this for sale or can please recommend any dupes? Thank you! Looking in US
great perfume ! had a chance to get my hands on two 100 ml if anyone is interested i am selling one !!!!

Amazing perfume, such a shame it's discontinued it has such a sweet and slightly sour opening due to the Raspberries and the Mandarin, then it turns fully sweet due to the gourmand and vanilla note in it and the hints of really expansive makeup powders.

Overall a really great fragrance for those lucky ladies out there that can get their hands on it.

This Story Below has nothing to do with the performance of the Perfume, it's just a story of how lucky I was to get my hands on it.

Been at a local store that sells personal hygiene items and daily use stuff, saw that they got a really small section with Perfumes afterwards saw a name of few brands Kenzo was one of them, I asked them if they had Kenzo Flower (The original one from the year 2000) they immediately told me they don't then one staff member said yes we do have one last bottle I saw it it was Flower by Kenzo L 'Elixir didn't really care much about it since I really wanted to get the original one for my mom since she used to wear Kenzo d'ete 1992 so thought it'd be a good idea to get her something from the same manufacture seeing that L 'Elixir was a branch of the original I assumed it wasn't really that big of a deal, I went back home and landed on this page knowing it is a discontinued fragrance from better times I was in shock, I immediately contacted the store to put the bottle aside for me for pickup, snatched the 100mL for a good 80$.

EDIT to my previous review:
If you are looking for a dupe, try Blush Cardigan by Bath & Body Works and you will not be disappointed. To my nose they are 90% similar. Blush Cardigan is just a little bit less powdery and the raspberry is more detectable.

It was heavenly and sweet in a way that isn't juvenile.. A deep, fruity and sensual cloud of bliss with the timeless Flower DNA

Why would they discontinue it?
Burvīgs saldais pūderītis ar avenītes piegaršu.
Im so mad they discontinued this, wth! Pick it up while you still can because this is a gem
One of my faves from Kenzo. Selling my back up bottle if anyone is interested 😍

Pure raspberry goodness that has a praline running through and a very powdery drydown. I instantly bought this when I smelled it. I’m not a fan of most other Kenzo perfumes especially the flower ones, but this one alone carries the brand for me and that’s why its memorable! This was also the perfume that got me into perfumes, so it has a special place in my heart.
A very juicy beginning with raspberry, it is almost a bit tart. Then it turns into a slightly powdery syrup in which the raspberry is still there. Very beautiful and likeable.

Just received my bottle. So far my impression is that it smells like a mix of designer scents; Flower by Kenzo, Prada Candy, even a little Black Opium. But on my skin it’s so faint in terms of projection even though it has great longevity.

Reminds me of a jam donut with powdery icing sugar (minus the starchiness of the donut itself!). It’s more elegant than a lot of designer gourmands out there and feels very versatile.

My rating: 7.5/10 (points off for lack of projection)
Bf rating: 8.8/10

Edit: I sold this on because I just couldn’t smell it, I think was anosmic to it or I got a bad batch. I find myself missing it, though, so I might try find a replacement.

I adore Flower L'Elixir ever since I smelled it at a Bloomingdale’s a few years ago but I am so sad that it’s discontinued . I am like 40% done with my bottle. What a huge mistake for Kenzo to discontinued it.
OMG they discontinued it !!!! Why ? The best perfume ever, I’m so sad !

Goodness, this has been in my possession ever since its release, and I didn’t enjoy it for a long time. In fact, I just realized that I have a negative/mediocre review up for it, still visible.

Well, I love it now. That happens so often with me. Fragrances I dislike, eventually become ones that I love.

This is a sweet raspberry powder delight. It has gourmand vibes and reminds me of a powdered donut with raspberry compote. But it’s not as literal as that, and stays as a reminds me instead of me feeling like I’m wearing food.

It has all day longevity and projects moderately but in a quiet way. Why did they discontinue this?

Ah, but it is a very worthy perfume to be appreciated, yes! Kenzo and his habit of flanking everything that is denomination, inflecting only names and more names several times, ends up scaring when he launches them, but this one is very worthy of being honored for its beauty!

As soon as sprayed, it is a refreshing fruity scent with an enigmatic citrus background. The Raspberry note is lively and causes a sensational effect on the complete structure of the perfume, as it manifests itself at each evolved step of the same! I love the juicy reddish feel it gives.

In the dry down it becomes more floral, however, with a very characteristic airy tropical aroma, the Orange Blossom seems to be together with a very indolent Jasmine, dirty that makes it here in this phase a bit complicated and bringing the powdery, sweet and Kenzo heavyweight; nothing that compromises the resourcefulness of the fragrance, since it still bears the raspberry note.

In parting, which by the way is after long, long hours, the fragrance becomes more full-bodied, closed and dense like a true L'Elixir. I can noticeably feel a second skin with thin and slightly powdery makeup, but nothing that refers to colored pencils, really thin stuff, I can also feel a caramel aroma that comes from the delicious Praline that sews and ends with praise this work here; smooth sweet, with almond bottoms and a very tasty hazelnut shell, to cause salivation, even!
