Oh gosh that same vibe from the body shop smoky rose!!! Esp the edp version. Please test this from beginning to end before getting to excited to purchase. It does change from beginning till the dry down. I prefer the initial phase.

Il profumo del tulle di una bomboniera con 5 confetti.
Zucchero a velo delicatissimo su fiori d'arancio e rose lievi, bianche, tenui, garbate.
La nota fruttata è anch'essa morbida, lampone esangue immerso nello zucchero.
Un profumo ordinato come una composizione ikebana, pochi elementi fermi ed eleganti.
E statico come un'ikebana.
Nel senso che, quando lo si spruzza sul polso, posa una tenace dolcezza che persiste moltissime ore (con mia sorpresa...) senza cambiare di una nota, assolvendo il proprio compito, diligentemente.
Simile a Tresor la Nuit Lancome.
Per gourmand-addicted.
Un profumo aggraziato, un po' noioso.

I agree with the reviewer below me. This started out wonderfully! It was almost a dark cherry marshmallow scent on me. Neither cherry or marshmallow are in the notes, but that's what it reminded me of.

It's hard to believe that some reviewers could not detect the original flower in this, though. It's definitely there; and on the drydown, it comes out in full force and is very similar to the original. I would buy this if the top notes stayed around, but no.. The drydown kills it for me. I used to own flower, but sold it.

Sillage and longevity are good with this one. Nice fragrance, but wait for the drydown before breaking out your wallet..

Flower L'elixir makes wonderful addition to all Flower line. It definitely has this Flower core with smooth powdery base. Opening is very sweet but at the same time light. I was expecting something dense and thick. It reminds me of pimped up version of Flower Tag edp rather than any other perfume.
It's sweet, comforting and cozy. After 3 hours of wearing i was left with exact the same scent as Flower Le Parfum. I don't mind as i'm fan of all scents from this line but this makes L'elixir not that unique. Sillage is enormous for the first hour and then it gets quiet delivering pleasure to the one who's wearing it.

So it looks I am not the only one finding it similar to La Vie est Belle. Sad, are we facing a historical turn where everything will smell Lancome like instead of Mr. Mugler’s Angel or Chanel’s Coco Mademoisele? Smelt it on paper, I still have a little sample I got with something else but it doesn’t appeal to me since I got such a strong vibe of La Vie est Belle when tried it first time that I was put off.
I love the initial one much more than this cocktail kind of thing. Sorry, Mr. Morillas, this time U disappointed me, a bit.
UpDate: Feb 2016: for those days I feel like reaching for a sweet fragrance this has become my choice. I have to just think of it as a non Kenzo Flower like and non LVB either and that may quite work. How much more fun that iris in the middle would have been if just a tiny bit brought more front..... Still, after all, is not too bad, though still a bit too LVB.

I love almost all fragrances from the Flower Series,but this one ist the most beatiful one. Powdery,almondy and rosy,but also on the powdery side.
Cuddly and with some fruity vibe, remains me of Rahat lokoum Marzipan from Serge Lutens,but where Rahat ist sowehow weird dusty,this one is dense,yummy,almost edible lush !
Beatiful addition for winter !

Very Good.

La Vie Est Belle + Tresor Midnight Rose.

Is fantastic!!, very different from the Flower Kenzo line, gives another view. I like previous editions, but always were bit powdery on me.
Elixir has not that strong powdery side, instead, an "spicy" - tasty Vanilla stands out.
The floral touch is also remarkable, mainly the Orange Blossom, and the Praline makes all balanced. Is an upgrade.
Perfect!!, will be one of my favourites. A fragrance that is felt, strong and womanly.

Morillas did a great job on that one! It is definitely what an elixir would smell like, strong, intense, oriental...I personally like it a lot, and I don't find it similar to Nuit de Tresor, which I disliked..due to the patchouli..no patchouli in Flower l' Elixir...but they are both warm scents..I much prefer the Kenzo.
In a way it makes me think of Black opium without the coffee note, and of Dior addict, in a smoother version...
Like it isn't anything new, but in the category of orientals, this is nicely done..
I wouldn't put it though I n the category of fruity gourmands, it isn't sweet per se, although in the drydown, the original Flower comes through, in a more warmer tone...and fruity, no, I dont smell that..it even has a smokey undertone on my skin.
I smell a very pretty floral oriental, with dominant bourbon vanilla and orange blossom, I don't detect the raspberry, but others might..
I will happily wear it, in cooler weather, I think it will warm up even more..

I've been very excited to try this one, since I loveee the original flower by kenzo. I could already see this beautiful tall bottle standing on my vanity and calling it one of my new favorites.. To my surprise, as soon as I sprayed it on it reminded my of the recent la nuit tresor of lancome, which I didn't like much. I find no resemblance whatsoever to the original Kenzo Flower.. which was what I was kind of hoping for since this perfume is to celebrate 15yrs of her release. sprayed it twice on my skin, longevity @ 3 to 4 hrs..nothing impressive here. :-(

A very sharp synthetic perfume, I do not feel any cosy magnolia here, here is only musk in all the steps of pyramid.
Magnolia in all it's beauty is in Bvlgary Splendida - Sensuel Magnolia
This definitely has that quentin bisch signature , similarly found in fleur narcotique and bois imperial .. those all 3 can be sigblings and ciel magnolia is the youngest more fun outgoing sister :)
I absolutely love this fragrance, I actually had to stop someone wearing it to ask what it was. To me this is my new favourite summer fragrance, fresh , clean and just perfect!
Lovely and cosy magnolia

Not being a huge magnolia fan (as a kid, I was always nauseous in the car, and since magnolia was its interior spray, I made a bad link, unfortunately), this fragrance didn't speak much to me.

All I smell is a musk-magnolia blend that for me is nothing extraordinary and a bit boring.

But I can see why people like this fragrance, it's really pretty and doesn't bother anyone around me. Soft, floral and musky (and slightly woody). Not at all sweet for me!

Reminds me a lot of a perfume I smelled on a friend: Maios by Lofty Paris.

7.5/10
A sweet synthetic mess, very similar to Burberry Her. Yuck!

Synthetic. I fell in love with the opening -it was like waking up to a 22ºC spring morning and taking your dog for a walk by the lake, so I almost bought it without waiting for it to develop, and then... A pure, synthetic disappointment.
Musky, powdery and soapy. Fresh and lightweight. Almost identical to Fleur Narcotique, however this one is musky and more sharp. It’s very similar to Diptyque‘s city candle (Paris).

Nice powdery floral scent, very much in line with the trend we´ve been seeing in all major designer brands for their perfume lines. I got a decant as a gift for purchasing other perfumes. Frankly I wouldn´t buy the full bottle because I have other flowery/powdery scents that have better performance at a similar price. It has a hint of sweetness to it too....reminds me (distantly) of Red Temptation by Zara.
As much as I like the other scents from Memory line, Ciel Magnolia is an exception. It's so cloyingly synthetic, I don't get that subtle and tender scent of magnolia.
Amazing floral fragrance smells like an expensive cream. So relaxing before bed i fell in love at first snif. Sillage is very moderate yet i love it so much i had to get it.

Fleur Narcotique of Ex Nihilo is one of my favorite perfumes of all times. This is a very good dupe by the same perfumer, but with totally different notes. So, just forget about the pyramid here.
When I smell my skin it is a bit different than FN: there is a tiny bitter note somewhere under the bright florals, but the silage is almost identical to FN. The radiating power is very strong, you will not pass anywhere unnoticed.

Dina_France (perfume reviews on youtube)
Clean, fresh, sunny perfume. Extremely gentle and simple and appropriate for all occasions. It smells very transparent pink.
Cool, "zen" fragrance of spring magnolias (saucer magnolia) + something woody, cologney, masculine in the base. Masculine note ruined it for me.

This is a clean,soapy, elegant, warm and a bit powdery magnolia. It smells very japanese, if you know what i mean. It’s simple but pleasant and well done. Inoffensive. A good fresh fragrance for cold days, because it has some creaminess to it. If you like comforting, soft floral scents, try it.
Flowery , bright Freur Narcotic in a new bottle. That's all. U choose wich one to buy .
Very minimalistic sweet and tender perfume, like japanese design, simple and extremly capacious. Super delicious in my opinion.
It’s smells like the og one but with more longevity and more fruity and yes there is a bubblegum smell in the beginning but it will fade away don’t worry. Smells perfect

An incredible plum and peony scent.
The plum scent lasts forever until the very end.
Huh? Doesn't this have any patchouli in it?
I could smell the patchouli very strongly.
A special cursed substance that causes headaches and asthma.

Ugh, this was such a disappointment. I liked all the listed notes and blind-bought it for a good price. I was especially intrigued by the plum note, which I love. Expected some overlap with e.g. MJ's Decadence or Guerlain's Baiser de Russie but less complex, more linear perhaps. So, linear it is (on me). But instead of plum, I got a blast of tobacco that lingered, and the plum note to me read more like a screechy, medicinal cherry or cherry pits. There is zero tartness (which would be fine) and nothing to really soften or balance the sharpness of the uber-sweet cough-drop quality, even in the drydown. I couldn't wait to scrub it off, once I had it on me long enough to make sure it wasn't gonna turn into something amazing (or at least wearable). Happy to swap or otherwise offload this one.

I was super excited about this perfume as the notes are really intriguing and exactly what I tend to gravitate toward. I’m not sure if I got a bad bottle, but I get such a strong scent of tobacco immediately, and that overpowers anything else that I can smell - even on the dry down. I love Kenzo World EDP, but this one is just so different from the OG. I’m hoping it’ll macerate over time and get a little better, but for now it honestly gives me a stomach ache to smell

Underrated gem.
I quite like this one.

I never hear or see anyone talking about this fragrance on social media.
Kenzo World Intense is my favourite from their line second to Flower. I don't own or care for their other fragrances. I'm sure they're lovely on others but these two are my faves.
Another underdog perfume this one reminds me of is Burberry Black (Francis Kurkdjian creator of infamous Bacarat Rouge)

Luckily found it on sale for $59 AUD. It kind of smells like the Lush store when you walk past. In a high end kind of way. It's musky & fruity. It's extremely strong upon first spray which is why I'd assume people don't like it at first. It's unique. feminine. Original. Smells expensive & honestly if it was sold by a "fancier" brand like YSL or Chanel it would be more popular.

So this one is great if you aren't a label snob & want something that is good value, sweet & want to stand out.

I have so many expensive fragrances and affordable ones in my collection and I try not to be biased and follow the crowd.

It's definitely not for everyone. I think you should give this a try but definitely not a blind buy kind of fragrance.

Came here after watching the Kenzo World perfume advertisement video directed by Spike Jonze in which actress Margaret Qualley does a very outlandish unbelievable athletic fantasy dance routine. Really fell down a rabbit hole tonight in that the Taylor Swift music video I was watching called Delicate was reviewed as being too derivative of the Kenzo World video. So I watched the Kenzo World video, too. Both videos feature strange facial expressions, some very ungainly and rather uncoordinated but seemingly quite difficult dance moves, extremely weird sequences, etc..Both videos are what I guess would be called avant garde. Not sure I understand much about either video, but the Kenzo one must have fulfilled its purpose if I came here.

Kenzo World Intense is an underrated fruity floral gourmand fragrance. The opening is heavy on the juicy plum note. The peony adds subtle freshness and the jasmine adds elegant floral touch to the fragrance. The vanilla here is powdery sweet and alluring. Overall it's a perfect balance of fresh florals with juicy sweetness. The smell is elegant yet sexy. Also it's perfect for formal occasions as well as romantic date nights too. If you're using it as a signature scent or for any formal occasions then 3-5 sprays will be enough to serve such purposes. But for date nights or parties I prefer to go heavy on the sprays. Kenzo World Intense creates a beautiful Scent bubble and leaves an amazing scent trail. Longevity is around 6-8 hours depending on skin chemistry but it lasts longer on clothes.
I enjoy this fragrance during spring and the rainy season but it can be used all year round too. If you're looking for a fruity floral gourmand fragrance then give Kenzo World Intense a try. I'm sure you won't be disappointed ❤️

I purchased this fragrance without letting it settle on my skin first. Personally, I find it challenging to wear; it's strong, but not in a way that has an impressive sillage. The scent itself is heavy, definitely more suitable for winter and nighttime wear. To me, it feels overbearing, akin to eating too many cinnamon rolls without a glass of water. I believe a good alternative might be Black Opium by Yves Saint Laurent.

Wow. Deep, plummy, syrupy vanillic floral. This is definitely not a warm weather nor daytime fragrance. Perfect for cold weather. I see it being compared to decadence, but I don’t think they’re similar. Decadence is much smokier, and KWI is far sweeter. This is definitely a sexy fragrance. I have a winter trip in NYC coming up, and I’ll definitely be wearing this on a chilly night out. Very nice.
Really like this one. syrupy, sweet, pleasant, long lasting, very different from most fragrances. Found myself sniffing it all night. I like it.

Beautiful, syrupy plum & florals on a vanilla base. Rich & decadent without being cloying. Smells like Miss Dior (old formulation) without the patchouli. If you like Dior Absolutely Blooming, you’ll like Kenzo World Intense.

I simply love this perfume, it's one of my favourites. It smells amazing, like juicy ripe plums and it lasts forever on my skin. It will always be in my collection and I like make sure to have several backups just in case Kenzo discontinues it (really hope they won't) Love, love like a hug that comes out of a bottle

I was afraid to buy this as the opinions are strong. Curiosity got me and my bottle arrived. Some said it smells like juicy fruit gum, applied lightly - yes that's exactly what it smells like. Someone else said this needs to be applied with a heavy hand, yes it does. When applied heavily it awakens like a low growl becoming dark, juicy, tart, and deeply vanillic. It smells intoxicating, ready for a November evening when heavily applied on skin. I sprayed a lot so I had a big scent bubble and longevity but I feel it would be similar if applied with a lighter hand. It can smell somewhat synthetic, but I don't mind it. If you have Olympéa Legend this is redundant which it kind of is for me! But I will keep her for now :)

Quite a unique fruity fragrance, but I don’t think it’s a love for me. The plum is very prominent, and as this isn’t a common note, it definitely gives it a point of difference. It almost has a ‘cold’ character compared to other fruity perfumes - more sour/tart than sweet/juicy. I get a bit of florals but I’d say this more of a fruity than a floral perfume. I actually don’t get much sweetness from the vanilla. Overall it’s interesting and unique but I think it would work better as a candle than a perfume - I think it’s just a bit too sour for me.

The dry down is almost identical (if not identical) to my holy grail, number 1 perfume, My Burberry Black, but as if it’s a poor man’s version. Not nearly as deep or long lasting.

Very tart plum, has a masculine edge, and this fragrance also doesn’t last.

This is a big nope for me. I gave it to my niece.

I wouldn’t say it’s bad. But it doesnt measure up to my other fragrances.

The opening is very strong and reminds me very much of Bond No 9 ‘I love New York Holidays’ and also a touch of angel. Also something also reminds me of Wish from Chopard. It smells like there is something that reminds of patchouli. I definitely agree with some people saying the opening smells somewhat masculine, but then when it dries down you get the floral qualities. It’s not overly fruity, the floral quality is equal. Certainly smells very complex and expensive! The bottle is beautiful!

I really liked it when I smelled it at the store.. but the reasons I loved it at first ended up being why I didn’t like it. The plum and vanilla come across as experimental not well blended or balanced, so that beautiful bust of plum and vanilla I enjoyed at first sniff became a persistent and artificial scent on my skin throughout the day, this was distracting and a little obnoxious to the point of headaches. The simplicity of not having too many notes ended up coming across as more simplistic/generic as there was no journey and nothing to break the monotonous scent. Although there aren’t too many notes the fragrance still come across like it’s trying too hard, which was weird. A little too playful, It feels like a night out fragrance and we keep it at that. I really wanted to love this because I’m a big fan of the perfumers and I was curious about the blend of plum and vanilla, but I ended up giving the bottle away. I can see how some people might enjoy this, it has a people pleaser side to it especially at first sniff or short periods of time.. it’s not a bad fragrance, but not a safe blind buy. Test it, wear it around and see if you like before you buy. If you don’t like candy sweet fragrances, you likely wouldn’t enjoy it.

Figured it out! This is one of those perfumes, to my nose, you must spray heavy. One spray on each wrist & done makes it smell super masculine. The heavier I spray the more the plum & sweet vanilla comes out and the more that weird masculine note fades. I totally understand the juicy fruit comment now too. It smells divine, only if you're heavy handed though!! I wore it heavy to give it one last real try the other night as I was cleaning and omg I haven't been able to put it down since, I kept getting the most beautiful whiffs of dark plum vanilla. I LOVE LOVE LOVE this now. Great longevity and projection too btw. You just have to be all in with this beauty.

This smells quite powerful to me, which is exactly what I wanted. On my skin, I can smell plum and peony. This smell has captured my heart. This is contemporary, fruity, and just a little floral. It has a highly invigorating scent in my opinion. This is a terrific fall evening and night scent since it has a hint of sultriness and I adore how the vanilla and black plum combine. I wish the sweetness would have persisted through the drydown, but the heart is much more floral. With the vanilla note present, some sweetness reappears in the base, but it never gets syrupy or cloying. Amazing longevity, silage and projection.

KWI is mainly a juicy, plump plum with sweet, warm vanilla. The floral notes help keep it fresh, so it’s not overbearingly sweet. The performance is good but by no means “intense” .
I like KWI because I love plum notes in perfume, but in all honesty it is not earth shattering and doesn’t live to our expectations from Mr. FK.

Kenzo World Intense is intensely sweet in the opening, almost like fruity bubblegum or lollies. Beyond that, I really had trouble identifying much else except for the vanilla in the base, although even that seemed quite subtle to me. The fruity sweetness does soften after a while but I’m not a fan.
Smells like Juicy Fruit Gum!!

What I enjoy about this is that the peony adds a freshness and transparency to the fruity plum and it sits on a base of vanilla . It would probably not be as great if it sat on a base of patchouli. It actually reminded me of la Petite Robe Noir Intense with the fruity opening, but I got sick of this one quickly due to it sitting on a patchouli base. The vanilla base of this registers rich and syrupy but isn't cloying to me.
Very juicy sweet in the beginning, like cherry medicine or a can of pears, before it fades to an almost nonexistent powdery-sweet floral. It's alright for the price, but nothing special.

Yes, Gucci Rush! (Which I own).
I arrived to a meeting, greeted a friend and said: here it smells like Gucci Rush! She had no idea what that was. Later on she showed me the bottle of her perfume she kept in her bag, and it was this. I removed the cap and smelled directly from the nozzle: again, gucci Rush almost exactly as I remember it.
The funny thing is that the notes here on fragrantica seem to be very different for each one.

Smells nothing like gucci rush or my burberry
This smells like intense sweet plum scent at first spray and then drys down to smell sooo extremely cheap
Heavy and a bit of BO kinda frag. Have this moments of smelling like a pair of socks in a changing room at the gym...

Okay so I collect perfumes and I'm always looking for something that's going to blow my mind and this is unbelievable. I love it so much. Huge difference from Kenzo world. On my skin the plum stands out the most and not just during the top notes. It really sticks around. Now I found out they have another one called Kenzo World intense fantasy collection that looks similar and looks like it's the same notes. It's for sale in the UK. Does anyone know if there's any difference between this one and the one called fantasy collection? I think it's the same exact thing but I'm not willing to purchase an entire bottle of it to find out
This plum peony blend smells really bad to my nose. Feeling like I am in a crossing with no directions with this one.

Wow. Sweet, creamy, dark, a bit spicy and borderline masculine. This is a very pleasant and versatile blend of plum and vanilla, with a delicate touch of jasmine.
I'm thrilled with my blind-buy, this is my new go-to night out scent.

I don't understand the relatively low rating for this fragrance. It's a really good and unique fruity floral. The plum is delicious. A safe buy for anyone who enjoys sweet, juicy, fruity scents.

Also, I don't quite get the comparison to Decadence (I did compare them next to each other). In the opening, they are indeed somewhat similar due to the plum. But even after 15min, these two are very different. Kenzo World Intense gets sweeter and more floral, while Decadence just stays Decadence :D (I really dislike it, too sharp and unpleasant for my nose).

This Kenzo is really nice, and if I'm in the mood to get myself a mood-boosting, jammy fruity scent, I'll definitely consider this.

Update: I bought it :) Love it!

Light and floral with a bit of depth from the plum. Not the most exciting (I much prefer the plum in decadence which is very intense on me), but an easy, yet unique fragrance that I happily wear to the office when I want to switch up my regulars.

I don't reach for it very often, there are definitely better perfumes for me out there, but if you love plum it's worth having a bottle around if you find it at a good price.
A plum tart with lots of added vanilla. A very smooth, slightly sensual scent. It's sweet but not overwhelming.

This is quite good for the price. It’s not that kind of scent that will immediately blow you away, but it is dark sensual and somewhat interesting. The more I smell it the more I like it. I wouldn’t call it intense much, it’s like average edp.
As a non professional sniffer I can detect plum with vanilla and very pleasant jasmine. And I love me some sweet juicy jasmine 🤤 I’m getting a little bit of Alien vibe, but I’m not saying they are similar, just very similar style and direction. I think if you like Alien you must like this too.
I really don’t like the cap though 😅 it creeps me out and I can’t explain why 😂 the bottle looks actually better without it.

Btw, I’m starting to think that this might suit my boyfriend better than me 🤔
This smells just like the bottle looks; big, plump plastic plum. Just Perfect!

Idk .. its not bad but its not wow ..if u want spend ur money go ahead..weird smell ..so different reminds me of Miss Dior Absolutely Blooming..the peony.. You should try it b4 u buy it ..lm little mad and disappointed

Such of beautiful perfume. Nice juicy plum, i love it.
Very beautiful bottle too.

This perfume is a gift from my husband and he absolutely loves it.. so unfortunately I can’t throw it away
It’s not a bad scent whatsoever but I would never have purchased it myself.. it’s a little bit heavy and causes me headache and smells somewhat synthetic.. the drydown is much better than the opening (fruity powdery vanilla) but still not my favorite.. but to be honest the sillage is amazing it lasts a really long time up to two days on the clothes

Kenzo World Intense is just like her name, intense. And she is divine. I blind bought this and fell in love with the first spray. Gorgeous.

This is a perfume I would wanna wear to cheer my self up (in these gloomy quarantine days). The scent is sweet, bright, and unique. Love the silage, love to smell this scent on me, but I wouldn't wanna wear it just anywhere outside. It's kinda night occasion perfume to me.

Tbh I don't expect much from woman's perfume line because I don't really like floral and fruity, mostly I tried men's and I do often prefer theirs (like, I love Versace Eros), this one though, is an exception.

Maybe because I like bold scent. And this is bold. This is my signature. Would totally repurchase once I run out. This is a must-have perfume for me.

Sometimes I look back at the Kenzo World range and think:

- Kurkdijan is overrated.
- The marketing for this range is more intriguing and memorable than the scents themselves.

Not that they are bad fragrances, nor do they smell cheap like Victoria's Secret body sprays. I have to give Kenzo credit for that.

This is just a super syrupy plum. Peformance is alright, very acceptable for eau de parfum. I can't really smell the floral notes on my skin.
It is definitely not worth the price or the marketing.

It's basically a less sophisticated version of Marc Jacob's Decadence EDP. They tried to make the original Kenzo World more cold-weather oriented...but went with questionable scent choices.

Verdict: Definitely try before you buy. Purchase during mega-sales because then it is kind of worth i(?).
I must be regret to buy this parfume, it makes me sick, the smell is too wierd. Sorry too say I hate this parfume.

~Peach nectar, a heart of plum and a warm vanilla base~
I never have much luck with making Fragrantica's smell-a-likes function work, which is a shame because I value comparisons. Having owned both perfumes I can tell you this smells a lot like the much more niche and highly revered (especially in the mid-noughties on MakeUpAlley) Frapin 1270. It's the plum - it's almost identical, and the main feature of both fragrances.
I think Kenzo World Intense can somehow work as a beachy fragrance as well as a winter warmer. Very versatile. A bit of a sneeze inducer at first spray, but very enjoyable, attractive and plummy. The vanilla is warm, there's a sexy, musky sweetness, and enough of a pop of vinyl for it to feel modern. I also happen to love the bottle. It feels great in the hand and when the eye bounces against the glass of the bottle it tinkles.

On my skin, World & World intense are almost the same. I can’t tell the difference. At the same time, it’s almost the same scent as Gucci rush, but at the fraction of price (testers of world can be found online very cheap).
The bottle is ugly, really ugly, but at the right price, I might buy it for the pleasant smell.

Oh, gorgeous weirdo on my skin. It's not alike of any in my perfume collection. I have some plums in it but none is floral- peony blended.
I love it from my first testing till now when I've got a decant in perfume swap. On my skin is fruity peony with vanilla undertones which evolves musky on my skin- am I the only one? It must be jasmin. When I dislike the first K. World is this pure love. But I understand this one never could be a crowd pleaser, it's so different to other fragrances.
It has a good sillage and longevity on me.
Another Kurkdijan masterpiece.
When I use up large decant I'll decide if buy a bottle.
Edit 10.6.2020: Still like it but what is bad: I can catch sometimes smell of rotten beer in warmer weather.
Can anyone tell me if the cap is supposed to be rubberized like the original, or plastic. Mine is plastic.
I tried a tester and I really like it, sort of oriental fruity perfume with a base of vanilla. Just wish it had a heavier sillage on me.
Not catchy plum.

Gorgeous sweet plum opening. Unfortunately, the sweetness disappears too fast (within 5 mn) to leave only a soft fruity/vanillic dry down. Nothing "intense" here. If only the sweetness and strong plum could stay on longer!!! That would be a big LOVE.... NB: "Love" for the juice, not for the ugly bottle...
Smells like juicy fruit gum.
I dont hate this one nearly as much as the original but its still a dislike for me. Granted it does have a Christmas vibe to it

I agree. Anyone who has lost Gucci Rush may find in Kenzo World Intense a vibe of it.
The EDT is more in my style. However I can't not appreciate this plummy version.

I am very surprised that this one is actually good. I didn't like the original or the EDT.
This is far better than these two. The opening notes are not my taste, too strong and sweet, even masculine in a way. But it settles down into a floral fruity scent, that has a nice sparkling peony note. Nice and fresh peony really shines through in this fragrance.
So I think it's an interesting and good scent.

I am a perfume collector that somehow doesn't have anything from Kenzo in my collection. I first ordered the EDT of Kenzo world because of the horrible reviews on this site for this fragrance and the Kenzo World EDP. The EDT was lovely so I progressed to this one. The plum is to DIE for.

this smells very strong to me which is what I wanted and honestly I smell Plum and peony on my skin. those are actually both of my two favorite notes. I'm in love with this fragrance. It'll never become my signature and take the place of Chloe EDP but this is certainly something that I gravitate towards at least once a week. There are so many horrible perfumes available to us that are truly awful and somehow have higher reviews than this one. This is modern fresh fruity and slightly Floral. To me it's a very energizing fragrance. It deserves a 5-star review. now that I have the other two I'm going for the original Kenzo EDP. I thought I would never buy that because the ratings were truly awful but then again so are the ratings for this. I just didn't know that my taste was so far off from everyone else but it is definitely worth the splurge

This perfume is very similar to Gucci Rush en X by Clive Christian to me. They seem to have very different notes but they smell very much alike, at least on my skin.
I like this one, longivity is great and the sillage also! If you are a fan of Gucci Rush, you must try this one for sure.
Plum is my favorite note! This a wonderful, whimsical fragrance that is worth trying!

This turns into a fruity mess on my skin. I get way too much plum, and the plum is not in balance with the other notes. The peony smells a little synthetic. I also smell something like metal? No this does not work for me.
Sillage and longevity are good.

This is funny! I like the plum and vanilla opening but then it turns sour and weird on my skin. I think I can blame the peony note. It's slightly warmer and sweeter than Kenzo World in my opinion. After one hour the sourness is gone and I like it again. This might be different on somebody else!

I really love the super sweet, ripe, juicy plum note in the opening of Kenzo World Intense! It combines with the peony and jasmine beautifully! I love intensely sweet perfumes, so I wish that sweetness lasted throughout the drydown, but it gets much more floral in the heart. Some of the sweetness returns in the base with the presence of the vanilla note, but it never becomes syrupy or sugary. Longevity is good on me, around 5 hours. This is beautiful, and different from other recent mainstream scents!

No offense to those who love this because I'm sure it smells lovely on you. On me, it smells very sticky and cloying. It made me feel sick, and so is my dad. It projects really loud on me. It is what I love about Kenzo perfumes. They all perform really well. I think it's perfect for people whose skin eats up perfumes. This would probably smell lovely to me if it is less loud and screeching. Because it is so strong it gives me impression of the plum being overripe.
It is sweeter and fruitier, and more Kenzo, than the original, but still I am very disappointed with perfume works by new Kenzo art directors ;o(

It is just coming out here in France..they had a tester and they were nice enough to let me try it!
Well, it is better than the first one in my opinion., it has a warmer vibe, and gets rather sweet in the base..it is more rounded and smoother too... it is kind of a vanillic oriental. Not heady but it has presence..I am not sure it is my cup of tea, but in winter it would certainly be pleasant to wear..I wasn't like impressed overly with it, it still has a bit of the original in it, but more likeable...if you didn't like the first one, you might enjoy this version..I am kind of liking it, nothing more..well done, but not a huge want for me !
UPDATE: I went again to try it, and my husband liked it, and I found it to smell great on my skin, so I bought it! It is a bit unusual, but the notes are so well blended in.,

I got a 50ml of this on ebay bnib with shipping for $56 I'm really glad I bought this. One of the best perfumes so far in 2017! This is better than the original, I feel like Kenzo World Intense was just done better. Slight sultry, love how the black plum, and vanilla mix, this is a great fall evening, and night perfume.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Electric Wave pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: I am a huge fan of the house of Kenzo and bought this online in 2020 for a good price having smelled it in duty free previously when it was first released. I love the bottle too. The smell is very interesting. A crisp yuzu/grapefruit/apple that goes to a woody dry down, the apple is very crisp and sharp. It kind of IS 'electric', and yet I am still not sure it beats the orignal L'Eau Par which I love. I see this is very rare now and I have used half my bottle which causes me conflict between being a collector and someone who enjoys using fragrances to wear them. If this was still in production the fact is I would probably not buy it again. REALLY nice, but not a classic for me. These flankers are released as if to be used in the heady summer of their relase year and then forgotten. Had I spent that summer of 2016 in endless Ibiza pool parties (I wish) I'd have blazed through this. Ah well...fragrance is a fantasy...fun at the time...and then often gone until another one comes along. UPDATE: As my bottle wears down to the bottom, I must say the drydown is kind of odd...almost like the opening apple accords have gone brown and sour. The mix of citrus and woods creates an odd smell. Not awful but...a bit strange. So in conculsion: Beautiful opening, odd drydown. 7/10.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Electric Wave pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: Unfortunately, very ordinary scent :-/

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Electric Wave pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: Smells different. Warm and nice. Need to check in spring or summer. During cold wintertime it's not interesting at all.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Electric Wave pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: This is not L'eau par Kenzo, this is L'eau Kenzo.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Electric Wave pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: I love the bottle and the packaging image. I'm going to buy this as soon as is out.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Electric Wave pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: A bit fresher (mintier) clone of Bleu de Chanel.
Smells like straight up vanilla on my skin. Relatively good longevity and projection.

This is beautiful and I regret not getting a backup when I still could! It’s really sexy and seductive. I really like the juicy sweet blackberry note in the opening, then turns sweet creamy with the jasmine and tuberose. I really love this on the slightly colder days and it’s pretty potent. It lasts pretty long, especially on fabric, which at least givers me extra time to enjoy this beauty. Oh how I wish they would bring this back 🙏🏽

I was looking for a kenzo perfume from nine years ago and when time had come to purchase one I spotted this one on the shelf and tried to smell it and actually I didn’t like it.
It smelled like a cough syrup to me, I got the essence of berry notes that was overwhelming like they added berry syrup or " flavoring agent " to the perfume.
do yourself a favor and layer this w caramel by demeter😍😍
All i smell is flowers. Am i the only one?!

Fruity white floral. Sugary warm vanilla base.
Only had it on ten minutes, and so far it does smell a bit ‘purple’ fruity, and floral, I can smell both the tuberose (a bit bubble gummy) and jasmine (a bit heady). It’s more floral than frutiy.

Edit: dries to a sugary warm vanilla, very nice, not synthetic, but definitely designer when compared to the rum present in modern day niche fragrances (ie no rum here!)

Edit: tried it again, and it’s now very, very, Berry. More tart berry than floral, and hardly any vanilla or caramel or anything other than a slight sweetness.

Blind Buy - This is fruity, sweet and pleasant but it’s nothing to write home about. That’s not to say I don’t like it, it’s just very simple and straightforward. Nothing magical or groundbreaking.

It starts off with a sharp, tart rush of blackberry but quickly mellows out to a sweet, deep berry. I don’t get a distinct caramel not so much as just an over all indiscernible sweetness. It’s nice though, and I enjoy it.

I think this would be best suited for colder months as the berry is quite deep, it doesn’t strike me as a fresh or summery scent at all.

I blind bought it on a sale. First impressions: it's kinda average, it starts sharp I smell the blackberry immediately, but in a few minutes it settles down to a really nice fragrance that is warm and less sharp ( I loved the sharpness tho). I would love it to stay that way, it's really interesting, but in an hour it starts to smell like vanilla (that is pretty average, not like the vanilla in Si intense the black bottle which was just gorgeous for instance) and that's the only thing I can smell. If there's vanilla in a scent pretty soon it overcomes everything else and you can only smell only the vanilla on me, it's like this with every fragrance. So I got a good first hour- it's a really nice sharp and warm at the same time scent, than it settles down to vanilla as a skin scent and I could smell it on my wrist in the morning as well. If it smelled like the first hour the entire time I would say it's an exceptional perfume, but it doesn't. I wouldn't buy this if it's not on sale, it's too expensive for a skin scent. If I can get a strong scent from a perfume for 6 hours at least I'm happy. I don't like very feminine scents, I like perfumes that stand out and have a good (strong) sillage. I'm an Euphoria fan and I'm very happy with it.
As a conclusion; I don't recommend buying this if it's not on sale, it's warm and nice, but a skin scent (unless you like it being this way) it's average, it kinda smell like many other perfumes. While it's still sharp and kinda sweet/warm (so the first hour) It reminds me a little bit of YSL Black Opium. I would say just buy Black Opium, or if you're a fan of Black Opium try this one as well, maybe you'll like it, but Black Opium has a better performance I think.

I just got a sample of this beautiful perfume, and so it is, very, very beautiful!!!

The berries are there, and the caramell and vanilla, and the drydown is so stunningly good, wow and wow!!!

I think this perfume is perfect for everybody who loves berries, caramell and vanilla, 10/10 :))

Mmmmm blackberry, like a nice sweet blackberry shampoo. It's not heavy and sacharin sweet like Misteriosa, more like Tresor Midnight Rose but change the raspberry to blackberry. A bit sour and tart, would be sparkling to wear in the morning. Reminds me of a doll from my childhood. 6.5/10

I bought this awhile ago and guess I didn't pay much attention when I received it. First, I like Kenzo scents. 2nd...MMMMMMM Purely by luck, one of my favorite perfumes is Givenchy Hot Couture and this smells exactly like the original version! Sweet with lots of berries, long lasting and just a scent you can keep smelling all day.

I also own Signorina Misteriosa and I don't find them similar, I like this one much better. This is a delicious date scent. He will inhale you all night!

This perfume came out the year that gourmands were all the rage, and it does feel a little imitative. It reminds me of Jimmy Choo, but over-done. It's sweet and powdery and comfortingly nice, but it's not unique. I'll wear this in the foody season around October/November, but then I put it away for winter in favor of more unique, sophisticated scents. Fine, but I won't buy another bottle.
Really nice and elegant, soft, feminine.. Better for the warmer months.because..its not too strong like the cousin flower l elixir :) i get the rum undertone.

I really like Kenzo Jeu d'Amour l'Elixir. I've wanted this one for a long time and I got a sample a week ago. I have to say it's very similar to Salvatore Ferragamo Signorina Misteriosa. Kenzo is better for me, less sweet, but deeper and stronger, juicier and fizzier. What's more, there are a lot of my favourite notes like carmel, blackberries, rum and juicy fruits. It's delicious scent.
this started out great-all fruity and boozy, but once the dry down hit-all i was left with was a sweet not special vanilla....
Overly sweet scent, vanillla and berry with a lot of caramel. That's it. I find it simple, really sweet without depth. Had a sample.

Amazing sweetly citrus berry boozy vanilla. I love this sort of scent - gourmands are on high rotation with me at the moment. Earthy smooth patchouli and sandalwood keeps this grounded and from being too girly and sweet. This is a high quality vanilla based fragrance with moderate projection and longevity. It's perfect for both evening and everyday wear, and the combo of fruit and vanilla means I can wear this year round.

I do think this is a little more feminine than most of my other gourmands, but it would work as a masculine fragrance as well. I don't get a lot of floral which is odd as I'm very sensitive to too much tuberose.

Overall - very well blended and balanced and a happy blind buy. If you like gourmands, you'll love this.

Jeu d’amore

Overall this is sweet, fruity edge, and must have the white florals and caramelly notes as support as it veers towards having a juicy edge rather than a vanillery edge.

It lasts reasonably well
This is a whole lot of tuberose and a sharp jasmine with a tiny bit of fruit and caramel. I don't find this scent gourmand. It's all about the white florals.

June7rose: depends on chemistry but on me this was pure caramel and blackberry underlined with vanilla. None of the other notes would step up on me. Actually very lovely fragrance. Definitely gourmand, not fruitchouli.

I sprayed it accidentally on my hand today, when i wanted to spray it on the test strip.
On me, it is a warm, rich and powdery caramel, with a intensive berry opening.
Not my thing, because i don't like caramel and i also don't like berries, but i have to say the caramel note is superbly done here. Caramel fans will surely love this fragrance. Berry fans will also like this, but keep in mind that the berry note here is intense but short lived.
I would recommend this scent to someone who is looking for a dark but warm fragrance, and to people who like powder.

Can a lady who has tried this tell me how strong the patchouli and tuberose are? It sounds like a winner to me but for those ingredients, which aren't my personal favorites. Love blackberry, vanilla, caramel, sugar, etc.

And when I thought Kenzo can't really make gourmands, here comes this fragrance.

Opening with dark and prominet blackberry followed by very present caramel.

The drydown doesn't change it much if you ask me. I get some vanilla, unfortunately I can't detect rum, and some floral notes in the background, I wish jasmine would be more prominent here.

Sweet, warm, comforting. It's not like I would get a bottle myself, but I have to pay Kenzo some respect for this one.

To me solid 7/10.
So exciting blackberry beginning. And then oranges and caramel stays. And acually the base doesn't smell nice.

I love Jeu d'Amour as a fresh floral daytime scent, I like Kenzo in general so I was very curious for the Jeu d'Amour flankers.

L'Elixir starts with a super strong raspberry/strawberry and vanilla combination. It's funny, the Félin flanker has a strawberry note but smells more like blackberry to me, and this has a blackberry note and smells like strawberry. It's extremely sweet.
The tuberose that is in all Jeu d'Amour scents joins the fruity notes, at this phase it's a bit similar to the original Jeu.
Now I notice a difference depending on the weather. As I tested it in warm weather on the inside of my elbow, it got really weird. It smelled like caramel, but also like monoi oil and a bit fruity. Very heady and like a crude mixture and somehow also like a shower gel.
I later tested it again on my arm in cooler temperatures and now it dried down to a sweeter Jeu d'Amour with a strong berry and a slight boozy note.

Overall I'm not impressed. The cool skin version is okay, not great but not bad, the warm skin version is just uuuugh. Might be better on different people, of course, but try with caution.
The original Jeu d'Amour EDP is still the best scent from this line.

The opening of this reminds me of Escada's Magnetism. Tart berries mixed with something green, patchouli in this case. Whereas Magnetism had patch, basil, cassis and green leaves. I do pick up on a hint of citrus and florals. Sweet and tart without being cloying/candy-like.

Pleasant, but nothing ground-breaking. Having owned Magnetism for several years I think I've done by dash in this department.

Tried now, winter

Similar to
Black opium by YSL
Jeu d'armour elixir by kenzo, but this flower is louder. The FLOWER elixir in red bottle I mean.
I am juicy by juicy couture
Paco rabanne xs - but paco I get a soft sugar bomb, and that is supposed to have cocoa etc

This is quieter than the others I've listed. It's got s delicious juicy opening, the accords look right, it's like a direct relative of those other sweet, juicy, vanillary ones. All fab, but you don't really need them all.

This is a big hitter, I tried it on a card, and it's big, warm, sweet, floral.

Black opium
Paco rabanne xs (in scent only)
YSL manifesto

You know where I'm going. Those sort etc

No comment on strength or sillage

First thought: very strong and sweet. Now the tiny spray has been on my arm for about ten minutes and it smells like berries and chocolate. Sweet but not exactly in a sweet way... a bit in an aggressive way, like cherry bonbons which turn out to be more alcoholic than expected. Yet, I only smell it when I sniff my arm. I would say moderate sillage, though very strong already in a tiny amount. Not for me, doesn't go with my body chemistry: too sharp-sweet and not warm and comforting, which I usually like.

It smells great.I agree smell like bottle's color.very dark purple.because biggest thing I can smell is black berry.smells like a dessert if blackberry jam and cream with a glass of expensive sweet wine in a very fancy restaurant that the gentleman who loves you take you there for night and acts with you like you are a queen.this is perfume of a sexy queen not a princess girl.I can smell blackberry jam,syrupy and a little tart but more sweet and dark purple,very small shot of wine in the beginning.then tuberose and Jasmine that are like white cream mix with blackberry syrup and very small amount of patchouli.I agree this is very sexy and very fancy and feminine.it's very sweet in beginning but them sweetness is less intense and less sharp.I can't smell any orange or vanilla.longevity is very good but I have a sillage problem.when I smell the place of my body that I sprayed this I see that it's still very strong.but when I'm out I can't smell it around me.but actually my friends say after you go out of a room we can smell it for long time.so maybe it's sillage is good too.it's a warm perfume not good for summer
9/10
موافقم عطری هست که به رنگ شیشه ان هست.بنفش پررنگ چون بیشترین چیزی که می شود حس کرد بلک بری هست.مثل دسری هست از مارمالاد بلک بری و خامه و یک گیلاس شراب گرون قیمت تو یه رستوران فنسی با جنتلمتی که شما رو شب بذده انجا و نثل یه ملکه باهاتون رفتار میکنه.این عطر هم برای یک ملکه سکسی هست نه یک شازده خانوم کوچولو.اولش بوی ترش و شیرین مارمالاد بلک بری و یه شات کوچیک شراب را میشه حس کرد اما بعد یاس و مریم بویی شبیه خامه سفید ایجاد می کنن و شدت شیرینی عطر کمتر میشه بعد هم مقدار کمی نعنای هندی.من هیچ پرتقال یا وانیلی حس نمی کنم.این عطر خیلی خیلی خوشبو و جذاب هست.ماندگاری خیلی خوبی هم دارد اما مشکل پخش دارد.هرموقع جایی که عطر زدم را بو می کنم می بینم هنوز بویی کاملا قوی و مشخص دارد ولی وقتی بیرون هستم اصلا حس نمی کنم بوی عطر از من برخاسته.ولی دوستانم میگن که حتی وقتی از جایی بیرون میری تا مدتعا رد عطرت پیداست پخش شاید پخشش هم کم نباشه.این عطر گرم و شیرین هست و اصلا مناسب تابستان نیست
۹/۱۰

It's the first time I'm trying it on my skin and I find it sweet,delightful,luxurious,classy,seductive,charming and feminine in a mature way
If you're not into sweet scents it's not for you.it opens sweet with fruit notes/black berry and becomes even more syrupy sweet as it dries down thanks to the boozy vanilla and caramel.but there's enough florals to give it a mature,ladylike vibe and a hint of patchouli,sandalwood and rum to give it depth
It's not a childish candy but a sensual delicious confection
I can't compare it with original jeu d'amour because I've just tried that one on paper but elixir version seems to be less floral, warmer,sweeter,a tad darker and all in all more likable for me,so I chose it over original and I think I'm gonna use it alot in these fall and winter nights
It's an hour I've applied it and it's just as strong as first minute.it seems to have a good sillage(which is more important for me than Longevity) I really like this one
Edit:
After a couple of full wears I can say that I'm very glad with my purchase,not anything ground breaking but still it's delicious,sexy and classy. and I may repurchase it whenever my 50 mil tester bottle finishes.it's rich,seductive and delicious.I'm loving this lovely combination of black berry,caramel, tuberose and boozy vanilla, so deep and sweet and stays easily on my skin for +8 hours with a good projection.it smells just like the color of bottle
If you're a gourmand lover and you're +25 give it a try
P.s:I agree about similarities with signorina misteriosa but this one has more syrupy/caramelized sweetness and is a tad richer,all in all I prefer Kenzo but I may consider buying ferragamo instead of repurchasing kenzo just to experience a new one
It also reminds me of Loewe Quizas Seduction which I love but that one is a lot more floral/tuberose dominant
❤❤❤❤
از اونجا ک کنزو ژوغ د امور رو فقط روی بلاتر تست کردم نمیتونم مقایسه دقیقی بین اون و ورژن الکسیر انجام بدم فقط چیزی ک من بطور کلی حس کردم این بود ک الکسیر کمتر گلی هست همینطور گرمتر،شیرین،کمی تیره تر و درکل برای من دوست داشتنی تر و درضمن بیشتر مناسب فصل سرماست، بهمین خاطر بین این دوتا ژوغ د امور الکسیر رو درحال حاضر انتخاب کردم(هرچند هنوز چشمم دنبال ژوغ د امور اولیه هم هست)
کنزو ژوغ د امور الکسیر یه عطر گرم و شیرینه پس اگه دوستدار عطرهای شیرین نیستید بعیده بپسندینش.. شروع عطر با رایحه شیرین و غلیظ توت سیاه همراهه ک رایحه غالب عطر هست و تا آخر عمر عطر حضور داره، این عطر به تدریج با حضور کارامل و وانیل آغشته به رام،شیرینتر هم میشه منتها به لطف مریم ک بعنوان امضای ژوغ د امور تو قلب عطر حضور داره،رایحه خانومانه ای به خودش میگیره..پچولی و صندل و رام(عرق نیشکر)تو بیس عطر فقط نقش عمیقتر و غنی تر کردن عطر رو بعهده دارن وگرنه بازیگر اصلی رو پوست من شراب توت سیاه هست با شیرینی غلیظ و شربت مانند کارامل و مقدار خیلی ناچیزی روایح خامه ای و نرم گلی و چوبی..رایحه کاملا خوشمزه ای داره ک به هیچ وجه بچگونه نیست.کاملا شیک و زنانه و جذابه و اگه دوستدار عطرهای خوشمزه هستید و بالای 25 سال دارید و دنبال یه گزینه بالغ،ژوغ د امور الکسیر انتخاب خوبی میتونه باشه
موندگاری بالای 8 ساعت و پخش خوبی داره و بعنوان عطر مجلسی و قرارهای عصرانه و شبانه عالیه
راجع ب شباهتش ب سینیورینا میستریوزا هم موافقم ولی شیرینی کنزو چسبناکتر و کاراملی تر هست و درمجموع من این عطر کنزو رو به همتای فراگاموی خودش ترجیح میدم
درمجموع بااینکه عطر خاصی نیست خیلی دوسش دارم

The opening is a delightful caramellic, floral-fruity scent which wowed me. However, the pungent tuberose appeared after a while and ruined my joy. It became sharper and sharper till the scent almost became a semi-sweet floral on me.
If you're planning to buy this, give it some time on your skin to make sure this doesn't happen to you.
As for the sillage and longevity, I would say they're both poor on me, I'm afraid.

This is an evening perfume, a bit too heavy for the day.
It is very warm and sweet to me. I do smell plenty of patchouli and vanilla and something fruity, but I can't define this fruity as a blackberry, to me it is more like orange...

Wow, this is a beautiful scent. Soft, warm, sweet and floral, well composed.
Reminds me of homemade berry jam. I can sense blackberry, vanilla and floral notes like tuberose that gives a good balance to the sweet notes.
I have liked everything Amour by Kenzo so far and this is not an exception.
This is really sweet, seductive, sexy scent, a love potion, just as advertised.
Natural smelling, even in it's sweetness.

What a sexy, deep, night perfume! I like this one so much, it smells very provocative and womanly. It's heavy on tuberose and gourmie notes. Sillage and longevity are great. The color of the bottle is hypnotic. This perfume is a proof that tuberose can be sexy.

In love with this , it's a sweet warm vanilla blackberry scent , tuberose does smell quite nice in here and dominant and I don't mind it at all. Caramel , rum and mandarine is also detectable and it all goes so well together that I can't get enough of it. It manages to smell fresh ! Sweet fresh ! The patchouli is there but stubble , just enough to keep it earthy and grounded. Complete winner ! I bought this on my trip to Aruba and I can't find it here in Canada yet. I hope it gets here soon as I am half way done my bottle !
My husband loves it , he says it reminds him of poison. In fact he thought I was wearing poison when I wear this. This is definitely the same family and similar notes as poison but it's more modern and fresher with no incense. I prefer it to poison !

It's similar to Signorina Misteriosa, possibly because of blackberry, tuberose, vanilla and patchouli all together. It's nice, I like it, but something bothers me a bit, I guess it's like usual - tuberose.

This is one of the most bizarre perfumes I've ever tried. I had a few spritzes on my arm and thought that it took a really long time for the alcohol to evaporate. After half an hour, I could only detect a super faint floral blackberry, with a bit of very soft vanilla lingering through and then it completely dissapeared on me after the two hour mark. I had another spritz on the back of my hand where it seemed to last a bit longer, but the sillage stayed very very soft. For some uncomprehensible reason, my nose seems incapable of detecting this scent. I find that it stays quite sharp and boozy, maybe because of the rum notes?

Not sold on this one, I much prefer the original Jeu d'Amour. The fact that they named this one elixir confuses me, because the original has a lot more intensity and a stronger sillage.
Another perfume to look for next time I go to Mueller or Douglas :)
I blind buyed this and dont regret, lots of rum with patchouli an tuberouse. Georgeous and delicious
This fragrance confuses me. I usually LOVE sweet-spicy scents, but I can't decide between chai latte and Indian curry. I kind of like it, but it also smells a bit strange. Very good longevity tho

Cardamon is the star of the show here and blends beautifully with the vanilla and spices; this has a chai gourmand, addictive quality. Smooth as velvet, on me this is a scent with strong silage that still feels light - an unusual winter or autumn special perfume that doesn't smell like anything else I know. My daughter picks up a waxy, candle like scent that is cozy and comforting but with quite a distinctive character.

La fragranza nella versione anni 96 si apre con un soffio di canfora fredda e pungente,spezie esotiche di cardamomo e varie che rotolano su un cuore denso e cremoso di elitropina,gardenie e patchouli caldo.
Al primo impatto si presentano tutte assieme come un preludio di quello che sarà.
Pian piano si sviluppa il bouquet avvolgente,solare,voluttuoso,fatto di contrasti amari e dolci.
Il suo mese migliore è dicembre,l'atmosfera natalizia,il freddo fuori e le luci colorate trovano il migliore momento per questo profumo.
Mi suona strano che ancora oggi si parli di prestazioni "bestia" di questo profumo dal momento che oggi sono tutti intrugli chimici che puzzano a kilomettri di distanza, (gli oudh e la vie est belle regnano sovrani),questo ha una normale potenza,sviluppa in modo abbastanza intenso ma niente di tragico. Si sente per molto tempo la scia di eliotropio,vaniglia e cashmeran. Ma per me resta un buon profumo.

This is a spicy but sweet perfume which is perfect for winter weather. The opening has bitter cloves and cumin in the top notes but as it settles it becomes sweeter softer and the florals become more noticeable. It is essentially a vanilla and amber fragrance with lovely aspects of fragrant spices; the cardamon is especially lovely. The performance is good but it is certainly not room filling like the reviews would have you believe. The bottle is the clunkiest and most uncomfortable bottle to hold ever, and the cap weighs a ton and is difficult to remove. It is easy to find in discount stores at a good price and is well worth the money.
Ooh. I think I may have to have a little lay down to recover from how fabulous this is. Ooh! Ooh!

I have been obsessing over this for over a year even thinking of blind buying it. I finally tested it in store and it was an experience for sure... When I first sprayed it I loved it! It smelled modern and intricate. Spicy and woody, a bit sweet a bit bitter and at the same time complex and playful. However as it developed on my skin it turned sweeter and more feminine and it also started reminding me of something... it smells exactly like my 60 year old aunt and must be her signature perfume I'm planning to ask her. I like my aunt a lot and she's a kind, lovely and beautiful woman but for some reason this association puts me off for some reason. But the worst thing for me is how sweet and feminine it got. On the small paper it still has the same character it had on the first spray. Needless to say I'm very disappointed... I really wanted this to work for me. My advice is to test it in store and leave it on for as many hours as possible before you make up your mind.

Considering repurchasing a bottle this winter, for nostalgia. This was my first big girl (or so I thought) perfume, I managed to snag it from my mom before leaving home for university. It made me feel all grown up, and put together and most importantly, strong. God, I was anxious studying in a country where I barely understood the language but this was my magic cloak every morning.

Thinking back I realize, this perfume taught me three things. I remember a colleague in a class sat next to me and yelled in agony: Omg, is that Kenzo Jungle?! You bet it is. So, I learned quickly, I absolutely do not care what people think! I like it, I wear it with pleasure. Second, it taught me everything, even good things, are best in moderation. :) And third, god how I LOVE spicy perfumes.

And the bottle is an absolute icon!!!
A waste of money, washed it off rightaway☠️☠️☠️ horrible smells like a very dusty full of spiders old basement🤢🤢🤢

Theres some note I’m not quite on board with with this one. I like 90% of this fragrance but that 10% just smells off and not in a way I can readily describe. Might be the cumin. Im hoping it will chill out. I’ll come back and edit this if the dry down gets any better.

Its chilled out into something thats more tolerable. Not as Indian food. I love Indian food but I don’t want to wear it as a scent. Now it’s just dry spices. That first twenty minutes was something to get through though. Will just have to note if I want to wear this to put it on at least a half hour before I leave.

Spices, spices and spices. Imagine smelling Christmas spices, but without the sweetness, just the spices.
Just take your spices out, take the clove, the cardamom, the cinnamon, the cumin and a tad bit of vanilla, mix them together and you'll have what this perfume is.
There are some florals in the beginning, too...which make this perfume smell a little outdated and old fashioned first (a la Aromatic Elixir or Youth Dew), but thankfully they actually disappear quite quickly and that old fashioned spicy floral becomes nothing but Christmas spices. So spicy that it hurts my nose a little whenever I smell it (I don't mean that in a negative way...it's just very powerful).

I find that it smells better an arm length away from your face. So don't spray it next to your face. As if you spray it around an arm length away from you then you can get occasional lovely whiffs of Christmas spices coming towards your way from time to time. I can imagine the same lovely effect happening when someone who wears Jungle Elephant walks past someone and that someone gets that lovely whiff of Christmas spices.

However from close up it's just a little too much. Just the same way as it would be too much to have your nose permanently in the spice container. It would just be too much.

So basically what I'm trying to say: This is not a skin scent. This is a scent which is made for projecting and filling out a room. So too close, when it is at its essence, it's simply too strong and burning, but it's amazing when it gets the chance to project and float around the air.
Probably best worn around the lower torso rather than upper torso, then one can enjoy it more.

I haven't tried layering it yet, but it should be amazing for layering as it's pure spices. It's like spicing up your other perfumes, make them more Christmas.

Not bad, super interesting.

I don't think that it smells like rice pudding or chai as it's not sweet enough for it. But it does smell like the spices you can put into a rice pudding or chai.

As it is so strong, the older it gets the better it smells...meaning that it will last you for several hours and each hour it will smell better and better.

Very fascinating scent. Not for the faint hearted, but super interesting and enjoyable.

i’m marrying this perfume y’all

to tell u i was so scared at first bc everyone went batsh8t crazy with the reviews saying “indian spice market, STRONG SILLAGE, BEAST PROJECTION, SPICY, SCARY, witchy” and all. Ofc with reviews like that, you’ll think you’ll smell like a spicy lunch but babes, no, I’m grateful that despite the “spicy” comments some people said chai latte (my favorite drink), pumpkin spice, carrot cake, candles, and cookies—which gave me a spark of hope that maybe this beast is just a gentle giant.

god where do i even begin bc i’m sniffing my wrists every second. I love you l’elephant.

OKKKAYYYYYYYYY

it’s crazy how I smelled this from the package when it came (kinda pissed that i got spoiled for that surprise umph)

L’elephant is everything I wish for in a spiced gourmand fragrance, it filled that void I’ve been longing for which khamrah never gave, teriaq just left me disappointed with a chicken fried rice accord, nomade naturelle was a tad bit too fruity with a disappointing longevity, and lalique le parfum was more spiced cola than spiced vanilla. To put it simply, I’ve been on the hunt for a perfect sweet-spiced vanilla and the search is over !!

I was a bit hesistant of L’elephant at first bc of the mango note bc BABES I DON’T ENJOY FRUITY NOTESSSSS 😭 BUT NOOOO MANGO WAS NON-EXISTENT, MANGO WAS NOWHERE TO BE FOUND. THANK GOODNESS. It’s also probably bc it’s extremely macerated like it should be lightly golden but mine came in DARK BROWN VANILLA ESSENCE SHADE 🪵 like a richly macerated kayali vanilla 28

L’elephant starts off with the sweet and slightly mentholated aroma of cinnamon sweets that instantly reminded me of cinnamon gum, omg GUMDROPSSSS!!! and crushed hot tamales candy, after which, it quickly develops into a sweet, Sweet, SWEEET, ambery, caramelized cinnamon-sugar and cardamom dessert or basically any spicy-sweet food and drinks.

I’m talking: eggnog, chai, pumpkin spice, carrot cake, horchata, gingersnaps, snickerdoodle, gingerbread, banana bread, pecan pie, fruit cake with dates, and other more lovely, festive, homey, comforting and autumn + winter desserts.

There’s also this lovely, thick, and honey-like aroma in the mid dry-down, quite waxy and balmy, which adds more to that warm-hug-like comforting feeling.

Lastly, the dry-down ties it all up to perfection. Once you’ve indulged all the spiced desserts you can think of, l’elephant washes it all down with a cup of milk and slightly woody licorice.

I totally get why people call it a beast because it indeed has a beast performance, but scent-wise? It’s a tamed beast, it’s not as scary as how people are making it look like.

TOTALLY NOT OLD-FASHIONED OR RETRO DESPITE IT BEING A FRAGRANCE FROM THE 90s. It’s a lovely spiced gourmand that’s impossible to dislike, otherwise it would be denial, if not, you lack appreciation. (jk ur preference is urs whatever i’m just biased LMAO)

I know people would totally hate scents like this at specific time, occasions, and seasons but I AM SO READY TO BE OBNOXIOUS AND WEAR THIS IN MY DAILY ROTATION.

because who wouldn’t wanna feel like a little gingerbread princess wearing a spicy gumdrop scented perfume !! 🍪

It needs more love and appreciation, this is a misunderstood beast. And I mean by VERY misunderstood. PLEASE STOP SAYING L’ELEPHANT IS SCARY BC SHE IS LOVELY 😡

GOURMAND LOVERS BETTER GET THIS BC PEOPLE PROBABLY SAY IT’S SCARY TO GATEKEEP IT FROM YALL. I REPEAT, GOURMAND LOVERS BETTER GET THIS !!

This is worth every penny! There are more expensive perfumes out there that are nowhere near as original and strong as this one! So far, I have 3 of Kenzo's masterpieces - this beauty, "World Power" and "Ikebana Indigo". I may be a fan already. They have some of the best bottles in my opinion.

Even without the cap (mine is a tester), the bottle is pretty. A little difficult to hold, but I love the curved shape. The scent inside, however, is the real star. Milky spice cabinet it is. It slightly reminds me of Omnia by Bvlgari (the 2003 release in the auburn bottle). The latter is a spicy nutty tea while the former is a spicy milk. The clove note is super strong and, to my surprise, I really like it. The cumin, cardamom and whatever else is inside provide more spiciness. The vanilla and ylang-ylang make the fragrance wearable by creating a creamy base for the spices. There is a subtle touch of patchouli in there as well. Much like Omnia, it has unisex potential. Not a typically feminine scent. Guys should also treat themselves to a bottle of this gorgeous perfume if they are into this scent category. It performs like a beast. 2 sprays on my nape and 2 on my chest give me more than 7 hours of decent sillage. I have more expensive bottles that cannot even touch this performance. The scent can survive a washing machine and is almost difficult to wash off your body. Be careful when applying it! Other than that, "Jungle l'elephant" is an impressive spicy perfume. It is ideal for autumn and winter, and not that expensive for its high quality! I love the cozy feeling it gives me.
Go for the bottle with the very gold metal cap vs the one with the more silver cap. The difference in strength is tremendous. The reformulation here is absolutely pitiful.

Man oh man! So when I got this about a year ago, I really liked it but was NOT all that Impressed with the longevity/performance. Well I must say that the "Maturation Process" has struck again! Whereas initially I was having to spray about 6 times to get good performance, now after that year of "Maturation" has made L'Elephant much more potent and nuanced. Now I cant do more that 2 spritzes on my shirt and 2 on my neck and thats probably too much!

Now, it probably did t take a whole year for this scent to reach it's peak performance, but it being as hot in Florida as it is, I'd stored it away and finally pulled it back out after about 7 or 8 months of not wearing it (Since January 2025) so it probably reached it peak performance before wearing it again yesterday and today.


Also, YES! Im sure this fragrance has been reformulated and is a bit weaker than it was initially, buuuuut it is STIL ehat if consider a "Beastmode fragrance" and well worth the purchase ESPECIALLY if ya have patience and let this thing Maturate. Its super beautiful, unisex and so much better than Spice Bomb or Spice Bomb Extreme in my book! I compare these bc imo the spices wear a bit similar, except that L'Elephant had Mango and is just PHENOMENAL! A 9 outta 10 spicey BEAUTY!

This fragrance was recommended to me online based on other scents I love. I was especially drawn to the name and bottle design as elephants are my "spirit animal." I hastily and blindly bought a full bottle. Unfortunately, this was an instant scrubber for me. On my skin, it takes on a nauseating, dirty animal, rotting hay, zoo vibe that is both overtly masculine and offensive. It's so pungent and musty that I scrubbed numerous times. It's as if they captured the aroma of an overly frequented elephant bathroom in the jungle. I keep the bottle in my guest powder room with my other elephant themed decorations. I would never wear this.

FULL BOTTLE WORTHY. My first blind-buy purchase of this perfume was a very adorable mini. Admittedly, due in part to the bottle (read: cap). But after one wear I knew I wanted a full bottle. In the biggest size. It’s right up my alley. Brings one of my favorites to mind: JHAG Moon Dance. The two aren’t entirely the same; I’d say if Moon Dance was sourdough bread, Jungle could be its starter mix. Jungle is somewhat floral seeming, just not a high-octane floral like Moon Dance is. Jungle is fruitier, more exotic. They’re similarly vintage-chypre - which is like catnip to me. Jungle is a bold, sumptuous, intoxicating, warm, sweet, spicy-vanilla. Enormous, heavenly spices. A hint tropical. Masterfully balanced, beautifully blended. An incensey cashmeran drydown. BEST drydown of them all. It’s exceptional! A multi-faceted, everlasting, beastmode gem. MASTERPIECE

The opening was a bit scary, but let 40 minutes pass and now I see why people like it. It's definitely unique and one of those perfumes that sends a message, so your personality must be a fit to make it work. It's super strong, too!

It smells like a mix of teas, or a Christmas candle (I can't believe cinnamon isn't listed!), like someone else mentioned. Or perhaps a type of spicy candy? However, it is a not juvenile sweetness at all. In fact, I picture a 30+ y.o. elegant woman rocking this, one who wears colorful clothes & bold accesories, who is not afraid to stand out.

Very realistic and natural smelling - the opening is an overpowering, photorealistic clove. If you don’t love cloves, this is NOT for you.

I bet the drydown is what makes so many people love this scent, though. The cloves are still there, but the vanilla and amber along with some floral notes peek through. The amber is not like a modern screechy amber, it is more of a smooth and waxy amber. I think it is absolutely gorgeous, but I don't know if I would wear this often enough to justify a full bottle.

Cardamom up top reminds me of when my husband makes korma. Segway (mmm don't fall off) to Christmas candle/spicy chai/mulled wine in the best way possible. I love this during the autumn and winter. It is bold and I can't think of anything else comparable. Skin is horribly sensitive to it but I live with it by not wearing it on consecutive days.
Dominic created this fragrance whe he was working at Lautier / Florasynth , good Memories

I can’t believe people are still commenting on this! I was around 17 or 18 when I wore Kenzo Jungle L’Elephant. For my age at the time, it felt daring—bold, dynamic, fast in character. The woody notes wrapped in warm spices gave it such presence: strong, full of life, but never heavy. It was like carrying an invisible fire that made you stand out. With this fragrance, I could be a city girl suddenly finding herself in the suburbs, where others found me mysterious—almost like I had come from another planet.

I finally had the chance to try this one. After spraying it on my wrist, I felt nauseous and immediately washed it off. Unfortunately, the scent still lingers. It is definitely the heaviest fragrance I’ve ever smelled. The sillage and longevity are unbelievable, but I just don’t understand why anyone would want to smell like Christmas candles.
Smells like potpourri

A love, will always be in my top 10 for creative genius, alone. There is something intriguing and addictive about Kenzo L’Elephant. There’s simply no fragrance quite like it. Powerful yet gentle, multifaceted, contradictory yet integrated and rich.

Firstly, there are perfectly measured spices with anise - blending and transitioning with/into creamy gardenia, heliotrope with what my nose detects as a dirty, raw ylang-ylang combining with green mango. All this on a bed of barely gourmand vanilla, masterfully balanced with amber and what I smell, as a slightly metallic, damp earthy note (must be the patchouli).

L’Elephant is more than a soothing, spiced pudding fragrance though. More a whole escapade and journey. She is coarse and rough around the edges, without being disjointed or vulgar. Taking you through winding, rugged terrain with dry, dusty clouds of dirt, interspersed with damp earth and fallen banana leaves afoot.

The journey is impressively smooth, given the environment she’s treading in. Flexing her incredible strength and gentle, stoic nature.
A perfume balancing her yin-yang feminine and masculine energies with effortless grace and dexterity. She could be perceived as androgynous to some. She refuses to conform to restricting labels that don’t define her. Bold, intuitive and unapologetic for who she is.
She gets that some don’t get her and remains totally unbothered by anyone’s opinion. She quietly considers she was born ahead of her time and that, well after all the seasonal changes, she’ll still remain valid, enduring and talked about. A masterpiece.

2 sprays is all the wearer needs to get fair demonstration of her endurance and enveloping sillage, as the journey weaves on. Vintage lasts til the next day, albeit as a skin scent on me. Latest formulation has been reigned in considerably but still gorgeous to wear.
I also love to wear a dupe perfume oil of this with a touch of Dior Addict. L’Elephant’s spices adds another facet and the vanilla in both beast-mode faves, marries harmoniously. I hope this iconic perfume is never discontinued like Tiger was. My Mum used to wear this, then I began wearing since late 90’s and my daughter also loves this scent. That’s 3 generations already💕

I bought this fragrance some years ago thinking that there were so many positive reviews given by about Kenzo Jungle L'Elephant. When I received it in the mail, I was excited to try it. I was surprised by what I smelled emanating from my wrist. All I could think of was that this fragrance reminds me of, Rice Pudding. I love rice pudding, but, I don't want to smell like it. So it has been sitting in my armoire untouched for years. I wanted to like it but, I can't.

This smells EXACTLY like a Christmas candle. Where you normally get a blast of alcohol in that initial 3 seconds when you smell a perfume-this is replaced by a sour/balsamic tinge. Once that brief moment is up, you get all the spices, very sweet and festive. I'm not sure I get the mango, but there is so much going on in here, its hard to focus lol. Overall I like it. Debating on getting a full bottle as I only see myself wearing this around the holidays. Great Performace! Can def pass for a later fall scent.

One of the first scents in my fragrance journey that made me go wow!

A single spray evelopes you in a heavy and rich cloud which lifts you up into a higher sunny golden realm. Certainly requires the right personality to love this. The sillage is enormous, the scent is thick. If you can't take it you'll want to try and hide yourself in the room.

The scent transforms over time into something a lite bit less spicy. It gets too round for my liking, settling into vanilla and amber. At this point I'm missing something to provide more contrast.

Overall a 9/10 fragrance
It’s now winter in where I leave and the cold blowing wind makes me crave for this so much. I wish I still had a bottle.

We have been dealing with home renovations here and I was feeling sorry for myself because of the disruptions to my routine, so I splurged on Kenzo Jungle Elephant. It arrived yesterday and I just spritzed some on, un-showered, still in pajamas.

I am Elephant! Hear me roar! This fragrance is me. It might be more me than I have ever been. On first sniff, Kenzo is spicy and there is a bite of patchouli. The patchouli seems to burn off within the first 30 minutes or so. I smell cinnamon, clove, vanilla and amber. There is an almost smoky accord that reminds me of Shalimar EDP. I can see myself wearing this scent a lot this fall and winter to parties, formal dinners, holiday celebrations ... and anywhere I want to give folks the message: stand back and do not hug me. (Not a hugger. It's very invasive if you don't like to be hugged). However, I also plan to enjoy it inside in air conditioning while I am sitting at my desk, working, or even just puttering around, reading, or watching tv.

Please don't put your fancy bottles away, ladies, or save them for special occasions. Tomorrow isn't promised to any of us. Wear them. Own them. Be audacious. Let them hear you ROAR!
