If you would like to try Kenzo Elephant, I found it for a great price on Ebay. I paid under $60 US including shipping.

Yes, this is a bold scent but right now it is available relatively inexpensively. If you like Obsession (the original), Youth Dew, Shalimar, Cinnabar, Opium, or Estee Lauder's Spellbound (which has a lot of clove also), I believe you will find a spot in your heart for this Elephant. The bottle is beautiful too.

I desperately wanted to love this one.
I'm so glad I didn't not blind buy it, however I was very close to doing it after seeing multiple YT reviews and everyone saying it's super spicy, it's the "elephant in the room" kindda fragrance.

Sadly, to me it's only an 80s men's aftershave cologne/splash. I got a chance to test it out today at a department store that had one last bottle of it left with them. I'm so glad I tested it. The first 10 minutes I got spicy masala chai scent (I'm Indian and I know what I'm talking about, we've this spicy variation of spiced ginger chai) it smelled warm and cozy. Nothing that blew my mind or stopped me in my tracks. Just meh. Then 20 minutes in and it turned into a weird men's cologne (something I feel my father used to wear, like Faberge Brut Classic).

This should serve me as a good lesson for future when I'm tempted to blind buy perfumes based on reviews. No hate on anyone who loves this, trust me I wanted to love it too. But the elephant isn't for me sadly. No elephant ride for me, I'll just walk away...

After letting Kenzo Jungle L'Elephant "Maturate" a few months, its gotten EVEN BETTER than it was on first wear. It lasts a good amount of time (NOT a beast anymore bc of reformulations, but good longevity, 7 to 8 hours on skin). This smells similar to og Spice-Bomb, but has some noticable fruity nuances (Mango). Very "Unisex" and just smells AMAZE-BALLZ! The bottle and Metal cap are so extra, but really beautiful and of quality. An 8 outta 10 spicey, cinnamon/mango bomb! Très Bien!😉
I used to own a bottle of this years ago. When I first tried it I liked it but when I got home it just reminded me of a spicy grandma that’s spilled fireball on herself accidentally.

Szegfűszeg, pacsuli, kömény, fahéj, ylang, kardamom. Ellenállhatatlan erősség. Domináló és megkérdőjelezhetetlen. Fűszereket érzek virágok és zavaróan kiugró fák nélkül. Szerencsére nem natúr vaníliává száradva tűnik el a bőrről, mint sok olcsóbb és drága parfüm is, hanem fahéjas szegfűszeges ylangként, mint egy keleti csoda. Férfiasan határozott, vezető, egzisztenciával bíró nőt képzelek mögé, aki az eszével és kitartásával hódít, nem a törékeny nőiességével. Nagyon nagyon nagyon hosszan tart ruhán és bőrön is, mosdás után is érezhető. Erejéből adódóan nem vaníliához és gyümölcsökhöz szokott orrú tinédzsereknek való.

☼♃♆♌︎♐︎♓︎ ' ⁱᵗ'ˢ ᵛᵉʳʸ ˢᵘⁿ/ʲᵘᵖⁱᵗᵉʳ/ⁿᵉᵖᵗᵘⁿᵉ ˢᵗᵒʳʸ. ˡᵉᵒ, ˢᵃᵍ ᵃⁿᵈ ᵖⁱˢᶜᵉˢ

at first i was disappointed. i thought it was too retro for me (thanks ylang-ylang). but i gave it a second chance, didn't rush to wash it off right away - and yes, it's beautiful. now i understand. very unique. not really retro at all. just some slightly aged spices, "magic" wax candles with herbs and licorice somewhere on the side. that's verything my nose can make out. for some it's a signature, for others it matches their image, but for me this little elephant is only for home evening enjoyment.

I was convinced after reading all the reviews that this fragrance was the oriental vanilla for me. I blind bought it with so much confidence I put it on the day it came in the mail, just as I left the house for the theatre. Mistake! This is a powerhouse indeed but the spices were a big turn off for me. Could be the cumin or the caraway or both, but I spent the night itching to wash it off. Hours after a good soap scrub it was still going strong.
Not blind buy safe!
The opening is wonderfully sweet and spicy, evoking thoughts of Asia. The warm, aromatic spices gradually give way to a sweet, calming base.

Not sure what possessed me to purchase this perfume. I think I was trolling Fragrantica and a few other perfume blogs/websites and I spotted information about Kenzo "Jungle L'Elephant." I remember this fragrance being controversial, back in the day. Waaaaaay before niche perfumery was the thing, there were a few houses like Kenzo. The fragrance has been in production for nearly 30 years! I decided to blind-purchase a full bottle 'cause the price was under $30 USD for a new 100ml bottle.

So, this stuff is different. But I actually like the fragrance a whole lot!! It's welcome reprieve from my current, go-to fragrances.

To my nose, Jungle L'Elephant is a SPICE BOMB. Definitely opens with a strong cumin note, which can read a bit skanky. But somehow, the cumin morphs with the cardamom, caraway, black licorice, clove and other spicy notes making for a really nice balance of spice notes and accords. And somehow, it all works.

I do detect some ylang-ylang in the mid-development. I think I also detect ginger, which is not listed as a note. Fortunately, the spices quickly balance out that tropical banana, sour ylang-ylang (a note I detest). With time, the fragrance develops as a spicy, semi-tropical, mixed-spice bomb with evident cardamom, caraway, cumin, clove, some vanilla, amber I suppose.

I LOVE the brushed gold cap but I find the bottle impossible to handle (I have small hands). So, I'm going to decant the liquid into a more user friendly perfume bottle with a vaporizer.

I'm pleasantly surprised. A great little keeper perfume, well worth it's price.

I liked it at first, but then it started reminding me of clove cigarettes and started making me feel nauseous. I gave it to my daughter. Too bad because I had been wanting to try it for ages and the bottle is adorable. Mimic makes a ginger perfume that is similar, lighter and more wearable, but I think it’s hard to find. It has ginger in the title.

I was born in '95 and this perfume was released in '96. I remember this clearly from my early childhood but haven't smelled it since then, not in stores and not on any person. Not until I recently bought an old bottle. It's certainly not one of the known or popular perfumes, neither with the young people nor the community of more niche-oriented perfume enthusiasts I know.

However I wish that any lover of softly spicy gourmands would check this out. To my nose it's a warm bitter-almond cookie with soft chai spices, very similar to Italica by Xerjoff (really expensive) and also reminiscent of the eggnog inspired Lush perfume Yog Nog.

Somehow this is both reminiscent of frangipani sunscreen in the summer and Christmas cookies in winter. A lovely gourmand, somewhat tropical to my nose. I cannot recommend this enough, it is a fantastic scent and not "vintage" smelling at all.

I really get a ton of clove, licorice, and vanilla in this. It’s mainly a clove fragrance that’s warm, slightly sweet with a slight powdery dry down. I don’t get much fruit at all.

If you like fragrance’s like this that are warm, spicy, sweet, and you love Cardamom with a splash of citrus you might like Rima XI Carter Barcelona. It doesn’t smell the same but it’s the same sort of genre or vibe.

wWOW! Not for me. I like a strong fragrance that smacks you round the head but this was too much for me. I got frangipane and coconut a few minutes after the initial boozy opening, although neither is listed. I love both these notes but there was something extra that got in the way for me. Some kind of nasty oily thing going on. I have a perfectly formed 5ml sample bottle in its original box up for grabs if anyone in the UK wants it, DM me!

This is what Jane wore while living with Tarzan in the jungle. This is a bewildering scent, a kind of a non-poisonous snake lingering around your neck, a little bit scary at first but when acquainted eventually becomes your closest friend. This is a aromatic, green and earthy scent: a mix of mud, mould, exotic fruits, green leaves, spices and flowers. This is not as powerful as I was expecting, instead of a full grown elephant this more like a youngling. Little bit disappointed with that. Longevity with one spray is approx. eight hours. The bottle is name fitting, well balanced combo between smartness and ornamentality.

The scent: 9 / 10
Longevity: 8 / 10
The bottle: 9 /10
please test before you buy. this is insane. a guy from my class was sniffing me but my dad hated it. dominique ropion is not for everyone

My first impression ir propolis- it straight up smells like beeswax/honey-ish to me. I suppose that could be due to the spices mixed with liqourice.
Very pleasant, sweet due to the mango, the smell reminds me of a spa. It also seems to me to have a sort of pine/fir note?
Regardless, the scent is familiar yet unique, cozy, sensual. This was a blind buy, and it did not dissapoint.

Wonderfully dry earth smelling opening with spicy, milky stages following. I also get vanilla pudding notes and a hint of ballpoint pen ink (but only if you let your mind wander there). Very unusual and very strong scent in today's world. The 30ml bottle looks a lot better than a 100ml one. Smaller bottles give the impression of something rare and precious.
I scored a vintage 3.3 oz bottle of this from eBay. From 2002. I had this back 10 years ago, it was so strong! This baby is gonna be fun when i get it. Can’t wait!

I love this perfume. It's so....different....unique....it plays in it's own lane. It's one of the very few of my perfumes I'd never felt the inclination to layer. Until I had an idea....because of the Cardamom to....give it a shot....layer it with Lush Cardamom Coffee. Mr/Ms L'Elephant and Cardamom Coffee are wonderful together. Try it.

Am mid tidy up in my room, spring cleaning (never ends) and I chucked a few bottles together, but the lid of this never stays in place so of course I ended up with this being sprayed inside the bag I'd chucked the scents into.
Needless to say, my room is a spicy little harem for days on end. 😂
I'm wearing ORGANZA by Givenchy so I've got a whole damn vibe going on with my room.

Sweet mother Mary, I almost blind bought this because of the bottle and it’s made by D Ropion but I’ve sprayed this 20mins ago in the dept store as a test and I can say without a doubt the clove note is VERY strong. I’m waiting for it to dry down but be warned …
been wanting to try this for some time now. i knew that i would most probably like it based on the notes but WOW. it’s a gorgeous warm spicy scent.
Warm, cozy, complex, timeless, elegant, a true masterpiece to remind us the power of beauty.

(review from sample)

Had high hopes as I typically gravitate towards warm spicy scents, but this was definitely not for me. It became a torment to bear on my wrist as I caught horrible synthetic-y, headache inducing whiffs of it. The performance is absolutely strong, and in this case I find that to be a detriment. It smells interesting and nicely spicy up close but when those whiffs hit me - whew. Scrubber.

one of the greatest designer fragrances ever made! beautifully blended spices that create this earthy warm sweet feeling, which for me is easily wearable by both genders (im wearing this now as a man :P), and dont get me started on the performance on skin!!! i tried this on skin while out shopping with my mother and she couldn’t stop complaining for how strong this perfume is haha. honestly fell in love once again with a kenzo perfume, simply perfect!!!

My mom had this one as a sampler many years ago and gave it to me since it felt too strong for her. Worked great on my skin since it can make perfumes disappear or dry down poorly. So beautifully spicy. I like smelling like the spices section at the market so it works.

Jungle L'Elephant gives me LIFE. I find it similar in character and mood to Coco edp or edt. Kind of a more vivacious, fresher Coco. And L'Elephant has such clever notes; they play together so well, keeping me entertained. Big sillage. Delicious.

Edit: current formula

A spice BOMB! This fragrance is literally like if you stored your tea and spices in the same cabinet. The clove is quite strong at first, but after Elephant has settled, it’s a spicy black tea scent. One of my most complimented perfumes! It’s great to layer with sweeter fragrances like Bianco Latte, but my favorite combo is Elephant + Al Haramain Amber Oud Gold (an Erba Pura dupe)- I literally cannot wear this combo without someone telling me how good I smell. Fabulous performance as well.

This is my first review of a fragrance - I’ve never felt strongly enough to do it until I bought this a couple of weeks ago. I can’t stop wearing it. I wear it to bed. I wear it to the gym. I wear it to work. I freaking love it. The initial spray is strongly cloves. But as someone who casually smoked clove cigarettes in the 90s before they made smoking indoors illegal, it’s strangely satisfying because I never made a habit of it - a true guilty pleasure. I use neutrogena body oil which has a distinctive fragrance and it blends perfectly, extending it and allowing me to enjoy the middle and base notes. The ylang is present but not overwhelming, and the patchouli makes the base notes feel completely different than a gourmand fragrance like those popular right now. 15/10. Will buy over and over again!

I am wearing today the original formula 2 years since it was released and it is so much stronger than the current one. It is the perfect spicy, exotic scent which lasts and lasts. To me it smells like cinnamon with all its aspects enhanced. I am not sure why it is not listed.It also has ylang and heliotrope which I love, but hidden underneath the spices. I used to wear it also in summer but it can be too much. Cold season though? Perfect. One of my signature scents. I was wearing it for 3 years straight.

(if you are going to buy it without trying it, read this and smell, but if you already have it and like it, dont listen to this comment) based of first spray i liked it. it almost gave me a honey vibe but idk it isnt listed. after 5 minutes, it gave me a serious migrane. the cardamom is to much for me. the cloves dont bother me tho. it smells like honey covered cardamoms to me with cinnamon. its probably bc of my skin dna. (had to wash it out)

My partner likes this because of all the spices. It reminds him of mulled wine.

While it’s a well-done perfume, it’s not my preferred profile.
I will happily use up a sample since he likes it.
This is an absolutely gorgeous spicy scent, but it is unbelievably overwhelming and unwearable (for me). I wish they would make a lighter version, as I would love to be able to wear this.
For anyone hunting an older bottle, the new bottles have a more pronounced notch in the cursive “z” in “Kenzo” on the actual bottle.

***Bottle available for swap, only missing ~20 sprays, macerated 1 year already message me 2/2025***

I bought this based on reviews I read here while looking for a niche gourmand fragrance with a spicy edge that stands out among the usual suspects. I guess Jungle L'Elephant probably IS that... the problem is I don't like it. Layered with other stuff to add some chocolate and cognac notes, yes. But on its own there is something loud and screechy in the opening that never really goes away for me. I can't put my finger on it. Like a sharp, medicinal licorice smell which doesn't blend with whatever else this is trying to do.

I've got 98% of a bottle I'd trade for something that is more my style. Til then it's an occasional mixer with other fragrances when I'm in the mood for spicy sweets. You win some, you lose some...

Absolutely vile and so disappointing. I just touched the bottle to put it back in its box and now it's all over my fingers. 🤢. Giving this one away, I can't get ride of it fast enough. Don't even pay me! Dominic Ropion, WHAT WERE YOU THINKING?!!!

this perfume is a bit harder to stomach. It is very oriental, very heavy, very spicy and boy is it strong. It might be a good scent for a big crowded event, in case you get lost, your friend or partner will easily sniff you out. I understand some people can absolutely hate it. I don’t, I enjoy it a lot, but I wouldn’t say I love it yet. I had it few years ago but I was early pregnant so it was too harsh for me at that time, and now I bought it again. I remembered the smell pretty well, it doesn’t remind me of anything else in the whole perfume world, it is still quite harsh so it wasn’t just the pregnancy nose. It’s straight up cloves and cardamom in the opening. Later as it warms up, I smell something almost waxy, so I get the resemblance to a candle. It is well blended, it’s hard for me to detect anything else and put my finger on a specific note, but it is much more complex than just the initial cloves and cardamom. I will continue to observe this scent as it is very interesting. I will avoid wearing this on days I will spend some time in a car, because I suspect that could actually make me nauseous. Even sitting in the office this might not be a very good idea. But in the outside or some more open spaces absolutely yes. You will make yourself known and remembered with this. btw I’m legitimately afraid of spraying it on my neck, and that’s something coming from me. Only wrists so far, MAYBE the back of my neck when i’m wearing a pony and going out.
Omg. No offence to anyone who loves this but how? It is disgusting.. it smells like a glass full of cat piss mixed with spices.

A well-known classic that I finally got to try thanks to a friend!
First of all, not too sure about this being a "beast mode" scent. It is strong, but not uncomfortably long-lasting and does disappear completely after about 12 hours - on my skin, anyway.
The scent itself really does almost paint a picture of an arid savanna at sunset, silhouettes of elephants swaying in the distance. But I also get where the Christmas association comes from.

The spices are definitely the most prominent thing about this fragrance - especially the cardamom and cloves, which I smell throughout the scent's entire transformation. The patchouli is also very noticeable pretty much the entire time. It starts out as aromatic, unisex spicy with a citrusy tang, which seems to be the part that evokes the most winter holiday associations - then becomes sweeter and fruitier as ylang-ylang gives it that tropical feel, and mango seems to contribute to a zingy greenish note, almost like mango peels as opposed to the pulp. As it settles, it gets softer and sweeter until it dries down into the vanilla-amber base with the spiciness and patchouli still present.

It's definitely ahead of its time, and definitely not for everyone. If you don't like strong spices in anything, you're not going to like them here as well. This is now my "happy" scent - I'm not a fan of fruit-only fragrances and the fact they're so commonly recommended for an elevated mood, so Elephant is a perfect option for me when I'm feeling optimistic. Love it!
it still smells huge

I was sooo excited to get my bottle of Jungle L'Elephant, it's my first blind buy (that isn't a cheapie)!!!

The bottle is gorgeous and it has notes that I absolutely love like Cardamom, Licorice, Mango and Patchouli. Unfortunately, I didn't detect any of them :(

At first L'Elephant smells like a sweet fruity powdery scent. I immediately felt something powdery and creamy, I think it's the Heliotrope. I usually hate powdery fragrances but this one is not too powdery like Jasmine. I like the smoothness and airiness of Heliotrope.
I also smelled the powdery Gardenia right away.
Ylang-Ylang is by far the most dominant note, and it stays that way from beginning to end. To me Ylang-Ylang always smells like a fruity bubblegum, so that was a great addition. It makes L'Elephant more wearable and also more unisex.
There's slight Amber underneath, and also something woody.
The only woody note is Licorice but again, I wouldn't say this smells like Licorice at all, so I don't know where else the woody note came from (my bf also smelled it).
I smelled a tiny hint of Cloves, I wish I could smell more of it.
After a couple of hours I could smell Rhubarb too.
I smell no Mandarin Orange, Caraway, Cumin, or Vanilla.
This perfume is STRONG, insane sillage and longevity. Half a spray (I aimed wrong and only half got on my wrist) and you could spot me at any room through the smell. Lasted over 12 hours.

In short: Mainly a powdery Ylang-Ylang fragrance. Up close you can smell Amber and some woodiness, with a bit of Clove. BEAST MODE. I would recommend it to people who like this scent profile bc even though I never like (I really hate powdery perfumes) I did like it in L'Elephant - except for smokers. It doesn't blend well with smoke.

I don't regret blind buying it because the bottle is still gorgeous and this is discontinued so I might sell it in the future.

at first spray, this seems like love at first sniff...it's ambery, warm with some green notes. it opens with mango, clove, cumin, cardamom, patchouli and amber. i haven't smelled anything quite like this. tropical but spicy-there is a LOT of mango in this for me, along with some ylang ylang and gardenia and a lot of clove. this is unusual, good and intriguing and i can't stop sniffing my arm. i think i need to try this in warmer weather though.

looks like I only comment for the ultimates: either absolute bests or total abominations.

Having fallen in love with it in a fragrance, on my pursuit of finding cardamom-dominant fragrances I came across this. I immediately remembered seeing the bottle of it somewhere in a list and feeling sad because of the categorization in the "female" section, thinking it was just another lady perfume. I checked neither the notes, nor the perfumer, I sprayed on my arm and took a sniff. There's no denying that there are definitely some things in this world you can't comprehend until the moment you try it or it happens to you firsthand. My sweet child., here I am, again struggling to find appropriate vocabulary to explain this ethereal beauty without being repetitive. Utterly unbelievable fragrance, a masterful craftsmanship, exquisite blend, fantastic composition. Mr. Ropion is a bizarre magician for sure. I love this so much that I want to hug and kiss it as long as it's with me but of course, I am awkwardly hugging myself instead. It's so splendid that you can even see or peep to the glimpse of the meaning of life for a short period of time.

I believe that during its launch, there was no such a big deal as 'unisex", and as for the florals, it had to be put in the women's fragrances. Men can easily pull this off with confidence not only because of the piquant spices , but also because there is nothing to imply that. Maybe a little bit exaggerating, but I am so happy that I was able to experience this invigorating piece of art in this short lifespan of a human.
@FuzzyRush Cardabomb is right! Geeeez when does it stop smelling???

I blind bought this after reading rhapsodic reviews on here. I'm a hopeless romantic when it comes to perfume and always looking for "The One." Seeing that so many of you found true love with this, I had to try it. Full disclosure - it only arrived this morning so I'm only in a position to share first impressions and 3 hours' wear. I'm still not sure how I feel about it so far... First off, it's a cardamom bomb (a 'cardabomb'...sorry!) then the clove does start to make itself known (loudly). Am I crazy or is this somehwat reminiscent of Eden and/or Lou Lou by Cacherel?!
I know from the reviews that warming up or even maceration is crucial with this one, so I'm going to dig deep with the patience and hope that it becomes my darling the way it has for so many of you. Much has been made of its elephantine (again, sorry!) projection and sillage so I sprayed lightly and it is wafting, inoffensively, at arm's length. I imagine that overspraying this before being amongst people could be considered an act of aggression and is best avoided. I genuinely do not wish to offend the many admirers (and this is only a first impression!) but there is just a vestigial hint of public restroom upon walking into the room where it was sprayed earlier. I also concur with the comparisons to expensive Christmas candles. Presently it smells better on fabric than skin. I'm trying to talk myself out of disappointment by remembering that many have mentioned how it improves over time, but so far, the search for that special smell continues..

**Edit**
Ok, I now love this! 6 months of maceration has entirely changed this scent for me. Because of the spice, I had assumed that this fragrance would be best worn in Winter, but the sun really coaxes some magic out of it. Soft, almost powdery elements are now perceptible and the staying power and projection are impressive, but not obnoxious. Comforting and warm - this is a keeper.

I must have had the OG beast. OMG, very few perfumes nauseate me, but this one did. If you remember the Glade Apple cinnamon candle when they first came out & everyone was burning them, that is exactly what it smelled like on me. STRONG. Now, I loved that candle & mayyyybe still would (I havent bought one in years) but it smelled so close to that, and so strong & I could not get away from it, it almost made me sick. That smell was great for the house & you knew it was a candle, but it was horrible to smell ON me. If I actually bought that candle now, I may have to throw it away, that is how bad this perfume grossed me out. I cannot explain why this happened, other than by association, I didnt want to smell like that candle. UGH. I cant even think about it. I used it a couple times, just a tiny bit & sold it over a year ago, & I am still not over what it did to me.
If anyone has the old formula (metal cap) that they’re willing to decant or part with, please message me!

This is my absolute favourite perfume of all time. It's the one that I use on special occasions; holidays, birthdays, night outs etc. So I have come to connect this beautiful scent with happy memories and anticipation. Only a tiny little drop is enough. It is strong stuff. It really is the elephant that fills the room.

If this be the beast, than I am the self proclaimed beauty that goes along with it hand in hand. This is such a unique fragrance. I initially bought a new tester of Kenzo's Jungle expecting to be engulfed with a powerful punch of scent, but it was not the case. You see, I was going by the reviews on here that many were refering to it as a powerhouse scent. But alas, no powerhouse, no punch, but I could smell the potential lurking just around the corner that it did have. So I did what any scent love minded individual would do and bought a vintage version. Oh my, here was the beast the others were talking about. Here was the most obvious elephant in the room I had been on the prowl for. At first spritz, you are enveloped in the warmth of cardamom, clove, and cumin, than the magnolia, licorice, and ylang ylang make center stage so alive and wild. Finally, with this exotic blend of spices comes the earthy patchouli and musk that just lingers keeping the whole rigmaroll forever planted in the minds of everyone around you. It's been about 2 hours now since I last sprayed Kenzo's Jungle Elephant and it still smells as though I just sprayed it. I am absolutely pleased with this purchase. I do want to add, as others have said, there is something so merry and bright about it. Yes, it's not wrong in saying, this is Christmas in a bottle. It's as alive as the Yuletide. When I first got a whiff of it, nostalgia hit me. I was 5 again holding one of those vintage candles that are frosted on the outside with a white glitter substance, I was sniffing in with all my might the absolute deliousness of the holiday. I definitely get the same cardamom, vanilla, clove and other spices coming through. It's so awesome that Dominique Ropion has been able to capture so much in this prolific perfume. A wild beast, an elephant in an earthy jungle of vibrant exotic scents as well as an in depth olfactory snapshot of many peoples favorite holiday season.

What an absolute beast of a fragrance 💗 Lasts forever, projects to fill a room.
I keep getting comments and compliments on it - "you smell like Christmas" followed by a deep inhale is the most common one!

Mostly cardamom and cloves to my nose. Initial spray is quite spicy, dry down goes powdery and sweet, but not clawing. Harmoniously woven through the whole thing is vanilla.

Definitely NOT a safe blind buy. It's unusual, distinctive and potent. Try before you buy.

Very much to my taste, so would heartily recommend. Especially for cold weather.

Perfection 😌

So rich and delicious upon first spray! A burst of spice and licorice and a bit of citrus. Settles down to something sweet, spicy and a little fruity. I can definitely see where people are coming from with the Christmas candle thing. It really does remind me of an apple cinnamon candle or air freshener, but I LOVE IT! I LOVE IT SO MUCH! I've wanted to try this for so long and I'm glad I finally did. It did not disappoint!

I don’t understand the negativity toward this perfume. To me it feels like a very mild warm drink with milk and ginger, cardamom, and licorice. On me it’s not loud, but then again nothing is really loud on me (unfortunately). Perfect for fall, day or night. Not a bad fragrance at all.

Category: Spicy, powdery, vanilla

Notes: Sprays on smelling only of vanilla and mandarin orange, but very quickly develops into a strong mix of clove and cardamom. The vanilla remains in the background, along with a powdery, honey-esque heliotrope and amber in supporting roles. This gets less spicy and more powdery the longer it stays on. After 7+ hours of wear this turns into a wonderful, boozy vanilla.

Vibe: Autumn. Old couch. Peach cobbler. Cinnamon sticks. Rowanberry branch. Cocktails. White trash TV. Boardroom. Extramarital affair.

Sillage: 8/10. Punchy and present without being too loud. I could easily smell it off my wrist while resting my hand in my lap.

Longevity: 7/10. Pretty decent longevity, will definitely last you at least a good 6 hours in cooler weather. It does become pretty much a skin scent after 4-5 hours, but it's still there.

Wear: Could work for daytime wear but I think it's probably more suitable for evening. The spiciness of this scent, particularly clove, makes this an undeniable fall and winter scent to me.

Overall rating: 4/10. Got this sample in a trade from the lovely @Aren. What a weird fragrance… do I like it? Do I hate it? At first I thought I really liked it, but everytime I came back to it I liked it less and less each time. I think it's because it got more and more powdery with time, and I don't really fw powdery. But then it changed up on me again after about 7 hours of wear, and the powdery character disappeared and it turned into this gorgeous, almost boozy, very rich vanilla. Smells just like the bourbon vanilla extract paste I have for baking. This is my second clove forward scent I've tried on (Nina Ricci L’air du Temps being the first) and this is definitely a huge upgrade from my previous experience. Quite pleasantly spicy, a little sweet and very powdery. I'm very happy about the fact that I'm not even slightly picking up on the caraway since I think caraway reeks. What stands out most is the clove, followed by cardamom. There's a hint of licorice root, and the scent is carried by an undercurrent of vanilla and very powdery heliotrope and amber. It's a powerhouse scent for a powerhouse of a woman. While I don't hate this I think I'm just not a fan of clove forward scents… It’s a little too spicy for my tastes, kind of stings your nose when you go into sniff it, and way too powdery for me to stand. While I adore where it ends up after several hours, it's not worth the wait. I think this might be signature scent worthy for someone else - truly a unique and interesting scent even though it wasn't my personal taste or style.

Who would wear it?: Rene Russo.

Jungle l'Éléphant is a magnificent spicy perfume whose smell is quite astonishing!

To smell its final scent, you have to wait a few minutes, because the opening is extremely strong and destabilizing. But when it's all put together, it's delicious, typically everything I like; a melody of intoxicating and heady spices, vanilla and ylang-ylang.

Why did I choose the neutral smiley in this case? Because an after smell that I can't isolate bothers me. I think it might be the cumin ans its sweaty smell (quite light here but still there).

I was on the verge of love at first sight; without this after smell, not only would I have bought it but it could have become my new signature to replace my current discontinued one. Sad :(

EDIT: (MACERATION IS A MUST!) So I recieved my bottle of Kenzo Jungle L'Elephant on 09/06/2024, I was honestly quite dissapointed when Id initially sprayed it on because it smelled almost 1 to 1 like Cacharel's Eden which I love, but already own. L'Elephant had virtually NO spice and smelled almost one to one like Eden by Cacharel, the predominant Mango note is pretty much used in the same way in both which made them smell almost identical. Also, the spices were way, WAY too subdued in L'Elephant, and after having heard/read so many reviews stating that this was a very spicey fragrances (which is why I wanted L'Elephant to begin with) I was VERY dissapointed to say the least.

Fast forward 6 weeks or so, after letting this sit and "macerate", during that time, Kenzo Jungle L'Elephant has DRASTICALLY CHANGED for the better, I now see what everyone was talking about when they said this was uber spicey. Also, the performance has gone from good 6-7 hours to "Beast Mode". For example, I'd done about 4-5 sprays before bed last night, and then this morning, after I'd just woken up, my niece's mother visited me and said "wWOWw you smell gooood, whatchoo wearin'!?". This fragrance and a couple of others have made me a total believer in the maceration process! It's kinda crazy bc Id never noticed a fragrance do that before I started really getting into collecting. Kenzo Jungle L'Elephant is still a great buy, and YES! It still has that beautiful METAL, heavy cap, so don't believe some sources that claim the cap is now a cheap plastic! Id also like to mention that this fragrance was quite feminine leaning when I'd first tried it back in September, but with the strong spices opening up like they did, this fragrance is now 100% unisex/genderless imo, and I don't get why ANYONE would be bothered by that "OPINION".. Anyhow, Go get ya'll dis Kenzo L'Elephant before it gets horribly reformulated or worse... DISCINTINUED😮!... Thank you to whomever took the time to read my thoughts on this hidden 💎! 🫠
This is a top notch ONLY FOR LADIES perfume.Its sexy on a woman but not on men...

first time blind buying a perfume based on the notes, i was not expecting the clove to be so abundant 😭 the way this dries down is so gorgeous and cozy, ive been trying to get into more mature scents and this is perfect. the scent did overwhelm me at first, but the dry down smells like the best mix of spicy and sweet perfect for fall.

Kenzo Jungle sigh. My first true head over heels, heart racing, can't stop thinking about. Love. I can't even describe how much I loved this perfume and for so many years.
Until I got asked by my then fiance to please stop wearing it, because it was making all his clothes smell like it - it was getting all over the house. He liked the smell. But it was ' too much'. I quit wearing it as per his request, but years and years on this fragrance haunts me like a ghost. I tried to find more subdued versions. But nothing, but nothing matches Kenzo Jungle. The most complex and misunderstood masterpiece that ever existed. Bold, warm, inviting, sultry, sweet, spicy, tropical. Yes tropical. Best in heat, summer nights. 'Tropical the island breeze
All of nature wild and free'

Perfumes have no sex, but some of them have a very loud gender!

I got very irritated when I saw Jungle E. classified as unisex or even to the point of being more masculine, and the truth is that even a person with parosmia would agree that it is an epitome of a feminine archetype!!!
I'm a man and I wear Jungle E. when I want to be close to my anima, but I would never say that there is anything masculine about it!
Guys, there's nothing wrong with wearing feminine perfumes, but please stop calling them unisex in order to excuse yourself!
Probably the first woman on Earth (before a man was born) smelled on Jungle E.!
A masterpiece that will never be surpassed!!!
These were perfumes!

I bought a 2ml sample of this when I was exploring Dominique Ropion's earlier works. I love a lot of his creations, but not this one. On skin it was giving me overripe fruit and a chaotic melange of spice. I smelled like an unfortunate fall candle that no one wanted. It wasn't quite a scrubber, but I was thankful that I was due for a shower a few hours after putting it on my body.

When I was like 12 I smelled it on my arts teacher and I asked her what perfume she was wearing, she told me kenzo jungle and we could only buy it from the airport since we didn't have it in stores, so I asked my dad to buy it for me and he did! It smelled amazing on her but it was too mature for me to wear it and like it on me.
I'm thinking of repurchasing it, I think I'll like it on me now. Memories!

So sad . . . I really wanted to like this fragrance. I purchased a bottle as a blind buy after watching and reading a few reviews. This is not a beast . . . it is an Elephant! This is extremely strong and heavy, and for me, it overwhelmed me quickly giving me a nauseating headache. But it is a nice fragrance just way, way, way too much. I tested it twice. The first time, after a couple of hours I had to take another shower. The second time, I only sprayed it once on one wrist, then spread that little bit around my other wrist. It still was overpowering. I have a few "beastmode" perfumes, but this is beyond them all.

Based on other people's reviews I was expecting something incredibly strong and borderline offensive, but come on people, this is in fact pretty tame. It opens with a flash of invigorating spice, but that subsides quickly, and I find it to be quite wearable. It's soft and unisex. Yes, it is for people who like spices, ahem, look at the notes, but it's well blended and slightly creamy. It feels like it was inspired by India. I think this will be nice for the cooler weather; I find it unique and comforting. When it fades, it does smell more like patchouli, so if you hate patchouli, you've been warned. Oh and it does not smell like a fall/Christmas candle. Coming from someone who typically hates scented candles, it's better than that! Overall, a nice scent. Kenzo you've done it again.

Sensual, dirty and hedonistic. Wear this in hot humid weather and make others uncomfortably question their sexuality.

Bubba & Claudette Rocque from Heaven's Prisoners wear this.

I've been wearing Elephant layered with Vanilla by Alyssa Ashley, which boosts up the vanilla accord a little bit, and my partner who never comments on my perfumes, has already complimented me twice on separate occasions. I find it funny, but I also understand him, because this is such a warm, elegant and delicious scent. Still, I love that it's not venturing too far into sweet gourmand territory.
Works well in heat and in cold weather. Just be careful not to overspray. A single spray is enough with this one, and it literally lasts all day.

I loved the clove and licorice notes here, but unfortunately the cumin note turned musty on my skin as I initially feared it would. It, along with the patchouli and cardamom notes, wound up drowning out most of the other notes. This would be too heavy for hot weather, but I could see it making the perfect Jack-of-all trades scent for cooler weather.

I have been wanting to test this one for the longest time.
This is a very powerful array of spices. It smells like visiting an older relative during the holidays, and entering the kitchen where cinnamon toffees and decorative candles are placed all over the hardwood furniture covered in fluffy, warm toned covers and doilies, as they are looking through their pantry while they are telling you the story of each spice and herb from their massively varied collection, before engaging in another baking session. You're settled down on a chair, enjoying homemade vanilla rice pudding, and a bunch of dried leaves and tiny branches are sitting inside an ornate bowl on the same table you're eating at.
Even the tv has some kind of porcelain figurine on top of it, your relative's stories kind of make your head spin, but you're ultimately comfortable and warm.

It's a very nice and unique scent, I haven't personally smelled any perfume like this but a thousand Christmas and fall candles, nothing wrong with it. I am not complaining I would definitely wear it around those days.

I bought it because everyone says it smells like chai and it does but if you add a lot of liquor to it, not bad tho but not what I was expecting.

It's a spice bomb. Reminds me of eucalyptus, aftershave, chai tea, and black licorice. It's good if you're looking for a unique fragrance. You have to appreciate clove, nutmeg, anise types of scents. A nice change from smelling like fruit or candy. I can see someone pairing this with a cinnamon fragrance for colder seasons.

Just wanted to give a quick tip, if you got a new bottle, let it sit and macerate, don’t give up on it.

At first, it was all wrong and I hated it (the juice was a light yellow)

Now I am really into it! And the juice has turned ambery dark orange color ( I’ve had it for about maybe 3 years now).

Been eyeing Kenzo L'Elephant for a few months now, but didnt wanna pull the trigger and spend $70 on blind buying a frag that may lean way too feminine, most of my frags are unisex, and I use some feminine leaning scents, just not completely feminine leaning.

After the initial purchase, but before I'd recieved it, I'd read somewhere that it'd been reformulated (much weaker) and that the cap was now plastic, I became so upset as so many brands do that crap and then I find out the hard way. And YES, presentation does matter to me, most frags I blind buy are bc of notes list and the beautiful bottles at times. L'Elephant is one of those instances.

I'm happy to report that the cap is still metal and beautifully detailed, but while the opening is still quite potent, Im not too sure about the longevity or sillage, I sprayed some on my shirt and while I can still smell it a good amount a few hours later, Its REALLY calmed down quite a bit, so according to many reviews here on fragrantica, I have to wonder if "the reformulation monster" got to this? Bc I just wouldn't call this "beast mode" like described here on fragrantica.

Im hoping the fragrance just needs to open up some more after air is introduced into the bottle like it happens with so many of my new frags. Also, I was REALLY surprised at how much L'Elephant smells a lot like Cacharel's Eden, another, floral/fruity (mango) 90's powerhouse, except L'Elephant has a (little bit) of added spicyness. And Eden has no spice as far as I can tell.

Beautiful, fruity, spicey fragrance, and I definately say it's more feminine than masculine, yet confident men can still pull off wearing L'Elephant due to the slight spicyness... 8 outta 10 scent and Im so stoked that I hadn't yet read that bs about reformulations and re-packaging as I would never have gotten it...... Thanks to whomever took the time to read my review!
----------------UPDATE------------------
So, my bottle of L'Elephant has been maturing for about 6 weeks, and WOAH! Now I get what they mean by "Strong Cinnamon and Clove" what a CRAZY difference! This "maceration" thing is no myth I guess huh? I've now had a few different fragrances change after letting them sit for a spell, but this one had a pretty drastic change. This just went from "unisex leaning feminine" to straight up UNISEX bc of the very strong spiciness. yYAYy!😁 I LOVE spicey frags! Oh, and that strong Mango note that made this smell just like Cacharel's Eden, has now been tempered by the delicious spices which make Kenzo Jungle L'Elephant it's own thing!.. Smells really yummy now! But, If wearing this thing to work or office setting, maybe 2-3 sprays max now fo sho!

This to me is Instant headache and nausea in a bottle. Only Angel by Thierry mugler does this as well. It just smells like a sweaty priest after swinging the cencer for an hour. When someone wears this I have to leave the room.
I love spicy scents but this I can’t take.

In the air it smells nostalgic like a hair salon growing up, or the smell of blow drying your hair, and hair grease. When I put my nose to skin it smells like an almost savoury spice mix with not much discernible sweetness. It almost feels like my nose is drying out. I’m not sure how wearable it is because of its association with hair grease and blow dryer heat. It’s very musky, dry and dense like a dust cloud. It’s not that wearable to me because of its strong associations with freshly blow dried hair (not bad but not expected in a perfume) I’ll give this one a wearing later on to see how it goes
Update: I’m surprised by how much I love this one. it’s colder now and decided to give it another go and honestly I’ve changed my mind about this one. Maybe because I’ve let it sit and the temperature is cooler but it’s a lot more enjoyable. There’s a little dry sweetness and I get a lot of liquorice, indistinguishable ‘spices’ and a sweet vanilla. I have a nice little bubble around me in a sweet soft spicy way. I smell like cinnamon chewing gum in a good way and reached for it a lot this winter. This one will last ages since you don’t need much but I feel like I replace this even it (eventually) runs out. Just goes to show, don’t just things too fast!

I bought it years ago. And I seemed to like it back them. As I have used almost 100 ml. But the little there is left ... I can't stand the smell of it, I just can't. And this one you have to love to wear it. Because it is so strong. The strongest perfume I have ever smelled.

Straight up spicy banger! The cinnamon and cloves are strong and energizing. This smells identical to Lush's old classic soap, Red Rooster. Wearing it on the first day of August, a sweltering summer day. These spices work well in the heat, mixed with lovely citrus.
This is a gorgeous sweet spicy milky chai tea with a drop of orange. Kind of remids me of Lush Karma.

Honestly super disappointed in this one. I absolutely love spicy scents, and I've heard this is a great one. Many of the notes are some of my all time favs including cardamom, cloves, licorice, patchouli, and vanilla. Unfortunately, I get none of that. It just reminds me of the nemat nag champa perfume oil (which doesn't have any of the woody spice of actual nag champa incense). On paper it dries down to a nice spicy aroma that I somewhat enjoy, but it just never seems to get there on my skin. Just a sweet and very rounded out scent with zero edge to it. Smells like earthy, musky mango and ylang-ylang. So much ylang-ylang. I'm going to keep testing it to see if my opinion changes, but really isn't the sexy spiced scent I was anticipating.

update: After about 5+ hours I start to get a little of those spices and vanilla coming through. It's ok but not worth dealing with the top notes for most of the day just to get to a faded version of something I like. Honestly, a really suffocating one-note fruity floral for me, I've grown to hate it.

A couple of years ago (around 2016) I tried L'Elephant and that was some experience for sure! I loved the vanilla base but, at that time, I couldn't handle the strong clove note. It was very strong and the sleeve of my coat smelled of it for at least 4 weeks... What a beast!! I am into strong perfumes but this was too much for me.
Fast forward to 2024. For some reason cloves really grew on me to the point I find myself loving the smell. I really like (vintage) CoCo and (vintage) Chamade. So I had to try this Elephant again. And now, it is gorgeous!! Probably thank to those horrific reformulations, it is softer, sillage is moderate instead of strong/enormous and longevity is a decent 10 hours (after about 5-6 hours it is a skin scent of lovely vanilla). I can smell mandarin orange and a very noticable 'dirt and wet leaves' patchouli, cloves obviously, cardamom , some licorice and lots of vanilla. It's sweet, soft, 'milky'. The other notes don't play a big role on my skin. I am describing my, according to the batchcode, august 2023 bottle. So, in short, it's lovely and actually suitable for office wear. But, it is not a beast anymore. So I did order an older formula from eBay. Because now that I can appreciate cloves, I want the real deal of an Elephant stomping across the room! And I'll save my 2023 bottle for the office :-)

Edit: I have been wearing the 2023 version for a couple of days in a row now and sillage is definately intimate. I sprayed at least 8 times but I did not turn into a perfume cloud(bomb) and my husband could only smell it up close. It does last all day.

You must like spicy aromatic fragrances to enjoy this one. The spices and warmness actually reminds of of a cozy festive scent you'd want to wear during the winter holidays. Smells festive. I think it's discontinued, but can still be found on discounter sites. I don't normally enjoy cumin, but all of the other spices cover up most of the cumin note (at least to my nose). Unisex in my opinion. Price isn't too bad, but still wouldn't recommend blind buying.

I dont like the smell and nor friends around me. It s indeed strong mango and ylang smell. I was wearing it during a summer trip, all my clothes, car , bed smelled this perfume. Honestly extreme sillage and longevity! Amazing performance if you like the smell! Rarely found such performance.

My friends mum and nana used to wear this when I was around 14/15 and I’ve loved it ever since. You either love it or hate it. In the beginning when you first spray it it’s instantly mature/old lady but give it a minute once that’s gone it’s the most unique beautiful scent, to me it smells like you’re walking through an Indian spice market, you get the cumin and cardamom with a sweet warm creaminess like a hot pan of milk with fresh vanilla pods simmering and i can smell it all the way through, in the dry down I start to smell the liquorice and mango a sweetness with cinnamon, turmeric and patchouli. The longevity is beast mode it lasts for days on your clothes and the aroma radiates throughout any room you walk through. It gives incense, hippie, bohemian, Moroccan, it’s so comforting and warm and dreamy. I love it! 😻

This is one of the best fragrances I've ever had the privilege to get my nose on. A masterpiece.

The scent bubble you get is amazing, it's reminiscent of hiking in a beautiful pine forest in the heat of summer.

I think you could get away with wearing this all year round, both night and day (I will be anyway).

Just Beautiful.

absolutely vile holy shit. sprayed all over on my wool jumper in Sephora. instantly nauseous, the first time i’ve ever gagged. and sadly one of the longest lasting fragrances on the market.

my first thought was christmas. the warm spice of festive oils. very rich, pungent. aromatic and warm

Cloves and cardamon on a bed of vanilla and patchouli. Very unique scent, I agree this is nothing short of a masterpiece. I also see why some wouldn't like it: it's quite cloying and very potent. The chai latte comparisons make sense given how spice heavy the frag is, but it's not a latonic or a caramely scent.

I love to spray myself all over with perfume and even for me one spray of Jungle Elephant is enough. Two sprays and you might start giving your co- workers a headache.

Used to be my signature decades ago. I still like it now I am revisiting it, but at the moment I prefer scents that have slightly less going on? I also notice cumin/some bitterness much more than I used to.
Very unique blend. Spicy, creamy, with some florals. Completely unisex fragrance. Performance is out of this world, do NOT overspray, this projects massively and lasts an eternity.

If we must make a top perfumes check, this absolute masterpiece by Ropion, would be definitely, probably in first 10 or less.
This is in every aspect of parfumery art one big masterpiece. Big. Like elephant. This perfume behaves like elephant.
It enters the place like elephant, loud, crushing, clumsy, charming, dangerous and serious. Once you smell it you NEVER forget it. It's like thunder. Why kick down the door when you can just tear down the wall right away? Real Elephant. That is the force of this perfume.

It's well know. The Dream by Henri Rousseau inspired Kenzo Takada for his Jungle boutique. But did you ever look at that painting? Because commercial for this scent could be just that. Extremely provocative but realistically truthful to Kenzo ideas.
This perfume is a scent of Jungle goddess. Lying nude on the stones, after waterfall shower, while birds and the rest of fauna worships her. Forest water penetrating her skin. Humid air closing her eyes in half...
"This artistic vision also impacted the distinctive packaging and is the outcome of a tight collaboration of the French designer Joël Desgrippes and Marc Gobé with Kenzo Takada. Aimed to communicate the essence of both Paris-based fashion designer’s colorful, vibrant personality and his aesthetic vision, self-described as exotic, luxurious, surprising and sensual, the bottle for Elephant setting the pure lines of the glass against the figural metal cap marked also a shift in the visual expression from flora to fauna, with Le Tigre and a masculine Zebra completing in the Jungle trilogy. The box was the real groundbreaking element setting a precedent in the perfume industry for the connection to the catwalks and the iconic “Jungle Jap” boutique in Galerie Vivienne, Paris featuring naïve jungle interiors Kenzo painted himself in the 1970s. The same way the original box was meant to fold out like an origami creating a miniature stage set for the animal."(cafleurebon.com)


Head
mandarin, cardamom, cumin
Find one perfume that opens with this wonderful lunacy? They fit so good. They balance each other so nicely. They lead you together to me Heart notes! Simultaneously. Powerfully. Have in mind that this perfume doesn't calm down. It opens loud, powerful, crushing everything in front, same way it continues. Elephants don't slow down if they see flowers in front of them. Right? That's how this perfume opens.

Heart
caraway, clove, heliotrope, ylang ylang, mango juice. If you don't love spices and ylang-ylang, this will crush you. And it won't care. If your skin is dry I recommend to use body oil, dubble good. Care for your skin and fundament for this perfume. This perfume doesn't like dryness! Very difficult to filter out single notes independently. But dry skin will smell like dry spices.
My dear how this scent smell when it develops all over the skin it likes. Very hard to describe. So beautiful. So good composed. Masterfully balanced. Intriguing. And very very powerful. No, one more time. Very difficult to filter out single notes independently.

Base
licorice, vanilla, patchouli, casmerin, amber.
Did you read that good? You can read it, to sense it as seperate dry-down is not possible.
This perfume gets just better and better. Hitting you with perfect melange continously.
My hell, what a great mayestic perfume this is.

Is it for anyone or everyone?
No. Far far from that. 1 spray is enough. It lasts more than 12 hours. It doesn't remind of any other perfume. It's very specific and unique. As I wrote at the beginning. This perfume behaves like elephant.

Most people associate Elephant with Christmas or cold weather, but I think this frag smells its best in the heat and humidity of summer, when it has a chance to breathe and create a beautiful sillage.
This is a very polarizing scent, but those who love it (like me) worship it. It is unlike any other perfume on the market.

Kenzo Jungle L'Elephant smells like baklava with cloves. Sweet, spicy, sticky with ambery drydown. Florals are only a supporting act. Delicious autumn fragrance. Wear it to keep warm and cozy. An old school classic. Youth Dew, Opium and Cinnabar have all the cloves and spices I'll ever need. So I don't really need this one, but it gets respect from me. The bottle is unique. Who doesn't love elephants?

If KJ was an MMA fighter, I'd put my money on it without second thought. It's the strongest, most aggressive (not in a bad way), can really punch you in the face unless you're careful and know how to handle it properly. It's unique, no question about that, especially in the sea of today's generic fruity and sticky-sweet scented waters. This one puts them all to shame. Now the notes. I find cumin and cardamom to be most prominent, and after a while, ylang-ylang comes to play, but like a young kid that joins some older kids on the playground, it's there, but barely noticeable and while the bigger kids run after the ball, the little one runs around a bit confused, not daring to approach the bigger kids and try and kick that ball. I don't detect clove, I guess cumin overpowers it. I can't think of the right adjective to describe it entirely, but it is definitely special and I like smelling it, it can be both unpleasant and pleasant at the same time (pleasantly unpleasant?), a class of its own, truly a masterpiece.

My first perfume that I loved so much, I used to wear it no matter what. Loved it from the first spray to the very last droplet. Always buying a new bottle terrified it may get discontinued. Nothing, nothing compares to Kenzo Jungle.
She is cozy, warm, unexpected, sweet, comforting, sexy, has all the notes I adore so well blended. A masterpiece!
Back in the late 90s when I first got her, I remember that it was summer so to this day it reminds me of late nights and hot mornings, lazy afternoons, full moon, laughter, wine...
A few years later, I let her rest a bit and got Opium. Again, no matter how much I loved Opium, Kenzo remained my one and only.
I now go back and forth between the two, KJ always wins a bit more.
When I die, I want a bottle with me.
I just love wearing this in the heat and humidity of Greek summer. Spicy lactonic vanilla, so yummy. I totally get the chai latte comparison.

I swear, I detect star-anais in this, but it's not listed in the notes?
Yes, loads of cardamom too.
This grew on me. I smell of chai latte when wearing it. Cinnamon-y, but not sweet, a little bitter even.
It's a curious, unusual one and I wander how it would fear getting layered with something really sweet/vanilla-y like Angel's Share for winter, and something really green (suggestions?) for summer...

She stomped into my life, I found her personality tricky to deal with. She was all Chai latte and cloves. People asked me who she was, what is her name, she doesn't smell like an elephant. She's strong, oh so strong. She hangs around and doesn't leave. I found her too much for me, I let her go, I think of her often and might have to let her back into the herd.

Ace I'm hiding in my sleeve when I want to stand out. Very sexy and unusual, works so well with my chemistry. I prefer to wear it in the summer when so many women smell of coconuts and other exotic fruits as they are added to skin products - and then you walk in having this bold but PERFECT notes, somehow combined to be uplifting despite the warm overall tones, with a touch of mystery no other "coconuty" scents have.

Creamy, lactonic, a little cloying, fruity tropical syrup with Splenda, dry spices, smooth cherry cinnamon cough syrup on a bed of Nivea lotion. It does smell a lot like a Christmas candle, to be honest. I like it but it smells decidedly very "perfumey" and does nothing to enhance or complement the skin, at least on me. I would buy a candle that smells like this.
I hated this when I first got it. But now 6 years later I’ve just found it at the back of my cupboard all forgotten about. I’ve just smelt it and it’s truly beautiful. I now love it. 😍

Very original and interesting: the different spices take a different place in the nose according to their level of "heat", which gives the impression of having your nose filled with each sniff, but still managing to distinguish them all!

Greatly resembles the smell of chai tea latte, so very comforting and gourmand, but too realistic to be worn on the skin in my opinion, especially as the projection is very strong so risks disturbing others 😕

There's also a risk of nausea/headaches if worn in hot weather, but it must be very nice in winter.


Useful details : english is not my mother tongue and my opinions are copied and pasted from my personal notes, written on the fly after several phases of testing (tracking changes for several hours on blotters, then on my skin for a day).

Very complex and unique Oriental scent, well blended spices, bitter sweet, very aromatic, can be a little overwhelming on it's own depending on the situation but it always adds unbelievable dimension, beauty and depth to other vanilla based or soft spicy fragrances. Love it more layered than on it's own.
Sex in a bottle 🔥

Very spicy and made my whole body feel warm and enveloped in the scent. That being said, this was the perfume that made me realize I cannot pull off perfumes with any amount of spice in them with my body chemistry. I didn’t smell any mango but it reminds me of the markets that have burlap bags of spices open and then scooped into small bags when you buy them by the gram. Unfortunately cannot handle the warmth this scent conjures up. Cutest bottle.

This is beast mode, I wore this around Christmas time and people followed me down corridors asking what perfume it was. This is a perfect December scent, spicy, warm and magical. Reminds you of drinking rum spiked hot chocolate at a Christmas market

holy spice bomb! I smell like a Christmas market wearing this, and I love it!

I don’t sense any floral notes and barely any fruit besides a vague orange in the opening. it’s basically 90% spices and 10% vanilla. sometimes I layer it with other vanilla perfumes to amp up the sweetness and tone down the spice.

I don’t really get the people calling this scent sexy or dirty, for me it’s the ultimate comfort scent. it smells like how wearing fluffy sweaters and fuzzy socks feels. though I’m curious if wearing it in high heat/humidity would change my mind.

I was recommended to purchase this fragrance by someone on Fragantica. I can confirm this is the most foul smelling perfume I have ever come across, so much so I had to throw it away. It is headache inducing and just a cluster of annoying scents. The scent actually changes my mood, lol.

I love this scent. I love the warm, spicy fragrance with a bit of bright orange and the floral that emerges after the first hour or so. Unfortunately, my husband doesn't like it as a perfume. He doesn't hate the smell, just doesn't like the smell as a perfume. So, I don't know how often I'll find a reason to wear it.

Dear Jungle L'Elefant,

(Edit, adding: I had sealed some tissues I had sprayed with samples. After some days I made a blind check if the characters are still there and if I can recognise which sample is what.
You are the one that stinks. Fecal. Never again!)


A whole long work day you have spent wafting on and around me - and many others - with an enormousness and lasting power I have never experienced before in a perfume.
(I had sprayed you at 7am and now it it 8 pm, and there is still so much of you left of these two spritzers on my forearms.)
And since I had found out that that you annoy me pretty soon after, I have been craving to come home to wash you off and change my clothes for many hours. Your intensity of the cloves is suffocating me!

However, you might have done me the favour of underlining a core character trait of mine: confidence and assertiveness. In a meeting with decision makers, you may even have helped me to feel strong, to feel unique and to make me feel "I'm allowed to have that opinion".

You are a powerful scent, and you can be appealing by your spicy sweet muddy uniqueness. You are certainly not elegant, nor clean.

If you were less intense in the cloves - and overall -, I could like you.

Got this one several years ago as a blind buy, tried it a few times and found the cumin went too strong and funky on me. I really love cumin as a seasoning, but it wasn't sitting well on me, getting a BO type of vibe from it.
Well I revisited it today, and I'm getting a different read. There's more of a sweet (candy but deep) note that seems to be balancing out the cumin better. This one might be growing on me.
Spice overdose, and creamy at the same time. I am amazed! Jungle L'Elephant is very unique, and I can see why it could be a polarizing fragrance.

I ❤ Kenzo Labsolue, so obviously I expect I will like other Kenzo fragrances. I often read Fragrantica reviews, positive and negative. But nothing prepared me for this experience.
First I felt an explosion of spices, especially cumin. I had to open a window, it was so strong. Then it changed into cinnamon. But not the Khamrah cinnamon, but strong in your face cinnamon. I felt it till lunch and I had to change my Tshirt, as it was so strong.
I love cinnamon, but this was too much. It´s a no from me. Do try it before buying.

Got this for my girlfriend as a blind buy for her birthday. She's been wanting it for a while. Got it for a great price on FragranceNet, $45. It smells like a Christmas scented, spiced, incense stick. In a good way. Very warm with a sweetness to it like candy. Love at first sniff.

It's also very unisex. I sprayed some on me and it smelled a little more masculine mixing with my body scent. Smells great, very spicy, some cinnamon, cardamom, I think nutmeg maybe? I'm not smelling that clove top note everyone talks about. But the drydown is amazing. Still retains that Christmas spice but takes on a patchouli bottom note over time that reminds me of incense.

The bottle is very high quality. It's a little cumbersome, very wide. But a solid glass bottle a heavy aluminum cap is very nice to have these days.

I think they might've reformulated it over time because it doesn't have that insane longevity and projection other people talk about. It definitely radiates, I'll admit that. As for filling entire floors of buildings with scent like some people claim? Definitely not. It fills a room for the first few hours for sure, but nothing crazy.

The longevity is a bit lacking as well. Coming from someone who uses performance beasts like Y EDP and Savauge elixir, I expected a lot more after seeing the ratings here. It still lasts for a good part of the day, and projects decently enough... That's a lot better than 90% of women's perfume. But I was expecting something like Y EDP that you can tell on clothes after they wash and on your skin after you shower.

All in all, Kenzo has a great fragrance here. A timeless classic that I hope never gets discontinued. If you want to smell like a Christmas scented incense stick, this one's for you.

I ordered a sample because I was just too curious... It really is a POWERFUL spice bomb. I can smell cloves and cardamom after spraying it 2 hours ago, and my 2 ml sample is closed in a plastic bag which is closed in a drawer. Definitely unique, not unpleasant but I find it hard to consider this a fragrance meant to be worn. If I was in a small room with someone wearing 2 sprays of L' Elephant I would probably start to lacrimate. More than that could be considerate chemical warfare

I will never forget the moment I first smelled this timeless masterpiece, it felt like I experienced all the layers that human existence on earth could possible attain, all at once, it just shook me. I am at my 13th bottle, btw. It is one of the things that makes life worth living.

A masterpiece!

I came here to say that and saw the same thing written just a few hours ago 😁 .
Well, what can you do - it is 🤩 !

Piece of art.
Masterpiece 💛

Wonderful strong perfume, exactly like others write.

I read a lot of hate about this perfume but I was so greatly surprised, when I tested it.

Strongest perfume ever, clove, cinamon, hint of mandarine in opening, everything perfectly blended and smells even day after.

Addictive scent.

30 ml of this is like 150 ml of another perfume.

My 30 ml bottle is nearly 3 years with me and still last 5 ml aren't not spoiled. It experienced too high and too low temperature, shaking during a lot of travelling..... and it's just altered, but still beautiful.

My signature, my favourite, my endless love.
Since the moment l first smelled this perfume l fell in love. Its intoxicating.
This perfume is a savage beast it takes no prisoners.
This perfume is not for everyone.
This perfume is not subtle at all.
This perfume will wake up your senses and blow your damn socks off!
It's a powerhouse scent.
This is probably one of the most powerful potions ever made, it's concentration is outstanding. She stands alone. There is no other like her. Literally no other. Maybe Estee Lauder Cinnabar or Youth dew comes the closest out of any other on the market or in history but they are more bitter scratchy spicy where this is creamy spicy.
I get why this perfume was given the Elephant as its animal. If you imagine a fragrance as a jungle animal the elephant is the largest and most awe inspiring force there is. Everything runs from the stampeding elephant its a force to be reckoned with like this perfume.
This oriental spicy dream is so strong l advise you test it on something you can throw away if you dont like it. If you spray its powerful scent on your skin be prepared for it to stick around for at least 24hrs even after a bath and on your clothes even after they've been washed. Oh and don't spray it on your neck straight after a bath, it's so strong it burns, not literally, but stings so bad your skin feels like it's burning! Many a time I've forgotten this rule in a rush and ran for the bathroom to fill my facecloth with cold water to hold against my throat and been left with bright red skin for an hour.
A paper trial is a must for a first time tester.
It's the middle east in a bottle, like walking through a spice market and all the spice fragrances pull your senses from one direction to another. The cloves are like a throat punch and the cumin and cardamom are prominent. The heliotrope Amber vanilla and floral composition turn the spice harshness to a soft sweet creamy spicy.
I've heard others describe it as a "Christmas candle scent" erm its quite a bit more complex and exciting than that huns! Way to turn a beautiful world class groundbreaking scent into a basic bitch. 😆 🤣 😂
As I've heard many say its one of those perfumes where even if you're not into heavy or spicy scents you can't help but like this. For many it's instant love.
I must praise the master / genius who created this Mr Dominic Ropion. I thank you sir for my favourite perfume. God bless you and your amazing nose and will to take risks potency and scentwise. Also to Kenzo for marketing it as it was and not asking Ropion to make it weaker to appeal to more sensitive noses. ❤️
This perfume will make you stand out from every other fruity flowery sweet and powdery woman around you. It's unique, nobody will know what it is and everyone will ask you. I've had strangers chase me down the street to ask what it is I'm wearing and where can they get it from? Only 1 person in 30 yrs has ever guessed what it was because their wife used to wear it. When you know, you know!
I will never be without a bottle of this ever, in fact l may demand that I'm sprayed with it for my funeral. I bet strangers will be gathered round my grave enjoying the Kenzo Jungle waft coming up through the soil and filling the air years after ive gone. 😆 🤣 😂
I used to wear this to college in the 90's and the students would know when I was in the building as soon as they walked into the place. They could smell this in the reception area all the way up the stairs and up 3 floors all the way down the corridors getting stronger the closer they got to our class, and l used to arrive much earlier than them. Its that strong.
Sooo... in conclusion this is amazing, if your not afraid of a savage beast perfume. It's also a beautiful bottle and it lasts a long time because with this, one spray really is enough. I use way more though, because I'm fearless like that. 😆 It gets sprayed all over my neck, shoulders, hair, wrists, clothes, l spray heavy because its so awesome and l dont care if it spices peoples brains out. I like to be wrapped in a cloud of expensive perfume and for those around me to smell a trail of my perfume, or what the hell am l spending all this money for, so l can hardly even smell myself? Hell no! I never understand why people think it's such a bad thing to have a trail of lovely perfume left in a room after you've left it. It's better than smelling people's farts, breath, dirty hair and sweaty bodies.
Yes indeed smell me London, inhale my fabulousness, you're welcome. 😆 🤣 😂
I give this perfume a 10/10.

My Blind buy. And i love it. This is truly a legend. The longevity of the fragrance is truly endless. Beast mode😁 I bought 30ml. And now I know that I will buy 100 ml. I'm falling in love with the smell itself over time. from the beginning it fails really strangely. But according to the review, I was expecting something worse. I realized one thing. The scent is ideal for layering. Anything you layer on top of the scent instantly puts her in beast mode. it's magic❤️I'm really looking forward to trying the scent in spring and summer. It doesn't feel like winter or Christmas to me. In the summer it can be completely different.
A festive Christmas toothache in the candle aisle at Marshall's.

Vicky_83 you have to make an effort and imagine that Jungle Ellephant is the best seller of all time from Kenzo and in Top 10 best selling perfumes in history, based in sold units. Briefly, it s a Legend.

Okay, so I love “mature” fragrances. However, this is too mature and not particularly feminine either. This fragrance, as many have mentioned, is a clove bomb. I would call it a clove Tsunami actually. This smells identical to toothache drops due to the prominent clove note. I tried to give it some time to see if the dry down over time would be more pleasant. Unfortunately, the dry down didn’t yield any favorable results. I’m sorry, but I just can’t imagine anyone actually liking this fragrance.
It's not bad, it smells like cinnamon love heart candies on me. I would suggest you try this before buying.

This is what I mean when I say maturity, but if it has one fan - thats me. Recognizable, from a million scents I wouldnt miss this one. European NY advent gatherings , Xmass spice blend, it warms me up in winter.

This was a blind buy for me and I was so hoping it would come to be a replacement for my beloved Cinnabar. I guess I don't understand the whole concept with this fragrance. The bottle is cumbersome and a strange shape, I don't think there is anything jungle-ish about it and I don't understand the elephant unless it's to indicate the scent's strength which to me is not that great.
It is not a beast to me, at least not in a good way. It isn't very spicy and seems sweet and creamy to me-very unlike the Cinnabar notes that I was hoping for which is clove, cinnamon, etc.
I do agree with others that it is reminiscent of a Christmas candle, albeit not an expensive one. I'll wear it on the weekends until it's gone, but I don't love it that's for sure.

Edit:
It's growing on me! I was even so bold as to overspray it today and I am getting it. I have tried a lot of new (to me) fragrances over the past couple of months and it is refreshing to put one on without the big, savory amber/ambroxen dry down that really bothers me. Thank god this is on my shelf. I'm sorry I was such a brat about it at first.
AND....I oversprayed it at 9 this morning and now at 12 its still going strong.

Wow, this is a beast. Two sprays from a travel flacon and my first thought was the scene in the film Jumanji with the herd of stampeding elephants and rhinos that trample everything in their path. Twelve hours later, I still smell Jungle L'Elephant, although it has calmed down to a lovely warm scent. It does remind me of Christmas candles in the dry-down. But that opening is an olfactory atom bomb.
I love wearing this fragrance around Xmas. It is a perfect compliment for the festive season as it is so rich and vibrant

I had this five years ago, but sold it; shifting tastes caused me to seek it out again, and I’m glad I did! Jungle l’Elephant used to strike me as a “Christmas candle” scent with an ultra-heavy ambroxan base gluing it down instead of grounding it. These days, I get a fascinating mix of cinnamon-camphor warmth (reminiscent of Tiger Balm), nutty cardamom, creamy tropical florals, and milky vanilla. I couldn’t detect anything floral in it before, and now I notice golden, syrupy ylang-ylang playing hide and seek with all the spices. Yet the biggest difference I notice now versus then is the presence of a fractalized patchouli note, smelling of wet potato skins, right after spraying. Earthy, creamy, warm-spicy. I’d wear this in warm weather as well, though it’s an obvious cold-weather grab. Facets of it remind me of both YSL Cinema and Initio Parfums Psychedelic Love. Always interesting, I don’t get tired of wearing this.

In the jungle, the mighty jungle, the lion sleeps tonight.

But the elephant NEVER sleeps.

Kenzo Jungle L'Elephant is aptly named. This is the elephant in the room. The most powerful of nature's beasts. This isn't a spice bomb. This is a spice tank. A juggernaut of warm, dry, spicy notes. It's a Christmas candle on the forest floor; the spice rack distilled in fluid form. It fills the radius with the wintry, pungent and earthy aroma of cumin, clove, cardamom and caraway, leaving a trail in its wake. It imprints its scent on everything it touches, with a half-life of hours, days, even weeks on both skin and fabric. Vanilla, the powerful queen of the perfume notes, is no match–she bows in submission, and her floral entourage soon follows. The fruity notes of mango and orange are content to be but mere participants in the elephant's majestic procession. Like its trumpeting cry as it echoes for miles, Jungle L'Elephant announces its presence–and that of its wearer–long before either can be seen.

The elephant is powerful. It can be ridden, but it cannot be tamed. It requires a strong rider. And alas, I am not worthy. I find that I cannot ride the beast. Perhaps it is something in my skin chemistry, or maybe it is my timid temperament. But alas, I do not ride the elephant. The elephant rides me. One spray and I was overpowered. I was overwhelmed, weighed down as though trampled upon by the mighty creature. Spicy notes are already tricky on my skin, and my own chemistry rendered them dirty, pungent and wild. But I cannot hate Jungle L'Elephant. You cannot hate an animal for doing what nature has intended. I am content to respect this magnificent beast, and admire it from afar.

Apply a light and gentle hand, lest the elephant go on a rampage.

I thought I'd love this...but I absolutely hate it. Love spices. But this is sooooo acrid, bitter and just horrible on me. Do not get vanilla or any sweetness. Just dry and bitter.
