Can't believe its the same perfume as reviews left below! Left to macerate for quite a few months. Nope. Just no. Have a huge bottle aswell. Ooops.
I have since learned to not blind buy.

This just arrived and I’m so stoked! It’s been on my wish list forever! I knew that I enjoyed this scent a long time ago when trying it in store not too long after it came out (!), at the time it was a bit too mature and powerful to my taste. These days it’s not widely available in physical stores here, so it was a semi blind buy. I knew I would likely enjoy it, as I adore spicy scents, but it was still a bit of a gamble. I found it online for under €60 for 100ml, which is more expensive than my usual maximum price for blind buys of €35-€40, but a solid deal in a fragrance family that is safe for my tastes.

Let me start with the bottle. Since I haven’t really looked at this bottle since the late 90s or early 00s, I didn’t really remember what the bottle looks like exactly. From pictures I assumed that the glass bottle was a simple rectangle, but this is not the case. The bottle makes a beautiful, subtle wave, making it more playful and elegant. The matte gold cap is made of real metal and it’s quite heavy. It fits very tightly on the bottle. I think the design is stylish and elegant, but to nee the matte gold makes it look like it’s plastic when it’s not. I think brushed gold, brushed stainless steel or silver/chrome might have made it look more sophisticated, although it’s possible that they’ve tripped those options and the matte gold worked best with this design.

**THE JUICE**

As soon as I spray it, I recognise the scent, I don’t know from who or where, but I know I’ve smelled it many times before, and I instantly love it.

The opening mainly revolves around cardamom supported by cloves and cumin. It transports me to markets in India, with the scent of spices in the air. I don’t perceive it as particularly christmassy or wintery, probably because there’s no cinnamon, which is the main holiday spice imo.

In the heart the ylang and heliotrope come forward along with the licorice and the scent becomes softer. The longer it develops on my skin the more the vanilla and amber come forward as well, making it softer and softer. This is not sweet, but it’s warm and soft. It’s like the hug of an Indian aunt who spends most of the day cooking all kinds of wonderful Indian dishes. It doesn’t smell so much as a perfume, but as an experience. It takes you to a place, an Indian spice market.

While not listed in the notes I keep thinking I smell Anise, which I think is an illusion of the liquorice mixing with the other spices. It also has an incense-like quality. Not a smoky incense, but something like nag champa sticks fresh from the box, also triggering visions of India.

While this scent is wonderful for fall and winter, I believe it can easily be worn in summer too. To me this scent is more reminiscent of the hot bustling spice markets in India or the Middle East, than of the holiday season, and because there’s very little sweetness, it’s not as likely to become cloying as some other scents.

I’ve only received this about two hours ago, so this truly is my very first impression. I might come back to expand on this review if my opinion changes (or the scent once it settles a bit), or when I’m testing it in different seasons/weather (it is winter now).

ETA: The scent is not nearly as powerful as I expected, I’ve applied twice now to experience the opening again, and it’s not overwhelming at all. However I believe this is because the bottle was very cold when I received it earlier today. I suspect the scent will become much stronger once the bottle settles and warms up more.

Other things I’ve noticed.. the vanilla and spices together remind me of cookies once the vanilla comes through more.. not your typical sweet gourmand perfume cookies, but some sort of more hearty spicy cookie that only has a hint of sweetness. The vanilla is quite fluffy and very creamy, and really fills your nose, similar to the vanilla note in Mancera Vanille Exclusive (just the vanilla not the perfume), albeit less prominent and slightly less dense.

When I breathe in and out on the wrist I’ve applied this on it releases more of the mango and green notes, which does give it more of a jungle vibe. I am guessing that with added humidity and warmth in summer it may well turn into a simmering subtropical rainforest. There’s also something pine like and herbal this way.

ETA2:
After reapplying liberally multiple times, and turning up the heating more in the evening, I finally get the holiday season connotations. It now smells like gingerbread! I’m not sure if other people overspray, of if the juice will become a lot more intense over time, but this was definitely not a one spray result. I also still feel like the scent is more exotic rather than Christmassy, but the gingerbread is there. I’m surprised at how gourmand this actually is. While I did expect it to smell spicy, I didn’t expect it to smell this edible. I expected a spicy oriental in a seductive and sexy way rather than a soft, fluffy, comforting way.

I blind bought this and I regret it so much. From the notes, I thought I was going to love this. I love sweet and spciy perfumes but this is not one. Sweet yes, but where the spice is I couldn't tell you.
White powdery toilet cleaner with a sweet, rotting mango underneath. Very like early Estée Lauder perfumes, like Cinnabar. 60s toilette and not in a good way. Dusty. Bitter palm leaf smell in the dry down, like rotting leaves.

I wouldn't even clean my house with something that smelt like this? HAd to scrub it off my wrist because the compost smell was too much for me.
Do not blind buy.

L'Elephant remains one of my most cherished perfumes to this day. I've owned this for years and I also have a back up bottle. Every year, I pull it out during the holiday season and those holiday spices are heavenly. I still only need one spray. L'Elephant is amazing on its own or layered to enhance a weaker perfume. One such combination is L'Elephant layered with Nebras to get a warm, spiced chocolate piece of heaven. This perfume remains a treasure in my collection and I am so happy to have it.

I used to love Jungle l'elephant, long time ago, I bought recently a bottle of a new version, is possible something went wrong with this bottle because the fragrance
smells very alcoholic, sour and acid at the same time. What a pity...

Whoa! This is intense! I sprayed the back of one hand just once, and I can smell this coming off me in great thundering gallumphing sense-memory-inducing monsoons! A few minutes after I sprayed it, I felt transported back to my childhood, wandering the aisles of Pier One while my parents searched for hippie home accessories and the like. Along with the 1970s-era Pier One smell, those resinous woods and mysterious unguents, I smell something I never experienced back then but would have loved I'm sure: a vanilla-chai latte. Behind all that is a sharp, almost piney-aromatic smell that feels sort of Christmas candle, but not in a bad way. I smell the cardamom and love it; the creaminess also. The musks don't read at all animalic to me, but I don't have a vintage formulation, only the current one from a Fragrance Net decant, so I can't say. This reminds me a little bit of Le Parfum by Lalique, except where that one has bay leaf for the aromatic, this one has something woodier and more piercing. It's also a lot sweeter and creamier than Le Parfum, which is on the crisp, nongourmand side of the vanilla spectrum. I like it a lot so far, but I could see this being oppressive if oversprayed, especially in the heat. As it develops, the gardenia comes through, and it's intoxicating.

I find myself thinking, in a circular, unsatisfying way, about the perfume's name. I understand the allusion to Jungle, of course, but it's still a strange and far from obvious choice. As Kenzo was surely aware, the elephant isn't celebrated nearly as often as the big cats in the perfume world. Elephants don't strike most people as sexy. And yet they are noble, beautiful, intelligent, and highly empathic animals--and increasingly in danger of extinction. Maybe Kenzo meant to draw our attention to their rarity, a rarity reflected in this strange and enormous, intelligent, refined, and LOUD af perfume.

Opens with heavy headache inducing spices fighting for attention, with cloves and cardamom standing on top. Then in the background an animalic musk holds everything together. Ultimately the cardamom reigns supreme with the animalic musk standing right behind.
As it dries down, it becomes more creamy, almost lactonic, with vanilla giving it a decent sweetness, reminiscent of Indian kulfi ice cream.
This is a very unique and artistic composition. Not for the faint at heart and definitely not blind buy safe. Exquisite and niche quality, but also quite a polarizing scent.
I can't really recommend this for any particular occasion, maybe winter holidays? Just make sure to go easy on the sprays if you will be indoors! This is powerful stuff!
Definitely not a scent for everyone, but I think every fragrance enthusiast should try this at least once.

This is a strong like for me. The opening was an old-school clove and amber, then some slightly chocolate-y patchouli; well-composed, but nothing I haven't smelled before where spicy fragrances are concerned. Then, it didn't exactly change character, but it grew into a lush and slightly fruity warm spicy-- much less clove and very little patchouli, but more of a perfectly balanced cinnamon, cardamom and fragile mango scent. I tested this in cold weather, but I would love to see what happens when heat and humidity press down on the level spiciness just to encounter what note pops out. I can imagine it would turn very luscious, since it proved unexpectedly transformational and pleasantly surprising on first test. That said, I can see how it could fairly be compared to a "holiday candle"; the evenness of the notes and the lack of a real muskiness to it can call to mind a house scent rather than skin scent.

Wow this is really stunning. I read so many reviews before buying and it was nothing like I expected.
First I’ll say this really evolves a lot and I don’t mean to say it’s bad at first it’s just not what the final smell will be. So I can see how a lot of people hate it at first smell. You need a chance to understand the full evolution of the perfume before deciding.
The opening is extremely green smell which I think I’m perceiving from the clove and cardamom, but even more I’d say it smells like fresh cinnamon sticks. Yes, I agree it smells like an expensive soap likely from the Heliotrope. Very clean smelling to my nose.
As it evolves I get this beautiful licorice smell coming through, then finally the vanilla comes.
It’s a very concentrated vanilla, not sickly sweet.
When it finally dries the clove becomes sweeter and I can see how people say it smells like a Christmas Candle, but there is something very sexy about it. It’s hard to describe. It smells like the inside of an expensive candle store. You can pick up the main notes, but there are other things there I can’t quite place. Sometimes the drydown reminds me of the quality of angel by mugler due to the strong cinnamon/vanilla & patchouli combo. Very unisex to me!

It really starts to get sweet in the end. It just smells expensive and spicy/sweet like a Christmas decoration store.
Very happy I purchased this! The bottle is beautiful! The elephant is huge!

I had this in the 90s and loved it. Decided to buy the new formula and it smelt nothing like i remembered. "Empty", watery, unpleasant version that remotely resembled the original. Was able to get a vintage miniature from a former perfume collector and OMG. There you are.... a deliciois juicy superbomb. Superconcentrated. Half a drop on the skin is enough to last all day. Any more will be cloying. Once it opens up on the skin - a compliment getter. Also, people really enjoy it layered with Revlon Charlie White. Creamy freshness and spices go well together

I used to hate this perfume because the weird smell, however lately i found nowadays this kind of rare quality scent would be more appreciated than new launch fragrances that smell quite mass. If i could describe, Jungle L'Elephant is giving imagination journey to exotic places like Thailand where you can smell the essence of exotic plants and fruit with touch of incense. This is not for everyone, would suggest you to try it first before you buy

Questo è un profumo meraviglioso, caldo, confortante,esotico e invernale.
Mi ha incantato dalla prima volta che lo ho provato nel 1996.
Ho confrontato una versione del 96 con una del 2010, la prima aveva un bouquet più denso,l'apertura mostrava liquirizia e spezie indiane che si sentivano da subito,la seconda invece ha un'apertura fredda e verde,canforata,seguita da chiodi di garofano che prevalgono su tutto il resto. Il profumo sembra più sfumato,meno denso. Nella prima il cuore risulta più cremoso,la speziatura resta sul bouquet e permane la liquirizia amara.il sottofondo mandorlato emerge dopo un bel po',la fragranza ha uno sviluppo più lento e graduale. Nella seconda si sente ancora il chiodo di garofano mentre il sottofondo si percepisce a malapena,si sente che c'è qualcosa di morbido e dolce ma è meno distinguibile.
Direi che sono buone entrambe ,ma ovviamente preferisco la prima,che dopo tempo è ancora cremosa e speziata.

I have that type of cursed body chemistry that just eats fragrances. Within 3 hours, nearly every fragrance I’ve tried is gone. Not skin scent. Gone.

But Jungle l’Elephant is the rare outlier that sticks with me. To the point where I need to think carefully about the environments I’m going to find myself in while wearing it, lest I overwhelm people with my fragrance. Two modest sprays is the absolute max I’d use, and even then only if I was going to be somewhere outdoors. I can spray this in the morning, and come evening, it’s still there, softer and closer to be sure, but still commanding a presence.

The smell is a spicy oriental. I don’t get any of the floral others have noticed. Lots of clove and cardamom. Patchouli at the end. A vintage smell to my nose- none of the sugary hyper girlish notes that so many modern fragrances give off to me. This is a fragrance has presence and commands respect- in the way being around an elephant does, I imagine.

This is a great fall/winter scent. Spicy, warm, and interesting enough to keep your attention during long dark winter days.

Perfect fall fragrance. I hate to be that girl but it really makes me think of pumpkin pie or a chai latte, it has those cozy, delicious spices that make you smell edible but it still has some grounded florals to keep it smelling designer and nuanced. It’s not exactly spicy and powerful in the empowering designer way, but it’s unusual and smile-inducing once it’s dries down a bit.

Makes me think of a dreamy fall day at a pumpkin patch with your best friend, running through a corn maze and drinking hot cider while sitting on a haystack. It’s even better when you feel the wind rush through your hair and you can smell the chai-latte, vanilla like scent. Comforting, warm, and memory invoking. If you love spicy vanilla scents you won’t regret this once!!

And I personally love the bottle. Cute little elephant :)
All day long Beautiful Fall scent

Thinking ahead to the colder days, I got my elephant bottle in the summer. I shyly dabbled in it as couldn't wait and already liked it back then. I mostly picked up a lot of licorice and more of the fresh spice. But then autumn arrived, the temperature dropped, my throat got a little scratchy and I was craving something warm and uplifting. Oh my goodness, I got just that and more. After sitting for a while, the scent got softer, warmer, rounder and it just sits beautifully on my skin and around me all day (2-3 sprays). It is powerfully enveloping, but not harsh or intruding. As much as I love my candles, I wouldn't compare it to one. For me, it's a gorgeous fairy dust of an amazing spice blend with just the right amount of sweetness.

As a teenager I worked in a small local perfume shop. Any time a customer tried Elephant I got a horrible headache that didn’t leave until the next day. While I don’t necessarily hate this perfume, this perfume sure hates me.
This never happened to me with any other fragrance.
Very spicey with some brown sugar. A bit plain and not too complex. I liked it in the 90s as it was a novelty back then to be so spicey and sweet.

It smells like a medicinal tea with a bit of brown sugar in it. I feel a lot of cumin and cardamom when I smell this and there's something about this that makes it nauseating for me. I think it might be the licorice undertone that I honestly don't like at all. I appreciate the novelty and the bottle is beautiful but not my cup of tea.

Christmas candle was a good description, and I do mean that in a positive way. I love Christmas candles. I ordered L'Elephant early this summer, smelled it, and promptly put it up on the shelf to save for a colder day.
I'll probably come back and add more thoughts after I've worn this more than once, but all I can say for now is WOW: this shit smells like gourmet vegan Smarties from a hippie supplement shop. Spicy, tart, fruity, sweet - I think it's the cardamom that makes it feel so edible, that and the vanilla. I wish I'd just gone ahead and gotten a big bottle instead of a miniature. I love it already.

What a beautiful perfume to wear it at home. Yes, it is beautiful, but its strength and notes are not suitable for this day and age. I still wear it, but only when I am alone, or going out on a snowy, cold winter day.

I love this.It's addictive.Although it does have that air freshner Christmas candle and a bit of fermented sausage smell to it,its very sweet warm and spicy oriental that still makes it very pleasant.
Longevity and projection is lacking on me unfortunately.Its not extreme as others describe it.
However it is wearable and I will show it love this time since I repurchased it.I had decluttered it in the past.

Absolute bomb of an opening. This is a powerful and spicy scent. It may just be the power of suggestion, but I definitely get the "gentle giant" vibe they are going for, from the strong spices contrasting with the soft flowers and wood. Wearing this, I feel like I should be sitting in the middle of a forest grove, communing with nature. I love this but have no idea when I would wear it. It's the sort of thing I would wear at home when the mood strikes, but not out and about. Well-executed concept.

This makes me smell like a spicy marshmallow and I love it.

Delighted that I don’t get any cumin.
Not getting any patchouli, either, but it’s vintage and who knows how it was stored, etc.

What an interesting and beautiful scent. I'd been putting off trying this bc I was worried it might be too in-your-face, overwhelming, and suffocating, but after finally taking the plunge, I'm so happy I got this. This is way softer and more graceful than I was imagining. And the evolution of it is so fun!

Upon first spray, I immediately get spicy, creamy white flowers. Like gardenias on a hot summer day, with someone smoking a clove cigarette in the background. As it develops, the clove comes forward, and its presence brings with it the mango, mandarin, and ylang-ylang. It's gives off a lovely "Christmas spices mulling on the stovetop" vibe. In the drydown, the clove fades into harmony with the other notes and settles nicely into a blend of warm vanilla, clove, gardenia, a hint of simmered orange, and a whisper of powdery ylang-ylang.

I definitely see why it's called L'elephant. This might be the "roundest" perfume I've ever come across. Absolutely no sharpness here, and it has a commanding-yet-gentle presence. The scent picture brings to mind the magic of spotting a majestic elephant while on a hike thru the lush jungle (as opposed to seeing a rampaging elephant tear thru the brush while on a safari tour, like I was originally picturing). To me, Kenzo Jungle L'elephant is quite in line with many of the 90's classics and their style of sweet, fluffy glamour, and I'm so glad we still have this in circulation.

Very strong and very spicy aura. Not for everyone.
I get most of the spice and strong patchouli when I sniff closely. Is very sharp when you bring your nose closer. You can't get any fruit or flower with a close distance.
When you move your body, some dry fruit scent do appear but very mild.
0 sweetness, is very dry and powdery scent.

This can be great for layering your perfume.
I tried to layer with Crystal Noir EDP, smell gorgeous with the L'elephant.
Might try a few option to match this. Can be very interesting.

About the bottle, the juice color and the elephant cap bottle is stunning.
Too bad this match with a square bulky body glass. Body glass shape can be better.
I have two bottles, one from the 90s and the current one. To be honest, this must be the only one perfume that smells exactly the same despite the reformulations. Great for Kenzo!

I am French Caribbean and this fragrance feels like home. It reminds me of the kind of dessert we serve in Martinique and Guadeloupe. This is thick, warm. It can definitely be worn in warmer climates but should not be over-sprayed as this fragrance can surely become sickening .

I am more into niche / luxury fragrances and if I had not been recommended that fragrance by another Fragrantica user, I would have never tried it.

Christmas in a bottle! Stunning scent with great performance. Right in the middle unisex. This definitely will pierce through the cold, but I also think it can be worn during the hotter days. The fleeting tropical fruity and floral scent comes out between the different spicies makes it spring and summer appropriate. The sweetness is light, too. Dominique Ropion has done it again and again. Side note, Kenzo and Cartier are probably the most underrated designer houses out there.

Unique and captivating! All these spices enhanced with fruity and vanilla notes seduce me. The bottle is pretty, but bulky. I was reluctant about the cumin and caraway, but it's skillfully balanced with cardamom and floral notes. What originality!!! The first dominant note is really that of clove.

Performs like a spicy niche on a budget price.

I have a lot of love for this 90s spicy powerhouse. Luckily it smells similar to how I remember it & performs reasonably well. In a blind sniffing I would believe it was high end & it is definitely a love it or loathe it scent.

It is ALL kinds of spice. Deep, vibrant, resinous & in your face. The cloves take centre stage but it’s not your average Christmas scent. It is unique & chaotic & absolutely fabulous. Even the dry down is a deliciously bonkers cardamom vanilla. There is warmth, but low, mellow sweetness. There is dry spice tempered with rich, dried peel. This is the kind of fruit cheese or chutney you’d pair with a particularly funky blue cheese. It’s bold, unabashed a real trip.

Bland is boring. Elephant is bold & bonkers. Absolutely adore it.

This is such a classic! I discovered this fragrance trough my mom, since she owned the original bottle in the 90s. I am usually fond of oriental, sweet and gourmand fragrances, so I knew I would love this one as well. This perfume was LOVE AT FIRST SIGHT! When you first spray this fragrance you instantly get hit with this sweet, almost honey-sweet cumin and cardamom note. It almost reminds me of those spiced Christmas cakes you eat during holidays. The smell slowly progresses into a fruity mandarin note which is so nicely blended with the spices. I also get just a hint of mango in there. The drydown is a classic vanilla scent. This is definitely a love or hate type of perfume, not for the faint of heart. The price is reasonable in my opinion. This scent leans more feminine. If you are a fan of sweet and spicy oriental perfumes, you should definitely try this out!

Burvīga. Manuprāt saka taisnību, vai nu tu iemīlies vai ienīsti šo aromātu.Rudens,ziemas mēnešos lieliski sasilda, karstos vasaras mēnešos nedaudz smacē. Der gan viens pšiks dienā gan divi,trīs pšiki vakarā.

What an interesting fragrance. It smells like Christmas but would be equally appropriate for hot, balmy weather. It opens sweet with the orange, but dries down spicier. One time I wore it, I got tons of cinnamon and clove (like cinnamon gum). Another time the cumin was overtly strong and it gave it a savory food smell. It's exotic, unique, and like no other fragrance I've encountered before. It's also incredibly strong - both in projection and longevity. Great powerhouse and really is underpriced for what it is, it feels very niche.

Every kind of spicy: soft spicy, sharp spicy, cinnamon, ginger, clove. It’s very arousing, to the point where it might be difficult to sleep. Smells very nice, but like nothing so much as a good stick of cinnamon chewing gum. Might be great for layering. I like it. But it doesn’t exactly make you smell expensive.
Smells very Indian. Like you just walked into a shop of Indian-import wares owned by a white hippie who loves incense (not like an actual Indian grocer). Quite intense
This is one of the most amazing summer fragrances. Liquid gold and spices. Warm skin, sand, sweat and sunset. Best suited for hot summer nights, star gazing and kissing under the night sky.

Sticks around for HOURS, great longevity. The fragrance is a mix of spicy clove and sweet licorice, I was surprised that cinnamon isn't listed. I thought this would be really outdated but this could easily have been released in 2023.
I love it! It smells like fall, Christmas, unburned clove cigarettes, and comfortable house smells. It lasts all day and made the teller at the bank sneeze lol; but I love it.
A warm spicy embrace. Smells like luxurious winter holidays. My first ever perfume and I am still in love with it many years later. It's quite heavy, so a little goes a long way.

I was afraid this would be so spicy it’d be hard to wear. It’s definitely not hard to wear! At first I got a mixture of vanilla and a lightly mentholated clove. I’m glad the vanilla is as forward as it is. The spices are light, not opium level. Kind of reminds me of the spice in Ivory Route, almost creamy. I’m digging it.

Whole Lotto Ylang-Ylang, but more: like i'm in --yes-- a jungle, but down on the forest floor with my nose under a tree root where someone stashed their spice collection. I think it's the licorice that creates space/sharpness, stops everything from becoming dank and dark. Very interesting layered situation. Clove stands up in the drydown. I agree with 'cinnamon raisin toast' as described below. I would follow someone home who smelled like this.

Kenzo jungle elefante compatilhavel pesada especiada doce viciante amo isso nota de cravo da índia evidente.
Fragrância com cheiro único

I get the whole cold weather/holiday comments, but for me, this fragrance comes alive in the warm months, when it can breathe and move in the breezes. There is a tropical vibe that just sings in warm weather. I've been wearing this for 20 years and will always have a bottle. It's so addictive, strange, amd wonderful.
the amount of different spices makes me disoriented and confused. i dont think this is a well blended perfume, definitely not classy and unfortunately i dont see the appeal:(
It’s so strange and that’s what I LOVE about it. Truly unique, every time I wear it I get the whole experience!

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Spring Fragrance Kenzo
review_content: Not my personal favorite. I'm not a huge floral person. I was stole this from my older sister and it's been my scent for a while. I loved it at the time, but grew out of it. I would definetly reccomend, but I just grew out of this style!

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Spring Fragrance Kenzo
review_content: If you're looking for a mature floral fragrance and wish to add a little luxury to your everyday routine, this is the one for you. It's effortlessly elegant yet easy-going and uplifting, also perfect for many occasions. The delicate bottle catches my eye from afar and looks gorgeous on the shelf at home. Pleasure for both senses, so to speak.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Spring Fragrance Kenzo
review_content:
Another Kenzo Flower Gem :)
Till now I have not yet smelled a flanker that disappoints me. They're all good! In every flanker you can still smell the character of the original Flower. But they all differ from it in stunning ways.
They're all beautiful :)
♥♥♥♥

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Spring Fragrance Kenzo
review_content: Got as gift from very very special person 2 years ago im not willing to finish the bottle 1st coz of its nice smell 2nd coz it is special !

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Spring Fragrance Kenzo
review_content: can't believe such a special fragrance has been tried by so little amount of people here..you must take a whiff of this ladies..it's spectacular!!!

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Spring Fragrance Kenzo
review_content: Smell nice..does long lasting.. my mum's fav

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Spring Fragrance Kenzo
review_content: A bit similar to Prada Infusion d'Iris, a bit less intense. Very lovely and easy to wear.

My nose reads the opening as more cucumber-fresh than lotus on my skin – probably because I encounter cucumbers more often than real lotus. The mimosa’s honeyed sweetness rises slowly and softly, cushioned by a clean white-musk veil. The touch of sandalwood and ambroxan is so restrained that nothing sticks out; it simply adds body to that "refreshing sweetness".

It’s minimalist, intimate, and zen – but not flat or strictly linear. A calm, contemplative skin-scent that fits Kenzo’s ethos beautifully.

For those who remember the Kenzoki line from the mid-2000s, there's no need to explain what this fragrance smells like. It's impossible to forget the soft, slightly powdery, "rice-like" scent of their body and face creams. I got them around 2003 and thought, "What a great scent, I want a mist with this!" And a couple of years later, they actually came out – I happily bought them: Rice, Lotus, Bamboo.

Holding those jars and bottles was a separate aesthetic pleasure; they felt like velvet to the touch, and the creams melted on the skin, leaving that light haze and aura :)

In fact, I'm very glad that the company decided to continue this idea a decade later (it's been about 10 years, hasn't it?) and slightly reinterpret these fragrances – they're worth it.

By the way, they have a magical property – when needed, they can calm your nerves at night, and when needed, they can energize you in the morning after a shower and workout.

The modern version is slightly more long-lasting than that mist, but overall, it's the same thing.

Recommendation: definitely worth trying!

As someone who is into quite powdery clean smells and does not like overly floral or sweet notes, I really like this perfume. It gives me an instant feeling of cleanness and freshness. I have to say, I do not smell “lotus” in it — It has a very soapy/shapooey smell, in my opinion. But it is an expensive natural soapy smell mixed with a breath of fresh air after rain, which I love. The first perfume after Chloe Love (which was discontinued) that gives me similar vibes. But unlike Chloe, it is more calm and neutral. Not overpowering or irritating, very delicate. Settles in a musky smell. It lasts a good amount of time and does not get “heavy” as it fades. It is quite a pricy perfume, but I never regretted buying it.
It smells delicate, clean and non-intrusive. Easy everyday wear. A bit too expensive for what it is, imo.

It smells like detergent. With, I perceive, cumin? No lotus, no sandalwood. Just a strong musky mimosa that reminds me of toilet cleansers :/.

Unfortunately, it's my least favorite of the range...

5/10

My forever signature I always come back to. Delicate, elegant and comforting scent without that soapy/shampoo-ey feel. To me, it's smell of air after rain in the early autumn (you get it, right?) mixed with a hint of something sweet/floral. Dries down to a beautiful musky woody base, surprisingly deep and creamy for an aquatic/ozonic perfume. Sometimes sandalwood takes the lead in the composition which I don't mind too, as I love its smell. Mimosa is quite prominent but it's balanced so well by the lotus and woody notes, it's not at all straightforward. I am really in love with the scent. Works best in rainy/foggy weather.

This perfume is very calming and soothing. A few years ago, kenzo launched a skin care line and the purple cream smelt exactly like this. So glad, as I could have bought the cream only for the fragrance it had. It is powdery in a grown up version and it lasts a lot too.

LOVE THIS!!! ❤️❤️
It's become my new favorite perfume and personal scent.

Stunning lotus scent. Love it at the first smell, it give me chill and calm vibe. Never found something similar to this before.

I don't know why no one talk about this. It's hard to find any review online. I bought a sephora trial set first and going to buy a full bottle one.

I always liked The Favourite by Penhaligon's, but something in it also irritates me, there is some sort of underlying screechy sweetness, but Reve Lotus is such a stunning mimosa. Quite similar to The Favourite, except this is lighter, more introverted and subtle. Beautiful beautiful mimosa. I know the title says lotus in it, but the lotus only supports this stunning mimosa. Smells heavenly. Aquatic, powdery and musky, which is an interesting combination, but works so well. I can sense some similarity to Jo Malone's Mimosa & Cardamom, but I find this more beautiful, as that one is almost bold for a mimosa and Reve Lotus is lyrical. +

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Pour Femme Hyper Wave Kenzo
review_content: clean. lotus is musky on my skin. sweet dry-down that mellows as it dries down. too reminiscent of an old air-freshener from my childhood for me.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Pour Femme Hyper Wave Kenzo
review_content: The more I wear It, the more It reminds me of Aqua di gioia.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Pour Femme Hyper Wave Kenzo
review_content: Fresh, green, aquatic, light. I am really Into in, just wanted It to last longer.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Pour Femme Hyper Wave Kenzo
review_content: The more I wear it, the more I love it. Why didn't anyone mention it clearly has Zarkoperfume's vibes? Smells very similar to one of their molecules, at least on my skin.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Pour Femme Hyper Wave Kenzo
review_content: i normally would never pick this but my boyfriend gifted me this for valentines and I LOVE IT!! my first citrusy fragrance!! it feels so in sync with me, so energizing and feminine and feels like a bright wide smile while the sun shines in the back of your silhouette <3

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Pour Femme Hyper Wave Kenzo
review_content:
Lovely flanker of a timeless classic. Opening is very fruity, not sweet though. It doesn't remind me of grapefruit, more like a unripe tangerine. Feels bitter and dry, based on paper sample I expected it to be juicier.
Later on lotus starts to be more prominent, giving the scent aquatic Kenzo vibe, reminding the familiar DNA.
Projection is not big, just like with the original. But it's a lovely, citrusy summer scent.

The OG has been my summer signature for years. I blind bought this 30 ml flanker to give it a twist from time to time. And I'm happy with it.

7/10

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Pour Femme Hyper Wave Kenzo
review_content: Not sure if notes description here is correct. To my nose the scent appears to be more complex than just 3 notes listed. This one does have similarities with the original L’eau, but feels a bit more fruity and juicy. Maybe its lotus that gives me a very pleasant & refreshing vibe, kind of like wet tea leaf. A very underrated fragrance imo. Surprisingly decent longevity and sillage considering its an EDT and a fresh scent.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Pour Femme Hyper Wave Kenzo
review_content: Great lotus.... Its really nice.. for spring and summer:) I am more into warmer than fresh scents.. but.. my mind circles around this beauty..

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content: This was my mom’s signature scent for my entire childhood. It’s been used up since long time ago, but I can still remember exactly how this smelled. It’s classy and feminine, yet soft and beautiful. Not obnoxious at all, yet so memorable.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content: This scent is addictive, memorable, powdery, sweet but never cloying, elegant and cozy at the same time. I love Alberto Morillas.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content:
Incredible, powdery, sweet, but never cloying, the smell is absolutely addictive, and I’ve been addicted for years. If I knew that it was discontinued when I was buying my last bottle — I would have cleared out the store shelves. I was prepared to wear this for the next hundred years. It’s the only perfume that I never get tired of, or bored with, it never caused a headache or burned my nose (I am overly sensitive). I would go into debt to bankroll an Inception-style heist to plant an idea into Alberto Morillas’ head (or Kenzo CEO) to get this perfume into their regular non-limited edition production. I am using the last bottle extremely sparingly, good thing this perfume lasts forever on dresses, scarves, and coats.
L’Elixir came close, but this is the scent I will forever hallucinate about. The powderiness of it is perfect — I have never ever encountered anything similar, and I’ve been hunting powdery scents. It blends with my skin chemistry in a way I’ve never encountered before or after. I will genuinely be devastated when I will spray the last drop. I’m not sure I will be able to throw out the bottle.
If anyone has any recommendations for other Alberto’s perfumes that remind you of it — please share. Most of the time I genuinely prefer not wearing any perfume if it’s not this.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content: My mother used to wear it. Back then I wasn't too fond of her powdery sweet fragrances. She wore Alien as well, and Sun Moon Stars, Eclat d'Arpege... I now see that she had pretty good taste, and I often found myself secretly misting myself with her way too heavy (for 10yo me) scents. This one in particular always smelt so much like marshmellows to me. I might try to get my hands on this one, just for nostalgic memories. Now I'm a bit older and am appreciating these sweet scents alot more, I wonder if I would actually like it now!

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content:
My mom bought this perfume in 2003/2004 and never really wore it. She gave it to me 10 years later. I have been nursing it ever since. The scent has not spoiled at all - I wear it every fall and winter - a little goes a long way and it lasts forever. My scarves smell like this all season so sometimes I don't even have to re-apply. It's at the point where my closest friends and family know it as my signature scent.
I want to be able to wear this literally for the rest of my life.
I hope to find another bottle one day!

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content: Come Back please!!!was beautiful!!

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content:
I bought a very old bottle, has to be 2003 not 2013 given the state of the box and research I've done. The bottle having been sealed up for so many years remained unscathed and the juice inside pristine. Unbelievable juice from Kenzo. The best of Flower hands down. It smells niche by today's standards, there is nothing "designer" about this stuff, especially not in 2021. I can't believe my nose, this fragrance was way ahead of it's time. If you wanted Lipstick, this would have been your girl. It reminds me a little bit of Drole De Rose, with the violet and rose, almond, musk. But Le Parfum is denser and smells of higher quality. It's more Lipstick-y than Drole with less powder, more creaminess and a subtle waxy sweetness.

I'm not a big fan of Alberto Morillas' work, but this is exceptional. It's to die for. I have the 50 mL parfum spray, but would like to try Just A Drop and Satin Spray some day. L'Elxir is a completely different scent. Le Parfum is far and away the winner of the two, for me. Being a parfum, it stays closer to the body but lasts extremely well. I'm very thankful to have been able to acquire this beauty. I love everything about it. It was snowing today and Le Parfum was an absolute dream.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content:
I naively sold my bottle years ago, before I knew of it's discontinuation......and now of course you can't find it anywhere.

Smooth, delicious powdery vanilla almond violet. A lot better that the OG in my opinion. Stupid young me though it was 'too heavy' for day wear and I'd never finish it, as all we wore were fruity florals back then. If only I had known that perfumes of this type don't really turn, especially not in an opaque bottle......

Strong sillage and eternal longevity.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content:
I have had both Kenzo Flower in the sheer bottle w/ lovely poppy flower decoration- and this one, in the vibrant red bottle.
I like them both, but Le Parfum (created in 2003) is rounder, deeper and more sophisticated than its predecessor (born in 2000).
Kenzo Flower Le Parfum is a powdery iris/violet/ vanilla/amber mix.
So, cuddly, elegant, warm, soft...reminds me of my childhood.
You get this huge was of baby powder (iris and violet).
The base is a soft, almost gourmand vanilla musk accord, but the amber makes is so cozy and wintry.
Definetely a winter fragrance to me, evokes a soft warm blanket.
It's easy to wear, does not need to much thinking or exotic occasions to be worn.
A little treasure!
_______________

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content: Amazing scent. I adore this perfume. Idk why but it's reminding me of lipstick in a sweet way. It's classy and different for sure.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content: My signature perfume and one of the most beautiful perfumes ever. So tender and powdery. To me, main notes are vanilla and sweet almond. On my skin, it is very long lasting. Unfortunately, I think that Kenzo has stopped producing it. All I can see are flankers of the original version :-(

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content: First time I smelled this perfume was I'm my friend and I was overwhelmed it's strong but gentle in same time it's just amazing perfume 4 ladies Who know how to represent themselves without saying anything it's simply amazing

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content: Honestly ...this is sof and feminence scent is my favourite for all time... I am very sad though that was just alimited edition and cant seem to find someting even a slight similer to it in the market

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content:
Fragrance Review For Flower Le Parfum By Kenzo

Notes: Almond Violet Rose Amber Vanilla Musk

This is one of the flankers for the original Flower and has a sweet powdery but tragically short life, just like a real flower! I detected the rose but I've smelled better rose fragrances. Soft delicate rose with powdery attar. The violet is what most jumps out at me. For whatever reason I always immediately pick up on violet notes. The floral scent is very nice but I wish it lasted longer. The dry down is vanilla and amber very much a soap scent clean and uncomplicated. There is a touch of musk but I found it to be very light. An inoffensive, easy to wear, any occasion perfume.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content: This perfume is very pretty, romantic, classy and sweet. It's very much a Valentines Day fragrance. For women who love roses and want to smell good for their man. I detect a slight similarity to Elizabeth Taylor's Diamonds and Rubies, but this one is less floral. The rose and violet notes really stand out and they're sweetened by almonds and vanilla. An enchanting seductive scent of powder wafts up now and then a bit like rose powder. Sweet and soft, subtle, elegant and less floral than you'd expect even with a name like Flower. This should be called Vanilla Rose. I love fragrances like this and at the end you get blissful amber. Perfection.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content: just love it! it is so powdery and gentle. I just ordered my third bottle! :D

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content:
I find it interesting that no one is stating which formulation of this one they have: Satin Spray (75ml), Natural Spray (50ml) or Just a Drop (15ml). I think that makes a different in application, and possibly in how the scent will wear on the skin. I have the 15ml "Just a drop" formulation, which goes on as a thick liquid gel in drop form when you spray (as opposed to a spritz on the skin). I think this formulation gave me decent longevity (8 hours now, mostly a faint skinscent on me but still there, a bit).

That being said, I am disappointed in this one. I had hoped the almond note would show up on me in some way, shape, or form, but it made absolutely NO appearance. From first spritz to drydown, all I got was powdery violet (really heavy baby powder) and heavy white musk. There may have been a tiny whiff of rose, but it was very much overpowered by the baby powder and white musk on my skin. This is very sad indeed, as this one is getting harder to find and I had really hoped it would be a gem. All I can say is, it's a lovely scent if you love powdery violet and musk. For me, it's heading to the swap list, it just doesn't wow me otherwise.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content: I have a bottle of Amour Le Parfum from 2008 that lasts and projects over 20 hours with one spray, so when I saw this Flower Le Parfum I was quite excited to pick it up. Unfortunately, though the bottle I received is about the same age, there is almost no scent at all from the juice. It goes on as a skin scent!! Very disappointed.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content:
Love this perfume, it makes me feel so special!
So hard to get, I was lucky enough to get it while visiting Fuerteventura

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content:
Every time I wear a new Kenzo, I fall more in love with the house. This is the only house who seems to get a lot of fun out of taking chances with gourmand notes, and all with an Asian flair. If you've never worn Flower, you should know that it's the perfumers interpretation of a poppy flower. Poppies don't have any scent, so the entire composition is made up, and it does smell unlike any flower I've smelled, which is why I like it - because it doesn't have any discernible floral notes, however, you CAN smell the gourmand notes and I love it for that too. It gives me the sensation of dreaming while my eyes are open.

I was hesitant to wear this parfum version even though I've had it for a few years, because I LOVE the original Flower, so thank God I finally tried it because I love it.

The Kenzos have amazing longevity. This is the parfum satinant version in the original formulation with the all red bottle. It's been nearly 3 hours and the top notes are just beginning to settle. I was afraid this version would be too heavy in this super hot weather, and I am glad I was wrong. This is actually much lighter than the original and it has a halo effect - meaning, I can't smell it when I press my nose to my wrist, but I smell a halo of fragrance all around me.

It started very very powdery, but with an underlying current of warm resinous vanilla and almond. It is - at the same time - lighter and more airy than the original, but also fuller and warmer. Luca Turin gave it 3 stars and calls it a coffee vanilla and I completely agree. I make a chocolate coffee pudding sometimes when I have leftover coffee because it makes the chocolate more chocolatey and the same is true of this perfume. The coffee note made the vanilla and almond more vanilla-ish, more custardy, rounder, and heavier as a base. The floral notes are lighter and more airy than the original too. This is the perfect scent for hot weather, whereas the original Flower is better in cold weather. It's somewhat linear, but has insane longevity. I love it.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content: I ordered mine online from Nordstrom in summer of 2013.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content: where did u get it @wendyangeln? Can i buy it online as i am in SA?

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content: used this once and i cant forget it cos i loved it very much but i have never been able to find it anywhere. where can i get it?

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content:
I have it in Just A Drop (15ml).

Le Parfum is sensational. Literally. I bought this a few weeks ago. Normally when I buy a new bottle I will have eyes for nothing else for about a week and I'll keep sniffing and spritzing. New love, you know? But with Flower Le Parfum, OH MY GOSH. I cannot get over this. I put it on and every time I feel like... it's magical, honestly. This is vanilla-powder-floral HEAVEN. Not much development on me, it's just vanilla and powder and violet on me for the most part, but I notice that when I'm warmer it gets a little bit deeper, like there's a nutty quality (roasted almond to me) that deepens when it's warm. Ugh I adore this stuff.

The bottle is wonderful - it's opaque so I can put it on my dresser without worrying about light ruining it - yay! And it's tiny enough to throw in a purse - not that you would need to, since this stuff lasts FOR.EVER. I kid you not. It is so longlasting I can put it on in the morning and wear it all day and come home and shower... and it'll still be there on my wrists IN THE MORNING. Let's just praise God for this for one second :D

The consistency of the perfume is so new to me - I love it! Almost like a perfume gel? They should do more of these. Oh and when they say, just a drop, they mean just a drop. One drop of the gel is easily dabbable between wrists and on the neck. And I pat my cleavage with my wrists as well, where it warms up nicely and drifts up to my nose intermittently throughout the day - just to say hi :) ONE DROP.

This is... I don't know, I feel like I need to buy ALL THE BOTTLES that are left in te world, because I will never ever EVER be able to be without this. Winner.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content: This smells resinous and drier than Flower EDP. It is clearer and darker, if that makes sense, from the fluffy powder smell of the EDP. I really like how it smells grown up and simple. They smell related to me, but they do not smell like the same perfume. I really like the woodsy notes that cast this in a more mature light for me. I only have the old formulation so am using that sparingly, since I don't plan on getting the reformulated "le parfum" when mine runs out.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content: I love this perfume, but I only like Flower. On me they are quite different. The opening of Flower is like when you've thrown too much powder on baby and it's gone up your nose, and you look down to find you are all white. The violet comes a little later, and although the drydown is nice I'm never 100% sure. Le Parfum smells like Birds custard powder instead. It's calmer, less pungent, sweet creamy and yellow with a little rose, whereas Flower is white brittle and dry with a little violet. Hard to find, and a sad shame it is because I'll cry when mine runs out.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content:
This smells very similar to the regular Flower - powdery, creamy, violetty, vanillic, woody.

But even though this is a "parfum" I think it has more freshnes than the regular Flower. I can almost smell some fruit here, but it may be my strange nose, since no fruits are listed among the notes?

Thank you for the sample Denise! :-)

Update: I just googled the notes in this one, and there are supposed to be black currant in it, perhaps that is my "mystery" fruity note.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content: I found recently in a German perfumery a new reformulated version of Flower le parfum. The scent has changed a bit, not so nice as an old version so check the code number or colour of packaging /the old one only in red , the new one 3 sides red, front in white/.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content: One note wonder. Clean and fresh yes. Powder central. That’s all I am left with. Perhaps it’s my skin chemistry. Oh how I wish I got more of the almond or rose. I am paranoid I smell like a grandmother.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content: A lot of almond, sweet vanillary powder. But powder is less sharp and annoying then in original Flower. Obviously I like that more. Staying power is very very good.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content:
Powdery
Milky
Velvety
Smells a lot like vanilla-milk pudding with almonds.

The best Flower, Le Parfum is rounder and creamier than the regular one.

EDIT: I'm almost sure that the formula has been changed.
I have the bottle from 2004 and from 2012 and the juice is quite different.
The old one has definitely more vanilla, becomes more powdery and is more concentrated as Hadassa mentioned.
The new one is brighter in the opening (I may even say fresher) and I don't get that much of vanilla-milky notes. It's not so strong and powdery as the old one.

I'm writing about the 50ml parfume spray.

Still, the best Flower.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content:
Today I get more of the violet & rose as prominent notes, with a scrumptious amount of almond & vanilla...
Damm, this is really good stuff!!!
I honestly have to say that this one and 'Kenzo Flower Essentielle' are 2 of the best fragrances I ever had. Both are more amazing than I could ever express!!
~L O V E~

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content:
I agree with another reviewer... this smells like vanilla ricepudding with a topping of almond crumbs... it smells really delicious! There's a light floral note in the background as well...
I'll get myself a back-up bottle soon! This is definitely a keeper!!

♥♥♥♥♥

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content:
This is the best powdery perfume I have ever tried, and I have tried a lot, as I am a certified powder freak ;)

I dislike the original Flower to be honest; it's too bland. And this one... I am just crazy about it!

As a mother I know how addictive and beloved your baby's skin scent might be. And FLOWER LE PARFUM, to my nose, is the closest representation of it. It's a soft, tender, clean, milky, sweet scent of the velvety skin. It makes me swoon!

The only problem is that when I wear it I cannot concentrate, I keep sniffing my wrists all the time!

Someone said here that it reminds her of breastfeeding. It does! For me, breastfeeding is the fondest expression of love between mother and child, the most natural and touching. This perfume certainly reminds me of this kind of feeling.

I am a happy owner of two bottles, one made in 2005, another brand new (2012). I have to say that the older one seems to be more dense and concentrated, probably it has changed over time.

I highly recommend to catch it while you can.

10/10, pure love and innocence

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content:
Flower Le Parfum opens with the incense-like sharpness as the original Flower. For the first hours, I can detect a slight play-doh scent due to vanilla + almond. At this stage it's like hiding Hypnotic Poison under the signature sharpness of Flower. Towards the drydown, it smells very close to the original to my nose, just more intensive and a little warmer due to the presence of amber.

I totally agree with bhean_sidhe that the original Flower is "ghostly", always there but never in a solid form. However, Flower le Parfum, though more intense, is still "ghostly" IMO. Although I love Flower, thus love Flower le Parfum, I have to admit that these two are too similar to own both, unless you're a die-hard fan or you got a bargain.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content:
Flower by Kenzo le Parfum 75 ml satinant. When I spray on my skin its a bit oily at first, so I guess this one has no alcohol. 5 minutes later a wonderful scent appears. Love this one. I can smell mostly Almond, Opoponax, Amber, Vanilla and soft Violet. Lovely. On my skin this one is a bit like Prada L'eau Ambree - not exactly the same but very alike.

Flower by Kenzo le Parfum 75 ml Satinant. När jag sprejar på den på huden så upplever jag den som lite oljig, så denna innehåller nog ingen alkohol. 5 minuter senare så sprids en ljuvlig doft runt mig och jag älskar den. Jag känner mest Mandel, Opoponax, Amber, Vanilj och lite Viol. Härlig. På min hud så påminner denna om Prada L'eau Ambree, de är inte kopior på varann, men lika varann.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content: My all time favourite, I wish it was still in production.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content:
Why on earth is this called Flower? I walked into my local Nordstrom today to try on some new perfumes and accidentally tried this one by mistake. The bottle was shaped similarly to another Kenzo I have in my "try it on" file.

Wow! This smells amazingly NOT like flowers (bleh). It's powdery with creamy warm amber and sweet vanilla. No flowers. It smelled great hours later and got the thumbs up from my hubby. She shoots, she scores!

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content:
Lovely! Great vanilla/musk scent. Less is more, spray carefully or it will turn thick and heavy. No sweet notes, this one is a keeper. I love it. Sad for me this is hard to find to buy.

Härlig! Underbar vanilj/musk doft. Lite är lagom, spreja försiktigt annars blir detta en rumsdödare. Inga sockersöta doftnoter, vilket jag gillar starkt. Jag bara älskar den. Tyvärr är den svår/omöjlig att hitta i affärerna numera.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content: I love it. My husband adores it

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content:
I had the bottle. At first I had a sample though and I liked it so I thought about buying a whole bottle. When I finally found it and bought it, I noticed that the scent is simply too tiring for me.

The scent is a bit similar to Kenzo Amour Le Parfum, I mean both scents have something "holy" - opponax doesn't figure in a list of ingredients here but I suppose I read somewhere it is in the fragrance and it gives the "holy" feeling. Also in the end the scent becomes milky - it's nice but holy milk reminds me about breastfeeding ;) and a high pressure of breastfeeding in my country so no, thank you... Actually opponax, almonds and milk comes into play on me the most - but opponax is the most intensive making the scent so "holy" that I feel uncomfortable. Holy earth, holy milk...

The fragrance is thick and oily, lasting power is a killer really, in my opinion lasts longer than Elephant because when a drop of the fragrance is put on something (I was preparing a small sample and a drop was left on a desk), it lasts and lasts for almost one month!. The bottle is pretty, it's even prettier in reality than in a photo, it really looks pretty on the shelf. All in all, it's not my kind of fragrance but it's a very good one, I have to admit. Well done!

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content:
The best perfume. It smells the way marzipan tastes with vanilla mixed into rice pudding. Nothing smells like Flower by Kenzo..
At first it has a baby oil smell going on but it dries down to something delicious but nothing like the cheap dessert scented products you can find anywhere. It really is a unique smell. Milky, almond, vanilla, baby oil, really subtle hint of rose and that's it.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content: Loving that...more than the original version that actually smells like baby :)

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content: Light easy perfume which is lovely in the summer and takes you through into autumn. never tire of it.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content: This is truly an intense version of the original Flower. It is a bit warmer compared to the original, and it starts out sweeter. Not bad, lasting power is good. There is a hint of some chemical coming through though (just like the original for first couple of hours).

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content: Scent of my first LOVE, my one and only LOVE...

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content: The gorgeous, sultry, sexy sister of Kenzo Flower, Flower Parfum (In some reviews this is called Flower Red, for the red bottle) she comes out at night after having bathed in almond scented bath oil, nibbling marzipan so that her skin exudes a heavenly nutty scent, her breath is satin and so so voluptuous and enveloping. Touch her and touch oil of darkest reddest roses and musk. Wait with her and amber and iris come out to play. Flower is pretty, gorgeous, complicated and sweet. But oh my god Flower Parfum is so much more, it promises and it delivers. It doesn't just tease. It's tactile, overtly sexual. You would wear this for a soul moment, a deeply intimate encounter - after Flower has been tucked up in bed and kissed off to sleep hours ago.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content: vanillia milk rice pudding with almond crumble :-) yummy yummy!! its so delicious!! Delightful Vanillia, a warm and gentle scent, that melts with your skin! i don´t like any Kenzo perfumes but this one i´m addicted too!!

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content: This is basically the same as the original. Let me correct myself, not basically, it IS the same. It's the same baby powder smell as Flower by Kenzo, no more intensity, no less.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content: Le Parfum is a sweeter and warmer version of Flower by Kenzo.This is good for people how like the original scent but want more sweetness.I prefer the original because i love the scent and in this fragrance the typical "scent" is only in the background not dominant.When you take the first sniff you know why it's a Elixir it's very strong and sweet the colour of the Bottle match exactly to the fragrance.After some minutes you smell a bit of the standard scent and the fragrance is warm,sweet i really smell the vanilla and it's floral,after some hours you can smell only the sweetness and the musk.This scent is better for the fall and wintertime and the original is better for the spring and summertime.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content: Another Kenzo bites the dust on me, the baby powder is back but not as bad as the original, why can I not find a Kenzo scent that works on me? The only one so far is Indian Holi thats the only one I like the rest smell like I rolled around in baby powder. I am so disappointed I was hoping this version would work since the original didn't.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content:
Yes! The perfect match for me: floral, musk with gourmand notes. It´s the almond and amber that make it so sensous and much skinnier than Kenzo Flower. And no poudry note, which was annoying to me on K.F. I loved it in winter; have to have it again! But I´m wondering: just 2 reviews on this wonderful scent? Are out there not more fans of it?
Bottle is awesome

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content: I love all Kenzo fragrances. Love it. I wear it to office and got compliments.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Le Parfum Kenzo
review_content: I like this one more than Kenzo Flower. Suitable for office & winter.
For those who love this perfume, please try Nui Tatami by Kenzo. Unfortunately you can only find at the airports.
If anyone has a bottle to swap please let me know

It’s now been 15 years since the first time I smelled this intoxicating scent, and here I am like clockwork every few months trying to track it down… it’s that captivating. Why does this limited edition (*cries*) still have me in a chokehold? Between the warmth from the rice with the musky base notes, unique oriental florals, and just-sweet-enough dry down, this scent is one of a kind. The standard Kenzo Amour is a completely different beast to my nose, and not one suggested dupe even holds a candle to it. Until one day we hopefully meet again, Indian Holi!

I see that ppl are writing reviews based on what they remember this svent smells like.
Who in the would remembers this being a freshie? Or flowery? No no.
The cherry - insece combo was warm, intimate and inviting. Sensual and inoffensive.

Gave way to a nice musky powdery scent. Really a pleasure to experience.

I had 3-4 bottles and was soooo bummed that they didnt produce this version any more.

It was the best by far.

A cozy, pleasant smelling, warm scent.
Subtle, steamy, cherry.

A scent that evokes a feeling of warmth and safety. Vanilla rice pudding, powdery frangipani, and smooth sandalwood. Sweet, soft, floral and clean. Very comforting and joyful. An instant love from me.

Gorgeous fragrance. This is your regular Amour with extra fruity (berries) and fresh floral notes. Pink pepper and a fluffy white musk gives more omph to the scent.
The base is the same warm, cozy rice/vanilla combo. This version is more suitable for warm weather. Beautiful, feminine. It is a shame it was discontinued.
I really miss this fragrance. It is such a cozy, comforting scent that was really luxurious at the same time.
I find this version to be almost sickeningly sweet. It has a very warm undertone from spices, which enhances the sweetness from vanilla, berries and cherry blossom. Not a huge fan.
I miss this baby.

The limited editions of Kenzo have always brought us fragrance wonders and this Indian Holi flanker by Amour is no exception.
This perfume inspired by the spring festivities celebrated in India and Nepal full of color, brings us an enhanced version of Amour here the floral notes are the absolute protagonists, enhancing much more the note of cherry blossom and the characteristic frangipani (flower present in the entire line) together with the vanilla here not so creamy but rather warm accompanied by the notes of incense and sandalwood, the opening of this flanker is much powerful and projects very well for an hour or two which undoubtedly was an improvement compared to the original, but unfortunately it loses that creamy note of rice pudding that I love from the original, here after the first hour and a half the fragrance calms down little by little and I find that delicious rice-vanilla DNA which is not It feels so creamy and powdery because it is not accompanied by the note of tea, but is seasoned with red berries and pink pepper which gives this composition much more warmth and joy.
Although I prefer the original Amour, it improved a lot in terms of projection and duration, giving us a very good and appropriate performance for most of the year with the exception of extremely hot days.

My dad had bought this perfume for me when I was 13. Sadly I would abuse this scent and spray it like a body mist, I really did not have any idea what I had in my possession. This scent made me feel pretty and mysterious. I would love to own another bottle to treasure it for the memories and of course the scent. I also still have the beautiful book it came with and sometimes I feel like I can smell the fragrance as I flip through the pages.

The cherry blossom and berries are a bit aggressive at the beginning, but soon other notes pick up (mainly rice, pepper, and incense) and make it more balanced. The scent is quite linear, though I enjoy the late dry-down, where the "red" aspect is toned down, and the rice & vanilla dominate the composition.
It's a very feminine scent, with a soft projection but lasting durability, and it's suitable for most occasions. I can't compare it to the normal Amour, though, as I haven't tested it yet, but this is certainly for someone demure who wants just a bit of spice.

6/10
I tried but it's my least fave of the flankers. More fruity. Prefer to stick to the original.
It pains me that this was a limited edition. I’ve had this bottle for years now and I don’t wear it often out of fear of never finding it again. Silliness, I know... it’s just that good.

From the moment I sprayed this gem I was amused. At first it seemed too much. Within 20 minutes it was playful. I get the most compliments when I wear this or my all time love Dior's Dune. Sadly I am down to the last bit of this gem. Donations anyone ? ;)

This is such a beautiful scent. I love it. So comforting, yet fresh. I mainly get rice steam and soft florals against a cuddly vanilla backdrop. The vanilla leans powdery-clean and creamy, rather than sticky-sweet. If only it were more easily available. It's unique and sensual without being imposing, and makes for a perfect signature or day to day scent. It also lasts a good amount of time on me (7 hours) and has a moderate but gentle projection. I can wear this one all year round, but it's especially lovely in spring and fall. I don't care much for original Amour, but I love this one, and I also adore Amour le parfum, that one is better suited for cold months.

I am fond of the original Kenzo Amour and even more so of Kenzo Amour Le Parfum. I am currently wearing Amour Indian Holi on the crook of my left arm and the original Amour on the crook of my right arm, Le Parfum only existing as a memory due to the admirable speed with which I finished my 5 ml decant months ago.

The main accords listed here on Fragrantica go Vanilla-Floral-Fresh for the original and Floral-Fresh-Vanilla for Indian Holi. Seems about right to me.

On my skin, the original Amour is all about the vanillic rice pudding on a backdrop of soft, vaguely floral fabric softener. It is round, enticing and slightly sweet. Indian Holi definitely tones down the rice in favor of a floral character that is sharp upon initial application and mellows with time into a fresh, pink breeze of subdued vanilla, red berries and cherry blossom, retaining the character I would still describe as fabric softener. Amour is wider, Indian Holi is straight-forward, if that makes sense. Le Parfum draws on the original more than it does Indian Holi.

Soapy spring florals at first spray, but they begin to warm up as the vanilla, incense and sandalwood come through.
Whats left is a gorgeous creamy and powdery oriental scent.
Its very pretty and comforting and for some reason reminds me of my childhood.
This scent is also surprisingly strong, one spray goes a long way.
Im not familiar with the smell of rice in perfume but i notice it here, it really brings together the whole perfume and gives it a special quality that makes this perfume unique.
I think its perfect for this Autumn

Kenzo amour was my signature scent years ago but I need a fresh test of it,so I can compare these two,I'm gonna edit when I do so
This Indian holi flanker is lovely
It's an oriental floral or oriental vanilla in my book not a floral woody musk..
This is very soothing, cozy,cuddly and fresh the same time, and I love such a freshness
There is a dominant creamy vanilla,flavored by cherry blossom and a nice,delicious rice steam,little amount of musk and sandalwood to make it deeper and more unique and a touch of frangipani and some other florals to make it more youthful and likable.. Honestly I don't get mentioned notes individually but I can feel their presence,all I get is soft floral vanilla,wrapped in rice steam and some musky sandalwood.I don't detect incense and I don't miss it. It's creamy,fluffy, warm and fresh as mentioned and one of most beautiful creamy vanillas..everything is blended artistically and result is this adorable, delightful,calming scent..sweetness is not sickening,it's not like any other perfume I know except original amour,they both share amour signature gene
I wish it was stronger, Longevity is moderate on me.it radiates softly but noticeably for people around you for an hour or two, then it's almost a skinscent,still I'm happy to wrap myself in this soothing heaven
Edit:
I compared it side by side with original amour and as I thought they share a similar skeleton but Indian holi has more fresh flowers with a slight fruity undertone while the original is more heavy in vanilla-rice pouding.the original is a bit sweeter,warmer and more cozy.has a few hours more longevity and better sillage.indian holy has a slight fruity tartness in opening and has a bit of sharpness comparing to well-rounded, creamy original.
Indian holi is exactly what we can name a day/warm weather version of original amour though it's wearable year round not just in spring and summer.
It's difficult to choose which one I prefer.I really enjoy both of them but if I have to choose one,it would be the original amour because it packs more punch and I love creamy, sweet,vanilla scents but now that I have both I can choose each of them in different situations. I'm still a hardcore fan of Kenzo Amour but Indian holi is so good that I've already used up my 30mil and purchased a 100mil of it.I love how fresh it is while being a vanilla scent and I love it's floral freshness, I prefer it to aquatic, ozonic or citrus freshness .this is a heavenly floral-vanilla scent that you may love even if you usually hate florals or vanilla scents
Now I'd really love to have a bottle of Kenzo l'eau amour for these hot summer days and a bottle of discontinued Kenzo Amour le parfum for the future winter
I never thought that I will be in love again

Indian Holi is a cosy, warm and soft cloud of cherry-vanille with a hint of rice-note.
I like it all year round, a perfume for every occasion.
Longivity and sillage are not so bad on my skin, soft but always in my nose for several hours.
Frangipani offers after a while in a very nice way.

Really a scarf to cuddly in!

My daughter owns this and was wearing it today. I actually thought she had snuck into my stash and borrowed my Ellen Tracy Bronze perfume...the dry downs are that similar...floral, balsamic, powdery & perfect in the warm late Spring temperatures which seem to bring out its warm notes in the most perfect, balancing way. If the $100+ Kenzo price tags are a bit steep for your budget, I suggest you try ETB...it is very similar & an affordable scent which is easily accessible & found in many discount US stores (Ross, Marshall's, TJMaxx).
Cheers! xo
Soft vanilla candied cherry blossom with a hint of incense. Sadly, I also get no sillage or longevity. It's completely gone in 15 minutes. 8^{
Nothing special unfortunately. This is going to become my bedtime scent. It is a warm vanilla-ish fragrance but it's barely there on me after about five minutes.
One of my favorite perfumes because it makes you feel like you're wrapped up in a warm cashmere sweater drinking some chai on a cold day. The clean smell of rice just makes it even more toasty! :)
Beautiful! Sweet yet sophisticated, not a clone of all the fruity florals out there. Alas, it has basically no sillage or lasting power on me, but I still wear it - I just have to reapply often!

Thanks to a sample from a fellow Fragrantica member, I was able to try this perfume. It has a fresh sweet smell, a little fruity, a hint of sharpness at first sniff but it mellows out rather quickly into a light scent that I have to look for on my skin. Overall it's a cute scent.

I forced my nose to like this one, but it was impossible. This fragrance is too linear to me. As it was ''indian'' i though it was going to be spicier and sweeter, but not at all. Much lighter than the original Amour, less vanilla and a hint of cherry flowers. So boring... I switched it with a friend and she gave me the chilling Organza on it's place. Veeeery annoying and boring.
I liked this scent, but it was very light- very quiet and close to the skin. No matter how much I sprayed I couldn't smell it unless in put my nose to my wrist.

Heavenly. I searched for a very long time for a perfume that would make me weak in the knees. I found exactly that and more in Indian Holi. This scent is sweet in just the right way, spicy and sensual. It has good lasting power, it isn't overly strong and the spicy oriental notes are right up my alley. I feel sexy, confident and alluring when I wear this. Indian Holi is definitely my signature fragrance. It's becoming harder to find, but trust me.. when my large bottle is gone? I will get another one.

You know when you find a fragrance that has everything you are looking for so you don't need to search any longer? That's what this perfume is for me. It's sweet, spicy, clean, fresh, sensual all in one bottle. It's a trip to heaven each time I spray it.

Very, very comforting. In fact, I use it almost every night just before sleep - it makes me feel sleepy, safe, clean and relaxed. It is lovely, much better than the classic version - it still has the soapiness, vanilla hint and rice-incense note of Kenzo Amour EDP, but the note of cherry blossom makes it just soo soft, like pink, cashmere pullover :)
I don't find it sexy, or bold, but I cannot belive that someone might not like it at all - it's save - for dinner at grandma's, for playing with little baby, for party with friends, and even for nice date in the winter evening.

As a previous reviewer mentioned this, like the original Kenzo Amour, has a note that really puts me off. It turns into a smokey peppery "makes my nose itch" scent within 5 minutes on my skin and then it completely disappears. Of all the Amour flankers I like the Florale best!

If I had to describe this perfume in words: Pure Innocence. This scent is like a beatiful young child; naive, innocent, sweet, cute. Nevertheless, I don't feel one bit childish while I'm wearing it. I feel womanly and sexy. That's a rare beauty.
p.s
Better then the original.

There is something in this flanker and the original Kenzo Amour that just doesn't work with my chemistry. I half suspect that the rice note has a lot to do with it, maybe even the peony too.

I love the name and I love the bottle, but unfortunately the scent doesn't love me. It becomes quite sharp and rubbery on my skin, with a musky cherry blossom accord mixed with some harsh, smoky incense. I really don't think I'll be re-applying Kenzo Amour Indian Holi anytime soon.

I'd be lying if I didn't say I was disappointed. I really thought I would enjoy this flanker. It would have been nice to smell Kenzo Amour Indian Holi on someone else, especially one with the right skin chemistry. That cherry blossom, vanilla and rice blend must be divine.

Despite this fragrance's incompatibility with my skin, it did last a good six or more hours and projected quite strongly. I would wear it during Autumn and Winter.

Thankfully Kenzo Amour Le Parfum worked for me, so if there are any other unfortunate people who struggle to wear both this flanker and the original, do try the exclusive Kenzo Amour Le Parfum.
