Very disappointed. Too light, within 45 minutes it's gone and no sillage at all! It could be more intense with vanilla, incense, frangipani... More like an EdT to me and really expensive in CH, I've given it to my mum.
I am thinking I will make this at home...baby powder with a wisp of curry.
I have no idea what effect if any this scent has on other people when I wear it, but this makes me feel sensual like none other. It's georgeous!

I tested it with Kenzo Amour on the other wrist. Overall it smells like Amour but a little spicier. From the scent I can't really tell which one I prefer. Both are lovely and have their own caracter. But the sillage and the longevity of Indian Holi on me are significantly less good than original Amour. With the same amount of application, after 8 hours I can still smell Amour easily but Indian Holi has almost gone since after 5 hours.

This scent is so GORGEOUS!!! I fell in love with Kenzo Amour but always felt like it was missing something. Indian Holi fills in those gaps quite nicely. Can't wait for Fall again so I can wear it. It's a bit warm to wear in AZ weather.

first off I just had to try this because alot of these notes here are indeed most of the my favorites! cherry Blossom, Pink Pepper, Plumeria, Vanilla, incense and rice! and the bottle looks super cool too! my kind of my frag! when I sprayed it on, I kinda got the same play doh scent I got from Hypnotic Poison, still good enough for me though, the dry down smelt better on me then HP did, I was enjoying this lovely but play dohish scent until I discovered the last power isn't too great! which really sucks because I do like this scent alot!
I bought this because I was looking for a spicier fall/ winter scent to wear. It does not stay on me! Like within 30 minutes it's gone. Considering it's not that cheap, I would not repurchase.

I attended a fragrance event a few years back and was introduced to the original Kenzo Amour. For me it was just "meh OK" then the rep showed me this LE gem and I went bonkers! I don't know how to describe "notes" but this is a lovely exotic fruity floral but it is more mature and sexier than a typical summer fruity scent. I absoltuely LOVE this, so much that I have bought a backup bottle since it is an LE and for now is still fairly easy to find.

To me, this fragrance is grace in a bottle.
It's that girl who is very pretty, then you discover that she's bright, genuine and kind, too.

The name? Well, I'll just take the word of other reviewers about the meaning. I have never been to India, so I really don't have a clue.

As for the fragrance, I actually pick up some rose in this. It appears that other reviewers haven't noticed it on themselves, but on me it is subtle, but there.

I'm mostly getting cherry blossom, creamy vanilla and rice. This is sweet without being over-the-top and it's well-blended into a lovely and very feminine fragrance. It lasts for hours, but it's not a silliage bomb on me.

If you're looking for a versatile fragrance for day or evening, this is a good one.
I loved Amour but I have to admit I love Indian Holi even more. there's an extra dimension to it, its more interesting and special. I want a full bottle, right now!!!

A happy reward for my daliances in the dusty back shelves of perfume stores! Although this limited edition gem was out of stock at the store, I sampled it from the almost empty display bottle, and fell in love!
This gentle, mysterious, powdery-sweet-spicey blend was immediatley delightful, and had settled down to a soft,delicate incense-like prettiness by the time I realized that the store had discontinued selling it :-(
I jumped online and found it easily :-) That was 2 days ago, and as I write I am listening hopefully for the delivery truck!
The scent lingered all day when I tried it, seeming to mingle with my own skin in a most flattering way. Even after showering it was detectable, thankfully! Not in a bullyish way, more like I'd adopted it and it was happy to live with me! The wonderful harmonies between the sweetly spicey essence of Indian Holi with my favorite vanilla and pretty flowery notes is a joy to experience. Maybe it's on my front porch now so I can welcome it home again!

I have never liked the original kenzo amour because it reminded me the smell of rice, which i hate. also, i found it sweet in a bad way and almost linear.
now, my sister`ve borrowed indian holi, and I`m almost in love with it.
it takes the idea in kenzo amour and reinterprets it adding more spice to overlap the sweetness, which gives it a whole new sense of complexity.

Literally perfect. Soft and delicate but sweet. Definitely more fruit than the original. A little over sweet at first but it mellows and lingers with a warm scent. I wouldnt call it "spicy" but there are notes somewhere in there.
This is the best perfume my wife wears nowadays! Perfect scent!

Spices attack me !!! Lol. Yeah..fierce, strong on my skin.. the wave of incense and cherry blossom fulfill the air. Pink peppers and vanilla detected after 20 minutes, the scent is softer.,sensual, warm. Sandalwood appears after next 15 minutes. Okay..honestly I'm lookin for Kenzo Amour but can't find it in my country anymore,but this one is great second choice. Longevity and silage are good. A lovely blind buy :D

A lot alike Kenzo Amour, just a little bit softer. I like it alot. Cherry, Vanilla, Rice and Musk stands out most on my skin. Great every-day-scent.

Mycket lik Kenzo Amour, bara lite mjukare i framtoningen. Jag gillar den enormt. Körsbärsblomma, Vanilj,Ris och Musk är de doftnoter jag känner bäst på huden. Härlig varje-dag-doft.

Well, this is definitely cherry blossom and creamy vanilla, absolutely delicious scent. Very lasting and remains deliciously creamy all the way through. Every single person at work said how gorgeous this smells yet nobody can pinpoint what the scent actually is. I am surprised by how gorgeous it smells and how long it lasts. Wow
This is just the most beautiful Vanilla I've ever come across. When I finish this bottle I'm def buying another. Just perfect...

I finally received this after craving it for a year. Let me start by saying I have an obsession with India and Asian cultures, so when I first saw it on the shelves I knew that I will fall in love with it. The perfume accents a lot of important ingredients and scents that you would smell visiting India and the cherry blossom you would smell visiting Japan as well. The scent bursts with juicy red berries that quickly gives its place to spicy creamy cherry blossom. The floral heart emerge itself after that turns it into a romantic journey by itself. The incense is always there but it's not suffocating incense neither in your face, in contrary the incense only adds a smokey mysterious allure to this fragrance.The pink pepper and the spices tickle your nose as it goes to its dry down which has a woodsy vanilla creamy texture complimented by the long lasting cherry blossom that lingers.
The fragrance staying power is excellent 6 to 8 hours on my skin, sillage isn't so strong it would only project itself around half of meter radius around you and the sillage last for 2 hours then it turns to a skin scent that evolves by the time spent on your skin.

My man was surprised by how romantic, sensual and feminine ( his exact words) so it's definitely a scent that would suit a romantic date, a night of passion and anytime you feel like you want to smell divine.

Its suitable to all seasons, night and day. It can take you from an office setting to a romantic date. I tried it before in the summer and the only difference that the vanilla and incense were more prominent with the heat but nothing unbearable or headache inducing (for me and others).

As for myself I will be wearing this while enjoying a homemade Indian curry dinner with my husband.

If you love cherry blossom this is a must have.


PS: Thanks hubby for finally getting this for me :)
It is more fruity-flowery rice and less creamy vanilla that K amour.The spiced smells just in the beginning.

oooh! I love this one! I will keep this around in my wardrobe for a long time. The name suits it perfectly, it is a playful happy scent.
It is slightly tropical a very colorful eastern fruity gourmand fragrance.
It smells like Holi. I Imagine a crowd of thousands of adults and children just throwing colorful powder on one another in such joy and carelessness, with huge smiles! Its what I imagine living in a rainbow filled world would feel like! This scent absolutely makes you feel like that...so free spirited, a happy go lucky type of personality who falls in love carelessly. A new fave! I cant believe I never tried this one before.
As for the notes, they are all detectable! Frangipani with a hint of light spices nothing harsh or in your face, and the vanilla is there all the way through, the cherry blossom shines as well. Beautifully picked ingredients that really work good together to make an unforgettable scent. I have never smelled anything like it! Unique
I bought it for my mom cause I liked it at the store. It's zesty and unobtrusive at the same time.

well, it is very nice lovely smell on my skin.
on top i can smell the magnolia, rice.. and a lot more of frangipani.. (thats make a very unusual smell)

first i wear it at morning for work, but it just 4 hours in my skin.:(
and my friends tell me i should wear it at night...:)
its smell good nice, its kenzo


i gave it 8/10

I adore this! I much prefer it to the original Kenzo Amour. Hooray for it being the first frangipani fragrance not to give me a raging headache!

It's more of a skin scent on me and smells so feminine, romantic and sexy. Everything is so well balanced and rounded, love love love! I'll be wearing this on a romantic getaway with my man next month, that's for certain!

I got a sample of this in the mail today. As I put it on my wrist and took a whiff, I immediately pictured myself walking into a candlelit bedroom that had flower petals on the bed and incense burning on the night stand. I'm in love.
I bought this years ago so I liked it at some point but I have really grown to hate a lot of scents I used to love. This, like the others, is just heavy and artificial to me.

Indian Holi is a beautiful mixture of innocence and edginess. At first sniff it's romantic, musky and beautiful then it turns into a subtle, smoky, sexy addiction. The musk blends in lavishly soon after application. The end result is vibrant and alluring. When I smell it I see cheerful people dancing. It's a dynamic scent full of sensuality and charm.

Update: It's summer now, and I am enjoying my Indian Holi much more now! The heat makes it VERY sexy on my skin. Just when I thought I couldn't love it anymore, wow!

Kenzo Amour Indian Holi starts out soft, sweet, and warm, with flowers, rice milk, and red fruits over a base of incense and the littlest bit of spice. At times, Indian Holi smells like peach cobbler a la mode; at others, it smells like rice pudding with saffron; and at yet others, like incense and vanilla.

Despite its name, there's very little spice to be found here; if you're looking for a perfume with those gorgeous Indian chai spices, you'll have to look elsewhere. The name Indian Holi refers not the spiciness of Indian cuisine, but the bright, colorful nature of Holi, a holiday in India where people throw rainbow colored pigments on each other in celebration.

It's odd, but Amour Indian Holi smells reminiscent of Burberry Brit EDP, although I can't really pick any single notes that they share in abundance other than vanilla. They both have that "peach cobbler a la mode" smell despite both lacking peach, although Brit is more fruity and bold than the soft incense of Indian Holi.

I'm not yet sure if I want to invest in a bottle of Indian Holi when I've got a full bottle of Brit hanging around for those peach cobbler-craving days, but that rice pudding and incense is so delicious that I might just go out of my way to grab a bottle of this as well.
Simply amazing.. and lasts for ages!

I have to say that this is one of my favorite perfumes. It is not overt in any way. It is a perfect mix of sweet and sassy. It does not try too hard with sweet, spice or floral but a blend of all make a wonderful symphony together. This perfume always lifts my mood and is a goto for me when I want a unique and comforting scent around me. I love the name and the bottle and the contents in it. You can't see the color of the juice through this bottle but I imagine is it a light golden color with all the sunny brightness and uplifting feeling this one gives me. As with a lot of Kenzo you will definately get vanilla but mostly the exotic florals, incense and spices make this a must have for any collection.
I was drawn to the gorgeous fluid shape of the bottle but sadly the fragrance was a disappointment. For me, it is overly sweet and lacks any depth.

I tested it the second time yesterday.
First time I tried it in May. In warm weather the fragrance developed into a creamy warm and thick scent - the incense and vanilla were very loud.
Yesterday in cool rainy weather Indian Holi turned rather cold and less creamy with rose, peony and musk being the most prominent notes. Still it was very lovely, feminine and peaceful.

have it, and really like it! sweet, warm and spiced vanilla, it´s absolutly a winter fragance. adorable! everybody ask me what i´m wearing when i put this on.
oh! i almost forgot to said, it last for ever, and ever, and more...

Lo probe junto con el Kenzo amour, que les puedo decir para mi este es mejor y tiene una aroma embriagador y adictivo , me encanta y sobre todo que a otros les encante. Cuando me lo pongo suelo tener muchos halagos por el aroma . delicios0¡¡¡¡

I Love LOVE LOVE this scent! I is simply amazing. It is different from anything I own. And when this bottle is gone; I will purchase another. If it is discontinued - I will have heart failure. I simply can't explain it any other way than sunshine in a bottle. Just makes me wish I could spray it right in my face - j/k! But if you haven't smelled it -your missing out!

This is just such a lovely and warm scent. It's subtle and not overpowering not matter the quantity. One of my top ten favorite fragrances. This is a perfume that you can wear year round. I get 3 main ingredients out of this vanilla, pink pepper and the peony...it's so much more as the scent evolves but really a wonderful perfume and well made...I own a lot of KENZO!

I like this fragrance a lot, but I can't figure out what's Indian about it. I get cherry blossoms pretty well, but I definitely associate cherry blossoms with Japan. I don't really detect any spices or incense, so I was a bit disappointed. Despite my disappointment with the lack of "Indian-ness," I still would consider buying this. It's probably best example of cherry blossoms in perfume that I know of.

this is nice and gental to . i just tested this beside the original Kenzo amour. thi to me isent very much more spicy the way i thought i would be , but almost sweeter in away.
I think its the Rice that is more prominant in this one . the original vanilla , heliotrop is there , but the peony and cherry blosoms makes it more interesting , the spices aswell . allthoug like i sayed , not very strong.
this to me have almost more play dooh feel to it then the original. nice , but note worth the buy imo.
a little to shy and simple

I am in love! This is sweet but not syrup-y gourmand IMO. I get spices like cinnamon and cardamom, beautiful sandalwood, a bit of incense, dry vanilla. This is slightly sweet from the vanilla but not at all syrup like; almost like chai-tea! Very pleasant! I just bought a bottle and it will be perfect for the autumn season!
I love this one. Smell very well soft and sweet.
This is lovely, youthful incense infused scent. I absolutely love it. The cherry blossom is nicely balanced by the smokiness, and the spice is very light, just giving the sweetness an edge.

A charming little thing. The first impression was ”oh no, another fruit syrup”. Yes, it is extremely sweet, but the combo cherry blossom - spices is a lucky one. I’m not fond of gourmand sweet fragrances, but should I pick up one, I would take Amour Indian Holi.

This is a beautiful, exotic floral scent. By far the best cherry-blossom scent I've encountered yet.

The sweet cherry-blossom is the star of this perfume, along with the fresh rice steam, rose (not listed above), incense, and vanilla. It is warm and fresh at the same time. This certainly isn't loud or over-the top. It is gorgeous and soft, and would work as an everyday scent any time of the year.

The bottle is stunning, and captures the fragrance inside well - colourful, beautiful and cheery!

I adore it - the incense adds just the right amount of smokiness to the sweetness of the cherry blossom. It imbues it with a slightly mystical, exotic air that is perfectly in keeping with the name. That said, it has absolutely no staying power, at least on me. I sprayed it on my wrist, and it was all but gone an hour later. Divine, but unfortunately, very short-lived. Like being taken up to heaven and then unceremoniously kicked out, all in one afternoon.
This smells like every other oriental perfume out there. It is not original and it is certainly forgettable.
I had a hard time warming-up with it, but thinking twice is an amazing exotic scent...of course, not suitable for daily use ;)

I had this one and it was the version of Amour I liked most. It had a bit of spice and raunchyness to it. But even here the original Amour note was so strong and getting on my nerves with the drydown - because the spicyness and raunchyness faded away then. If you are looking for these kind of spices in a stronger way, have a look at Tova and "Nirvana". It's also a scent inspired by India - and Indian Holi for me was like a light version of "Nirvana".
I've got a sample of it and I think I'm addicted! Got to find the full version asap!

i think this perfume is ok. i wish there was an "in between button" b/c i wouldn't say "i like this and want to buy it" but i wouldn't say i dislike it either. i like it better than regular amour. this one is lighter and i like that i smell a berry or something sweet. i don't see berries listed as an ingredient, but i smell something berry-ish and just think this one is nicer. i will have to resample to give a better opinion as i often find i need to try a perfume a few times before i decide how i like it.

I initially fell in love with Kenzo Amour but after I smelled this its my definate favorite of the two. It just has that extra something special. Its warm and cozy smelling and the incense is amazing. Another beautiful fragrance from Kenzo.

I just tried Amour Indian Holi. I havent ever smelt the regular amour, but this one is quite delicious, however it doesnt last very long.
The initial sent was lively but slightly mysterious. after only a few minutes my wrist had turned into a field of lush, flavorful flowers after a fresh rainfall, only, it had rained a crisp citrus that is lingering on the leaves and petals of the red and orange hued flowers. sadly this doesnt last much more than 15 minutes before the scene fades and subtle spices begin to saunter by, and as this leisurely parade strolls past, it begins to slowly pull a soapy, astringent scent with them, with hints of soft white flowers.
I've only been wearing this perfume for about a half hour now, and it seems to be almost completely gone.
It is an admirable piece, although it comes and goes much too quickly.
i have that for 2 years and i like it but it doest last so i dont wear it very often

Kenzo Amour Indian Holi is a delicious, spicy and happy scent that unfortunately gives me instant headache exactly like sister Kenzo Amour. Too bad.
The two share many similarities but Indian Holi is definetely more kicking and bright. Sillage is nice and lasting power is good.
I blame the synthetic vanilla for headache or maybe the rice note, who know? I know that many of the latest Kenzo give me this problem.
I would have bought this straight away if not for this problem.
Try first buying.

Amaaaaaaaaaazing juice!!SENSUAL..Sexy & sophisticated but in a confident way..not in a "Pleeease notice me.." ....I loove the fact that the incense note is right in the top notes unlike most frags that prefer to keep it in the basenotes for the drydown only..I think its kinda outrageous to have right to ur face in the topnotes...I HIGHLY appreciate that...I hope it's never disontinued ever..Thanx Kenzo!!!

Very nice and relaxed, cheerful and sensual. A great fragrance for women from young to middle age. I think not a good option for teens.

I like it a lot.
the presence of incense in this perfume I think is what makes it totally different from Kenzo Flower. It's a soft incense fragrance.

The opening notes of this were heavenly. I took a deep breath and exotic incense and warm, spicy musk made both my daughter and I sigh with pleasure. After a mere few minutes, however, my jaunt through the orient ended, and I was dumped into a fruit orchard surrounded by berry bushes and scattered roses. Sadly, this didn’t work with my body chemistry.

Differences between this and the original:
1. The original tends to be sweeter than Indian Holi, but I find Holi a little bit more complex
2. The original lasts longer than Indian Holi
Therefore, it's more likely I'll purchase the original (mostly because of the staying-power which I find very important).

It took me a while but I finally worked out which olfactory memory had been stimulated by Indian Holi - Pink Creaming Soda! Yummy!

It does get spicier the longer it is on but I prefer the exciting pink opening myself.

Unfortunately, this is a very weak potion & I don't really get a lot out of it. It also stimulates brain hurt (you know, when you smell something & there is that squeezing pain behind your eyes) so it is a no for me. Maybe Armour will work better for me.

Love this - there's just something about it I can't stop sniffing. Definitely in the right category, a floral woody musk! I prefer it to the original Kenzo Amour. Reminds me a bit of Betsy Johnson, which has similar notes, but I like this one much better, it's much better balanced! The top notes listed don't pop out for me so much; I get peony, vanilla and musk the most. Sweet florals, very warm and creamy smelling, with a hint of spiciness and a bit of powder from the sandalwood. It's pretty linear, not much change on me over time. Snatch it up while you can!

It starts off very powdery. It almost brings me back to days in grade school. Then the sweet/floral/musky scents start dancing around and the powdery innocence starts to fade into a more sultry, sensual scent. It is not overpowering even on the first spray and yet it lasts all day. Lovely on the nose and the eyes too.

I Was a bit dissapointed with this
fragrance i expected a spicy woodsy
firey untamed collection but what it turned out it was a prud very shy on my skin the water drowned out the spices
the peppers woods but i like the incense i think they shoud add more
volume of spices woods and put cinnamon
or chai tea to it but i love the Sinuous Red bottle very different and sensual.

Wow What can I say....I was very excited about this fragrance when I heard about it, after purchasing it I did'nt smell good on me at all. Because of the price, I really tried to like itie use less of it etc.It just did not work out with my chemistry.No matter how little I used it was just over powering,and much too sweet.I must say it is long lasting that is good and bad even after I washed it off I could still smell it so I finally thre it away.Then I disposed of it I had almost a full bottle but I just could not wear it or stand to smell it, this is a perfume that walked into the room before I did....I was much too much for me.
The only fragrance by Kenzo I think I have appreciated.
Exotic and spicey,much better then the other amours.But amour le parfum is still my favourite(gold bottle)

okay let me start off by saying that I don't like kenzo perfumes on me. I don't have anything nice to say about them. I tried the most popular on Amour and smelled playdoh. But this one is a pleasant surprise. Its so...interesting. I smell the spices and the sandalwood right off the bat mix with the rice pudding. It does have power. And as it dries down I smell the cherry blossom stepping forward. Leaving just a pretty floral. Wow. didn't expect this. Sensual is the perfect word.

just realized that the drydown smells similiar Hilary duff with love.

I have this and I love it...
its my favorite new like Hugo Boss XX

i feel like all kenzo perfumes are the same!i dont like the fact that they arent unique...i've never asked a woman (which i do that ...a lot!)about their perfume and got "kenzo" as an answer...so its not a perfume that you'll get compliments...you can easily find similar and low cost immitations colognes at the super-market...so thanks but no thanks!...even though i've tested all of them, i wont ever buy a kenzo perfume! xo xo

Way oversweet with a bug spray edge. This does not work at all on my skin. It has the earmarks of a sweet vanilla Kenzo, not unlike Amour, but the other notes don't blend at all on me and it's sort of dreadful. Glad it works for others, but wow, I'll pass.

It's a well balanced perfume. Powdery - but not that "old lady" powder - and creamy. Very comforting and exotic. Sweet but not annoying. I feel pretty and mysterious wearing it.

EDIT: Don't feel mysterious anymore. I feel comfortable and my skin smells like chocolate after a few hours! Delicious! My boyfriend agrees!

Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful! I searched parfum with similar climate , soul , character as Safran Troublant and I have found Indian Holi exactly. On skin dance, blended joyfully, fresh notes cherry flower , rose, warm notes of parrying rice, sandalwood, and notes spices( pepper). Indian Holi is juicy ,spicy, but simultaneously warm and bit cream. Very appetite, very optimistic, and also magic like India, like woman and like woman subtle and sensual. Very nice, comforting, beautifull. I love it.

I like this exotic take of Kenzo Amour! It's more spicy than regular one, very festive, joyful and amusing! I love the packaging and hope I can put my hands on the great coffret! Too bad it's LE.


Edit 22/05: wearing Indian Holi today I had an insight: this is what Kashaya should have been!

I got a chance to try it thanks to a fragrantica member.

It really smells exotic to me, as standing in a fair, next to the flower and candy stands.

Its a weel balence fragrance, between floral and woody, with a touch of sweet.I don't get any musk or incense of it.

I love the Rice steam and Cherry blossom, wrapped in peony and pink peper.

On me it last all day long. I put some on the back of my neck and when i turned my head I got a fresh whaff of it. Really easy to wear, a kind of sweet freshness that uptlifted my spirit.

I think it would be great to wear on a first date or casual dates with friends.

Nice, well-blended, warm, deliciously gourmand rather than woody. Most of the time I could smell vanilla and tones very similar to those of Armani Code. That is why this perfume seems to me already existing, in many subtle variations.
Or, maybe just my nose cannot distinguish anything special.

Its encircling. Pleasant, vaporous... nice notes of sandalwood and vanilla... but don't have clear notes of incense... in my opinion its floral-spicy...
Gives me a warm-steamy sensation...
Its nice, only that for my taste...

I have to write about this, I have been searching for a Kenzo scent I can wear that doesn't smell like a baby powder on me. This is so sensual and spicy with some berries mixed in. It is absolutely to die for, sweet and spicy sensual, I imagine I am in India during the festival of colors. I love it!!! I found my Kenzo perfume!

I love this! The perfume is so soft but the pepper and rose add a hint of mystery. Lovely and multilayer perfume so soft with a hint of spice at the same time its perfect!

P.S. This does not last very long at all, very disappointing but I still want it!

This is first of Kenzo that I tried on my skin. It is very nice at the beginning- flowers with something less familiar. It's soft, a bit spicy after hour. I really like how frangipani with peony smells- very yummy! Then it's a little spicy, warm wood on me. Lasting power is good and I definitely want to try other Kenzo perfumes, they always associate something very oriental for me.

ı bought it 2 weeks ago..with the first sniff I felt in love with it, especially teh rice coming so nice...I did nıt hesitate to buy it..the only problem, even me hardly smel it while I wear it.the people around even do not notice that I wear a perfume! I wish it had been more intense...

This is a real comfort scent for me; putting it on always lifts my mood. I wouldn't say it's at all challenging. Rather, I would liken it to a warm cashmere sweater on a cold winter day - elegant, soft, and incredibly warm.

I just received this perfume this weekend. I thought I was going to love it, but I don't really like it. It's very sweet on me and it doesn't have much in common with the original Amour. I smell lots of peony and it smells kind of cheap. I don't smell any vanilla and I bought it because I'm very in love with vanilla and deep warm scents. This is just too sweet and boring, not deep, warm or sexy at all
It's a lovely, sweet, creamy fragrance, perfect for autumn. However, I think it could be a bit fruitier and more vibrant. I like it, but I still prefer the original Amour.
This one is very precious! Exotic but not in that strong offensive way the orientals are. Rice provides creamy and incense is of good quality. Soft, confortable. I love it.
Very nice "little sister" of Kenzo "Amour". The fragrance is rich, colorful and it also has the smell of rice steam that i like so much in Amour.
long time it is parfum is my favorite, i love it
i had the same impression, that´s a lighter version of amour...but i woudn´t wear it on summer,maybe at night...i love both of them!

I just received a carded sample from Sephora and it's really not that different from the original Kenzo Amour. Indian Holi only has a bit more "bite" to it (more fruity). It's actually not as strong as Amour, which is disappointing. I completely agree with the reviewer below me. I may buy this one, though. The original Amour no longer smelled good on me - instead of smelling like rice and warmth, it started to smell like car tires :( So I gave it away. This one actually works on me. I love it.

I've tried it out today and it's not quite as woody as the original, but very delicious. It brings back memories of my childhood. I also like the colour of the bottle which is a bit more glowing and pink than the fuchsia one.
Although I can't make out any special notes, it's very well combined - very warm and sensual.

I found a new bottle forgotten on a greek island in a perfume store. It's fantastic one of the best fragrances by Kenzo but didn't last long on the market. If you don't like licorice or ouzo stay away.

the best, for 20 years now.
https://youtu.be/THQlJ12vqmc

What a discovery ! Just forget about all what has be done during the last two decades in perfume industry. This scent is unique and no , it has nothing to do with Encre Noire otherwise we could find analogy with all vetiver based fragrances. The blend between licorice anise (for me fenugreek is more accurate) and vetiver is making all the uniqueness of this masterpiece. One of the GOT scents for very hot days.

This is a beautiful fragrance done in a very Japanese fashion. It is extremely subtle. It gives me a scent of freshness that's like wearing no scent at all, and I think that's the intent of the designer. Many Japanese designers attempt this feat.

I have good news for people who want to smell this but don't want to buy an entire bottle of a discontinued fragrance. I have a bottle of this and got a sample of Comme des Garcons Zero. To my nose and on my skin, they are identical. When my bottle of Kenzo Air runs out, I will buy Zero. It's quite interesting they smell the same, because the notes are nothing similar.

Take away the anise note and it's Roja Elysium cologne.
Edit: 4hours on with REC and i get grapefruit. Dry down is different but i take Kenzo over Roja

I just picked up two bottles left forgotten in a perfume store. Strangely these are a little more than half full which I discovered is normal.
For me it is hands down the best Kenzo fragrance for men ever. I'm getting great projection and longevity compared to some other reviews. Hands down one of the most gorgeous anise notes I've ever smelled. This was a great surprise for me and I'm shocked that this was not a big seller.
Maybe the bottle was too expensive to manufacture I don't know.
It's like a small sculpture.

This is another of those hyped vintage scents I hunted for a long time. Scored a 50ml. It's soft, anise-forward with a backbone of just IsoE. Maybe it was interesting in 2003 but, considering it got discontinued pre-2010, I think, I doubt it sold well. IsoE-dominant scents are so common now that Air just felt like a poorly/simply constructed scent, to me. Anise + Vetiver + Cedar is essentially all this is. Very much like Encre Noir Sport + anise but even lighter than ENS.

Longevity is super poor, especially if you struggle with IsoE. I got 2-3 hours of noticeable smell, with less than 30 minutes of projection.

A 6.5/10. Nostalgia hype has led me to some great buys and some really bad ones. This falls into the bad category.

To bad it was discontinued and the few left on ebay and amazon are jumping up in price.But there is hope, i actually found a dupe of kenzo air which is very very close to the real juice if not the same.Just search on google for: in the air vebelle.It´s a german company and they are shipping to some european countries.Damn i can´t stop sniffing my hand, this stuff is so good.Got a compliment on the first day of wearing.
Unfortunately I've never got to try this, just wanted to say that this bottle is the work of art

One of the lastest great fragances by Kenzo... Really airly and ozonic. Totally anized... A decontracte and carefree cousin of Au The Blanch by Bvlgari. As Eau de Cartier and Eau de Givenchy Vintage are truelly WATER, this fragance are really misty. Other icon forgotten no explanation.
Dommage il était magnifique 10/10 un chef-d’œuvre 😥

It has a certain spicy but almost buttery sweetness to it. I don't know whether it's because of the anise and vetiver pairing or maybe some amber but it's nice enough. There's also some woods present but nothing harsh. But the anise in here is actually blended very well. It doesn't remind me of a licorice or fennel aroma at all. It's a fairly simple scent but for any anise lovers, even though long discontinued, perhaps an interesting composition. Performance is soft and quite frankly horrible. Fun to sample should you get a chance.

7/10

What Kenzo Air definitely possesses is this aforementioned ozonic quality to it. However, it is not a static fragrance that settles down once you apply it and then just reveals its layers continually. Rather, I like to say it has to be in that constant swirl with your movements. You need to be active to really smell this scent real potential.


Now, right after sharp yet quick angelica opening it almost instantly sets its soft velvety anise/caraway tone which is staying for long time present, accompanied by woody base and just a slight link of citrusy bergamot hints, those more so add a bravado of freshness to frail anise. Once anise weakens its presence, its character is transformed with licorice that protrudes to my nose mostly. Sweet licorice that resembles lacquered mahogany wood and well fits to minimalist urban chic aesthetics. Staying power is long enough, while projection is slightly ephemeral. One second it seems like you almost lost it and then in next moment it starts to gain its initial intensity back, though this time without any sign of angelica around.


Best to apply during the day whilst it gets warmer in its character as hours pass. Approximately after six-seven hours it is still well detectable. There is no definite end to Kenzo Air if you ask on sillage, for every time you do a sudden movement it reappears. And just how refined is that comeback - even sharper, more complex, embedded and locked in your skin pH!


Airy as proclaimed, spring breezy day or summer noon emitting subtle grey noise from swinging tree branches and birds flying high above is accurate to accessorize your being with Kenzo Air. Wind will bring this haziness right up to your nose. Gently.

FIJI

Its Fiji on first trip to fiji years ago it was just perfect its a beautiful beachy vibe type of thing thats always fresh and refreshing. Still have some in the original bottle and recently bought two original bottles so enough to see me out LOL. Its extremley Fresh and wonderful. They have re-released variations but nothing beats the real thing like original Coca cola. RUBBISH Atomiser great name.
9/10
Anise, vetiver and some sweetness from the licorice (i'd guess). And completely gone in 2 hours max. Don't waste your time on this one guys...
Please,bring it back!!!! One of my favourite perfumes I’ve ever had...

There are few scents able to remind me the smell of our Mediterranean maquis...the sensation I feel when I cross a pine forest just before to match with the beach and the sea. Kenzo Air is one of them. Amazing scent, I have been lucky finding a a 50ml flanker at a good price. It's much more earthy than airy to my taste, but I love it. Someway it is close to Armani White, another amazing scent that has gone.
Please bring such fragrance back!
Such a great scent! I’ve missed it so much. Please Kenzo bring it back...it will be a huge success!

Another discontinued gem. Luckily, I was able to get a 50ml bottle at a good price.

I get anise, vetiver and some licorice and citrus. The scent is light and 'airy', as the name would suggest. Very refreshing, not overly sweet or cloying and excellent for warmer weather.

The scent is light and projection is minimal. I would say it is a skin scent after about 10-15 minutes however longevity is not bad.

Overall, a great discontinued scent which is perfect for summer.

Ratings
Sillage: 4/10
Longevity: 6.5/10
Scent: 8.3/10

Finally! I was lucky enough to find and grab a bottle for a good price! Here are my two cents.

It is very sad to see nowadays boring releases from designer houses, stacking the shelves with "sport" versions and nonsense flankers, and then looking to all these great discontinued fragrances makes you want to go hunt them. This is one of those incredible fragrances.

The concept of "Air" here is different, it is not that fresh and transparent feel, but rather a soft spicy, ozonic vibe. When first sprayed (about the first 10 seconds) it is a blast of anise and licorice, after a while the licorice becomes almost invisible, and vetiver and cedar take place. Truly one of the best and most interesting fragrances I've smelled. For those who haven't had the opportunity of smelling it, the most literal description I can make IMHO (so that you can imagine it) is that it is a merge between Au Masculin, Encre Noire and cedar, with that ozonic vibe I can't really explain, but that's what my nose gets. Longevity is good but sits close to the skin, which is not a problem at all since the scent itself will be a marvelous journey for your nose.
HOW I MISS YOU. Bring it back!

Please bring this back! It is too good to be discontinued
Anyone that misses this can enjoy Bello Rabelo by Les Liquides Imaginaires, at a much higher price but also at a very good quality. I find both to be very close to each other.

It my was everyday scent for years. Too bad it was discontinued. Really smells like a breath of fresh air, it is sooooooo refreshing....I gave it as a present to my dad, and tried on my skin, ever since it became my favorite along with Light Blue from Dolce and Gabbana, for everyday usage. Because it doesn't seem, to me, a male scent. It is the kind of perfume that makes you smell clean all day, and every time you smell a hint of it it feels like a breeze. Also, I would say it reminds me of something I could call an icy fragrance. Somewhat like Armani Code Ice, but way more subtle, not as woody, which is why I think it fits the unissex category. Its silage is soft, and it lasts for 4h on my skin. For women that like fragrances such as Thé Blanc from Bulgari, Light blue, it's a must have. Really, it is a pity that it was discontinued.

Two things about Turkey RAKI (Traditional alcoholic drink) and KEBAP of course you have to eat something with rakı.

Why i start like this because kenzo air smells like RAKI :)
Kenzo Air is anise, vetiver, licorice bomb and absolutely smells like a Rakı for me.(there is to much anise in it)
Now you can think what kind of comparison is that scent and Alcoholic beverage ?
I have to remind you, there are to many of those kind of scent ;) and i think this one inspired from RAKI, if you did not try yet you have to drink as soon as possible ;)

About scent like i said harmony of anise-vetiver-licorice. Fresh, clean and aromatic perfect for summer. This guy is ONE LEVEL scent.
Sillage and longevity not good but ok.

Overall

Sillage 6/10

I sniffed this for the first time yesterday my uncle has this fragrance. Let me tell you that this anise/vetiver scent is very nice and very very unqiue. It's very unfortunate that this has been discontinued. The vetiver reminds me of the dirty vetiver in encre noir. I will not pay 100 dollars for this scent. But a local discounter has many of these in stock for 40 dollars. Will be picking up a couple of bottles and wear it through out this coming summer.

Scent: 8/10
Projection: 7/10

Ive just found this one too.

Great Fragrance! It starts off as Anisette and quickly dries down into a just right, faint spicey licorice backed up by light citrus and cedar. Beautiful, really nice, very unique.


Try it. You'll like it!

A piece of art.
From juice till the bottle.

Beautiful fragrance, it could easily become a signature scent for me. Nice vetiver brightened with anise, then has a nice soft drydown. To me, KenzoAir is the love child of Kenzo Homme Boisee (which is most of Air's opening) and L'Eau par Kenzo pour Homme (supplying Air's drydown)

This has been my everyday fragrance when I was a student in the university. Apart from the happy memories this is an excellent fragrance composed by one of the greats, Maurice Roucel. Basically it is a friendly, peppery-fresh vetiver, heavy on Iso-E Super and with anise on top. Surely synthetic but unlike other modern niche fragrances that are equally synthetic and rely on marketing, this actually hides inspiration in its composition. In other words, you can happen to buy it simply because it smells good and not because of the fanfare surrounding it. In two words joyful and unpretentious. For a modern update check L'Homme De Coeur by Divine.

to me it is the better spicebomb .. hehe
just an amazing composition with anis caraway and licorice roots .. just too good to be true this juice ..
.. nice blended !!

I just got the 50ml in a set with the shower gel. Love it - much woodier than kenzo woody (the brown bottle). Like others have said, this starts off a little aniseed-y. About an hour or so later a very light version of encre noir comes through.

I've never even considered aniseed as as a fragrance ingredient i would be interested in, but this frag has been a subtle nose opener.

The last flask I bought was in 2011, in a website I can´t remember. It came to me from Israel. Before it arrives here in Brazil I already know it would be alterated in its scent, coz it was discontinuated long time ago. And was exactly that what happened. It had a terrible scent of tobaco/urine... what a pitty...
Please, let´s send Kenzo lots of mails asking them to return this masterpiece... I can´t find kenzo´s e-mail anywhere.. Somebody can help me?

consegui uma garrafa e tenho o AIR e o AIR INTENSE ...ambos muito parecidos,ótimos de boa projeção e fixação relevante. aroma exclusivo e sedutor de fato. pena ser descontinuado,fragancia merece respeito.

I've been looking for this fragrance and I decided to stop by at local fragrance hut store. And luckily, they happen to have the tester and I tested it. From initial spray, I smell strong alcohol, and as it dried down it started to smell like terre d'hermes. If the original kenzo air isn't supposed to smell like that, please let me know.

Alafrom is right, if ever you have the chance to layer Etro anice with Encre noire the result is unmistakably ----------> kenzoAIR! So remarkably similar when layered but both are so very unlike kenzoAIR on their own.

I further agree that there is little or no difference in the original and intense variations. Intense has a slight blue tint to it where original is clear. Furthermore the intense versions box is identical to the original except it has a glaring sun on it. The intense versions bottle is not frosted but rather a clear plastic.

Lastly, so far to my experience I have yet to buy a bottle that comes filled with more than 50-60% juice. They all say 90ml but the reality is you are getting around 60ml. It's may be due to leakage or evap or just manufacturing limitations. But with such a special scent I suspect it's discontinuation had more to do with packaging than anything else!

**NOTE** never ship a bottle of kenzoAIR or its intense counterpart via airmail. There is a very very high likelyHood the bottle will burst under pressure and you will receive a cracked bottle or worse a leaky mess!

9/10. A staple of my collection!!!
Recently bought it ... So there are still stocks of the old production. Fragrance makes happy after a long search!

This is a light and airy fragrance, maybe one of the best Kenzo's I've ever tried. It does bother me that it's gone after about 2 hours. It's projection also could've been better, but I suppose that would tear down the core concept of the fragrance; air.

Like Taskphorce said, you can easily detect the Iso E Super. Considering this fragrances perfume is 48% Iso E Super and Encre Noir's is 45% Iso E Super, it's also not really a shock they have similarities. I found them close enough at times to vote for a reminder of the other fragrance, but only in their drydown.

/edit: When smelling them side by side they seem more different than I had thought them to be. It's strange, because the first few times when I smelled Encre Noir it made me think of Air, but it had been nearly 8 years since I had smelled that. And when I recently put on Air again for the first time in those 8 years, it made me think of a lighter Encre Noir.

Air has the added licorice and anise notes, which really complement each other and together with Iso E Super they form a great team. I guess they have the Iso E Super and vetiver in common, but that is pretty much it. Comparing them side by side after about 30 minutes, they share similarities but Air is a lot lighter than Encre Noir. I guess it's the Iso E Super that keeps popping up every once in a while.

So in conclusion. Are they the same? No. Do they have similarities? Yes. In the end, I think Tom Ford's Grey Vetiver would be closer related to Encre Noir than Kenzo Air is. Grey Vetiver could be it's younger and lighter summertime brother, while Air is more of a nephew.
Somebody have kenzo paris e-mail adress? We have to send them one million e-mails for them to bring back this masterpiece. I never found kenzo contact in the websites... :-(
I really love this one on my boyfriend, it smells warm, confident and sexy ! for me, it's one of the best masculine fragrances out there.

After many reviews, of good and bad this fragrance is, also on the bottle design, some love it, some hate it... I bought one anyway.

The fragrance opens with soft anise-caraway accord tamed by the woody notes, and it lingers in such a nice way. You may think this might smell spicy due to the aromatics used, but it is not!

I do find this fragrance has a moderate lasting power, with a good silage. I wonder if this has been discontinued, because I couldn't find this at any fragrance store let alone the Kenzo perfume counter.

Oh, no this is gone? I really liked this one! Vetiver can be soooo overpowering, but this was a light, airy version, with hints of smoke and only the faintest traces of anise or bergamot. Just a gorgeous almost incense-wafting-in-fresh-air fragrance. Maurice Roucel does it again!

I know it's quite late in the day, given that this is no longer produced but this was and probably remains my favourite scent to date and the one that made me interested, properly, in scent in the first place.

The strong anise note just seemed to cling and cling and was like nothing else I've smelt since.

Why, oh why, did Kenzo drop this amazing fragrance?!?!?!!

I have read somewhere that one of the ingredients is ISO E-SUPER. But it's not in the notes.
That's why someone might smell there synthetic.
Love, love, love this perfume!!! If you want something unique for the summer and not a usual fruity-sweet stuff pls try it.
If you liked and missed this fragrance, try Chopard's Noble Vetiver. Even better!!!

My husband bought this for me and then started knicking it himself. It is obviously a unisex fragrance. I love it and it smells great on him too. It has notes that I have been looking for, for along time in perfume. Clean and sophisticated and as the day progesses it is still there

Kenzo Air, its simplicity is its strength; irresistible aromatic freshness with a hint of liquorice in the background, is the scent that makes you rediscover nature that you thought you had lost, the horizon that brings you free and clear to follow a kite in the sky ... it's the air of freedom and the great outdoors ... this time Kenzo has hit the mark.
To be missed.

This is a strong scent in my opinion, with a nice vetiver drydown. Even though it's versatile enough to be used in any season, Kenzoair makes a welcome change for me from the usual aquatics in summer.

@ravjan: The blue colour inside the bottle is not that of the juice, but instead a (sneaky) blue plastic insert - I took my bottle apart (don't ask me why) - and the juice is simply a typically common yellowish colour.

Actually this is not airing or uplifting like it looks!
Like any other fragrance from Kenzo, this has some signature note from the house (this is why I love Kenzo), something like pepper or incense.
I like it, but not so sure about a purchase in future.

P.S: The bottle is a masterpiece

An underrated gem.

It happened by accident that I layered two fragrances. I was testing Encre Noir to write my final review and instead of spraying it on an unscented smelling strip, I sprayed it on a piece of paper on which I previously tested Etro's Anice.
What a suprise to smell the anisic aspect of vetiver amphasized by the real anise note. Especially in the drydown when the two perfumes blended perfectly together.

Well, I found Kenzo Air Intense / Kenzo Air to have a very similar vibe to the above scenario and despites probably not being as praised as Encre Noir, it still has a great charme. Peppery, anisic, funny. Chemical? Yes, most definitely, but very well blended. Does great in warm weather.

If you're wondering about the differencies between the "intense" version and the original, well, I haven't found a substantial one. The "intense" is exactly like the original version but a little bit stronger, that's it.

Rating: 7.5/10
One of the frags I simply cannot stand! And it's all for anise. Shame because the bottle and the colour of the juice inside are so pretty..

It's feminine enough for me and I enjoy wearing it every once in a while when the weather gets warm. It is indeed light and airy and what I can smell the most are the citrus notes. What I could do without is the caraway note - I don't like it in food and it turns out that it's just as unsavory in perfume.

تقریبا شبیه بوی لالیک انسیر نویر میباشد

ولی کمی ظریفتر ولطیفتر

Almost like smell Encre Noire Lalique

But a little bit more delicate and subtle
reviewer_name: D A V A R I

review_content:
Yay! My 3rd Kenzo is finally here. Kenzo Air is not a very strong scent. I spritz it twice on my wrist and I have a hard time smelling it, perhaps my skin is too dry.
For the scent, there is nothing fruity or floral here at all, but just woods. I only smell this wet woody vetiver with fresh cedar + licorice combo. The scent is wet and cold; like a wet forest or driftwood by the river bank or even a haystack. Somehow, I still find it fresh and quite unique. It's never too hard nor even appear to be herbal.
In my opinion, this is not a very usual fragrance, and it's a must try, especially for those who are interested in an interesting woody scent, and the blocky bottle is quite a collectible item.
am a Flight steward, i thnk every airliner will be dawn to it! coz its nice,unique, fashionablly and affordable..i always have trust with Kenzo products!

Try this on your skin and Paul Smith Story at the same time. Both are similiar. Maybe, if you add more wood, more vetiver, a "burning forest" note* and increase the power, we could have a little idea of how Lalique Encre Noire smells.

*Someone wrote "Burning forest" about Encre Noire in another forum.

I love this perfume. The smell of anise is one of my favourites. Kenzo Air is fresh and woody at the same time, with anise and vetiver together through the dry down. So different and unique that everyone should try it!

Hey I bought this one two days ago and I noticed this morning that the bottle was half full :s I love the scent and since I got it I can´t stop spraying it on me every chance I get; but half bottle in two days it´s just impossible. Can anybody who owns this please tell me if theirs came half full too?
Yes,this scent is special,the anise...i like it!It`s light but so pleasant, so blue, so free...

I see it as an unisex and ageless scent, very fresh, light, but not cheap "blue". It has the spirit of boundlessness. I gave it to my mother who is 70 and she loves it! For myself, I prefer somewhat stronger colognes, though.
though it is a men parfume i bought it when i went to italy . at the begining i wanted to be a gift for my father.. but it ended in my drawer. lovely scent

Light, summery, fresh but somehow different from others fresh fragrances. Begins with anise and bergamot, then it changes to vetiver which reminds me this from Encre Noire Lalique except it's more sweet. Quite nice frag great for hot summer days I suppose. The bottle is as always in Kenzo a piece of art.
I think Air is just a love-me-or-leave-me from the start. Many people find it weird because of the strong anise note and I loved it precisely for that. Refreshing.
i liked this fragance and it was cool at first, but then... i don't know, i just stopped liking it.

IT´S MY FRAGRANCE, I LOVE IT. THE ANIS IS SO INTENSE AT THE BEGGINING, AT THE MIDDLE IT BECAMES MORE BERGAMOTA AND AT LAST, IS LIKE SWEET-WARM-WATER FOR TEA, SO COMFORTABLY...
....
p.s.
Somebody can tell me if kenzoair was discontinued? I´m having troubles to find this here in my country. :-(

great drydown, but a little weak on the opening, made by Maurice Roucel who usually makes only great fragrances
afraafra
Iran

I bought this from Kenzo website, when it was released. It was purchased based on the notes. For reference, fragrances on my skin usually wears true to notes described. To my disappointment, the soft lactonic note last about five minutes on my skin., then transitions to a unisex skin scent. I gave it a couple more chances during different seasons, same result. When I decide to downsize my collection, it would go. I think it could be quite nice on a man.

I have the newer bottle of this. I believe both versions are discontinued (in the US, anyway), and I’m not sure if the bottle change also meant a reformulation. Either way, I do really like this scent. It was a blind buy years ago, and I almost swapped it away. It’s very simple. It’s a lactonic rice note with perhaps the most subtle floral in the background. However, it did grow on me and I’m glad to have it. It’s very calming and smells a bit like skin, with does give it just a hint of “sensual” vibes - but it’s incredibly subdued. Imagine you put on a fragranced lotion before bed. This is your skin when you wake up. Very beautifully done.

Mixed bag here. If you are looking for a rice "soliflore" after falling in love with the note? This is not your holy grail (edit: Poesie Soft - you're welcome). That is a woefully incomplete notes list (or lack therof) and you will be dissapointed. (as I was with my most expensive blind buy ever) BUT, it is quite lovely, it is soft, very light florals (possibly lotus and just a touch of orange blossom?), a bit lotion-creamy, the rice is definitely there and very nice. Would make a wonderful daily scent for someone in a health care field or other profession that requires a very discrete and comforting scent only. I would not say it is a smell alike to Arden Beauty, but take away the rhubarb and dial the whole thing back a bit and you have a pretty good idea of this.
Very soft powdery bedtime scent

Even though alot of you aren't writing positive things about this one, I want to try it because Kenzo doesn't really f*ck up when it comes to knowing what smells good. I like powdery scents and the combo with rice intrigues me.
Totally uninteresting. It doesn't even smell like rice. I wouldn't even call it a perfume. Maybe it's an aroma scent, but then again it's weak, flowery, common and not at all what the name suggests.

Its aromatherapy effect is sensual and relaxing, I LOVE it! Such an interesting interpretation of rice, it suits a very refined, sophisticated and self-confident woman who could seduce a man with her light, delicate but sensual scent or simply wants to smell airy and natural. What comes to my mind when I smell Kenzoki Sensual Rice Steam? Alluring peace and quiet, and sensuality on the horizon...
Absolutely amazing in its simplicity. There's got to be something magical about it, every time i'm in a shop i keep coming back to this lovely water. Shame they don't have an EDP/EDT for this.

I was delighted by the smell and then suddenly became totally indifferent, what bothers me is the powdery note, aromatic and lasts quite long on the skin. I like the Kenzoki line of products, especially cream for the body.
Ginger is the best, imo, refreshing and pleasant for summer.
i smelled that one at the store it was on my hand since the next day

Personnally, it doesn't remind me of azuki beans nor mochi, I smell rose syrup with vanilla. Nonetheless, it definitely has a pastry character : salty notes that highlight the sweetness and a softness, almost like powder but not quite.

This has the same vibe as Poudre Matcha (also from the Kenzo Memori collection), but it's sweeter and less powdery.

Taking into account how powdery and creamy the Memoir collection is, and the listed rice note, I feel this perfume is sharper than expected.
Don't get me wrong, this perfume is quite nice. But the I was expecting something with that unique powder note that brings rice and I got almost only black currant, with that sharp and almost citrusy scent. It is pretty, tho. It is sweet but have some savory vibe that makes it not vanilla or tonka sweet, but as most gourmands, but a more realistic sweet.
If you are looking for cozy rice note, go for Tatami Nuit.
As all the perfumes of Memoir collection, sillage and longevity are not great.

I find it more flowery than fruity actually.
Maybe rose ?
I didn't like the opening actually. At fist I just thought like a vintage flowery fragrance and I was very disappointed. But the dry down is worth it : soft, fruity and somewhat savory. In a very subtle way. I don't find it gourmand at all though.
I can't smell the rice note.
Now I got used to the very flowery opening and it is okay.
I would call it a spring/summer lovely scent.

Coeur Azuki is just an instant love for me. We have tiny assorted Turkish delights in Türkiye called ‘kuş lokumu’ and they are not as sweet as the regular ones but fruity and so flavorful and this fragrance reminded me those mouthwatering sweet treats. My childhood was full of tiny Turkish delights so the moment i’ve sprayed on my skin it transported me to my innocent, carefree childhood days. Luckily i’ve found the key to my old sweet memories and it’s pretty satisfying for my appetite as well, always enjoy to wear it🎈

Agreed that it reminds of mochi cakes. You may want to try it if you're usually not into gourmands. I am normally turned off by them, but this one is an exception. This is not cloying or heavy and I don't feel like I just robbed a whole confectioner's after spraying it. Very light, kinda understated scent. I love occasionally smelling it on myself during the day.
Located in US, would like to buy a bottle, or possibly swap. Message me! :)

Fragrance a little too sweet and fruity for my taste - but HAPPILY for once, without being too synthetic! Nice but not exceptional. The rice note is almost non-existent for me... the longevity is there!

Unisex? Not at all! I can't imagine it being worn by a man...

The dry-down is very pleasant, and becomes less sweet and much more cocooning.

7.5/10

This one smells to me very similar to Very Good Girl and Rose of no man’s land at the same time. I definitely get a rose with vanilla, something musky, too, and some berry-like sourness. I am surprised that the rose is so prominent to my nose and it is not even listed there. Apparently I am getting it from a combo of other notes.

Maybe it is less sparkling than musky rose fragrances with lychee but this one somehow leans towards them.

I usually don't fall for this type at all, but Cœur Azuki is very charming. It's fun, playful, vibrant, young, even juvenile, but also remains very subtle. Reminds me of gummies with a slight powder on top, the ones that just been opened and aren't too fresh. Of mochis too! Lovely and unique.

An airy, sweet, inoffensive fragrance. I bought it in the airport while coming back from holidays in Greece. It just instantly transported me to my childhood - it reminded me of my best friend and it brought back all the feelings and memories of a long gone past. It’s fascinating how a scent can ravage your soul…It’s definitely sweet, yet fresh and clean, but not detergent clean, it feels more like a luxury spa kinda of scent.
This definitely smells like berry mochis. Sweet and fruity with a subtle tang. It's also light and feminine.
Where is this available in the states?

This is nice. The opening smells like a warm pudim and then it turns into a mildly sweet floral scent. Feminine and comforting. A good scent to wear around children. Reminded me of the cherry blossom scents from L’Occitane en Provence.

This is an elegant, sophisticated and subtle, simplistic soft sweet scent. It's definitely a skin scent, though. Ageless feminine leaning unisex.

Like Nagchampesque described below, it has that Turkish delight-like powdery, natural sweet smell. I would say perhaps mochi, since it's inspired by Japanese heritage. An elegant simple gourmand to my nose. I do get a lot of rice and vanilla in the dry down. It's quite lovely.

I admit that I bought this secretly hoping it would smell like azuki/anko well it doesn’t at all to me.

I would describe it as ‘Turkish delight-ish’, an elegant and slightly sweet blackcurrant floral perfume. Unfortunately it is a skin scent but a pleasant one nonetheless.
Where can I buy this in the US?
I need this!

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo pour Femme Limited Edition Kenzo
review_content: I really like this eventho what is left in my small bottle is nil. This smells fresh and powdery at the same time like guest_zetlover discribed. I really enjoyed this. Nothing really interesting but it's still beautiful and simple. Good for everyday wear.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo pour Femme Limited Edition Kenzo
review_content: simple but lovely

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Pour Homme Hyper Wave Kenzo
review_content: Currently in Egypt and this is good for the day straight out the shower. Reminds me Slightly of Creed Erolfa 7.8/10

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Pour Homme Hyper Wave Kenzo
review_content: Very pleasant, light summer scent.It's like a citrusy iced drink, yum-yum.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Pour Homme Hyper Wave Kenzo
review_content:
Kenzo Hyper Wave is a good summer refreshing scent.Smells like when you are sitting near sea,drinking some tangerine Schweppes and breathing sea salt.And you know that smell when waves comes and goes from you,they leave some seaweed smell. That's exactly what does it smell.
Longevity is ok for summer scent,it could be better,i saw even worse.A few hours you can enjoy and relax yourself with this very good perfume.
From me 7.5/10.It would be higher,but performance...
For this price 35/40€ 100ml, just buy it and enjoy.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Pour Homme Hyper Wave Kenzo
review_content: Ultra fresh, very youthful fragrance. Great for hot days. Really pleasant uplifting scent. It reminds me a little bit of CK One. I'm really liking it Sometimes it's hard to put your finger on exactly why as its not groundbreaking, but it's quite an addictive smell and I think it'll do well in the heat. I love orangey/mandarin fragrances and this does that note really nicely. I don't personally find this all that "aquatic" as in sea notes. It's more that the mandarin comes across juicy and watery. So far I really like the way Kenzo does freshies.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Pour Homme Hyper Wave Kenzo
review_content: We can call this fragrance Davidoff Cool Water, whose hardness is taken lightly and sweetened. Although its freshness and sweetness rate is truly enormous, its recognizability and permanence is just as weak.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Pour Homme Hyper Wave Kenzo
review_content:
Hyper Wave is very, very similar to the original L'eau par Kenzo pour homme.
I think it has slightly better performance. It's still not an amazing performer.

Like the original, Hyper Wave evokes a relaxing day by the pool more than the raw, untamed sea.

Fresh, likeable, youthful, breezy... simple and inconsequential in the best sense of the word, like a summer breeze.

Great for sweltering summer days.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Pour Homme Hyper Wave Kenzo
review_content:
I think the current rating is too low - 3.74 ... Personally I would give it 4.5 rating.

It's fresher smoother, more white floral/watery version of Versace pour homme.
It's like 70% similiar to Versace pour homme but this is summer only whereas I find Versace more versatile.

It smells very simple and quite generic yes, but it's also very very nice.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Pour Homme Hyper Wave Kenzo
review_content: So simple but good! Opens with a burst of seawater and mandarin. Just showers you in it, almost feels like being hit by a... Hyper Wave? Then that aromatic segment of mandarin mixes with the moss to create a juicy almost candy like mandarin smell. To me it almost smells gourmandy, like a mandarin orange just waiting to be bitten into but it does this almost completely without sweetness.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Pour Homme Hyper Wave Kenzo
review_content: I treated myself to this recently. I am a huge sucker for the Kenzo house and aquatics in general. My first thought is it's...very nice! The last flanker I bought was L'eau Par Kenzo Colours which I found a little bland and dated. This is much fresher, modern, and vibrant. The scent is not loud at all and stays close to the skin but it is at least still there after 5-6 hours. Overall an improvement on the previous flankers. Fresh, invigorating, and breezy. Don't expect beast mode and if you can find it for a good price you could do a lot worse for a summer freshie. I have tried Hyper Wave Pour Femme in store and that is much 'juicer' and has a more interesting note combo. Update on the Pour Homme version: The performance is actually better than I first thought, with pleasant green sillage hitting my nose even after a few hours. A really pleasant green aquatic which I do not regret buying.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Pour Homme Hyper Wave Kenzo
review_content:
It's better than the original, mostly because it's more simple. There is this sweet and fresh opening that reminds on paper like shower gel, but on skin more like a youthful smell. It's unisex, not that it's feminine or masculine, but because it's so inoffensive and easy to like.

Currently totally digging it.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Pour Homme Hyper Wave Kenzo
review_content: This is a citrussy take on the original Kenzo L'eau. The review below me is spot on, starts with strong citrus and dries down to a slight mossy scent. I don't think the performance is as strong as the original L'eau, which radiated for hours in the summer. This is fine for a light citrus aquatic, as it's not that complex.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Pour Homme Hyper Wave Kenzo
review_content: It starts with the slightly oceanic tangerine note. For the first minutes it is the light aqua aroma but then it turns to the complex connection between sea notes and moss. I do not like this transition. But 30 minutes later it stops being intense and becomes mild fragrance. I advise to use this aroma men 18-34 years old.

product_name: L'Eau Kenzo Pour Homme Hyper Wave Kenzo
review_content: Pleasant light and fresh scent. Surprisingly good. Worth a try if you need a new fragrance for the summer.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content: Smells like a spring day, dipping your head in a bouquet of flowers. Or going out into nature in full bloom. Never knew violets could smell so heavenly! Even though its an EDT its a rich and strong smell, but I'm so glad it's not nauseating, just pure flowers. The very first perfume I bought for myself ❤️

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content: looking for something similar! got an old bottle from work and gave it to my mom and she absolutely fell in love! been trying to find her a replacement that smells like it. i've seen that insolence by guerlain smells similar but it just doesn't hit the same :(

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content: Flower Lumiere is my best from the Flower's collection. It's a violet and musk bomb with a very strong projection. I can hardly smell any citrus, the heliotrope and Ylang-Ylang notes dominate but not in an old-school way. The composition is classic and classy, very feminine and beautiful. The scent is ideal for cool spring days

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content:
Although Kenzo Lumiere is EDT , it has a beast projection and it lasts a whole day on me. For me it is quite similar to LˇAbsolue, however, Lumiere is fruity and flowery. I could not depict these notes in L´Absolue. Lumiere has also got musk, but it is softer than in l´absolue and it is mixed with flowers and fruit notes.
I loved them both and I could not decide, which is better. They are both much the same and yet much different.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content: this opens with a very strong violet with musk. it smells like violet candies. i think the currant is adding a hint of greenness here as well. it's a springtime floral. heliotrope comes in about 5 minutes in, softening things up a bit and adding a bit of a powdery element (but nowhere near as powdery as i remember the original to be.) the violet remains quite strong on me...while i like it, i wish the violet was more toned down as i think my skin is really amping it up.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content: A jasmine bomb! Very strong, beast mode, headache inducing jasmine. All that from only just ONE spray. Smells nothing like the OG and definitely nothing like ANY of the Guerlain Insolences, which I happen to be a huge fan of because of the violets. The violets are non existent here. Gotta go wash it off now.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content: Smells like a grape 🍇 jolly rancher to me lol

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content: I first smelled this at an airport- fell in love and bought it. However when I hit 2 months with this perfume, it started to grow very nausea and headache-inducing on me. It's a very heavy perfume, floral and almost fruity at first but then dries down to this weird musky clean scent. I now dread wearing this perfume and passed it onto my mom.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content:
Guys, I might even be going crazy, but on my skin the Eau de Lumière version here was crazy bomb, and I liked being able to discover another greatness of this Flower's Collection that carry a DNA of powder from madam about to retire! The bottles, at least for me, are a Katana in their entirety! [laughs]...

I like the citrus and greenish mix that it reveals right when sprayed, it looks like the sun has arrived and with its rays it brings that unexpected feeling of heat, but it's not scary for having a lemonade and a lot of tropical, citrus fruits in the mix.

In the heart, Jasmine's dirty footprint is very evident, but this note is oily, aromatic and evident for good, due to Ylang Ylang; here the fruitiness does not refer to fresh peach, but dissected peach, placed in the sun and bright as the name of the fragrance suggests. I remember the Flower by Kenzo matrix here, the crazy but measured talc, fine powder, classy, eminently decided.

In the "goodbye" of it, I feel a balsamic touch, which involves a characteristic sweetness of Vanilla bean, but that doesn't bother, all added to the sharp characteristic that Violet and its leaves are able to transmit. Musk to sensualize and seal the illuminated proposal of Eau de Lumière, by Kenzo!

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content:
fresh and clean. i can describe this one as jasmine-peach with a powdery violet base.

I think because of the peach and violets, i feel this is leaning sweetish. this is not like the original Flower at all, even though it does share the powder base.

On me, it blooms more when sprayed on skin vs on clothes. The sweetness-acidic nature of peaches is slightly more prominent too on skin.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content: Very powdery. The flowery scent only last a couple minutes than it was just powdery. Not a bad powdery smell, still kinda nice but it is just too powdery for my taste. It last forever because of that though, sometimes I can still smell it even though I already took a bath. The only occasion I think is suitable for this perfume is a cold sunny day in spring. Other than that, I feel like this perfume would be too overwhelming.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content:
Review is for my own reference - I actually like this floral! I think this would make a really nice relaxing bubble bath for a daytime bath. It smells like grammy's bath cube salts but in a nice way. I wouldn't buy this, but I might keep if gifted. But again I'd use it as a bubble bath. Smells like a clean, fancy, yet humble older woman :) Deifinelty a daytime scent. It seems like the silage might be an arms-length or bigger. and so far it seems like it would last long. A pleasant floral, I keep smelling my wrist :) The powdery note is noticeable, kind of reminds me of scented carpet soda or a foot powder, but in a nice way.

Edit: as this dries down I am liking it more, it's becoming sweeter. It reminds me of how Sears used to smell. Def keeping my sample of this!
It doesn't last as long as I would like it to :(
Flower and Flower Eau de Lumière Kenzo do NOT smell similar!

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content: Beautiful. To me it’s like they found and bottled one single beautiful smell rather than multiple scents, chemicals, and ingredients. Like this smell in its complete form was gifted to the brand from on high. It’s very well blended and I have no desire to prise from it the individual notes. I had no idea what was listed when I first smelled this but I immediately got the impression of mimosa. I could hazard a guess that it’s the ylang ylang and heliotrope, but I won’t. In my mind, I’m in mimosa heaven and there I will stay.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content: white flowers bomb on my skin. and musk. i never wore this in summer. this fragrance plays totally different in warm weather. this reminds me one of those oldschooll fragrances. in particular Chanel Nr.5 right now all i can smell.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content:
This forgotten sample gives me today the first flower of springtime, perce-neige, crocus and violet, a little bit of jasmine, for a first sunny and cold day....and it gives me a strange memory of an old sample wich was the first perfume I could smell : the first and old Miss Dior ...
I wonder if Kenzo eau de lumière, lighter and greener than Flower can be a choice for next spring..;;;so nice, so cute.. simply breath.......

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content: So far from the beloved original!! I really was hoping to get more violet .. To me, it is musky, sticky, aquatic. Great lasting power.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content: I get an initial blast of oceanic notes and synthetic floral musk with violet in the background, a reminder of it's original and no Bergamot whatsoever. There are no aquatic notes listed but that's what I smell. Tested it last year and really liked it, got a bottle but unfortunately I don't get on with the notes.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content: Unfortunately this was a letdown for me. I regret choosing this over original Flower (both were on sale). I made the decision based on the first 15 mins on my skin, should've waited longer! When I got home, original Flower smelled better than Eau de Lumière. When I sprayed Eau de Lumière the smell was great at first, such a bright flower explosion! But dry down was simply musky soap/laundry. It's not bad, just not the kind of summer scent I was looking for.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content:
I must say that I had been imagining the notes for a long time before this perfume came into my hands. And I was not disappointed. It has a very sparkling floral and fruity output.
I am not a fan of the aroma of peach or peach but in this case it does not bother, since it is balanced with notes of violet, rose and jasmine. In summary, it is a citrus-floral start perfume with hints of peach and violets that give it that powdery powdery soft background. Very feminine and used more spring, I am using it in winter on cold days and it is quite nice too. Of moderate wake and duration over 5 hours on my skin.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content: On my skin, it doesn't smell anything like the original which I LOVE and was my signature for sometime. I really wanted more violet .. It is too musky, sticky, aquatic. I actually can't stand it. It is very lasting too, I can smell it even after a shower.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
