review_content: This one is a very unique...well...there is original Kenzo flowed DNA in it, but not a lot and you can detect Kenzo flower but little hints of it. You can actually say it will be more Givenchy Amarige family member rather than Kenzo Flower. Overall this is nice, pleasant well balanced scent creation. Juts prefect for warm sunny spring days.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content: So, I'm originally a big fan of Kenzo Flower EDP. I'd gotten low on the bottle I had, hadn't sprayed it in months, so I gave it to my cousin who had been begging for it for forever. Thought I'd try a different variation, and this is very pretty. Problem for me is, it's too floral. I like a bit more warm / powdery scent. Once it dried down for nearly 24hrs on my business card, I like it, but I don't want to wait forever to like a scent on my skin. I have a full 1.7 oz bottle up for trade if anyone's interested, I'll stick with my regular Flower.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content:
Characteristics
-Very Smooth, very well blended and beautiful
-Not overwhelming even you splash it all over the body
-Sillage is in your own range, longevity is 6-8 hrs but after 6 hrs it becomes very light musky-powdery smell left and nothing mimic sunlight anymore

Scene
-Smell like someone place a bouquet of flower on the table next to tall large window, and then when sun rise, the lumière break through the window into the room, splash on the bouquet and thus, light warm smell start to showing out
-“Smell like the fresh flower vaporate under sunlight”
-Not green, mostly floral and warm

Suitable
-Any age women
-Day time
-Best In Autumn
-Any occasion even on date day
-Best suitable when you walk in the garden in early evening time before sunset, sky starts to be orange
-When watching sunset with your lover
-Because the hint of sunlight, I also like to wear it in the day that I wanna feel there is still some hope, light at the end of dark tunnel
-To give encouragement

Conclusion
-I know there is no sunlight note in the pyramid, but really they work a good job mixing all the notes out there to mimic sunlight, and I do feel it real
-I love it

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content: Well, this was quite unique. Light floral, yet musky. I can't say I mind it, but it doesn't knock my socks off either. Prominent purple flowers (very distinct lilac and rather distinct violet) and light (however contradictory it might sound) white musk. I love the original Flower, and this one is a whole different perfume. I'm guessing not many hardcore Flower by Kenzo EDP lovers would be charmed by this flanker.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content:
Ad is right. This subtle, defenseless, fragile and fragrant crystal flower has the power to color grey rising skyscrapers, and leaden skies in my city now, so even by just opening the cap.
The state of grace is a parallel world and I live it in this rainbow with 'Eau de Lumière'.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content: Soo nice. Tried this on in store, and kept getting this lovely, soft, warm? Sweet, gentle floral, almost delicious smell, puffing dreamily from my arm, anytime I moved or there was a breeze around me. I am only dissapointed that I got a 50ml instead of 100ml, will probably buy another one soon to make up for this lol. I just can't get enough of it, the Drydown has me taking deeper more frequent breaths through my nose just to try to inhale the intoxicating aroma coming from my own skin. I have been searching for something soft but that projects around me, and I daresay this does. I can smell it when my arm isn't near my face, and it lasts for hours. It has become a skin scent now but this is like, over 6 hours since I sprayed it on. Happy I got it,:)

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content:
To me, Flower smells like violets on a rainy Summer day, and Flower Eau de Lumière is violets on a sunny day. Because past the first 30 minutes dominated by bergamot and quite close to J'Adore EdT, Eau de Lumière turns almost exactly like original Flower on my skin. A bit more citrus, and quite a bit more musky, but a couple of hours after spraying, I can barely tell the difference. Its longevity is clearly superior to the original though. It stays all day long. I also like the stronger musky notes, but I'm a fan of musky floral fragrances.
A lovely relaxing version of Flower.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content:
Opening is beautiful, sweet, fresh flowery fragrance, bergamot gives a special vibe. I almost bought it immediately, but decided to wait. And it was a good decision, unfortunately it quickly turned to a musk bomb on me. Not really nice, a bit masculine and couldn’t stand it really. I was very sorry about it as the opening was gorgeous.
I strongly recommend to try it first and wait. Don’t blind buy it (unless you are a musk fan).

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content: Quite different from The original flowers which I by The way ADORE. This one also has The powder but also a peachy smell. The compostion in This one is very balanced and wellajusted. Nice, fresh, clean, soft and feminine. The scent is inoffensive and pleasant. Longevity and silage is average on me.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content: I like the combination of violet and peach. This is light, easy to wear, suitable for summer and daytime wear. Perfect for people who like soft and floral scents but want to stay away from overwhelming or rosy scents.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content:
Opening flower then turns powdery and ends in musk
Beautiful scent. Elegant I love it so much
Really beautiful

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content: This doesn't resemble original Flower at all. At least to my nose. It's elegant,grown up women scent. At first i didn't liked it too much,but after some time I applied it again and i like it more. Very elegant,slightly powdery,warm fragrance.This suits a women who has elegant,classy style.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content: Kenzo eau de lumiere sneakingly creeped it's way into my fragrance collection when I stumbled across it during the holidays. This perfume has quickly reached my top 5. Blooming with radiance, this perfume is perfect for spring and summer. I personally use fragrances all year around. However, if I really like a fragrance I just limit or increase the amount of perfume spritzed according to season. Flower eau de lumiere illuminates with sensuality and elegance. With notes of jasmine, bergamot, peach, white musk, and Bulgarian rose, this fragrance is ultra feminine and sure to grab you lots of compliments. If you enjoy the original flower fragrance, imagine it but with a touch of light liquid gold that illuminates and has you shining. I like kenzo, but I LOVE eau de lumiere. You can tell the two belong to the same family group, but they smell completely different. This fragrance has gotten compliments any time I have had it on and if you would like a new lovely fragrance that has amazing longevity and silage, but isn't totally out there I recommend this! x ❥❥

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content:
I'm actually disappointed there aren't more reviews of this beauty. I do hope it sticks around.

I find it lovely. Fresh, floral, subtle yet lasts all day. I'm reminded of an updated version of Givenchy Amarige, but prettier and brighter.

This was a genuine sniff and must have. I've been reaching for this and only this for 3 full months now, and that's very unlike me.

It's beautiful.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content: just got this today and another winner from the kenzo flower line :) im a huge flower fan :) its one of my signature scents :) and this one is lighter than the original but still smells beautiful :) a light floral......

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content:
This perfume smells nothing like the legendary Kenzo Flower created in 2000 by Morillas and I'm really grateful about it. Truth is, the classic Flower has never been my ''type'' of perfume, my cup of tea and I've tested it several times, but no, it never trigged my love for it. I love florals but Flower was just too much - too much sweet and powdery to the point I started to dislike it even on other people. Everytime I smelt it on other women I got sick and nauseated also helped by the fact that the perfume has a very considerable sillage (smelling it on the bus it made me search for some fresh air and made my stomach turn). That's the reason why I banned Flower and all its infinite flankers from ever smelling them .

When I SA this year made me test Eau Lumière as a new release I was kind of allarmed because I thought it would be another very similar scent to Flower. But when I smelt the paper strip all of my fears dissipated and I was smelling one of the most lovely perfumes. It has got nothing to do with the original Flower thank God and it was love at first smell for me. Eau Lumière is sweet but not overly sweet, it's a very beautiful blend between flower notes, white musk and fruit notes. The name is so adequate in my opinion- the fragrance is really luminous, joyful, young, full of spirit, shining. It may not be a perfume masterpiece or an extraordinary one woth to be remembered in the Hall of fame of perfumes but it's nonetheless an uplifting and joyous fragrance for everyday use, not complicated or sophisticated that can be worn in everytime of year. It's a perfume that you wear for your own happiness, without making a statement but just to make you feel good.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content: Soapy citrus, flowers. Musk seems bit "dirty", thou with time it settles in better. Light, feminine, inoffensive, soapy. I usually don't like soapy perfumes, but this one seems good. It's not "aggressive" cheap soap scent.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content: The crisp white shirt version of Flower L'Elixir. Where L'Elixir is sweet and abundant, Eau de Lumiere is dry and restrained, but there's an overlap in their DNA. Very good as far as musky florals go, tart without being annoyingly sharp. I like it better than the original Flower.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content:
This is really a luminous scent.
I get a strong jasmine and not much else. it is rather simple, but i like it better than the original Flower.This one doesn´t have that powdery tristesse from the original. It is still a bit powdery but it is much lighter and more solar.
I am not in love with it, but it is nice.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content:
FLOWER lumiere

I like the
Is better than FLOWER and the others that smell like FLOWER

Sparkly
Warm sweet aquatic fruit, like pear or a mellow fruit
Floral
Deeper notes that I can detect but cannot name.

Well done for an EDT!

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content:
Love this so much, I got it at good price when it went on sales, but it turned out to be a great blind buy! Love everything about it, the fresh, clean, uplifting nature, not so loud, just very sweet and youthful.

Office-friendly. Perfect for spring and summer here in Japan. And the bottle is such a pleasure to watch and hold.
A lovely, beautiful scent that doesn't feel boring even when I'm wearing it almost every day to work. After a long day of work I can still detect the scent on my hair.
My signature scent for now.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content:
A lovely fresh citrusy white floral with a musky dry down,this warms up on the skin beautifully, but the masterpiece in this is the Jasmine.

It is soft but heady,and this is true Jasmine, it has real body,and when you smell it in the air,it has a wonderful sillage.

The rose is there,but is not prominent,it is the bergamot,Jasmine and white musk that creates this exquisite fragrance.

This is perfect for day or evening wear, office,or a party, I love the white musk in this that Adds sensuality....superb!!

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content:
Typical Morillas creation, pretty , a bit of florals a bit of musk very spring like
But done over a thousand times , if you like clean classy florals this is nice
Kind of like Flower in the air , or j'Adore edt...pretty, clean..
I don't need it but it is lovely !

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content:
Very interesting smelling scent, the floral notes and some spicy note are the most dominant notes. A bit too strong for me at first, but it settles down really well.
I sense a soapy scent and it's very good, quite suitable for this perfume.
It's similar to other fragrances from that line, but I don't mind, it's nice anyway.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content: Refreshing, nice citrus & rose scent, a bit sparkling and very gentle. Perfect office fragrance, I would say. It's fresh, rosy and subtle musky. However, some warmness of its base is not my cup of tea.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content: There's a milky vinyl note - maybe it's the white musk in the background - that gives this fragrance its postmodern touch. A gentle perfume in the way of Everbloom by Shiseido.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content:
Very floral, lacks the sweetness of the original Flower but I prefer this one.
You can definetely tell they come from the same family.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content: I think the creative director has no more idea to create a new perfume and just wanna play safe with the first success story.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content: 23 Flankers for a perfume!!! Soon this will break a record in Flankers number.

product_name: Flower by Kenzo Eau de Lumière Kenzo
review_content: Absolutely beautiful, fresh and innocent. Perfect for spring, smells clean and reminds me of cotton. It would match perfectly silk white dress. Lots of clean musk and fresh bergamot, not a sharp one.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Wild pour Homme Kenzo
review_content:
An invigorating opening leaded by coriander and ginger. Its citrusy note soon disappears giving way to an aromatic beautiful blend of mint and cardamom.

Personally, I'm not very fond of aromatic fragrances, but this is one I can sniff deeply and immediately it feels like I'm walking on air. Truly pleasant indeed.

Definitely not aquatic whatsoever.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Wild pour Homme Kenzo
review_content:
The ginger is very prominent in this one, but that's okay cause I love ginger and that's why I love the house of Kenzo, it's almost like a staple in their fragrances. This one does open very gingery with a touch of citrus but then I find the coriander comes to the fore with the ginger lingering in the background. I also get the musk in the drydown.

I prefer the opening to the dry down, it gets bland after about an hour. Overall it's good and has that distinct kenzo signature that I've come to love and expect. It's a quality fragrance, however, I wish it could last longer on my skin. This is perfect for hot, breezy days days, jeans and t shirts.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Wild pour Homme Kenzo
review_content:
I bought this perfume few days ago. And so far, still do not know what it smells! Maybe a slight citrus flavor and water, but they disappear. Too simple! At first is pleasant, but then who can say what you feel on your skin? Noone! You can feel the fragrance about an hour or maximum 2. Intensity is very very bad! The sillage and longevity are both low, very low!

I do not recommend it!

Do not waste your money! My mistake is enough! 53 Euro in garbage!

From 1 to 10 --> 2.5 points!

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Wild pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: Generic, refreshing with low sillage. Nothing special. I wouldn't buy it.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Wild pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: I thought I would like but then it quickly turned to something boring as said by urobian just below. I think his description is precise too. Remembers me the cologne Xtreme, by O Boticário.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Wild pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: Indeed this is not like the wonderful Eau Indigo, to me its a shy fragance, nothing to share and just a simple citrus linear aquatic line with some acid and dusty touch with poor longevity. Very generic and boring, i totally love Kenzo fragances but this is step back to the house.

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Wild pour Homme Kenzo
review_content: This seems like L'Eau Par Kenzo Eau Indigo last summer!

product_name: L'Eau par Kenzo Wild pour Homme Kenzo
review_content:
Nice gingery opening. After two hours it reminds me L'Eau d'Issey.
It's not so aquatic like the original L'Eau Par Kenzo.

Back in the day, somewhere in the mid-80s, I (along with a lot of girls my age) had Kenzo Kenzo. It was the era of Lou Lou and Anaïs Anaïs, and Kenzo Kenzo (in a beautiful light green, traditional Japanese box) was somewhere between those two iconic scents. Not as heavy and strong as Lou Lou, but not as soft and flowery as Anaïs Anaïs. A unique and aromatic, slightly bitter scent with a lot of ingredients, which could give you a bad headache if you weren't feeling well.

After Kenzo Kenzo, the house released Ça Sent Beau, inspired by its predecessor, but less heavy and complex. I was able to get my hands on a bottle of Ça Sent Beau via Vinted as part of my nostalgia. The scent is still sold - mainly online - but no longer in stores. Just for the beautiful bottle alone, something you want to have, and since I am a real fan of Kenzo fragrances, I was super happy with this acquisition. I had not smelled my ‘old’ Kenzo Kenzo for years, so I was super curious how I would experience the scent again.

My first reaction was WOW. They don’t make fragrances like that anymore! Whether that is good or bad, of course depends on taste. After the first fresh notes of mandarin and bergamot disappear into the background, I immediately recognize the soft, aromatic bitterness! The prominent patchouli from the top notes flows beautifully together with the bouquet of white flowers in the middle notes: jasmine, gardenia, tuberose and orange blossom. In the further drydown, the ylang ylang comes in, together with the coriander and the peach - which makes the whole thing a bit softer and more powdery and blends beautifully with the amber, vanilla and vetiver in the base. A beautiful composition, fortunately not as intoxicating as its predecessor, which is certainly still recognizable - albeit in a smooth 'less is more' version.

For an eau de toilette, Ça Sent Beau has a nice longevity and a lot of sillage. Glad I was able to get my hands on a bottle! Let's see if I can find a bottle of Eau d'Eté somewhere!

This has huge sentimental value, since it was my first "real" perfume. I think the current formulation is similar to the one in the early nineties. If they have made changes, they've made them very well, because I don't notice any difference comparing the vintage bottle to the new.

I’m slightly annoyed by people in reviews saying this is reformulation of Kenzo by Kenzo, it’s not, it’s completely different perfume. I remember this one from 90s. If I remember it right there was Kenzo by Kenzo in pale minty green box, Ca Sent Beau in bright green box and Le Monde Est Beau in bright yellow box. All had the same beautiful glass bottle. Seems like Kenzo was discontinued, and Ca Sent Beau and Le Monde reformulated to new standards, sometimes I see them in differing boxes now. Kenzo was similar to elephant, slightly oriental, Le Monde beautiful spicy realistic mandarins with fresh soapy dry down. If I remember it right CaSent Beau was somewhere in the middle of those two/ mix of those two. UPDATE: I actually bought it from FragranceNet (white box with flower-reformulated), I knew I’m not going to love it but I sort of like all vintage and Kenzo frags, so out of nostalgia. Oh well😣, I’m in shock. This is not how Kenzo smells like (young and hip), it’s more like old discontinued Chanel scent, I mean Chanel no.5 could be cousin. It’s sort of authoritarian, classy, old smell, first who came to my mind was Queen Elizabeth, lately my husband wanted to smell it but I refused it to put it on my skin so he sprayed his hand and I realized it’s sort of unisex, even Soros or some other senile, old, rich guy could smell like this. I don’t understand notes in here, I love all mentioned above. I guess it’s too rich on patchouli, too woody, old soapy dry down. Its not that it smells bad, it’s just too mature and serious fragrance, doesn’t vibe with my artistic free casual spirit. I sold it on eBay immediately , so no harm.

Ca fragrance Beau is a sweet, sparkling, soapy, and floral fragrance with an airy, silky, and spicy undertone. Tuberose, Coriander, Patchouli, Peach, Amber, and Vanilla are the notes I detect on my skin. Timeless and stunning. I think best in the spring and fall. It is a very beautiful and spiritual aroma that offers me serenity and tranquility. To add to its allure, the staying power is amazing, and the silage is exceptional. This is the flower I want to wear on a chilly, rainy day to cheer myself up and warm my soul. I am totally in love of it!!!

I don´t recomend this for a blind buy. I don´t know where I made mistake. I tested it in perfume shop and it developed on my skin into wonderfull realistic mandarin. This is patchuli...Kenzo Jungle Elephant vibe. Maybe I mixed it up with Kenzo Le Mond est beau....I really don´t know where is mistake. Or I have bad skin chemistry when I am stressed. I really don´t know.
So I layer it with Elephant and it´s quite ok.
But....where theese hyperrealistic mandarins are???
Bottle is vintage pleasure....I´ll keep it like a decoration after using up perfume. It´s so pleasant to hold it in hand. On picture is ugly but holding it in my hands.....I am really surprised and delighted.
@Callista25 to support your opinion!! New reformulation is like mid-expensive soap. The glory has gone 😐

My grandmother had it back when it was called Kenzo Kenzo, and I was fascinated by the scent and the bottle. It's not quite the same anymore, but there's nothing like it. I love it. The perfume was even created the same year I was born.

At first it has its own signature but after 30 minutes or so, it turns almost identical to Eden by Cacharel...Guess Cacharel copied Kenzo on this one.
Great as a room deodorizer...
Mine is from 2004 it was a good year for Kenzo perfume. Long lasting, beauty.
Current formulation is a soapy green floral.

I have to be fair to this one: it is absolutely beautiful. I have just been so sad and irritated, that it is not quite the same as Kenzo Kenzo from 1988, even if they say so. This is sharper, and something is missing. But still, it is recognizable, and on some days ( like today) I feel it is better on my skin and more like the old version. Some days, I feel like I have to find a very soft/darkish caramelly kind of scent to put under it, since that is what is missing, and some days it is just ok by itself.
I have also done a review on the original Kenzo Kenzo; that was really my favorite. But - if I can’t have that one, I am still so very happy for this! Light hand though - it is quite strong!
I definitely feel it's a "spiritual" fragrance... and I don't know why...

Kenzo Ca Sent Beau:

Two Little Word's: Absolutely Stunning!! I Honestly Can't Get Over How Beautiful This Perfume Really Is!! I Litterly Blind Bought This Fragrance Because I Red That It Has Patchouli In It's Formulation & I Absolutely Love Love LOVE A Perfume That Has A Patchouli Note In It,& The Patchouli In This Kenzo Is S0ooooo Well Constructed To Give This Fragrance A Real Good Twist On It's Heavenly Floral Notes!! It's Fresh & A Little Green,& Absolutely Totally Up-Lifting, Bringing A Long Lasting Smile To My Face!! Surrounding It's Wearer In Pure Class!! This Perfume Would Be The Perfect Choice For A Bride To Wear On Her Wedding Day, Or To Wear While Attending A Wedding It's That Gorgeous!! I Put This Perfume On Me This Morning Stright After I Showered & All Day I've Been Getting The Most Exquisite Aroma I've Ever Smelt!! & At 11.10pm It's Still Going Strong, Which Is Absolutely Outstanding For An Edt With Not One Single Touch Up!! Kenzo Really Do Make Fantastic Quality Fragrances Without A Doubt, & The Design Of The Bottle Is Just Breath Takingly Beautiful!! My Husband Was The First Person To Pass Remarks On It Before He Left For Work, & When He Arrived Home It Was Still Smelling Absolutely Stunning Making Him Give Me A Second Hug Just To Smell It Again!! Kenzo Ca Sent Beau Has Kept Me Company All Day Long As I Worked Around The House, & Believe Me When I Honestly Say It's Deffo Way To Good Just For That!! This Deffo Is Sure Firmly On It's Way To Being One Of My All Time Favourite Perfumes!! & I Will Deffo Wear This Fragrance For The Next Few Day's & See How We Get Along, & What Other's Think Of It On Me!! But Already It's Looking Very Promising Indeed!! Will Up-Date This Review In The Very Near Future!!

Ca scent Beau and Kenzo Kenzo are two total different scents - Kenzo Kenzo reminds me of a more flowery Cacharel Eden and Ca scent Beau is a more sweet sparkling soapy flowery scent with an airy smooth Corianderspicy note. On my skin I get Tuberose, Coriander, Patchouli, Peach, amber & Vanilla. Timeless and gorgeous. I think best in springtime and fall.
I really do like it. It is a very "Asteraceae" perfume - I can scent zinnias, lesser fleabanes, marigolds, sunflowers + greenness of cut stalks.
I love this scent so very much, it's one of my 10 top fav perfumes =))

Ca sent beau smells like a strong laundry detergent. I did not like it at all. I will be honest, that when I sampled it I expected a light green floral scent, that I expected to love.
To my surprised its very chemical smelling and it just too much. There is a strong smell of "green" (no idea what that was, and some soapy white flowers. Really smell like fabric detergent of a cheap room spray at best. I did not find it either light or feminine, and to be honest, it's a very strange smell for Kenzo.

Aquarius_moon, I love your review. Since you have just started wearing Ca sent beau for the first time, you are probably smelling a reformulation, which does have the smell of, as you described, a air-freshener version. The same thing happened to Kenzo's beautiful Parfum d'ete. It is now just a watered down shell of it's former glory. The original Ca sent beau was much closer to Kenzo by Kenzo and you could notice it in the drydown. I'm sure it's all because of the oakmoss changes that occurred, but you're right, it is still awesome and I love to pull it out to wear this time of year. Men don't be afraid, Luca Turin recommended it as a fruity, barbershop fougere for men!

Ca Sent Beau was a replacement for the discontinued Kenzo by Kenzo, and because I didn’t want Kenzo replaced, I avoided it till now. But finally the level in my last bottle of Kenzo grew low, Ca Sent Beau itself became hard to find, and I panicked and got a bottle. So how does it compare? Well, to a nose accustomed to the first Kenzo, Ca Sent Beau smells a bit like the air-freshener version. Like a rough sketch, recognizable but simplistic, as though a gifted cartoonist dashed off a caricature of a famous painting.

That said, the ‘caricature’ itself is pretty amazing, and there are plenty of reasons to be delighted it’s still around. For one, if you’ve heard much about the first Kenzo and want to know how it smells, you needn’t pay an extortionist price for a vintage bottle. Get Ca Sent Beau, and you’ll get a perfectly accurate idea, even if it will be deprived of the full depth and nuance. Likewise, if you loved the first perfume, you’ll certainly notice the differences, but considering that there’s nothing else that smells remotely alike, such a close relative is a treasure.

And if you’re a casual buyer? Well, if the notes sound good to you, and if you’d like a highly original, impeccably crafted, easy to wear perfume for casual occasions, give it a try without worries that it might be dated. Unless you’re thoroughly committed to the esthetics of Iso E transparency, Ca Sent Beau is unlikely to strike you as ‘old.’ It’s more full-bodied than diaphanous, but it’s not dense, opaque, powdery, perfumey, aldehydic, flamboyantly baroque, or any of the other features usually thought of as old. In fact, despite its wonderfully unique refusal to conform to a category—one wants to call it a green-fruity-oriental-chypre and more—a quick and dirty classification would probably land it close to a modern fruitchouli. Take something like the current Miss Dior, make a couple of mental upgrades, and you’ll come close.

Instead of Miss Dior’s fermented citruses, the fruity top note in Ca Sent Beau is sweet, succulent, and delicious. At times, it comes across as neither mandarin nor bergamot but a juicy, fresh pineapple. In the middle, where Miss Dior goes almost tooth-paste mentholated, Ca Sent Beau has much more going on. Its patchouli is camphoraceous and seasoned with a savory coriander-cumin note; it's possibly the fragrance's most distinctive pleasure. The fruity note morphs, just as it says on the tin, into peach laced with ylang; and non-screechy white flowers appear, most notably, a tuberose, so lovely it will haunt you even if you’ve known more famous tuberose scents.

The drydown is where Ca Sent Beau suffers the most from the comparison with the first Kenzo. Rich in sandalwood and oakmoss, the first perfume possessed a whole additional emotional register, suited even to the dressiest occasions. But by today’s standards, when so many drydowns go for naked musk/naked vanilla/simple cessation, Ca Sent Beau does more than enough to keep one's interest and, once again, leaves the likes of Miss Dior in the dust.

On the whole, it’s a youthful but not juvenile scent, playful and intelligent, well-mannered yet distinctive, and after searching for something similar for ages, I can confidently say it doesn’t exist. (Eden, which I had long ago, bears no real resemblance.)

I am wearing this for the first time today and, 4-5 hours from spraying, it does remind me of Eden from Cacharel. A much nicer, friendlier and quieter Eden. This perfume does smell beautiful, the name is very becoming. It wraps you in a warm, delicate and peaceful cloud of beautiful flowers. There's nothing "loud" in this scent on my skin, no animalic note, no aggressive patchouli, just beautiful white flowers and slight fruity note. The crisp in the opening fades away and it becomes a harmonious ensemble. I'm glad I bought this, after reading about it here, and I will probably buy again. Longevity is great on me; office friendly and, in my opinion, a perfect spring scent. Definitely recommended!

I really, really hated this one...I was expecting a slightly fruity, slightly green, maybe slightly dated masterpiece...but all I got was a very dated, overly strong white floral, with a hint of musk and patchouli...strongly encourage those looking for fruity to try this one before you buy!...

THAT SMELLS BEAUTIFUL CA SENT BEAU

This fragrance captivated my nose because it's the green notes and the patchouli that you pick up on almost immediately. The citric scents of bergamot and orange are there but they're clearly playing second fiddle to the patchouli. This patchouli is green and rather like incense but not too smoky. There's also spicy notes, coriander and vetiver which although at the base my nose could immediately detect. So this is a green spicy floral scent with the flowers serving as background chorus girls to the patchouli singing his song. The flowers, however, are the dramatic white flowers that are to be taken as seriously as the patchouli: gardenia, jasmine, tuberose and African orange flower. This really does smell beautiful but if it had been either sweeter or stronger, it would have smelled bad. On me this smells perfectly balanced. It evokes a green garden with white flowers and green plants. There's a slight resemblance to Eden by Cacharel. Vanilla and amber is there to help the fragrance smell just as it's name indicates good. Sweet, but not too sweet not too gourmand either. Really nice. Fragrances like this are getting harder to find. I love to wear this in spring and summer and recommend it. It's available on such sites as Fragrance Net Fragrance X Beauty Spin and Amazon.com. If you like Kenzo fragrances and floral fragrances you'll love this one. But also keep in mind that the patchouli is also a big player so you have to be into patchouli. O la la! Ca Sent Si Beau!!!

Just got it from fragrance.net. Good price. It was wrapped beautifully with tissue paper inside with a beautiful bottle. So elegant looking. I held my breath and sprayed the first spray on my wrist,then two more. Heaven in a bottle. I can't tell you exactly the aromas but I can certainly say it was soft, clean, lingering and very feminine. I want to keep smelling myself. It has all the ingredients in a perfume that I like so it's a keeper. I hope this helps. Silly me, I have hundreds of bottles of perfumes and all I can say is I like what I like and am pretty picky.

It reminds me of my university years in the 90's. I even named my pet cat "Kenzo" because of it ! Nice clean sweet perfume. Floral but not too much. I don't see myself wearing it now. Maybe too young to me now or maybe too 90's.
One of my favourite tuberose scents. Get it if you can!
Probably one of the most memorable and enjoyable summer perfumes I've ever had the pleasure of owning. Seems impossible to find now.

One of my "must have" fragrances:)
I had it since years and almost constantly have it. Lastly bought it at strawberrynet and thought to be a gift for a friend.
Then decided to keep it again for myself:)
Why?
As this fragrance is unique. Its spirit gives me always what I need in the moment - confidence, charm, allure.
It's a compliment for every woman.
Simply amazing for me...
Use it all the year:)
A marvellous perfume,perfect for all seasons,especially the sunny days of winter and fall.

I am wearing this fragrance today for the first time since my last bottle of Kenzo back in the early 90s! It is not easy to find so I was delighted when I realised it has been re-released as Ca Sent Beau. Thank you Fragantica!

It has changed a bit since I remember it. I don't consider this to be fruity any more; I don't get any at all. Innocent? No! It's an intense steamy floriental that needs to be approached with care! The bottle disguises a deep and heady juice much like Michael by Micheal Kors which I also own and adore. Staying power is amazing, will be smelling it for days! This is the floral I want to wear on a cold miserable day to lift my spirits and warm my soul. Love it!!!

I'd almost forgotten about this fragrance. Thanks to Icecube's review, this bought back memories. Quite frankly, it's been a LONG time since I smelled this, all I could remember was a very bright sweet floral, probably orange blossom with amazing sillage ( I used to spray my wrists and wash it off a bit before I step out of the house). The fragrance eventually turned but I kept it for years because of the pretty bottle.

A 70 ies old school perfume. Classy, beautiful flovery opening.
A weak orangenote in the background.
Dries down to a vaxy smelling fragrance.
Ends smelling as a mixture of vax and mimosa.

Smells dated, but somehow I like it. Orange blossom is the most prominent note to my nose. Ca Sent Beau is a fresh floral with a touch of aldehydes. Soapy, cologne-y, kind of sharp. It reminds me of my dad's cologne that he used to wear a very long time ago.

I do feel sorry that I am going to bring this one a few points down, but the point of reviewing on MUA is to tell "truth and nothing but the truth", and my truth about this scent is that it failed to work with my nose and my chemistry, and I am saying that after having used up 2 bottles: that's how much I wanted to like it! I absolutely love the bottle, and I was looking for such a long time for a crispy white/yellow/green summer scent that would make me feel like a nymph in an afternoon forest. Perhaps it all has to do with expectations set too high. I bought both bottles unsniffed because I had never ever disliked a Kenzo scent before - all of them appealed to me in different ways somehow. But the 1st sniff I took had me breaking into sweat: oh no, this has gone BAD! Or is it a fake?!! Or is it so old that I. living in a new century, simply don't get it? It was like a cologne-soaked elderly woman's undies! So chemical and so artificially pungent!! I, wanting to get my money#s worth out of it anyway, still wore it for month, starting each day with the thought:" Ok, maybe I will like it now" and being let down again and again. Since I was staying in the countryside that summer I didn't really care how I smelled, and wanted to wear basically anything that was more than just skinscent. Alas, I did end up with my own scent, because this perfume evaporated after half an hour and never, not once, did it leave a trail of ever being sprayed! The 2nd bottle I have used up as an air freshener: the angry acid did seem to eat up any bad smell around, so still grateful for that. I will repurchase a small sample of perfume/eau de perfume if I find it, because eau de toilette was money thrown out in the air, literally!

I love this scent, it is my 'signature' scent, it makes me happy when I am sad and confident when I feel I need that, makes e feel sophisticated and chic, it fills the room and lasts forever on my clothes. I simply adore it!
very sweet, very powdery, floral and a little green. Feminine, innocent and clean. A great classic !

There are situations, you want to smell bombastic good, fresh, but somehow serious and chic and not sexy a lot. For example going for an interview for a job or just do it your work properly and fast.

Here is the perfect fragrance for it and I am so glad about it. I tested it about month and today stocked up with 2 bottles more, because it is just so delicious serious. It does not make sense to describe the smell, because I have no idea, what it is, but if you have good eyes and can read the lousy small ingredients list, you may see: Oakmoss extract and tree moss extract.

I think, this is one of the small amount of fragrances dealing with naturally raw stuff. Even if applied this loud and intensive perfume with heavy hand over and over you, I do not get headache, which is very practical, if you have to work hard.

Sillage about one-two hours, longevity 7-8 hours (EdT!!) When the perfume is dying, it smells a bit like Dune from Dior.

Intriguing essence in a Japanese style without a 1989 feeling. Liked it at first sniff, maybe due to my favourite orange blossom, but separate notes here are “out of the coverage”, as well as its fragrant group: don’t count on something fruity floral. A stylishly intellectual abstract composition with mentally seductive personality. Like Eau Indigo's mother is playing chess, Oops!.. - Sudoku. I imagine that for casual style it could be a bit serious, also is not the one to veg out with, but for the right time and place it could be a hit. Rather unique successful blend on the modern market. Yes, Yamamoto tried to follow this path with Yohji Yamamoto pour Femme (2004) - similar coriander edge, in YY it seems rough and unfriendly - but Ca Sent Beau is more smoothly balanced and much more interesting as if meant for women who get better with age. :)
5 ***** from TS? Personally, I would give it 4 stars for sure.

This is technically a fruity-floral. It is a plummy orange/tangerine draped with tuberose and orange blossom. But I suppose this is a floriental. I mean it’s white flowers resting on a comfortable amber. And I reckon it’s a fougère since it seems to have a dark, nutty coumarin base. Chypre? Yeah, there’s bergamot and oakmoss.

I’m not even joking. What the hell is this? Fruit? No question. Perhaps orange, more likely tangerine. It’s definitely floral. A bit of steamy orange blossom and a bucket of green, creamy tuberose. Amber for days (literally) spiked with patchouli. And the darkness---coumarin? oakmoss? Mix it up with a good measure of musk and you wind up with a languid slurry of a perfume. In tone, Ça Sent Beau is like a grand queen about 2 martinis into holding court with a gathering audience. A little tipsy, talking fast, one opinion to the next. An increasing flourish and emphasis that don’t quite cover up the slurred speech. Mesmerizing.

And while this is a cousin to Prescriptives Calyx---tasty fruity chypre--- Ça Sent Beau replaces the straight-forward oakmoss base with a narcotic cough syrup base made of what seems like oakmoss and coumarin.

CSB’s components are not so much potent as heavy, but the balance is perfect. Rather than calibrate the heavy with lighter elements, the cough syrup base adds some shadow to the density and makes it feel sultry.

I can think of four definitively syrupy perfumes that I like. Serge Lutens’s Cedre (mothball syrup.) Lutens's Arabie (spice cabinet syrup.) Badgley Mischka’s Badgley Mischka (simple syrup.) And Ça Sent Beau. I think cough syrup is my favorite.

At last I got a chance to test Ca Sent Beau (thanks Tankgirl!). What a delicious fragrance! It opens up juicy and slightly peppery with mandarin orange and orange flower with a hint of tubrose whispering in the background. Somehow it reminds me of ginger in this stage.

After a while it becomes more floral, and warmer and sweeter from amber and just a tiny touch of patchouli. The fragrance has a mote of saltiness that I find very appealng. I don't find it animalistic as some do, but it's not a crowdpleaser either. It's a complex fragrace that I would like to wear a warm summer day. Sillage and longevity medium.

I have a very different reaction to this fragrance: to me, it smells exactly like baked apples, fruity and sweet with cinnamon. The dry down becomes more subtle and a little less sweet, but it still makes me think of Thanksgiving dinner and crisp autumn days. For me, yes, "That smells good", but I don't wear it very often because it seems somewhat lacking in sophistication. Perhaps I should give it away to a teenage girl?

It's a kind of vintage fragrance, not too "old" to wear imho. I like it, but I don't wear it every day, it's the fragrance I wear when I'm in the mood.

Ca Sent Beau is a strong fragrance, and a very long-lasting one. I spray it only two times and that's enough, the fragrance lasts all day and I leave a trace of the scent all around :)

It's a green oriental, and I'm not a fan of patchouli, actually too many fragrances with patchouli note don't work well on me, but this one (Oriens too) is an exception. Ca Sent Beau is a fragrance you can compare to Elephant when it comes to power :)
It seems a lot with 'Beautiful" Estee Lauder and yes, it is retro but very nice.
mine went bad. I can't remember how it used to smell exactly, but it was never so fresh. kinda old fashioned perfume.

It reminds me Elephant a lot too. It is easier to wear, far less agressive, but I prefer the first because of the taste of spicies mentioned by Turquoise. The spicy notes that make Elephant more agressive at the beginning make it far more beautiful, specially after some hours, when Ca Sent Beau has a true, undressed animal scent. At this stage, I could confuse it with a body odour.

The notes listed in the scent pyramid seem to me to be incomplete and arranged oddly. Elsewhere I found the following list of notes, which conform better to my impression of the scent:

Top: coriander, mandarin, tangerine
Heart: orange blossom, tuberose
Base: patchouli, amber, vetiver

I experience some uplifting citrus in the opening, followed by crisp herbs. Later, Ca Sent Beau ("That Smells Beautiful," in French) leans just a tad toward the masculine with orange blossom and vetiver, and the tuberose is very quiet. It stays cool and refreshing for about four hours on my skin, and never develops a deep warm base that one might expect with the patchouli and amber. They're there, but faintly, and the drydown is mostly vetiver.

Not as feminine as I usually prefer, but doesn't make me feel uncomfortably androgynous. A lovely, pleasant smell indeed. Incidentally, I would not classify this one as a floral fruity, as it seems primarily a vetiver fragrance in my opinion. I'd call it aromatic instead.

Still in two minds about it
sometimes it smells of cleannes and innocence to me, sometimes it feels a little too sweet

had it and will have it again, I think
a...personality splitter :-)
No es uno de mis favoritos, despues de comprarlo no me agradó más. Pero como buena chica lo usé hasta terminarlo
I bought this on a whim after reading about it in 'The Guide'; still deliberating about liking it; on first whiff didn't grab me - doubt that I am a fan of pachouli.
This is my best summer-fragrance! It's special, fruity scent! I love it!!! Must have!

very beautiful light & airy perfume..........very elegant & peaceful..........im not sure what buckwheat tea smells like lol but the tuberose & cherry blossom are the highlight & it continues throughout or at least on me it does.........and i love sandlewood & vetiver in dry downs so thats a plus for me & for the perfume lol...............dries down smooth & soft...........

perfect for day or night & any season but i would lean towards fall & winter - but light enough to wear spring or summer ( im wearing it tonite & its warm & humid & smells lovely )

i just love the flower line.........and this does not disappoint :) and i love the bottles !!!

and longevity moderate & silage closer to skin - its not a beast perfume - its classicly elegant
This is the most beautiful rendition of cherry blossom imo. So elegant, soft, but striking and a compliment magnet. Beautiful perfume.
Pretty floral scent with a perfect amount of powdery woodiness to it. I wasn't expecting to like this at first, but it surprised me.

Beautiful smell that makes you think you might have smelled it before. Very cozy and comforting like a nice hug. The smell is beautiful upon it's opening. Sadly on skin that beautiful floral/tea opening doesn't last and becomes more generic as it settles for a few hours. I still recommend it, I would definitely spray it on maybe an article of clothing instead. Still it is quite beautiful and very unique, I would recommend as a blind buy if it's on sale. 8/10. I don't think people would ever hate the smell, very inoffensive. Also I agree with the user GoodNose.

It's a sparkly and dreamy fragrance. A little bit unusual compared to anything else I've smelt but it's quite addicting to smell.

Less is more with this one, and I enjoy the enveloping scent.
This scent is easily underestimated, it's soft, feminine and floral. It doesn't last long, unfortunately but the scent is lovely, elegant and graceful.

Flower Ikebana is floral and warming, and it has quite a sillage. This has a very similar toasted flormand vibe to L'Interdit Intense, which blends tuberose and sesame while this fragrance blends tuberose with buckwheat. I like it, but I don't love it.

This is so unexpectedly gorgeous! I have sample of this, sprayed it after shower and wasn't expecting much. The first sniff stopped me in my tracks. This is a marvelous chunky tuberose ("pretty" type, without its fleshy aspects), softened by unique roasted buckwheat note. And then there's creamy delicate sandalwood. And Flower's signature powderyness.
Absolutely lovely, hands down, this is the best luxe release of the past few years to me, but I am a lifelong Flower fan.
اصلا قابل مقایسه با نخستین نسخه کنزو فلاور نیست.زیبایی های اون عطر رو نداره.پخش و ماندگاریش هم ضعیف تره.
Beautiful warm cherry blossom perfume! This is a cool spring morning or a cool spring evening in a bottle! 9/10

I received this is as a sample from Sephora despite being a man, I received women's samples of Kenzo Poppy Bouquet and the Ikebana. Ikebana is lovely from spray to dry down. It strikes a nice balance between sweet and woody. The floral heart is beautiful and gives the perfume a lovely sillage. Closer and the creamy sandalwood and cedar with the touch of fresh vetiver is alluring and a tad sexy. I love to smell this on my SO. The price point makes it a great value.

I wonder why so few people admire the note of buckwheat tea in this fragrance... Maybe because it's quite unknown for most of us? The thing is that it's quite similar to roasted buckwheat that one can cook wonderful, comforting porrige of. And the best thing for me in this fragrance is just that! It may be a new trend, a couple of months ago I purchased a shower gel from Yves Rocher that smells oat and buckwheat (I don't appreciate their perfumes but sometimes I just adore the scents of their other products). It's literary like washing yourself with sweet buckwheat porrige :) I know it may sound insane but it's very enjoyable. And my point here is that the shower experience helped me to hear the note of buckwheat in Kenzo Flower Ikebana -- the fact is that I enjoy it more that the rest of the composition. It's a pity it doesn't last for long as it's a top note... The flower notes that last I find a little annoying. So it's a dilemma for me.

I think it's one of the best mainstream perfume launches lately!!! It's the first one I'm testing from the new Ikebana line. And I started with the right one, I can't wait to smell the others. Sakura is spring-like, airy and light like cherry blossom petals floating on the wings of the wind. It has a sweet tuberose, bubblegummy, similar to the one in My Way. But the protagonists are the cherry blossoms. Realistic and naturally rendered. You perceive them with the same intensity from the first spray to the last hints from the subtly woody base. . It projects moderately, with a slightly above average longevity, similar to Kenzo perfumes. Congratulations, you did an excellent job!!!

HOLY WHAT! I was not expecting to like this fragrance as much as I do these notes don’t particularly call to me, but there is this beautiful, sweet uplifting aspect that I can’t quite put my finger on. It’s just gorgeous. I NEED TO LAYER HER!!
Once it dries, it becomes this almost woody soicy sent, and I’m really digging it.
Alas I spoke too soon! Has an almost medicinal note on the dry down that I am not the biggest fan. I still really like it though.

Successful blind buy for this floral lover! Love at first sniff. Simply gorgeous and very unique in my collection! I get the soft delicate freshness of cherry blossom, grounded by the more heady tuberose, smooth sandalwood, and slightly savory buckwheat notes. This is very versatile, can be dressed up or down and I see this being appropriate for any occasion.
This smells like heavenly spring. Very feminin. I usually don't like powdery, but here the wood overpowers.

I see you cherry blossom, I adore you tuberose, you've made your presence known cedar, you enrich the drydown sandalwood. This is an adorable, feminine fragrance, light in performance so it doesn't intrude into other people's personal space, but altogether so lovely. That's all.

I didn't like Jeu d'Amour and I profoundly dislike tuberose - or so I thought. I do find this mostly pleasant, however.

For the most part it is a sweet, creamy, powdery floral, very meek and tame. I do pick the "bubblegummy" accord in the opening but it stays only for those very first few minutes (similar to Toy 2 Bubble Gum's and just as short-lived), and then it goes on to evolve into a more classic Kenzo scent with the signature ricey Kenzo powder (if you've tried several Kenzo pefumes for women you might be getting what I mean.) But the longer it stays the less excited I feel about wearing it as it gets progressively less sweet and flowery and more woody and yes, musky. The musk with woods (I'm guessing cedar specifically) smells somewhat bitter and medicinal but that undertone is hardly as strong as the metallic accord in BR40 for instance, so for me it doesn't completely ruin my enjoyment of the fragrance. I just wish it would take a different direction and stay closer to the opening scent which I absolutely do love. Past that point it's just alright.

Started reminding me of Shakira S a few hours in but even then, Ikebana Sakura uses better ingredients and has overall more personality with occasional subtle powdery sweetness coming in even when the scent no longer screams tuberose. Performance is disappointing although I'm using a sample so take it with a grain of salt.

Feminine, versatile, simple without being simplistic. If you *think* you dislike tuberose, this one might have you two getting along as it did with me. Blind buying is not advised because of extremely musky drydown.

I wanted to like this one so bad! Why? Probably the memory of kenzo perfume ads on TV in the early 2000s, nostalgia made me want to own a kenzo fragrance? I tried it and it was a "meh" for me. I guess I am not meant for this one: the longevity and sillage are too delicate to me. It is a spring flowery, pretty and airy fragrance, it depicts the delicate cherry blossoms with beautiful and light strokes. I did not get any tuberose on my skin at all

Like it a lot !! It's very pretty and youthful. I was really impressed by its scent because woody notes usually don't work well with my skin. For me, this fragrance has a very creamy but floral scent!!

The most beautiful take in cherry blossom for me.
I feel like a geisha in my kimono strolling under the blooming cherry blossoms.
Dry down after 2 hours is like a bubblegummy cherry blossom. I guess because of the tuberose?
Super creamy floral scent. I love it ! It definitely leans feminine but I could wear this easily as a guy. Performance is great.

Very soft and feminine perfume. It's sweet with woody touch which is not overpowering. I thought I could smell something almond-y which seemed almost gourmand, but apparently I mistook the cherry blossom note for that. I love tuberose and I can make it out here but it's nothing like fruitchouli/floral gourmands in which you can usually find it. It has the overall Kenzo DNA I adore and it's not too generic.

This one caught me by surprise, an interesting take on cherry blossom. Normally, I associate cherry blossom with fresh-bubbly air fresheners. I find that it’s rather rare in perfumes, and even then, it’s usually incorporated into quite lighthearted, girly, fruity-fresh constellations that highlight its tartness.

In Flower Ikebana Sakura, however, I experience a more sensual, womanly, and calm take on the note. The fragrance is quite linear, and more dense and rich than I assumed based on the packaging and the marketed focus on cherry blossom. In fact, while definitely noticeable, this isn’t a decided cherry blossom perfume to me. It’s nicely balanced with the other notes and people around you will probably not even perceive you to smell „like cherry blossom.“ Kenzo also briefly mentioned Jasmine in the heart on their website, which somehow is rarely listed in descriptions of this fragrance. I’m also surprised there isn’t any vanilla listed anywhere; I couldn’t find a review talking about that either. To me, there is quite a pronounced vanillic quality to this. Maybe it’s just a VERY creamy-soft sandalwood, but I also showed a fellow fragrance enthusiast, and he smelled vanilla as well. So for what it’s worth, to us, there is some vanilla, and the cherry blossom is rather tame. Those and the rest of the notes blend nicely into a very smooth, warm, cozy, sweet, slightly earthy floral that is also a tiny bit yummy. It‘s very feminine and sensual, can be worn anytime in any season. Due to the cherry blossom and the tea note, it’s rather unique. Ikebana Sakura is not very complex or challenging, but simply pleasant and inviting. I personally love it and will likely buy a bottle. :)

Smelled it on store (on a blotter) and loved it. After a few weeks, I got it as a sample and decided to use it to go out for a lunch date with friends (which went on for most of the afternoon).
I’m very glad I got it at a sample and didn’t buy it. The smell on my skin was totally different from the blotter and the drydown was absolutely nausea/migraine inducing (to the point that I immediately jumped in the shower when I got home). A good reminder to always try on perfumes on my skin before buying. :(

Sakura ( Japanese cherry blossom ) is not realistic or similar to the real one at all but I can understand the ikebana vibes. Tuberose was not dominant, that was a good for me. However as a perfume I was expected something more spécial.
Beauty!

I had my eye on this perfume for a long time before getting a sample. And I am so glad I only got the sample.
When I sprayed it on, at first, nothing. My husband made a joke that it is a very weak tea.
Jokes aside, after a while I got a very faint smell of tuberose with cherry blossom. The musky ending was pleasant, but way softer than Lumiere or L´Absolue. What a shame.

Okay so I have a box that I put all my perfume samples in. When I first received Flower Ikebana I was disgusted and absolutely hated it. 🙈 I don’t remember what I even thought it smelled like. I’m just glad I didn’t throw it away!

Today I found out My Way will have another flanker… It pushed me over the edge. I am so over brands churning out a scent profile to death and ticking off the boxes for every single trend they can possibly be apart of. I could go on and on.

So I pull out my sample box, dig around and find Ikebana. It’s been at least 2 months since I tried it, probably more. I go with one spray on my arm… Omg! So good! How could I have hated this?! I’m not really seeing good reviews for it. I implore those reviewers to try it again if they can, test it with one spray.

Me personally I am sick to death of gourmands, sick of designers just making variations of the same scent profiles. I want originality, I want something that isn’t catering to the masses. Something that would be missed for all its nuances and uniqueness should it be discontinued. I am so happy I was able to refresh my feelings with Flower Ikebana. I was starting to feel burnt out with the fragrances that are within my budget.

The initial spray actually very quickly reminded me of Marc Jacobs Daisy. You know how Tuberose be smelling purple like the Daisy violets. But it’s more dense, not refreshing. It’s the perfect in-between of grape Jolly Rancher and floral, but don’t be scared!!! It’s not grape cough syrup or “old lady” or mature. It’s adult and sexy. I’m 32 and obsessing!!!

I adore that this fragrance is strong and long lasting. It’s been 4 hours since I first sprayed it and it’s muscling through! 💪 😎 I have a feeling this will easily last my desired 6 hour mark, and on and on.

The drydown definitely smells of sandalwood, but it’s not obnoxious. It’s blended perfectly with something else. The Sobacha Tea or the Sakura Blossom? I’m not sure as I’m not familiar with either. I’d say it’s a very light flower petal scent with the sandalwood so Sakura Blossom? The drool-worthy Tuberose, I still get wafts of it if I don’t pay attention. 😍

If you’re like me and enjoy grape candy-like Tuberose, scents like My Way Intense, My Way Parfum, or L’interdit Rouge… but maybe you too are tired of smelling super sweet all the time… want something DIFFERENT, you’re good with sandalwood, and love beast mode scents… then get yourself a sample of Flower Ikebana!

I’ve done had my gourmand phase. I wanna smell grown and sexy. I’d say I’m in my sweet floral phase but I don’t want to categorize FI and dissuade anyone from trying it. Believe me this one is special!!!

These are the true notes according to the website:

FLOWER IKEBANA, a floral woody fragrance for women, is composed like an ikebana, inspired by the Japanese art of flower arrangement, with a balance resting on three notes: Sobacha Tea with its roasted accents, delicate Sakura blossom enhanced by Indian Tuberose absolute, and the precious warmth of Australian Sandalwood essence.

it's like a bomb of "too much". the flower notes are too strong for me and the wood that settles after just makes the fragrance more nauseating. on top of that, its projection is crazy, which in this case is not a good thing.
had to throw the freshly washed shirt i had on in the laundry because i simply couldn't take it
The most boring perfume I had the misfortune of blind buying. It smells as plain as water with sugar and pencil shavings in it. I returned it.

L’interdît’s fruity floral structure but with tuberose on steroids, milky, heavy, and picturing on me a sapy gardenia note. The sandalwood’s creaminess enhance the buttery sensation. Lasts forever. Very interesting but not for a shy little heart. The delicate flowers on the bottle and the zen name are a trick.

I've blind bought it because I read that was similar to L'interdit and it was a huge mistake. There is no resemblance to L'Interdit in my opinion. It is quite heavy and cloying, it is a tuberose bomb - maybe the woods make it louder? - a monster silage and projection that causes discomfort, nausea and it is headache inducing. But to be fair, but it could be an excellent option for those who adore tuberose. For me, particularly, was a disaster.
The drydown is quite woody, not in a masculine way but not pleasant as well.
Got the 75 ml bottle on sale, which tells me that being a 2023 launch it may be out of market quite soon. I do advise test before buying it.
I am sorry, I do not want to be an unpleasant man, but my review has some perspectives to help those who blind buy fragrances as I do, so the chances of regretting may be minimized.

I deceided to try my sample of Flower Ikebana few hours before bed. The fragrance surprised me in the beginning, the tea is really prominent. But I would not call it tea fragrance per se.
The beginning of this fragrance is really beautiful and surprising after reading few reviews. People described it as a pleasant almost boring and nothing special. I can smell the tea notes, something floral and also woodsy.
The fragrance is really intimate, after while I forgot I even sprayed it. So the sillage is intimate to moderate, best suited for spring or summer.
I was enjoying it but in the end it became unpleasant. I was trying to sleep and position my arm away from my face, so I would not be able to smell this fragrance. The drydown is unpleasant to me and I can smell it even after 10+ hours.

Usually not a fan of tuberose or vetiver but this is so beautifully blended and balanced. There's some sweetness, some tartness, some incense. Bright beautiful and now I need a full bottle because I'm gonna go through this sample really quickly.
Floral, feminine, with a gentle sweetness, this fragrance reminds me of early spring. I don't care for the buckwheat tea opening, but thank goodness it doesn't last too long.
Sweet milky tuberose with some woody notes. This smells lactonic and I hate that. I will be giving my sample away.

Love at first sniff! I smelled it on store than I went home and ordered. A very pleasant floral scent with elegant side. Must have for floral perfum lovers. Good balanced with sandalwood- this is the first Kenzo since 20 years that I bought. Nice job!
The top notes are really joyful and pleasant: a creamy and almondy cherry blossom. Tuberose brings a touch of sexyness and warmth. Then it gets really woody and almost dusty.

Tried it today both on skin and blotter. The development has been quite different. On paper it smells like milk with a subtle flowery smell. On skin it starts with a sultry tuberose that turns nondescript in the middle but here comes the surprise: the drydown is like an old school woody musky floral. Lovers of a more classic perfume style should check this out, they might find it interesting.

An easy, sweet tuberose. Has a young spirit. Flower Ikebana doesn't present anything new, but it is a pretty perfume, suitable for those, who, for example, find L'Interdits too much. Not similar to the original Kenzo Flower.
a light creamy tuberose, It is how i imagine fairies smell like along with the first Flower Kenzo 😙 🧚♂️ 🧚♀️
I tried it today at Macys and I fell in love. It smells so pretty and inoffensive

This is pretty! It’s sweet, floral and aquatic. Joyful and feminine. It’s not groundbreaking but it’s pleasant. Something romantic for hot days. It’s not like the original, this one is fresher and youthful. It’s worth trying if you like dreamy scents.

Amazing, one of my personal favourites. I like it much better than the regular Kenzo Flower. Warm yet not heavy, woody, comforting, classy and flowery yet not generic. Perfection in a bottle, for me. I love it.

Flower Ikebana is very nice and smells like sweet flowers, in particular tuberose and cherry blossom. It is more wearable and less stuffy that the original Kenzo Flower. It may be one of the best flankers, along with my other favourite - Kenzo Flower l'Elixir. Ikebana is nevertheless a bit too flowery for my taste, especially considering that the tuberose is quite prominent, but overall it is a wonderful well-blended perfume.

Amazing fragrance! It was love at first sniff, I can't help but wear it (and, for the first time in my life, overspray it!), and it immediately became my signature fragrance. It's warm and sweet but not cloying nor overwhelming, it's more like a hug from a loved one. It was perfect for spring but it is also suitable for the hotter temperatures of these days (end of May in Italy), and I'm curious to find out how it will perform in the middle of summer and in winter. Sakura blossoms don't have a strong scent so this is not a realistic sakura fragrance, but I think it represents the delicate and comforting splendor of hanami well. I also love the "Japanese vibe" of the soba cha tea in the opening (and also of the paper box and bottle). Morillas is always a guarantee.
Fresh clear with wild flowers, like a sauvage beach with a sea full of waves.

I had this because my boyfriend bought the L'eau Par Kenzo Wild Edition por Homme and we thought it cute that the bottles fit each other. However, I did not like it very much as it smelled of candies with orange while I am a floral-type of person.

This is one of 2 Kenzo blind buys. Had I smelled first I would not have purchased either. For a minute i thought i smelled grape candy but that gave way to the peaches and gentle florals for a pleasant easy-breezy summer scent. Its gentler but to me not as nice as the original kenzo l'eau par but it's still a very nice aquatic fruity floral. Just not a head turner. I definately see the resemblence to Escada Into the Blue.

this reminds me of the old Avon unisex perfume, Cyberlink (if the name is correct)
a fresh scent, long lasting...even though i bought the Dubai Grade AAA version. what's more to say about the original version?
nothing really spectacular, reminds me of teenage days when i used to have that Avon unisex perfume.

Update: the more i wear it i think the more interesting it gets. the opening was a real sharp citrusy smell but instantly evaporates to a more floral tone, which then left a soft smell to the skin. because of the spicy notes so spraying direct onto skin will get some of the burning sensation (this turns me off during the few 1st try) but then wait for a few minutes to enjoy the drydown...it's just cool & refreshing! no sticky feeling wearing this unlike the sweet heavy perfumes out there. try it!
Yes, it's more classy than the Avon perfume i've mentioned earlier :P (the Avon Cyberlink was targeted to teens aged less than 20 after all in their catalouge)

I think it's fresh and clean, I smell passionfruit in this frag but is no note of passionfruit here.
For me it's a mix of Escada Into the Blue and Azarro Now, I kind of find this to be more unisex.
I don't know if I like it or not.
Definitely a summer and daytime scent.

Gorgeous fruity scent reminscent of cocktails and beach parties in the midst of the long hot Summer.
Invigorating during days of humidity and heat.
Spray on for a liberating experience.
SOOO FREE!! Love it!!
I agree with every word of Allegra! Very nice and happy fragrance.

I think I've just found myself the summer fragrance for 2011's season, since Wild version of L'eau par Kenzo is so delightful, joyous and exuberant concoction of flowers and fruit. Just one sniff and off you are on the holiday mood! A splendid choice for the summer, definitely.
Nice, not great. Slightly boring. .

Pear.... again...
Not my cup of tea.

14. June 2013

Ok, i really wish they would stop doing all this to Kenzo fragrances. Endless flankers i mean. Just how many "amour" and "flower" flankets are out thete alreafy???
This is another meaningless flanker/limited edition. Nothing outstanding at all. Quite watery, airy and also sickenly sweet to my nose. Somehow it really reminds me of a pear flavored candy or even more a pear scented soda i was drinking as a child. The opening reminds me of it at least, but the middle stage is just plain sugar, pear and jasmine. As simple as this.
Kisses of butterflies? Come on, why can't beautiful butterflies smell beautiful??!! If i could compare it to smething, it would be more of the scen for jellyfishes. Plain, simple and almost invisible. Even the colour of the bottle and the design reminds me of jelly fish. And I don' t find it creamy at all.

Please do not remove this comment, since others might find it useful. Not every review should be positive, so people like me wanted to make a blind buy might find it very informative. Thanks.

This perfume is citrucy, smells like pear cream soda with a pinch of lemon zest. It is very light and airy. Floral notes are soft and less distinctive than fruity ones.
I'm not sure about the longevity yet (wearing it for two hours), but I think it will last for 3,5-4 hours.
Sillage is very soft, Kiss'n'fly doesn't disturb people who are in the same room with you, but you will still feel this perfume and enjoy it.

Reminded me a bit of an old Givenchy Oblique Play.
Love Kenzo. This bottle is super pretty too.
itsgonna be lovely white floral summer spring wind
I saw this was close to L’Eau D’Issey Florale and found it on Mercari. Your noses didn’t let me down!!! It’s very similar. I am so pleased!

I got the mini version of this, and it's nice and fresh, definitely a daytime scent. However, there's a note in there that reminds me of cemetery visits in my Dad's village of birth. I think it's because of the rose and the specific floral combination. So this is not really it for me.

finished my bottle, only to find it's been discontinued. sad loss for the frag community, clean and sweet scent, the pear in the opening is majestic. Would love to repurchase, Ill look for the issey one :( saaaadneeesss

I have the first previous version of this in blue without peach, it smells like the cleanest perfume i've ever smelled. Cleaner than D&G Light Blue, it is amazingly elegant and light yet so fresh and clean. Love it as an office smell

Floral, citrus, aquatic at the same time, to me it's the definition of perfection. I'm a virgo and I go crazy when rose meets soapy fresh scents and this is it. So innocent yet chic... I first discovered it when a friend was wearing it and I immediately thought this is that clean scent I was looking for. I was ready to buy another bottle but I think this one has recently been discontinued as I couldn't find it anywhere online.

The same way as Kenzo can make great and outstanding perfumes, the house can also make something really terrible. Don't get me wrong - I'm a Kenzo lover, but this is really like some teenage juicy spray. Peach just doesn't work for me here, it smells so chemical...

Male version is way better than this one.

There was a lot of pear and lemon in the opening..which I liked but not loved(I'm not a fan of fruity scents)..but the heart of L'eau2 is a mild sweet rose;with a touch of creamy lotus giving it an aquatic aspect just like pink roses in rain and just a touch of citrus to brighten it up...I LOVE;LOVE and again love this fresh smell of pink wet roses
It has nothing to do with org l'eau.the org one was more aquatic and less feminine but this one is just like a sweet dream.so light..so pure..a refreshing spring and summer scent
When it dries down I can feel musk and something like green tea
Longevity and sillage are moderate/good..more than what I expected for such a mild n lovely scent
Edit:after using it a couple of times,now I can smell pear from the start til the end,not fresh and so light as i felt before
I still like this pear,rose,lemon combo but I prefer to use it during spring,rather than hot summers
لحظه اسپري شدن رايحه گلابي و ليمو احساس كردم.بدم نيومد اما از اونجا ك درگل زياد علاقه مند به عطرهاي ميوه اي نيستم عاشقش نشدم
اما قلب و اساس اين عطر رز هست..رايحه ملايم و شيرين رز..به همراه كمي رايحه كرمي مانند لوتوس ك حالت آكواتيك به عطر ميده..دقيقا مثل يه بوته رز صورتي زير بارون و يه مقدار جزيي مركبات
عاشق عطر خنك وخيس رز هستم و عاشق كنزولئو2..شباهت زيادي با كنزولئو اوليه نداره..كنزولئو بيشتر آكواتيك و كمتر زنانه بود..اما اين مثل يه روياي شيرينه. سبك..خالص..يه رايحه باطراوت وخنك براي بهار وتابستون
درانتهاي عمر عطر رايحه مشك و چاي سبز هم برام قابل لمسه
موندگاري و سيلاژ هردومتوسط هستن..متوسط رو به زياد..بيشتر از انتظاري ك از همچين عطر لطيفي داشتم

Light and bright, floral, pleasant, soft sillage.

The scent really kicks in in its best, ultimate form after a couple of hours. It is like a tender spring or summer dream. It would probably be a bit contradictory to wear it in the winter season; or why not if you want to give off some cute energy like a little elf?

The lotus and rose combine very harmoniously and the subtle citrus balances the floweriness by brightening it up.

L'Eau 2 makes me think of flowers with raindrops on them. Beautiful. If this fragrance were a material and you could touch it it would be silk.

Light and aquatic fragrance. I can sense pear, lotus and freesia very intensively.
It's quite easy-going, modest and subtle everyday scent, but not impressive in my opinion. I liked L'eau par Kenzo much better.
Not bad, but a little ordinary for my taste.

I thought this would be somewhat similar to L'ear Par Kenzo but it's not. The seller said this one is better smelling but they didn't have tester. I wasn't too convinced so I only bought the mini - and I'm glad I did. Although I don't mind the smell, I can't say I like it. Obviously I prefer L'eau Par than this one. But maybe I'll give it another try sometime.

I just bought a bottle. At first it seemed to me nothing special, something like Light Blue from DG, but later I realized that this is the fragrance that lift me up when I am sleepy, lazy. It is pure, without any disturbing elements. I feel clean, sporty, energetic, alive. It is great!

Kenzo L'Eau 2 pour Femme doesn't change much on me: a soft lemony floral scent. The lemon here has nothing astrigent, its gentle tartness adds a zesty, invigorating zing to the flowers. The core of the floral part of L'Eau 2 seems to be a mild rose, with a touch of lotus bringing in a slight aquatic aspect, and a soupcon of freesia for a green touch. The overall effect is cool and breezy, girly and carefree. In the late drydown, I also find there is a slight honey note enhancing the floral sweetness.

L'Eau 2 has a soft sillage and its longevity on me is about 8 hours. As a citrus pink floral scent, there are probably other more interesting and memorable choices out there. That being said, L'Eau 2 is not bad on its own: refreshing, approachable, without being overly synthetic or saccharine. I'd recommend it to those who are looking for a lighthearted citrus floral fragrance for spring and summer.
A mist of sweet pears with a hint of soft lemon roses feel very feminine! but I detect a scent green, do not know ... ideal for summer, airy and creamy. kenzo good news!
I think it's boring and cheap... its fresh, but not interesting at all.

there is just so much YES in this frag. its very fresh, and the rose it's just magnificent, without being powdery or smelling musty. I LOVE LOVE LOVE it!
ETA: my coworkers and my superior always compliment me when I'm wearing l'eau 2
------------
Just noticed that there's the tea note missing from the base notes, definitely check that out, when first released it.was noted as the tthird base note. Every time I wear this I get the sweet pear and roses, which also.are.no longer listed, and the creamyness of the lotus, different to the sharp dry lotus.from the.original.l'eau. Sweet freesia and then a little cedar and the tea note (which may get noticed as patchouli- i know i thought it.was.patchouli, but lo and behold it was tea on the drydown)
Inmense lasting power, medium to excellent projection/sillage depending on the day - especially climate related (ex. When it's very humid the sillage is monstruous, you will.be emmiting waves of this stuff, and it only gets stronger with time, stays fresh always. On drier days sillage is average, longevity is still good, tends more towards a woodier fruity fragrance than fresh and sweet)

This perfume has changed my perception about citrus, and I thank Kenzo for that. I never liked any citrus scent before. Until a seller kindly include 2 vials of this along with my purchase, I was immediately in love, and so were my friends. I checked out the notes and was surprised to know it has lemon as the main notes! I love it. Smells so fresh and suits for everyday use.
I really like it on the first spray, sweet, fruity and fresh at the same time. But after a few times, it changes, warmer and reminds me with many other perfumes out there.

Strongly reminding me of YSL In Love Again the classical one.. but looks like more light version of it.
Stays on my sking as very pure and sexy, love it!!!
think can be really my No1 for summer evenings!
It smells like Holloween Kiss by Jesus del Pozo

A true spring/summer fragrance. Very uplifting and lots of lemon in topnote. When it calms down there is also pear,rose, musk and cedar. A bit too sweet for me but a great every-day-scent fort all women- timeless.

En äkta vår/sommardoft! Upplyftande med massor av citron i toppnoten. När den lugnat sig så känner jag även ros, musk, päron och cederträ. Lite för söt för min smak men superhärlig varje-dag-doft för alla kvinnor - Tidlös.
Very uplifting fragrance, it's like sweet juice with a little flower. Perfect for summer.
Though I love sweet fragrances, L'Eau 2 impressed me with its subtleness. It is perfect to wear with jeans and casual clothes.

Kenzo always make unique fragrances, but actually, this new L'Eau is not quite like that. It smells like so many other fresh and clean perfumes out there. It's those kind of perfumes that it's difficult to dislike, it's pretty, easy to wear and perfect for when you just want to smell good and "safe". It also doesn't have anything to do with the original L'Eau, which smells much more aquatic and kind of unissex.

The pyramid says it all: It starts very citrusy and fruity, and the heart is floral, sweet and very feminine. This transition reminds me a little bit of Scarlett from Cacharel, maybe because of the pear, but much fresher. You can definitely smell each note of L'Eau 2.
