For me, lotus, pear and rose are the most prominent. As you can expect, this is very girly girl kind of perfume, which surprises me because Kenzo doesn't make stuff like that.

The longevity and sillage are quite poor on my skin, unfortunately, and I have to reapply many times during the day. I think it works for all seasons, but it would be lovely for Spring and Summer.

Kenzo lovers like me may be a little bit dissappointed with L'Eau 2, but if you like fresh and clean, feminine and charming fragrances, you should give it a try! It's cute, and it's cheaper than other high end brands.
I really like it,fresh, light with a little sweetness. Perfect for summer, but i could wear it anytime. I hope i can buy it soon.

I'm really impressed with this L'eau par Kenzo flanker. Although an aquatic, L'eau 2 Kenzo for Her has a sweet juicy quality which smells really fun and invigorating on the skin.

There aren't many similarities between this flanker and the original. I'm really enjoying the sweet bursts of lemon and pear, followed by some gloriously feminine florals. Freesia provides a clean base, while the rose and lotus, in turn, create an element of girlish charm.

L'eau 2 Kenzo for Her is the perfect choice for Spring and Summer, and will be a sure hit with the younger segment of the population. To be completely honest, I didn't expect too much prior to testing this flanker, so I have been more than pleasantly surprised. I would most certainly wear this.

Due to its flirtatious and candied sweetness, some may consider this fragrance a tooth-ache. I actually don't mind it, and that's partly because this fragrance settles in a way that is soft and discreet, rather than loud.

The drydown is a subtle blend of sweetened florals, white musk and cedar. I think the composition as a whole, has been well executed. Even the sales assistants have been raving over the new L'eau 2 Kenzo for Her.

In terms of longevity, I'd have to say that it really does last, a lot longer than you may expect. I assume that this could be a limited edition, or even the 2012 answer to a Summer release. Either way, snap it up now or be sorry.

A great mix of citrus and sweet at the beginning but the drydown is too musky in my opinion, what surprised me because white musk usually is very fresh and hardly noticeable. I was a little disappointed.
I love it !!! It's fresh and a good daytime scent.

I love it. Fruity and then little bit creamy. And the bottle. Simple and nice.
Very good for summer.
:-) On my wishlist!
A good fresh-maker with the delicious rose smell, sweet in 20 minutes, very optimistic, just like the posters above. I wouldn't mind having it in the summer!

For me it smells like elderberry with a hint of
lemon.Very nice!
Where is Lemon

I'm revisiting this one years after I first got it and I must say it's turned out to be one of my most successful blind buys. I love how the mint and spices in the opening contrast with the woody base and keep it from being too earthy or dry. It's a green and woody fragrance for sure but has an invigorating quality to it. I enjoy wearing it on my evening walks during the summer and fall.

These older Kenzo fragrances from the 2000s and 2010s all had so much character, it's too bad they all got discontinued. The new line created by Quentin Bisch gets generally good reviews but got boring to me pretty quickly.

I remember this one from years ago. It was my dad's cologne but I used to "borrow it" and rock it for the high-school myself so it was one of the first fragrances I ever wore.

Very green, peppery and sharp vetiver. That sharp, peppery basil note made it quite unique. Was quite strong aswell. Good days.

Kenzo Homme Boisée opens with a sharp, almost spicy kick—I was sure there was anise in the top notes before checking, but it seems to be mint and basil adding that twist. The first spray is bold, but as it dries down, it settles into a peppery vetiver, fresh yet grounded.

The Kenzo DNA is still here—clean, fresh, and easy to wear. If you like vetiver with a green, slightly spicy touch, this one is a solid choice.

A heavy vetyver fragrance with basil, mint and cedar mixed with some rosemary. But, heavy vetyver! It's almost as heavy as Gueralin Vetyver. Someone did mention Sandalwood and I agree. I'm getting the same creamy sandalwood note after the top notes.

The notes in this fragrance play well together. Definitely a warm weather freshie, but it can be equally used in cool autumn months too.

On my skin, longevity isn't so great, maybe 5-6 hours and the sillage is about 1-2 feet. Still, a nice scent. Mine is a 2010 bottle with the embossed bamboo stem and leaves. I paid about $40. I wouldn't pay more than that.

Kenzo Homme Boisee is a great fresh summer option that doesn't rely on aquatics, citrus, or ambroxan for it's lift. With enough depth to work year round, I think it's a super versatile option, and was a steal at $30-$40. Hard to recommend at inflated prices, due to it's discontinuation, but under $50 it's worth the price 100%.

It's a very simple blend, with brief unsweetened mint, and the rosemary and basil giving it a bit of a camphorous, herbal, and anisic edge, but overall a non-descript and enjoyable green feeling with woody browns underneath. The vetiver lands somewhere between fresh green, and earthy brown. There is a bristly and prickly feel to this when sniffed up close, but in the air, it's nice, smooth, and fairly one dimensional. I think the beauty here lies in the simplicity.

It splits a difference between completely natural feeling, and synthetic feeling as it arrives somewhere in the middle and feels modern, yet not muddled for it. The aromachemical feel gives it enough airy lift where it doesn't feel heavy or muddy like an essential oil blend would.

I'd call this the Kenzo designer equivalent to Aesop Tacit for sure, with Tacit being far more natural feeling with a photorealistic basil and very beautiful vetiver. This Kenzo is like the streetwear version to Aesop's yoga studio and cushy boutique hotel vibe. They are 2 sides of the same coin, with each suiting their respective brands overall look and feel.

The performance and feeling of this one trends toward middle of the road, yet it still stands out as unique to me. Not knock your socks off unique, but unique in a quiet and confident non-shouty way. It tip toes between natural and synthetic (not a diss here) and clean and earthy in a satisfying way, and I'd recommend it wholeheartedly if you can come across for a bargain.
Discontinued masterpiece by Chanel's perfumer Olivier Poulge. Went through a few bottles when it was still available on the market.
Shy and weak opening. Somehow sour for any reason. I can smell very subdued notes in the backgroung: cardamom, rose.Then the dry down gets stronger and sweeter. Sandalwood becomes a player.
The opening is shy and weak. It is somehow sourand I can smell something very subdued in the background tham should be cardamom and rose. The dry down is stronger and sweeter.
Great fresh/sporty scent w/ no citrus! Mint & basil top that lasts. Pepper heart note fades to a very good, robust vetiver. Evocative. A+
This is a masterpiece. That’s it, that’s the review.

This relaxed, watery, masculine fragrance is very versatile but particularly perfect for rainy days. I like it a lot and I'm bummed out it's been discontinued.

I associate Kenzo Homme Boisee with L'eau d'Issey Pour Homme. Not that they smell all that similar, beyond a certain watery freshness, but I think they have a similar vibe. I can see the same man wearing L'eau d'Issey when it's sunny, and Kenzo Homme Boisee on cloudy days.

Just bought a bottle to try this out, lovely woodsy and aromatic citrus with pepper elements. In fact I wish it was a bit more prickly and peppery, but still a nice scent, not the best sillage but good longevity. Reminds me of Terre d'Hermes

Edit: having now used Encre Noire, I think that's what Kenzo was trying to copy, dry down is 80% same, with Lalique being the superior scent of the two in my opinion, though some might appreciate more the hint of freshness with Kenzo's basil.

This is a fantastic fragrance that can be worn anywhere. Citrus and mint dominate but whoever says this doesn't last must have had a bad bottle. This is old school strong and I can still smell strongly over ten after initial application of two or three sprays. Sadly this has been discontinued like all masterpieces, confined to memory and replaced by bland, boring multi national rubbish.

This is too amazing to be discontinued! The mix of woody and minty notes is just perfect, and the price was very good for what was offered. My wife loves every time I use it. It is fresh, modern and natural.

Kenzo Homme Boisee has just the right balance of nutty rooty vetiver and green herbs without getting overly dirty or too old school.

A few I have that I can compare this to:
Lagerfeld Bois de Vetiver: brighter sweeter citrus geranium Ambroxan
Guerlain Homme L’Eau
D&G Masculine (spicier from the clary sage & caraway)
Tom Ford Grey Vetiver that I much less prefer due to its smoky spicy undertone

I find Givenchy Very Irresistible Fresh Attitude Summer Cocktail to be a good layering partner.

You might also like Porsche Design Titan.

باران در شب جنگل های استوایی
بهترین و خلاقانه ترین تولید کنزو تا امروز
-----------
Scent & Quality: 8/10
Longevity: 7/10
Sillage: 7/10
Creativity & Uniqueness: 8/10
Affordability: 7/10
-----------
Overall: 7.4/10

بهترین کار بهاری که از بوش سیر نمیشید من از همون سالی که تو ایران لانچ شده خریدم تا به الان ..فقط دو سالی میشه که سخت پیدا میشه احتمالا توقف تولید شده باشه...ولی کار خیلی خوبیه تکراری نیست....شروعش مرکباتی نیست فلفلیه..خیلی سبز نیست ولی شدیدا مرطوب و جنگلی و خاکی است...تو این چند سال مشابهش رو نتونستم تو هیچ برندی پیدا کنم ...عطر امضام شد و یه جورایی منو با این رایحه میشناسن دوستان و اقوام نزدیکان.....ترکیباتش بنظرم خیلی طبیعیه و کمتر از مواد مصنوعی استفاده شده..کلا کنزو کارای خوب، طبیعی و استانداردی داره..کنزو تاکادا روحش‌شاد باشه...مهمترین اصل بین ما ایرانیا هنگام خرید عطر (حدود هشتاد درصدمون) ماندگاری و پخش بوی عطر که باید بگم : ماندگاریش روی پوست من فوق العاده هست و حدود ده ساعت میمونه خیلی بالانس خوبی داره تغییر نت هاش مشهوده و خسته کننده نیست نشر بو هم تا دوساعت اول عالیه .... در کل پخش بوش خوب و راضی کنندس...هر جا که زدم، پرسیدن که چی زدی ...امتیاز من به این عطر ۹/۵ از ۱۰
عین عطرای خنک دیگه تکراری نیست نه تو تاپ نت نه میدل نت و نه تو نت پایانی ....داخل پرانتز یه چیزی بگم (نت پایانی این عطر دقیقا مشابه عطر لایتون از برند پرفیوم دی مارلی میباشد)....جنگل بارون خورده درختای خیس خاک مرطوب....پنجاه درصد بهاری ،بیست درصد تابستونی،پانزده درصد زمستان و پانزده درصد پاییز.....کاشکی قیمتا برگرده و این عطر بدون ریفرموله شدن مجدد تولید انبوه بشه....موفق باشد با احترام with love💙💚💙💚

Somewhat misleading bottle in that this isn't a "woody" fragrance, but rather a minty, herbal one. It's both relaxing and refreshing and pretty well-blended; the mint in the opening is not overpowering and you get plenty of herbs and a soft vetiver in the drydown.

Performance is an issue for me. As the opening fades this fragrance sits very close to the skin. I can barely smell it after 4 hours, which is a real shame, because this is good stuff; it just doesn't jump off the skin like I'd want it to.

The scent itself is a "love," however.
A masculine version of Bal d'Afrique....This was the most satisfying blind buy ever!
اگه عاشق کارهای وتیوری خنک هستید تو خریدش شک نکنید. البته کمی کمیاب شده.وتیور لیمویی تو بیس نت رایحه شاخ و برگ خیس درختان حس میشه. پخش و ماندگاری نسبتا خوب
Another cool one from Kenzo. It’s a modern smelling woody/herbal blend with cool citrus and natural vetiver. Very well balanced with enough depth to be taken seriously. Bravo.

Reminded me of Guerlain homme eau Boise but more wearable, much smoother and better in my opinion.

It is cheap but with very good quality. Green, woody and fresh basic gentleman scent.

Probably one of the most non-offensive scents I own. The mint blends smoothly with the basil and vetiver. I wonder if the mint and basil combination could be made into a drink...

Longevity and sillage are lower than average.

Relaxing, albeit safe (and a bit boring). I am essentially ambivalent toward this scent. I wouldn't mind wearing it, but it isn't particularly attractive in any way either. And I don't find it as comforting as others...It's kind of like clear as a color.

Between this and Guerlain L'Eau Boisee or Guerlain Homme (two scents that are similar to this one), I see myself reaching for either of those 100% of the time over this.
deeply relaxing, green, almost spiritual, I adore it

Very pleasant fresh woody spicy green scent, nothing groundbreaking though. Very common smell it doesn't distinguish from the rest scents, so quite generic but safe and pleasant. The performance is not so good as many say and it doesn't stain as some wrote. Moderate sillage and longevity : about 4 hours maximum as a faint skin scent. This Kenzo is alive on my skin for the first 1.5-2 hours. Then it stays very close to the skin. I like it but it's not worth a full bottle imo.

I came across Kenzo Boisee accidentally whilst browsing eBay. A 30ml bottle for £12 inclusive of postage so I couldn't resist the temptation to purchase the bottle.

From the moment I sprayed it, it reminded me of another fragrance that I adore.... Eureka!

Tacit by Aesop, the green minty luscious green scent they both give off is unmistakably similar. I would not say they are 100% identical though. Tacit's ingredients are more realistic but KB does not do a bad job.

The mint in both does not give off the notorious 'mouthwash' note, thank god! KB transports me to a green humid jungle in a way similar to Selva de Brasil by Berdoues.
Tacit is an EDP and KB is an EDT which explains the difference in the performance between the two.

Tacit retails at £70 for the 50ml bottle and it rarely is available at a discount price although I, fortunately, happened to find it at a much lower price on eBay. KB can be readily found at nearly half the price on eBay.

All in all, Kenzo Boisee is nothing groundbreaking but is definitely a very good fragrance and a keeper for me.

6/10
A very dynamic sweet yet beautiful men's scent with strong different character drydown scent, all in all 9/10.
@gabriel: KB performs well on clothing. Just spritz your shirt or t-shirt underneath a few times and it projects all day. No problems with stains btw.

I just got it. I have been wearing it for two days. It is beautiful fresh sharp and timeless scent. But the thing is - I cannot see, how can people talk about good longevity. On my skin it works for 20 minutes, than turns into a skinscent immediately, - I have never seen such a developement with a fragrance. And that soft fresh vetivery skin scent lingers there for another maybe 2-3 ours. True story. (It is original for sure)
a tasty and fresh fragrance. if you sprayed on clothes it will leave a mark on your clothes.

Once upon a time, I had this beautiful, masculine, woody fragrance. Ever since, I've never been able to find a pure woodsy scent that excites me as much as this. It is an easy first adventure into woodier scents for those less familiar, as both the spices (basil, mint, rosemary) and cedar notes used here are safe and complimentary to a lot of skin tones. If memory serves - it's been a few years since I've run out of this one, sadly - silage and longevity are comfortably powerful without being too domineering. This is an incredibly "manly" scent in the bearded lumberjack sort of way.
@Endymion I think they vary a lot! This one is rosemary and basil while KHS focus on grapefruit and spice.

I do love this one
real beauty and manly. this is the best perfume for me so far. feels like lost in tropical jungle. love, love and love
this is a lovely fragrance, more green than woody. it does last long but I wish it had more projection, after an hour it's a skinscent where nobody can smell it so what's the point but a great scent.

Very nice juice from Kenzo house.

It shares a lot in common in the presentation of vetiver and herbal/green vibe with Guerlain Homme l'Eau Boisee.

Guerlain Boisee is one of my favorite vetiver cologne for summer formal/casual days, but after I got this Kenzo and it just grew on me. Consider the year of production, I may refer the Guerlain one as Kenzo Homme Boisee Sport/Fraiche/Eau.

The difference between those two Boisees lays on the selection of herbal ingredients, the Guerlain uses grass as accompaniment to vetiver and makes it a bit unisex and energetic, but the Kenzo chooses brasil and is thus more masculine and low-profile somehow.

Both Boisees are definately gorgeous juices, but which one to grab should depend on your preference. If you are not in a budget constraint, you can get them both into your wardrobe with no doubt or hesitation.

Rating: 7.0/10
---
After wearing it a week, I found out this is definately not as good as Guerlain l'Eau Boisee in terms of materials quality, but still a nice perfume.

I love it... good job by Olivier polge

9.5/10

چیزی که بیشتر تو این عطر غالبه رایحه نعنا هست تا چوب، یه نعنای خنک و فرش . با گذر زمان نعنا کمرنگ میشه و عطر بسمت چوبی شدن پیش میره، ولی نه اونقدر محسوس،اینجوری بگم، بیشتر رایحه شاخ و برگ درختان رو میده تا چوب .

one of the best fresh, green & woody perfume.
lemon, pepper, mint and clean vetiver.


این کار با نعنای تازه، فلفل و لیمو شروع میشه و همون اول کار خواب رو از سر آدم میپرونه :) در ادامه فلفل محو و نعنا و لیمو ملایم میشن، و به مرور وتیور قوی و قوی تر میشه و در نهایت با کمک وتیور، نعنا و ریحان یه عطر سبز و فرش رو خواهیم داشت.به نظر من خیلی بوی چوب نمیده، بلکه بوی شاخ و برگ درختان جنگل رو میده. یه حس تازگی و واقعا با طراوت از خنکای یک جنگل در فصل پاییز
بطور خلاصه؛
تلخ سبز فرش ترش
وتیور ریحان نعنا لیمو
7.5/10

Really like this one. Starts off with citrus, herbs and woods which comes across as a little busy within the first few minutes, but it starts to meld nicely after that. Ultimately it dries down to a vetiver and light citrus mint combo which is very nice. As a comparison to other scents, I would say it is a combination of Guerlain's Vetiver Extreme with the mint note of YSL's Live Jazz. Two fragrances I really enjoy and which aren't particularly common.

Kenzo Homme Woody (also called Kenzo Boisée in some countries) was released in 2010, inspired by the look and the connection of the man with the energy of the earth and the immensity of the sky, as if he was the tallest tree, in a path with no limits.

It is almost unknown and poorly commented. But it is a masterpiece of perfumery that, unfortunately, is no longer manufactured.
It has notes of mint and basil, in the output; Rosemary and pepper from Madagascar, in the heart; Haiti vetiver and Atlas cedar, in the base.

When it touches the skin is minty and sweet. This freshness merges with a completely aromatic nuance, dotted by a touch of pepper. The base is woody, with greater presence of cedar and its camphorated and balsamic nuances. To me, it seems that the vetiver doesn't even exist.

During the evolution, it can makes you remember many other creations. In my case, I think of Burberry The Beat.
The bottle kept the visual identity, in a mix of gray and amber colors, which resembles wood.

In my opinion, is one of those fragrances without defects: is versatile, is elegant, exudes well, has great durability and, furthermore, was made by Olivier Polge.

Just purchased this gem for my husband and it smells AMAZING on him: fresh, clean, light, rugged, earthy, unique and deliciously woodsy. The vetiver note is beautifully balanced and creates an air of mystery that I find very sexy.

Sophisticated, professional, and alluring – an underrated gem and everything you want in a fragrance at an affordable price. Whoa – this morning I was reminded how much I like Kenzo’s Homme Boisee edition. This is a beautiful composition of herbal, floral, and woodsy notes that provides a clean and fresh feeling most of the day. While the sillage sets close to skin level, Boisee is a compliment getter and crowd pleaser. Additionally, given the fact that it remains close to skin level, Boisee offers great flexibility to be worn in any environment and for most occasions. The gentleness of the woodsy and herbal notes also allows for wear across seasons. The real beauty of Boisee is the price – a 1.7 ounce or 50 ml bottle can easily be found for around $25 USD. For this price range, Boisee is highly underrated. My only concern is regarding performance – I found that Boisee lasted comfortably around 4 hours on me and a bit longer on clothing. Yes – it was disappointing. All things considered, to include the lackluster performance, my final tally for Kenzo’s Boisee is 4.1 stars out of 5 stars. For the price, it is hard to beat. It is a beautiful fragrance that I recommend adding to any collection. Enjoy your day and happy fragrance hunting…

I like this perfume. It's woody and I get a lot of compliment from the ladies. But too bad, on a warm country like Indonesia, this perfume cannot retain its original scent after few hours as it turns to smell like something else. Well, maybe it's my body chems?

And against the sun heat in here, I only got around 2 - 3 hours longevity. Which is too bad, since I really like this fragrance.

Actually I've never had kenzo pour homme legendary but i've smell and test it alot and smell that in my relatives for years.but boisee have heart scent of that but little different and modern.i like it for daily use for all seasons.
average longevity and sillage.7/10
راستش من هیچوقت عطر افسانه ای کنزو رو نداشتم ولی بارها و بارها اون رو تست کردم و روی بدن اطرافیانم بو کردم.این عطر هم یه جورایی همون بو با یه مقداری تغییرات مدرنه. ماندگاری وپخش بوی کاملا متوسطی داره. برای چهار فصل مناسبه و بوش همه پسنده.دوسش دارم ولی برای یه دفعه خرید

Warm aromatic woody. The earthy vibes from vetyver and pepper notes surprisingly remind me of Terre d'Hermes and Burberry the beat(I tried all of them on the same day in duty free). Design-wise, this one is a very artistic bottle greatly represent the scent itself.

Using a sample I got from department store perfume section. Upon application I smell blends of cedar and mint with the an aromatic spice from pepper. Vetiver slowly comes in as mint and pepper tones down. 10 minutes after reveals a soothing Rosemary with basil that brings out the herbal touch. The composition is good, comforting, safe to wear, earthy fresh but woody and would be good to wear indoors and outdoors, fall and summer afternoons.
Unfortunately, as it is a pleasant scent, I prefer a more complex perfume if it's under the woody aromatic group. Women would love smelling this though. Projection and longevity is above average. 7/10.

Lovely, fresh, long lasting woody, vetiver scent, but sorry, it smells nothing like Declaration by Cartier or M7 lol!
Well worth a blind buy, and a great addition to any collection.
It positively *****$ all over Bvlgari Man in Black Extreme in terms of performance ;-)

This begins with an overgrowth of herbs: mint, basil, and I also get some dirty tarragon. As it dries, some polite vetiver and a stick-like rosemary tame down the leaf-bomb opening. After a full day at work, I can detect clean cedar if I sniff my collar.

I wear this almost every day. Two sprays to the neck. A few times, after trigger-happy mornings, colleagues have told me I smell especially clean.

I was a bit disappointed. To me this has mostly a brighter green scent rather than the woodsy tones in the profile. The mint and basil are evident and dominate up front. I mostly get an inexpensive and antiseptic (and i think others here may have said Soapy instead) vibe from it. Its possible on my skin the woodiness and more earthy tones are absorbed quickly and I don't pick them up (unlike other colognes). Overall, this seems like something you'd buy cheap at a drug store, not unique or complex in any way. I wanted to like it, i really did...
To me it smells similar to Declaration by Cartier. Very easy scent not bad at all.

To me..the scent very similary to the burberry beat...
The scent is great..long lasting too..
Can be used any time...
Scent : 8/10
Sillage : 8/10
Longevity : 8/10

This is a great, light, oud wood fragrance. It is less expensive than for example M7, but you are sort of getting something along the same lines. Reminds me of Tam Dao as well. Stays close to the skin but not weak by any means. I don't get much "green" unless one means "grassy" or maybe earthy. Like hay. No way does it have any similarity to Eau Sauvage in my humble opinion, and no offense to any of my fellow perfumistas. I have been wearing ES for over 25 years, always owned a bottle and had one in my collection. Yes it is something that is so pleasant and unassuming that it could be worn any time, anywhere, at any time of the year. In that respect then it is very much like Eau Sauvage. I blind bought this because of the reviews, the price, and because it was created by one of a line of master perfumers.

Lovely vetyver based fragrance, I love it in the spring and rainy days.

The opening it's green, minty, citric (bergamot or lime) and a just a bit soapy. And is strong, the first hour I get beast projection with 4 sprays.

In the dry down woody notes are stronger, the vetyver it's the dominant note now. It's remind me of Grey Vetiver and Guerlain Homme Intense(without the rum note).

It's very easy to wear and gets some compliments also. Great longevity and overall quality. I think it's the best flanker of Kenzo Homme.

9/10

Very earthy and organic, it definitely has that natural feel which Kenzo is known for. For me, the mint is just too sharp and overall feels like it's not balanced properly. This is the rain-forest in a bottle, which sounds wonderful until you experience all the dirt and bugs that come with it. There's nothing wrong with being dirty though, it's just a bit heavy on the vetiver for my taste.

the opening scent is very sharp and i have to hold my breath for about 10 seconds.
the vetiver on the basenote is very relaxing. i love this fragrance

I bought this blind about a year ago, thinking if it had bois in the title it would surely be a winner. Erm, no...

I felt compelled to review after having acquired kenzo air, which to my nose smells much more agreeable.

I don't know what kind of a wood it is supposed to smell like, but I've never come across any wood or vegetation which has ever smelled like this.

I am getting a VERY soapy smell, like imperial leather soap, or those novelty gift soaps you get. A mix between soap and citrussy furniture polish.

If you want a fresh woody scent, better go for guerlain eau boisee, or stick to kenzo air.

I have grey vetiver, and although I dont have it on my top shelf, that does vetiver MUCH better than this one

Clinique chemistry for men can come across as soapy, but not soapy to the max like this disappointing kenzo frag. The title does not match the contents in my opinion.
I have it and cant bring myself to wear it.

Very interesting, not sure I've come across other scents that remind me of this. Starts out with a blow of basil and sweet mint, which is replaced by a more peppery note within the first 15-20 minutes and after some time the vetiver kicks in and stays around with a woody note. A very fresh scent, but strangely doesn't come across as soapy. Very pleasant and versatile for use in spring and summer. Holds a decent longevity, though the sillage is not amazing, stays close to you. Highly recommendable :-)

This is a very allround versatile kinda frag. Wear to work, night out, formal, casual.. not a beast of projection but it will get you noticed. Especially in the morning' if you spray it'll give u and people around u a feeling of cleanliness. Again' versatility is the key to this one. Just started using my second bottle...
Compliments every single i wear this scent. Amazing!!! .

Overall I would give this a 7.5/10

The opening combines mint, basil, and a citrus note. I'm not sure what the note is (maybe bergamot) but in any case I don't love it in this fragrance. It brings an element of sharpness that takes away from the herbal and slightly sweet aromas that both mint and basil have. But even still the opening is good. After that, the herbs stay put and team up with a spicy woody accord. There is also something in the drydown that reminds me of lavendar, which gives it a nice clean vibe.

Not particularly unique, but an enjoyable smell. I think people who like the smell of basil should check this out as the note is pretty pronounced.

I picked this one up at Dillards for a very good price. I was amazed how this one smells so fresh and spicy with a touch of wood. This is a great fragrance. I received a few compliments as well. I smelled Grey Vetiver later after buying this one and I must say this Kenzo was done much better. This cologne is good for any time use.
after actually letting this dry down, this is BETTER than grey vetiver. and half the price! In my opinion this is grey vetiver with a small amount of more depth.
Smells like tom ford grey vetiver. Very nice. Got a free bottle of this from a lady at Dillard's!

I get the basil and mint at first. After about 15 minutes the basil is replaced by a light hint of pepper. The dry down starts about 20 minutes in and is mint and cedar. This lasts as a relatively close skin scent for about 8 or 9 hours. I enjoy the scent. I haven't smelled anything like it. They just started selling it today at ulta and i picked it up. So far I think I will be using this quite a bit. I give it a 7 out of 10 for uniqueness.

Good gosh, hit me on the backside of the head! This is everything I wanted Bvlgari MAN to smell like!

Bvlgari MAN has this screeching floral citrus top that's hard to get around, not to mention base notes that are barely there, but remarkable.

Kenzo Boisee, to summarize on the whole, is a citrus woody scent with a generous helping of soapy-musk nuances. Apart from the citrus at the top, there's also spicy but not sharp notes, and a tinge of a green medicinal aromatic smell.

A European woody-soapy clean. I LOVE THIS! Good longevity. A must try.

**EDIT** On several more wearings, I started thinking of similarities to Cartier Declaration. Which is better? Declaration does it better. The complexity and longevity run circles around Kenzo B
Pure woody scent. Soft, calm and earthy. Still has some mysteriously oriental notes, which I always love from Kenzo house. Once again another thumbs-up for Kenzo!

Update,
To sum up this amazing frag, after it settles you have a woodsy/spicy LUXURIOUS aroma. This juice a high quality herbal aromatic scent...a very fresh, clean scent...A TRUE GEM!!!!!★★★★★

I never found Kenzo's cologne for men to generic or common. Most of their cologne's have a long staying power. I did find that most of them dry back nicely !!!!!!!!
Kenzo Homme Woody Edt Boisée is no exception, it has a well blend aroma of herbs, Basel, Rosemary to give it a herbal or a green aroma. The woodsy (Cedar) as well as Vetiver combined with black pepper really spice's it up and makes it the best of Kenzo frag in opinion.
For me Kenzo Homme Edt Boisée has a real masculine aroma as well as it being a very mystical scent from the Orient. This cologne is really rich in a warm woodsy scent also being very aromatic which comes off as an attractive scent also perfect during the summer/fall day's.
Longevity is well past 10 hour's
Sillage is beyond most fragrance's, with your body temperature it radiates further them most colognes.
Overall, I don't find this cologne boring or plain...instead I find that it evokes or opens your senses to a far away land where the aroma is fresh and pure. This cologne gives you that clean fresh and spicy scent. 10/10
Perfect perfume, lasts long, combination of fresh and spicy and masculine.

"This perfume reminds me of..." ...a whole lot of other scents. It's generic woody/spicy. I find it uninspired. It's inoffensive and likable, but inoffensive and likable doesn't convince me to pull out the credit card.
I have it & I do not like it!

Very nice green, woody fragrance. Fresh with no bitterness. Smells "clean", but not soapy. It's not so unique as to be a head turner, but it is quite pleasing. I don't think strangers would comment on your fragrance, but your friends would probably ask what you were wearing.
I like this one. Its not a bang but rather bit mysterious/different from the mainstream. Nice woody smell. Good for 4-5 hours at the Office. 7/10 overall.

A great fragrance. Pleasant long lasting , good projection.

Wear it when you want to smell like fresh wood.

Longevity: 7/10
Projection:8/10
Scent: 7/10
This is a great natural peppery herby wood smell. I am loving this one. I get more of the mint than I do the basil and the basil notes are the reason I bought it. Great frag either way!

Call me crazy but I get loads of citrus from this? Can't see any mentioned among the notes but to me it has a very lemony top and now-a couple of hours after spraying it on I get lots and lots of pepper along with the cedar. Lovely. Warm, dry-very dry-and relaxing. Love wearing it!

Smells like lots of other scents. The achievement here was to neutralize the notes listed above. I love the scent of basil, and do appreciate vetyver and pepper, but there is nothing about this fragrance I find appealing for the first one or two hours. I do like the scent of cardamom as it gets more pronounced with the fragrance development. I do not find this fragrance a great achievement though. Far too common.

On a summer vacation, I fell in love with a Brazillian man and this was his signature scent.

It is a joyful blend of basil and sweet mint, with bonfire and sizziling woods in the background. Kenzo Boisee contains a very friendly vetiver, it is not overly grassy or sour. But does add a bit of warm smoke and soaks up the wateriness of the sweet herbs.

I remembered Kenzo Boisee as alluring, warmly inviting scent with a distinct aromatic sweetness. (or maybe I was just so in love!)
Small resemmblance to Carvens Vetiver
fixa bem,porém dono de uma fragancia frustante como todo kenzo masculino.
love it

This is really quite unique. I tried on skin only once and coulnd't figure out which notes it does contain and what it smells like. If u want to be different and not belong to the crowd group then this is for u.
I need to test more and update here again.

Boisee is by far my favorite scent from Kenzo's collection marketed to men. I purposefully used the verb "marketed", as I find it pretty universal i.e. very unisex really. The smell is absolutely natural to me - woody, herbal, spicy and earthy notes are my types of scents and I never saw anything particularly masculine in them.

This EDT is a powerhorse when it comes to sillage and longevity - just a few sprays in the morning carry me strongly throughout the day. I simply love this concoction of prominent earthy vetiver, enticing and a bit savoury black pepper, and cooling mint and basil.

Strangely, while wearing it, I feel like a young samurai, practicing the sword fight deep in the woods or better, flying through the trees, like the characters in the "Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon" movie, even though they were not Japanese ;)
Amazing sensation of refreshment and invigoration on a hot summery day with a scorching sun!
5/5
Fresh, a bit sharp, unique and pleasant. So hard to be wiped away with paper tissue so I guess longevity must be good. A nice summer fragrance from Kenzo.

First, dab sampling: Looking for a light, slightly more complex version of Encre Noire? Then you might want to try this one. Though not listed, I'd guess there is some citrus and violet leaf in here. And I think there is iso e super in here, just in case you don't like it. I don't, but I think it may be bearable here (I'll have to try it again, when I can do a regular wearing). Longevity and projection ("sillage") seem to be very good.

My nose is hit with a burly woody, spicy herby and vetiver blast. This is not the best vetiver that I’ve smelled, but it could be the combination of rosemary that is not mixing well for me. I'm normally all game for the woody and smoky smells. In short words, I'm neither “Like or Dislike” and the rest of it has been said before.

A very modern vetiver scent. It's smooth and sophisticated. It's not as potent but much more refined than Guerlain Vetiver, in my opinion. I also get something smokey but very clean and something like iris. Peppery freshness is all around. Wonderful.
The review below is very accurate. I don't mind the smokiness at all the though. Great masculine scent without being over powering. Good at night but it works great in the office too.

A vibrant spicey modern frag with a huge soapy opening, which is strong, but gets too smoky in the end..

I applied 6 heavy sprays


0- 30 secs. Alcohol, nothing much, modern, non-descript

30 secs - 1 hour 1.5 foot projection, very good! This is a strong acidic, spicy, citrus frag with a niche immense soapy twist!! Very masculine and distinctive. Ages 28-50. If you forget the soapy twist then this could be like a watered down version of Terre D Hermes. Night time frag, quite sexy.

1- 2 hours. 1 foot projection. Strong smokiness comes in. The niche soapy twist goes towards the end of the 2 hours and it is now very similar to Salvatore Ferragamo F in Black Pour Homme

2-3 hours. 8 inch projection. Incredibly smoky, too much so..it has lost its character of the 1st hour

3 - 5.5 hours - 3.5 inch projection. Same as above

5.5 hours - 7 hours - 1.5 inch projection

7-9 hours. Close to skin

An unusual start, which is distinctive, but then the smokiness ruins it. Strong frag though

I like this. very herbal and woody scent.
Longevity is very good. Lasts a full work day on me and projects really well all the time. So I don´t understand complaints on poor longevity at all! :)
This is good quality stuff and very well made by Olivier Polge. The top and base notes remind me a lot of Guerlain Homme Intense.

Very few fragrances work well in tropical, humid countries. This unfortunately does not. Even with generous sprays, the notes don't really carry beyond the first 2 hours.

Sillage: 4
Projection: 2
Longevity: 3

Start sour with citruses and basil.
Dry down to a nice vetiver note with woods,green notes and pepper.
But after 3 hours it became a little generic ,i mean that u will notice similarity with any vetiver based fragrance and not the good ones.
Quality,longevity,projection and smell are average.
Best time to wear it is in a cool spring morning after a rainy night.
It's ok.
Great scent! Smell like the original One Man Show with more pepper

It's fresh and green and reminds me of some green Yves Rocher Fraîcheur Végétale showergels. I also thought the scent was too intrusive. And unless you don't want to smell like YR showergel, it's not such a good recommendation.

This fragrance launched at mid 2010, and known in some countries as "Kenzo Homme Eau de Toilette Woody" corresponds to a new perfume that is based on the classic lines of Kenzo Homme in 1991, but the similarities only to this point as it changes the original marine scent a strand woody spicy inspired by a tree and the idea of a man getting his energy from the earth while looking towards the infinite sky grow without limits, which is reflected in the names " Boisée "and" Woody "which translates from French and English as" woody ". The bottle repeats the shape of bamboo stick used in other men's fragrances like Kenzo Kenzo pour Komme and Tokyo, changing the color of a brown glass that recalls the idea of wood decorated with an engraving of two leaves on a branch. At the site of Kenzo Parfums note that perfume main notes are: mint, basil, rosemary, Madagascar pepper, vetiver and cedar Atlas.

In the game the fragrance displays notes are soft cross between a wood plant with a lemony lima brief point that drops quickly to almost nothing Just a couple of minutes, leaving a scent that is between sweet vegetal musk amber trend A very fresh and young vetiver features green dusty and dry brushing groups flowers with hints of herbal mint. In mid-stage dry the green group about the idea of spiced water, lowering the mint and vetiver increasing feeling enhanced by the herbs, rosemary and basil integrated into this line as support without shine independently. Within 40 minutes of applied stress begins to pepper derived from the idea of water species, giving features ginger rub dry with earthy and very soft wood in the background. About 1 hour is more pepper applied on a background rudeness continues to remind ginger earthy but fairly bright points provided by a composite herbal, with hints of cardamom spiced with bitter orange in this Declaration by Cartier. At 3 hours the dry portions of spiced lean toward the woods, giving an impression of cedar at 4 hours patchouli mixed with a more visible and on par with the wood, followed by pepper and spice representative of the first part and vetiver passing shade of bush now tending to be absorbed by the wood, all over a body of water aniseed spices that supports and helps make a good trail and projection to these notes. It feels a little green grass but it seems to become independent and not become a complement to the rest of the notes remaining always in the background. At about 8 hours stay alive spicy, fragrant, light amber, with a fresh pepper showing a flashy not annoying itching or bitter, accompanied by notes such high green bushes next to a dusty wooden pepper are complemented by helping project it. In the final phase is less spicy and more spicy vetiver presence of bushy, with more inclination to nutmeg giving an impression even slightly sweet herbal mint reminiscent of a screw.

The fragrance has the advantage of reminding other perfume mixtures above but structuring these notes of a novel and striking, which projects while maintaining a style that is between the classic and young causing a good memory effect in a manner similar to that got La Nuit de L'Homme YSL line of tobacco wood and vanilla. On the point of pepper fragrance has a penchant for cool winters in daily use, expanding to intermediate stations and hot summers in interior, present clean and ideally semiformal social rudeness, even accepting some degree of sporty dynamics. In office the amount of wood species gives the idea of a return of the classic line elegant suit and tie, executive presence and seriousness, perhaps moments pepper providing relaxed casual tone at times, mild winters also focused indoors and outdoors. In the night scene pepper stands quite marked difference from their peers without being intrusive, much like the effect achieved by similar aromas and Light Blue pour Homme D & G in the summer and The Beat Man by Burberry, adding a layer of wood gives reliability and cleanliness preventing the pepper go to the side of the sage or deodorants. On the romantic side is well balanced pepper and other spices layers that give a touch of clove and anise, adding notes sexiest warm wood, perhaps adding a recommendation that over-application can play against the note of pepper out of control and numbing the nose. Age range between 25 and 50 years, with a slight preference for seriousness and elegance over 30 years.

Previous reviewers got it very well: I also submit to the fresh-aromatic vetiver feeling with additions of black pepper at middle and soft cedarwood at dry down.
I perceived it as a combination of the smooth vetiver of Lalique Encre Noir's drydown with the spicy pepper of Burberry The Beat and some strong mint/basil fresh feeling thrown in it.
I love Kenzo Jungle and hated Kenzo Tokyo and Kenzo Air left me flat, but this one is the best creation of japanese creator with the magic touch of Oliver Polge. My rank 8.2/10. ☣☣☣
One word describes this cologne, "amazing".

Strong mint and vetiver. It doesn't really smell like bubblegum thanks to the dryness of wood that gives it some virility. Nothing to do in my opinion with the original Kenzo pour Homme so strikingly different from the rest, independent and one-of-a-kind. It is good but would fit me more in a Lacoste line of scents rather than Kenzo.

Vetiver will hit you from start to dry down.

At first the vetiver is accompanied by a pinch of tingling mint that gives Kenzo Boisse enough dose of freshness.

That phase is quickly gone and replaced by a more intense version of vetiver, bit creamier, heavier.

On dry down the star remains the same, but this time with cedar dancing in the background, pulling the vetiver into a more shy and earthy version, playing itself out to skin scent phase.

If you love vetiver, try it out. If you hate it, you won't find this appealing.

Sillage and longetivity are also ok, less than Kenzo Power.

For those who are familiar with Kenzo fragrances I would say that this one continues the philosophy of harmony with nature and subtle power. It is long lasting but close to the skin, not overpowering at all but very elegant. It is suitable for persons who don't like to attract too much attention.

I LOOOVVEE this scent. It has some likings to Eau Savage Extreme and Aqua di Parma. It's easy for me to get back to it more and more. Longevity for more than 5 hours. I'd like mixing it up with Terre de Hermes for a night out. It's refined and potent. Just how I like it.
Freshly chic.

I'm Surprised to not find any citrus in this scent, because it give that sour tang riiiight on the top of the scent that offends my nose. It may be the harsh mix of cedarwood with the basil? I dont know.
Sorry I'm not into it.

I'm surprised not to find anise in the scent pyramid, because that's what it smells like to me.

I'd say it smells at least as much, if not more, herbal than it does smell woody; not so much green, more like dried spices. It lasts quite a long time. Personally, I like it, but I don't love it. Not having a huge variety of fragrances stored in my head, I find it to be pretty unique and as such all the more a thing of personal taste.

Out of the original Kenzo Homme, the Fresh version and the Boisée version, I like this one best. I think it's unmistakably a Kenzo Homme fragrance, but I find it to be more closely related to Fresh (which also has this prominent anise note) than to the original (which, while also being aromatic, is more creamy-aquatic than its brothers).

Tested this today and fell in love. It is possibly the longest lasting scent i have tried in a very long time. I find it evervescent and at the same time creamy rather than woody. The only other scent that it vaguely reminds me of is Brasil Dream for men by Estee Lauder. This is another winner from Mr Polge.

And i pray it gets not discontinued in some years..

Overbearing review by henri345que..
To my nose more herbal than anything else. Starts to tire my nose during its way to the base. Well, better than Sport, which tires my nose since the first spray, allthough I got compliments with it.
Best Polge since Dior Homme!

A scented EDT sober, elegant and mature. Entry Notes incense-like aroma and sensation of dust, very dry and elegant. Middle notes that evolve over that feeling of dry wood dust to light touch sweets, dry wood dominate. Notes a bit more woody base, losing all sense of fragrance powder.

A fairly mature aroma, I think is perfect for a formal meeting, or romantic events in people 30 and older. Not recommend it for anyone under 30 years. The season of use may be universal, only required to be used at night, is perfect for a dark suit. Mildly recommended.

Really memorable fragance,comfortable and manly, ..a gentle wet aromatic smell of fresh herbals and woods mixed in a soft and organic atmosphere of fruits dry flowers and warm spices, the smell represents an intimate and sensitive relation of nature through the olfative sense. For day or night, cold or warm weather boisee stands in a balanced place.

To me, it's similar to Notre Flore Cedre by L'Occitane en Provence. But the only common note is cedar.

The scent is herbal & woody, and a bit citrusy, although citruses are not listed here. I could smell vetiver in the very beginning, then it faded.
I tried it on skin yesterday and I could smell it for at least 6 hours. Doesn't change much in time.

It's a pleasant fragrance for sunny autumn days, but I'm not very impressed or surprised here...The bottle is great.

For me it's a mix of Burberry The Beat for men (also done by O. Polge) and Declaration. It is more green than woody, I can describe this as fresh spicy, something like herbs with a pepper. It is very close to The Beat, so if you like it, you will like this as well. Sillage is average, longevity is good.

Kenzo + Polge = Success.
Kenzo made it again!. "Kenzo pour homme boisee" is an aromatic/spicy and soft, woody gorgeous scent.
This new fragrance is supposed to be a flanker to the 1991′s "KenzoHomme"
They have nothing at all in common (the only real similarity being the shape of the bottle and a salty trail). That doesn't mean that it will be a big dissapointment for all the original "KenzoHomme" lovers like me, as long as they don't expect something as unique as the 1991's original.


It starts fresh and slightly spicy.
There is a lively explosion of a salty refined vetiver, sexy mint and a background of spicy basil. The herbal side of mint and basil is fresh and brilliantly light yet intens. Even though, it never becomes overpowering.
Being honest, at this stage, I was afraid, as the opening really blew my mind and I was scared, presuming that it could react as "Tokyo", when, after the top notes, the whole perfume lost all the character.
This is not happening in "Kenzo Boisée": the mint accompained by the glorious vetiver shows their presence all the way through, so the perfume becomes rather linear but deliciously addictive.

During the heart and the drydown, the linear formula changes a little with the soft, airy, light cedar accord. Here, the wood seems almost secondary, where the previous notes from earlier reign above all.
So this is not a deep woody perfume as it has been advertised (Thank God).
If you are looking for a real, light wood scent, you better go and sample the CDG "Wonderwood".


"Kenzo pour Homme boisée" is a magnificent, well put together fragrance.
Yes, it is salty but not as the original one, and also it is spicy and woody but nothing like "Jungle Homme".
It has the perfect balanced amount of very carefully (and intelligently) chosen ingredients By Polge.
Some people will compare it with the original and it will probably receive bad reviews without justice because they may find it a little mainstream compared to any other of the Kenzo's fragrance line.
I have to agree, but also, I'm happy to say that this new launch will have success in terms of being the best mainstream launch of this year for two simple reasons:

1. Polge always made great perfumes and this one is not an exception.

2. It leads us eventually to the woodiness side that everyone expects, making the scented trip really memorable.

"Boiséé" is not as loud as "KenzoHomme" and not as quiet as "Power". It has its own place in the middle, having a distinctive projection and a really good lasting power.

Kenzo never let me down. And I have a great vision about this fragrance, the notes are great, the bottle is attractive, the commercial is awesome.
I definitely get one!

I got this because I wanted a perfume with the rice note. It definitely not what I was expecting. I personally think this feels like staying in your duvet after putting on body cream and showering with a borotalco body wash. I think the rice is probably more in the background which is the note, together with the vanilla, that gives a bit more “fullness” and “roundness” to the frangipiani, I have Jo malone’s Frangipiani cologne and I can detect the frangipiani in both, but in Jo malone it is more light, watery and flowery, whereas in Amour it is like a more cream like and slightly powdery. I would say it’s a neutral scent (not warm nor cold), that has a certain coziness and it’s slightly reminiscent of borotalco smell without the strong powdriness. It’s a likeable fragrance that feels nice to spray when going to bad or if you want to smell nice but you don’t want a strong perfume. It’s called amour, it kinda feels like hugging another person under your freshly changed duvet.

I purchased Amour after reading an article here recently about Olivier Cresp (who originally formulated my signature, Angel). I'm exploring a few of his frags, and I love tea notes so Amour made the cut (plus the bottle is really cool!).

I've only sprayed this on paper so far, but I suspect Amour needs body heat to really shine. The rice/tea opening is lovely and recognizable. If you're exploring either note, this is a fine example of either. After about 15 mins, Amour smells much akin to Guerlain L'Instant...like honey and powder. It's a touch spicier and a bit more floral, but they're definitely siblings. It's fall where I am so it's the perfect season, I think, to test it on skin. I'll update once I wear it this week.
This was my absolute favorite perfume when I was a teen. I used it primarily in the cold and dreary winter months and took comfort in its coziness. It will always have a special place in my heart🩷

Amour smells like the love child of hypnotic poison (the edt version) and Jo Malone’s scarlet poppy intense. A stunner for sure! Powdery, romantic and a bit savory. The only issue is the longevity as many others have pointed out.. but despite that - incredible! I want to believe Jo Malone had this one in mind when she created Scarlet poppy

This is the fragrance equivalent of a baby blanket or fleece hoody. Very soothing. Mostly feminine to me, and definitely in the cozy lane. But it could definitely be worn at night. Not business or black tie but lots of occasions, yes.
To me, this smells like a combination of Hypnotic Poison Dior and Cinema YSL, I like it a lot :) My boyfriend thinks it smells like playdough lol
This is the kind of vanilla that i like it is gentle not too sweet soft and it is white fluffy comforting vanilla
Letting go my 8ml decant location Toronto

My current obsession is powdery fragrances and I kept seeing Amour cited as a classic powdery vanilla. I have to admit...I like it, but its not what I imagined. Its a lot spicier and muskier than I was looking for, i imagined it to be soft and fluffy and gentle but to me its kind of a classic 'night time' type scent, something I would wear out with the girls if i want to smell sexy but clean.

But more importantly...it smells (to me) almost identical to the Degree 'Sexy Intrigue' deodorant. When I was a teenager I had a body spray perfume version of it that I wore. And while that smell is incredibly nostalgic, its just WAY too similar.
Today's lactonic rice gourmand girlies have no idea about the classics like Amour. This is THE one my friends.
The notes looked interesting, but on first spray I knew it wasn't for me. I'm also not really understanding the comparison to Hypnotic Poison. Amour has no longevity or uniqueness compared to HP
Very almondy and powdery scent. Reminds me of the Nivea pearl and beauty deodorant but stronger. Smells amazing in summer. Subtle yet so womanly at the same time. Smells good enough to eat.

Smells very comforting and soft! 🌸
Very beautiful feminine scent 🩷

I know I had tried this on, a long time ago, but I never bought it - until now. I guess I didn’t have money enough to buy a lot of fragrances back then, when my kids still were kids.
So, now I took the plunge and bought myself a 50 ml bottle. But the scent is so, so weak!! I hope that I just have a day of being anosmic to it - it has happened to me once before, with my signature fragrance - Narciso Rodriguez Narciso Rouge!
I immediately thought that was THE most beautiful fragrance I had ever smelled at the time - apart from Cacharel LouLou and Love, Chloe’. And of course another from Kenzo - Flower!
But Rouge disappeared so quickly, I thought, and I almost could not sense it! But THANKFULLY, it changed, and I can now percieve it perfectly well.
And - it is one of my most complimented fragrances, ever.
So, I just hope that this one will come along, too!!
Because it is very beautiful. I love soft fragrances, but I want to be able to smell it on myself!
So for now, since it is so weak on me, I will only give it a ”like” - otherwise it would get a ”love”.

A little later: my husband could smell it, when he came in from his fishing tour, however… ”You have sprayed something here!” Well, I guess I might have overdone it, after all. I will spray less tomorrow.

Next day: strange phenomenon, this. Today, I feel the fragrance a lot more! Maybe it is because now I know it better?? Anyway, it is still very soft. But obviously, it is not a good idea to put on 12 sprays. 😜

Kenzo Amour is one of my all-time favorites — a fragrance I keep coming back to, year after year. It strikes the perfect balance between comfort and sensuality, with a creamy softness that feels both intimate and radiant.

Though it’s a strong scent with good projection, I find that it actually blooms even better on my skin in summer. There’s something about the warmth that makes it melt into the skin beautifully, becoming even more addictive. At the same time, it’s cozy and enveloping enough to be perfect in winter too.

A true signature scent in my book — elegant, emotional, and effortlessly wearable all year round.
Vanilla and baby powder. It’s quite nice. I don’t get any florals but I like it anyway.

This is a very soft, warm, easy to wear fragrance that I would put in the same category as safe 2000s scents like Valentino V and Boss Deep Red - not in notes, but in the overall easiness and softness. Its comforting, has no sharp edges, smells of rice steam and something slightly clean and powdery. I dont get the comparisons to Hypnotic Poison at all. To me, there is nothing bold in Kenzo Amour, just warmth, comfort, love, and cashmere.

Once upon a time this was the best the perfume in the world to me. The first reformulation sent me on a quest to find my new signature.

Amour is still nice, but it's just a shadow of it's former self. I think most perfumes are too strong and annoying, but the new Amour is ridiculously weak. 30 minutes after applying 10 sprays and it's almost gone.

Edit to add: This was indeed quite similar to HP 15 years ago. They dont't resemble each other (or their former self) any more
Lovely floriental frangipani perfume, probably my second favorite scent after Loulou... dreamy, comforting, I love the rice in it, I am wearing it right now!
This perfume is a soft powdery musk, a comforting hug, It reminds me of Love's baby soft. No sharpness. Soft and sweet. Just how Iike my perfume.

This was I think my first ever perfume, which my mom bought for me after an afternoon together, spent on my first ever search for a scent that I would love. Just because of this memory it will always have a special place in my heart. After almost 20 years later, it still smells to me like ultimate comfort, coziness, motherly love. I am surprised that it does not have milk among the notes - to me, this is primarily lactonic rice scent. Like a rice pudding with vanilla.
at first it’s very playdoh to me, but once it settles it’s nice warm powdery cozy smell! Mixed feelings about it as the playdoh opening is intense to me
Such a pretty scent. The rice scent is subtle, and it’s more powdery floral vanilla with some sweetness. Lovely and feminine.

Smell of love. Not lust, flirt or romance, but a true love.
Warm, long lasting and comforting.

I was so, so excited for this one but all I got was a screechy floral note, ambroxan, and nail polish remover. I sadly, and reluctantly returned it.

My hunt for real rice milk/rice pudding continues.

As someone who loves rice pudding, I'm not getting that at all. It's more like sweetened baby powder, or baby wipes. It's not unpleasant, just unremarkable.

See Poesie's Madar perfume oil for a perfume that is spot-on to rice pudding.
There is something in all Kenzo perfumes that makes me nauseous and gives me a headache. The same with Elie Saab.

This is rice pudding made with flower water.

I find it quite similar to L’eau Papier, but with a touch of florals. Just a touch.

Tbh, for that scent profile, I prefer this one because L’eau Papier has this soapy note (is that the musk?)

Amour is rice pudding made with flower water and L’eau Papier is basmati rice steamed with soap 😁

Kenzo Amour is a straightforward gooey rice pudding fragrance, powerful and sweet.

Ironically, given the “Asian-inspired” marketing campaign, it’s maybe the ultimate in lactonic (milky) scents that put dairy front and center.

Despite my well-known distaste for sweet gourmands, I find Amour surprisingly lovable; the milkiness is comforting, and the powdery heliotropin makes it stop short a half notch from the over-rich dessert zone and remind you it’s a perfume.

If you’re looking for a canonical, real-deal sweet milky vanilla comfort scent, this is the one.
Bugün bana iltifat aldırdı Denizli'de bir mağazada arkamdan gelen kız abla senden çok güzel koku yayılıyor dedi ,bende çantamdan çıkarıp onada sıktım:)))

I was in love during the first 5 minutes of testing this fragrance. Buttery soft vanilla, frangipani, heliotrope, and lovely teasing whiffs of cherry blossom and rice milk, but as time went on and the intensity quickly dwindled, my excitement followed suit. I adore the fragrance, but I'm disappointed by the softness of expression. A like for the books.

All the notes should add up to something lovely for me, but there's an odd heaviness to this one once it settles down on the skin. The aura around me while wearing it is nice, very kind and gentle. I definitely feel the romantic story it's trying to tell - fluffy and innocent yet grown-up. I wish there was something fizzy or citrus to lift it up a bit, but that's just my taste. The overall effect is very cuddly, I have to be in the right mood for it.

As others have mentioned, there is a very slight Play-Doh vibe in the vanilla, similar to Hypnotic Poison. If you're vanilla-skeptic as I am, this won't be one to convert you. However, the florals waft around nicely; I only get the waxy lipstick smell when I smell my wrist up close.

The cherry blossom accord is dominant. If you've smelled any "Sakura" body mist or hand soap, you know the drill. Not too inspiring, but it's cradled nicely by the fuzzy notes around it.

The incense at the base gives it a tiny bit of smoky edge, just enough to keep it from going fully saccharine.

Giving it a "like" as I wear it on this sunny winter day, where the crispness of the air carries the sweetness well. To my husband, it smells like an SPF chapstick he used religiously in the Alps; he loves it for the scent memory. Well, I'll take the compliment :-)

smells like vanilla porridge. Warm, cozy, not too sweet, almost savory but not sickly. Has fair longevity and projection. Inoffensive, easy to like. If you like vanilla gourmands, its a safe blind buy. Its feminine, young but not juvenile, I could see this being lovely on a mature lady.

I think this is definetly a signature worthy perfume. Just absolutely delicious. It is very similar to Dior Hypnotic Poison but somewhat better and more pretty. Can not stop smelling my wrist. Love it.

I am pretty sure my mom had this fragrance at some point when I was younger. I was also pretty sure I knew exactly how it smells. Turns out I kinda didn't.

Upon spraying: mostly flowery, sweetish orchids and heliotrope - can't tell if I get any rice or tea, they probably get too blended in with the rest. Also pretty intense and a little cloying. Then it settles into its "true form", which I'll agree is an extremely powdery, play-do vanilla. It's not entirely unpleasant or uninteresting, though - there's this elusive sharp, almost slightly masculine note, which I assume is either the wood or incense; and in general it's a pretty non-standard fragrance profile for this day and age.

I always thought this was a sweeter vanilla with a lot more tea and rice, almost like a spa scent, instead I get 90s office vibes from it. I do kinda like it, though, but for now I'm going to put it in the "ok" category until it grows on me - I feel like it will.

Upon first wear I rated it as a dislike. Given the legendary status of the scent I expected special effects but I barely felt it on me - just a rice pudding steam. Years have passed and it turned out I started to miss this cosy scent and asked for it to be a gift for this Christmas. Now I am changing this gentle beauty rating to like. It has a moderate sillage and is very clean and warm. Wintertime I feel musk and rice the most, with a beautiful heart of cherry blossom - heliotrope notes. Frangipani adds certain milky waxiness. The scent is calm and enveloping. I especially envision a shy woman to like its gentle and encouraging aura that works like a safety blankett. The scent is memorable. I think it is the best for wintertime, as it might be too warm in different weather, or rather the scented blanket it creates wont be needed. In warmer weather vanilla feels the most prominent. During wear it becomes creamy and cosmetic powder-like. It is gentle yet long lasting. It's 9,5 hours already and I still clearly feel the scent on myself. No wonder it is so popular.

First impressions: (sample)
Three words: vanilla baby powder.
With a playdouhy vibe of Dior hypnotic poison. Yeah not a fan of this one. It does smell like the early 90’s smell. Not my signature scent sorry.
Edit 1:
OOOOF y’know this reminds me of Moncler pour Femme Moncler, and I HATED THAT SCENT. This is like a baby powder version of that one. This is an immediate scrubber for me. NOPE!
Verdict: pass- reminds me of a scent I HATE.

Here is a small opinion based upon in-shop blotter smell.

It smells dated. And it's not nice and comfortable, it feels like an outdated office scent, not like a comforting date smell as I wish it to be. I won't buy it because it smells like the time of my youth, which dates me. To me it's also probably that "sakura flower" which smells unpleasant, every time it's listed, a perfume feels outdated and smells slightly synthetically sweet.

In one word-- Meh.
I cannot believe the rave reviews...it's okay...a powdery vanilla-ish somewhat Play-Doh scent. Smells much better on the skin than on clothes. The drydown is the best part of the scent, a hint of wood mixed with Play-Doh vanilla, not bad. How this won awards is beyond me, though.
It is a pleasant enough scent, non offensive, perfect for an office setting. It's doesn't perform overly well, even when applied with a heavy hand...but if you like a very gentle perfume, you might like it. No one will ever ask you what you're wearing, but no one will run from you with a headache either. 🤷 If you want to blend in, smell pleasant, not stand out, you will like this.
I love Kenzo perfumes and have a few of them. This one just isn't my style. In fact, with all the perfumes I have, will ditch this one.
Really thought I'd like this, but it smells of old stale makeup. :(

Omg I loved it so much 10+ years ago when I was much more optimistic and bubbly.
This fragrance reminds me of better times which makes me sad( But fragrance alone is really a warm, soft embrace of a cozy late summer evening.
It smells like winter 2007! My mom used to wear it back then. Feeling nostalgic..
On my skin it smells like baby wipes. It's not bad, but i don't know if i really want to smell like that

As others have noted, Kenzo Amour smells like a whipped vanilla lotion — not like the oil used to scent lotion, but vanilla in the *matrix of lotion.*

Smoother than rice pudding. Lactonic vanilla with a touch of incense.

I am in love!

This smells like a dream to me. It's everything I want from an everyday perfume. It's sweet and vanilla-y, and powdery in a way that is not dusty, it's powdery because of the rice. It is not gourmand though, it has a very clean smell, to the verge of being soapy. Smells like a beautiful body cream: snuggly, sexy, airy, and sweet, but in a perfume form.

It has everything I like about powdery vanilla scents when executed correctly. It is pure, innocent, and clean but also sweet and very sexy.

Great Longevity and decent sillage, at least on me. The only thing is, give it 5-10 seconds, because the first spay is for some reason, very sharp and synthetic. But after some seconds when all the alcohol is gone, it's DIVINE.

Small Edit: In no way shape or form, this is similar to Hypnotic Poison. I have HP, I really like HP, and I can see someone liking both of them, but HP is way more, not obnoxious exactly, more in your face. HP is more of a night perfume and I think it's way more polarizing than this one. But if you like HP, and want a day alternative, I would say give it a shot.

I can't believe that I haven't heard more about this, it's sooo good! A beautifully done "your skin but better" perfume: somewhat musky, non-gourmand vanilla and almond scent - velvet smooth, not particularly sweet, a little starchy. My nose perceives it as dry and airy, like paper and clean sheets, rather than powdery. It smells like a hug from a calm, kind person that loves you. Longevity and sillage aren't great on my skin, but okay for the price. I generally fall for bolder, sweeter, weirder scents, so this is not quite a love, but I like it a lot and will happily use it up.
Smells like playdough. EXACTLY like playdough. I am a lover of playdoughy vanillas like hypnotic poison and such, but even I wouldn't wear this perfume.

It smells like powdery rice pudding and lasts really long on my skin. I sprayed this yesterday evening on my wrist and it's still noticeable today. It's nothing special but yet to me addicting as I find the rice pudding note very appealing and like rice notes in general.

I don't like this unfortunately. It smells dated to me, a little sour. I prefer Hypnotic Poison by a lot. I don't get rice pudding, I don't find this gourmand really. I also don't find it super powdery, it's more floral and kind of in the clean vein. However, it doesn't smell low quality, so that's good, it's just not my cup of tea.

Baby wipe powder quickly fades to reveal a most generic vanilla. Longevity poor, sillage even worse. The famous rice note does not make an appearance, no matter how badly I wish for it. Not all of them can be winners…

I get why everyone is saying this smells like rice pudding, though I find there is something more powdery and almost dusty about this. It certainly isn't a creamy rice pudding. I bought this in hopes it would be a good dupe for The Different Company's Pure eVe. On paper they do smell strikingly similar, but I was quite disappointed by how they smell on me. Pure eVe is fresh air, almonds, a little baby powder, vanilla extract. It's just so comforting and lovely, and I got whiffs of it off my shirt all day. This is powdery rice pudding and is gone in under four hours. Not at all what I was hoping for.

Mmmm…

This perfume is so beautiful. It gives a similar air to Dulce by RJ or Vanilla Musk.

It smells like deliciously sensual rice pudding. Odd, I know.

This perfume is so ladylike and sweet. It smells modest, almost.

I love it so much. It smells delicious and lactonic, yet sweet and powdery, all while smelling gourmand. I don’t really pick up on any florals, but I get this beautiful milky / rice vanilla scent. I’m almost positive there are rice notes in this fragrance.

Wear Amor if you want to smell sweet and flirty, but still mysterious. You’ll smell like the sweetest girl in the room, without being obvious.

I hands down, 100% endorse this perfume. It is ladylike, gourmand, modest, and not at all cloying. It is so discreetly flirty. I promise people will want to hug you or ask you for your number. Hahaha kidding. But seriously, this perfume is gorgeous! That is undeniable.

I smelled this perfume once and immediately went to go purchase the biggest size they sold. I LOVE KENZO AMOR.
i can see why this fragrance is so popular, it’s so welcoming and cozy. like rise vanilla backed dessert, like if it just came out of the oven. beautiful!

I bought a decant of this as I'm trying not to blind buy full bottles, so unfortunately I cannot comment as to how old the formulation is or how it was stored, or it might be from a modern bottle.

From a distance I get the creamy rice pudding element of this and it's quite pleasant and cosy. However when I get in closer for a stronger sniff it has a chemical undertone which reminds me of Windex. Maybe this is what others describe as playdough?

I don't hate it, don't love it. Very glad I didn't buy a full bottle. I am learning my lessons.

Overall it has taught me that perhaps creamy lactonic scents aren't for me? Or maybe I've not yet found "the one"?

EDIT: the dry down is a pleasant powdered vanilla. Quite generic and I think you could easily find this in an alternative. It's quite pricey and hard to find where I am so I wouldn't recommend paying over the odds for this
So so sooooooooo gorgeous.

I'm in shock that so many people think Kenzo Amour is similar to Hypnotic Poison, are you serious?!
For me it doesn't have the faintest resemblance at all - thankfully, as I cannot stand HP!
Kenzo Amour is a thing of beauty, it's a cozy comfort for a cold autumn day (or night), a gorgeous rice and frangipani notes, that makes me feel like i'm wearing the softest cashmere sweater, staying home with my beloved ones... It's not sexy, but very sensual and mellow....
It is hygge in perfume form

(for the record, my bottle is a vintage one)

I am seeing such fantastic deals online for 50 ml and 100 ml bottles of this but I'm really torn on whether to buy. I love the accord of rice but I'm not enjoying sweet vanilla accords as much as I used to. I think this perfume could have been less play-doughy if they left out the vanilla. I already own Jo Malone's Scarlet Poppy Intense which has a nice heliotrope note, and a few rice accord perfumes so I'm not sure I need this. I love the smell of steamed rice (very Zen and calming) but I don't like rice pudding at all.

I won't lie, the other notes besides vanilla are gorgeous.

It annoys me when people try to compare an artfully blended perfume like this one to fast fashion crap like Zara. This is much more complex and tasteful and made of quality materials than Gleam of the Moon. Just because the same rice and vanilla accords are listed doesn't mean it's even remotely the same.

Update: I got a 30 ml for next to nothing. If it feels too sickly I will just declutter.

Wow... I had this one when I was younger, the orange one in 2006. And I remember it being a soft, warm vanilla scent. Reminded me of Esprit life.
My friend said the colors are all the same fragrance. Today I wanted to test it and I was disappointed.
It smells like a grandma covered in sun tan lotion and lots of lots of old powder from the 80's 😬 and I don't mean baby powder but makeup powder and to that a splash of musk.
Ugh this was nothing alike the one I had. Glad I didn't bought a full bottle!
I would have wanted to love this based on the bottle alone but No ☹️. The start is like a Rituals store and the dry down is really play doh on my skin. Pity.

Very comforting musky vanilla. Light and creamy tropical florals, and that milky rice undertone... This is amour, it's hugs, soft bed sheets, window slightly open bringing in summer breeze. It's almost lotion-y in it's creaminess. I cannot imagine disliking this if you like vanilla and musk. It's such a cozy scent, so simple and obvious yet so genius.

I've tried Amour several times since it came out in the 2000's, so here we are again. Amour reminds me a lot of the general smell of lotion. It smells like a cozy skin scent and would make a nice first designer fragrance for a young girl, or something to spray on before bedtime or whenever you just want to feel comforted. Someone below mentioned it made them feel safe and that's a brilliant way to put it. It lingers a long time on the skin too.

I used to own this perfume but I ended by giving it away. HP is slightly cloying, smells like playdough. I thought it would be an intoxicating fragrance, as its name announced, but it gives you rather a headache... I don't understand the hype about it. Yes, it's recognizable but I much prefer to it Amour by Kenzo which doesn't have tha coconut and almond notes which are so cloying. A disappointment, sadly.

Smells like paradise on earth. So comforting and soft. No aggressive notes just something fleeting around. A little story... For a while I've been looking for Amour Kenzo. But I wanted the original bottle, the orange one from 2006. Online it's crazy overpriced and I thought that it's not worth it. Today I was walking in my neighbourhood in the Queens only to discover they just recently opened a perfume stores full of discontinued stuff at good prices (OMG). I almost cannot believe it ...They had 1 bottle of Amour Kenzo and I got it. Magical scent.

This smells absolutely amazing… for all of five minutes, and then, sadly, I smell… nothing. It disappears. Devastating.

This is very different from hypnotic poison. No mature vibes on this one, pure deliciousness, not beach vibes at all, just wish it lasted because it completely doesn’t. So so sad.

Opens really powdery, but like the powder was pulverized rice. At first I wasn’t sure but I’m about 30 minutes in and yes. This is fluffy and airy vanilla and I just keep sniffing my arm. I really like it and can’t wait for warmer weather to wear it. It reminds me of a perfume I bought when I was 18 from BBW that was a short lived line before their signature square glass bottles were introduced I wish I remembered the name 🩷

A nice, creamy musk. It is a tad too sweet for my taste and I wouldn't wear it in the summer, but I will very happily use up my sample.
My 15 year old daughter loves it, and on reflection it does feel a bit "young" for me; I think it's probably the sweetness that makes it so.

This is a beautiful powdery, soft, airy, ethereal "your skin but better" perfume. It less "your perfume smells really good" and more "you naturally smell really good." This is probably going to sound really weird to some people but this kind of smells like those scented My Little Pony toys that had this... sort of semi-sweet-vanillic-plastic vibe, or like a doll's head but in the BEST way possible if that makes sense and I absolutely LOVE it lol. Don't let that turn you off from trying it though because this is actually one of my favorite perfumes of all time. Take each review with a grain of salt because everybody's nose and skin chemistry are different, but this is SO beautiful in my opinion. 10/10 fragrance
So beautiful, it's a unique take on vanilla. It smells like a soft warm hug. Unfortunately it doesn't last very long
Smells too much like Jo Malone - Honey & Crocus - which I don’t like 🫤

Very aptly named, Amour has warmth and gentleness that goes right to my heart. Rice and vanilla create a beautiful accord which lights up around frangipani, giving me the impression of a postcard embrace on an exotic beach, with the perfect sunset in the background. That is why I cannot wear this during cold season, although it has warmth and sweetness, I think it needs cool summer evenings to blossom properly.
Suntan lotion exactly!!! Very warm, soft, sweet, tropical, floral, warm skin-like, a little salty. I think rice notes give perfumes a warm sweet/salty skin smell. I love it!
